Location of Incident: Lohutok Boma, Lohutok Payam, Lafon
Description: 2.	On 2 January, three secondary sources reported that on 24 December 2024, armed Toposa youths from Riwoto Payam, Kapoeta North County shot and killed one 32-year-old male civilian from the Lopit community during an attempted cattle raid in Lohutok Boma, Lohutok Payam, Lafon County. According to the sources, a group of four armed Toposa youth attacked a cattle camp in Lohutok Boma and opened fire on the victim, killing him, and thereafter fled the scene without raiding any cattle when the  Lopit youths responded to repulse them.

Location of Incident: Pantheer village, Marial Lou Payam, Tonj North
Description: 4.	On 2 January, multiple sources reported that on the same day, two male civilians were shot and killed (one Dinka Mitit and one Dinka Panlual) and nine others (seven Dinka Mitit and two Dinka Panlual) were injured during violence between between Dinka Panlual and Dinka Mitit sub-clans in Pantheer village, Marial Lou Payam, Tonj North County. Reportedly, armed Dinka Panlual youths attacked the Dinka Mitit community in retaliation for past grievances.

Location of Incident: Pantheer village, Marial Lou Payam, Tonj North
Description: 4.	On 2 January, multiple sources reported that on the same day, two male civilians were shot and killed (one Dinka Mitit and one Dinka Panlual) and nine others (seven Dinka Mitit and two Dinka Panlual) were injured during violence between between Dinka Panlual and Dinka Mitit sub-clans in Pantheer village, Marial Lou Payam, Tonj North County. Reportedly, armed Dinka Panlual youths attacked the Dinka Mitit community in retaliation for past grievances.

Location of Incident: Maridi town, Maridi
Description:
6.	On 2 January, two secondary sources reported that on 31 December, one SSPDF soldier raped a 17-year-old girl from the Moru community in Maridi Town, Maridi County. According to the sources, the SSPDF soldier and another male civilian accosted the victim and another 18-year-old girl while they were returning from a New Year's Eve night prayers at a local church, and the SSPDF soldier proceeded to rape the 17-year-old girl, his companion raped the 18-year-old girl. The incident was reported at Maridi Police Station, and the two perpetrators were arrested by a joint security patrol team and detained for investigation. The victims received medical attention at a local hospital. 

Comment: While the prompt response by the authorities is commendable, concerns remain about the prevalence of sexual violence in the area and the need for accountability and justice. HRD will continue to follow up on the case for accountability of the perpetrators.

Location of Incident: Billinang, Juba
Description:
1.	On 3 January, two secondary sources reported that on 6 December, Murle armed elements from GPAA abducted two children during a cattle raid in Billinyang Boma, Juba County. Murle armed elements attacked cattle camps in Billinyang Boma, raided an unspecified number of cattle and abducted two children. Reportedly, joint armed Mundari and Dinka Bor youths pursued the attackers and in the ensuing confrontation recovered the abducted children and some of the raided cattle. Two armed Mundari and one armed Dinka Bor youths were reportedly shot and killed during the confrontation.

Comment: According to the sources, the attack was likely a revenge action for the attack on Murle cattle traders by the armed Dinka Bor youths in Mogiri Boma on the 6 November 2024, which resulted in the killing of 22 people and the raiding of hundreds of cattle from the Murle traders.

Location of Incident: Billinang, Juba
Description:
1.	On 3 January, two secondary sources reported that on 6 December, Murle armed elements from GPAA abducted two children during a cattle raid in Billinyang Boma, Juba County. Murle armed elements attacked cattle camps in Billinyang Boma, raided an unspecified number of cattle and abducted two children. Reportedly, joint armed Mundari and Dinka Bor youths pursued the attackers and in the ensuing confrontation recovered the abducted children and some of the raided cattle. Two armed Mundari and one armed Dinka Bor youths were reportedly shot and killed during the confrontation.

Comment: According to the sources, the attack was likely a revenge action for the attack on Murle cattle traders by the armed Dinka Bor youths in Mogiri Boma on the 6 November 2024, which resulted in the killing of 22 people and the raiding of hundreds of cattle from the Murle traders.

Location of Incident: Lalanga Boma, Lohutok Payam, Imehejek Administrative Area
Description: 2.	On 3 January, three secondary sources reported that on 25 December 2024, armed Buya youths from Kimotong Payam, Budi County shot and injured two male civilians (ages 30 and 40 years old) from the Lopit community during an attempted cattle raid in Lalanga Boma, Lohutok Payam, Lafon County. According to the sources, a group of five armed Buya youths attacked cattle camp in Lalanga Boma and opened fire on the victims (cattle herders), injuring them. Reportedly, armed Lopit youths repulsed the attackers who fled without raiding any cattle. the injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Lalanga Boma for medical treatment. The incident was reported at Imehejek Police Station and investigation is reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: Padiet Payam, Duk
Description: 3.	On 3 January, multiple sources reported that on the same day, Murle armed elements shot and injured one 36-year-old male civilian from the Lou Nuer community in Padiet Payam, Duk County. According to the sources, Murle armed elements attacked and opened fire on a group of 14 Lou Nuer civilians who were travelling from Duk Padiet to Uror Boma, Uror County, injuring one, while the other 13 escaped unharmed. The local youth subsequently recovered the injured victim and brought him to Duk Padiet for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: in Jebel Boma Town, Jebel Boma County
Description: 4.	On 2 and 3 January, multiple sources reported that on 31 December 2024, armed Toposa youths abducted three girls (ages 10, 11, and 16 years old) from the Murle community in Jebel Boma Town, Jebel Boma County, GPAA. According to the sources, armed Toposa youths attacked a group of four girls travelling from Jebel Boma Town (Upper Boma) to sell mangoes in the outskirts of the town (Lower Boma at the river side) and abducted three of the girls, while the other girl (also 16-year-old) managed to escape and alerted the local youth. Reportedly, the local youths pursued the attackers and in the ensuing confrontation recovered the three abductees.

Location of Incident: Pagak, Duk
Description: 5.	On 2 and 3 January, multiple sources reported that on 30 December 2024, Murle armed elements shot and killed two male civilians, injured one woman and abducted her infant boy in Pagak Payam, Duk County. According to the sources, Murle armed elements attacked and opened fire on a group of Lou Nuer civilians travelling from Pajut, Panyang Payam to Pagak in Pagak Payam, killing two, injuring another, and abducted one four-month-old infant. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Pajut for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Pagak, Duk
Description: 5.	On 2 and 3 January, multiple sources reported that on 30 December 2024, Murle armed elements shot and killed two male civilians, injured one woman and abducted her infant boy in Pagak Payam, Duk County. According to the sources, Murle armed elements attacked and opened fire on a group of Lou Nuer civilians travelling from Pajut, Panyang Payam to Pagak in Pagak Payam, killing two, injuring another, and abducted one four-month-old infant. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Pajut for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Pagak, Duk
Description: 5.	On 2 and 3 January, multiple sources reported that on 30 December 2024, Murle armed elements shot and killed two male civilians, injured one woman and abducted her infant boy in Pagak Payam, Duk County. According to the sources, Murle armed elements attacked and opened fire on a group of Lou Nuer civilians travelling from Pajut, Panyang Payam to Pagak in Pagak Payam, killing two, injuring another, and abducted one four-month-old infant. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Pajut for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: in Ugin village, Malual Chum Payam, Tonj East
Description: 6.	On 3 January, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, suspected armed Dinka Akook youths from Ngabagok Payam shot and injured one male civilian from the Dinka Thiik community in Ugin village, Malual Chum Payam, Tonj East County. the attack was reportedly a revenge action linked past unresolved grievances between the two communities. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Marial Lou for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Otogo Payam, Yei River
Description:
1.	On 7 January, three secondary sources reported that, on 13 December, soldiers of the SSPDF, arbitrarily arrested and detained one 61-year-old male civilian in Otogo Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, the soldiers of the SSPDF arrested the victim, while he was on his way home and detained him for unspecified reasons. The sources reported that, this incident happened after the victim had reported himself to the SSPDF on 13 December immediately after escaping from abduction by the National Salvation Front (NAS) elements on 12 December 2024. 

Comment: Reportedly, the victim was abducted by the NAS since April 2024, for unknown reasons, until he escaped on 12 December 2024. HRD will follow-up with County authorities for more information and call for his release from military detention.

Location of Incident: Rumola Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos
Description:
2.	On 7 January, three secondary sources reported that, on 31 December, armed Logir men from Mohina Boma, shot and killed one 22-year-old male civilian, and shot and injured another 40-year-old male civilian in Rumola Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos County. According to the sources, the incident was in revenge for the killing of one 27-year-old Logir cattle keeper from Mohina Boma, by armed Logir youths from Rumola Boma on 7 April 2024. Reportedly, the injured victim was evacuated to a health facility in Ikotos town for treatment and the incident was reported to the local police and investigations are ongoing.

Comment: HRD will continue to follow-up on this incident with County authorities and the local administration for a proper investigation and judicial due process and accountability for perpetrators

Location of Incident: Rumola Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos
Description:
2.	On 7 January, three secondary sources reported that, on 31 December, armed Logir men from Mohina Boma, shot and killed one 22-year-old male civilian, and shot and injured another 40-year-old male civilian in Rumola Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos County. According to the sources, the incident was in revenge for the killing of one 27-year-old Logir cattle keeper from Mohina Boma, by armed Logir youths from Rumola Boma on 7 April 2024. Reportedly, the injured victim was evacuated to a health facility in Ikotos town for treatment and the incident was reported to the local police and investigations are ongoing.

Comment: HRD will continue to follow-up on this incident with County authorities and the local administration for a proper investigation and judicial due process and accountability for perpetrators

Location of Incident: Kuei Boma in Wau Payam, Ayod
Description: 3.	On 7 January, multiple sources reported that, on 5 January, Murle armed elements, shot and killed two women from the Gawaar Nuer community (aged 47 and 50 years), in Kuei Boma in Wau Payam, Ayod County. According to the sources, the assailants ambushed, shot and killed the women, while they collected food for their cattle. Their bodies were recovered by community leaders and youths.

Location of Incident: Thong village in Ayod Payam Ayod
Description:
4.	On 7 January, multiple sources reported that, on 6 January, Murle armed elements abducted one 22-year-old woman and her two-year-old son from the Gawaar Nuer community, in Thong village in Ayod Payam Ayod County. According to the sources, the youths in the community mobilized and pursued the abductors and only recovered the body of the woman, and the abductors fled with the child to an unknown location. 

Comment: HRD will follow-up on these reports with Ayod County authorities for more information.

Location of Incident: Jaac Payam, Aweil East
Description:
5.	On 7 January, one secondary source reported that, on 5 January, one SSPDF soldier allegedly raped one 15-year-old girl in Jaac Payam, Aweil East County, and fled the scene. According to the source, the survivor was taken to a health facility in Aweil town for medical examination and treatment. A case is yet to be opened with the police for investigation although a report was made to the SSPDF commander, and no action was taken against the perpetrator.

Comment: HRD will follow-up on this report for more information and advocate for corrective action and accountability by the perpetrator.

Location of Incident: Kol Ngap village, Kuenyja boma in Tonj Payam, Tonj South
Description:
6.	On 7 January, three secondary sources, reported that on 6 January, armed Dinka Gok youths from Cueibet County-Lakes State, shot and killed two male civilians (one Dinka Luanyjang and one Dinka Thiik) and injured four other Dinka Luanyjang male civilians in Kol Ngap village, Kuenyja boma in Tonj Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources the incident happened in the context of a foiled cattle raid attempt by the Dinka Gok from Lakes State in Kol Ngap village. Reportedly, three Dinka Gok raiders were killed in the process and the rest escaped towards Cueibet County in Lakes, while the injured victims were taken to a health facility in Tonj South County for treatment. 

Comment: HRD will follow-up on the incident for more information on possible arrests of perpetrators or unreported casualties.

Location of Incident: Kol Ngap village, Kuenyja boma in Tonj Payam, Tonj South
Description:
6.	On 7 January, three secondary sources, reported that on 6 January, armed Dinka Gok youths from Cueibet County-Lakes State, shot and killed two male civilians (one Dinka Luanyjang and one Dinka Thiik) and injured four other Dinka Luanyjang male civilians in Kol Ngap village, Kuenyja boma in Tonj Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources the incident happened in the context of a foiled cattle raid attempt by the Dinka Gok from Lakes State in Kol Ngap village. Reportedly, three Dinka Gok raiders were killed in the process and the rest escaped towards Cueibet County in Lakes, while the injured victims were taken to a health facility in Tonj South County for treatment. 

Comment: HRD will follow-up on the incident for more information on possible arrests of perpetrators or unreported casualties.

Location of Incident: Saba Mile, Source Yubu Payam, Tambura
Description:
7.	Between 6 and 7 January, two secondary sources reported that, on 26-27 December, EACR Forces, beat and killed three male civilians (ages unspecified) and caused the death of two children (ages and sexes unspecified), shot and injured one male civilian, beat and injured another male civilian and caused the enforced disappearance of two other male civilians from the Azande Community in Saba Mile, Source Yubu Payam, Tambura County. According to the sources the injured victims were taken to a health facility in the area for treatment. 

Comment: the motive for the attack, the circumstances of the casualties and information on response from state authorities are yet to be provided. HRD will follow-up on this report for a full account of the incidents.

Location of Incident: Saba Mile, Source Yubu Payam, Tambura
Description:
7.	Between 6 and 7 January, two secondary sources reported that, on 26-27 December, EACR Forces, beat and killed three male civilians (ages unspecified) and caused the death of two children (ages and sexes unspecified), shot and injured one male civilian, beat and injured another male civilian and caused the enforced disappearance of two other male civilians from the Azande Community in Saba Mile, Source Yubu Payam, Tambura County. According to the sources the injured victims were taken to a health facility in the area for treatment. 

Comment: the motive for the attack, the circumstances of the casualties and information on response from state authorities are yet to be provided. HRD will follow-up on this report for a full account of the incidents.

Location of Incident: Saba Mile, Source Yubu Payam, Tambura
Description:
7.	Between 6 and 7 January, two secondary sources reported that, on 26-27 December, EACR Forces, beat and killed three male civilians (ages unspecified) and caused the death of two children (ages and sexes unspecified), shot and injured one male civilian, beat and injured another male civilian and caused the enforced disappearance of two other male civilians from the Azande Community in Saba Mile, Source Yubu Payam, Tambura County. According to the sources the injured victims were taken to a health facility in the area for treatment. 

Comment: the motive for the attack, the circumstances of the casualties and information on response from state authorities are yet to be provided. HRD will follow-up on this report for a full account of the incidents.

Location of Incident: Yei town, Yei River
Description:
1.	On 8 January, multiple sources reported that, on 1 January, one soldier of the SSPDF from Wudabi Payam, Morobo County, raped, impregnated and claimed one 16-year-old girl as his wife in Yei town, Yei River County. According to the sources, on 29 December, the victim along with three other women and seven SSPDF soldiers including the perpetrator, fled from NAS activities against civilians and government forces in Moribongo village in Wudabi Payam, Morobo County to Yei town for safety. Reportedly, the perpetrator, has escaped and remains at large, while the victim was received humanitarian and medical support in Yei town, during which she was discovered pregnant. The matter was reported to the commanding officer of the SSPDF, and the victim was handed over to the SSPDF in Yei town for protection while investigations are ongoing to apprehend the perpetrator. 

Comment: HRD will continue to follow-up on this incident for more updates.

Location of Incident: Kamee Boma, Narus Payam, Kapoeta East
Description:
2.	On 8 January, three secondary sources reported that, on 14 December, armed Toposa youths from Kaldo Boma, shot and killed one 45-year-old male civilian in Kamee Boma, Narus Payam, Kapoeta East County. According to the sources, the incident was a revenge action for the raping of one 28-year-old Toposa woman from Kaldo Boma by the 45-year-old man on 13 December. Reportedly, the 14 December incident triggered the abduction of one 20-year-old Toposa man from Kaldo Boma by armed youths from Kamee Boma and his whereabouts remain unknown. The incidents have been reported to the Police in Narus Payam and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made.

Comment: HRD will continue to investigate these incidents for more information.

Location of Incident: Dengjok Boma in Dengjok Payam in Akobo
Description: 3.	On 8 January, multiple sources reported that on 6 January, Murle armed elements shot and injured one Lou Nuer civilian (sex unspecified) in a cattle camp in Dengjok Boma in Dengjok Payam in Akobo County. According to the sources the incident happened during a cattle raid led by the Murle armed elements during which they raided an unspecified number of cattle, although the local youths mobilized and recovered all the raided cattle, and the assailants fled the scene.

Location of Incident: Dengjok Boma in Dengjok Payam in Akobo
Description: 3.	On 8 January, multiple sources reported that on 6 January, Murle armed elements shot and injured one Lou Nuer civilian (sex unspecified) in a cattle camp in Dengjok Boma in Dengjok Payam in Akobo County. According to the sources the incident happened during a cattle raid led by the Murle armed elements during which they raided an unspecified number of cattle, although the local youths mobilized and recovered all the raided cattle, and the assailants fled the scene.

Location of Incident: Patuet, in Pajut Payam, Duk
Description:
4.	On 8 January, multiple sources reported that on 5 January, Murle armed elements, shot and injured one elderly Lou Nuer civilian in Patuet, in Pajut Payam, Duk County. According to the sources, the incident happened when the victim was traveling on foot from Duk Padiet in Padiet Payam, Duk County to Uror Boma in Tiam Payam in Uror County. The victim was evacuated to a health facility in Duk County for treatment.

Comment: The rise in criminal and other related activities by the Murle armed elements continues to worsen the security and human rights situation of civilians in the area. HRD will continue its engagements with county authorities for more robust security in the area.

Location of Incident: Tigri forest in Panawac Boma, Pachong Payam, Rumbek East
Description:
5.	On 8 January, one secondary source reported that, on 7 October, soldiers of the SSPDF extrajudicially executed one 30-year-old male Dinka Agaar civilian in Tigri forest in Panawac Boma, Pachong Payam, Rumbek East County. According to the source, the victim was arrested by the police in Thanylau village of Maleng-agok Payam in Rumbek East County, for allegedly killing his mother and sister on 7 October. The police later handed the victim over to the SSPDF who took the victim to Tigri forest, shot and killed him execution style. 

Comment: HRD will follow up on this incident for more information.

Location of Incident: Nyulere Boma, in Lirya Payam, Juba
Description:
1.	On 9 January, two secondary sources reported that on the same day, five unidentified armed men, abducted two children (10-year-old girl and five-year-old boy) in Nyulere Boma, in Lirya Payam, Juba County. According to the sources, the 10-year-old girl managed to escape her abductors and was recovered by the youths in the community who mobilized and pursued the abductors. Reportedly, the abductors made away with the five-year-old boy and there are speculations of them being members of the Murle armed elements.

Comment: HRD will follow-up with community leaders and other members of the local alert network for more information.

Location of Incident: outskirts of Adebe Boma, Kurumi Payam in Lafon
Description:
2.	On 9 January, three secondary sources reported that on 25 December, Pari youths from Lafon County, armed with sticks and machetes, beat, mutilated and killed two Murle boys from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (aged 16 and 17 years) in the outskirts of Adebe Boma, Kurumi Payam in Lafon County. According to the sources, this incident was in revenge for the killing of a 27-year-old unarmed Pari man by armed Murle youth during an ambush in Kurumi Payam on 13 September 2024 [see HRD Daily Report 24 October 2024]. The incident was reported to the Police in Lafon County and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made. 
Comment: HRD will continue to follow-up on this report for more information.

Location of Incident: Rumbek town, Rumbek Cetral
Description:
3.	On 9 January, three secondary sources reported that, on 2 January, soldiers of the SSPDF extrajudicially and summarily executed three male civilians (alleged murder suspects) in Rumbek town, Rumbek Central County. According to the sources, the victims were arrested and detained on 1 January by the SSPDF at the Rock City Military detention center on allegations of murder of a woman in Rumbek town and were later extracted and killed the next day in a remote area in Rumbek town. 
Comment: The families of one of the victims located in his body and transferred it to Malen-Agok Payam in Rumbek East County for burial. HRD will continue to follow-up for more information.

Location of Incident: Agawei village in Marial Lou, Tonj North
Description:
5.	On 9 January, three secondary sources, reported that on 8 January, one armed Dinka Lou Paher youth from the Pamum subclan, shot and injured another male Dinka Lou Paher civilian from the Pagak subclan in Agawei village in Marial Lou, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the assailant shot severally at the victim in the victim’s homestead in Agawei village, injuring him and fled the scene and remains at large. Reportedly, the injured victim was taken to a health facility in Marial Lou Payam for treatment, while the incident was reported to the police and investigations are ongoing although no arrest has been made. 

Comment: this incident is linked to the cyclical and violent retaliatory attacks between the Pamum and Pagak subclans of Dinka Lou Paher in Marial Lou Payam, Tonj North County.

Location of Incident: Condook village, Akop Payam, Tonj North
Description:
On 9 January, three secondary sources reported that in the early hours of the same day, five male civilians were shot and killed (three from Agurpiny and two from Adok-thok- subclans of Akop Dinka Section) and 16 other civilians injured (eight from Agurpiny and eight from Adok-thok) during an inter-subclan violence in Condook village, Akop Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, these casualties are tied to unresolved grievances between these two subclans in Akop Payam.

Comment: Tension remains heightened in the area as there are fears of more civilian casualties should there be no state intervention with security and defence forces to contain the situation. HRD will continue to monitor the situation for more updates.

Location of Incident: Condook village, Akop Payam, Tonj North
Description:
On 9 January, three secondary sources reported that in the early hours of the same day, five male civilians were shot and killed (three from Agurpiny and two from Adok-thok- subclans of Akop Dinka Section) and 16 other civilians injured (eight from Agurpiny and eight from Adok-thok) during an inter-subclan violence in Condook village, Akop Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, these casualties are tied to unresolved grievances between these two subclans in Akop Payam.

Comment: Tension remains heightened in the area as there are fears of more civilian casualties should there be no state intervention with security and defence forces to contain the situation. HRD will continue to monitor the situation for more updates.

Location of Incident: Ngo-Sulugu Boma, Bagarri Payam, Wau
Description:
7.	On 9 January, one primary source and one secondary source reported that, on 6 December, a SPLA-IO element raped one 13-year-old girl from the Balanda community in Ngo-Sulugu Boma, Bagarri Payam, Wau County. According to the sources, the survivor was lured and raped by the SPLA-IO element, in Ngo-Sulugu, where she visited her mother during the holidays. Reportedly, the incident was reported to the SPLA-IO brigade commander who arrested the perpetrator on 1 January. The survivor was later taken to a health facility in Wau town, for medical examination and treatment. 

Comment: A family relative to the survivor was cautioned by the SPLA-IO commander to not open a formal case with the police but have the matter resolved with the traditional courts. HRD will follow-up this issue with County authorities for due process and proper judicial measures to ensure accountability by the perpetrator.

Location of Incident: Mogoes Boma, Mogoes Payam, Kapoeta East
Description:
1.	On 6 January, three secondary sources reported that, on 3 January, Murle armed elements from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) abducted one 12-year-old boy from the Toposa community in Mogoes Boma, Mogoes Payam, Kapoeta East County. According to the sources, the abductors invaded Mogoes Boma and attacked four children aged 12, 14, 15 and 15 years (sexes unspecified except for the victim) who were grazing their goats and abducted the 12-year-old boy and fled the scene towards GPAA. Reportedly, the incident was reported to the police and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made.

Comment: HRD will continue to follow-up on this incident for more information

Location of Incident: Pamai Boma, Wechkol Payam in Uror
Description: 2.	On 6 January, multiple sources reported that, on 5 January, Murle armed elements shot and injured one 48-year-old woman of the Lou Nuer community in Pamai Boma, Wechkol Payam in Uror County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked a cattle camp in the evening of 5 January in Pamai Boma, shot and injured the victim just outside her homestead in the cattle camp and fled the scene. Reportedly, the victim was taken to a health facility in the area for treatment.

Location of Incident: Majok-Yithiou town, Aweil East
Description:
3.	On 6 January, one secondary source reported that on 26 December, one SSPDF soldier, raped one 12-year-old girl in Majok-Yithiou town, Aweil East County. According to the source, the survivor was alone in her homestead when the SSPDF soldier entered and raped her, leaving her profusely bleeding and unconscious and fled from the scene. Reportedly, the survivor was taken to a health facility in the area for treatment and two days later, after she was evacuated to another health facility in Aweil town, since her condition was not improving. The source reported that the incident was reported to the police and the perpetrator arrested and detained awaiting investigation and trial. 

Comment: HRD will continue to follow-up on this incident with the police and other justice actors in Aweil to ensure judicial due process is followed and justice is served for the survivor.

Location of Incident: Paliang Payam, Tonj East
Description:
4.	On 6 January, multiple sources reported that on 4 January, Dinka Kongor youths from Paliang subclan attacked, beat and killed one male Dinka Luanyjang civilian from Pan-Nhial Payam Tonj East County in Paliang Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked the victim at the market in Paliang Payam, when he was shopping, beat and killed him, for allegedly eloping with their sister to an unknown location. Reportedly, the victim was rushed to a health facility in Paliang Payam for treatment, but he later succumbed to his injuries on 5 January. The sources added that, the incident was reported to the Paliang Police and a case was opened and investigations are ongoing.

Comment: HRD will continue to follow-up on this incident for more information.

Location of Incident: Kuajiena Payam, Jur River
Description:
5.	On 6 January, one primary source and two secondary sources reported that, on 21 December, one Wildlife Service officer, attacked and grievously injured one 34-year-old Lou civilian in Kuajiena Payam, Jur River county. According to the sources, the Wildlife officer attacked the victim with a local panga knife, cutting off the victim’s left hand trying to behead the victim and seriously injuring the victim’s head, when the victim tried to separate a fight between the wildlife service officer and another civilian. Reportedly, the victim was evacuated to a health facility in Wau town for treatment, and a case was opened with the Police and the victim arrested and detained pending investigation and other legal processes. 

Comment: HRD will follow-up on this incident for more information and to ensure due process and fair trial rights are respected.

Location of Incident: Ifune, Ikotos, Ikotos
Description:
1.	On 10 January, multiple sources reported that on 5 January 2025, and 22 December 2024, armed Lango youths attacked and killed one 55-year-old Lango male civilian and one 50-year-old Lango woman respectively in Ifune and Cholok Bomas respectively in Ikotos Payam, Ikotos County. According to the sources, the victims were attacked and killed at their respective homesteads on allegations of practicing witchcraft. Reportedly, the incidents were reported to the Ikotos Police and five suspects were arrested and detained. 

Comment: Tension remains very high in the communities in Ifune and Cholok Bomas, as there are rumors of rapid mobilization of youths in Ifune Boma to attack the police station to forcefully release their detained members. HRD will continue to follow-up on this report for more information.

Location of Incident: Cholok, Ikotos, Ikotos
Description:
1.	On 10 January, multiple sources reported that on 5 January 2025, and 22 December 2024, armed Lango youths attacked and killed one 55-year-old Lango male civilian and one 50-year-old Lango woman respectively in Ifune and Cholok Bomas respectively in Ikotos Payam, Ikotos County. According to the sources, the victims were attacked and killed at their respective homesteads on allegations of practicing witchcraft. Reportedly, the incidents were reported to the Ikotos Police and five suspects were arrested and detained. 

Comment: Tension remains very high in the communities in Ifune and Cholok Bomas, as there are rumors of rapid mobilization of youths in Ifune Boma to attack the police station to forcefully release their detained members. HRD will continue to follow-up on this report for more information.

Location of Incident: Kaikuny village, Diro Payam, Akobo
Description:
2.	On 10 January, multiple sources reported that on 9 January, Murle armed elements shot and killed one 50-year-old male Lou Nuer civilian in Kaikuny village, Diro Payam, Akobo County. According to the sources, the assailants shot and killed the victim outside his homestead during a cattle raid in Kaikuny village and raided his 27 herds of cattle and fled the scene. Reportedly, the local youths pursued the raiders, but their effort was abortive. 

Comment: HRD will continue to follow-up on the incident for more information.

Location of Incident: Kaikuny village, Diro Payam, Akobo
Description:
2.	On 10 January, multiple sources reported that on 9 January, Murle armed elements shot and killed one 50-year-old male Lou Nuer civilian in Kaikuny village, Diro Payam, Akobo County. According to the sources, the assailants shot and killed the victim outside his homestead during a cattle raid in Kaikuny village and raided his 27 herds of cattle and fled the scene. Reportedly, the local youths pursued the raiders, but their effort was abortive. 

Comment: HRD will continue to follow-up on the incident for more information.

Location of Incident: Wun-thou Boma of Yali Payam of Yirol East
Description:
3.	On 10 January, two secondary sources reported that, the SSPDF arbitrarily arrested and detained 35 civilians in Yirol town, Yirol West County. According to the sources, the victims were arrested and detained at Barbu-Ziet military detention in Yirol town over their alleged participation in an intracommunal violence over ownership of a cattle camp location in Wun-thou Boma of Yali Payam of Yirol East County which led to the death of five persons and injuring of nine others.

Comment: The sources expressed concern over the possible summary and extrajudicial execution of the suspects in addition to the want of jurisdiction to arrest, detain and investigate criminal cases. HRD will engage with county authorities to secure the transfer of the suspects to the jurisdiction of the SSNPS for due process proceedings.

Location of Incident: Outskirts Kuajok Town, Gogrial West
Description:
5.	On 11 January, multiple sources reported that on 10 January, the SSPDF extrajudicially and summarily executed two male civilians in the outskirts Kuajok Town, Gogrial West County. According to the sources, the victims were suspects accused of killing the two boys in Kuajok in December 2024. Reportedly, the bodies of the victims were retrieved by their relatives for burial.

Comment: The extrajudicial executions were allegedly done pursuant to the provisions of the Green Book on orders of superior officers. This brings the total number of recorded EJEs by KFO HRD in Warrap State to 139 since the EJEs begun in early 2021.

Location of Incident: Hai Masana IDP camp, Wau town, Wau
Description:
6.	On 10 January, multiple sources reported that on 24 December, a SSNPS officer and another male civilian, raped and killed one 13-year-old Dinka girl at the Hai Masana IDP camp, Wau town, Wau County. According to the sources, the body of the victim was found on 25 December with a broken neck after she went missing the whole 24 December. Reportedly, the incident was reported to the Wau police, and two suspects were arrested and detained in connection to the incident including the 28-year-old SSNPS officer and one 18-year-old Balanda male civilian both residents of the Hai Masana IDP camp and investigations are ongoing. 

Comment: HRD will continue to follow-up on this case to ensure a thorough investigation and that judicial due process is respected.

Location of Incident: Mantor village, Boung Payam, Akobo
Description:
1.	On 13 January, multiple sources reported that on 11 January, Murle armed elements abducted 17 women of the Lou Nuer community in Mantor village, Boung Payam, Akobo County. According to the sources, the victims had left Uror and Akobo counties to Pulboy, east of Walgak in Boung Payam for fishing and were returning with fish when they were attacked by the Murle. Reportedly, of the 17 abducted, four were later killed by the Murle armed elements (two from Uror County and two from Walgak), and were buried locally where their bodies were found, while the local youths pursued and recovered 12 of the victims and one remains missing. 

Comment: HRD will continue to follow-up on this incident for more information about the remaining victim and for possible investigation and arrest of perpetrators.

Location of Incident: Mantor village, Boung Payam, Akobo
Description:
1.	On 13 January, multiple sources reported that on 11 January, Murle armed elements abducted 17 women of the Lou Nuer community in Mantor village, Boung Payam, Akobo County. According to the sources, the victims had left Uror and Akobo counties to Pulboy, east of Walgak in Boung Payam for fishing and were returning with fish when they were attacked by the Murle. Comment: HRD will continue to follow-up on this incident for more information about the remaining victim and for possible investigation and arrest of perpetrators.

Location of Incident: Hufra oil Field in Bungi Payam of Alieny
Description: 3.	On 13 January, multiple sources reported that, on 11 January armed Bul Nuer youths from Mayom County and armed Leek Nuer youths from Rubkona County shot and killed two civilians (Sudanese nationals from the Misseriya tribe) and injured others (number unspecified) in “Bierr number 10”, near Hufra oil Field in Bungi Payam of Alieny County under Ruweng Administrative Area (RAA). Reportedly, security forces (SSPDF, NSS) and Police, were deployed to the area and fought back the assailants recovering about 523 herds of cattle that were raided during the joint attack and returning them to their owners.

Location of Incident: Hufra oil Field in Bungi Payam of Alieny
Description: 3.	On 13 January, multiple sources reported that, on 11 January armed Bul Nuer youths from Mayom County and armed Leek Nuer youths from Rubkona County shot and killed two civilians (Sudanese nationals from the Misseriya tribe) and injured others (number unspecified) in “Bierr number 10”, near Hufra oil Field in Bungi Payam of Alieny County under Ruweng Administrative Area (RAA). Reportedly, security forces (SSPDF, NSS) and Police, were deployed to the area and fought back the assailants recovering about 523 herds of cattle that were raided during the joint attack and returning them to their owners.

Description: 3. Location of Incident: Wuzein area under Alieny County- RAA
Description:
4.	On 13 January, two secondary sources reported that on 10 January armed Leek Nuer yourhs from Rubkona County attacked and killed three civilians (two males and one 13-year-old girl) at a fishing camp in Wuzein area under Alieny County- RAA. Reportedly, the attackers are of the same group that attacked the Misseriya cattle camp in Bierr number 10 near Hufra oil field, since the attack of Misseriya cattle camp happened few hours after the killing of the three civilians in Wuzein, and the two area are not very far from each other. 

Comment: HRD will continue to follow-up on this incident for more information.

Location of Incident: Alabek Payam, Tonj North
Description: 5.	On 13 January, three secondary sources reported that on 11 January, 10 male civilians were shot and killed (2 from Dinka Pan-Kuei and 8 from Dinka Pan-Arek) and 13 other injured (seven from Dinka Pan-Kuei and 6 from Dinka Pan-Arek) during violence between Dinka Pan Kuei and Dinka Pan-Arek subclans of Dinka Lou Ariik Community in Alabek Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the fighting was triggered by an attack launched by the Dinka Pan Kuei in Alabek Payam and the injured victims were evacuated to a health facility in Warrap town for treatment:

Location of Incident: the outskirts of Warrap town, Tonj North
Description:
6.	On 13 January, three secondary sources reported that on 11 January, SSPDF soldiers extrajudicially executed four male suspects (three from Adok-thok subclan of Dinka Apuk Padoc and one from Dinka Kongor from Aliek Payam) in the outskirts of Warrap town, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the three of the suspects were accused of inciting the subclan violence between the Agurpiny and Adok-thok subclans and the other was accused of cattle theft. Reportedly, the remains of the victims were handed over to their families for burial in their respective Payams.

Comment: Thus far, this brings the number of extrajudicial executions to six in Warrap State, and 143 cases since 2021.

Location of Incident: Mabia Boma, Tambura Payam, Tambura
Description: 7.	On 13 January, two secondary sources reported that, on 9 January, unidentified armed elements attacked and killed one 36-year-old male civilian from the Azande community along the Mupoi road in Mabia Boma, Tambura Payam, Tambura County. According to the sources, the group of armed men yielding matchets killed the victim while he was on his way from Tambura town to Mabia Boma to collect food, on allegations of him serving as an informant to the security forces on the hideout of the armed groups on 28 December 2024. Reportedly, his body has not been recovered by his family.

Location of Incident: Duma Boma, Nabanga Payam, Tambura
Description:
On 13 January, two secondary sources reported that on 10 January, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one 75-year-old male civilian from the Balanda community along the Namutina road in Duma Boma, Nabanga Payam, Tambura County. According to the sources, the motive for the incident is uncertain but it falls within the wider picture of cyclical violence between the Balanda and Azande communities and the general insecurity that has enveloped the area.

Comment: HRD will continue to monitor these security developments in Western Equatoria State and its human rights implications.

Location of Incident: Kalempus Boma, Katiko Payam, Kapoeta South
Description: 1.	On 14 January, three secondary sources reported that, on 1 January, armed Buya youths from Kimotong Payam, Budi County, shot and killed three civilians from the Toposa community (two male- 24 and 31 years, and one 15-year-old girl), in Kalempus Boma, Katiko Payam, Kapoeta South County. According to the sources, the incident was in revenge for the shooting and wounding of a 52-year-old Buya man in December 2024. The incident was reported to the police and investigations are ongoing.

Location of Incident: Anyieldit in Padiet Payam, Duk
Description: 3.	On 14 January, multiple sources reported that on 12 January Murle armed elements shot and killed one male Dinka civilian in a cattle camp in Anyieldit in Padiet Payam, Duk County. According to the sources, the incident happened during a cattle raid incident where the Murle raided 4000 herds of cattle, and the cattle owners fought back and recovered the raided cattle.

Location of Incident: Anyieldit in Padiet Payam, Duk
Description: 3.	On 14 January, multiple sources reported that on 12 January Murle armed elements shot and killed one male Dinka civilian in a cattle camp in Anyieldit in Padiet Payam, Duk County. According to the sources, the incident happened during a cattle raid incident where the Murle raided 4000 herds of cattle, and the cattle owners fought back and recovered the raided cattle.

Location of Incident: GPAA
Description:
4.	On 14 January, multiple sources reported that on 9 December and 1 January, two former abductees (four-year-old and a two-year-old girl) from Eastern Equatoria, were received by authorities in GPAA and placed under interim care. According to the sources, the children are under the custody of the authorities in GPAA, awaiting family tracing and reunification.

Comment: HRD will continue to follow-up on these reports for more information.

Location of Incident: Mayen village, Tonj South Payam, Tonj South
Description:
5.	On 14 January, three secondary sources reported that on 13 January, six male civilians were shot and killed (four Dinka Muok and 2 Dinka Thony) and six others were shot and injured (unspecified demographics) in Mayen village, Tonj South Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, this is part of an unresolved grievances between the two subsections in Tonj South County. Reportedly, the injured victims were evacuated to a health facility in Tonj town for treatment.

Comment: HRD will continue to monitor the situation for more information.

Location of Incident: Mayen village, Tonj South Payam, Tonj South
Description:
5.	On 14 January, three secondary sources reported that on 13 January, six male civilians were shot and killed (four Dinka Muok and 2 Dinka Thony) and six others were shot and injured (unspecified demographics) in Mayen village, Tonj South Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, this is part of an unresolved grievances between the two subsections in Tonj South County. Reportedly, the injured victims were evacuated to a health facility in Tonj town for treatment.

Comment: HRD will continue to monitor the situation for more information.

Location of Incident: Mundri West town, Mundri West
Description:
6.	On 14 January, one primary source reported that, on 5 January, the SSNPS arbitrarily arrested, detained and tortured one 14-year-old boy in Mundri West town, Mundri West County. According to the source, the victim was accused of stealing 300,000 South Sudanese Pounds (SSP) from a businessman, however, the victim was not informed of the charges at the time of the arrest. The source recounted that, the victim was beaten with sticks severally and his fingers were pressed with metals while in detention, for him to disclose the whereabouts of the alleged stolen money.

Comment: The family of the victim had paid the alleged sum on 11 January, however, the SSNPS have kept the victim in prolonged detention, demanding that 1,000,000 SSP be paid as fines before the victim will be released. HRD will continue to engage justice chain actors for a prompt action to secure the release of the minor from prolonged detention.

Location of Incident: Napotpot Bom, Narus Payam, Kapoeta East
Description:
1.	On 15 January, three secondary sources reported that on 11 January, armed Didinga youths from Maji Boma, Ngauro Payam, Budi County, shot and injured one 18-year-old male civilian from the Toposa community in Napotpot Bom, Narus Payam, Kapoeta East County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked the Longorinyang gold mining area, as part of an ongoing conflict over the area. Reportedly, the victim was taken to a health facility in Kapoeta, although there are plans in motion to evacuate the victim to Kenya due to the severity of his injury.

Comment: HRD will continue to follow-up on this incident for more information.

Location of Incident: Wau town, Wau
Description:
3.	On 15 January, multiple sources reported that, on 21 December, one SSPDF soldier attacked and killed one 65year-old male civilian from the Zande community in Agok residential area, Wau municipality, Wau town, Wau County. According to the sources, the SSPDF soldier stroke the victim with a stick on his head during an altercation, leading to the victim’s immediate death. Reportedly, the SSPDF soldier fled the scene and reported himself to his division commander, who had him arrested and detained at the SSPDF barracks and on 13 January handed the soldier over to the police for investigation. 

Comment: HRD will continue to follow-up with the justice chain actors in the area, to guarantee a victim-centered approach to justice administration.

Location of Incident: Suguru Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi
Description:
1.	On 16 January, three secondary sources reported that, on 11 January, armed Toposa youths from Namonichek Boma, Lokwamor Payam, Kapoeta North County, shot and killed one 16-year-old boy from the Buya community, in Suguru Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, the assailants raided 21 herds of cattle from the deceased, but 13 herds were recovered by local Buya youths who mobilized and rushed to the scene, while the raiders escaped with eight herds into Lokwamor Payam. Reportedly, the matter was reported to the police in Budi County and investigations are ongoing.

Comment: the incident was in retaliation to the shooting and killing of a 21-year-old Toposa man from Katiko Payam, Kapoeta South County by armed Buya men from Suguru Boma, Loriyok Payam, Budi County [see HRD Daily Report 27 December 2024].

Location of Incident: Suguru Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi
Description:
1.	On 16 January, three secondary sources reported that, on 11 January, armed Toposa youths from Namonichek Boma, Lokwamor Payam, Kapoeta North County, shot and killed one 16-year-old boy from the Buya community, in Suguru Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, the assailants raided 21 herds of cattle from the deceased, but 13 herds were recovered by local Buya youths who mobilized and rushed to the scene, while the raiders escaped with eight herds into Lokwamor Payam. Reportedly, the matter was reported to the police in Budi County and investigations are ongoing.

Comment: the incident was in retaliation to the shooting and killing of a 21-year-old Toposa man from Katiko Payam, Kapoeta South County by armed Buya men from Suguru Boma, Loriyok Payam, Budi County [see HRD Daily Report 27 December 2024].

Location of Incident: Gumuruk
Description:
2.	On 16 January, multiple sources reported that, on 14 December, one 15-year-old Lou Nuer girl and former abductee (since 2021), was recovered by authorities in Gumuruk County in Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) and taken to the Interim Care Centre in Pibor. According to the sources, on 20 December, the girl was transferred from Pibor to Juba, and on 27 December, she was transferred to Yuai, where she was reunited with her family. Reportedly, she and her family proceeded to Pajut Boma in Duk County where the family is currently based. 

Comment: The girl recounted that, at least nine Lou Nuer children (six girls and three boys) who were abducted from Jonglei at varying periods of time in the last few years are being held by abductors in Gumuruk County, GPAA. HRD will continue to follow-up on these cases for more information.

Location of Incident: Aweil town, Aweil
Description:
3.	On 16 January, three primary sources reported that, on 10 January, NSS officers arbitrarily arrested and detained three male civilians (including the Imam of Aweil main Mosque) in Aweil town, Aweil County. The sources recounted that, the incident was triggered by a dispute between the victims and a senior member of the Islamic Council in Juba, who ordered for the arrest and detention of the victims for different reasons including their refusal to stepdown and handover to newly appointed committee members and a dispute over an alleged 72,000,000 South Sudanese Pounds (SSP). Reportedly, the victims were released without charges on 13 January following the instructions of the State Director of NSS.

Comment: There were no reports of torture or other cruel, inhuman, or degrading treatment or punishment by the NSS.

Location of Incident: Akemel village, Pakuem Payam, Jau
Description:
4.	Between 14-16 January, multiple sources reported that on 13 January, armed Nuer youths from Unity State, shot and killed one male civilian and injured another in Akemel village, Pakuem Payam, Jau County, Ruweng Administrative Area (RAA). According to the sources, the incident happened during a cattle raid by the armed Nuer youths at a cattle camp in Akemel village where they raided an unspecified herd of cattle. Reportedly, the victims were shot and severely injured and were evacuated to a health facility in Pariang town for treatment, where one of them (Executive Director of Pakuem Payam) succumbed to his injuries. 

Comment: This incident created tension between the Nuer IDP community in Yida and the local Dinka host community. The sources informed that the RAA government relocated about 139 IDP women and children from Yida to Pariang after some Nuer IDP women were attacked by some members of the Dinka host community. HRD will follow-up on the incident for more information.

Location of Incident: Akemel village, Pakuem Payam, Jau
Description:
4.	Between 14-16 January, multiple sources reported that on 13 January, armed Nuer youths from Unity State, shot and killed one male civilian and injured another in Akemel village, Pakuem Payam, Jau County, Ruweng Administrative Area (RAA). According to the sources, the incident happened during a cattle raid by the armed Nuer youths at a cattle camp in Akemel village where they raided an unspecified herd of cattle. Location of Incident: Koch town, Koch
Description:
5.	On 16 January, two secondary sources reported that, on 15 January, one armed Jagei Nuer man shot and killed one male Jagei Nuer civilian (aged between 25-28 years) in Koch town, Koch County. According to the sources, the victim’s brother shot and injured the suspect in December 2024 for an alleged sexual affair with their sister. Reportedly, in retaliation, after recovering from the injury, the suspect shot and killed the victim (second brother to the girl) and fled the scene, while the Koch County Commissioner has instructed the police to search for the suspect and bring him to justice. 

Comment; HRD will continue to monitor the situation for more information.

Location of Incident: Koch town, Koch
Description:
5.	On 16 January, two secondary sources reported that, on 15 January, one armed Jagei Nuer man shot and killed one male Jagei Nuer civilian (aged between 25-28 years) in Koch town, Koch County. According to the sources, the victim’s brother shot and injured the suspect in December 2024 for an alleged sexual affair with their sister. Reportedly, in retaliation, after recovering from the injury, the suspect shot and killed the victim (second brother to the girl) and fled the scene, while the Koch County Commissioner has instructed the police to search for the suspect and bring him to justice. 

Comment; HRD will continue to monitor the situation for more information.

Location of Incident: Madebe Payam, Ibba
Description:
7.	On 16 January, four secondary sources reported that on 14 January, SSNPS officers arbitrarily arrested, detained, illtreated and caused the death of one 61-year-old woman and left another 58-year-old woman in critical health conditions in Madebe Central Boma, Madebe Payam, Ibba County. According to the sources, the victims were arrested, detained, and illtreated (beaten with sticks and denied food and water) by the SSNPS following the disappearance of a four-year-old boy who was in their custody. Reportedly, the surviving woman was taken to a health facility in Ibba County where she is receiving medical treatment. The SSNPS officers involved were arrested by the South Sudan People’s Defense Forces (SSPDF) but later retrieved and transferred to Yambio.

Comment: HRD will continue to engage County authorities of accountability by the officers involved to ensure a victim-centered system of justice administration.

Location of Incident: Madebe Payam, Ibba
Description:
7.	On 16 January, four secondary sources reported that on 14 January, SSNPS officers arbitrarily arrested, detained, illtreated and caused the death of one 61-year-old woman and left another 58-year-old woman in critical health conditions in Madebe Central Boma, Madebe Payam, Ibba County. According to the sources, the victims were arrested, detained, and illtreated (beaten with sticks and denied food and water) by the SSNPS following the disappearance of a four-year-old boy who was in their custody. Location of Incident: Lachorok Boma, Arilo Payam, Lafon
Description:
1.	On 17 January, three secondary sources reported that, on 15 January, armed Toposa youths from Riwoto Payam, Kapoeta North County, shot and killed one 20-year-old male civilian and injured two others (aged 23 and 25 years) in Lachorok Boma, Arilo Payam, Lafon County. According to the sources, the assailants invaded Lachorok Boma to raid cattle when they found the victims bathing in a river in the area and attacked them. Reportedly, the injured victims were evacuated to a health facility in Imehejek Administrative Area (IAA) for treatment, and the incident was reported to the Police in IAA, and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made. 

Comment: no cattle was raided by the assailants as the youths in Lachorok mobilized and pursued them into Kapoeta North County. HRD will continue to follow-up for more information.

Location of Incident: Lachorok Boma, Arilo Payam, Lafon
Description:
1.	On 17 January, three secondary sources reported that, on 15 January, armed Toposa youths from Riwoto Payam, Kapoeta North County, shot and killed one 20-year-old male civilian and injured two others (aged 23 and 25 years) in Lachorok Boma, Arilo Payam, Lafon County. According to the sources, the assailants invaded Lachorok Boma to raid cattle when they found the victims bathing in a river in the area and attacked them. Reportedly, the injured victims were evacuated to a health facility in Imehejek Administrative Area (IAA) for treatment, and the incident was reported to the Police in IAA, and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made. 

Comment: no cattle was raided by the assailants as the youths in Lachorok mobilized and pursued them into Kapoeta North County. HRD will continue to follow-up for more information.

Location of Incident: Rupmaker village in Motot Payam in Uror
Description: 2.	On 18 January, multiple sources reported that on 17 January, Murle armed elements shot and killed one 25-year-old Lou Nuer male civilian and injured three other male civilians (between 23-26 year) in Rupmaker village in Motot Payam in Uror County. According to the sources, the Murle armed elements attacked a cattle camp in Rupmaker village, raided and unspecified herd of cattle and fled the scene. Reportedly, as the Lou Nuer youths mobilized and pursued the raiders, they fell into a coordinated ambush by the Murle armed elements during which the reported casualties happened.

Location of Incident: Rupmaker village in Motot Payam in Uror
Description: 2.	On 18 January, multiple sources reported that on 17 January, Murle armed elements shot and killed one 25-year-old Lou Nuer male civilian and injured three other male civilians (between 23-26 year) in Rupmaker village in Motot Payam in Uror County. According to the sources, the Murle armed elements attacked a cattle camp in Rupmaker village, raided and unspecified herd of cattle and fled the scene. Reportedly, as the Lou Nuer youths mobilized and pursued the raiders, they fell into a coordinated ambush by the Murle armed elements during which the reported casualties happened.

Description: 2. Location of Incident: Aweil town, Wanyjok and Nyamlel markets, in Aweil
Description:
3.	On 17 January, multiple sources reported that, between 16 and 17 January, 15 civilians died (allegedly 12 Sudanese nationals and three South Sudanese) and many others injured during a violent protest by unidentified armed South Sudanese protesters in Aweil town, Wanyjok and Nyamlel markets, in Aweil County. According to the sources, the violence was triggered by news of the alleged killing of some South Sudanese nationals in Al Jazirah state in Southeast Khartoum by Sudanese Armed Forces. Reportedly, State authorities allegedly deployed the police and security forces to contain the situation in the market and residential areas in Aweil town. 

Comment: several Sudanese nationals have deserted their businesses and homes and sort refuge at police stations across Aweil County including the Mathiang military barracks. HRD will continue to follow-up on this incident for further corroboration and more information.

Location of Incident: Aweil town, Wanyjok and Nyamlel markets, in Aweil
Description:
3.	On 17 January, multiple sources reported that, between 16 and 17 January, 15 civilians died (allegedly 12 Sudanese nationals and three South Sudanese) and many others injured during a violent protest by unidentified armed South Sudanese protesters in Aweil town, Wanyjok and Nyamlel markets, in Aweil County. According to the sources, the violence was triggered by news of the alleged killing of some South Sudanese nationals in Al Jazirah state in Southeast Khartoum by Sudanese Armed Forces. Reportedly, State authorities allegedly deployed the police and security forces to contain the situation in the market and residential areas in Aweil town. 

Comment: several Sudanese nationals have deserted their businesses and homes and sort refuge at police stations across Aweil County including the Mathiang military barracks. HRD will continue to follow-up on this incident for further corroboration and more information.

Location of Incident: Kucnyuk village of Tonj Payam in Tonj South
Description: On 17 January, three secondary sources reported that, on the same day, armed Dina Thony youth from Manyangok Payam of Tonj South County, shot and killed one Dinka Muok adult male civilian in Kucnyuk village of Tonj Payam in Tonj South County. According to the source the incident happened when the victim was on his way to Tonj Town in Tonj South County to purchase some items for his family. Reportedly, this is in connection to the ongoing retaliatory violence between Dinka Thony and Dinka Muok in Tonj South County.

Location of Incident: Kuajok town market in Gogrial West
Description: 5.	On 17 January, three secondary sources reported that, on the same day, two civilians were killed (unspecified details) and four others injured in a stampede caused by violent protests in Kuajok town market in Gogrial West County. According to the sources, the violent protest was triggered by the alleged killing of some South Sudanese nationals in Al Jazira state, Southeast Khartoum, allegedly by the Sudan Armed Force. Reportedly, this sparked violent protests in Gogrial West County, by South Sudanese nationals targeting businesses and homes owned by Sudanese nationals and other South Sudanese, resulting in the casualties reported.

Location of Incident: Kuajok town market in Gogrial West
Description: 5.	On 17 January, three secondary sources reported that, on the same day, two civilians were killed (unspecified details) and four others injured in a stampede caused by violent protests in Kuajok town market in Gogrial West County. According to the sources, the violent protest was triggered by the alleged killing of some South Sudanese nationals in Al Jazira state, Southeast Khartoum, allegedly by the Sudan Armed Force. Reportedly, this sparked violent protests in Gogrial West County, by South Sudanese nationals targeting businesses and homes owned by Sudanese nationals and other South Sudanese, resulting in the casualties reported.

Location of Incident: Tonj town, Tonj South County, Warrap State
Description:
1.	On the evening of 16 January 2025, tensions erupted in Juba as groups of unidentified armed South Sudanese protestors took-over some areas in Juba to protest the killing of South Sudanese civilians during the recapture of Wad Madani in Al-Jazirah State,  Sudan, from the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) by the Sudan Armed Forces (SAF).  Though the unrest was initially contained by the South Sudan Government security forces, the violence escalated when groups of violent South Sudanese men mobilized to target the Sudanese communities and other nationalities, including business owners in various parts of Juba, Central Equatoria State and Aweil, Northern Bahr El Ghazal State. Further, similar patterns of civil unrest occurred in Bor town and Duk County, Jonglei State; Malakal and Renk town, Upper Nile State; Wau and Boro Madina towns in Western Bahr El Ghazal State; and Kuajok Town, Gogrial West County and Tonj, Tonj South County in Warrap State. Linked to the escalation of civil unrest in parts of these areas, UNMISS HRD documented attacks on civilians, looting, and the destruction of civilian properties by unidentified South Sudanese armed elements, as well as displacement of civilians, mainly of Sudanese origin. Similarly, tensions were reportedly high in Abiemnom County, Ruweng Administrative Area and Mayom County, Unity State against the Sudanese community in the area. 

2.	As of 24 January, UNMISS HRD documented a total of 304 civilian casualties (39 killed and 265 injured), including 22 women and 55 children (53 boys and two girls), linked to the civil unrest.  Fifteen out of 304 civilian casualties were (confirmed) South Sudanese. Reportedly, 20 civilians (Sudanese traders) were allegedly killed and 35 others injured by unidentified armed protestors in Aweil town, Wanyjok, and Nyamlel, Northern Bharr el Ghazal State; six killed and 175 others injured in Juba, Central Equatoria State;  five killed and 31 others injured in Wau town, Wau County and Boro Madina, Raja County in Western Bhar El Ghazal State; one killed and seven injured in Renk and Malakal town, Upper Nile State; one killed in Maridi County, Western Equatoria State; one killed in Duk County, Jonglei State; and five civilians (including three South Sudanese) were killed and 17 others injured in Twic and  Tonj South Counties, Warrap State.

Location of Incident: Tonj town, Tonj South County, Warrap State
Description:
1.
