Location of Incident: Rualbet Payam, Tonj North
Description: 2.	On 29 January, three secondary sources reported that on 28 January, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one male civilian and injured two others (one woman and her male child), all from the Dinka Jurbol community, in Rualbet Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked and opened fire on the victims in their homestead for unknown reasons. The injured victims were reportedly evacuated to a health care facility in Warrap Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Rualbet Payam, Tonj North
Description: 2.	On 29 January, three secondary sources reported that on 28 January, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one male civilian and injured two others (one woman and her male child), all from the Dinka Jurbol community, in Rualbet Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked and opened fire on the victims in their homestead for unknown reasons. The injured victims were reportedly evacuated to a health care facility in Warrap Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Kumier village, Tonj Payam, Tonj North
Description: 3.	On 30 January, one primary source reported that on 28 January, unidentified armed elements shot and injured one male civilian in Kumier village, Tonj Payam, Tonj North County, Warrap State. As recounted by the source, the assailants attacked and opened fire the victim while he was grazing his cattle in the area, injuring him. The attackers also seized an unspecified number of cattle and fled the scene. Reportedly, the victim was evacuated to a health facility in Tonj Town, and transferred to a hospital in Wau Town, Western Bahr el Ghazal State, and subsequently transferred to Juba for advanced medical attention.

Location of Incident: Kumier village, Tonj Payam, Tonj North
Description: 3.	On 30 January, one primary source reported that on 28 January, unidentified armed elements shot and injured one male civilian in Kumier village, Tonj Payam, Tonj North County, Warrap State. As recounted by the source, the assailants attacked and opened fire the victim while he was grazing his cattle in the area, injuring him. The attackers also seized an unspecified number of cattle and fled the scene. Reportedly, the victim was evacuated to a health facility in Tonj Town, and transferred to a hospital in Wau Town, Western Bahr el Ghazal State, and subsequently transferred to Juba for advanced medical attention.

Location of Incident: Nyolo Boma, Agoro Payam, Magwi
Description:
1.	On 31 January, three secondary sources reported that on 29 January, armed Dinka Bor cattle herders from Jonglei State shot and killed one 52-year-old male civilian from the Acholi community in Nyolo Boma, Agoro Payam, Magwi County. According to the sources, a group of armed Dinka Bor cattle herders encountered and opened fire on two male civilians in the bushes in Nyolo Boma, killing one, while the other escaped unharmed.

Comment: The incident has heightened tensions between the local Acholi community and the Dinka Bor cattle herders in Agoro Payam. Relatedly, on 31 January, suspected Murle armed elements from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) and Acholi youths from Agoro Payam reportedly jointly attacked Dinka Bor cattle herders in Nyolo Boma, and in the ensuing confrontation, Murle armed elements seized and fled with approximately 5,000 heads of cattle. The violence has reportedly resulted in the displacement of approximately 4,200 civilians across Magwi County and 70 houses in Nyolo Boma burnt by armed Dinka Bor cattle herders. Security forces have reportedly been deployed to the area, while UNMISS is engaging with state authorities to support de-escalation of the violence. HRD will follow up to ascertain civilian casualties.

On 3 January 2025, a source (who reportedly interacted with the victim) informed HRD that in October 2025 (date not specified), an SSPDF soldier from an SSPDF unit in Rotriak, Rubkona County, attempted to rape a 27-year-old Leek Nuer woman. The source informed that the incident happened in-between the Rubkona refuse dump site and Helnyamiele, a farming and wood collection area in between Rubkona and the Unity Oil field, Rubkona County. Reportedly, the woman was amongst five women who had gone to collect wood, harvest or buy vegetables. The SSPDF soldier allegedly waited when the woman was trailing the other four before he pushed her to the ground and tried to overpower and rape her. The source informed that two youths travelling on a motorbike intervened and the suspect fled. According to the source, the youths reported to some soldiers in an SSPDF barracks at the oil field and they deployed soldiers who successfully arrested and detained the alleged perpetrator at the SSPDF barracks. Reportedly, the SSPDF soldier confessed to the attempted rape. The source did not know if the soldier was still in detention.

Comments: HRD will gather more details, report and advocate accordingly for preventive action and for accountability. HRD will plan capacity building on human rights, international humanitarian law (IHL) and conflict-related sexual violence for government security forces and armed opposition forces in Rubkona County.

•	Unidentified armed men gang raped two minors in a location in-between Guit and Rubkona Counties, Unity State
On 6 January 2025, two secondary sources informed HRD that in November 2024 (date not specified), unidentified armed persons gang raped two Jakany Nuer minors (aged 11 and seven) in an area along the Rubkona- Manga Port Road. According to the sources, the victims were travelling to their family home in Manga Port and lost their way before meeting the armed perpetrators. Reportedly, the latter gang raped the two before showing them the way to Manga Port. The victims reportedly received medical treatment at a health facility in Manga Port and the case was reported to the police in the area. According to the sources, no suspect has been arrested in connection to the incident.
Comments: HRD will gather more details, advocate for accountability and report accordingly.

•	Unidentified armed men raped two minors in Nhialdiu Payam, Rubkona County, Unity State
On 6 January 2025, two secondary sources informed HRD that in October 2024 (date not specified), unidentified armed persons gang raped two Leek Nuer women in an unspecified location in Nhialdiu Payam, Rubkona County. The sources informed that the two victims had gone to fetch firewood when the armed men accosted them and raped them before fleeing into the bushes. Allegedly, one of the victims became pregnant because of the rape and suffered a miscarriage. Reportedly, the women did not seek or receive medical or psychosocial attention nor did they report to the police, for fear of being stigmatized. 
Comments: On 3 January 2025, HRD reported an attempted rape which occurred in October 2024 in-between the Rubkona refuse dump site and Helnyamiele, a farming and wood collection area in between Rubkona and the Unity Oil field, Rubkona County (see HRD DSR of 3 January 2025). Sources have informed that many victims choose not to report rape incidents for fear of stigma thereby depriving them of medical care or justice. HRD has raised the issue with some protection partners for more awareness raising to be conducted to prevent such incidents and to provide information on safe access to medical and psychosocial assistance for victims. HRD will gather more details, advocate for accountability and more awareness raising, and report accordingly.

Location of Incident: Yambio Town, Yambio County
Description:
•	Alleged Rape of a 25-year-old civilian woman from Hai Tarawa residential area in Yambio Town, Yambio County

On January 3, 2025, HRD's Yambio FO received and documented preliminary reports from multiple sources regarding a rape incident in Yambio town, Yambio County, which occurred on December 31. The survivor, a 25-year-old civilian woman from Hai Tarawa residential area in Yambio Town, was provided protection and support at the Child Transit Center (CTC) in Yambio Town. The alleged perpetrator was not disclosed at the time of this report.

HRD conducted a follow-up visit to the CTC to gather additional information and investigate the reported rape case. Regrettably, the team encountered an obstacle when the security guard denied HRD access to the survivor. The guard cited the need for authorization from the Ministry of Gender and Child Welfare before permitting HRD to meet with the survivor.

Unfortunately, as the ministry was closed at the time of the visit, HRD was unable to obtain the necessary authorization. Undeterred, HRD plans to return on Monday to resume investigations, address the issue of access denial, and ensure that the survivor receives the necessary support and protection. HRD will also provide a detailed report on the case, highlighting any challenges encountered and recommendations for future action.

This incident raises serious human rights concerns, including access to justice, protection of vulnerable groups, and the right to health. HRD will continue to monitor the situation and advocate for the survivor's rights, while addressing the underlying human rights issues.

Comment: HRD will continue to closely monitor the situation, advocate for the rights of the survivor, and work to address the underlying human rights concerns. Additionally, HRD will engage with the Ministry of Gender to address the denial of access issue, ensuring that such obstacles do not recur in the future.

Location of Incident: Sakura, Nzara
Description:
Alleged Rape of a 31-Year-Old Azande Civilian in Sakure Payam, Nzara County

During the SDP to Sakure Payam, Nzara County, HRD was informed by two credible sources, including the police and the health unit worker, of an alleged rape incident that occurred in Buremaku Boma, Sakure Payam, Nzara County, on December 27, 2024. The sources revealed that a 31-year-old woman from the Azande community was reportedly raped by her husband's nephew, a Congolese national, while her husband was away hunting.

The victim sought medical attention at the Sakure Primary Health Unit on December 31, 2024, 72 hours after the incident. The suspect was arrested and detained at the police station for investigation. 

Comment: HRD Yambio FO will continue to follow up on the incident to ensure accountability.

Location of Incident: Yambio Town, Yambio County
Description:
•	Update on the Case of Severe Domestic Violence in Yambio Town, Yambio County

On January 8, 2025, HRD Yambio FO interviewed a 25-year-old woman (details on file) who had endured severe domestic violence and abuse, including rape, allegedly perpetrated by her husband (details on file) between December 25 and December 31, 2024. The victim's account confirmed earlier reports from the Western Equatoria State Human Rights Commission and other sources, as documented in HRD Yambio FO's Daily Human Rights Reports of January 3 and 6, 2025.

The survivor, a mother of four from the Jur Community, recounted the horrific incidents that occurred after her husband, a former South Sudan Peoples Defence Forces (SSPDF) soldier, accused her of infidelity. Over the years, she suffered physical assaults, psychological torture, rape, and denial of economic opportunities. In 2024, she secured a job with an NGO, but her husband refused to let her take the position, citing unfounded concerns about extramarital activities.

Fearing for her life, the survivor escaped from her home and fled to the Child Transit Centre in Yambio Town, Yambio County, on December 31, 2024, and reported the incidents to the authorities, including the Human Rights Commission. A police case was opened on January 7, 2025, and the perpetrator was arrested and detained at the Police Headquarters in Yambio.

The survivor is receiving medical treatment and support services at a health facility in Yambio Town. This case underscores the pervasive nature of gender-based violence in Western Equatoria State, where women and girls continue to face disproportionate risks of violence and abuse.

Comment: The survivor and two of her children are seeking refuge at the Child Transit Centre in Yambio, where they receive protection. Nevertheless, the family faces challenges accessing necessities like food and other necessities. The survivor has expressed her intention to remain at the facility until the case is brought before a court of law, citing concerns for her safety and well-being should she return to her abusive husband.

Location of Incident: Kondeko Sub Boma, Jansuk Boma, Yei Town Payam of Yei River County.
Description:
•	Abduction and rape of a 15-year-old girl by three unidentified men in Kondeko Sub Boma, Jansuk Boma, Yei Town Payam of Yei River County. 
On 14 January 2025, HRD YFO, received and documented information from two reliable secondary sources including police officer and a traditional leader about the abduction and rape of a 15-year-old girl by unidentified men on 05 January 2025 in Kondeko Sub Boma, Jansuk Boma, Yei Town Payam of Yei River County. 

According to the sources, on 17 December 2024, a 15-year-old victim, a primary seven pupil in Juba (details on file) came to Yei from Juba to visit her relative in Kondeko Sub Boma. It was reported that at around 22:00 hours on 05 January 2025 the victim was kidnapped while walking alone at night from her cousin’s house towards her grandmother’s house. Three unidentified masked assailants on a boda-boda forcibly took her and raped her from abandoned house. Sources added that on 08 January the victim was released by her captors and the victim reported the incident to Kondeko Police. It was reported that the police instead of providing support and protection to the victim, they provided male police and military personnel at Kondeko Police Post to question and   beat the victim with a horse pipe as part of interrogations. 

On 08 January 2025, the victim was examined at the medical facility in Yei Town, where she received medical treatment. HRD established from the medical personnel that due rape and ill treatment, the victims sustained injuries including swollen genitalia, vaginal bleeding, visible bruises, and abnormal gait.

Comments: The abduction of a 15-year-old girl is a violation of personal liberty and security contrary to Article 37 of the Convention on the Rights of the Child (CRC. Additionally, sexual violence against a child is violation of bodily integrity (Article 34 of the CRC) Holding and beating the victim captive in inhumane conditions is a cruel, inhuman, or degrading treatment (Article 5 of the UDHR; Article 37 of the CRC). The beating of the victim by Police and military during questioning amounts to torture and ill-treatment according to the Convention against Torture and Other Cruel, Inhuman or Degrading Treatment or Punishment (CAT). Police mistreatment of the victim during interrogation highlights the importance of proper training for law enforcement and the need for strict adherence to international standards in dealing with survivors of sexual violence. HRD further established that on the 06 January 2025, in relation to her disappearance, three female cousins and two male acquaintances of the victim were arrested without proper investigation. The arbitrary arrest of victim's relatives without proper investigation for no apparent reasons is a violation Article 9 of the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights (ICCPR).

Location of Incident: Mugwo Payam, Yei River County
Description:
•	Rape resulting into pregnancy of a 17-year-old girl by a civilian man in Mugwo Payam, Yei River County
On 13 January 2025, HRD YFO, received and documented information from two reliable sources including police officer and a traditional leader about the rape of a 17-year-old girl by a 28-year-old civilian man in Mugwo Payam, Yei River County on 11 January 2025. The rape resulted into pregnancy of the survivor.

On 11 January 2025, the 17-year-old victim (details on file) from the Kakwa tribe and her parents reported a case of rape and pregnancy to the Police Station in Mugwo Payam, Yei River County. It was reported that over the past two months, the perpetrator (details on file) also from the Kakwa tribe allegedly raped the victim multiple times resulting into pregnancy. The perpetrator confessed to the "relationship" and the crime, expressing willingness to settle for early marry which the survivor declined despite the survivor's family agreement. The victim had reportedly been inappropriately detained allegedly for her safety since 11 January 2025. This practice of detaining victims is a severe violation of human rights and contradicts best practices in handling sexual violence cases. On 13 January 2025, the survivor was reportedly brought to a medical facility in Mugwo Payam for medical attention The case is scheduled to be heard by the traditional court on 14 January 2025. 

Comments: The sexual acts between a 28-year-old man and a 17-year-old girl constitute statutory rape under South Sudanese law While traditional courts play a role in South Sudanese justice systems, cases of sexual violence should ideally be managed by the formal legal system to ensure proper procedures and victim protection. The team advised the police to immediately release the 17-year-old victim from detention and ensure her safety and well-being. The police were also advised to arrest the 28-year-old perpetrator and initiate formal criminal proceedings. This case reflects the ongoing challenges of addressing sexual violence in Greater Yei. It underscores the need for strengthened legal frameworks, improved law enforcement responses, and comprehensive support systems for survivors of sexual violence. HRD YFO will continue to follow up the case.

Location of Incident: IDP Camp 3, Rejaf Payam, Juba County, CES
Description:
•	A 14-year-old girl was gang-raped by three unidentified men in Zone 4, Block 1 of IDP Camp 3, Rejaf Payam, Juba County, CES
On 15 January 2025, HRD JFO received and documented information from a primary source and a secondary source (a relative of the survivor) about the gang rape of a 14-year-old girl from the Nuer ethnicity (details on file) by three unidentified men in Zone 4, Block 1 of IDP Camp 3 at approximately 12 a.m. on 01 January 2025. 
According to the sources, initially the survivor and her two friends (details on file) were returning from the church to their residence at IDP Camp 3, Zone 4, Block 2 when they were confronted by a group of men (number not specified). The men attempted to pursue them, resulting in the three girls running in separate directions. The survivor ran back to the church and stayed there for a while. At approximately 12 a.m., she decided to walk back home; unfortunately, she encountered another three men who stopped her and dragged her towards the compound of Zone 4, Block 1 of IDP Camp 3, where she was physically assaulted before being gang raped. She made an alarm, which resulted in a man coming to rescue her. The three men abandoned the survivor before the man arrived. The man then escorted the survivor home. 
The case was reported to the police on 3 January 2025, and the two perpetrators have been arrested and are now detained at Jebel Police Station while the other one remains at large. 
The survivor received medical and psychosocial support at a hospital in Juba.
Comment: HRD JFO will continue to follow up with the case and locate the man who saved the survivor for an interview.

Location of Incident: Hai Nyakama, Yei Town, Yei Town Payam of Yei River County
Description:
•	A 13-year-old girl raped by a civilian male 09 December 2024 in Hai Nyakama, Yei Town, Yei Town Payam of Yei River County  
On 15 January 2025, HRD YFO, received and documented information from two reliable sources including medical officer and a humanitarian worker the rape of a 13-year-old by a civilian male in Yei Town, Yei Town Payam of Yei River County on 09 December 2024. 

According to the sources, on 09 December 2024, the 13-year-old (details on file) from the Kakwa tribe visited her “boyfriend’s” (details on file) residence in Hai Nyakama. During this visit, sexual intercourse occurred between victim and her “boyfriend” who is also a minor. The following day, the boyfriend disclosed the incident to his friends, who subsequently reported the incident to the survivor’s brother. The medical report on 25 December 2024 indicates that the survivor was raped, and the rape resulted into pregnancy. The perpetrator has been arrested by police in Yei for further investigations.

Comments: Both the victim and the perpetrator are minors which raises serious legal issues regarding consent, statutory rape and detention. The pregnancy resulting from the incident adds complexity to the case and requires immediate attention to the victim's health and well-being. The delay in reporting (16 days) may have implications for evidence collection and the effectiveness of certain medical interventions.

Location of Incident: Dangoda village, Jansuk Boma, Yei Town Payam of Yei River County
Description:
•	Rape of a 15-year-old by a civilian male in Dangoda village, Jansuk Boma, Yei Town Payam of Yei River County  
On 15 January 2025, HRD YFO, received and documented information from two reliable sources including medical officer and a humanitarian worker the about the incident of rape of a 15-year-old by a civilian male in Yei Town, Yei Town Payam of Yei River County on 26 December 2024. 

According to the sources, on 26 December 2024, at approximately 19:00 hours, a 15-year-old (details on file) visited her classmate’s (details on file) residence in Dangoda village, Jansuk Boma. Upon arrival, she encountered a civilian (details on file) who raped her. The friend of the victim, upon returning home, discovered the situation and informed victim’s parents. The victim was brought to the one of the medical facilities on 28 December 2024, where she received medical care. The case was not reported to the police for unknown reasons. The family has decided to handle the matter internally. 

Comments: The victim is a minor (15 years old), which raises legal issues regarding consent. The decision to handle the matter at the family level may potentially obstruct justice and proper support for the victim. HRD will continue to follow up the case.

Location of Incident: Hai Zubaat, Bentiu town, Unity State
Description:
•	Two men reportedly gang raped a Leek Nuer woman in Hai Zubaat, Bentiu town, Unity State
On 14 January 2025, during a routine patrol by UNMO and HRD, a primary source (victim) informed HRD that on 12 April 2024 at around 8pm, two men reportedly raped her in the Hai Zubaat neighborhood in Bentiu town. According to the 20-year-old victim, she was on her way to buy bread from a shop in a nearby local market when the two men overpowered and gang raped her before fleeing the scene of the incident. The victim informed that she received medical treatment at a health facility in Bentiu but did not report the case to the police. HRD referred the victim to a protection partner for psycho-social assistance. 
Comments: HRD has recently reported on some rape incidents in Rubkona. HRD will conduct further investigations, advocate for preventive action and accountability. HRD is working with relevant UNMISS sections and components to organize an internal meeting to strategize on how to address the situation and prevent further incidents. HRD will also liaise with government and protection partners for concerted preventive and response action. The absence of permanent judges or judicial institutions in Unity State has been a factor helping to cement the climate of impunity and lack of confidence in the formal justice system. HRD will also collaborate with RoLSIS to disseminate the outcome of the recent Bentiu mobile courts, including the rape and SGBV convictions, to help instill more confidence in the justice system amongst community members who are either not aware or still have some distrust for the formal justice system (currently the periodic mobile courts). HRD will continue to participate in regular UNMO and UNPOL joint patrols to gather more details and conduct advocacy. HRD will report accordingly.

Update on SGBV cases from Partners: TOCH informed that from the 19 December 2024 to 23 January, they recorded 21 GBV cases including 13 rape cases, 02 sexual assault, 04 Physical assault and 02 forced marriage cases at the one stop center in Kuajok Hospital and that the victims received medical, psychosocial support as well as dignity kits for survivors of GBV while the legal procedures are ongoing.  TOCH also informed that last week (date unknown) a minor was raped by her uncle in Alek. The uncle was later arrested and the victim received medical and psychosocial support. HRD will follow up on the rape cases to ascertain their status.

Location of Incident: uweng Administrative Area (RAA).
Description:
•	HRD was informed about the alleged rape of a 15-year-old Dinka Panaruu girl by a 27-year-old police officer in Ruweng Administrative Area (RAA). 
During the police detention monitoring, HRD, UNPOL, and Gender Affair Unit was informed about a rape case incident of 15-year-old girl by a 27-year-old police officer. The incident happened on 09 January 2025 during the cultural dance. The police officer who was in-charge of the detention cell informed that the incident occurred when the alleged police suspect was under the influence of alcohol and allegedly rape the victim. The family of the victim were the ones who discovered the incident, and reported the incident to the police and the suspect was arrested on 10 January 2025, one day after the incident. HRD and UNPOL briefly interviewed the suspect while in detention, but he denied raping the suspect. He said he was only talking to the girl because he wanted to send her to bring something for him. He said the family found him talking with 15-year-old girl at around pm while people were attending to the cultural dance. He said when the family saw them talking, they allegedly attacked, beat and accused him of raping their daughter. The girl was reportedly taken to the medical facility, but the result was never shared with the police, and the case remains under police investigation while awaiting mobile court.
Comments: HRD was observed that the police officer cased of perpetrating rape was allowed to move freely out of the detention cell and within the police compound while others with less serious offences were not given the same privilege and remained in the detention cell. HRD complained and asked why the suspect was allowed to move freely, posing a flight risk, and the police responded that the suspect was only allowed to move around the detention facility but not out of the police premises.

Location of Incident: Pankeer, Bor South, Jonglei State
Description:
Rape of a minor in Pankeer, Bor South, Jonglei State

On 28 January, HRD received information from protection actors and CSOs that on 31 December 2024 at 23:00 hours, a minor Dinka girl aged 12-year-old, was subjected to sexual violence by a male in Pankeer, Bor town, Bor South County, Jonglei State. The survivor was travelling alone returning to home when the alleged 20 years-old Dinka male raped her. According to the sources, on 04 January the survivor presented herself at the hospital and received both medical treatment and psychosocial support at the One-Stop-Centre in Bor town. HRD received information that the perpetrator was arrested at the same day and was taken to the Bor main prison.

Location of Incident: Pakual, Bor Town, Bor South, Jonglei State
Description:
Rape of a woman in Pakual, Bor Town, Bor South, Jonglei State

On 28 January, HRD received information from protection actors and CSOs that on 28 January, during daytime, a woman aged 20 years-old from Dinka community was subjected to sexual violence by a 30-year-old Dinka man in Block M in Pakwau suburb, Bor Town, Bor South, Jonglei State. Reportedly, the survivor was alone in the residence she shares with her parents when the perpetrator broke into her house, attacked and raped her. According to the sources, the perpetrator was apprehended shortly after the attack by the police that arrested him. According to the protection partners, the survivor presented herself at the hospital on 21 January and received specialized treatment at the one-stop-center in Bor.

Comments: HRD will follow up on the reported cases at the police station to advocate for justice and accountability

Location of Incident: Kakwa community in Lutaya Kondeko Sub-boma, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County.
Description:
1.	On 3 February, two secondary sources reported that on 22 January, one SSPDF soldier raped a 26-year-old female civilian from the Kakwa community in Lutaya Kondeko Sub-boma, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, the SSPDF soldier attacked the victim while she was harvesting produce from her farm, accused her of belonging to the National Salvation Front (NAS) and proceeded to rape her. The incident was reported to the police in the area. On 23 January, the survivor received medical care at a health care facility in Yei Town.

Comment: HRD will follow-up on the incident for accountability of the perpetrator.

Location of Incident: Lou Nuer community in Pulbura, Tiam Payam, Uror County
Description: 2.	On 3 February, multiple sources reported that on 31 January, Murle armed elements shot and killed one 33-year-old male civilian from the Lou Nuer community in Pulbura, Tiam Payam, Uror County. According to the sources, Murle armed elements attacked and opened fire on a group of five Lou Nuer male civilians while they were hunting in the bushes, killing one. Reportedly, the Lou Nuer youths are patrolling the area to protect the community from further attacks by Murle armed elements.

Location of Incident: Cum-Cok residential area, Jiir Payam, Rumbek Centre County
Description:
3.	On 3 February, one primary source and one secondary source reported that on 2 February, one NSS personnel raped a 10-year-old girl in Cum-Cok residential area, Jiir Payam, Rumbek Centre County. According to the sources, the NSS officer found the survivor and two other children (ages between three – five years old) alone at their homestead, dragged the survivor into the house and raped her. Reportedly, the victim was rescued by a NSS patrol team that heard her crying inside the house. The perpetrator was subsequently arrested and detained by the NSS in Rumbek Town.

Comment: HRD will follow up on the incident and engage with the authorities for accountability for the perpetrator.

Location of Incident: in Apat village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj South County
Description:
4.	On 3 February, three secondary sources reported that on 1 February, five civilians were shot and killed (three Dinka Muok and two Dinka Thony Payam) and four others were injured (two Dinka Muok and two Dinka Thony) during violence between armed Dinka Mouk and Dinka Thony youths in Apat village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Muok youths attacked the Dinka Thony community in Apat village and in the ensuing confrontation, five civilians were shot and killed and four others were injured. The injured victims from the Dinka Muok community were reportedly evacuated to a health care facility in Tonj Payam, while the injured from the Dinka Thony community were referred to a health care facility in Manyangok Payam for medical treatment.

Comment: According to the sources, tension  is mounting in the area with the likelihood of more retaliatory violence.

Location of Incident: in Apat village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj South County
Description:
4.	On 3 February, three secondary sources reported that on 1 February, five civilians were shot and killed (three Dinka Muok and two Dinka Thony Payam) and four others were injured (two Dinka Muok and two Dinka Thony) during violence between armed Dinka Mouk and Dinka Thony youths in Apat village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Muok youths attacked the Dinka Thony community in Apat village and in the ensuing confrontation, five civilians were shot and killed and four others were injured. The injured victims from the Dinka Muok community were reportedly evacuated to a health care facility in Tonj Payam, while the injured from the Dinka Thony community were referred to a health care facility in Manyangok Payam for medical treatment.

Comment: According to the sources, tension  is mounting in the area with the likelihood of more retaliatory violence.

Location of Incident: in Puolbar village, Marial Lou Payam, Tonj North County
Description:
5.	On 3 February, three secondary sources reported that on 31 January, armed Dinka Luanyjang youths from Paweng Payam, Tonj East County shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Lou Paher community during an attempted cattle raid in Puolbar village, Marial Lou Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Luanyjang youths attacked and opened fire on the victim while he was herding his cattle in Puolbar village, killing him. The attackers were reportedly repulsed by armed Dinka Lou Paher youths and fled without raiding any cattle.

Comment: According to the sources, armed Dinka Lou Paher youths are mobilizing for a retaliatory attack against the Dinka Luanyjang community. HRD is engaging with the local authorities to take proactive measures to deescalate tensions and avert more violence.

Location of Incident: the Moru community in Movo Boma, Kediba Payam, Mundri East County.
Description:
6.	On 3 February, multiple sources reported that on 19 January, NAS elements shot and injured one male civilian from the Moru community in Movo Boma, Kediba Payam, Mundri East County. According to the sources, NAS elements stormed the homestead of the victim, where he was with other relatives and attempted to abduct them; however, opened fire on the victim when he attempted to escape, injuring. The injured victim was reportedly evacuated to a health care facility in Juba, Central Equatoria State for advanced medical attention.

Comment: Reportedly, the presence of NAS elements and the prevailing insecurity in the area has triggered the displacement of over 50,000 civilians from Mundri East and Mundri West Counties to safer areas

Location of Incident: Mundri Town, Mundri West County
Description: 7.	On 3 February, multiple sources reported that on 15 January, one SPLA-IO element attacked and killed one male civilian in Mundri Town, Mundri West County. According to the sources, the SPLA-IO element hit the victim with a blunt object during an altercation between the two,  killing the victim on the spot.

Location of Incident: from the Balanda community in Young Star residential area, Tambura Town, Tambura County
Description: 8.	On 3 February, multiple sources reported that on 31 January, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one unarmed man (member of the South Sudan National Police Service (SSNPS) who was off duty) from the Balanda community in Young Star residential area, Tambura Town, Tambura County. According to the sources, the assailants opened fire on the victim while he was visiting his house in the area, where he had been displaced over a year ago. Reportedly, a case has been opened with the police in Tambura and investigations are ongoing.

Location of Incident: Pojulu community (former officer of the South Sudan National Police Service (SSNPS)) in Giru Village, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County
Description:
1.	On 4 February, two secondary sources reported that on 19 January, the SSPDF arbitrarily arrested and detained one male civilian from the Pojulu community (former officer of the South Sudan National Police Service (SSNPS)) in Giru Village, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, SSPDF soldiers arrested the victim from his home and detained him at the joint operation detention facility in Yei Town for his alleged involvement in the murder of three women in Yei Town on 25 December 2024. Reportedly, no formal complaint has been brought against him since his arrest, and his family and other visitors have been denied access to see him.

Comment: HRD will engage with the authorities and SSPDF leadership on due process.

Location of Incident: from the Acholi community in Nyolo Boma, Agoro Payam, Magwi County
Description:
2.	On 4 February, three secondary sources reported that on 31 January, armed Dinka Bor cattle herders from Jonglei State shot and killed one 32-year-old male civilian from the Acholi community in Nyolo Boma, Agoro Payam, Magwi County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Bor cattle herders attacked and opened fire on the victim while he had gone back to his homestead in Nyolo Boma to collect some food, killing him. The incident was reported at Ayii and Magwi Police Stations and investigation is reportedly ongoing.

Comment: According to the sources, the victim was one of the persons who had been displaced from Nyolo Boma to Oboma/Ayii Bomas in Iwire Payam, where food had become scarce. Reportedly, most houses in Nyolo Boma have been looted and burnt down by armed Dinka Bor cattle herders.

Location of Incident: in Rualbet and Awul Payams, Tonj North County
Description:
3.	On 4 February, multiple sources reported that on 31 January, eight civilians were shot and killed (four Dinka Awan and four Dinka Atok including one woman) and three others were injured (all men – two Dinka Awan and one Dinka Atok) during violence between the armed Atok Dinka and Dinka youths in Rualbet and Awul Payams, Tonj North County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Atok youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Awan community in Apor-Lok village, killing four men and injuring two others. In retaliation, armed Dinka Awan youths attacked and opened fire on Dinka Atok civilians, killing four including one woman and injuring one man. The injured victims from the Dinka Awan community are reportedly receiving medical treatment at a health care facility in Rualbet, while the injured Dinka Atok victim is receiving medical treatment at a health care facility in  Warrap Town, in Awul Payam. The County leadership has visited the area to de-escalate the situation.

Comment: According to the sources, the violence was triggered by dispute over ownership of Apor-Lok village which lies at the shared border between the two communities and a recent alleged armed cattle raid by suspected armed Dinka Awan youths in Awul Payam during which over 200 heads of cattle were reportedly stolen. Reportedly, the County authorities visited the area to de-escalate the situation.

Location of Incident: in Rualbet and Awul Payams, Tonj North County
Description:
3.	On 4 February, multiple sources reported that on 31 January, eight civilians were shot and killed (four Dinka Awan and four Dinka Atok including one woman) and three others were injured (all men – two Dinka Awan and one Dinka Atok) during violence between the armed Atok Dinka and Dinka youths in Rualbet and Awul Payams, Tonj North County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Atok youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Awan community in Apor-Lok village, killing four men and injuring two others. In retaliation, armed Dinka Awan youths attacked and opened fire on Dinka Atok civilians, killing four including one woman and injuring one man. The injured victims from the Dinka Awan community are reportedly receiving medical treatment at a health care facility in Rualbet, while the injured Dinka Atok victim is receiving medical treatment at a health care facility in  Warrap Town, in Awul Payam. The County leadership has visited the area to de-escalate the situation.

Reportedly, the County authorities visited the area to de-escalate the situation.

Description:

Location of Incident: in Rualbet and Awul Payams, Tonj North County
Description:
3.	On 4 February, multiple sources reported that on 31 January, eight civilians were shot and killed (four Dinka Awan and four Dinka Atok including one woman) and three others were injured (all men – two Dinka Awan and one Dinka Atok) during violence between the armed Atok Dinka and Dinka youths in Rualbet and Awul Payams, Tonj North County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Atok youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Awan community in Apor-Lok village, killing four men and injuring two others. In retaliation, armed Dinka Awan youths attacked and opened fire on Dinka Atok civilians, killing four including one woman and injuring one man. The injured victims from the Dinka Awan community are reportedly receiving medical treatment at a health care facility in Rualbet, while the injured Dinka Atok victim is receiving medical treatment at a health care facility in  Warrap Town, in Awul Payam. The County leadership has visited the area to de-escalate the situation.

Comment: According to the sources, the violence was triggered by dispute over ownership of Apor-Lok village which lies at the shared border between the two communities and a recent alleged armed cattle raid by suspected armed Dinka Awan youths in Awul Payam during which over 200 heads of cattle were reportedly stolen. Reportedly, the County authorities visited the area to de-escalate the situation.

Location of Incident: in Dong village, Aliek Payam, Tonj North County.
Description:
4.	On 4 February, three secondary sources reported that, on 28 January, armed Nuer youths from Unity State shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Kongor community in Dong village, Aliek Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, armed Nuer youths attacked and opened fire on the victim while he was grazing his cattle in Dong village, killing him. The attackers also seized seven heads of cattle and thereafter fled across the border back into Unity State.

Comment: Tensions is reportedly mounting in among the Dinka Kongor community amidst fear of more attacks during the dry season.

Location of Incident: in Dong village, Aliek Payam, Tonj North County.
Description:
4.	On 4 February, three secondary sources reported that, on 28 January, armed Nuer youths from Unity State shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Kongor community in Dong village, Aliek Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, armed Nuer youths attacked and opened fire on the victim while he was grazing his cattle in Dong village, killing him. The attackers also seized seven heads of cattle and thereafter fled across the border back into Unity State.

Comment: Tensions is reportedly mounting in among the Dinka Kongor community amidst fear of more attacks during the dry season.

Location of Incident: Bari community in Pakala village, Ayii Boma, Iwire Payam, Magwi County
Description:
1.	On 5 February, three secondary sources reported that on 1 February, armed Dinka Bor cattle herders shot and killed one 52-year-old male civilian from the Bari community in Pakala village, Ayii Boma, Iwire Payam, Magwi County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Bor cattle herders stormed and opened fire on the victim in his homestead, killing him, in continuation of violence over grazing land. The incident was reported at Ayii and Magwi Police Stations and investigations are reportedly ongoing.

Comment: Reportedly, the victim’s home as well as other abandoned homes in Pakala village have been occupied by armed Dinka Bor cattle herders. This has created widespread fear among the displaced communities to return to the area.

Location of Incident: Lou Nuer community, in Nyale Boma, Waat Payam, Nyirol County.
Description: 2.	On 5 February, multiple sources reported that on 3 February, Murle armed elements shot and killed one male civilian and injured another, both from the Lou Nuer community, in Nyale Boma, Waat Payam, Nyirol County. According to the sources, Murle armed elements attacked and opened fire on a group of Lou Nuer civilians who were transporting the cattle, killing one man and injuring another. The attackers also raided an unspecified number of cattle, which were reportedly recovered by Lou Nuer youths. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Waat Payam for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Lou Nuer community, in Nyale Boma, Waat Payam, Nyirol County.
Description: 2.	On 5 February, multiple sources reported that on 3 February, Murle armed elements shot and killed one male civilian and injured another, both from the Lou Nuer community, in Nyale Boma, Waat Payam, Nyirol County. According to the sources, Murle armed elements attacked and opened fire on a group of Lou Nuer civilians who were transporting the cattle, killing one man and injuring another. The attackers also raided an unspecified number of cattle, which were reportedly recovered by Lou Nuer youths. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Waat Payam for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: another in Mezo village, Wunkok Payam, Pibor County, GPAA
Description: 3.	On 5 February, multiple sources reported that on 1 February, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one 25-year-old male civilian from the Murle community and injured another in Mezo village, Wunkok Payam, Pibor County, GPAA. According to the sources, the assailants attacked and opened fire on three Murle civilians including one woman as they were walking from Wunkok to Pibor, killing one and injuring another, while the woman escaped unharmed and reported the incident to the authorities in Pibor.

Location of Incident: another in Mezo village, Wunkok Payam, Pibor County, GPAA
Description: 3.	On 5 February, multiple sources reported that on 1 February, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one 25-year-old male civilian from the Murle community and injured another in Mezo village, Wunkok Payam, Pibor County, GPAA. According to the sources, the assailants attacked and opened fire on three Murle civilians including one woman as they were walking from Wunkok to Pibor, killing one and injuring another, while the woman escaped unharmed and reported the incident to the authorities in Pibor.

Location of Incident: Bul Nuer community in Abiemnom Town, Abiemnom County, Ruweng Administrative Area
Description: 4.	On 5 February, three secondary sources reported that on 4 February, suspected armed Dinka Alor youths shot and killed one 21-year-old male civilian from the Bul Nuer community in Abiemnom Town, Abiemnom County, Ruweng Administrative Area. According to the sources, a group of seven unidentified armed elements attacked three Bul Nuer male civilians who were tending to the cattle of the Nuer spiritual leader in Abiemnom Town, killing one, and thereafter fled the scene. The motive for the attack remains unknown. The sources further informed that government security forces were deployed to the area to avert further attacks.

Location of Incident: in Dangar village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County
Description:
5.	On 5 February, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, two male civilians were shot and killed (one Dinka Thiik and one Dinka Akook), and 10 others were injured (four male Dinka Thiik and six Dinka Akook including one woman) during violence between armed Dinka Thiik and Dinka Akook youths in Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Akook youths attacked and opened fire on Dangar village, Ngabagok Payam, killing one male civilian from the Dinka Thiik community and injuring four others, and thereafter fled the scene. In retaliation, armed Dinka Thiik youths attacked and opened fire on homesteads of the Dinka Akook community in Malual-Cum village, killing one man and injuring six others including one woman. Reportedly, two of the injured Dinka Thiik civilians were evacuated to a health care facility in Wunlit Payam for medical treatment, while the other two, and the injured Dinka Akook civilians are receiving treatment locally. 

Comment: According to the sources, the incident is linked to cyclical revenge violence for unresolved grievances between the Dinka Akook and the Dinka Thiik communities. The County authorities have reportedly deployed additional security forces to the area to avert more revenge violence.

Location of Incident: in Dangar village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County
Description:
5.	On 5 February, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, two male civilians were shot and killed (one Dinka Thiik and one Dinka Akook), and 10 others were injured (four male Dinka Thiik and six Dinka Akook including one woman) during violence between armed Dinka Thiik and Dinka Akook youths in Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County. Comment: According to the sources, the incident is linked to cyclical revenge violence for unresolved grievances between the Dinka Akook and the Dinka Thiik communities. The County authorities have reportedly deployed additional security forces to the area to avert more revenge violence.

Description:

Description:
5.
