Location of Incident: in Tit-Magaik village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj South County
Description:
6.	On 5 February, multiple sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Muok youths shot and injured one male civilian from the Dinka Thony community in Tit-Magaik village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Muok youths ambushed and opened fire on the victim while he was herding his cattle for grazing in Tit-Magaik village, injuring him. The victim was evacuated to a hospital in Tonj Town for medical treatment.

Comment: According to the sources, the attack was a revenge action for unresolved grievances connected to past violence between the two communities. Reportedly, tension is mounting between the two communities amidst reports of mobilization by armed Dinka Thony youths for retaliation.

Location of Incident: Bai community in Gedi Boma, Bazia/Kpaile Payam, Wau County
Description:
7.	On 5 February, one primary source and one secondary source reported that on 26 December, one SPLA-IO element raped a 17-year-old girl from the Bai community in Gedi Boma, Bazia/Kpaile Payam, Wau County. According to the sources, the SPLA-IO element approached the victim during a funeral service at their family home in the Mongu-Arab locality, Gedi Boma, forced her on a motorcycle and took her to another house where he raped her and thereafter her near the funeral place. Reportedly, on 10 January, the incident was reported at Hai Kossti Police Station and the survivor received medical care at a health care facility in Wau Town.

Comment: Reportedly, the SPLA-IO leadership requested for the medical report so as to settle the case customarily. HRD will continue to follow up and advocate for accountability of the perpetrator.

Location of Incident: Tambura Town, Tambura county
Description:
8.	On 5 February, multiple sources reported that on 2 and 3 February, soldiers of the EACRF arbitrarily arrested and detained four male civilians from the Balanda community in Tambura town, Tambura County. As recounted by the sources, on 2 February, EACRF soldiers arrested two of the victims from Maringindo Boma, Nagero County when they had gone to a local bank in Tambura Town and detained them at the EACRF barracks for unknown reason. Similarly, on 3 February,  the EACRF arbitrarily arrested two male civilians  (commercial motorcycle operators) as they were traveling from Mapiso village, Mangburu Boma to Tambura Town, and transferred to the EACRF barracks in Tambura, where they remain in detention.

Comment: The incidents have heightened tensions among the Balanda community and has restricted their movement into Tambura Town. The arbitrary arrest and detention of Balanda civilians by the EACRF raises serious human rights concerns and could further deepen ethnic tensions in an already fragile environment and undermine peace efforts in Tambura County.

Location of Incident: from Mapiso village, Mangburu Boma to Tambura Town
Description:
8.	On 5 February, multiple sources reported that on 2 and 3 February, soldiers of the EACRF arbitrarily arrested and detained four male civilians from the Balanda community in Tambura town, Tambura County. As recounted by the sources, on 2 February, EACRF soldiers arrested two of the victims from Maringindo Boma, Nagero County when they had gone to a local bank in Tambura Town and detained them at the EACRF barracks for unknown reason. Similarly, on 3 February,  the EACRF arbitrarily arrested two male civilians  (commercial motorcycle operators) as they were traveling from Mapiso village, Mangburu Boma to Tambura Town, and transferred to the EACRF barracks in Tambura, where they remain in detention.

Comment: The incidents have heightened tensions among the Balanda community and has restricted their movement into Tambura Town. The arbitrary arrest and detention of Balanda civilians by the EACRF raises serious human rights concerns and could further deepen ethnic tensions in an already fragile environment and undermine peace efforts in Tambura County.

Location of Incident: Azande community in Mupoi Payam, Tambura County
Description: 9.	On 4 February, multiple sources reported that on 17 December, armed Balanda elements abducted 27 civilians (eight men and 19 others including women and children) from the Azande community in Mupoi Payam, Tambura County. According to the sources, armed Balanda elements abducted the victims from different locations including the Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) camp and nearby villages in Mupoi Payam, and transferred to Zengia village. Reportedly, four of the abductees (one woman and three girls) subsequently escaped   from captivity; however, the whereabouts of the other abductees remains unknown.

Location of Incident: Azande community in Mupoi Payam, Tambura County
Description: 10.	On 4 February, two primary sources reported that on 21 and 31 January, two girls (ages 15 and 17 years old) who were among the 27 civilians abducted by armed Balanda elements in Mupoi Payam, Tambura County on 17 December 2024 were recovered by the authorities after escaping from their abductors. As recounted by the sources, the survivors managed to escape  from their abductors when the SSPDF/EACRF attacked the locations of the armed Balanda elements, and were subsequently rescued by the SSPDF who handed them over to the authorities in Tambura Town. The sources further informed that the abductors forced them to perform domestic chores including cooking, fetching water, and washing clothes while in captivity. The 15-year-old girl was reportedly reunited with her family on 2 February, while the 17-year-old girl is awaiting family reunification.

Location of Incident: from the Azande community in Mupoi Payam, Tambura County.
Description: 11.	On 4 February, three secondary sources reported that on 17 December, armed Balanda elements stabbed and killed two male civilians from the Azande community in Mupoi Payam, Tambura County. The attack is reportedly linked to the ongoing retaliatory violence between the Azande and Balanda communities.

Location of Incident: in Bol Village, Motot Payam, Uror County
Description: 1.	On 6 February, multiple sources reported that on 5 February, Murle armed elements shot and killed one 32-year-old male Lou Nuer civilian (a youth leader) during an attempted cattle raid in Bol Village, Motot Payam, Uror County. According to the sources, Murle armed elements attacked and opened fire on the victim at his cattle shed, killing him. Reportedly, the local youths responded to the scene and deterred the attackers who fled without raiding any cattle.

Location of Incident: in Padoi village, Akobo County
Description:
2.	On 6 February, multiple sources reported that on 24 January, authorities in Padoi village, Akobo County recovered a 19-year-old male civilian from the Murle community who was abducted by armed Lou Nuer youths in 2009 when he was four years old. According to the sources, the former abductee was transferred from Akobo County to Pibor, Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) on 29 January and reunited with his family in Likuangole County on 1 February.

Comment: Reportedly, the 19-year-old man was abducted together with his two sisters, now 22 and 25 years old, who are still with their abductors in Akobo County. HRD will continue to engage with the authorities of Akobo County to secure the release of these women from the armed Lou Nuer youths.

Location of Incident: in Panyigai/Panakuach Boma, Budang Payam, Rubkona County.
Description:
3.	On 6 February, multiple sources reported that on 5 February, armed Arab Misseriya elements from South Kordofan State, Sudan shot and injured two male civilians (cattle herders) from the Leek Nuer community during a cattle raid in Panyigai/Panakuach Boma, Budang Payam, Rubkona County. According to the sources, armed Arab Misseriya elements attacked and opened fire on the vicitms at a grazing area in Panyigai/Panakuach Boma, injuring them. The attackers reportedly raided approximately 600 heads of cattle. The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Rotriak and subsequently transferred to a health care facility in Bentiu for medical treatment. Government security forces were reportedly deployed to the area and recovered most of the cattle (exact number unspecified) as swell as apprehended and detained one the attackers (a 14-year-old boy).

Comment: The incident was reportedly a retaliatory action for the attack on a Misseriya cattle camp by armed Nuer youths from Mayom and Rubkona Counties on 11 January 2025 [see HRD Daily Report 14 January 2025].

Location of Incident: in Panyigai/Panakuach Boma, Budang Payam, Rubkona County.
Description:
3.	On 6 February, multiple sources reported that on 5 February, armed Arab Misseriya elements from South Kordofan State, Sudan shot and injured two male civilians (cattle herders) from the Leek Nuer community during a cattle raid in Panyigai/Panakuach Boma, Budang Payam, Rubkona County. According to the sources, armed Arab Misseriya elements attacked and opened fire on the vicitms at a grazing area in Panyigai/Panakuach Boma, injuring them. The attackers reportedly raided approximately 600 heads of cattle. The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Rotriak and subsequently transferred to a health care facility in Bentiu for medical treatment. Government security forces were reportedly deployed to the area and recovered most of the cattle (exact number unspecified) as swell as apprehended and detained one the attackers (a 14-year-old boy).

Comment: The incident was reportedly a retaliatory action for the attack on a Misseriya cattle camp by armed Nuer youths from Mayom and Rubkona Counties on 11 January 2025 [see HRD Daily Report 14 January 2025].

Location of Incident: in Akeu village, Kirik Payam, Tonj North County
Description: 4.	On 6 February, three secondary sources reported that on 5 February, armed Dinka Noi youths from Awul Payam shot and killed two male civilians from the Dinka Leir community in Akeu village, Kirik Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Noi youths attacked and opened fire on Akeu village, killing two of the residents, and thereafter fled the scene. The attack was reportedly a  revenge action linked to past violence between the Dinka Noi and Dinka Leir communities. The sources further informed that the County authorities have embarked on a mission to the area to deescalate the situation and prevent a revenge attack and further violence by the Dinka Lier community.

Location of Incident: in Wun-Thim village, Pathuon West Payam, Gogrial East County
Description:
5.	On 6 February, multiple sources reported that on the same day, a joint armed Luo and Dinka Marial-Bai youths from Western Bahr el Ghazal State shot and killed two male civilians and injured three others including one woman, all from the Dinka Apuk community, in Wun-Thim village, Pathuon West Payam, Gogrial East County. According to the sources, armed Luo and Dinka Bai youths attacked and opened fire on a homestead in Wun-Thim village, killing two of the occupants and injuring  three others. The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Pathuon West Payam for medical treatment. 

Comment: According to the sources, the incident is connected to past unresolved grievances over the disputed Manyang village along the border between Gogrial East County and Marial-Bai Payam, Jur River County, Western Bahr el Ghazal WBG State. While this may seem an isolated revenge attack against the backdrop of prevailing calm following peace initiatives by the two State Governments, it may heighten tensions between the two communities and trigger retaliatory violence by the Dinka Apuk community.

Location of Incident: in Wun-Thim village, Pathuon West Payam, Gogrial East County
Description:
5.	On 6 February, multiple sources reported that on the same day, a joint armed Luo and Dinka Marial-Bai youths from Western Bahr el Ghazal State shot and killed two male civilians and injured three others including one woman, all from the Dinka Apuk community, in Wun-Thim village, Pathuon West Payam, Gogrial East County. According to the sources, armed Luo and Dinka Bai youths attacked and opened fire on a homestead in Wun-Thim village, killing two of the occupants and injuring  three others. The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Pathuon West Payam for medical treatment. 

Comment: According to the sources, the incident is connected to past unresolved grievances over the disputed Manyang village along the border between Gogrial East County and Marial-Bai Payam, Jur River County, Western Bahr el Ghazal WBG State. While this may seem an isolated revenge attack against the backdrop of prevailing calm following peace initiatives by the two State Governments, it may heighten tensions between the two communities and trigger retaliatory violence by the Dinka Apuk community.

Location of Incident: Wec-Muk village, Walgak Payam, Akobo County
Description: 1.	On 9 February, multiple sources reported that, on 4 February, Murle armed elements shot and injured one 41-year-old woman in Wec-Muk village, Walgak Payam, Akobo County. According to the sources the incident happened when the assailants broke into the victim’s house and attempted to abduct her son. Reportedly, the injured victim was evacuated to a health facility in Lankien Payam for treatment.

Location of Incident: Pajut Boma, Panyang Payam, Duk County
Description: 2.	On 9 February, multiple sources reported that on 6 February, Murle armed elements ambushed and killed one male civilian and injured another in Pajut Boma, Panyang Payam, Duk County. According to the sources, the assailants ambushed the victims who were traveling from Uror County to Poktap, Duk County, with their cattle. Reportedly, a confrontation ensued when the local youths mobilized and pursued the assailants and recovered the stolen cattle.

Location of Incident: Motot Payam Uror County
Description: 3.	On 9 February, multiple sources reported that on 7 February, Murle armed elements shot and killed one 40-year-old male Lou Nuer civilian in Motot Payam Uror County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked a group of cattle keepers grazing their cattle and injured the victim. Reportedly, the injured victim was taken to a health facility in Motot Payam but later succumbed to his injuries.

Location of Incident: along the Yiga Riverbank in Madol Payam, Rumbek North County
Description:
4.	On 7 February, three secondary sources reported that on 6 February, armed Dinka Luanyjang youths from Tonj East County, shot and killed four Dinka Agaar civilians (a seven-year-old boy, two women, and one man) along the Yiga Riverbank in Madol Payam, Rumbek North County. According to the sources, this incident was in retaliation for past and unresolved grievances caused between the Dinka Luanyjang and Dinka Agaar communities. Reportedly, one of the suspects for this incident has been arrested and detained. 

Comment: HRD will continue to follow-up on this incident for more information.

Location of Incident: Baaw Water/Fishing point in Akok village in Alabek Payam, Tonj North County
Description: 5.	On 9 February, three secondary sources reported that, on 6 February, armed Dinka Pan-Kuei youths shot and killed two male Dinka Pan-Arek civilians at Baaw Water/Fishing point in Akok village in Alabek Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the assailants opened fire on the victims at the fishing point and collected their fishing gears and left the scene. Reportedly the incident is part of the ongoing sub clan violence between Dinka Pan-Kuei and Dinka Pan-Arek, and the SSPDF has been deployed in the area to contain the situation and prevent further violence.

Location of Incident: in Yikador village, Pathuon East Payam, Gogrial East County
Description:
6.	On 9 February, four secondary sources reported that on 2 February, the SSPDF extrajudicially and summarily executed four male Dinka Apuk suspects in Yikador village, Pathuon East Payam, Gogrial East County. The sources recounted that, the victims after being arrested and detained at the SSPDF barracks on allegations of cattle theft and robbery, were extracted by SSPDF to Yikador village, tied to a tree and killed by firing squad. Reportedly, the families of the deceased have retrieved their bodies for burial.

Comment: This incident brings the number of recorded numbers of extrajudicial executions in Warrap State to 151 (since the EJKs begun in early 2021). This means HRD has recorded 11 EJEs so far in 2025.

Location of Incident: in the Boo-River area, Kpaile Payam, Wau County
Description:
7.	Between 6-7 February, one primary source reported that on 6 January, the SSPDF arbitrarily arrested, detained and illtreated two male Balanda civilians (aged 67 and 22 years) in the Boo-River area, Kpaile Payam, Wau County. The source recounted that, the victims had gone fishing when they returned and found the SSPDF ransacking their home, on allegations that they are members of the Sudan’s People Liberation Army- In Opposition (SPLA-IO). Reported the victims were beaten with sticks and the bottom of the gun, forcibly taken the SSPDF barracks where they were chained, and for to lay down facing the sun, and were beaten repeatedly when they attempt to shield their eyes from the scorching sun.

Comment: The source recounted that, the SSPDF soldiers who assaulted the victims were from the Zande tribe, but they were saved by the intervention of another SSPDF soldier (a Lou) who helped them escape at night when the commander of the SSPDF was asleep.

Location of Incident: Boo River area, Kpaile Payam, Wau County.
Description:
8.	Between 6-7 February, multiple sources reported that on 5 January, the SSPDF shot and killed on male Balanda civilian in Jomoi village (43-year-old), beheaded three others (one male and two females) and injured many others in Boo River area, Kpaile Payam, Wau County. According to the sources, the SSPDF accosted civilians living in the area, looting their property, and opened fire on them for unspecified reasons. Reportedly, they beheaded the three victims and threw their heads in the river and burnt the entire village during an armed confrontation with the SPLA-IO in the area.

Comment: This incident has resulted in a dire humanitarian crisis, with the remaining civilians taking refuge in the bushes. HRD will continue to investigate this incident for more information on possible unreported casualties and for state action to hold perpetrators accountable.

Location of Incident: Boo River area, Kpaile Payam, Wau County.
Description:
8.	Between 6-7 February, multiple sources reported that on 5 January, the SSPDF shot and killed on male Balanda civilian in Jomoi village (43-year-old), beheaded three others (one male and two females) and injured many others in Boo River area, Kpaile Payam, Wau County. According to the sources, the SSPDF accosted civilians living in the area, looting their property, and opened fire on them for unspecified reasons. Reportedly, they beheaded the three victims and threw their heads in the river and burnt the entire village during an armed confrontation with the SPLA-IO in the area.

Comment: This incident has resulted in a dire humanitarian crisis, with the remaining civilians taking refuge in the bushes. HRD will continue to investigate this incident for more information on possible unreported casualties and for state action to hold perpetrators accountable.

Location of Incident: Boo River area, Kpaile Payam, Wau County.
Description:
8.	Between 6-7 February, multiple sources reported that on 5 January, the SSPDF shot and killed on male Balanda civilian in Jomoi village (43-year-old), beheaded three others (one male and two females) and injured many others in Boo River area, Kpaile Payam, Wau County. According to the sources, the SSPDF accosted civilians living in the area, looting their property, and opened fire on them for unspecified reasons. Reportedly, they beheaded the three victims and threw their heads in the river and burnt the entire village during an armed confrontation with the SPLA-IO in the area.

Comment: This incident has resulted in a dire humanitarian crisis, with the remaining civilians taking refuge in the bushes. HRD will continue to investigate this incident for more information on possible unreported casualties and for state action to hold perpetrators accountable.

Location of Incident: in Diayanga and Atakpataguru Bomas, Nagero Payam, Nagero County
Description:
9.	On 7 February, multiple sources reported that, on the same day, soldiers of the SSPDF illtreated an unspecified number of civilians (including the County Executive Director) in Diayanga and Atakpataguru Bomas, Nagero Payam, Nagero County. According to the sources, the incidents happened during a forceful disarmament exercise by the SSPDF, on allegations that the civilians were are sympathizing and supporting rebel groups in the area. Reportedly, in the process, they looted civilian property, beat up civilians and burnt some homes, and assaulted the County Health Director. 

Comment: These incidents have exacerbated the tension and insecurity in the area, resulting in forced displacement of civilians for safety. HRD will engage County authorities and the leadership of the SSPDF on the question of excessive use of force and call for accountability by perpetrators.

Location of Incident: in Ulang village, Walgak Payam, Akobo County
Description: 1.	On 10 February, multiple sources reported that on 9 February, Murle armed elements shot and injured one 20-year-old female civilian and abducted two children (one seven-year-old girl and a 10-year-old boy) in Ulang village, Walgak Payam, Akobo County. According to the sources, the Murle armed elements shot and injured the woman as she resisted their attempts to abduct the children from their homestead while they were sleeping. Reportedly, the injured woman was evacuated to a health care facility in Lankien Payam for medical treatment. The whereabouts of the abducted children remains unknown.

Location of Incident: in Ulang village, Walgak Payam, Akobo County
Description: 1.	On 10 February, multiple sources reported that on 9 February, Murle armed elements shot and injured one 20-year-old female civilian and abducted two children (one seven-year-old girl and a 10-year-old boy) in Ulang village, Walgak Payam, Akobo County. According to the sources, the Murle armed elements shot and injured the woman as she resisted their attempts to abduct the children from their homestead while they were sleeping. Reportedly, the injured woman was evacuated to a health care facility in Lankien Payam for medical treatment. The whereabouts of the abducted children remains unknown.

Location of Incident: in Aweil Town, Aweil County
Description:
2.	On 10 February, one secondary source reported that on 17 January, the NSS arbitrarily arrested and detained one male civilian (an activist) in Aweil Town, Aweil County, reportedly on the instruction of a senior state official. According to the source, NSS personnel arrested the victim for publishing critical views on governance of Northern Bahr el Ghazal State by the current State Governor on social media (Meta/Facebook) and detained him at the NSS facility in Aweil. Reportedly, the victim remains in incommunicado detention and access has been denied to his family and lawyers.

Comment: HRD will follow-up on the report for due process.

Location of Incident: Lapa-Pam area, Akoy village, Alieny County, Ruweng Administrative Area
Description: 3.	On 10 February, two secondary sources reported that on 9 February, suspected armed Leer Nuer youths from Rubkona County shot and injured one 14-year-old boy from the Dinka Panaru community during a cattle raid in Lapa-Pam area, Akoy village, Alieny County, Ruweng Administrative Area. According to sources, the assailants attacked Akoy village and raided unspecified number of cattle, and in the ensuing confrontation with the SSPDF, the 14-year-old boy was shot and injured, while one SSPDF soldier was shot and killed. Reportedly, the security forces and the armed youths from Alieny County managed to recover all of the raided cattle. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Wuzein for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: in Jokmier village, Panyijar County
Description: 4.	On 10 February, two secondary sources reported that on 4 February, armed Dinka Agaar youths from Rumbek Centre County attacked and injured two male civilians from the Nyuong Nuer community during a cattle raid in Jokmier village, Panyijar County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Agaar youths attacked the vicitms with spears, injuring them. The attackers also raided four heads of cattle and fled the scene. The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Panyijar County for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Paguot village, Makuac Payam, Tonj East County
Description:
5.	On 10 February, three secondary sources reported that on 9 February, armed Dinka Pakam youths from Rumbek North County, Lakes State shot and killed two male civilians from the Dinka Luanyjang community in Paguot village, Makuac Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Pakam youths ambushed and opened fire on the victims while they were herding their cattle to a cattle camp in Paguot village, killing them, and thereafter fled the scene.  

Comment: Reportedly, the attack was a revenge action for the killing of four Dinka Pakam civilians on 6 February [See HRD Daily Report 10 February 2025].

Location of Incident: Ajang village, Marial Lou Payam, Tonj North County
Description:
6.	On 10 February, multiple sources reported that on 9 February, armed Dinka Akok youths from Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County shot and killed two male civilians from the Dinka Luanyjang community in Ajang village, Marial Lou Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the assailants ambushed and opened fire on the victims who were transporting a young female civilian (age unspecified) on a motorcycle from Romic, Palieng Payam for medical treatment in Tonj Payam, killing them. The attackers also seized their motorcycle. Reportedly, young girl was rescued by a local government official who took her back to Romic, where she is receiving medical treatment.

Comment: According to the sources, the attack is a revenge action connected to cyclical revenge violence between the Dinka Akok and Dinka Luanyjang. Tension is reportedly mounting between the two communities with the likelihood of  more retaliatory violence.

Location of Incident: Ajang village, Marial Lou Payam, Tonj North County
Description:
6.	On 10 February, multiple sources reported that on 9 February, armed Dinka Akok youths from Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County shot and killed two male civilians from the Dinka Luanyjang community in Ajang village, Marial Lou Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the assailants ambushed and opened fire on the victims who were transporting a young female civilian (age unspecified) on a motorcycle from Romic, Palieng Payam for medical treatment in Tonj Payam, killing them. The attackers also seized their motorcycle. Reportedly, young girl was rescued by a local government official who took her back to Romic, where she is receiving medical treatment.

Comment: According to the sources, the attack is a revenge action connected to cyclical revenge violence between the Dinka Akok and Dinka Luanyjang. Tension is reportedly mounting between the two communities with the likelihood of  more retaliatory violence.

Location of Incident: Bandala Boma, Nagero Central Payam, Nagero County
Description: 7.	On 10 February, multiple sources reported that, on 8 February, the SSPDF shot and killed two male civilians in Bandala Boma, Nagero Central Payam, Nagero County. According to the sources, a group of SSPDF soldiers arbitrarily arrested the victims when they encountered/witnessed the soldiers who were burning and looting civilian homes, including a health care facility in Nagero Town, and subsequently opened fire on the victims, killing them. Reportedly, the bodies of the victims were retrieved by their families for interment.

Location of Incident: Bandala Boma, Nagero Central Payam, Nagero County
Description: 7.	On 10 February, multiple sources reported that, on 8 February, the SSPDF shot and killed two male civilians in Bandala Boma, Nagero Central Payam, Nagero County. According to the sources, a group of SSPDF soldiers arbitrarily arrested the victims when they encountered/witnessed the soldiers who were burning and looting civilian homes, including a health care facility in Nagero Town, and subsequently opened fire on the victims, killing them. Reportedly, the bodies of the victims were retrieved by their families for interment.

Location of Incident: Maringi Boma, Nagero Payam, Nagero County
Description: 8.	On 10 February, three secondary sources reported that on 8 February, the SSPDF arbitrarily arrested and detained two male civilians from the Balanda community in Maringi Boma, Nagero Payam, Nagero County. According to the sources, the SSPDF soldiers arrested the victims as they witnessed the SSPDF razing houses and looting in Nagero Town. Reportedly, the victims were released on the same day; however, their phones were confiscated by the soldiers.

Location of Incident: Tambura Town, Tambura County
Description: 9.	On 10 February, one primary source reported that on 9 February, the SSPDF arbitrarily arrested and ill-treated one male civilian from the Balanda community in Tambura Town, Tambura County. As recounted by the source, a group of five SSPSF soldiers arrested and beat up the victim for allegedly being an informant for the Sudan People’s Liberation Army – In Opposition (SPLA-IO) and beat him up. The victim was reportedly released following the intervention of one SSPDF commander; however, his mobile phone and an unspecified amount of South Sudanese Pounds were reportedly taken from him by the soldiers. The sources further informed that the victim has opened a case with the Police in Tambura Town; however, no action have been taken.

Location of Incident: Tambura Town, Tambura County
Description: 9.	On 10 February, one primary source reported that on 9 February, the SSPDF arbitrarily arrested and ill-treated one male civilian from the Balanda community in Tambura Town, Tambura County. As recounted by the source, a group of five SSPSF soldiers arrested and beat up the victim for allegedly being an informant for the Sudan People’s Liberation Army – In Opposition (SPLA-IO) and beat him up. The victim was reportedly released following the intervention of one SSPDF commander; however, his mobile phone and an unspecified amount of South Sudanese Pounds were reportedly taken from him by the soldiers. The sources further informed that the victim has opened a case with the Police in Tambura Town; however, no action have been taken.

Location of Incident: Yari Boma, Mugwo Payam, Yei River County
Description: 1.	On February, one primary source and three secondary sources reported that on 10 February, suspected NAS elements abducted 13 civilians (seven men, four women, one 3-year-old boy and two girls ages two years and three months old) in Yari Boma, Mugwo Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, a group of 15 suspected NAS elements setup a checkpoint along the Yei-Kaya Road where they unlawfully searched and detained the victims before abducting them. Reportedly, one of the abductees managed to escape, while 11 others were released on the same day, and one male civilian (a driver) remained in captivity. The abductors reportedly burnt down one motorcycle and one commercial vehicle belonging to some of the victims.

Location of Incident: Yari Boma, Mugwo Payam, Yei River County
Description: 1.	On February, one primary source and three secondary sources reported that on 10 February, suspected NAS elements abducted 13 civilians (seven men, four women, one 3-year-old boy and two girls ages two years and three months old) in Yari Boma, Mugwo Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, a group of 15 suspected NAS elements setup a checkpoint along the Yei-Kaya Road where they unlawfully searched and detained the victims before abducting them. Reportedly, one of the abductees managed to escape, while 11 others were released on the same day, and one male civilian (a driver) remained in captivity. The abductors reportedly burnt down one motorcycle and one commercial vehicle belonging to some of the victims.

Location of Incident: Jalimo Boma, Kangapo II Payam, Kajo Keji County
Description:
2.	On 11 February, three secondary sources reported that on 9 February, NAS elements shot and killed two children (ages and sexes unspecified) in Jalimo Boma, Kangapo II Payam, Kajo Keji County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked the SSPDF barracks in Jalimo Boma, killing two children and three SSPDF soldiers. Reportedly, the incident triggered the displacement of other civilians to different communities.

Comments: HRD will follow up to gather more information on the incident.

Location of Incident: Jalimo Boma, Kangapo II Payam, Kajo Keji County
Description:
2.	On 11 February, three secondary sources reported that on 9 February, NAS elements shot and killed two children (ages and sexes unspecified) in Jalimo Boma, Kangapo II Payam, Kajo Keji County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked the SSPDF barracks in Jalimo Boma, killing two children and three SSPDF soldiers. Reportedly, the incident triggered the displacement of other civilians to different communities.

Comments: HRD will follow up to gather more information on the incident.

Location of Incident: all from the Jie community, in Kassengor Boma, Lopeat Payam, Kapoeta East County
Description:
3.	On 11 February, three secondary sources reported that on 8 February, Murle armed elements from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) shot and killed two male civilians ( ages 33 and 37 years) and injured three others (ages 25, 31, 25 years), all from the Jie community, in Kassengor Boma, Lopeat Payam, Kapoeta East County. According to the sources, Murle armed elements ambushed and opened fire on a group of five Jie traders while they were traveling from Moruo Payam, Verthet County, GPAA to Kassengor Boma, killing t and injuring three. The injured victims are reportedly receiving treatment at a local health facility  in Kapoeta East County. The incident was reported to the police in Kapoeta and investigations are reportedly ongoing.

Comment: According to the sources, the incident was  a revenge action for the killing of two Murle youths by armed Jie and Toposa youths some months ago in GPAA.

Location of Incident: all from the Jie community, in Kassengor Boma, Lopeat Payam, Kapoeta East County
Description:
3.	On 11 February, three secondary sources reported that on 8 February, Murle armed elements from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) shot and killed two male civilians ( ages 33 and 37 years) and injured three others (ages 25, 31, 25 years), all from the Jie community, in Kassengor Boma, Lopeat Payam, Kapoeta East County. According to the sources, Murle armed elements ambushed and opened fire on a group of five Jie traders while they were traveling from Moruo Payam, Verthet County, GPAA to Kassengor Boma, killing t and injuring three. The injured victims are reportedly receiving treatment at a local health facility  in Kapoeta East County. The incident was reported to the police in Kapoeta and investigations are reportedly ongoing.

Comment: According to the sources, the incident was  a revenge action for the killing of two Murle youths by armed Jie and Toposa youths some months ago in GPAA.

Location of Incident: in Motot Payam, Uror County
Description: 4.	On 11 February, multiple sources reported that on the same day, Murle armed elements shot and killed two male civilians in Motot Payam, Uror County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked a food protection facility belonging to the World Food Programme (WFP), opened fire on two civilians serving as security guards, killing one and injuring another, and thereafter fled the scene. The injured victim subsequently succumbed to the injuries.

Location of Incident: Pathai Payam, Uror County
Description: 5.	On11 February, multiple sources reported that on 10 February, Murle armed elements abducted three female civilians (two girls and one woman), Pathai Payam, Uror County. According to the sources, Murle armed elements attacked a group of 13 female civilians from the Lou Nuer community who were walking from Ayod village to Paluony Payam at the Ayod and Palouny junction and abducted three, while the others escaped unharmed. Reportedly, the local youths mobilized and pursued the abductors to no avail. The local authorities are reportedly investigating the incident.

Location of Incident: Maruwa Hills, Verthet County, GPAA
Description: 6.	On 11 February, multiple sources reported that on 7 February, unidentified armed elements shot and killed two male civilians (traders) in Maruwa Hills, Verthet County, GPAA. According to the sources, the assailants ambushed and opened fire on a group of five civilians  as they were traveling on a motorcycles from Maruwa, Verthet County to Kassengor Payam, Jebel Boma County, killing two, while the others escaped unharmed.

Location of Incident: Rumbek Town, Rumbek Centre County
Description:
7.	On 11 February, one primary source reported that on 8 and 11 February, the SSPDF arbitrarily arrested and detained two male civilians in Rumbek Town, Rumbek Centre County. As recounted by the source, on 8 February, the SSPDF arrested and detained the first victim at the Rock City military detention facility Rumbek Twon for his hairstyle. On 11 February, the second victim (brother to the first victim) approached the SSPDF at Rock City to demand the release of his brother, and he was also arrested and detained. Reportedly, the second victim was released on the same day, while his brother remains in custody.

Comment: According to the source, over 150 other civilians are being detained by the SSPDF at Rock City under very deplorable conditions and some with critical health conditions. HRD will continue to engage the authorities and the SSPDF Divion 12 Command for the release of civilians from military detention.

Location of Incident: in Akol-Awet village, Awul Payam, Tonj North County
Description:
8.	On 11 February, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, suspected armed Dinka Awan youths from Rualbet Payam and armed Dinka Atok from Awul Payam shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Kongor community and injured another in Akol-Awet village, Awul Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the assailants jointly attacked and opened fire on a group of Dinka Kongor civilians who were travelling from Aliek Payam to Warrap Town for business and to visit relatives, killing one and injuring another. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Warrap Town for medical treatment. 

Comment: According to the sources, the incident is connected to the ongoing violence between various Dinka communities in Tonj North County.

Location of Incident: from the Balanda community in Tambura Town, Tambura County
Description: 9.	On 11 February, multiple sources reported that on the same day, the SSPDF arbitrarily arrested, detained and illtreated nine male civilians from the Balanda community in Tambura Town, Tambura County. According to the sources, the SSPDF arrested and detained the victims for celebrating the removal from office of the Governor of Western Equatoria State. the sources further informed that the victims were repeatedly beaten while in detention. Four of the victims were released after the intervention of UNMISS.

Location of Incident: in Tambura Town, Tambura County
Description:
10.	On 11 February, one secondary source reported that on 8 February, EACRF soldiers arbitrarily arrested and detained one male civilian (a seminarian) in Tambura Town, Tambura County, for allegedly informing the leader of a Balanda militia group about the movement of the SSPDF from Tambura Town to Nagero County. 

Comment: Despite intervention by religious leaders and HRD with SSPDF leadership to secure the victim’s release, he remains in custody at the SSPDF barracks in Tambura Town.

Location of Incident: from the Acholi community, in Loriyok Payam, Budi County
Description:
1.	On 12 February, three secondary sources reported that on 5 February, armed Buya youths shot and killed one 32-year-old male civilian and injured another 40-year-old male civilian, both from the Acholi community, in Loriyok Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, armed Buya youths attacked and opened fire on the victims while they had gone to collect charcoal in the bush in Loriyok Payam, killing one and injuring another. The injured victim evacuated to a health care facility in Kapoeta South for medical treatment. The incident was reported to the police in Kapoeta South and investigations are reportedly ongoing.

Comment: According to the sources, this incident was in retaliation for the shooting and killing of a 26-year-old Buya man by Acholi military men around Kidepo valley, Camp 15, Budi County on 17 December 2024.

Location of Incident: from the Acholi community, in Loriyok Payam, Budi County
Description:
1.	On 12 February, three secondary sources reported that on 5 February, armed Buya youths shot and killed one 32-year-old male civilian and injured another 40-year-old male civilian, both from the Acholi community, in Loriyok Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, armed Buya youths attacked and opened fire on the victims while they had gone to collect charcoal in the bush in Loriyok Payam, killing one and injuring another. The injured victim evacuated to a health care facility in Kapoeta South for medical treatment. The incident was reported to the police in Kapoeta South and investigations are reportedly ongoing.

Comment: According to the sources, this incident was in retaliation for the shooting and killing of a 26-year-old Buya man by Acholi military men around Kidepo valley, Camp 15, Budi County on 17 December 2024.

Location of Incident: organization in Bor Town, Bor County
Description: 2.	On 12 February, multiple sources reported that on 21 January, one six-year-old boy from the Murle community who had been abducted by suspected Lou Nuer armed youths from Nanaam river area in Gumuruk County, Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) (exact date unspecified) and transferred to Bor, was recovered by one humanitarian organization in Bor Town, Bor County. According to the sources, on 4 February, the boy was transferred to the Interim Care Center in Pibor, awaiting reunification with his family.

Location of Incident: Ngabagok and Palieng Payams, Tonj East County
Description:
3.	On 12 February, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, two male civilians from the Dinka Akook community were shot and killed and five others were injured (two Dinka Akook, two Dinka Thiik and one Dinka Luanyjang) during retaliatory violence in Ngabagok and Palieng Payams, Tonj East County. According to the sources, joint armed Dinka Luanyjang and Dinka Thiik youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Akook community in Mariik village, Ngabagok Payam, injuring four male civilians, two of whom subsequently succumbed to their injuries. Reportedly, in retaliation, armed Dinka Akook youths attacked Lolith village in Palieng Payam, and shot and injured three male civilians (two Dinka Thiik and one Dinka Luanyjang) and thereafter fled the area. The injured Dinka Akook civilians were evacuated to a health care facility in Ngabagok Payam for treatment, while the other injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Romic Town, Marial Lou Payam, for medical treatment.

Comment: According to the sources, the incident is a revenge action in connection with the ongoing retaliatory violence between these communities [see HRD Daily Report 11 February 2025]. Tension continues to mount in the area with the likelihood of more violence.

Location of Incident: Ngabagok and Palieng Payams, Tonj East County
Description:
3.	On 12 February, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, two male civilians from the Dinka Akook community were shot and killed and five others were injured (two Dinka Akook, two Dinka Thiik and one Dinka Luanyjang) during retaliatory violence in Ngabagok and Palieng Payams, Tonj East County. According to the sources, joint armed Dinka Luanyjang and Dinka Thiik youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Akook community in Mariik village, Ngabagok Payam, injuring four male civilians, two of whom subsequently succumbed to their injuries. Location of Incident: Ngabagok and Palieng Payams, Tonj East County
Description:
3. According to the sources, joint armed Dinka Luanyjang and Dinka Thiik youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Akook community in Mariik village, Ngabagok Payam, injuring four male civilians, two of whom subsequently succumbed to their injuries. Location of Incident: in Akok village, Alabek Payam, Tonj North County
Description: 4.	On 12 February, three secondary sources reported that on 11 February, armed Dinka Pan-Arek youths shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Pan-Kuei community in Akok village, Alabek Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Pan-Arek youths attacked and opened fire on homesteads belonging to the Dinka Pan-Kuei community in Akok village, killing one of the residents, and thereafter fled the scene. The sources further informed that, the attack was a revenge action for past violence between the two communities.

Location of Incident: Duanchan area, Kaikuiny, Diro Payam, Akobo county
Description: 1.	On 13 February, multiple sources reported that on 2 February, the body of the woman who was abducted by Murle armed elements in Kaikuny, Diro Payam, Akobo County on 28 January [see HRD Daily Report 30 January 2025] was found in Duanchan area, Kaikuiny, Diro Payam. According to the sources, the body was found by the Diro Payam authorities while they were travelling by foot to Akobo Town.

Location of Incident: in Awul and Rualbet Payams, Tonj North County
Description:
2.	On 13 February, multiple sources reported that on the same day, six male civilians were shot and killed (three Dinka Atok, two Dinka Jurbol and one Dinka Luac-Koth) and two Dinka Atok civilians were injured during retaliatory violence in Awul and Rualbet Payams, Tonj North County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Jurbol youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Atok community in Awul Town, killing three male civilians and injuring two others. Reportedly, in retaliation, armed Dinka Atok youths attacked Achol Boma in Rualbet Payam, shot and killed three male civilians (two Dinka Jurbol and one Dinka Luac Koth who was visiting the area). The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Warrap Town for medical treatment. The sources further informed that the SSPDF has been deployed to the area to contain the situation.

Comment: Tension reportedly remains high in the area with the likelihood of more revenge violence between these two communities.

Location of Incident: in Awul and Rualbet Payams, Tonj North County
Description:
2.	On 13 February, multiple sources reported that on the same day, six male civilians were shot and killed (three Dinka Atok, two Dinka Jurbol and one Dinka Luac-Koth) and two Dinka Atok civilians were injured during retaliatory violence in Awul and Rualbet Payams, Tonj North County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Jurbol youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Atok community in Awul Town, killing three male civilians and injuring two others. Reportedly, in retaliation, armed Dinka Atok youths attacked Achol Boma in Rualbet Payam, shot and killed three male civilians (two Dinka Jurbol and one Dinka Luac Koth who was visiting the area). The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Warrap Town for medical treatment. The sources further informed that the SSPDF has been deployed to the area to contain the situation.

Comment: Tension reportedly remains high in the area with the likelihood of more revenge violence between these two communities.

Location of Incident: Achol Boma in Rualbet Payam, Tonj North County
Description:
2.	On 13 February, multiple sources reported that on the same day, six male civilians were shot and killed (three Dinka Atok, two Dinka Jurbol and one Dinka Luac-Koth) and two Dinka Atok civilians were injured during retaliatory violence in Awul and Rualbet Payams, Tonj North County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Jurbol youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Atok community in Awul Town, killing three male civilians and injuring two others. Reportedly, in retaliation, armed Dinka Atok youths attacked Achol Boma in Rualbet Payam, shot and killed three male civilians (two Dinka Jurbol and one Dinka Luac Koth who was visiting the area). The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Warrap Town for medical treatment. The sources further informed that the SSPDF has been deployed to the area to contain the situation.

Comment: Tension reportedly remains high in the area with the likelihood of more revenge violence between these two communities.

Location of Incident: in Gaak village, Achol Boma, Rualbet Payam, Tonj North County
Description:
3.	On 13 February, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, the SSPDF shot and injured five male civilians from the Dinka Jurbol community in Gaak village, Achol Boma, Rualbet Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the SSPDF stormed Achol Boma in pursuit of armed Dinka Jurbol youths who were involved in the attack in Awul Town (see preceding paragraph 2) and in the ensuing confrontation with the armed youths, they shot and injured five civilians. Reportedly, the SSPDF also burnt down approximately eight houses (tukuls) in Achol Boma.

Comment: This situation has the potential to exacerbate the insecurity and tension in the area. HRD will continue to monitor the situation for more updates and call for restraint and proportionality in enforcement.

Location of Incident: in Gaak village, Achol Boma, Rualbet Payam, Tonj North County
Description:
3.	On 13 February, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, the SSPDF shot and injured five male civilians from the Dinka Jurbol community in Gaak village, Achol Boma, Rualbet Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the SSPDF stormed Achol Boma in pursuit of armed Dinka Jurbol youths who were involved in the attack in Awul Town (see preceding paragraph 2) and in the ensuing confrontation with the armed youths, they shot and injured five civilians. Reportedly, the SSPDF also burnt down approximately eight houses (tukuls) in Achol Boma.

Comment: This situation has the potential to exacerbate the insecurity and tension in the area. HRD will continue to monitor the situation for more updates and call for restraint and proportionality in enforcement.

Location of Incident: in Mayen-Ador village, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County
Description:
4.	On 13 February, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, two male civilians were shot and killed (one Dinka Adoor and one Dinka Luanyjang) and five other Dinka Adoor civilians were injured (two boys and three men) during a cattle-related violence in Mayen-Ador village, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Luanyjang youths attacked and opened fire in Mayen-Ador village, killing one civilian and injuring five others. The attackers also seized twenty heads of cattle and fled into Makuac Payam. In retaliation, armed Dinka Adoor youths shot and killed one male Dinka Luanyjang civilian  in Toch area as they pursued the armed Dinka Luanyjang youths in attempts to recover the raided cattle. The injured victims were reportedly evacuated to a hospital in Tonj South County for medical treatment.

Comment: According to the sources, armed Dinka Adoor youths are mobilizing for a revenge attack, and more violence is expected.

Location of Incident: in Mayen-Ador village, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County
Description:
4.	On 13 February, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, two male civilians were shot and killed (one Dinka Adoor and one Dinka Luanyjang) and five other Dinka Adoor civilians were injured (two boys and three men) during a cattle-related violence in Mayen-Ador village, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Luanyjang youths attacked and opened fire in Mayen-Ador village, killing one civilian and injuring five others. Location of Incident: , in Taap village, Akop Payam, Tonj North County
Description: 5.	On 13 February, three secondary sources reported that on 12 February, armed Nuer youths from Mayom County, Unity State shot and killed one male civilian and injured nine others including two boys and one woman, all from the Dinka Apuk-Patoc community, in Taap village, Akop Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, armed Nuer youths attacked and opened fire on a group of Dinka Apuk-Patoc civilians who were fishing and cleaning their fishing gear at a fishing point in Taap village, killing one and injuring nine others. Reportedly, the assailants also seized the victims’ property including fishing nets, mobile phones, cash, clothes and fled to Unity State. The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Akop Payam for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: , in Taap village, Akop Payam, Tonj North County
Description: 5. Location of Incident: in Rombek Village, Mogiri Boma, Mangalla Payam, Juba County
Description:
1.	On 14 February, two secondary sources reported that on 13 February, armed Dinka Bor cattle herders shot and killed one 45-year-old male civilian (a trader from the Pari community in Eastern Equatoria State) in Rombek Village, Mogiri Boma, Mangalla Payam, Juba County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Bor cattle herders accosted a group of traders as they were transporting cattle to Mogiri market, opened fire on one, killing him, while the others fled unharmed. The incident was reported at the Gumbo Police station for investigation.

Comment: According to the sources, three days prior to the incident, a convoy of 18 land cruisers and two lorries carrying armed Dinka Bor youths, with some allegedly dressed in SSPDF uniforms, had entered from Eastern Equatoria State claiming to search for cattle allegedly stolen by the Murle community from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA).

Location of Incident: Jabur Boma, Mangalla Payam, Juba County
Description: 2.	On 14 February, two secondary sources reported that on 13 February, one SSPDF soldier shot and killed one male civilian (a Kenyan national) in Jabur Boma, Mangalla Payam, Juba County. According to the sources, the SSPDF soldier attacked and opened fire on the victim, killing him, on allegations of an extra-marital affair between the victim and the soldier’s wife.

Location of Incident: Pari community in Ugure Boma, Burgilo Payam, Lafon County
Description:
3.	On 14 February, three secondary sources reported that on 13 February, armed Dinka Bor cattle herders shot and killed one 43-year-old male civilian from the Pari community in Ugure Boma, Burgilo Payam, Lafon County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Bor cattle herders encountered and opened fire on seven Pari male civilians from Yukurwe Boma who were transporting their cattle to Juba for sale, killing one while the others escaped unharmed. The attackers also seized 17 heads of cattle belonging to the civilians. The incident was reported to the police in Lafon County and investigations are reportedly ongoing.

Comment: Reportedly, the incident has heightened tensions between the local Pari and Dinka communities in Lafon County especially in Burgilo Payam where the incident occurred. Observably, the influx of armed Dinka Bor cattle keepers from Jonglei continues to pose protection risks to the communities in parts of Eastern Equatoria State.

Location of Incident: in Abin-Dau village, Wunrok Payam, Twic County
Description:
4.	On 16 February, multiple sources reported that on 14 February, armed Dinka Twic Mayardit youths shot and killed two female civilians and injured two others (one girl and one woman), all from the Nuer community, in Abin-Dau village, Wunrok Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, the assailants ambushed and opened fire on a commercial passenger vehicle traveling to Unity State, killing two of the occupants and injuring two others. The injured victims were reportedly evacuated to a hospital in Turalei for medical treatment. 

Comment: According to the sources, the attack was a revenge action connected to past cross-border violence and unresolved grievances between the Dinka Twic Mayardit and Nuer communities. There has been a noticeable decrease in cross-border violence between the Twic and Nuer communities since 2023, largely attributable  to the presence of Prophet Gai Maciek (an influential Nuer elder) in the area. This incident has the potential to revive animosity between these two communities with attendant human rights abuses.

Location of Incident: in Abin-Dau village, Wunrok Payam, Twic County
Description:

Location of Incident: from the Dinka community in Mayom Kuel cattle camp, Maloupech Payam, Cueibet County
Description: 5.	On 14 February, one primary source reported that on 8 February, unidentified armed elements shot and injured two male civilians (ages 28 and 30 years old) from the Dinka community in Mayom Kuel cattle camp, Maloupech Payam, Cueibet County. As recounted by the source, the assailants attacked and opened fire on a group of three Dinka male civilians as they were bathing at a waterpoint in Maloupech, injuring two, and thereafter fled the scene. The injured victims were evacuated to a hospital in Wau for medical treatment. The whereabouts of the third civilian remains unknown.

Location of Incident: from the Azande community in Mupoi Payam, Tambura County
Description:
6.	On 14 February, one primary source reported that on 17 December, armed Balanda elements abducted and repeatedly raped one 23-year-old woman from the Azande community in Mupoi Payam, Tambura County. As recounted by the source, the victim was among the 27 civilians who were abducted by the armed Balanda elements on 17 December 2024 [see HRD Daily Report 6 February 2025] and transferred to Zengia Boma where the victim was subjected to forced labor and repeatedly raped by the leader of the group. Reportedly, on 3 February, the victim escaped from her abductors during an armed confrontation between the SSPDF and the armed elements along the Tambura-Nagero Road. The victim was taken to a health care facility in Tambura Town for medical care.

Comment: The report underscores the ongoing human rights violations and abuses including conflict-related sexual violence affecting the civilian population in the context of continued tensions and violence between the Balanda and Azande communities in Tambura County.

Location of Incident: in Minyori village,  Logo Boma, Otogo Payam, Yei River County.
Description:
1.	On 17 February, two secondary sources reported that on 13 February, suspected NAS elements abducted four male civilians (three of whom are loggers) in Minyori village,  Logo Boma, Otogo Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, NAS elements stormed a homestead in Minyori village and demanded a share of the money that the loggers are getting from the sale of timber; however, when the victims failed to give the money, the NAS elements abducted and transferred them to an unknown location. 

Comment: Reportedly, NAS elements have been sending warnings to the loggers to pay taxes lest they would be abducted. Observably, the presence of NAS elements in the area continues to pose protection risks to the local civilian population.

Location of Incident: Napeikar cattle kraals in Nakwa Boma, Lomeyan Payam, Kapoeta North County
Description: 2.	On 17 February, three secondary sources reported that on 14 February, Murle armed elements from Greater Pibor Administrative Areas (GPAA) shot and killed 14 civilians including one woman and injured nine others from the Toposa community during a cattle raid in Nakwa Boma, Lomeyan Payam, Kapoeta North County. According to the sources, Murle armed elements attacked Napeikar cattle kraals in Nakwa Boma, killing 14 of the residents and injuring nine others. The attackers also raided 700 heads of cattle. The incident was reported at Riwoto Police station and investigation is reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: Napeikar cattle kraals in Nakwa Boma, Lomeyan Payam, Kapoeta North County
Description: 2.	On 17 February, three secondary sources reported that on 14 February, Murle armed elements from Greater Pibor Administrative Areas (GPAA) shot and killed 14 civilians including one woman and injured nine others from the Toposa community during a cattle raid in Nakwa Boma, Lomeyan Payam, Kapoeta North County. The incident was reported at Riwoto Police station and investigation is reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: in Uleng Boma, Padiek Payam, Uror County
Description: 3.	On 17 February, multiple sources reported that on 16 February, Murle armed elements shot and killed two male civilians and injured another from the Lou Nuer community during a cattle raid in Uleng Boma, Padiek Payam, Uror County. According to the sources, Murle armed elements attacked and opened fire on Lopyier cattle camp in Uleng Boma, killing two of the occupants and injuring another. The attackers also seized 40 heads of cattle, 20 of which were subsequently recovered by the local youths during a pursuit of the attackers. The injured victim was evacuated to a hospital in Yuai for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: in Uleng Boma, Padiek Payam, Uror County
Description: 3. Location of Incident: in Phak Port, Mayendit County
Description:
4.	On 15 and 16 February, two secondary sources reported that on 15 February, SPLA-IO (RM) elements shot and killed two civilians including one woman and injured three others including one woman in Phak Port, Mayendit County. According to the sources, the SPLA-IO (RM riverine forces who were en route to Adok Port, Leer County attacked Phak Port, under the control of South Sudan National Police Service (SSNPS),killing two civilians and injuring three others. Reportedly, two SSNPS personnel were also killed during the attack. 

Comment: According to the sources, the situation remains tense in the area with the likelihood of retaliatory attack by the SSPDF and Hoak Nuer armed youths from Mayendit against the SPLA-IO positions in Rub-Kong and Adok Port. It can be recalled that Phak Port was under the control of  SPLA-IO (RM); however, they were dislodged from the area by the allied armed youths from Mayendit and Koch Counties during the conflict in southern Unity State in 2022.

Location of Incident: in Phak Port, Mayendit County
Description:

Location of Incident: in Bungu village, Sinakpuro Boma, Tambura Payam, Tambura County
Description: 5.	On 17 February, one primary source reported that on 14 February, armed Balanda elements shot and killed one male civilian from the Azande community in Bungu village, Sinakpuro Boma, Tambura Payam, Tambura County. As recounted by the source, armed Balanda elements accosted the victim and his wife while they had gone to harvest food from their farm in Bungu village; however, opened fire on them as they attempted to flee from the attackers, killing the male victim, while the woman escaped unharmed.

Location of Incident: in the Gangara Emilia neighborhood, Yambio Town, Yambio County
Description: 6.	On 17 February, two secondary sources reported that on 14 February, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one male civilian from the Balanda community in the Gangara Emilia neighborhood, Yambio Town, Yambio County. According to sources, a group of there unidentified armed elements attacked the victim in his home and the ensuing altercation, opened fire on the victim, injuring him. The victim was evacuated to a local health care facility in Nzara County for medical attention, where he succumbed to the injuries on 16 February.

Location of Incident: in the Gangara Emilia neighborhood, Yambio Town, Yambio County
Description: 7.	On 17 February, multiple sources reported that on 13 February, the SSPDF shot and injured one male civilian from the Azande community in Lirangu Town, Lirangu Payam. According to the sources, a group of SSPDF soldiers accosted the victim while he was transporting his farm produce on his bicycle to a safer location following the attack by the SSPDF on the SPLA-IO barracks in Lirangu, and as he attempted to flee, the soldiers opened fire injuring him. The victim was reportedly rescued by his relatives who evacuated him to a hospital in Nzara County for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: in Kuron village, Kuron Boma, Kauto Payam, Kapoeta East County
Description: 1.	On 18 February, three secondary sources reported that on 17 February, Murle armed elements from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) shot and killed two male civilians (ages 28 and 32 years old) from the Toposa community (cattle herders) during a cattle raid in Kuron village, Kuron Boma, Kauto Payam, Kapoeta East County. According to the sources, in the early hours of 17 February, Murle armed elements stormed a cattle camp in Kuron Village and opened fire on the vicitms while they were still asleep, killing them. The attackers raided 500 heads of cattle and fled with them towards GPAA. The incident was reported at the Narus Police station and investigation is reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: in Kuron village, Kuron Boma, Kauto Payam, Kapoeta East County
Description: 1.	On 18 February, three secondary sources reported that on 17 February, Murle armed elements from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) shot and killed two male civilians (ages 28 and 32 years old) from the Toposa community (cattle herders) during a cattle raid in Kuron village, Kuron Boma, Kauto Payam, Kapoeta East County. According to the sources, in the early hours of 17 February, Murle armed elements stormed a cattle camp in Kuron Village and opened fire on the vicitms while they were still asleep, killing them. The attackers raided 500 heads of cattle and fled with them towards GPAA. The incident was reported at the Narus Police station and investigation is reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: the Acholi community in Torit Town, Torit County
Description: 2.	On 18 February, three secondary sources reported that on 3 February, the joint security operation forces (comprised of SSPDF and South Sudan National Police Service (SSNPS)), and under the command and control of the Mayor of Torit, arbitrarily arrested, detained, and ill-treated to death one 24-year-old male civilian from the Acholi community in Torit Town, Torit County. According to the sources, in the evening of 3 February, joint security operation forces arrested the victim for fighting in Torit Town and transferred him to Torit Police station where he was arbitrarily detained in a storeroom within Torit Municipal office compound. Reportedly, he was handcuffed, severely ill-treated, beaten with gun butt and heavy sticks, leading to his death. Reportedly, on 4 February, the joint security operation forces took the body to a hospital, and the subsequent postmortem confirmed that the victim succumbed to severe beatings and that different parts of his bones were broken. An investigation is reportedly underway; however, no suspects have been apprehended yet.

Location of Incident: in Diror village, Walgak Payam, Akobo County.
Description: 3.	On 18 February, multiple sources reported that on 14 February, Murle armed elements shot and killed two male civilians in Diror village, Walgak Payam, Akobo County. According to the sources, Murle armed elements ambushed and opened fire on the victims as they were returning from Bongkei fishing site within Walgak Payam, killing them.

Location of Incident: Awul Payams, Tonj North County
Description: 4.	On 18 February, multiple sources reported that on 15 February, seven civilians were shot and killed (two Dinka Atok and five Dinka Jurbol)  and 10 others were injured (four Dinka Atok including two women and six Dinka Jurbol including one woman) during continuation of violence between armed Dinka Jurbol and Dinka Atok youths in Awul and Rualbet Payams, Tonj North County [see HRD Daily Report 14 February 2025]. As recounted by the sources, armed Jurbol youths from Rualbet Payam attacked and opened fire on Ayiik village in the outskirts of Awul Town, killing two male civilians and injuring four others including two women from the Dinka Atok community. In retaliation, armed Dinka Atok youths attacked and opened fire Achol Boma, killing five male civilians and injuring six others including one woman from the Dinka Jurbol community. The armed Dinka Atok youths also reportedly burnt Achol market. The injured victims from the Dinka Atok community were evacuated to a health care facility in Warrap Town, while those from the Dinka Jurbol community are receiving medical treatment at a health care facility in Rualbet.

Location of Incident: Awul Payams, Tonj North County
Description: 4. Location of Incident: in Kangi Payam, Jur River County
Description:
5.	On 18 February, one primary source and two secondary sources reported that on 15 February, one SSPDF soldier raped a 12-year-old girl from the Luo community in Kangi Payam, Jur River County. As recounted by the sources, the SSPDF soldier accosted the victim while she was returning home from the market in Chalek Boma, Kangi Payam, forcibly dragged her to the nearest bush and raped her. The survivor was reportedly rescued by the passer by who heard her cry for help. The survivor subsequently informed her family who took her to a health care facility in Kangi Payam for medical treatment, where she was referred to a hospital in Wau for further medical examination. The family of the survivor also filed a case at Kangi police station, and the perpetrated was subsequently apprehended on the same day.

Comment: HRD will follow up on the case for accountability of the perpetrator.

Location of Incident: in Nangbangi village, Saura Boma, Yambio Payam, Yambio County.
Description: 6.	On 18 February, two secondary source reported that on 17 February, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one male civilian and injured another, both from the Azande community, in Nangbangi village, Saura Boma, Yambio Payam, Yambio County. According to the sources, the assailants ambushed and opened fire on the victims while they were travelling on motorcycles, killing one and injuring another who managed to escape. The injured victim is reportedly receiving medica care at a health care facility in Nzara County.

Location of Incident: in Nangbangi village, Saura Boma, Yambio Payam, Yambio County.
Description: 6.	On 18 February, two secondary source reported that on 17 February, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one male civilian and injured another, both from the Azande community, in Nangbangi village, Saura Boma, Yambio Payam, Yambio County. According to the sources, the assailants ambushed and opened fire on the victims while they were travelling on motorcycles, killing one and injuring another who managed to escape. The injured victim is reportedly receiving medica care at a health care facility in Nzara County.

Location of Incident: from the Didinga community in Tuhai Village, Lotukei Boma, Lotukei Payam, Budi County
Description: 1.	On 19 February, multiple sources reported that on 26 January, armed Toposa youths from Natinga Payam, Kapoeta East County shot and killed two male civilians (one 42-year-old man and his 12-year-old son) from the Didinga community in Tuhai Village, Lotukei Boma, Lotukei Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, a group of four armed youths stormed Tuhai Village in search of their 10 calves, that were allegedly raided on 25 January, and opened fire on the victims who were near a local goldmine in the village, killing them. The incident was reported at the Lotukei police post; however, no suspects have been apprehended.

Location of Incident: Maper village, Ajak Kuac Payam, Twic County
Description: 2.	On 19 February, multiple sources reported that on 18 February, armed Nuer youths from Unity State  shot and injured one male civilian (a trader) from the Dinka Twic Mayardit community in Maper village, Ajak Kuac Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, armed Nuer youths ambushed and opened fire on a private vehicle enroute from Unity State to Ajak Kuac Payam. One police personnel was also reportedly shot and injured by the attackers. Reportedly, the attackers also seized personal belongings of the passengers such as money, phones and clothes. The injured victims are reportedly receiving treatment at a hospital in Turalei Town.

Location of Incident: Maper village, Ajak Kuac Payam, Twic County
Description: 2.	On 19 February, multiple sources reported that on 18 February, armed Nuer youths from Unity State  shot and injured one male civilian (a trader) from the Dinka Twic Mayardit community in Maper village, Ajak Kuac Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, armed Nuer youths ambushed and opened fire on a private vehicle enroute from Unity State to Ajak Kuac Payam. One police personnel was also reportedly shot and injured by the attackers. Reportedly, the attackers also seized personal belongings of the passengers such as money, phones and clothes. The injured victims are reportedly receiving treatment at a hospital in Turalei Town.

Location of Incident: in Yapuku village, Bazumburu Boma, Bazungua Payam, Yambio County
Description:
3.	On 19 February, two secondary sources reported that on the same day, unidentified armed elements shot and injured one male civilian from the Azande community in Yapuku village, Bazumburu Boma, Bazungua Payam, Yambio County. According to the sources, three unidentified armed elements dressed in military uniform ambushed and opened fire on three civilians as they were travelling on a motorcycle, injuring one, while the other two escaped unharmed. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Bazungua Payam for medical treatment.

Comment: Reportedly, the incident is part of a pattern of attacks targeting civilians by unidentified armed elements dressed in military uniforms.

Location of Incident: Malual-Ador village, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County
Description:
1.	On 20 February, three primary sources reported that on the same day, two civilians were shot and killed and two others were injured during violence between armed Dinka Pan-Juaj and Dinka Pawen youths in Malual-Ador village, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County. As recounted by the sources, armed Dinka Pan-Juaj youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Pawen community in Malual-Ador village, killing two Dinka Pawen civilians and injuring one Dinka Baac civilian. In retaliation, armed Dinka Pawen youths shot and injured one Dinka Pan-Juaj civilian who was grazing his cattle in the communal land in Malual-Ador village. The injured victim from the Dinka Pawen community was reportedly evacuated to a health care facility in Wunlit for medical treatment, while the one from the Dinka Pan-Juaj community is being treated locally in Malual-Ador village.

Comment: According to the sources, the incident was a revenge action linked to past violence between the two communities. The County authorities have reportedly dispatched security forces to the area to prevent an escalation as well as apprehend the perpetrators of the violence.

Location of Incident: Malual-Ador village, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County
Description:
1.	On 20 February, three primary sources reported that on the same day, two civilians were shot and killed and two others were injured during violence between armed Dinka Pan-Juaj and Dinka Pawen youths in Malual-Ador village, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County. As recounted by the sources, armed Dinka Pan-Juaj youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Pawen community in Malual-Ador village, killing two Dinka Pawen civilians and injuring one Dinka Baac civilian. Location of Incident: Mangok village, Turalei Payam, Twic County
Description:
2.	On 20 February, three primary sources reported that on the same day, armed Nuer youths from Unity State shot and killed three male civilians from the Dinka Twic Mayardit community during a cattle raid in Mangok village, Turalei Payam, Twic County. As recounted by the sources, armed Nuer youths attacked and opened fire on Mangok cattle camp, killing three of the residents. The attackers also seized 100 heads of cattle and fled with them into Unity State.

Comment: The incident has reportedly heightened tensions in the area with reports of mobilization by the Dinka Twic Mayardit youths for a revenge attack against the Nuer to recover their stolen cattle.

Location of Incident: Mangok village, Turalei Payam, Twic County
Description:
2.	On 20 February, three primary sources reported that on the same day, armed Nuer youths from Unity State shot and killed three male civilians from the Dinka Twic Mayardit community during a cattle raid in Mangok village, Turalei Payam, Twic County. As recounted by the sources, armed Nuer youths attacked and opened fire on Mangok cattle camp, killing three of the residents. The attackers also seized 100 heads of cattle and fled with them into Unity State.

Comment: The incident has reportedly heightened tensions in the area with reports of mobilization by the Dinka Twic Mayardit youths for a revenge attack against the Nuer to recover their stolen cattle.

Description:
2.
