Location of Incident: Dinka Ngok community in Ajong village, Wunrok Payam, Twic County.
Description:
3.	On 20 February, three primary sources reported that on 15 February, suspected armed Dinka Twic Mayardit youths abducted three civilians from the Dinka Ngok community in Ajong village, Wunrok Payam, Twic County. As recounted by the sources, suspected armed Twic Mayardit youths ambushed a vehicle that was enroute from Wau Town  to Abyei, and thereafter abducted the victims who were aboard the vehicle. According to the sources, the incident is likely a revenge action connected to the unresolved border dispute between the Dinka Twic Mayardit and the Dinka Ngok of Abyei Administrative Area.

Comment: HRD will follow up to gather more information on the incident.

Location of Incident: Dinka Ngok community in Ajong village, Wunrok Payam, Twic County.
Description:
3.	On 20 February, three primary sources reported that on 15 February, suspected armed Dinka Twic Mayardit youths abducted three civilians from the Dinka Ngok community in Ajong village, Wunrok Payam, Twic County. As recounted by the sources, suspected armed Twic Mayardit youths ambushed a vehicle that was enroute from Wau Town  to Abyei, and thereafter abducted the victims who were aboard the vehicle. According to the sources, the incident is likely a revenge action connected to the unresolved border dispute between the Dinka Twic Mayardit and the Dinka Ngok of Abyei Administrative Area.

Comment: HRD will follow up to gather more information on the incident.

Location of Incident: in Larumba village, Baka Boma, Tore Payam, Yei River County
Description:
2.	On 21 February, three secondary sources reported that on 10 February, suspected NAS elements (belonging to the NAS – United Front (NASUF)) abducted nine male civilians from the Baka community in Larumba village, Baka Boma, Tore Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, NAS elements intercepted the victims while they were hunting in the national game park along the border with the Democratic Republic of Congo and subsequently abducted them. Reportedly, three of the men escaped from the abductors on the same day, while three others escaped on 16 February. Three of the victims remain in NAS captivity. 

Comment: According to the sources, the victims may have been abducted for forced recruitment into the NAS.

Location of Incident: in Jagoani village, Chuk Payam, Panyijiar County
Description: 3.	On 21 February, two secondary sources reported that on 15 February, suspected armed Dinka Agar youths from Amongpiny Payam, Rumbek Centre County, Lake State shot and killed one 32-year-old male civilian from the Nyuong Nuer civilian in Jagoani village, Chuk Payam, Panyijiar County. According to the sources, a group of 30 suspected  armed Dinka Agar youths attacked three Nyuong Nuer male civilians who had gone to Jagoani village to identify the location of armed criminals who had attempted to raid cattle on the night of 14 February, and opened fire, killing one. The other two returned alive to Panyijiar and informed the local authorities who dispatched security forces to the area; however, the assailants had already fled the scene.

Location of Incident: in Pathuon West Payam, Gogrial East County
Description: 4.	On 23 February, three primary sources reported that on the same day, armed Nuer youths from Mayom County, Unity State shot and killed five male civilians and injured two others from the Dinka Apuk community during a cattle raid in Pathuon West Payam, Gogrial East County. As recounted by the sources, armed Nuer youths attacked and opened fire on a group of Dinka Apuk herders who were grazing their cattle and also fishing along the river in the Toch area along the border with Unity State, killing five and injuring two others including one woman. The attackers also seized 60 heads of cattle and attempted to flee with them across the border; however, the Dinka Apuk youths reportedly pursued them and recovered half of the stolen cattle. The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Lietnhom for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: in Pathuon West Payam, Gogrial East County
Description: 4.	On 23 February, three primary sources reported that on the same day, armed Nuer youths from Mayom County, Unity State shot and killed five male civilians and injured two others from the Dinka Apuk community during a cattle raid in Pathuon West Payam, Gogrial East County. As recounted by the sources, armed Nuer youths attacked and opened fire on a group of Dinka Apuk herders who were grazing their cattle and also fishing along the river in the Toch area along the border with Unity State, killing five and injuring two others including one woman. The attackers also seized 60 heads of cattle and attempted to flee with them across the border; however, the Dinka Apuk youths reportedly pursued them and recovered half of the stolen cattle. The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Lietnhom for medical treatment.

The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Lietnhom for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Turalei Town, Turalei Payam, Twic County
Description: 5.	On 23 February, our primary sources reported that on 20 February, three civilians (one woman) were shot and injured during a clash between joint security personnel (SSPDF, NSS and South Sudan National Police Service (SSNPS)) and armed Dinka Twic Mayardit youths in Turalei Town, Turalei Payam, Twic County. As recounted by the sources, the clash was triggered by an attempt by security personnel to arrest and detain a youth who was suspected to have participated in vehicle ambushes and robbery in Twic county. An armed confrontation ensued when youths resisted the arrest and threatened to overrun Turalei Town Police Station, and three civilians were injured in crossfire. Reportedly, one armed Dinka Twic Mayardit youth and one security personnel were also killed, and three armed Dinka Twic Mayardit youths were injured during the confrontation.

Location of Incident: Akop Town/Payam, Tonj North County
Description:
8.	On 22 February, three primary sources reported that on 20 February, armed Dinka Lou-Paher youths from Marial-Lou Payam shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinak Apuk-Patoc community in Akop Town/Payam, Tonj North County. As recounted by the sources, armed Lou-Paher youths attacked and opened fire on homesteads belonging to the Dinka Apuk-Patoc community in Akop Town, killing one of the residents, and thereafter fled back to Marial-Lou Payam. 

Comment: According to the sources, the attack was a revenge action for past violence and related unresolved grievances.

Location of Incident: Luo community in Kuanya Boma, Jur River County
Description:
9.	On 17 and 21 February, multiple sources reported that on 16 February, three NSS personnel gang-raped a 19-year-old woman from the Luo community in Kuanya Boma, Jur River County. As recounted by the sources, the NSS personnel came to the family house of the victim while she, her mother and three siblings were sleeping, removed them from the house at gunpoint and threatened to kill her mother. Reportedly, as they attempted to escape, the victim was caught, blindfolded, and her hands were tied at her back and thereafter dragged her into the bush, where the three suspects raped her. The sources further informed that the victim managed to walk to her grandmother’s house, and on the following day, her family reported the incident to the paramount chief of Kuanya who then reported the incident to the NSS commander attached to Kunaya checkpoint. The victim was taken to a hospital in Wau for medical examination, which confirmed the rape, and a case was subsequently filed at Wau Special Protection Unit. 

Comment: HRD will follow up on the incident for accountability of the perpetrators.

Location of Incident: Luo community in Kuanya Boma, Jur River County
Description:
10.	On 21 February, multiple sources reported that on 8 February, the NSS arbitrarily arrested and disappeared one 28-year-old male civilian from the Luo community in Kuanya Boma, Jur River County. According to the sources, NSS personnel arrested the victim and his brother (a soldier of the SSPDF Tiger Division stationed in Juba) in unclear circumstances and transferred them to an unknown location. Reportedly, since then, their families have not seen or heard from them.

Comment: The detention of the civilian, along with his SSPDF brother, has raised concerns of enforced disappearance or incommunicado detention by the NSS.

Location of Incident: Nikijo Boma, Jur River County
Description: 11.	On 21 February, multiple sources reported that on 10 February, NSS personnel arbitrarily arrested, detained and ill-treated seven male civilians including one health worker, all from the Luo community, in Nikijo Boma, Jur River County. As recounted by the sources, NSS personnel arrested and detained the victims on accusations of collaborating with SPLA-IO elements or harboring illegal weapons. The vicitms were reportedly interrogated and beaten while in detention, and that three NSS personnel explicitly warned and threatened the health worker to stop providing medical treatment to SPLA-IO patients. Reportedly, the victims were released after three hours when no evidence related to the accusations was found. The sources further informed that the NSS personnel burnt four houses and seven shops at Nikijo market before leaving the locality.

Location of Incident: Achot Boma, Jur River County
Description:
12.	On 19 February, three secondary sources reported that on 10 February, joint security forces arbitrarily arrested, detained and ill-treated one 27-year-old male civilian from the Luo community in Achot Boma, Jur River County. According to the sources, the joint security forces arrested, severely beat up and cut off the victim’s ear to  coerce him into revealing the location of the SPLA-IO commander General Bol Wek. Reportedly, when the victim failed to provide information, the joint security forces burnt down the General’s home and other civilian structures in Achot Boma before retreating to Kuanya.

Comment: Observably, the operations by government security forces ostensibly conducted under the guise of maintaining security have instead resulted in widespread human rights violations and abuses. These actions have left affected communities traumatized, fearful, and deprived of basic necessities and protection. The severe ill-treatment endured by the 27-year-old civilian under duress, in circumstances amounting to torture, demonstrates a deliberate intent to inflict suffering and instill fear among the local population, all of whom are regarded as SPLA-IO sympathizers. HRD continues to follow up on the reports.

Location of Incident: Zambasende Boma, Lirangu Payam, Yambio County
Description: 13.	On 21 February, multiple sources reported that on 20 February, one male civilian from the Azande community was shot and injured during clashes between the SSPDF and SPLA-IO in Zambasende Boma, Lirangu Payam, Yambio County. According to the sources, an unspecified number of SSPDF soldiers opened fire on SPLA-IO elements upon encountering them while they were drinking at the house of a local chief, and during the confrontation, one civilian (a family member of the household) was injured. The injured victim was reportedly evacuated to a health care facility in Nzara County for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Pojulu community in Limbe, Lainya County
Description:
1.	On 24 February, two secondary sources reported that on 19 December, the SSPDF arbitrarily arrested and detained two male civilians (ages 25 and 27 years old) from the Pojulu community in Limbe, Lainya County. According to the sources, the SSPDF arrested and detained the victims after they rescued one SSPDF soldier who had been beaten by unidentified assailants and took him to the SSPDF barracks in Limbe; however, the SSPDF accused the victims for the having attacked the soldier and stealing his gun. The sources further informed that efforts by local leaders to secure their release have been futile. The vicitms reportedly remain in detention under unfavourable conditions and without any formal charge.

Comment: The arbitrary arrest and incarceration of civilians in military detention facilities raises serious human rights concerns. HRD will engage with the SSPDF leadership and judicial authorities and advocate for their release or due process under formal judicial process.

Location of Incident: in Gakdong Boma, Dengjok Payam, Akobo County
Description: 2.	On 24 February, multiple sources reported that on 22 February, Murle armed elements shot and killed one 30-year-old woman and abducted three children (two boys and one girl) from the Lou Nuer community in Gakdong Boma, Dengjok Payam, Akobo County.  According to the sources, the Murle armed elements attacked the victims in their homestead, opened fire on the woman as he attempted to stop the abduction of the children, killing her, and subsequently abducted them. Reportedly, the local youths pursued the abductors and on 23 February, found the dead body of one of the abducted children (a seven-year-old boy) in an area within Dengjok Payam. The whereabouts of the other two children remains unknown.

Location of Incident: in Gakdong Boma, Dengjok Payam, Akobo County
Description: 2.	On 24 February, multiple sources reported that on 22 February, Murle armed elements shot and killed one 30-year-old woman and abducted three children (two boys and one girl) from the Lou Nuer community in Gakdong Boma, Dengjok Payam, Akobo County.  According to the sources, the Murle armed elements attacked the victims in their homestead, opened fire on the woman as he attempted to stop the abduction of the children, killing her, and subsequently abducted them. Reportedly, the local youths pursued the abductors and on 23 February, found the dead body of one of the abducted children (a seven-year-old boy) in an area within Dengjok Payam. The whereabouts of the other two children remains unknown.

Location of Incident: Tonga, Panyikang County
Description: 3.	On 24 February, one secondary source reported that on 23 February, SPLA-IO elements shot and injured two civilians in Tonga, Panyikang County. According to the source, SPLA-IO elements opened fire on the vicitms in retaliation for the killing of one SPLA-IO element allegedly by another civilian in revenge for the previous killing of a family member by SPLA-IO elements. The source further informed that the victims had been displaced from Fangak County, Jonglei State to Tonga due to the flooding situation. Reportedly, the authorities in Tonga have met with the SPLA/IO and the Necessary Unified Forces (NUF) to prevent escalation of violence.

Location of Incident: in Bul-Agoor village, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County
Description:
5.	On 24 February, three primary sources reported that on 21 February, armed Dinka Kongor youths shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Pakoor community in Bul-Agoor village, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County. As recounted by the sources, armed Dinka Kongor youths attacked and opened fire on the victim for failure to pay a fine and complete the full dowry for their female relative according to Dinka custom, killing him.

Comment: The incident has reportedly heightened tensions in Bul-Agoor village with the likelihood of more revenge violence. Reportedly, the authorities are dispatching security forces to the area to deter more violence and apprehend the perpetrators.

Location of Incident: in Pisak village,  Otogo Payam, Yei River County
Description: 2.	On 25 February, two secondary sources reported that on 10 and 19 February, NAS elements abducted three civilians (two women and one man) from the Kakwa community in Pisak village,  Otogo Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, on 10 February, NAS elements abducted a woman from Pisak while moving in the community. Reportedly, on 19 February, during an operation by the SSPDF to rescue the woman, two other civilians who had been abducted by NAS elements on the same were also recovered in Yembe Sub-boma. The sources further informed that the three former abductees were transferred to Yei Town and handed over to the County Commissioner. The victims subsequently received medical treatment at a hospital in Yei for injuries sustained from ill-treatment during their captivity.

Location of Incident: in Pisak village,  Otogo Payam, Yei River County
Description: 2.	On 25 February, two secondary sources reported that on 10 and 19 February, NAS elements abducted three civilians (two women and one man) from the Kakwa community in Pisak village,  Otogo Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, on 10 February, NAS elements abducted a woman from Pisak while moving in the community. Reportedly, on 19 February, during an operation by the SSPDF to rescue the woman, two other civilians who had been abducted by NAS elements on the same were also recovered in Yembe Sub-boma. The sources further informed that the three former abductees were transferred to Yei Town and handed over to the County Commissioner. The victims subsequently received medical treatment at a hospital in Yei for injuries sustained from ill-treatment during their captivity.

Location of Incident: Morukomen Boma, Kauto Payam, Kapoeta East County
Description: 3.	On 25 February, three secondary sources reported that on 16 February, Murle armed elements shot and killed one 38-year-old woman and her two male children (ages six and 12 years old) in Morukomen Boma, Kauto Payam, Kapoeta East County. According to the sources, Murle armed elements opened fire on the victims as they were escaping the attack by Murle armed elements and subsequent confrontation with armed Toposa youths that began on 14 February through 16 February. Reportedly, on 14 February, Murle armed elements stormed several cattle camps in Morukomen Boma and raided an unspecified number of cattle. Armed Toposa youths pursued the attackers and an armed confrontations ensued in the outskirts of Morukomen Boma that reportedly lasted for three days (14, 15 and 16 February), during which combatants from both sides sustained unconfirmed numbers of casualties. The sources further informed that Murle armed elements shot and killed the three victims in revenge for the numerous numbers of Murle armed elements who were killed by armed Toposa youths during the confrontation on 14 and 15 February. Reportedly, armed Toposa youths managed to recover some of the raided cattle.

Location of Incident: Morukomen Boma, Kauto Payam, Kapoeta East County
Description: 3.	On 25 February, three secondary sources reported that on 16 February, Murle armed elements shot and killed one 38-year-old woman and her two male children (ages six and 12 years old) in Morukomen Boma, Kauto Payam, Kapoeta East County. According to the sources, Murle armed elements opened fire on the victims as they were escaping the attack by Murle armed elements and subsequent confrontation with armed Toposa youths that began on 14 February through 16 February. Reportedly, on 14 February, Murle armed elements stormed several cattle camps in Morukomen Boma and raided an unspecified number of cattle. Armed Toposa youths pursued the attackers and an armed confrontations ensued in the outskirts of Morukomen Boma that reportedly lasted for three days (14, 15 and 16 February), during which combatants from both sides sustained unconfirmed numbers of casualties. The sources further informed that Murle armed elements shot and killed the three victims in revenge for the numerous numbers of Murle armed elements who were killed by armed Toposa youths during the confrontation on 14 and 15 February. Reportedly, armed Toposa youths managed to recover some of the raided cattle.

Location of Incident: Lou Nuer community in Tiam, Pieri Payam, Uror County
Description:
4.	On 25 February, multiple sources reported that on 20 February, Murle armed elements attacked and decapitated one 30-year-old male civilian from the Lou Nuer community in Tiam, Pieri Payam, Uror County. According to the sources, Murle armed elements attacked the victim while he had gone to collect honey in the bushes in Tiam. 

Comment: According to the sources, at least three attacks by Murle armed elements reportedly occurred in the same area between Uror and Duk counties on the same day.

Location of Incident: in Kairo village, Murokomon Boma, Kauto Payam, Kapoeta East County
Description: 1.	On 27 February, three secondary sources reported that on 16 February, Murle armed elements from Grater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) shot and killed seven civilians and injured five others from the Toposa community during a cattle raid in Kairo village, Murokomon Boma, Kauto Payam, Kapoeta East County. According to the sources, Murle armed elements stormed and opened fire on a cattle camp in Kairo Village, killing even of the residents and injuring five others. The attacker also raided about 600 heads of cattle and fled towards GPAA. Reportedly, armed Toposa youths pursued the Murle armed elements and a confrontation ensued on the outskirts of Murokomon Boma, in which multiple combatants were killed on both sides (exact number unspecified). The incident was reported at the Narus Police Station where investigation is said to be ongoing; however, no suspects have been apprehended.

Location of Incident: in Kairo village, Murokomon Boma, Kauto Payam, Kapoeta East County
Description: 1.	On 27 February, three secondary sources reported that on 16 February, Murle armed elements from Grater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) shot and killed seven civilians and injured five others from the Toposa community during a cattle raid in Kairo village, Murokomon Boma, Kauto Payam, Kapoeta East County. According to the sources, Murle armed elements stormed and opened fire on a cattle camp in Kairo Village, killing even of the residents and injuring five others. The attacker also raided about 600 heads of cattle and fled towards GPAA. Reportedly, armed Toposa youths pursued the Murle armed elements and a confrontation ensued on the outskirts of Murokomon Boma, in which multiple combatants were killed on both sides (exact number unspecified). The incident was reported at the Narus Police Station where investigation is said to be ongoing; however, no suspects have been apprehended.

Location of Incident: from the Bul Nuer community in Biey Biey village, Pup Payam, Mayom County
Description:
2.	On 27 February, multiple sources reported that on 25 February, suspected armed Arab Misseriya elements shot and killed five male civilians and injured three others from the Bul Nuer community in Biey Biey village, Pup Payam, Mayom County. According to the sources, armed Arab Misseriya elements opened fire on a group of Bul Nuer fishermen while they were fishing in the area, killing five and injuring three. The injured victims were reportedly recovered by security forces and evacuated to a hospital in Bentiu for medical treatment.

Comment: This is the second incident documented in February 2025 in which armed Arab Misseriya elements have attacked civilians in Unity State [see HRD Daily Report 7 February 2025]. The incidents may provoke revenge violence by armed youths from the affected communities.

Location of Incident: from the Bul Nuer community in Biey Biey village, Pup Payam, Mayom County
Description:
2.	On 27 February, multiple sources reported that on 25 February, suspected armed Arab Misseriya elements shot and killed five male civilians and injured three others from the Bul Nuer community in Biey Biey village, Pup Payam, Mayom County. According to the sources, armed Arab Misseriya elements opened fire on a group of Bul Nuer fishermen while they were fishing in the area, killing five and injuring three. The injured victims were reportedly recovered by security forces and evacuated to a hospital in Bentiu for medical treatment.

Comment: This is the second incident documented in February 2025 in which armed Arab Misseriya elements have attacked civilians in Unity State [see HRD Daily Report 7 February 2025]. The incidents may provoke revenge violence by armed youths from the affected communities.

Location of Incident: Walchuk village in Tonj Payam, Tonj South County
Description: 3.	On 27 February, three primary sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Gok youths from Cueibet County, Lakes State shot and killed five male civilians (three from the Dinka Muok community and two from the Dinka Yar community) and injured 17 others (seven Dinka Muok men, eight Dinka Yar men and two Dinka Apuk-Jurwir women) during a cattle raid in Walchuk village in Tonj Payam, Tonj South County. As recounted by the sources, armed Gok youths attacked and opened fire on Dinka civilians who were grazing and watering their cattle near the river in Walchuk village, killing five and injuring 17 others. The attackers also seized over 500 heads of cattle and fled with them across the border into Lakes State. the injured vicitms were reportedly evacuated to a hospital in Tonj Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Pakuac village, Alabek Payam, Tonj North County
Description: 4.	On 27 February, three primary sources reported that on the same day, armed Nuer youths shot and killed two male civilians and injured three others from the Dinka Lou-Ariik community during a cattle raid in Pakuac village, Alabek Payam, Tonj North County. As recounted by the sources, armed Nuer youths attacked and opened fire on a cattle camp in Pakuac village, killing two of the occupants and injuring three others. The attackers also seized over 70 heads of cattle and fled with them into Unity State. The injured victims are reportedly receiving treatment locally in Alabek Payam.

Location of Incident: Pakuac village, Alabek Payam, Tonj North County
Description: 4.	On 27 February, three primary sources reported that on the same day, armed Nuer youths shot and killed two male civilians and injured three others from the Dinka Lou-Ariik community during a cattle raid in Pakuac village, Alabek Payam, Tonj North County. As recounted by the sources, armed Nuer youths attacked and opened fire on a cattle camp in Pakuac village, killing two of the occupants and injuring three others. The attackers also seized over 70 heads of cattle and fled with them into Unity State. The injured victims are reportedly receiving treatment locally in Alabek Payam.

Location of Incident: Achot Boma, Rocrocdong Payam, Jur River County
Description: 5.	On 26 February, five primary sources reported that on 6 February, the NSS ill-treated five male civilians from the Luo community in Achot Boma, Rocrocdong Payam, Jur River County. As recounted by the sources, NSS personnel who were conduct an operation in search of General Bol Wek of the Sudan People’s Liberation Army – In Opposition (SPLA-IO) in Achot Boma gathered villagers, including the Sultan and the Payam Administrator, in an open area and interrogated them about their alleged affiliation with the SPLA-IO. The NSS personnel reportedly beat up the five civilians including the Sultan, who reportedly coerced him into guiding them to the home of SPLA-IO General.

Location of Incident: Kuanya Boma, Rocrocdong Payam, Jur River County
Description:
6.	On 26 February, one primary source reported that on 6 February, one 24-year-old male civilian from the Luo community was shot and injured during a confrontation between the NSS and SPLA-IO elements in Kuanya Boma, Rocrocdong Payam, Jur River County. According to the source, the victim was injured by a stray bullet fired from the NSS side, while he was fleeing the scene. He managed to escape and fled to Achot village, where he sought refuge. 

Comment: The shooting of an unarmed civilian during active hostilities raises concerns about the adherence to international humanitarian law. HRD will follow up on the reports for accountability of the perpetrators.

Location of Incident: Akorobodgi neighborhood, Yambio Town, Yambio County
Description: 7.	On 27 February, one secondary source reported that on 24 February, an unidentified armed element raped a 35-year-old woman from the Azande community in Akorobodgi neighborhood, Yambio Town, Yambio County. According to the source, the unidentified armed element attacked the survivor in her homestead and raped her at gunpoint. The incident was reported to the police, and the survivor received medical treatment a health care facility in Yambio Twon. While the prompt response of the authorities is commendable, it is essential to ensure that the perpetrator is held accountable for this egregious human rights abuse.

Location of Incident: Yambio Town, Yambio County
Description: 8.	On 27 February, one primary source reported that on 26 February, unidentified armed elements ill-treated one 14-year-old girl in Yambio Town, Yambio County. As recounted by the source, a group of eight unidentified armed elements broke into a homestead in the Napere neighborhood in Yambio Town, threatened the occupants and struck the 14-year-old girl with a gun, causing her to lose consciousness. At the time of reporting, the incident was yet to be reported to the police.

Location of Incident: Machi Boma, Katiko Payam, Kapoeta South County
Description:
1.	On 26 and 27 February, three secondary sources reported that on 21 February, armed Buya youths from Kimotong Payam, Budi County shot and injured one 30-year-old male civilian (a cattle herder) from the Toposa community in Machi Boma, Katiko Payam, Kapoeta South County. According to the sources, a group of five armed Buya youths from Kali Boma, Kimotong Payam stormed Machi Boma and opened fire on the victim  while he was grazing his cattle in the area, injuring him, and thereafter fled the scene. The injured victim was reportedly evacuated to a hospital in Kapoeta for medical attention. 

Comment: According to the sources, the attack was a revenge action for the shooting and killing of a 15-year-old Buya boy by armed Toposa youths from Machi Boma in Kali Boma, Kimotong Payam on 14 November 2024 [See HRD Daily Report 22 November 2024].

Location of Incident: in Cham village, Borter Payam, Pochalla North County, GPAA
Description: 2.	On 26 February, multiple sources reported that on 5 February, Murle armed elements abducted two boys (ages 10 and 12 years old) from the Anyuak community, and subsequently shot and killed the 10-year-old, in Cham village, Borter Payam, Pochalla North County, GPAA. According to the sources, Murle armed elements abducted the boys from near their home while they were following their mother to the river side to fetch water. Reportedly, the local youths pursued the abductors and found the body of the 10-year-old boy who was shot and killed. The whereabouts of the 12-year-old boy remains unknown.

Location of Incident: in Cham village, Borter Payam, Pochalla North County, GPAA
Description: 2. Location of Incident: Pabek village , Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County
Description:
3.	On 26 February, three primary sources reported that on the same day, two civilians were shot and killed (one from the Dinka Kongor community and one from the Dinka Pakoor community) and two others were injured (one Dinka Kongor and one Dinka Pakoor) during retaliatory violence between armed Dinka Pakoor and Dinka Kongor youths in Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County. As recounted by the sources, armed Dinka Pakoor youths attacked and opened fire on homesteads belonging to the Dinka Kongor community in Pabek village killing one of the residents and injuring another. In retaliation, armed Dinka Kongor youths attacked Bul-Agoor village and shot and killed one Dinka Pakoor civilian and injured another. The injured victims were evacuated to a hospital in Tonj for medical treatment.

Comment: According to the sources, the incident is linked to the revenge violence between the two communities on 21 February [see HRD Daily Report 25 February 2025].

Description:

Location of Incident: Bul-Agoor village  , Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County
Description: rf

Location of Incident: Mari village, Jambara Sub Boma, Korobe Boma  Kupera Payam, Lainya County.
Description:
•	Attack and injury 17 -year-old civilian male by armed cattle keepers in Mari village, Jambara Sub Boma, Korobe Boma  Kupera Payam, Lainya County.
On 28 February 2025, HRD-YFO received and documented credible information from multiple reliable secondary sources, including, paramount chief, local leader, intergovernmental organisation worker and a relative of the victim  about the alleged attack  on civilian male (details on file)  aged 17 years in Mari village, Jambara sub boma, Korobe Boma  Kupera Payam, Lainya County on February16 2025, by individuals suspected to be Dinka Bor Cattle keepers.

According to the sources, on 16 February 2025, a group of armed cattle keepers encountered a civilian male from the Pojulu tribe  who was grazing family cows in the areas. The armed cattle keepers attempted to raid the cattle  which the boy resisted. Subsequently,  one the cattle keepers, hurled a grenade injuring seriously the civilian on his  foot.  The explosion attracted the local resident who intervened  and rescued the victim. The victim was rushed to a medical facility in Yei for treatment. The preparator was arrested and detained by police in Kupera. However, under unclear circumstances, the perpetrator was released on the same day.
Comment: Reports in the areas indicate, high influx of armed cattle keepers and this influx poses a big challenge to local communities. Attacking the civilian with grenade has been common in the area, and this incident raises serious concerns that call for strengthen security for protection of local communities in the area. The attack threatens the  right to liberty and may even result into loss of life centrally to human rights standards  and criminal code of South Sudan.

Location of Incident: from the Balanda Community in Yambio Town, Yambio County.
Description:
•	Alleged Disappearance of two journalists in Yambio Town, Yambio County 
On February 28, 2025, the HRD Yambio FO received and documented credible reports from multiple credible sources, including a family member and the Union of Journalists of South Sudan (UJOSS), about the disappearance of two male journalists (details on file) from the Balanda Community in Yambio Town, Yambio County. 
The sources revealed that before their disappearance, both journalists experienced a traumatic event where unknown armed assailants attacked their homes. The assailants looted their properties and set their houses ablaze. One journalist was affiliated with Anisa FM Radio, a Catholic Church-based station, while the other worked for Yambio FM, a local government-owned radio station.
The two journalists went missing on February 16, 2025, and their current whereabouts remain unknown. A family member reported that they filed a case with the Yambio Police Station, but it appears that the authorities have not effectively investigated the matter.
The disappearance of these journalists raises concerns about the safety and freedom of the press in the state. Unfortunately, this incident is not isolated, as there have been reports of other journalists facing harassment, detention, and disappearance in the country. 
The disappearance of the two journalists is a clear case of enforced disappearance, a grave violation of international human rights law, including the International Convention for the Protection of All Persons from Enforced Disappearance. This incident raises serious concerns about freedom of expression, as the attack on their homes and disappearance may be seen as an attempt to silence them and restrict their ability to report on issues of public interest. The looting and burning of properties put their lives at risk, violating their right to life, as protected under Article 6 of the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights and Article 11 of the South Sudan Transitional Constitution. Furthermore, the disappearance violates their liberty and security rights, guaranteed under Article 9 of the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights and Article 13 of the South Sudan Transitional Constitution.
HRD urges the authorities to take immediate and thorough action to investigate the disappearance of these two journalists and ensure their safe return. HRD will closely follow up with the police on the cases.
Comments: The disappearance of journalists is alarming, particularly in light of the former Governor's recent declaration of a free civic space in the state. This declaration was intended to promote a conducive civic and political engagement environment. The incident highlights a disturbing trend regarding the safety of media personnel in Western Equatoria State. It underscores the urgent need for law enforcement agencies to prioritize the protection of journalists and take swift action in response to threats against their safety, which is essential for promoting freedom of expression.

Location of Incident: in Gokwak Boma, Motot, in Motot Payam in Uror County
Description:
Armed Murle elements allegedly attack a cattle camp, capture a woman, subject her to ill treatment and loot 26 heads of cattle in Gokwak, Motot Payam, Uror County, Jonglei State

On 27 February, HRD received information from Uror County authorities, youth leaders and CSOs that on 26 February at around noon, armed Murle elements allegedly attacked a cattle camp in Gokwak Boma, situated five kilometers northeast of Motot, in Motot Payam in Uror County and looted 26 heads of cattle. They also captured a 35 year old Lou Nuer woman who was in the cattle camp at the time of attack, subjected her to severe beating and tied her to a tree before escaping from the area. The local youth who found the woman tied to the tree at around 15.00 hrs, followed the attackers and managed to recover ten heads of cattle while the attackers escape with 16. The seriously injured woman was taken to the clinic in Motot where she is receiving treatment.

Location of Incident: in Kuemlet village, Waat Payam in Nyirol County
Description:
Armed Murle elements allegedly shoot and kill one Lou Nuer male civilian and abduct two females including a minor in Kuemlet, Waat Payam, Nyirol County, Jonglei State.

On 28 February, HRD received information from multiple sources, that include CSOs, youth and member of local administration, that on 27 February, at around 13.00 hrs, armed Murle elements allegedly ambushed Lou Nuer civilians, travelling from Motot Payam in Uror County to Waat Payam in Nyirol County, in Kuemlet village  approximately two  kilometers away from Waat, and shot at them killing  one Lou Nuer  man aged 30 and abducting  two females – one girl aged 13 and a woman aged 25. The civilians were travelling from Motot to Waat to receive food distribution when they fell into ambush. Local youth in Waat received information, mobilized and pursued the suspected assailants allegedly killing one attacker in the crossfire in the bush but were unable to recover the abductees. HRD sources said the deceased attacker was later identified as Murle from the body scarification and other physical features typical of Murle tradition.

Location of Incident: in Kuemlet village, Waat Payam in Nyirol County
Description:
Armed Murle elements allegedly shoot and kill one Lou Nuer male civilian and abduct two females including a minor in Kuemlet, Waat Payam, Nyirol County, Jonglei State.

Location of Incident: Lofiriha Boma, Kudo Payam, Torit County
Description:
On 28 February 2025, HRD monitored and followed up on a reported incident of shooting and killing of eight (8) unarmed Lotuko male civilians in an intercommunal cattle and revenge related attack in Lofiriha Boma, Kudo Payam-Torit County and spoke to three reliable secondary sources who confirmed to HRD that the incident happened during the Dinka Bor-Magwi County conflict that took place on 2 February 2025.
According to the respondents, at approximately 16:00 hours on 2 February 2025, one armed member of the Lotuko community of Lofiriha Boma, who was at the vicinity of a traditional dance party in Lofiriha Boma, Kudo Payam, Torit County spotted the armed Murle men with a huge number of cattle passing along Lofiriha Boma. Reportedly, under the believe that they were Dinka Bor herders, who were about to attack the Lotuko community, he shot at them. Unfortunately, the Murle youths returned fire and proceeded to shooting indiscriminately at the unarmed Lotuko traditional dancers of Lofiriha Boma, thereby killing eight (8) male civilians instantly. After the shooting, the armed Murle men reportedly continued their journey towards Lafon and then towards GPAA.
The sources noted that the motive of the shooting and killing of the eight (8) unarmed Lotuko civilians was to retaliate the shooting from the armed Lotuko man from Lofiriha Boma. The incident was reported at the Kudo Police station, and investigation is said to be ongoing, but no suspect has been apprehended.
Comment: HRD will continue to follow up on developments and report accordingly

In another development on 28 February 2025, HRD followed up on reported incidents of inter-communal revenge related attacks where two unarmed Dinka male civilians aged 25 year old and 46 year-old were killed in two separate incidents of intercommunal revenge related attacks by armed Lotuko youth  in Torit town, Nyong Payam, Torit County and by armed Lokoya youth in  Lolere Boma of Kudo Payam in Torit County on  11 and 15 February 2025 respectively. HRD spoke to three reliable secondary sources in each of the incidents and confirmed them as earlier reported.
According to the respondents, at about 11:00 hours on 11 February 2025, about five armed Lotuko youth from Torit town, Nyong Payam Torit County ambushed the 25-year-old unarmed Dinka male commercial motorcycle (boda-boda rider) who was later found to be from Northern Bahr Ghazel State. The armed men beat him up and stabbed him numerous times with a knife until he died. Also, on 15 February 2025, a 46 -year-old unarmed Dinka male civilian a businessman who was a resident of Lolere Boma, Kudo Payam, Torit County had fire set on him by the Lokoya youths of Lolere Boma and he was burnt to death.
The respondents informed HRD that the killing of two Dinka male civilians, the 25-year-old and 46-year-old were perpetrated by the Lotuko and Lokoya youths to avenge against the Dinka community for their killings of the Eastern Equatoria State civilians and the burning of houses in Magwi County on 2 February 2025, (See 2025-02-03 and 04 -UNMISS HRD FOT Daily Report). 
The incidents were reported to the police in Torit town and Khor-Englis, Kudo Payam, Torit County, and investigations are said to be ongoing, but no suspect has been apprehended.
Comment: HRD will continue to follow up on developments and update accordingly

The armed men beat him up and stabbed him numerous times with a knife until he died. Also, on 15 February 2025, a 46 -year-old unarmed Dinka male civilian a businessman who was a resident of Lolere Boma, Kudo Payam, Torit County had fire set on him by the Lokoya youths of Lolere Boma and he was burnt to death.
The respondents informed HRD that the killing of two Dinka male civilians, the 25-year-old and 46-year-old were perpetrated by the Lotuko and Lokoya youths to avenge against the Dinka community for their killings of the Eastern Equatoria State civilians and the burning of houses in Magwi County on 2 February 2025, (See 2025-02-03 and 04 -UNMISS HRD FOT Daily Report). 
The incidents were reported to the police in Torit town and Khor-Englis, Kudo Payam, Torit County, and investigations are said to be ongoing, but no suspect has been apprehended.
Comment: HRD will continue to follow up on developments and update accordingly.

Location of Incident: Akuac residential area of Rumbek town, within Rumbek Center
Description:
An SSPDF soldier suspected of attempting to rape a 1-year-old infant arrested and put under custody at Rumbek Central Police station

On 3 February 2025, HRD registered an SSPDF soldier (aged 26) from the Commando Battalion at the custody of the Rumbek Central Police station. HRD gathered that the SSPDF soldier had been arrested by Police on 29 January, over suspicion of attempting to rape a 1-year-old infant female in Akuac residential area of Rumbek town, within Rumbek Center County. The incident reportedly took place the same day of the arrest of the suspect (on 29 January). HRD briefly interacted with the suspect, who introduced himself as a deserter and denied all the allegations. HRD subsequently inquired about the case with the Head of local Police investigation unit. The latter stated that they were still investigating the matter. He mentioned that he could not confirm the incident until receiving a report from a local service provider who received the victim with the mother for medical attention. On 4 February, HRD contacted the said service provider who confirmed to have medically attended the victim on 30 January and to have established the attempt rape evidences.

Comments: On 4 February, the Special Protection Unit of the Police stated that they were yet to receive the medical report to process their investigations. HRD will continue to monitor the development in the case.

Location of Incident: Machar Lung village of Mangar Tong Payam
Description:
HRD follows up on two cases  of  rape involving minors in Wanjyok  Payam in Aweil East  County

On 5 February 2025, HRD, RoLSIS and GAU visited the police station and prison in Wanyjok, Aweil East County (approx. 35km from the Aweil FO) to monitor the progress of two (2) rape cases against minors (See DSR 19-12-2024). 

In the first case, Athiang Apet Apet, the 22-year-old man accused of raping an 8-year-old girl on 15 December 2024 in the Machar Lung village of Mangar Tong Payam was sentenced to a mandatory prison term of seven (7) years. He was also ordered to pay a fine of 300,000 SSP or serve an additional five (5) years in default of payment. The perpetrator confessed to the act but stated that he was intoxicated at the time of the incident. The sentence was passed by the High Court on 13 January 2025. 

In the second case, Dut Dut Akok, the 23-year-old man accused of raping a 15-year-old girl on 7 December in the Pun Apot village of Manyiel Payam was sentenced to a mandatory prison term of seven (7) years. He was also ordered to pay a fine of 300,000 SSP or serve an additional two (2) years in default of payment. The perpetrator maintains that the sexual relationship with the survivor was “consensual” and that she was 18 years old.  The sentence was passed by the High Court on 14 January 2025.

In both instances, the team examined the judgments and interviewed the perpetrators.

Location of Incident: Lomuku, Yei Town Payam of Yei River
Description:
•	Rape of a 15-year-old by a civilian male in Lomuku, Yei Town Payam of Yei River County

On February 05, 2025, HRD YFO, received and documented information from three reliable sources including a medical officer and a psychosocial support provider about the incident of rape of a 15-year-old girl (details on file) from Kakwa community by a civilian male aged 24 years (details on file) in Lomuku, Yei Town, Yei Town Payam of Yei River County on February 01, 2025.

Sources revealed that the 15-year-old girl was discovered by her parent that she was abused by the perpetrator when the survivor reported home late at 9:00 pm on February 03, 2025, and on interrogation the survivor revealed that she was raped on February 01, 2025.

The survivor was on February 04, 2025, taken to one of the health centres in Yei where medical examination revealed rape. The perpetrator was arrested and accepted the allegations. He is being detained at the Yei Police Headquarters for further management.

Comment: UNMISS – HRD YFO will follow up with the police station to ensure accountability.

Location of Incident: Gei Payam, Likuangole
Description:
A 14-year-old Murle girl from Gei payam, Likuangole County seeks protection at the Pibor Intermediate Care Centre, GPAA

On 10 February, HRD received information from multiple sources including social workers from the Pibor Interim Care Center and the victim regarding a case of forced marriage of Murle girls in GPAA. Reportedly, a Murle girl aged 14-year-old from Othagon village in Gei Payam, Likuangole County was set to marry in a dowry arrangement of 30 cattle some years back with a Murle man of lango age-set group (30 – 35 year old) in connivance with part of her family. According to the victim, she left Othagon in July 2024 to live in Pibor with her mother, attend classes at school and escape from the forced marriage. According to the victim, on 20 December 2024, the perpetrator, accompanied by several of his Lango age-set friends, went to her home in Pibor town and demanded that she follow him back to Likuangole, and she refused. The following morning, on 21 December, they returned and insisted on forcing her to go to Likuangole, but she escaped to the ICC Pibor for protection. She disclosed that she does not wish to marry the man.

Comments: Cases of forced marriages in GPAA appear to be on the rise, with reports of some teenage girls committing suicide as a result of being forced into marriage. HRD is investigating and engaging with the GPAA Minister of Gender, Child and Social Welfare, and the authorities, on the alarming forced marriage issue.

Location of Incident: Yari Boma, Mugwo Payam, Yei River County
Description: 1.	On 3 March, two primary sources and two secondary sources reported that on 1 March, elements of NAS abducted seven civilians (four males and three females) in Yari Boma, Mugwo Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, the assailants ambushed a commercial vehicle transporting civilians from Yei to Uganda, and abducted seven civilians and burnt down the vehicle. Reportedly, while they ill-treated the abductees and looted the property onboard the vehicle a group of South Sudan People’s Defense Forces (SSPDF) on patrol in the area, responded to the incident causing the abductors to flee leaving behind the abductees. The injured victims were taken to a health facility in Yei for treatment, including two women who had fainted from ill-treatment and the matter was reported to the police for investigation.

Location of Incident: Ibahure Boma, Obonge Payam, Imehejek Administrative Area
Description: 2.	On 3 March, three secondary sources reported that, on 27 February, armed Toposa youths from Kapoeta North County, shot and killed one 58-year-old male Lopit civilian in Ibahure Boma, Obonge Payam, Imehejek Administrative Area. According to the sources the assailants stormed a grazing field in Ibahure Boma, raided 25 goats and 7 calves and while escaping, they shot and killed the victim, fearing that he may raise and alarm or disclose their identity. Reportedly, the lopit youths mobilized and pursued the assailants to no avail, found the body of the victim, returned and reported the incident to the police and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Muot village, Budang Payam, Rubkona
Description:
4.	On 3 March, multiple sources reported that, on 27 February, armed Leek Nuer youths from Unity State, shot and killed one male Arab Misseriya civilian (Sudanese National) in Muot village, Budang Payam, Rubkona County. According to the sources, the assailants shot and killed the victim, whilst he was tending to his cattle and proceeded to raid over 100 goats and five heads of cattle and fled the scene. 

Comment: HRD will continue to follow-up on this incident for more updates, following the deployment of the SSPDF to the area.

Location of Incident: Wanalel village, Thiet Payam, Tonj South
Description:
5.	On 3 March, multiple sources reported that on 2 March, armed Dinka Thony youths from Manyangok Payam, shot and killed four male Dinka Apuk-Jurwir civilians in Wanalel village, Thiet Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked the Dinka Apuk-Jurwir community and opened fire and killed four male civilians and made away with over 60 heads of cattle. Reportedly, this was in the context of past and unresolved grievances and intercommunal cattle theft between these communities. 

Comment: Tension is building up between these two communities following this incident with fear of possible retaliatory violence. HRD will continue to monitor this situation for more information.

Location of Incident: Wanalel village, Thiet Payam, Tonj South

Location of Incident: Awul and Kirik Payams in Tonj North
Description:
6.	On 3 March, multiple sources reported that, on the same day, three civilians were shot and killed (one male Dinka Noi and two male Dinka Lier) and six others injured (six male Dinka Noi) in Awul and Kirik Payams in Tonj North County. According to the sources, the Dinka Lier invaded Awul Payam, shot and killed one male Dinka Noi civilian and injured three others and fled with 25 heads of cattle and in retaliation, the armed Dinka Noi attacked Kuenjur village in Kirik Payam, shot and killed two male Dinka Lier civilians burning down 18 houses. Reportedly, the Dinka Lier were joined by the Dinka Awan and Jurbol and in pursuit of the Dinka Noi they shot and injured three other Dinka Noi civilians. The injured Dinka Noi civilians were taken to a health facility in Warrap town for treatment.

Comment: HRD will continue to follow-up on this incident for more information as tension has built up between these communities in Tonj North County.

Location of Incident: Yambio Town, Yambio County
Description:
7.	On 3 March, multiple sources reported that, on the same day, personnel of the NSS arbitrarily arrested and detained two male civilians in Yambio town, Yambio County. According to the sources, the NSS arrested and detained the victims during a protest in Yambio town, when youth resisted the appropriation of a community football field by the Catholic University in collaboration with some members of the state government. Reportedly, the Catholic University colluded with some state ministries. Reportedly, the NSS also confiscated a camera belonging to a journalist who was video covering the incident.

Comment: HRD will continue to follow-up on this incident for more information.

Location of Incident: Kondeko Boma, Yei town Payam, Yei River
Description:
1.	On 4 March, three secondary sources reported that, on 2 March a soldier of the SSPDF shot and killed one 17-year-old boy from the Kakwa community in Kondeko Boma, Yei town Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, the incident happened when the victim and other civilians were returning from a funeral ceremony in the vicinity. The SSPDF soldier allegedly under the influence of alcohol, stopped them for questioning, and in an attempt to retreat, the soldier opened fire, killing the victim. The soldier was arrested and detained at the SSPDF barracks in Yei town for investigation.

Comment: it has been noted that soldiers of the SSPDF allegedly harass civilians especially at night in Kondeko area. They imposed a curfew and a fine of 30,000 South Sudanese Pounds (SSP) equivalent of six USD on defaulters as bail money after being detained.

Location of Incident: Dabur Boma, Kuda Payam, Torit
Description: 2.	On 4 March, three secondary sources reported that, on 3 March, armed Dinka Bor youths shot and killed three Lokoya civilians (aged 29, 31, and 35 and sexes unspecified) in Dabur Boma, Kuda Payam, Torit County. According to the sources, the assailants stormed Dabur Boma and opened fire on six Lokoya youths selling bamboos, killing three of them, while the others escaped. Reportedly, this incident was a revenge operation based on passed and unresolved grievances including the casualties the Dinka Bor suffered during a joint operation between the Murle community and other communities in Eastern Equatoria. The incident was reported to the Magwi and Torit police and investigations are ongoing.

Location of Incident: Nyamuon village, Thoria Payam, Koch
Description:
3.	On 4 March, one secondary source reported that, on 28 February, a 23-year-old armed Jagay Nuer youth, raped one 13-year-old girl from the Jagay Nuer community in Nyamuon village, Thoria Payam, Koch County. According to the source, the victim was accosted and raped by the armed youth in the bushes while she went to fetch water and he later fled the scene. Reportedly, the incident was reported to the police and investigations are ongoing while the victim was taken to a health facility in in Koch County for medical examination and treatment.

Comment: Since the deployment of the mobile court to Koch County, there have been no reported rape cases in the area save this incident. HRD will continue to engage the justice actors in Koch County for continuous preventive approach to justice administration.

Location of Incident: Awul, Tonj North
Description:
5.	On 4 March, three secondary sources reported that on 3 March, armed Dinka Apuk-Patoc youths shot and killed one male Dinka Noi civilian in Awul Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the victim was shot and killed while traveling on his motorcycle from Awul Payam to Akop Payam in Tonj North County for a visit. Reportedly, the incident is part of past unresolved grievances between the communities in Tonj North County.

Comment: HRD will continue to monitor these incidents for more information, following the rising tension with fear of retaliatory attacks and further violence in these areas.

Location of Incident: Badala area in Nagero Payam in Nagero
Description:
6.	Between 3 and 4 March, two secondary sources reported that on 16 February, soldiers of the SSPDF, shot and killed four male civilians in Badala area in Nagero Payam in Nagero County. According to the sources, the victims were arrested by the SSPDF in Nagero town and taken to Badala area where they were shot and killed for unknown reasons.  

Comment: HRD received this information while on mission to Bagari/Kpaile Payam in Western Bahr el Ghazal and will coordinate with the office in Western Equatoria to corroborate the facts of the incident.

Location of Incident: Gangara-Amelia residential area in Yambio town Yambio
Description: 7.	On 4 March, multiple sources reported that, on 3 March soldiers of the SSPDF arrested, detained and ill-treated one male civilian of the Azande community in Gangara-Amelia residential area in Yambio town Yambio County. According to the sources, this incident was based on an accusation by the SSPDF that the victim was a member of the Sudan People Liberation Army- In Opposition (SPLA-IO). Reportedly, the victim was subjected to ill-treatment amounting to torture as he was coerced to admitting the allegation. The Acting Governor of Western Equatoria intervened and secured his release on 4 March.

Location of Incident: Gimunu, Yei town, Yei river
Description:
1.	On 5 March, two secondary sources reported that, on 4 March, suspected armed Mundari cattle keepers shot and killed one 67-year-old male civilian from the Kakwa community in Atende village, Gimunu Boma, Yei town Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, the incident happened when the victim was watering and grazing his cattle in Atende village, after which the assailants raided his 49 heads of cattle and fled the scene. Reportedly, the incident was reported to the police and the South Sudan People’s Defence Forces (SSPDF) in the area, who have pursued the assailants to arrest and recover the raided cattle. 

Comment: HRD will continue to follow-up on the incident for more information on possible arrest of the perpetrators.

Location of Incident: Gimunu, Yei town, Yei river
Description:
1.	On 5 March, two secondary sources reported that, on 4 March, suspected armed Mundari cattle keepers shot and killed one 67-year-old male civilian from the Kakwa community in Atende village, Gimunu Boma, Yei town Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, the incident happened when the victim was watering and grazing his cattle in Atende village, after which the assailants raided his 49 heads of cattle and fled the scene. Reportedly, the incident was reported to the police and the South Sudan People’s Defence Forces (SSPDF) in the area, who have pursued the assailants to arrest and recover the raided cattle. 

Comment: HRD will continue to follow-up on the incident for more information on possible arrest of the perpetrators.

Location of Incident: Nyara village in Loudo Boma, Bur Payam, Torit
Description:
2.	On 5 March, multiple sources reported that on the same day, soldiers of the SSPDF shot and killed three male civilians (aged 21, 22, and 25 years) from the Lutoko community and wounded two others (aged 25 and 32 years) in Nyara village in Loudo Boma, Bur Payam, Torit County. According to the sources, the soldiers of the SSPDF stormed Nyara village allegedly in search of one man suspected of being a member of the Sudan People’s Liberation Army-In Opposition (SPLA-IO) and open fire on residents indiscriminately in an attempt force him out since they could not identify him. Reportedly, they shot and killed three civilians and injured two, one of whom escaped (the 32-year-old) and the other was taken to a health facility in Torit town for treatment. 

Comment: This conduct by the SSPDF represents a blatant breach of criminal procedure and a violation of the sacrosanct right to life, safety and security of the person. HRD will engage justice actors in the area for accountability by the perpetrators.

Location of Incident: Nyara village in Loudo Boma, Bur Payam, Torit
Description:
2. Location of Incident: Yod village, Melengenya Payam
Description:
3.	Between 4 and 5 March, multiple sources reported that on 3 March, armed Lou Nuer youths from Jonglei State, shot and killed one 45-year-old man in Yod village, Melengenya Payam, shot and injured one 15-year-old girl and one 35-year-old man and abducted three children (two boys and one girl) in Vivino Boma, Vulvet Payam, Gumuruk County- GPAA. According to the sources, these series of events happened during a coordinated attack on Gumuruk County by the assailants for unspecified reasons. Reportedly, one mentally challenged man was declared missing and presumed dead, while the two injured victims were evacuated to a health facility in Pibor for treatment.

Comment: Although calm has been restored, these incidents resulted in large scale internal and forced displacement of civilians and the raiding of unspecified number of cattle belonging to residents of Vulvet Payam. HRD will continue to follow-up for more information.

Between 4 and 5 March, multiple sources reported that on 3 March, armed Lou Nuer youths from Jonglei State, shot and killed one 45-year-old man in Yod village, Melengenya Payam, shot and injured one 15-year-old girl and one 35-year-old man and abducted three children (two boys and one girl) in Vivino Boma, Vulvet Payam, Gumuruk County- GPAA. According to the sources, these series of events happened during a coordinated attack on Gumuruk County by the assailants for unspecified reasons. Reportedly, one mentally challenged man was declared missing and presumed dead, while the two injured victims were evacuated to a health facility in Pibor for treatment.

Comment: Although calm has been restored, these incidents resulted in large scale internal and forced displacement of civilians and the raiding of unspecified number of cattle belonging to residents of Vulvet Payam. HRD will continue to follow-up for more information.

Location of Incident: Wunlit Payam, Tonj East
Description:
4.	On 5 March, three secondary sources reported that, 15 civilians were shot and killed (two Dinka Pawen, two Dinka Luanyjang, and 11 Dinka Pan-Juaj) and four other Dinka Pawen civilians injured (three male and one female), during renewed sub-sectional violence between the Dinka Pawen and Dinka Pan-Juaj in Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Pan-Jauj youths attacked the Ageng cattle camp in Ageng village, shot and killed four civilians (two Dinka Pawen and two Dinka Luanyjang- grazing with the Pawen) and injured four other civilians, raided 25 heads of cattle and fled the scene. Reportedly, in retaliation, the armed Dinka Pawen youths attacked the Dinka Pan-Juaj community in Mayen-Ador village, shot and killed 11 civilians including three females and burnt down 15 homesteads. The injured victims were evacuated to a health facility in Wunlit Payam for treatment.

Comment: this incident has worsened the security situation and tension remain very high with a possibility of further retaliatory violence. HRD will continue to monitor the situation for more information.

Location of Incident: Nomonichek Boma, Lokwamor Payam, Kapoeta North
Description: 1.	On 6 March, three secondary sources reported that, on 3 March, two male Buya civilians were shot and killed (aged 27 and 29 years) and one unarmed Toposa man (aged 30 years) was shot and injured during violence between the armed Buya and the Toposa youths in Budi and Kapoeta North Counties. According to the sources, armed Buya men from Napak Boma in Kimotong Payam, Budi County, invaded Nomonichek Boma, Lokwamor Payam, Kapoeta North County to raid cattle, when they shot an injured one 30-year-old unarmed Toposa male cattle herder and raided 50 of his cattle and fled the scene. Reportedly, the angry Toposa youths mobilized and pursued the assailants into Napak Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County, where they shot and killed two male Buya civilians. The injured victim was taken to a health facility in Riwoto for treatment and the incidents were reported to the Riwoto and Loriyok Police and investigations are ongoing.

Location of Incident: Keleyang, Bebuzen Payam, Likuangole County in GPAA
Description: 2.	On 6 March, multiple sources reported that, on 5 March, Murle armed elements shot and injured one civilian (working with an International Non-Governmental Organization-INGO) in Keleyang, Bebuzen Payam, Likuangole County in GPAA. According to the sources, the assailants opened fire on a vehicle transporting two humanitarian workers from Pibor to Likuangole, along the Pibor-Likuangole-Road, injuring the victim. Reportedly, the victim and the other colleague, proceeded to Babuzen and were later transported back to Pibor by the security forces, where the injured victim is receiving treatment at a health facility.

Location of Incident: Ladow village, Yuai Payam, Uror
Description: 3.	On 6 March, multiple sources reported that, on 5 March, Murle armed elements shot and killed four male Lou Nuer civilians, and injured five others (two male, and three children including two girls) in Ladow village, Yuai Payam, Uror County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked a cattle camp in Ladow village and opened fire on civilians tending to their cattle killing and injuring the victims. Reportedly, they raided an unspecified number of cattle although the cattle were recovered by the youths in Yuai Payam with the support of the South Sudan People’s Defence Forces (SSPDF). The injured victims were evacuated to a health facility in Yuai town for treatment.

Location of Incident: Marial-Muok village in Tonj Payam, Tonj South
Description:
4.	On 6 March, four secondary sources reported that, on 5 March armed Dinka Thony youths from Manyangok Payam shot and killed two male civlians (one Dinka Adoor and one Dinka Luanyjang) in Marial-Muok village in Tonj Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, the assailants opened fire on a group of Dinka herders grazing their cattle in Marial-Muok village bordering with Manyagok Payam. Reportedly, they killed the victims and raided over 200 heads of cattle into Manyagok Payam. 

Comment: tension is building up in the area with a fear of further violence as this incident is part of the cyclical and retaliatory violence and intercommunal cattle theft between the communities.

Location of Incident: Loguruny Boma, Hiyala Payam, Torit
Description: 1.	On 7 March, three secondary sources reported that, on 4 March, armed Lutoko youths from Loguruny Boma, shot and killed one 32-year-old male civilian from the Buya community in Loguruny Boma, Hiyala Payam, Torit County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked and opened fire on two unarmed male traders transporting their cattle along the Loguruny-Hiyala-Road in Loguruny Boma, killing the victim, while the other man with him escaped into the bushes. Reportedly the assailants made away with their seven heads of cattle and the whereabouts and state of the other civilian remains unknown. This incident was reported to the Hiyala police station and investigations are ongoing.

Location of Incident: cattle camp in Kar Boma, Wechkol Payam, in Uror
Description: 2.	On 8 March, multiple sources reported that on 7 March, Murle armed elements shot and killed five Lou Nuer male civilians and nine others at a cattle camp in Kar Boma, Wechkol Payam, in Uror County. According to the sources, the incident happened during a cattle raid during which an unspecified number of cattle were raided. Reportedly the Lou Nuer youths mobilized and attempted to recover the raided cattle to no avail since they fell into a coordinated ambush and were outnumbered.

Location of Incident: Wun-abiel cattle camp in Amokpiny Payam, Rumbek Central
Description:
3.	On 7 March, two secondary sources reported that, on 6 March, suspected armed Nuer youths from Panyijar County in Unity State, shot and killed one male civilian at the Wun-abiel cattle camp in Amokpiny Payam, Rumbek Central County. According to the sources, the assailants invaded Amokpiny Payam and raided nine heads of cattle from the grazing land in Wun-abiel cattle camp and in an attempt to recover the raided cattle, the lone cattle grazer was shot and killed. Reportedly, the security forces were alerted on the incident and pursued the assailants but to no avail. 

Comment: this incident is part of the cyclical intercommunal and cross-border criminal activities along the Amokpiny-Panyijar border especially with the dry season and related cattle migration activities. HRD will continue to monitor the situation for more information.

Location of Incident: Wun-abiel cattle camp in Amokpiny Payam, Rumbek Central

Location of Incident: Kuth-Bur village, Alabek Payam, Tonj North
Description: 4.	On 8 March, three secondary sources reported that, on the same day, armed Nuer youths from Unity State, shot and killed five male civilians (three Dinka Lou-Ariik, two Dinka Kongor) in Kuth-Bur village, Alabek Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the assailants invaded the area with intention to exact revenge on the communities in Warrap State for past unresolved grievances and to raid cattle, when met a group of Dinka civilians grazing their cattle and opened fire on them, killing five. Reportedly, the assailants made away with 20 heads of cattle.

Location of Incident: Alor village in Maper Payam, Headquarters of Rumbek North County
Description:
On 8 March, four secondary sources reported that between 6 and 7 March, three civilians were shot and killed during violence between the Dinka Luanyjang from Tonj East County in Warrap State, and the Dinka Pakam from Rumbek North County in Lakes State. According to the source, in the context of cross-border cattle raid and past unresolved grievances, the armed Dinka Luanyjang invaded Alor village in Maper Payam, Headquarters of Rumbek North County, and shot and killed two cattle herders and raided 30 heads of cattle and fled into Tonj East County. Reportedly, in retaliation on 7 March, the armed Dinka Pakam crossed into Tonj East County, where the shot and killed one male Dinka Lunayjang cattle herder in Toch, Makuac Payam, although they raided no cattle as they were fended off by nearby armed Dinka Luanyjang in the area.

Comment: HRD will continue to monitor the situation between these two communities as there is a high possibility of further violence.

Location of Incident: Alor village in Maper Payam, Headquarters of Rumbek North County
Description:
