Location of Incident: Saura Payam, Yambio
Description:
6.	On 7 March three secondary sources reported that, on 6 March, unidentified armed elements shot and injured one 43-year-old woman from the Balanda community in Saura Payam, Yambio County. According to the sources, the incident happened along the Saura road, when the victim was returning to her home for unknown reasons. The incident was reported to the Police in Saura Payam and the victim was initially evacuated to a health facility in Yambio for treatment and later referred to a specialized health facility in Nzara County given the grievous nature of her injuries. 

Comment: HRD will continue to follow-up on this incident for more information.

Location of Incident: Mission zone, Yei, Yei river
Description:
•	13-year-old girl allegedly raped by a 21-year-old man in Mission Zone, Yei Town, Yei River County.
On 12 February 2025, HRD YFO received and documented information from a primary source, a witness and three secondary sources, including a medical officer, humanitarian worker, and a police officer, regarding the alleged rape of a 13-year-old girl from the Kakwa tribe by a 21-year-old civilian man from the Mundu tribe in Yei Town, Yei River County on afternoon of 09 February 2025.
Sources revealed that at approximately 4:00 pm, on 09 February 2025, the victim (details on file) was left alone at home while her other family members attended church service, Yei Town, Yei River County. However, when the father (details on file) of the survivor returned to the house, he found survivor screaming and struggling with perpetrator who was raping the girl in one of the rooms. The father immediately intervened. The case was promptly reported to the police. The 21-year-old (details on file) suspect was arrested and is currently in police custody for further investigation. The victim received medical care at a local facility in Yei Town on 09 February 2025. She was provided comprehensive support, including psychological counseling and medical care. 
Comments: The swift action by law enforcement in arresting the suspect is commendable. However, ensuring that the perpetrator is held accountable through a fair trial is crucial for upholding justice and deterring future crimes. HRD YFO will follow up the case.

Location of Incident: Sopiri village, Yei Town, Yei River
Description:
•	10-year-old allegedly raped by her stepfather in Sopiri village, Yei Town, Yei River County. 
On 12 February 2025, HRD YFO received and documented information from a primary source (a witness) and three secondary sources, including a medical officer, humanitarian worker, and a police officer, regarding the alleged rape of a 10-year-old girl by her stepfather in Sopiri village, Yei Town, Yei River County on 15 August 2024. 

Sources reported that on the night of 15 August 2024, the 10-year-old victim (details on file) was together at home with her siblings and stepfather (details still missing) in the family's home in Sopiri village, Yei Town, Yei River County. The mother left the child with her stepfather while she was hospitalized. Upon her return, the child reported the abuse, but the stepfather denied it. The mother attempted to resolve the issue within the family but was advised by her relatives to report it to the police after failing to resolve the matter at family level. The mother and child visited a medical facility on 07 February 2025, where the child reported ongoing abdominal pain since the incident. The case has not yet been officially reported to the police.
Comments: This incident reflects the alarming prevalence of sexual abuse within family settings in Greater Yei. The reluctance to report the case to the authorities initially highlights the challenges faced by victims in seeking justice. This is exacerbated by societal pressures to resolve such matters internally, which can perpetuate impunity. HRD YFO will follow up the case.

Location of Incident: Rumbek town, Rumbek
Description:
On 18 February, HRD received a report from multiple sources, including the police and the civil society network (CiSON) in Rumbek town, indicating that a 17-year-old girl was reportedly subjected to inhumane and degrading treatment, including beatings and denial of food by her relatives in Cueicok Payam of Rumbek Central County. 

According to the sources, the incident occurred on 2 February when the victim’s stepbrothers reportedly tied her up, subjected her to beatings, and subsequently denied her food for reportedly resisting forced marriage. 

According to the sources, after the beatings made her unconscious, the alleged perpetrators escaped and locked her up in the house, where her father and her stepsister later picked her up in a dire condition. The victim was reportedly brought to Rumbek State Hospital on 18 February with the help of CiSON, where she is currently undergoing treatment. 

Additional information gathered from the police and CiSON indicated that the situation of the victim is terrible and that her condition requires advanced medical intervention as she is currently anemic and still unable to sit on her buttocks, that is all covered by wounds from the beatings. The police reported that the alleged perpetrators are still at large and that the police and the county authorities are pursuing them from their hideouts. 

Comments: Violence against women and girls who resist early and forced marriage is a common occurrence in Lakes State. Family members have been the primary perpetrators in such cases and have been able to escape justice and accountability. HRD will follow up on the case and advocate for accountability measures against the alleged suspects.

Location of Incident: Pibor
Description:
Initial report: Thirteen cases of suicide, and four cases of attempted suicide due to early and forced marriages reported in Pibor, GPAA. 

On 18 February, HRD received the initial report from the Director in the GPAA Ministry of Gender, Child and Social Welfare on cases of suicide and attempted suicide mostly by teenage girls in GPAA because of pressure, as a tool for forced marriage, from family members and age-set groups to get married.  According to the Director, the Ministry had traced a total of 13 girls (Verthet county -05; Gumuruk county – 04; and Pibor county – 03) and 01-woman (Gumuruk county) who have committed suicide and 04 (Verthet county – 03, Pibor county – 01) cases of attempted suicide since 2024 because of early and forced marriage. 

Comments: HRD will follow up with the Ministry of Gender, Child and Social Welfare to gather details on the above cases when they are available as no additional information was available at the time of this exercise.

Location of Incident: Mayen-atol village of Abyen-ajook Payam, Rumbek Central
Description:
On 17 February, HRD was informed by the Special Protection Unit (SPU) of the Rumbek Central Police Station that on the evening of 16 February, an adult man (name on file) raped a female minor (eight-year-old) in Mayen-atol village of Abyen-ajook Payam, Rumbek Central County, Lakes State. The suspect, who is currently detained by the South Sudan National Police Service (SSNPS) in Rumbek Central Police Station, is reportedly a family member of the survivor, and the incident occurred in the family residence. The SPU source confirmed to HRD that the survivor had been taken to the Rumbek State Hospital, where she received the required medical and counseling support. The SSNPS will continue to investigate the incident, and once completed, the case file will be transferred to the High Court for trial. The SPU indicated that the survivor’s family is following up with the police and would be ready to speak to HRD anytime for more information.   

Comment: Incidents of rape involving family members have been occurring in Lakes State; however, due to stigma and social apprehension, some of these cases have not reached the court for trial. HRD will follow up with the investigating police officer and advocate for accountability once the SSNPS has sufficient evidence to prosecute.

Location of Incident: Patiergang village under Panhiany Payam of Rubkona County
Description:
•	HRD was informed about alleged gang rape of two young Leek Nuer women by four unknown men in Patiergang village under Panhiany Payam of Rubkona County (Unity State) during the month of January 2025.

During the visit to site C IDP camp in Bentiu town, HRD interacted with two female responders (age 19 and 30, name on file) who described the security situation in site C IDPs camp as calm and peaceful. However, the 19-year-old female responder informed HRD that during the month of January 2025 (exact date not provided) two females (names provided) was allegedly gang rape by four men. The secondary source could not provide the exact date of the incident and the identities of the perpetrators, but she mentioned that she knowns and met with the victims and they informed her that they were allegedly gang raped by four men in Patiergany village under Panhiany Payam in Rubkona County (Unity State), while victim went to collect waterlilies in the area. The incident allegedly happened during the day light in area that was remote and swampy, only women usually go there to collect waterlilies during the day. The responder further stated that the victims did not visit the hospital to seek treatment, and the case was not reported to the local police by the victims. 

Comment: Since the beginning of HRD’s effort to regularly conduct monitoring and engagement activities to the IDP camp in Site A, B, and C, particularly to engage the women group; HRD continue to record occurred cases of SGBV/ CRSV as result of stepping up our engagement activities with the women group in all the IDP sites. HRD will continue to regularly engage the women and ensure that alleged rape cases encounter by women while going to collect firewood and waterlilies in swampy and remote relocations are documented and victims are encouraged to seek treatment and report the incident to the police. HRD noted that sometimes the victims just ignore reporting the incidents to the police and to the health facilities to get treatment. This could result in the miscarriage of justice for victims and lack of accountability to perpetrators.

Location of Incident: Lumuko, Yei Town Payam, Yei River
Description:
•	Rape and pregnancy of a 17-year-old girl by an adult male  in Lumuko, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County  
On  February,19, 2025, HRD YFO, received and documented information from two reliable secondary sources, the health service providers regarding the rape resulting into pregnancy of a 17-year-old girl (details on file) by an adult civilian male  in Lumuko village, Yei Town  Payam, Yei River County on the 08 July 2024.

According to the sources, on 08 July 2024, the perpetrator (details on file), from the Kakwa tribe allegedly invited the survivor to his house where he raped her. The survivor after suspecting that she was pregnant, reported the matter to one of the health centres in Yei on February 12, 2025, who confirmed the same. The matter has not yet been reported to police for further investigations.

Comment: The rape of a minor is a serious criminal offense under South Sudanese law. As a signatory to the Convention on the Rights of the Child (CRC), South Sudan is obligated to protect children from all forms of sexual exploitation and abuse. The significant delay in reporting the case may impact evidence collection and investigations. Additionally reporting the case after discovering the survivors was many months pregnant reveals serious gaps in timely reporting of sexual related offences in communities and compromises appropriate medical response to the survivor.

Location of Incident: Olikwi residential area, Nimule Boma, Nimule Payam-Magwi
Description:
On 24 February 2024, HRD followed up on a reported incident of defilement and killing of a 7-year-old Madi girl by a 32-year-old Madi man who reportedly raped and killed her in the bushy areas along the River Nile near her home in Olikwi residential area, Nimule Boma, Nimule Payam-Magwi County and spoke to three reliable secondary sources who confirmed that the incident indeed happened on 17 February 2025 as reported.

According to the sources, at approximately 16:00 hours on 17 February 2025, the 32-year-old Madi man an acquaintance of the parents of the victim came to their home and took the 7-year-old girl and her 9-year-old brother promising to buy them sweets. However, when they got out of their home, he drove away his 9-year-old brother and took the girl on his shoulders to a bushy area near the River Nile in Nimule Boma, Nimule Payam, Magwi County, where she was raped and thereafter stabbed to death with a knife by the 32 year old man. The 9-year-old boy ran back home and told his parents about what transpired along the road, but they did not take any action because of the trust they had for suspect. After about two hours, as it was getting dark, the parents of the 7-year-old girl started to worry and made calls but the man was nowhere to be found.

As intimated by the sources, the parents of the little girl reported to the police in Nimule Police Station and a search was launched, and the body of the little girl was found on 20 February 2025 in the bushy areas along the River Nile near her home in Olikwi residential area, Nimule Boma, Nimule Payam-Magwi County. A medical examination was reportedly done, and the doctors determined that the girl was raped and killed afterwards. The police also were conducting a search for the suspect, and he was apprehended at the Nimule-Uganda border area while he was escaping to Uganda on 21 February 2025, and was brought to Nimule Police Station, where he is being detained while investigation is ongoing.

Comment: HRD will continue to follow up on developments and report accordingly.

Location of Incident: Hai Zande residential area, Gudele II, Luri Payam, Juba
Description:
•	Rape of a 12-year-old girl by an 18-year-old man in the Hai Zande residential area, Gudele II, Luri Payam, Juba County, CES on 15 February 2025.

On 20 February 2025, HRD received and documented initial information from a reliable secondary source: the chief crime officer of the Gudele police division (details on file), regarding the rape of a 14-year-old girl from the Zande ethnic group by an 18-year-old man from the Balanda ethnic group. The incident occurred between 15-18 February 2025, at approximately 8:00 p.m. in the Hai Zande residential area, Gudele II, Luri Payam, Juba County.
According to the source, the survivor was lured into the perpetrator's house and raped twice. Consequently, she experienced difficulty walking. Her parent noticed this and began to question her. She then disclosed that she had been raped by the perpetrator, who is known to her, between 15-18 February 2025. On 19 February 2025, the survivor's parents reported the case to the Gudele police station, leading to the issuance of an arrest warrant for the suspect, who remains at large.
The survivor received medical assistance on 19 February 2025 at one of the hospitals in Juba, where doctors confirmed that the rape had occurred.
Comments: HRD will locate the complainant to be interviewed to corroborate the information and follow up with the investigator on the process of investigation, including the arrest of the perpetrator.

Location of Incident: Between Leer and Koch county
Description:
•	Rape of two dok Nuer girls by four unknown men on the road between Leer and Koch County around mid-February 2025

On 24 Feb 2025 HRD conducted remote monitoring to verify the alleged rape of two Dok Nuer sisters, aged 18 and 20 years that occurred around mid-February 2025. The service providers sources informed HRD that the rape victims were received in their center for medical and psychosocial assistance. They narrated that the two siters were raped on the road between Koch and Leer counties by four (4) unarmed civilian men. The source further stated that the victims suspected that the perpetrators could be from Koch County while further clarifying that each girl was raped by two men.  The source also stated that no arrest has yet been made in connection to this incident. 

Comment: HRD will conduct a mission to Leer to gather more information and get details of the case for further judicial investigation towards the upcoming mobile court in Leer County

Location of Incident: Minyori Village Lasu Payam, Yei Town, Yei River
Description:
•	08-year-old boy allegedly raped by an -old Woman Minyori Village Lasu Payam, Yei Town, Yei River County.
On February,26 2025, HRD YFO received and documented information from three secondary sources, including a medical officer, two social workers, regarding the alleged rape of an eight -year-old boy from the Kakwa tribe by approximately a 30-year-old civilian woman from the same tribe in Minyori, Lasu Payam, Yei River County on February,13, 2025.
Sources revealed that, on February 13, 2025, the mother of victim beaten his eight -year-old boy as disciplinary and a result the boy escaped to the   perpetrator’s home for safety. However, instead of protecting the child, the woman fed the children with sedatives and raped him by forcing herself on to the child. After a long search for the victim, the mother found the child crying at the perpetrators’ house due to rape. The victim was taken on February 17, 2025, four days later of the incident to one of the health centers in Yei town and received medical care. The matter has not been reported to police.

Location of Incident: Gigomoni, Yei Town, Yei River
Description:
•	17-year-old allegedly ganged raped by unidentified group of boys in Gigomoni, Yei Town, Yei River County. 
On February,26, 2025, HRD YFO received and documented information from two secondary sources, including a medical officer, and social worker regarding the alleged gang rape of a 17-year-old girl from Kakwa community in Gigomoni, Yei Town, Yei River County on February 21, 2025. 
Sources reported that on the night of February 21, 2025, the 17-year-old victim (details on file) was returning home in Hai- Nyakama, Yei Town from a social function in Gigomoni village, Yei Town, Yei River County when she was accosted by about 8 boys who forced her into the nearby bush and gang raped her. The gang group left, and the victim went home in excruciating pain and the following day on February22, 2025, went to one of the health centers for medical care.  The case has not yet been officially reported to the police.
Comments: The above incidents are a clear case of rape, given the fact that the victims were minors and unable to give full consent. It is   violation of the victims’ bodily integrity. The reluctance to report the case to the authorities including police highlights the challenges faced by victims in seeking justice. HRD YFO will follow up the case.

Location of Incident: Nyago village, Abegi, Otogo Payam, Yei River
Description:
•	14-year-old allegedly raped by a 24-year-old civilian man in Nyago village, Abegi, Otogo Payam, Yei River County
On February,27, 2025, HRD YFO received and documented information from two secondary sources, including a medical officer, and community members regarding the alleged rape of a 14-year-old girl from Kakwa community in Nyago village, Abegi, Otogo Payam, Yei River County on February 23, 2025. 
Sources reported that at around 17:00 hours on February 23, 2025, the 14-year-old victim (details on file) was returning home from a nearby market, in Abegi, Yei River County when she was accosted by the perpetrator (details on file) who dragged the victim into the nearby bush and raped her. The brother of the victim, attracted by an alarm of the victim, intervened and rescued her. The victim was brought to one of the health centers in Yei Town for medical care. The case has not yet been officially reported to the police.
Comments: The above incident is a clear case of rape, given the fact that the victim was a minor and unable to give full consent. It is   violation of the victim’s bodily integrity. The reluctance to report the case to the authorities including police highlights the challenges faced by victims in seeking justice. HRD YFO will follow up the case.

Location of Incident: Lui Town, Lui Payam, Mundri East
Description:
A male civilian raped two girls in Lui Town, Lui Payam, Mundri East County;
On February 1, 2025, multiple sources, including the police, informed HRD Yambio FO about an incident of sexual violence that occurred in early December 2024 in Lui town, Lui Payam, Mundri East County. According to the sources, a male civilian (details on file), claiming to be a member of the National Salvation Front (NAS), abducted and raped two girls (details on file), aged 14 and 16, from their homestead.
The perpetrator allegedly used intimidation and fear to carry out the attack, claiming that NAS elements were surrounding the neighborhood, which prevented neighbors from intervening. This tactic of using alleged affiliations to instill fear and prevent intervention is a grave concern, as it highlights the need for increased protection for civilians and accountability for perpetrators.
This incident constitutes a grave violation of the rights of women and girls, as enshrined in the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against Women (CEDAW) and the Protocol to the African Charter on Human and Peoples' Rights on the Rights of Women in Africa (Maputo Protocol). Furthermore, this incident contravenes the Transitional Constitution of the Republic of South Sudan, 2011 (Article 16), which guarantees the rights of women, and the Penal Code Act, 2008 (Section 247), which criminalizes rape.
Following the perpetrator's arrest, he was transferred to Mundri West County due to the absence of a court in Lui Payam. He is currently on remand in Mundri West Prison, awaiting trial. 
Comment: HRD will continue to monitor the case

Location of Incident: Yei town, Yei River
Description:
•	Rape of a 16-year-old by civilian man in Yei Town, Yei River County

On March 07, 2025, HRD YFO, received and documented information from two reliable sources including a medical officer and a psychosocial support provider about an incident of rape that took place in Yei Town, Yei Town Payam of Yei River County as indicated below.

The case involved 16-year-old female (details on file), and a 25-year-old adult male (details on file) and was reported to the police by the girl’s parents on March 5, 2025. According to police reports on statements made by the victim’s parents, the victim once cohabited with the perpetrator, and with plans of getting married. The marriage plans were strongly opposed by the girls’ family on grounds that both parties are relatives. The case was reported to the Mugo Payam customary court and it was dismissed. The girl escaped from the village and threatened to commit suicide if she is not allowed to marry the boy. 

The parents of the 16-year-old traced the girl to the perpetrators’ residence at Hai-Leben, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County and after intense interrogations, the girl revealed that she was raped multiple times by the perpetrator. The parents reported the rape case to the police and the victim was sent to One Stop Centre for medical examination. The examination reports revealed that the girl is about 16 weeks pregnant for the perpetrator. The perpetrator was arrested and kept in detention for further investigations on the case. 

Comments: The above incident is a clear case of rape, given that the victim is a minor and unable to give full consent. It is   violation of the victim’s bodily integrity. HRD YFO will follow up the case.

Location of Incident: Rumbek and Matangai
Description:
On 11 March, HRD was informed by a local community member that a 15-year-old girl was found on the road between Rumbek and Matangai in the evening of 9 March with a rope in her hand. When asked, the girl reported that on 7 March, her parents and brother wanted to force her into an arranged marriage, which she refused. Because of the level of traumatization, the girl decided to take her life using a rope. The source informed HRD that he was able to persuade the girl not to take her life and provided her with refuge from 9-11 March. HRD was able to meet with the survivor on 11 March and confirmed the incident. HRD contacted the one-stop center at the Rumbek State Hospital, where the survivor was dropped off for psychosocial support. HRD also notified the Special Protection Unit (SPU) supervisor, who visited the survivor at the center to ensure her safety and further police procedures.      

Comment: HRD observed the presence of the survivor’s family members at the one-stop center who recognized her. That encounter made the survivor cry as she believed they might take her by force from the hospital. HRD urged the family and the SPU first to ensure the survivor’s interest and follow the established protocol. HRD will notify the state Ministry of Gender, Child, and Social Welfare and the civil society network for their intervention and advocacy.

Location of Incident: Yambio Town, Yambio County
Description:
On March 10, 2024, HRD Yambio FO conducted monitoring at Yambio Police Station, uncovering disturbing details about the alleged rape of two female minors, aged 13 and 14 (details on file), by an 18-year-old male civilian (details on file) in the Bazungua area of Yambio town, Yambio County. This incident is a reminder of the pervasive sexual violence and impunity that persists in the County, particularly against vulnerable minors.

The community apprehended the suspect and handed him over to the police on March 9, 2025. According to the charge room officer, the suspect allegedly raped the two girls at different times. The parents of the 13-year-old victim reported that she was severely ill. Upon inquiry, she disclosed that the suspect had taken advantage of her on March 7 during the celebration of the anniversary of the Azande Kingdom in Yambio town.

The suspect allegedly forcibly took her to his house, where he raped her. A neighbor also reported that the suspect had raped their 14-year-old daughter at an unspecified time in February. Both female victims were sent to the hospital with Form 8 for medical examination, and an investigation will commence upon their return for further action.

This incident constitutes a grave violation of the victims' rights to bodily autonomy, dignity, and protection from violence, as enshrined in international human rights law and South Sudanese law. The alleged rapes also breach Article 19 of the Convention on the Rights of the Child (CRC), which obligates states to protect children from all forms of physical or mental violence.

Furthermore, this incident highlights the systemic failures in protecting minors from sexual violence and ensuring accountability for perpetrators. The South Sudanese government must take immediate action to investigate this incident, ensure the suspect is held accountable, and provide support and protection to the victims.

Comment: The authorities must also take concrete steps to address the pervasive culture of impunity and sexual violence in the state. This includes strengthening laws and policies, increasing access to justice and support services for survivors, and promoting awareness and education about sexual violence and the rights of minors.

Location of Incident: Yambio Town, Yambio County
Description:
•	16-year-old minor was reportedly raped by another 16-year-old boy in Yambio Town, Yambio County

On March 11, 2025, the HRD Yambio Field Office received and documented a report from the One Stop Center, which stated that on March 7, 2025, a 63-year-old woman reported a case of alleged rape involving a minor who was reportedly raped by her 16-year-old cousin in Hai Kuzee, a residential area in Yambio Town, Yambio County. According to the report, the incident occurred in November 2024 but was only disclosed to the One Stop Center four months later.

The sources revealed that the victim's uncle became suspicious when she took longer than usual to return home. When he questioned her, she admitted that her cousin had raped her. Despite this disturbing revelation, no arrest has been made for the alleged crime.

The alleged rape of the minor constitutes a serious violation of her rights, specifically her right to freedom from torture and cruel, inhuman, or degrading treatment, as enshrined in Article 19 of the Transitional Constitution of the Republic of South Sudan (2011). The incident also highlights a failure to protect children from abuse and exploitation, as mandated by the Child Act, 2008 of South Sudan.

The fact that the incident occurred within a family setting and involved minors underscores the importance of strengthening child protection mechanisms and promoting a culture of respect for human rights. The lack of access to justice for the victim and her family is also a concern, as it perpetuates impunity and undermines efforts to prevent future abuses.

Comment: The authorities must take immediate action to investigate this incident and hold the perpetrator accountable by relevant laws, considering that the alleged perpetrator is also a minor and ensuring that any actions taken are in the child's best interests. Furthermore, the government must take concrete steps to address the systemic human rights challenges in the country, including strengthening child protection mechanisms, promoting a culture of human rights respect, and ensuring access to justice for victims of abuse and exploitation while also providing support and protection to the victim and her family.

Location of Incident: Leer town
Description:
•	HRD was informed about the alleged raping incident of a-10-year-old girl by 17-year-old boy in Leer town on 04 March 2025

On 11 March 2025, during the engagement meeting with one of humanitarian protection partners on the ground, HRD was informed about an alleged raping incident of a-10-year-old girl by a-17-year-old boy. The incident happened on 04 March 2025 at the premises of the suspect. According to the source, the 17-old boy was initially apprehended by the police in Leer after the incident, but the police have reportedly released the suspects after he had allegedly paid some money to the court as fines. The case has been recorded by the police in Leer and the victim also had been taken to one of the medical providers operating in Leer and the victim is currently undergoing medical treatment. HRD appealed to the partner to engage the police and to ensure that the suspect is arrested, the case is still being investigated, and the suspect is targeted to appear before the upcoming Mobile Court. 

Comment: HRD is aware that the criminal liability according to the South Sudan Criminal Procedure Act of 2008, Act 9, Section 9 (b) Section 1, is 12 year and above, such a person is criminally liable. The alleged suspect is over 17-year-old, and he is liable to be charge for the crime he is suspected of committing .  HRD is planning to travel to Leer next week as part of the upcoming Mobile Court preparation and plans to engage the police on the case, appeal to the police to investigate and rearrest the suspect to face justice.

Location of Incident: Romula Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos
Description: 1.	On 10 March, three secondary sources reported that on 6 March, armed Logir youths gang-raped and killed one 20-year-old woman from the Dongotono community in Romula Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos County. According to the sources, a group of three armed Logir youths from attacked the victim while she was on her way from the farm, gang raped her, and subsequently stabbed her repeatedly with a knife all over her body, killing her. The victim reportedly succumbed to the severe injuries while being evacuated to a health care facility  in Chahari for medical treatment. The sources further informed that the attack was a revenge action for the shooting and killing of a 19-year-old girl and a 20-year-old Logir man both from the Logir community by armed Dongotono in Ihode Boma, Chahari Payam on 9 March 2024. [See HRD Daily Report 14 March 2024]. The incident was reported at the Chahari Police Station and investigation is reportedly ongoing; however, no suspects have been apprehended.

Location of Incident: Juet ,Yuai Payam, Uror
Description: 2.	On 10 March, multiple sources reported that on 9 March, Murle armed elements shot and killed one male civilian and abducted two boys from the Lou Nuer community in Juet ,Yuai Payam, Uror County. According to the sources, Murle armed elements attacked the victims at their homestead, opened fire on the 63-hyear-old man and thereafter abducted the two boys. The local youths reportedly pursued the abductors; however, were unable to recover the children.

Location of Incident: Juet ,Yuai Payam, Uror
Description: 2.	On 10 March, multiple sources reported that on 9 March, Murle armed elements shot and killed one male civilian and abducted two boys from the Lou Nuer community in Juet ,Yuai Payam, Uror County. According to the sources, Murle armed elements attacked the victims at their homestead, opened fire on the 63-hyear-old man and thereafter abducted the two boys. The local youths reportedly pursued the abductors; however, were unable to recover the children.

Location of Incident: IDP site in Langachot village, Pibor Town, GPAA
Description:
3.	On 10 March, one primary source and one secondary source reported that on 8 March, Murle armed elements shot and killed a one-year-old girl and injured one woman from the Murle community at the IDP site in Langachot village, Pibor Town, GPAA. The injured victim is reportedly receiving medical treatment at a hospital in Pibor. 

Comment: According to the sources, the victims were displaced from Manyloden Village, Molocthoth Payam, Gumuruk County after the attack on Gumuruk County by armed Lou Nuer elements on 3 March and were living in the temporary IDP settlement near Pibor when they were attacked.

Location of Incident: IDP site in Langachot village, Pibor Town, GPAA
Description:
3.	On 10 March, one primary source and one secondary source reported that on 8 March, Murle armed elements shot and killed a one-year-old girl and injured one woman from the Murle community at the IDP site in Langachot village, Pibor Town, GPAA. The injured victim is reportedly receiving medical treatment at a hospital in Pibor. 

Comment: According to the sources, the victims were displaced from Manyloden Village, Molocthoth Payam, Gumuruk County after the attack on Gumuruk County by armed Lou Nuer elements on 3 March and were living in the temporary IDP settlement near Pibor when they were attacked.

Location of Incident: Riak Payam, Mayom
Description:
4.	On 190 March, two secondary sources reported that on 9 March, armed Bul Nuer youths from the Chiengding sub-clan shot and killed one male civilian and injured another from the Bul Nuer Chiengnyaloth sub-clan in Riak Payam, Mayom County. According to the sources, a group of seven armed Bul Nuer youths and attacked and opened fire on the victims while they were  taking their cattle for grazing in Thahdiek village, Jocknyang Boma, Kuerboni Payam. The injured victim was reportedly evacuated to a health care facility in Mayom for medical treatment.

Comment: According to the sources, the incident was a revenge attack linked to a killing incident by the victim’s son two years ago.

Location of Incident: Riak Payam, Mayom
Description:
4.	On 190 March, two secondary sources reported that on 9 March, armed Bul Nuer youths from the Chiengding sub-clan shot and killed one male civilian and injured another from the Bul Nuer Chiengnyaloth sub-clan in Riak Payam, Mayom County. According to the sources, a group of seven armed Bul Nuer youths and attacked and opened fire on the victims while they were  taking their cattle for grazing in Thahdiek village, Jocknyang Boma, Kuerboni Payam. The injured victim was reportedly evacuated to a health care facility in Mayom for medical treatment.

Comment: According to the sources, the incident was a revenge attack linked to a killing incident by the victim’s son two years ago.

Location of Incident: Tor Pariang, Alieny Payam,  Ruweng Administrative Area
Description: 5.	On 10 March, one secondary source reported that on 7 March, one SSPDF soldier  shot and injured one male civilian (a trader) from the Leek Nuer community in Tor Pariang, Alieny Payam,  Ruweng Administrative Area. According to the sources, the SSPDF soldier from the Tor Pariang military base opened fire on the victim while he was driving a commercial vehicle enroute from Pariang Town to Bentiu Town, injuring him. Security personnel were reportedly deployed to the scene; however, the suspect had reportedly fled the scene. The injured victim was reportedly taken to Bentiu town and subsequently evacuated to Juba for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Mayen-Ador village, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East
Description: 6.	On 10 March, three primary sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Pawen youths shot and killed one male civilian and injured two others from the Dinka Pan-Juaj community in Mayen-Ador village, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Pawen youths attacked and opened fire on homesteads in Mayen-Ador village, killing one male of the residents and injuring two others, and thereafter fled the scene. The attack was reportedly a revenge action for the past violence between the two communities.

Location of Incident: Mayen-Ador village, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East
Description: 6.	On 10 March, three primary sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Pawen youths shot and killed one male civilian and injured two others from the Dinka Pan-Juaj community in Mayen-Ador village, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Pawen youths attacked and opened fire on homesteads in Mayen-Ador village, killing one male of the residents and injuring two others, and thereafter fled the scene. The attack was reportedly a revenge action for the past violence between the two communities.

Location of Incident: Bahrabik local market, Rocrocdong Payam, Jur River
Description: 7.	On 10 March, multiple sources reported that on 8 March, four civilians (one man and three women) were injured when a SPLA-IO element detonated a hand grenade in the Bahrabik local market, Rocrocdong Payam, Jur River County. As recounted by the sources, the SPLA-IO element, who also works as a commercial motorcycle operator (boda-boda rider), while seated in a nearby local teashop detonated and threw a hand grenade in an attempt to escape arrest by two armed government security personnel conducting a search in the market, injuring four civilians. The injured vicitms were evacuated to a hospital in Wau for medical treatment. A case has reportedly been files at the Eastern Bank Police Station in Wau; however, the suspect remains at large.

Location of Incident: Pazua, Yambio
Description: 8.	On 10 March, multiple sources reported that on 31 December 2024, the SSPDF arbitrarily arrested and detained incommunicado one 35-year-old male civilian from the Azande community in Pazua, Yambio County. According to the sources, the SSPDF arrested the victim  from his homestead in Masia, Yambio Town, for allegedly buying a stolen motorcycle belonging to one SSPDF Commander in Masia; however, he denied any involvement in buying the motorcycle. The victim was reportedly ill-treated by the SSPDF and subsequently transferred to the SSPDF base in Pazua, where he remains in detention without access to healthcare, family, or legal counsel.

Location of Incident: Masia, Yambio Town, Yambio
Description:
9.	On 10 March, one primary source and one secondary source reported that on 7 March, the SSPDF arbitrarily arrested, detained and ill-treated a 25-year-old woman from the Azande community in Masia, Yambio Town, Yambio County. According to the source, the SSPDF arrested the victim after her ex-husband filed a complaint at the SSPDF barracks regarding their missing four-year-old son, severely beat her up, and thereafter transferred her to Masia Police Post. The police reportedly provided the Form 8 and she was subsequently taken to a hospital in Yambio Town for medical treatment. 

Comment: According to the victim, her son went missing in February while playing with other children in the Masia area, and she subsequently initiated a search and notified her ex-husband; however, instead of assisting in the search, he reported her to the SSPDF, resulting in her arbitrary arrest and subsequent ill-treatment. During her detention, the soldiers repeatedly demanded information about her son's whereabouts, accusing her of hiding him and threatening her with further harm.

The use of arbitrary arrest, mistreatment, and incommunicado detention as a means of punishment or intimidation is a clear violation of international human rights law and South Sudanese law. HRD will follow up on the incidents for accountability of the perpetrators.

Location of Incident: Ramula Village, Ramula Boma, Chahari Boma, Ikotos
Description: 1.	On 11 March, three secondary sources reported that on 10 March, armed Logir youths from Lodou village, Ramula Boma shot and killed one 32-year-old male civilian in Ramula Village, Ramula Boma, Chahari Boma, Ikotos County. According to the sources, armed Logir youths attacked and opened fire on the victim at his homestead while he was asleep, killing him. shot and killed him. Reportedly, the assailants came looking a for the relative of the victim whom they suspected was involved in the rape of one 20-year-old woman from the Dongotono community in Romula Boma on 6 March [see HRD Daily Report 11 March 2025]. The incident was reported to the Police in Chahari Payam and investigations are reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: Likuangole
Description:
2.	On 10 and 11 March, multiple sources reported that on 1 March, one 20-year-old woman from the Lou Nuer community who had been abducted by Murle armed elements State on 28 January was recovered by the authorities in Likuangole County, GPAA. Reportedly, she has been placed under the protection of County authorities who are working with protection partners to facilitate reunification with her family.

Comment: HRD is following up with authorities and protection partners for the transfer and reunification with her family.

Location of Incident: Yambio Town, Yambio County
Description:
3.	On 11 March, multiple sources reported that on 4 March, the SSPDF arbitrarily arrested and detained four male civilians (journalists) in Yambio Town, Yambio County. According to the sources, SSPDF soldiers intercepted the victims at a security check point while they were returning home from work, ill-treated and detained them for one hour for unknown reasons. The victims were reportedly released after paying 30,000 South Sudan Pounds (SSP) each.

Comment: HRD will follow up to gather more information on the incident as well as engage  with the SSPDF leadership for accountability.

Location of Incident: Masia, Yambio Town, Yambio
Description:
4.	On 11 March, multiple sources reported that on 7 March, the SSPDF arbitrarily detained and ill-treated one female civilian near Villa Park in Masia, Yambio Town, Yambio County. According to the sources, a group of SSPDF soldiers accosted the victim at her homestead, grabbed her by the hands and legs and beat her up before taking her to their base in Masia, where she was detained, for unknown reasons. The sources further informed that on 8 March, the victim was transferred to Masia Police Station reportedly for safekeeping, and subsequently received medical treatment at the One-Stop Center for injury sustained during the beating. Reportedly, after receiving treatment, the victim was returned to Masia Police Station, where she remains in detention with no formal case was opened against her.

Comment: HRD will follow up on the report and engage with the police and SSPDF for due process.

Location of Incident: Juba city
Description:
1.	On 12 March, multiple sources reported that on 11 March, the NSS arbitrarily arrested and detained one male civilian (member of the National Legislative Assembly for Nasir County, Upper Nile State) in Juba City. According to the sources, NSS personnel arrested the victim from his home in Tongpiny residential area and transferred him to  the NSS detention facility (commonly known as “the Blue House”) for unspecified reasons, where he is being detained incommunicado without due process. 

Comment: Reportedly, the incident is part of the ongoing Government crackdown on officials of the Sudan People’s Liberation Army – In Opposition (SPLA-IO) in connection with the crisis in Nasir County, Upper Nile State. Allegedly, prior to the current crisis, the victims  had criticized the heavy deployment of security forces in Nassir County. The arbitrary arrest and incommunicado detention of the member of the legislative assembly raises serious human rights concerns, particularly violations of fundamental right to freedom of expression, the right to liberty, safety and integrity of the person, and due process.

Location of Incident: Loriyok Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi
Description: 2.	On 12 March, three secondary sources reported that on 8 March, armed Toposa youths from Katiko Payam, Kapoeta South County shot and injured one 20-year-old male civilian from the Buya community in Loriyok Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, armed Toposa youths, who were returning from a pursuit of a group of four armed Buya youths who had earlier on raided 20 goats from Machi Boma, Katiko Payam, opened fire on the victim while he was packing firewood in the bushes in Loriyok Boma, injuring him. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Loriyok for medical treatment. The incident was reported at Loriyok Police Station, and investigations ae reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: Loriyok Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi
Description: 2.	On 12 March, three secondary sources reported that on 8 March, armed Toposa youths from Katiko Payam, Kapoeta South County shot and injured one 20-year-old male civilian from the Buya community in Loriyok Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, armed Toposa youths, who were returning from a pursuit of a group of four armed Buya youths who had earlier on raided 20 goats from Machi Boma, Katiko Payam, opened fire on the victim while he was packing firewood in the bushes in Loriyok Boma, injuring him. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Loriyok for medical treatment. The incident was reported at Loriyok Police Station, and investigations ae reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: Turem village, Labarab Payam, Verthet County, GPAA
Description: 3.	On 12 March, multiple sources reported that on 9 March, armed Toposa youths from Eastern Equatoria State abducted one four-year-old girl from the Murle community in Turem village, Labarab Payam, Verthet County, GPAA. Reportedly, the local youths pursued the abductors; however, they were unable to recover the abductees.

Location of Incident: Nyonglieth (Kumagone) Payam, Alieny
Description: 4.	On 12 March, multiple sources reported that on 11 March, unidentified armed elements shot and injured four male civilians in Nyonglieth (Kumagone) Payam, Alieny County, Ruweng Administrative Area. According to the sources, the assailants ambushed and opened fire on two vehicles, one belonging to the military and another to the police with four civilians aboard, enroute from Yida Payam, Jau County, Ruweng Administrative Area Bentiu Town, injuring the four civilians, and killing one NSS personnel. The injured victims were evacuated to a hospital in Bentiu Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Nyonglieth (Kumagone) Payam, Alieny
Description: 4.	On 12 March, multiple sources reported that on 11 March, unidentified armed elements shot and injured four male civilians in Nyonglieth (Kumagone) Payam, Alieny County, Ruweng Administrative Area. According to the sources, the assailants ambushed and opened fire on two vehicles, one belonging to the military and another to the police with four civilians aboard, enroute from Yida Payam, Jau County, Ruweng Administrative Area Bentiu Town, injuring the four civilians, and killing one NSS personnel. The injured victims were evacuated to a hospital in Bentiu Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Lojulo Payam, Morobo
Description:
1.	On 13 March, one primary source and two secondary sources reported that on 8 and 9 March, suspected NAS elements abducted 24 male civilians in Lojulo Payam, Morobo County. As recounted by the sources, on 8 March, suspected NAS elements intercepted 18 civilians at various points along the Wudabi-Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) as they were traveling to a weekly market at the border with DRC. The civilians were reportedly momentarily abducted and robbed of their belongings before being released later that on the same day. Related, on 9 March, suspected NAS elements stormed Arimbe village, Yoguffe Boma, Lojulo Payam and abducted six male civilians. The attackers also reportedly beat up and harassed civilians, looted property including money, food items, phones and motorcycles, as well as accused the villagers of being government spies. Reportedly, the six abductees managed to escape at different locations and times. 

Comment: According to the sources, the incidents have triggered the displacement of over 270 households in Lojulo Payam, underscoring the growing humanitarian crisis fuelled by insecurity and activities by the armed groups.

Location of Incident: Namiraz Boma, Katiko Payam, Kapoeta South
Description: 2.	On 13 March, here secondary sources reported that on the same day, armed Buya youths from kali Boma Kimotong Payam, Budi County shot and injured one 45-year-old male civilian from the Toposa community (a cattle herder) during a cattle raid in Namiraz Boma, Katiko Payam, Kapoeta South County. According to the sources, a group of four armed Buya youths stormed a cattle camp in Namiraz Boma and opened fire on the victim, injuring him.  The attackers also seized 24 heads. The victim was reportedly evacuated to a hospital in Kapoeta South for medical treatment. The incident was reported at Kapoeta South Police Station and investigations re reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: Namiraz Boma, Katiko Payam, Kapoeta South
Description: 2. Location of Incident: Mayen-Ador village, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East
Description:
3.	On 13 March, three primary sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Pawen youths shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Pan-Juaj community in Mayen-Ador village, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County. As recounted by the sources, armed Dinka Pawen youths attacked and opened fire on homesteads belonging to the Dinka Pan-Juaj community in Mayen-Ador village, killing one of the residents. The attackers also vandalized Mayen-Ador Primary health Care Centre (PHCC) and looted mattresses, furniture and other items.

Comment: The attack was reportedly a revenge action linked to ongoing retaliatory violence 
between the Dinka Pawen and Dinka Pan-Juaj communities. se two communities. reportedly, the state authorities are planning to deploy additional security forces to the area to deter more violence.

Location of Incident: Pagueth village, Ngapagok Payam, Tonj East
Description: 4.	On 13 March, three primary sources reported that on 12 March, armed Dinka Gok youths from Cueibet County, Lakes State shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Akook community during a cattle raid in in Pagueth village, Ngapagok Payam, Tonj East County. As recounted by the sources, armed Dinka Gok youths attacked and opened fire on a cattle camp in Pagueth village, killing one of the residents. The attackers also seized 30 heads of cattle and fled with them across border into Lakes State. Reportedly, the authorities of Tonj East County are coordinating with their counterparts in Cueibet County to recover the stolen cattle.

Location of Incident: Pagueth village, Ngapagok Payam, Tonj East
Description: 4.	On 13 March, three primary sources reported that on 12 March, armed Dinka Gok youths from Cueibet County, Lakes State shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Akook community during a cattle raid in in Pagueth village, Ngapagok Payam, Tonj East County. As recounted by the sources, armed Dinka Gok youths attacked and opened fire on a cattle camp in Pagueth village, killing one of the residents. Reportedly, the authorities of Tonj East County are coordinating with their counterparts in Cueibet County to recover the stolen cattle.

Location of Incident: Ngauro Boma, Ngauro Payam, Budi
Description:
1.	On 14 March, three secondary sources reported that on 13 March, armed Toposa youths from Namoruyang Payam, Kapoeta South County shot and injured two female civilians (ages 17 and 20 years old) from the Didinga community in Ngauro Boma, Ngauro Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, armed Toposa youths attacked Ngauro town and opened fire indiscriminately at the marketplace, two injuring civilians. Reportedly, the injured victims were taken to a health care facility in Kapoeta Payam for medical treatment. The incident was reported at Ngauro Police station and investigation is reportedly ongoing.

Comment: According to the sources, the incident is connected to dispute over grazing land between the Toposa of Namoruyang Payam and the Didinga of Ngauro Payam. The motive for the attack was allegedly to intimidate the Didinga farmers and community members into relinquishing their claim to the grazing land.

Location of Incident: Ikotos and Chahari Payams, Ikotos
Description: 2.	On 14 March, three secondary sources reported that on 13 March, two male civilians were shot and killed (one 35-year-old from the Lango community and one 20-year-old from the Logir community) during violence between armed Logir youths from Chahari Payam and armed Lango youths in Ikotos and Chahari Payams, Ikotos County. According to the sources, a group of 20 armed Logir youths stormed a grazing land a grazing land in Kamosin Boma, Ikotos Payam and opened fire on the 35-year-old unarmed cattle herder, killing him. The attackers also  sized his 320 heads of cattle and fled towards Chahari Payam. In retaliation, armed Lango youths, while pursuing the attackers, shot and killed the 20-year-old victim. The incident was reported at Ikotos Police Station and investigations are reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: Ikotos and Chahari Payams, Ikotos
Description: 2.	On 14 March, three secondary sources reported that on 13 March, two male civilians were shot and killed (one 35-year-old from the Lango community and one 20-year-old from the Logir community) during violence between armed Logir youths from Chahari Payam and armed Lango youths in Ikotos and Chahari Payams, Ikotos County. According to the sources, a group of 20 armed Logir youths stormed a grazing land a grazing land in Kamosin Boma, Ikotos Payam and opened fire on the 35-year-old unarmed cattle herder, killing him. The attackers also  sized his 320 heads of cattle and fled towards Chahari Payam. In retaliation, armed Lango youths, while pursuing the attackers, shot and killed the 20-year-old victim. The incident was reported at Ikotos Police Station and investigations are reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: in Nyat Payam, Jebel Boma
Description: 3.	On 14 and 15 March, multiple sources reported that on 13 March, armed Toposa youths from Eastern Equatoria State abducted two female civilians (ages 22 and 28 years old) from the Murle community in Nyat Payam, Jebel Boma County, GPAA. According to the sources, armed Toposa youths attacked a group of eight Murle civilians (six men and two women) while they were walking from Jebel Boma Town to Nyat Payam and abducted the two women while the six men managed to escape. Reportedly, the abductees have been taken to Kuren Peace village in Kapoeta East County, Eastern Equatoria State by the abductors.

Location of Incident: Wanhalel Payam, Tonj South
Description: 4.	On 16 March, three secondary sources reported that on 13 March, three male civilians were shot and killed during violence between armed Dinka Thony and allied Dinka Muok-Apuk-Jurwir in Wanhalel Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Thony youths attacked and opened fire on Mading village, killing two civilians (cattle herders) from the Dinka Apuk-Jurwir community. The attackers also raided 165 heads of cattle and fled into Manyangok Payam. In retaliation, allied armed Dinka Muok and Dinka Apuk-Jurwir youths shot and killed one Dinka Thony civilian who was grazing his cattle and fishing in the area, during a pursuit of the armed Dinka Thony youths.

Location of Incident: Wanhalel Payam, Tonj South
Description: 4.	On 16 March, three secondary sources reported that on 13 March, three male civilians were shot and killed during violence between armed Dinka Thony and allied Dinka Muok-Apuk-Jurwir in Wanhalel Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Thony youths attacked and opened fire on Mading village, killing two civilians (cattle herders) from the Dinka Apuk-Jurwir community. The attackers also raided 165 heads of cattle and fled into Manyangok Payam. In retaliation, allied armed Dinka Muok and Dinka Apuk-Jurwir youths shot and killed one Dinka Thony civilian who was grazing his cattle and fishing in the area, during a pursuit of the armed Dinka Thony youths.

Location of Incident: Pan-Nyok Payam, Twic
Description:
5.	On 16 March, multiple sources reported that on 15 March, two male civilians were shot and killed during sub-clan violence between armed Dinka Pangok and Dinka Pancher youths in Pan-Nyok Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, armed Pangok youths attacked and opened fire on a group of Dinka Pancher civilians in Pan-Nyok Town, killing one. Reportedly, in retaliation, armed Dinka Panther youths attacked Dinka Pangok homesteads in Pan-Nyok Town and shot and killed one Dinka Pangok civilian. The violence was reportedly triggered by a disagreement that escalated into a dispute over cattle.

Comment: According to the sources, the County authorities deployed the SSPDF to the area to avert more violence. Reportedly, several arrests have been mad, and the suspects are in detention in Pan-Nyok Town.

Location of Incident: Pan-Nyok Payam, Twic
Description:
5.	On 16 March, multiple sources reported that on 15 March, two male civilians were shot and killed during sub-clan violence between armed Dinka Pangok and Dinka Pancher youths in Pan-Nyok Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, armed Pangok youths attacked and opened fire on a group of Dinka Pancher civilians in Pan-Nyok Town, killing one. Reportedly, in retaliation, armed Dinka Panther youths attacked Dinka Pangok homesteads in Pan-Nyok Town and shot and killed one Dinka Pangok civilian. The violence was reportedly triggered by a disagreement that escalated into a dispute over cattle.

Comment: According to the sources, the County authorities deployed the SSPDF to the area to avert more violence. Reportedly, several arrests have been mad, and the suspects are in detention in Pan-Nyok Town.

Location of Incident: Wau Town, Wau
Description: 6.	On 13 March, multiple sources reported that on 25 February, the SSNPS arbitrarily arrested and detained two male civilians (ages 22 and 28 years old) in Wau Town, Wau County, reportedly on the instructions of one SSPDF officer. According to the sources, the SSNPS arrested the victims on accusations of being affiliated to or supporting the Sudan People’s Liberation Army – In Opposition (SPLA-IO) and detained at the Wau Town Police Station, where they were threatened and intimidated at gunpoint. The victims were reportedly released later on the same day.

Location of Incident: Ayat Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) camp in Tambura Town Payam, Tambura
Description:
7.	On 15 March, multiple sources reported that on 14 March, an unidentified armed element shot and killed one 17-year-old girl and injured another 16-year-old girl at the Ayat Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) camp in Tambura Town Payam, Tambura County. According to the sources, the assailant entered the tent where the victims were sleeping and opened fire, killing and injuring the victims and thereafter fled the scene. The incident was reported to the police and investigations are reportedly ongoing.

Comment: HRD will continue to engage the County authorities to improve measures to protect civilians and vulnerable groups such as the IDPs.

Location of Incident: Ayat Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) camp in Tambura Town Payam, Tambura
Description:
7. According to the sources, the assailant entered the tent where the victims were sleeping and opened fire, killing and injuring the victims and thereafter fled the scene. The incident was reported to the police and investigations are reportedly ongoing.

Comment: HRD will continue to engage the County authorities to improve measures to protect civilians and vulnerable groups such as the IDPs.

Location of Incident: Lohipor Boma, Homiri Payam, Budi
Description: 1.	On 17 March, three secondary sources reported that on 15 March, armed Logir youths from Ramula Boma, Chahari Payam shot and killed one 51-year-old male civilian and injured another 22-year-old male civilian, both from the Didinga community during a cattle raid in Lohipor Boma, Homiri Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, armed Logir youths stormed a grazing land in Lohipor Boma and opened fire on the victims who were grazing their cattle in the area, killing one and injuring another. The attackers also reportedly seized approximately 800 heads of cattle and fled with them to Ramula Boma. Reportedly, the injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Chukudum for medical treatment. The incident was reported at the Chukudum Police Station and investigation is reportedly ongoing.
