Location of Incident: Motot Payam Uror County
Description: 2.	On 17 March, multiple sources reported that on 14 March, Murle armed elements shot and killed one male civilian (a cattle herder) from the Lou Nuer community during a cattle raid in Motot Payam, Uror County. According to the sources, armed Murle elements attacked and opened fire on the victim while he was grazing his cattle in Motot, killing him. The assailants also raided 26 heads of cattle belonging to the victim and fled the scene. Reportedly, attempts by the local youths to recover the solen cattle were unsuccessful.

Location of Incident: Motot Payam Uror County
Description: 2.	On 17 March, multiple sources reported that on 14 March, Murle armed elements shot and killed one male civilian (a cattle herder) from the Lou Nuer community during a cattle raid in Motot Payam, Uror County. According to the sources, armed Murle elements attacked and opened fire on the victim while he was grazing his cattle in Motot, killing him. The assailants also raided 26 heads of cattle belonging to the victim and fled the scene. Reportedly, attempts by the local youths to recover the solen cattle were unsuccessful.

Location of Incident: in Iti, Gugu Payam, Jebel Boma
Description: 3.	On 17 March, multiple sources reported that on 15 March, armed Toposa youths from Eastern Equatoria State shot and injured two male civilians (ages 20 and 25 years old) from the Murle community during a cattle raid in Iti, Gugu Payam, Jebel Boma County, GPAA. The attackers also seized 92 heads of cattle. Murle youths reportedly pursued the attackers; however, were unable to recover any of the stolen cattle.

Location of Incident: in Iti, Gugu Payam, Jebel Boma
Description: 3.	On 17 March, multiple sources reported that on 15 March, armed Toposa youths from Eastern Equatoria State shot and injured two male civilians (ages 20 and 25 years old) from the Murle community during a cattle raid in Iti, Gugu Payam, Jebel Boma County, GPAA. The attackers also seized 92 heads of cattle. Murle youths reportedly pursued the attackers; however, were unable to recover any of the stolen cattle.

Location of Incident: Makuac residential area in Rumbek town, Rumbek Centre
Description: 5.	Between 13 and 17 March, multiple sources reported that on 12 March, SSNPS personnel shot and killed one male civilian in the Makuac residential area in Rumbek town, Rumbek Centre County. According to the sources, two SSNPS personnel who were on a patrol in Makuac residential area opened fire on victim while he was returning home from watching a soccer game, killing him, for unknown reasons. Reportedly, the two the suspects have been apprehended and detained in police custody pending investigations.

Location of Incident: Abiemnom Town, Abiemnom County, Ruweng Administrative Area
Description: 6.	On 17 March, multiple sources reported that on 14 March, suspected armed Bul Nuer youths from Mayom County shot and killed one male civilian (a local chief) from the Dinka Alor community in Abiemnom Town, Abiemnom County, Ruweng Administrative Area. According to the sources, armed Bul Nuer youth attacked and opened fire on the victim at his homestead, killing him. The attackers  also seized  19 heads of cattle. SSNPS personnel were reportedly deployed to the scene, and some of the raided cattle were recovered and returned by authorities in Mayom County.

Location of Incident: Abiemnom Town, Abiemnom County, Ruweng Administrative Area
Description: 6.	On 17 March, multiple sources reported that on 14 March, suspected armed Bul Nuer youths from Mayom County shot and killed one male civilian (a local chief) from the Dinka Alor community in Abiemnom Town, Abiemnom County, Ruweng Administrative Area. According to the sources, armed Bul Nuer youth attacked and opened fire on the victim at his homestead, killing him. The attackers  also seized  19 heads of cattle. SSNPS personnel were reportedly deployed to the scene, and some of the raided cattle were recovered and returned by authorities in Mayom County.

Location of Incident: Adau village, Akop Payam, Tonj North
Description: 7.	On 17 March, three secondary sources reported that on 16 March, armed Dinka Aduet youths shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Agurpiny community in Adau village, Akop Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked and opened fire on Adau village, killing one of the residents. The attack was reportedly a revenge action connected to the ongoing sub-clan violence between the Dinka Agurpiny and the Dinka Adok-Thok sub-clans of the Dinka Apuk-Patoc section. The sources further informed that the County authorities have strengthened security forces on the ground and investigations are ongoing to apprehend the perpetrators.

Location of Incident: Ameth-Chok village, Tonj Town, Tonj Payam, Tonj South
Description:
8.	On 17 March, three secondary sources reported that, on 16 March, armed Dinka Muok youths shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Luanyjang community in Ameth-Chok village, Tonj Town, Tonj Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Muok youths ambushed and opened fire on the victim at the outskirts of Tonj Town while he was travelling by motorcycle between Tonj Town and Manyangok Payam, killing him. The incident was reported to the police and investigations are ongoing.

Comment: According to the sources, the incident is linked to ongoing retaliatory violence between the Dinka Thony of Manyangok Payam and allied Dinka Muok and Dinka Apuk-Jurwir of Wanhalel Payams, and that the victim was allegedly mistaken for a Dinka Thony from Manyangok Payam.

Location of Incident: Makpandu Boma, Bangasu Payam, Yambio
Description: 9.	On 17 March, multiple sources reported that on the same day, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one female civilian and injured six others (three males and three female) in Makpandu Boma, Bangasu Payam, Yambio County. According to the sources, a group of 16 unidentified armed elements ambushed and opened fire on a commercial vehicle carrying passengers from Yambio to Juba, killing one and injuring six others. The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in  Makpandu Boma for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Makpandu Boma, Bangasu Payam, Yambio
Description: 9.	On 17 March, multiple sources reported that on the same day, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one female civilian and injured six others (three males and three female) in Makpandu Boma, Bangasu Payam, Yambio County. According to the sources, a group of 16 unidentified armed elements ambushed and opened fire on a commercial vehicle carrying passengers from Yambio to Juba, killing one and injuring six others. The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in  Makpandu Boma for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Saura area, Yambio Payam, Yambio
Description:
10.	On 17 March, multiple sources reported that on the same day, suspected SPLA-IO elements shot and killed one pregnant 28-year-old woman from the Azande community in Saura area, Yambio Payam, Yambio County. According to the sources, the incident is linked to the victim’s husband disserting the SPLA-IO and surrendering to the South Sudan People’s Defence Forces (SSPDF) in Li-Rangu Payam, Yambio County two weeks AGO. 

Comment: HRD will follow up on the report accountability of eh perpetrators.

Location of Incident: between Diel and Woobo village, Nyilwak Payam of Panyikang County
Description: On 14 January 2025, CAD Malakal FO had a telephone conversation with Hon. Mustafa Gai, the County Commissioner of Panyikang, Upper Nile State. The purpose was to receive an update on the general security situation following the incident that took place between Diel and Woobo village, Nyilwak Payam of Panyikang County, Upper Nile State. Hon. Gai reported that the overall security in Panyikang County remained calm. However, he shared that the fisherman who went missing during the attack by unknown gunmen (see DSR 9 January 2025) was found dead on 11 January 2025 on the river side in Diel. He explained that the NUF in Nyilwak undertook the transfer of the deceased to his village for burial to prevent any potential communal tensions.

Location of Incident: Pager Boma
Description: On January 20, 2025, CAD CES received information from the Education Director (ED) of Lobonok Payam about the killing of a civilian by suspected elements of the National Salvation Front (NAS) in Pager Boma, located between Karpetto Boma and Yappa Boma in Lobonok Payam. According to the ED, a group of youth and friends had gathered for a dance, and sometime before dawn, an unknown gunman emerged from the bushes and opened fire on the crowd, resulting in the death of one civilian. Comment: CAD CES is planning a Long-Distance Patrol from 21 to 24 January 2025, to Lobonok Payam to implement PA JU2424-05: Lobonok Peace Committee Training. During this patrol, CAD CES will closely monitor the situation on the ground and inquire on the presence of NAS within Lobonok.

Location of Incident: Movo Boma of Kediba Payam, Mundri East
Description: On 21 January, CAD Yambio FO had a telephone conversation with Mundri East County Commissioner, Hon. Margret Fozia to get a security situational update and follow up on NAS and cattle migration related issues. The Commissioner reported that the County experienced relative peace before and after the festive seasons until 19 January when some armed elements aligned to NAS – TC attacked and injured a young man in Movo Boma of Kediba Payam.

Location of Incident: Yirol East
Description: On 6 January 2025, CAD Bentiu FO led an integrated DAP to Ganyliel Payam, Payinjiar County for situational awareness. The team met with Hon. Gabrial Majok Gatluak, County Commissioner (CC) of Payinjiar, Paramount Chief Mr. Gorden Chieng Mayom, SPLA-IO Area Commander, Mr. William Tei Gattot, Director of Police Mr. Samuel Tut Koang, and RRC Director Mr. Michael Marial Kel. During the meeting, the CC reported that the security situation in the area was normal; however, mentioned an incident where armed youth from Payinjiar raided 41 cattle and killed one person in Yirol East County, Lakes State, on 4 January. T

Location of Incident: Pagil Payam in Ayod County
Description: On 20 January 2025, CAD Bor FO contacted Hon. James Mawich, state minister of roads and bridges, to follow up on the alleged January 18th attack in Pagil Payam in Ayod County which resulted in two civilian deaths and three injuries. The state official, who hails from Ayod, confirmed the attack and indicated that the perpetrators were suspected to be from neighboring Nyirol County. The Ayod commissioner, who issued a statement on the incident, implicated youth from Nyirol and Uror and called on the state government to intervene and stop the violence. Comment: The relationship between the two communities (Lou of Nyirol and Gawar of Ayod) has been tense for the past few years. Peace Canal and the Peacebuilding Opportunity Fund (POF) are reportedly organizing peace dialogue between the two sides to resolve the conflict.

Location of Incident: Pagil Payam in Ayod County
Description: On 20 January 2025, CAD Bor FO contacted Hon. James Mawich, state minister of roads and bridges, to follow up on the alleged January 18th attack in Pagil Payam in Ayod County which resulted in two civilian deaths and three injuries. The state official, who hails from Ayod, confirmed the attack and indicated that the perpetrators were suspected to be from neighboring Nyirol County. The Ayod commissioner, who issued a statement on the incident, implicated youth from Nyirol and Uror and called on the state government to intervene and stop the violence. Comment: The relationship between the two communities (Lou of Nyirol and Gawar of Ayod) has been tense for the past few years. Peace Canal and the Peacebuilding Opportunity Fund (POF) are reportedly organizing peace dialogue between the two sides to resolve the conflict.

Location of Incident: Pieri Payam
Description: On January 22, 2025, the CAD Bor Field Office engaged with Mr. Thomas Lwal, the Executive Director (ED) of Yuai, regarding a fatal ambush and cattle raid that occurred on January 21. According to Mr. Lwal, suspected Murle criminals ambushed a group of youth patrolling east of Pieri Payam, resulting in two fatalities. The attackers also stole 12 heads of cattle from Yuai. Efforts by the youth to recover the stolen cattle have so far been unsuccessful.

Location of Incident: Ihure village, Lobule Boma, Chorokol Payam, Ikotos
Description: 1.	On 18 March, three secondary sources reported that on 14 March, armed Logir youths from Mide village shot and killed one 17-year-old girl in Ihure village, Lobule Boma, Chorokol Payam, Ikotos County. According to the sources, two armed Logir youths opened fire on the victim while she was bathing in a stream in Ihure village, killing her. Reportedly, the attack was in revenge for the killing of a 24-year-old Logir man and injured eleven others from Mide village by armed youths from Ihure Boma on 24 September 2024 [see HRD Daily Report 27 September 2024]. The incident was reported at the Ikotos Police Station and investigations are reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: Vulvet, Gumuruk
Description:
2.	On 18 March, multiple sources reported that on the same day, five women (ages ranging from 22 – 45 years old) from the Murle community, who had been abducted by armed Lou Nuer youths from Vulvet Payam, in Gumuruk County on 3 March, were recovered by the authorities in Pibor, GPAA. Reportedly, two of the women had escaped from their abductors in GPAA, , while the other three were released by the abductors in Jonglei. The women are reportedly receiving medical and psychosocial support in Pibor.

Comment: Reportedly, 17 children (13 girls and four boys) belonging to the three women who were released remained with the abductors. HRD will engage authorities in Jonglei and other protection partners and advocate for their release.

Location of Incident: Louthot Boma, Barmayen Payam, Aweil Centre
Description: 3.	On 18 March, one secondary source reported that on 5 March, one soldier SSPDF shot and killed a 32-year-old male civilian in Louthot Boma, Barmayen Payam, Aweil Centre County. According to the source, the SSPDF soldier opened fire during an altercation with the victim, killing him. The incident was reported to the police and investigation is reportedly ongoing. The suspect remains at large.

Location of Incident: Yabongo Boma, Yambio Town, Yambio
Description: 5.	On 18 March, multiple sources reported that on 15 March, suspected SPLA-IO elements raped two girls (ages 14 and 16 years old) from the Azande community in Yabongo Boma, Yambio Town, Yambio County. According to the sources, two suspected SPLA-IO elements attacked the victims while they were harvesting vegetables from a family farm and questioned them about their allegiance to certain two army generals and proceeded to rape them. Reportedly, the survivors were recovered by a family members and subsequently received medic al care at a hospital in Yambio Town.

Location of Incident: Jokat residential area, Kajo Keji
Description:
1.	On 19 March, two secondary sources reported that on 6 March, the SSPDF shot and killed one male civilian (a businessman) in Jokat residential area, Kajo Keji County. According to the sources, SSPDF soldiers intercepted and opened fire on the victim while he was returning from a business trip from Uganda, killing him. They also seized his property including the motorcycle and took them to the SSPDF barracks. Reportedly, SSPDF military intelligence officers traced the stolen property, arrested and detained the soldiers involved. The body of the deceased was recovered on 14 March after the confession of the soldiers on its location. 

Comments: This incident constitutes a serious violation of the right to life and highlights ongoing concerns on military accountability and the urgent need for justice and redress for victims of unlawful killings.

Location of Incident: Jokat residential area, Kajo Keji
Description:
1.	On 19 March, two secondary sources reported that on 6 March, the SSPDF shot and killed one male civilian (a businessman) in Jokat residential area, Kajo Keji County. According to the sources, SSPDF soldiers intercepted and opened fire on the victim while he was returning from a business trip from Uganda, killing him. They also seized his property including the motorcycle and took them to the SSPDF barracks. Reportedly, SSPDF military intelligence officers traced the stolen property, arrested and detained the soldiers involved. The body of the deceased was recovered on 14 March after the confession of the soldiers on its location. 

Comments: This incident constitutes a serious violation of the right to life and highlights ongoing concerns on military accountability and the urgent need for justice and redress for victims of unlawful killings.

Location of Incident: Gunyuro Boma, Ifwoto Payam, Torit
Description:
2.	On 19 March, multiple sources reported that on 17 March, one SPLA-IO element raped and killed a 20-year-old woman from the Lutoko community in Gunyuro Boma, Ifwoto Payam, Torit County. According to the sources, the incident was reported to the SPLA-IO commander in the area, who ordered the arrest, detention and subsequent execution of the perpetrator without due process. 

Comment: HRD will follow-up to gather more information on the rape and the extrajudicial execution reports.

Location of Incident: Rigebat area, Aweil North
Description: 3.	On 19 March, one secondary source reported that on 14 March, an armed Rezeigat Pastoralist from East Darfur State, Sudan shot and injured one male civilian (a businessman) from the Dinka Malual community in the Rigebat area, Aweil North County. According to the source, the assailant ambushed and opened fire on the victim while he was transporting fuel on his  motorcycle from Northern Bahr el Ghazal State to East Darfur State in Sudan, injuring him. Reportedly, the assailant was arrested by the SSNPS; however, was released shortly after. The injured victim was evacuated to a hospital in Gok Machar Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Thiet Town, Thiet Payam, Tonj South
Description:
4.	On 19 March, four primary sources reported that on 18 March, the SSPDF extrajudicially executed one 15-year-old boy from the Dinka Apuk-Jurwir community in Thiet Town, Thiet Payam, Tonj South County. As recounted by the sources, the victim, under the influence of alcohol, stabbed to death another civilian during a quarrel at an entertainment centre in Thiet Town in late January 2025, and was subsequently arrested and detained at Thiet Prison. On 18 March, SSPDF personnel, reportedly on the instructions of a senior state official, extracted the victim from Thiet Prison and transferred him to the outskirts of Thiet Town, where executed him by firing squad. The body of the victim was reportedly handed over to his family for interment on 19 March.

Comment: To-date, 12 cases of extrajudicial executions have so far been documented in Warrap State since January 2025.

Location of Incident: Wanhalel Payam, Tonj South
Description:
5.	On 19 March, multiple sources reported that on 18 March, armed Dinka Thony youths of Manyangok Payam, shot and killed one male civilian and injured another from the Dinka Apuk-Jurwir community during an attempted cattle raid in Wanhalel Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, armed Thony youths attacked and opened fire on a group of Dinka Apuk-Jurwir herders who were grazing their cattle in the Toch area in Wanhalel Payam, killing one and injuring another. Reportedly, armed Dinka Apuk-Jurwir youths repulsed the attackers who fled back into Manyangok Payam without raiding any cattle. One of the armed Dinka Thony youths was reportedly killed during the confrontation. The injured victim is reportedly receiving medical treatment at a Hospital Tonj South.

Comment: Tension is reportedly mounting between these two communities with the likelihood of more retaliatory violence.

Location of Incident: Wanhalel Payam, Tonj South
Description:
5.	On 19 March, multiple sources reported that on 18 March, armed Dinka Thony youths of Manyangok Payam, shot and killed one male civilian and injured another from the Dinka Apuk-Jurwir community during an attempted cattle raid in Wanhalel Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, armed Thony youths attacked and opened fire on a group of Dinka Apuk-Jurwir herders who were grazing their cattle in the Toch area in Wanhalel Payam, killing one and injuring another. Reportedly, armed Dinka Apuk-Jurwir youths repulsed the attackers who fled back into Manyangok Payam without raiding any cattle. One of the armed Dinka Thony youths was reportedly killed during the confrontation. The injured victim is reportedly receiving medical treatment at a Hospital Tonj South.

Comment: Tension is reportedly mounting between these two communities with the likelihood of more retaliatory violence.

Location of Incident: Akol-Awet village, Awul Payam, Tonj North
Description:
6.	On 19 March, three secondary sources reported that on 18 March, armed Dinka Jurbol youths from Rualbet Payam shot and injured one male civilian from the Dinka Noi community in Akol-Awet village, Awul Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Jurbol youths ambushed and opened fire on a vehicle along the road between Warrap Town and Akop Payam, injuring one of the passengers. One SSPDF soldier who was also aboard he vehicle was also shot and injured. The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Warrap Town for medical treatment.

Comment: According to the sources, the attack was a revenge action linked to ongoing violence between the Dinka Jurbol (and their Dinka Awan and Leir allies) of Rualbet Payam and the Dinka Noi of Awul Payam.

Location of Incident: Ndavuro Boma, Bazungua Payam, Yambio
Description:
7.	On 19 March, multiple sources reported that on 18 March, elements SPLA-IO from Lirangu Payam shot and killed two male civilians in Ndavuro Boma, Bazungua Payam, Yambio County. According to the sources, SPLA-IO elements attacked Ndavuro Boma, during which they shot and killed the victims for resisting a conscription attempt into SPLA-IO ranks. Reportedly, the SPLA-IO elements also looted livestock and foodstuff belonging to the victims.

Comment: The incident highlights the ongoing challenges of impunity and lack of accountability in Western Equatoria State. The SPLA-IO's actions demonstrate a blatant disregard for human rights and a violation of international humanitarian law, perpetuating a culture of violence and fear.

Location of Incident: Ndavuro Boma, Bazungua Payam, Yambio
Description:
7.	On 19 March, multiple sources reported that on 18 March, elements SPLA-IO from Lirangu Payam shot and killed two male civilians in Ndavuro Boma, Bazungua Payam, Yambio County. According to the sources, SPLA-IO elements attacked Ndavuro Boma, during which they shot and killed the victims for resisting a conscription attempt into SPLA-IO ranks. Location of Incident: Gangara Emilia residential area, Yambio Town, Yambio
Description: 8.	Between 18 and 19 March, multiple sources reported that on 14 March, an unidentified armed element raped one 21-year-old woman in Gangara Emilia residential area, Yambio Town, Yambio County. According to the sources, two unidentified armed elements accosted the survivor as she approached her residence while returning home from her business and demanded money from her. Reportedly, one of the attackers took the survivor into her room, raped her at gunpoint and thereafter collected an unspecified sum of money from her and fled the scene. The survivor subsequently received medical care at a hospital in Yambio Town.

Location of Incident: Mangateen IDP camp, Juba
Description:
1.	On 19 March, multiple sources reported that on 16 March, one SSNPS personnel shot and injured a 16-year-old boy in Mangateen internally displaced persons camp (IDP) camp, Juba County. According to the sources, four SNPS personnel who had gone to Mangateen IDP camp in search of suspects of criminal activities approached a tent where three boys were present and startled by their sudden intrusion, the boys fled and one of the SSNPS personnel opened fire, injuring one of the boys. The injured was transferred to a hospital in Juba for medical treatment. Reportedly, police officer responsible for the shooting was detained at the local police station for two days before being released.

Comment: The incident raises human rights concerns on the excessive and unlawful use of force by security personnel in IDP settings. HRD will follow up on the case and engage with relevant authorities on accountability of the perpetrator as well as appropriate redress for the victim and his family.

Location of Incident: Pibor
Description:
GPAA authorities recover a 20 year old abductee from Gumuruk County – the victim was abducted as a minor from Central Equatoria and was subjected to violations amounting to CRSV 
On 20 March, HRD conducted an interview with a 20-year-old female abductee from Lafon town, Lafon County, Eastern Equatoria State who arrived at the Pibor Interim Care Centre in Pibor, GPAA on 18 March. The victim informed HRD that on 27 November 2020, Murle armed elements from GPAA abducted her [then 16-years-old], her uncle, and a 15-year-old girl in Mogiri Payam, Juba County, Central Equatoria State while they were travelling to Juba city. The victim informed HRD that the abductors beat her and forced her to travel by foot to Manyloden village, Gumuruk County, GPAA where she was held until 07 March 2025 when she escaped during the attack by Lou Nuer armed elements from Jonglei State. The victim informed HRD that she was subjected to forced marriage amounting to sexual slavery and forced labour, and was beaten on several occasions while in captivity.

Location of Incident: Riek-Liec cattle camp, Malueth Payam, Rumbek North
Description:
3.	On 20 March, multiple sources reported that on the same day, an armed Dinka Pakam youth shot and killed one male civilian (a subchief) from the Dinka Pakam community in Riek-Liec cattle camp, Malueth Payam, Rumbek North County. According to the sources, the victim was in the process of executing a cattle recovery order, given by the Rumbek North County Commissioner, to recover and return cattle raided from the Dinka Luanyjang community in Warrap State. Reportedly, as the victim was explaining his mission to the armed Dinka Pakam youths in the Riek-Liec cattle camp, one of the armed youths opened fire at him, killing him. Security forces have reportedly been deployed to apprehend the assailant who is at large.

Comment: The initiative of recovering the stolen cattle reportedly stemmed from a resolution adopted during a recent peace dialogue held between the Dinka Pakam and the Luanyjang communities.

Location of Incident: Ajicuer village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj South
Description: 4.	On 20 March, multiple sources reported that on 19 March, one male civilian from the Dinka Thony community was shot and killed, and four others (two Dinka Yar and two Dinka Apuk-Jurwir) were injured during cattle-related violence in Ajicuer village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, joint armed Apuk-Jurwir and Yar youths attacked and opened fire on a cattle camp in Ajicuer village, killing one of the occupants. The attackers also seized 30 heads of cattle and fled into Tonj and Wanhalel Payams. Reportedly, in retaliation, armed Dinka Thony youths attacked and opened fire cattle herders who were grazing their cattle in the swampy area, injuring four (two Dinka Yar and two Dinka Apuk-Jurwir). The injured victims were evacuated to a hospital in Tonj Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Ajicuer village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj South
Description: 4. The injured victims were evacuated to a hospital in Tonj Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Cuei-Chok village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj South
Description: 5.	On 20 March, three secondary sources reported that on 19 March, armed Dinka Gok youths from Cueibet County, Lakes State shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Thony community during an attempted cattle raid in Cuei-Chok village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Gok youths attacked an opened fire on the Dinka Thony community in a cattle camp in Cuei-Chok village, killing one of the occupants. Reportedly, armed Dinka Thony youths repulsed the attackers who fled back into Lakes State without raiding any cattle.

Location of Incident: Yabongo Boma, Yambio Town Payam, Yambio
Description: 6.	On 20 March, multiple sources reported that on the same day, suspected SPLA-IO elements shot and injured one 55-year-old male civilian from the Bongo community and raped and assaulted one 48-year-old woman from the Azande community in Yabongo Boma, Yambio Town Payam, Yambio County. According to the sources, the SPLA-IO elements shot and injured the male victim during a forceful disarmament attempt, and they proceeded to rape and assaulted the woman by inserting wooden objects into her genitals after she disclosed her status as being HIV positive. Both victims were evacuated to a hospital in Yambio Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Yabongo Boma, Yambio Town Payam, Yambio
Description:
•	Alleged Sudan People’s Liberation Army in Opposition (SPLA-IO) Attack in Yambio County: Civilian Man Shot and Woman Sexually Assaulted in Yabongo Boma, Yambio Town Payam

On March 20, 2025, the HRD Yambio FO received and confirmed disturbing information from credible sources, including the victims, police, and hospital staff, about two violent incidents in Yabongo Boma, Yambio Town Payam, Yambio County. At approximately 1:00 AM, armed assailants from Lirangu Payam, also in Yambio County, attacked the village.

The victims, a 55-year-old man (details on file) from the Bongo community and a 48-year-old woman (details on file) from the Azande community recounted their horrific experiences to HRD representatives during a visit to the hospital (details on file) where they are receiving treatment. According to the male victim, armed men speaking Azande and Arabic demanded he hand over guns. When he denied having any gun, one assailant attempted to cut his head with a machete. Despite fleeing, the victim suffered severe leg injuries from gunfire. The assailants then looted 8,000 SSP and a mobile phone from his daughter before retreating towards Lirangu Payam.

The female victim endured a ruthless attack, suffering severe physical and emotional trauma. After looting her home of an unspecified amount of SSP, one assailant sexually assaulted her. When she revealed her HIV-positive status, the assailant subjected her to severe physical abuse, using a wooden rod to inflict further harm, including violent insertion into her private parts. The assailants fled towards Lirangu Payam as the victim cried out in pain.

These incidents constitute serious human rights abuses, including the right to life, liberty, and security of person, as enshrined in Article 3 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights. They also violate the right to freedom from torture and cruel, inhuman, and degrading treatment, as outlined in Article 5 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights. Furthermore, the attacks constitute discrimination based on ethnicity, gender, and HIV status. These violations are also contrary to South Sudan's national laws, specifically the Transitional Constitution of the Republic of South Sudan, 2011, which guarantees the right to life and freedom from torture in Articles 10 and 11, respectively. Additionally, the South Sudan Penal Code Act of 2008 prohibits torture and rape in Sections 165 and 247, respectively.
Both victims are currently receiving medical treatment at a hospital, with the woman remaining unconscious. The male victim faces an additional challenge, as the hospital administration is requesting 25,000 SSP before he can undergo surgery, and his relatives are struggling to raise the funds.

These incidents highlight the ongoing security concerns and violence in Yambio County, which has experienced a complex history of conflict and instability.

Comment: These incidents demonstrate an apparent failure of the state to protect its citizens from violence and abuse. The attacks on the victims, particularly the sexual assault and torture of the female victim, are egregious violations of international human rights law. Furthermore, the demand for payment by the hospital administration before providing medical treatment raises concerns about access to healthcare and the right to life. The government should take immediate action to investigate these incidents, hold perpetrators accountable, and provide adequate protection and support to the victims.

Location of Incident: Narus, Kapoeta East
Description:
23-year-old unarmed Toposa man assaulted and killed by Toposa youth in Narus Payam, Kapoeta East County. (Database Case Code No. UNM/25/0227)
On 21 March, HRD was informed by three reliable sources about the killing of a 23-year-old Buya unarmed man by Toposa youth in Napotpot Boma, Narus Payam, Kapoeta East County on 14 February 2025.
As narrated by the sources, on 14 February 2025 at approximately 1500 hours, a 23-year-old man, reportedly of Buya ethnicity, was fatally attacked by a group of Toposa youth in Napotpot Boma, Narus Payam, Kapoeta East County. The victim was found walking with a goat when he was suddenly accused of being part of a group of cattle thieves. Without any clear evidence or due process, one youth raised an alarm, which quickly mobilized others in the area. The group proceeded to violently assault the man using stones and sticks, resulting in his death, suggesting a possible act of collective rage rather than a justified response.  
Following the incident, two Toposa men, one of whom had raised the initial alarm, were arrested by the police, while investigations continue to identify and apprehend other suspects involved in the mob killing. 
Comment:  The incident underscores persistent intercommunal tensions tied to cattle theft in the region. Similar incidents, including retaliatory killings following cattle raids, have been documented across the State.

Location of Incident: Mapel, Alur, Jur river
Description:
•	Eight youths were allegedly arrested and detained in Mapel Boma, Alur Payam, Jur River County, by the organized forces during the Tonj South governor’s reception along the Wau -Tonj road.  

On 21 March 2025, HRD received information from various sources, including one victim, that eight male youths (aged 24–36) from the Luo tribe were arrested, ill-treated, and detained by government security forces during a public event for the reception of the Governor of Warrap State in Mapel, Alur Payam, Jur River County, near the Wau-Tonj road.

HRD interviewed one of the victims, a 22-year-old male youth leader of Mapel/ Alur Payam who recounted that on 15 March, at around 2 pm, security forces, accompanied by the Tonj South County Commissioner, local chiefs, and civilians, had gathered to host the Governor of Warrap State gathered at Jebel Mabiu area, approximately 12 miles inside Alur Payam, Jur River County, the junction of Mapel along Wau -Tonj road. The group claimed the place is the border between WBEGS and Warrap State. It is the border to Tonj. Upon arrival, the forces reportedly seized civilians’ chairs and water without consent, sparking a confrontation when local youths questioned their actions. The security personnel escalated tensions by accusing the youths of involvement in the killing of a civilian named “Marker” from Tonj and alleged affiliation with the SPLA-IO. The forces then assaulted the group and arrested eight individuals. Five youths, including a 22-year-old youth leader from Mapel/Alur Payam, were released after the Governor’s departure, while three others were taken to Tonj and detained at a Disarmament Forces facility. There, they were reportedly beaten and interrogated by the Tonj South County Commissioner on 16 March, who later retracted accusations of rebel ties, apologized, and advised them to avoid involvement in land disputes, which he stated the two State authorities would deal with. All detainees were subsequently released. 

On 21 March, HRD interacted with the Mapel/Alur Payam Administrator, who confirmed the arrests and releases of the victims as recounted by the primary source. He added that on 19 March, the Deputy Governor convened the victims to discuss to diffuse the tension. He met them with a representative from the Ministry of Local Government of Western Bahr El Ghazal State. Those authorities emphasized commitments to resolving border tensions between WBEGS and Warrap State. 

Comments: The incident underscores concern over the arbitrary arrest and detention of civilians by security forces with no clear measures yet addressing the alleged abuses.

Location of Incident: Akobo Town, Bielkey Payam, Akobo
Description: 2.	On 21 March, multiple sources reported that on the same day, Murle armed elements shot and killed three civilians (an 80-year-old male civilian, one woman, and a three-year-old child) in Akobo Town, Bielkey Payam, Akobo County. According to the sources, a group of three Murle armed elements opened fire on the victims while they were sleeping outside their homestead Bure in the outskirts of Akobo Town, killing them.

Location of Incident: Megalon village, Jebel Boma County, GPAA
Description:
3.	On 21 March, one secondary source reported that on 19 March, armed Toposa youths from Eastern Equatoria State shot and killed three male civilians and injured another in Megalon village, Jebel Boma County, GPAA. According to the source, the assailants ambushed and opened fire on a group of Murle Cattle keepers in Megalon village, killing three and injuring one.

Comment: Reportedly, Murle armed elements and armed Toposa youths are mobilizing in GPAA and Kapoeta North County, respectively, with the likelihood of further retaliatory violence. HRD will continue to monitor the situation and corroborative the reports.

Location of Incident: Megalon village, Jebel Boma County, GPAA
Description:
3.	On 21 March, one secondary source reported that on 19 March, armed Toposa youths from Eastern Equatoria State shot and killed three male civilians and injured another in Megalon village, Jebel Boma County, GPAA. According to the source, the assailants ambushed and opened fire on a group of Murle Cattle keepers in Megalon village, killing three and injuring one.

Location of Incident: Akuac village, Ayien-Amuol Boma, Turalei Payam, Twic
Description:
4.	On 22 March, four secondary sources reported that on the same day, armed Nuer youths from Unity State shot and killed four male civilians and injured three others including one woman from the Dinka Twic Mayardit community during a cattle raid in Akuac village, Ayien-Amuol Boma, Turalei Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, armed Nuer youths attacked and opened fire on a cattle camp in Akuac village, killing four of the residents and injuring three others. The attackers also seized  over 100 heads of cattle. Reportedly, armed Dinka Twic Mayardit youths pursued the attackers, and in the ensuing confrontation, five armed Nuer youths were shot and injured five, while some of the stolen cattle were recovered. The injured victims from the Dinka Twic Mayardit community were evacuated to a hospital in Turalei Town for medical treatment. 

Comment: According to the sources, the attack has heightened tensions in Ayien-Amuol Boma with the likelihood of retaliatory violence by armed Dinka Twic Mayardit youths. Whereas  more attacks by armed Nuer youths are expected as the dry season ceases.

Location of Incident: Wunlit Payam, Tonj East
Description: 5.	On 22 March, three secondary sources reported that on 20 March, armed Dinka Gok youths from Cueibet County, Lakes State shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Kongor community during an attempted cattle raid in Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Gok youths attacked and opened fire on a group of Dinka Kongor and Dinka Baac cattle herders who were grazing their cattle in the Toch area in Wunlit Payam,  killing one Dinka Kongor civilian. Reportedly, the attackers attempted to seize cattle from the camp; however, armed Kongor youths who were in the vicinity opened fire on them, forcing them to flee back into Lakes State.

Location of Incident: Nasir town, Kuich Torbaar boma in Ulang County and Kier-wan, Mandeng, Nasir County
Description: 3.	On 19 March, UNMISS received reports on bombings in Nasir town, Kuich Torbaar boma in Ulang County and Kier-wan, Mandeng, Nasir County that killed two civilians and injured four others. Reportedly, Nasir town is almost deserted. The bombing was reportedly carried out by government forces.  Comment: During the fighting in Nasir on 14 February and 3 March, between the Nuer youth and SSPDF soldiers, most of the civilians moved to Jikmir and Mandeng payams (see IDSR#33). With the continued aerial bombardment of Nasir and other counties in the Southeast of Upper Nile State, civilian casualties are likely. It has also exacerbated the humanitarian situation, as most of the humanitarian actors in these areas have moved out. Relatedly, the ground forces in Gel Achel are trying to make incursions into Ulang, as they continue to repair bridges along the Lony and Luing swamps.

Location of Incident: Nasir town, Kuich Torbaar boma in Ulang County and Kier-wan, Mandeng, Nasir County
Description: 3. Location of Incident: Kuich Torbaar, Yomding payam, Ulang County, Jikmir, Nasir County
Description: 8.	On 21 to 23 March, bombings were reportedly carried out by government forces in Kuich Torbaar, Yomding payam, Ulang County, Jikmir, Nasir County leading to the killing of three civilians and injury to nine others.

Location of Incident: Kuich Torbaar, Yomding payam, Ulang County, Jikmir, Nasir County
Description: 8.	On 21 to 23 March, bombings were reportedly carried out by government forces in Kuich Torbaar, Yomding payam, Ulang County, Jikmir, Nasir County leading to the killing of three civilians and injury to nine others.

Location of Incident: Pibor
Description: 1.	On 24 March, three secondary sources reported that on 17 March, one 20-year-old female victim of abduction was recovered by the authorities in Pibor, GPAA. According to the sources, the survivor was abducted by the Murle armed elements in July 2020 along the Lafon-Mogiri-Juba Road in Lafon County and taken to Gumuruk County in GPAA when she was 15 years old. Reportedly, she escaped from her abductors in Gumuruk where she had been for five years and was received under protective custody by the Police in Pibor Town, as well as received food and non-food supplies provided by a local NGO. Arrangements are reportedly underway to transfer her to Juba and subsequently reunite her with her family in Lafon County.

Location of Incident: Lony village, Walgak Payam, Akobo
Description: 2.	On 24 March, multiple sources reported that on 23 March, Murle armed elements from GPAA, abducted two female civilians (ages 33 and 35 years old) from the Lou Nuer community in Lony village, Walgak Payam, Akobo County. According to the sources, Murle armed elements attacked a group of Lou Nuer women, who were collecting firewood in the bushes in Lony village and abducted the two victims. Reportedly, the local youths pursued the abductors to recover the abductees; however, they were yet to return by the time of reporting.

Location of Incident: Paciec cattle camp in Tiaptiap Payam, Cueibet
Description:
3.	On 24 March, two secondary sources reported that on 20 March, one male civilian from the Panyar section of Dinka Gok was shot and injured during violence between the Wat and Panyar sections of Dinka Gok in Paciec cattle camp in Tiaptiap Payam, Cueibet County. According to the sources, armed youths from the Wat section attacked the Paciec cattle camp to raid cattle belonging to the Panyar section, and in the ensuing confrontation, one male Panyar cattle keeper was shot and injured. One of the attackers was also shot and injured. The attackers reportedly also seized 30 heads of cattle. 

Comment: According to the sources, the county authorities and security forces were able to confiscate 40 heads of cattle from the armed Wat youths as leverage to compel them to return the 30 raided cattle to the Panyar cattle keepers.

Location of Incident: Paciec cattle camp in Tiaptiap Payam, Cueibet
Description:
3.	On 24 March, two secondary sources reported that on 20 March, one male civilian from the Panyar section of Dinka Gok was shot and injured during violence between the Wat and Panyar sections of Dinka Gok in Paciec cattle camp in Tiaptiap Payam, Cueibet County. Location of Incident: Kansuk Boma, Nyepo Payam
Description: On 25 March, CAD CES had a phone conversation with an interlocutor in Kansuk Boma, Nyepo Payam, Kajo-Keji County, to monitor the general security and political developments in the area. The interlocutor reported that at approximately 8:30 A.M. today, alleged NAS forces attacked an SSPDF barracks in Kansuk Boma, Nyepo Payam. According to the interlocutor, the attack resulted in the deaths of 2 civilians, 7 NAS soldiers, and 2 SSPDF soldiers bringing the total number of casualties to 11.

Location of Incident: Kaperto and Taboki bomas,Lobonok Payam, Juba County
Description: Civilians continue to live in fear in Lobonok Payam, Juba County. On 24 March 2025, CAD CES FO had a phone conversation with the Education Director (ED) of Lobonok Payam to follow up on the security situation in the area. The ED reported that while the area is calm, a concerning incident occurred on 16 March 2025, when two civilians were shot and injured by South Sudan People’s Defence Force soldiers in Kaperto and Taboki bomas.

Four People killed in Jebelein Boma, Dollo Payam. On February 05, CAD CES FOJ spoke with the Youth Leader (YL) of Terekeka Youth Association to follow up on the security situation in the area following reports of harassment carried out by Youth from Tali and Tindilo cattle camps in Luri Payam in Juba County (Ref: CAD CES DSR 3 Feb 2025). The YL reported that the security situation in Terekeka County is generally peaceful. However, on 04 February, four people (two SSPDF soldiers and two Ladies from Mundari cattle camps) were killed in Jebeleen Boma of Dollo Payam in Juba County. In similar report, CAD reached out to the Executive Chief of Kuda West who corroborated the report and revealed that the two SSPDF soldiers were killed by suspected Mundari cattle herders who were grazing their cattle around the area. In retaliation, the SSPDF soldiers came to the area and found the Mundari women selling their milk by the roadside and shot them dead. The (EC) further asserted that some residents of the area fled to Mir Kio and Kuda in fear that the SSPDF soldiers will kill more civilians in the area. The chief also mentioned that tension remain high between the Mundari cattle camp youth and the SSPDF who are planning to carry out search operation to recover the two guns stolen from the SSPDF soldiers killed. Comments: Similar incident have been reported in Rajaf, Kworojik, Luri and now Dollo in Juba County for the same cattle herders from Tali and Tindilo payams of Terekeka county. CAD will liaise with the county commissioners of Juba and Terekeka counties and find ways to deescalate the tension.

Location of Incident: Tambura town, Tambura
Description: 5.	On 24 March, multiple sources reported that on 23 March, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one 21-year-old male civilian in Tambura town, Tambura County. According to the sources, the assailants ambushed and opened fire on two civilians traveling on a motorcycle from Nabanga on the outskirts of Tambura Town. Reportedly, the other civilian managed to escape with the body of the victim and reported the incident to the police in Tambura Town.

Location of Incident: Nyombe village Yei Town Payam, Yei River
Description: 1.	On 25 March, four secondary sources reported that on 12 March, one SSNPS personnel attacked and killed one male civilian in Nyombe village Yei Town Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, two SSNPS personnel had gone to re-arrest the victim, accusing him of refusing to pay money for his previous release from police detention, and in the ensuing altercation, one of the SSNP personnel hit the victim on the neck with a chair, causing him to fall unconscious. The victim was reportedly evacuated to a hospital in Yei Town, and subsequently transferred to a hospital in Juba on 17 March, where he succumbed to the injury on 20 March. The suspect was subsequently apprehended and detained, while investigation is ongoing.

Location of Incident: Dongota, Yei Town Payam, Yei River
Description:
2.	On 25 March, two secondary sources reported that on 23 March, NAS elements shot and killed one 17-year-old boy from the Kakwa community in Dongota, Yei Town Payam, Yei River Country. According to the sources, a group of NAS elements stormed the home of the victim in search of his father whom they claimed had deserted the NAS and injured one of their members some years back. Reportedly, the father of the victim opened fire on the NAS elements who returned fire, killing the 17-year-old boy.

Comment: According to the sources, the SSPDF has apprehended two civilians in connection with this incident. HRD will follow up on the report.

Location of Incident: Irube Boma, Ifwotu Payam, Torit
Description: 3.	On 25 March, three secondary sources reported that on 8 March, SPLA-IO elements arrested, detained, ill-treated to death one 30-year-old male civilian from the Lutoko community in Irube Boma, Ifwotu Payam, Torit County. According to the sources, SPLA-IO elements arrested the victim from Motti Boma on accusation of having poisoned and killed one 25-year-old male civilian from the Lutoko community and transferred him to the SPLA-IO base in Irube Boma, where he was reportedly coerced to admit the allegations. Reportedly, when he declined, SPLA-IO elements burnt him with plastic residue during which he collapsed and died. The incident was reported at Torit Police Station and investigation is reportedly underway.

Location of Incident: Palouny Boma, Pieri Payam, Uror
Description: 4.	On  24 and 25 March, multiple sources reported that on 22 March, Murle armed elements shot and killed three male civilians (ages 25, 28, and 30 years old) from the Lou Nuer community during a cattle raid in Palouny Boma, Pieri Payam, Uror County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked and opened fire on a group of Lou Nuer cattle keepers in a cattle camp in Palouny Boma, killing three. The attackers also raided an unspecified number of cattle.

Location of Incident: Palouny Boma, Pieri Payam, Uror
Description: 4.	On  24 and 25 March, multiple sources reported that on 22 March, Murle armed elements shot and killed three male civilians (ages 25, 28, and 30 years old) from the Lou Nuer community during a cattle raid in Palouny Boma, Pieri Payam, Uror County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked and opened fire on a group of Lou Nuer cattle keepers in a cattle camp in Palouny Boma, killing three. The attackers also raided an unspecified number of cattle.

Location of Incident: Paluony Boma, Pieri Payam, Uror
Description: 5.	On 25 March, multiple sources reported that on 21 March, Murle armed elements shot and killed one male civilian in Paluony Boma, Pieri Payam, Uror County. According to the sources, the assailants ambushed a commercial vehicle contracted by humanitarian organizations transporting 10 persons and humanitarian supplies from Bor to Ayod, killing one of the passengers. The attackers also looted some of the humanitarian supplies. Reportedly, the other civilians drove off with the remaining supplies to Pathai and reported the incident to county authorities.

Location of Incident: Paluony Boma, Pieri Payam, Uror
Description: 5.	On 25 March, multiple sources reported that on 21 March, Murle armed elements shot and killed one male civilian in Paluony Boma, Pieri Payam, Uror County. According to the sources, the assailants ambushed a commercial vehicle contracted by humanitarian organizations transporting 10 persons and humanitarian supplies from Bor to Ayod, killing one of the passengers. The attackers also looted some of the humanitarian supplies. Reportedly, the other civilians drove off with the remaining supplies to Pathai and reported the incident to county authorities.

Location of Incident: Dhomdhometh, Gumuruk
Description: 6.	On 25 March, one primary source reported that between 3 and 7 March, armed Lou Nuer youths from Jonglei State shot and killed three civilians (two women and one man) and abducted four children and two women in Dhomdhometh, Gumuruk County. As recounted by the source, armed Lou Nuer youths attacked and opened fire on the victims at the Dhomdhometh water point along the Nanaam River in Gumuruk County. Reportedly, one of the female abductees was subjected to degrading treatment and punishment, as she was forced to strip herself and walk barefooted with limited food and water for four days while being beaten with a matchet and was subsequently released at an unknown location.

Location of Incident: Dhomdhometh, Gumuruk
Description: 6.	On 25 March, one primary source reported that between 3 and 7 March, armed Lou Nuer youths from Jonglei State shot and killed three civilians (two women and one man) and abducted four children and two women in Dhomdhometh, Gumuruk County. As recounted by the source, armed Lou Nuer youths attacked and opened fire on the victims at the Dhomdhometh water point along the Nanaam River in Gumuruk County. Reportedly, one of the female abductees was subjected to degrading treatment and punishment, as she was forced to strip herself and walk barefooted with limited food and water for four days while being beaten with a matchet and was subsequently released at an unknown location.

Location of Incident: Mabor-duang village, Aduel Payam, Rumbek East
Description: 7.	On 24 and 25 March, multiple sources reported that on 19 March, the SSPDF extrajudicially executed two SSNPS personnel in Mabor-duang village, Aduel Payam, Rumbek East County. According to the sources, the SSPDF extracted the victims from Rumbek Central Police station where they had been detained for killing one male civilian [see HRD Daily Report 18 March 2025] and transferred them to their military detention facility in Mabor-duang village, where they were executed by firing squad.

Location of Incident: Rum-Kol village, Makuac Payam, Tonj East
Description: 8.	On 25 March, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Jaluau youths from Wunlit Payam shot and killed one male civilian and injured another from the Dinka Luanyjang community in Rum-Kol village, Makuac Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, armed Jaluau youths attacked and opened fire on Rum-Kol village, killing one of the residents and injuring another, reportedly a revenge action relative to unresolved grievances and past violence between the two communities. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility  in Romic Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Rum-Kol village, Makuac Payam, Tonj East
Description: 8.	On 25 March, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Jaluau youths from Wunlit Payam shot and killed one male civilian and injured another from the Dinka Luanyjang community in Rum-Kol village, Makuac Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, armed Jaluau youths attacked and opened fire on Rum-Kol village, killing one of the residents and injuring another, reportedly a revenge action relative to unresolved grievances and past violence between the two communities. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility  in Romic Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Car-Ayay village in Palal Payam, Tonj East
Description: 8.	On 25 March, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Jaluau youths from Wunlit Payam shot and killed one male civilian and injured another from the Dinka Luanyjang community in Rum-Kol village, Makuac Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, armed Jaluau youths attacked and opened fire on Rum-Kol village, killing one of the residents and injuring another, reportedly a revenge action relative to unresolved grievances and past violence between the two communities. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility  in Romic Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Kamogu Village, Lokurubang Payam, Lainya
Description: 1.	On 26 March, two secondary sources reported that on 24 March, armed Mundari cattle keepers gang-raped one 17-year-old girl from the Pojulu community in Kamogu Village, Lokurubang Payam, Lainya County. According to the sources, an undetermined number of armed Mundari cattle keepers accosted the survivor while she was returning home from collecting food items from her family garden and gang-raped her. Reportedly, the survivor was taken to a health care facility in Lianya for medical care. The incident was reported to the police; however, no suspects have been apprehended.

Location of Incident: Lolianga Boma, Hiyala Payam, Torit
Description: 2.	On 26 March, three secondary sources reported that on 13 March, armed Lotuko youths from Loguruny Boma shot and killed two male civilians (28-year-old from the Lotuko community of Burung Boma, and a 30-year-old Somali national) in Lolianga Boma, Hiyala Payam, Torit County. According to the sources, two armed Lotuko youths ambushed and opened fire on the victims while they were traveling on a motorcycle from Torit to Ikotos County, killing them. The incident was reported at Hiyala and Torit Police Stations, and investigations are reportedly underway. Reportedly, the police were deployed to Lolianga Boma to retrieve the bodies to Torit Town.

Location of Incident: Kongor Payam, Likuangole
Description:
3.	On 26 March, multiple sources reported that on 3 and 4 March, joint Dinka and Lou Nuer armed elements from Jonglei State shot and killed two male civilians, injured two others, and abducted three women and two children (one seven-year-old girl and one baby boy under one-year-old) in Kongor Payam, Likuangole County. According to the sources, joint Dinka and Lou Nuer armed elements attacked a group of civilians at the Kariyak waterpoint in Kongor Payam, killing two, injuring two others and abducted five (three women and two children). The attackers also raided approximately 800 heads of cattle and reportedly burnt down several homes. The sources further informed that two of the women who had been abducted escaped on 5 March and reported having been raped by the attackers while in captivity. 

Comment: According to the sources, on 5 and 6 March, joint Dinka and Lou Nuer armed elements attacked Karwenya, Kuthume, and Manyole waterpoints in Wuno Payam, Likuangole County; however, no civilian casualties were reported. The attackers reportedly raided approximately 900 cattle and burned down many homes. Relatedly, on 7 and 8 March, the joint Dinka and Lou Nuer armed elements attacked Lokoromach Payam, Likuangole County; however, due to communication challenges, the authorities in Likuangole have not yet received any information regarding specific violations committed during the alleged attack on Lokoromach Payam, including the number of civilian casualties or abductions. Further, the attackers reportedly burnt down approximately 3,085 homes in Likuangole County, and about 2,094 people were displaced, 1,750 of whom remain in Likuangole Town without adequate access to food, water, or shelter.

Location of Incident: Padieng-Akok village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East
Description:
4.	On 26 March, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Thiik youths shot and killed two male civilians from the Dinka Akook community in Padieng-Akok village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Thiik youths attacked and opened fire on Padieng-Akok village, killing two of the residents, and thereafter fled the scene. The attack was reportedly a revenge action linked to past violence and unresolved grievances between these two communities, despite various peace initiatives. 

Comment: Reportedly, the State authorities are planning to visit Tonj East County to engage with the various communities in conflict to de-escalate the situation.

Location of Incident: Padieng-Akok village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East
Description:

Location of Incident: Gangara Paigu, Nzara
Description: 5.	On 26 March, multiple sources reported that on the same day, unidentified armed elements shot and killed four male civilians (including in a 17-year-old boy) and injured two others in Gangara Paigu, Nzara County. According to the sources, the assailants ambushed and opened fire on civilians traveling on motorcycles in the area, killing four and injuring two others. The attackers also looted their property and fled the scene. Reportedly, the injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Nzara County for medical treatment. Security personnel have reportedly been deployed to the area to investigate the incident.

Location of Incident: Gangara Paigu, Nzara
Description: 5.	On 26 March, multiple sources reported that on the same day, unidentified armed elements shot and killed four male civilians (including in a 17-year-old boy) and injured two others in Gangara Paigu, Nzara County. According to the sources, the assailants ambushed and opened fire on civilians traveling on motorcycles in the area, killing four and injuring two others. The attackers also looted their property and fled the scene. Reportedly, the injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Nzara County for medical treatment. Security personnel have reportedly been deployed to the area to investigate the incident.

Location of Incident: Gangara Paigu, Nzara
Description: 5. Location of Incident: Pageri Payam, Magwi
Description:
1.	On 27 March, three secondary sources reported that on 27 March, the SSPDF shot and killed one 50-year-old male civilian from the Madi community, injured a 40-year-old male civilian (Ugandan national), and arbitrarily arrested and detained one 40-year-old woman from the Madi in Loa Boma, Pageri Payam, Magwi County. According to the sources, a convoy of 11 SSPDF trucks entered Loa Boma and opened fire on the Sudan People Liberation Army-in Opposition (SPLA-IO) Ashwa cantonment site and when they noticed that the latter had vacated the area, they opened fire on a nearby catholic church, killing and injuring the two male victims claiming they are SPLA-IO elements escaping from the cantonment site. Reportedly, the SSPDF proceeded to arrest, detain and interrogate a 40-year-old Madi woman and released her hours later. The incident was reported to the authorities of Magwi County and Nimule Town.

Comment: The SSPDF allegedly burnt houses belonging to the SPLA-IO elements at the cantonment site. Reportedly, on the morning of 27 March, the Chief of Loa Boma, accompanied by several elders from the local Catholic Church, visited the SSPDF barracks to request the release of the deceased man's body for burial; however, the SSPDF commander reportedly denied possession of the body. The SSPDF soldiers allegedly warned that no civilians should leave Loa Boma.

Location of Incident: Baping village, Nyuak Payam , Twic East
Description:
Armed Murle elements allegedly attack a commercial truck, shoot and kill two male adult civilians and loot their personal properties including their guns in Baping village, Nyuak Payam , Twic East County, Jonglei State

On 29 March, HRD received information from multiple sources including County officials, community leader and SSNPS in Bor that on 28 March at around 17.40 hours, a group of armed Murle elements allegedly attacked a commercial truck contracted by humanitarian agencies in Baping village , Nyuak Payam, Twic East County. The attackers shot multiple times at the vehicle that was providing support to the road construction being carried out along Canal Road in Twic East County by WFP and shot and killed two security guards providing security to the road construction company. The security guards were drawn from local armed youth from Twic East County. The attackers looted their guns and other properties after killing them. The commercial truck managed to reach back to Bor on 29 March and opened a case with the Police in Modern Police Station Bor. HRD is following up for more information.

Location of Incident: Apajok, in Ageer Payam, Duk
Description:
Armed Murle elements allegedly attack civilians travelling in a commercial truck, shoot and injure a male civilian and abduct a minor girl, in Apajok, in Ageer Payam, Duk County, Jonglei State

On 30 March, HRD received information from multiple sources that include County officials and CSOs that on 29 March, early morning at around 8.00 hrs, armed Murle elements allegedly attacked a commercial truck carrying passengers from Pajut in Panyang Payam Duk County to Bor in Bor South County, Jonglei State, in Apajok, an area between Duk Padiet in Padiet Payam and Duk Poktap in Ageer Payam, shot and injured a Dinka civilian and abducted a 17 year old Lou Nuer girl from Pajut in Duk County. The injured person was brought to Poktap clinic for treatment. The local youth pursued the attackers but could not recover the abductee. 

Comment: According to HRD sources, the same group who attacked the commercial truck in Twic East(incident reported above under CRV) may have attacked the civilians in Duk County as the incident took place along Canal Road in Duk County. Canal Road connects Bor South, Duk, Twic East, Ayod and Pigi counties in Jonglei State.

Location of Incident: Arimbe village, Lojulo, Morobo
Description:
•	Two civilian men arbitrarily arrested and detained by the South Sudan Peoples Defense Forces (SSPDF) in Arimbe village, Lojulo Payam, Morobo County

On 28 March 2025, HRD-YFO received and documented information from three reliable secondary sources,(details on file) including a traditional leader, community member and a military official regarding two civilian men arbitrarily arrested and detained South Sudan Peoples Defense Forces (SSPDF) in Arimbe village, Lojulo Payam, Morobo County on 21 March 2025.

According to the sources, in the afternoon of 21 March 2025, the SSPDF forces from Lojulo Payam barracks were dispatched to respond to the activities of the National Salvation Front (NAS) which caused the displacement of over 1000 civilians in the areas on 09 March 2025 (see HRD daily report for 13 March 2025). During the operations two civilian men (details on file) a 29-year-old and a 32-year-old from the Keliko tribe were arrested in Arimbe village, Lojulo Payam of Morobo County by SSPDF forces under suspicion of collaborating with the National Salvation Front (NAS). The 29-year-old was released on 23 March 2025, two days later after the intervention of the Payam chief. However, the 32-year-old was taken to the SSPDF headquarters in Morobo Town for further questioning and detention. The 32-year-old civilian was further accusations of harbouring looted items, which were allegedly looted NAS elements in Arimbe village of Lojulo Payam. The SSPDF is continuing its investigation into these allegations as part of their broader efforts to combat NAS activities in the region in bid to restore of peace and order.

Comments: The arrest of these civilians and the broader security situation in Morobo County continues to affect local communities. As the situation unfolds, HRD will continue monitoring and documentation of human rights violations.

Location of Incident: Mundri East town, Mundri East
Description:
•	Alleged abduction and torture of a male civilian in Mundri East County
On March 28, 2025, HRD Yambio FO received and confirmed information from two credible sources including Union of Journalists of South Sudan (UJOSS) and Mundri East County Commissioner reported a disturbing incident involving the abduction, torture, and mutilation of a male civilian from the Moru community in Mundri East town, Mundri East County. The incident occurred on the afternoon of March 27.
According to the sources, the victim was forcibly taken from his homestead by four unidentified armed elements and transported to an undisclosed location. While in captivity, the assailants bound the victim and attempted to assault him sexually. In a horrific display of brutality, when the victim begged for mercy, one of the attackers used a knife to mutilate his genitalia.
Following the ordeal, the victim was transferred to a local health facility in Lui Payam, where he is currently receiving medical treatment for his injuries.
This incident constitutes a grave violation of international human rights law, including the prohibition against torture and cruel, inhuman, and degrading treatment or punishment, as enshrined in Article 5 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights (UDHR) and Article 7 of the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights (ICCPR). The attempted sexual assault also breaches the victim's right to bodily autonomy and physical integrity.
Furthermore, this incident violates South Sudan's national laws, including Section 276 of the Penal Code Act, 2008, which criminalizes torture, and Section 247, which prohibits sexual assault.
The incident highlights the ongoing concerns about the safety and security of civilians in the area. It underscores the need for the government to take concrete steps to prevent such incidents, investigate and prosecute those responsible, and provide reparations to the victims.
Comment: This incident demonstrates a blatant disregard for human dignity and the fundamental rights of civilians. The use of torture, sexual violence, and mutilation as a means of inflicting harm and instilling fear is a reprehensible act that warrants swift condemnation and action. The South Sudanese government must take immediate measures to investigate this incident, hold perpetrators accountable, and provide adequate reparations and support to the victim. Moreover, the government must take proactive steps to prevent such incidents from occurring in the future, including strengthening its justice system, promoting accountability, and protecting the rights of all civilians.

Location of Incident: Jikmir, Nasir
Description:
Sequence of the Attack – 16 to 25 March 2025
Date	Location	Incident Description	Impact / Casualties	Remarks
16-20 March	Ulang, Nasir, Jikmir Counties	Continuous bombardments by government forces.	Civilian distress, infrastructure damage.	continuing the aerial campaign. Escalating tension.
19 March	Nasir town	Bombing at 03:30 am. Hai Pur residential, Wathwaar hospital, and Nasir market impacted. Antonov bomb fell in airstrip. 	2 civilians killed; 2 women wounded.	High civilian risk. 
19 March	Kuich, Ulang County	Gunship attack. 	1 child injured.	Civilian impact.
21 March	Kuich Torbaar, Yomding Payam, Ulang	Bombing at 08:15 hrs by Antonov aircraft.	Damage reported.	Start of a heavy attack day.
21 March	Kuich Payam, Ulang	Gunship attack at 09:15 hrs set village on fire.	1 adult male killed.	Intensified air attacks.
21 March	Kuich Torbaar, Ulang	Second bombing at 20:00 hrs causing fire.	1 killed, 9 injured (including women and children) treated at Ulang health facility.	High civilian impact.
21 March	Kuerrenga & Mandeng, Nasir County	Gunships sighted overhead.	No casualties reported.	Aerial presence noted.
22 March	Jikmir, Nasir County	Bombing at 14:10 hrs by Antonov.	1 humanitarian worker killed; livestock destroyed.	Near Ethiopian border.
22 March	Malakal	SSPDF/Agwelek barge arrived with personnel and arms.	Purpose unclears.	Possible reinforcement.
22 March	Ulang-Baliet border	Reports of White Army (WA) gathering to possibly attack Malakal.	Escalating threat perception.	Rising risk of inter-communal violence.
23 March	Jikmir, Nasir County	Bombardment at 09:10 hrs.	Casualties undetermined.	Continued aerial strikes.
20-23 March	Gel Achel, Malakal	Arrival of SSPDF reinforcements and Dinka militia from Melut and Palouch.	Increased military presence.	Civilians began fleeing Malakal fearing violence.
24 March	Upper Nile State	First day without bombing since 16 March.	Temporary calm.	Possible operational pause or regrouping.
24 March	Renk, Akoka, Melut, Malakal	SSPDF requested Shilluk (Agwelek) and Dinka militias to join ground offensive.	Over 1,400 SSPDF troops gathered in Gel Achel. Potential ethnic alignment in the conflict.	Raises risks to PoC site in Malakal.
24 March	Wunaliet (SPLA-IO base)	Bombing by UPDF and SSPDF - major escalation.	SPLA-IO targeted. Turning point in the conflict.	External involvement (UPDF) suggests the conflict risks becoming a state-level war.
25 March	Nyatot village, Jikmir Payam, Nasir	Bombed at 09:40 hrs by Antonov. SPLA-IO previously stationed here.	Possible casualties, unconfirmed.	SPLA-IO maintains minimal presence. Attack marks serious escalation.
The ongoing conflict in Upper Nile State is showing alarming signs of ethnic militarization, as both Dinka and Shilluk militias are being mobilized. This development risks deepening the conflict along ethnic lines and significantly increases the threat to Protection of Civilians (PoC) sites, particularly in Malakal. Adding to the complexity, the involvement of external factors such as the Uganda People’s Defense Forces (UPDF) marks a dangerous escalation, raising concerns about the potential internationalization of the conflict. Furthermore, the fighting is no longer confined to Nasir but has expanded to involve the SPLA-IO, signaling a possible shift toward a broader regional confrontation that could trigger a national crisis. As a result, civilians are increasingly at risk, with reports of Nuer populations fleeing Malakal due to fears of ethnic reprisals, further exacerbating the humanitarian situation in the region.

Location of Incident: Wunlit and Palieng Payams, Tonj East
Description:
7.	On 11 April, during a follow up on the incident in which 195 civilians were shot and killed and 60 others were injured during cattle-related and retaliatory violence between allied armed Dinka Luanyjang-Dinka Pan-Juaj youths and armed Dinka Jaluau youths in Wunlit and Palieng Payams, Tonj East County [see HRD Daily Report 7 April 2025], multiple sources confirmed that 224 civilians were shot and killed (189 Dinka Luanyjang including 13 women and three boys, 23 Dinka Jaluau including three women and three girls and 10 men, 11 Dinka Pan-Juaj, and one Dinka Lou-Paher). According to the sources, the bodies of 19 male Dinka Luanyjang civilians were found with bullet wounds in Makuac Payam where the retaliatory attacks by the armed Dinka Jaluau youths occurred. Reportedly, additional 10 bodies of Dinka Jaluau civilians (one woman, two girls and seven men) were found with bullet wounds in Bul-Ayuel village in Wunlit Payam where the initial attack by the armed Dinka Luanyjang youths occurred.

4.	On 31 March, multiple sources reported that on 29 March, 36 civilians were shot and killed (24 Dinka Luanyjang including three women, eight Dinka Jaluau including two women and one girl, and four male Dinka Pan-Juaj) and 60 others were injured (12 Dinka Jaluau men, 10 Dinka Pan-Juaj men; and 38 Dinka Luanyjang including five women and three girls) during cattle-related and retaliatory violence between allied armed Dinka Luanyjang-Dinka Pan-Juaj youths and armed Dinka Jaluau youths in Wunlit and Palieng Payams, Tonj East County. According to the sources, joint armed Dinka Luanyjang and Dinka Pan-Juaj youths attacked and opened fire on Bul-Ayuel and Maper villages in Wunlit Payam, killing eight Dinka Jaluau civilians (two women and one girl) and injured 12 Dinka Jaluau male civilians. In retaliation, armed Dinka Jaluau youths attacked the Pan-Juaj community in Mayen-Ador village, Wunlit Payam and the Luanyjang community in Rumabuth village, Palieng Payam, killing 24 Dinka Luanyjang civilians including three women and four Pan-Juaj male civilians and injuring 10 Dinka Pan-Juaj male civilians and 38 Dinka Luanyjang civilians including five women and three girls. Reportedly, the injured Dinka Jaluau civilians were evacuated to a health care facility in Wunlit Payam, while the injured Dinka Luanyjang and Dinka Pan-Juaj civilians were evacuated to health care facilities in Romic and Palieng town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Ayien village, Turalei Payam, Twic
Description: 5.	On31 March, three secondary sources reported that on 28 March, armed Nuer youths from Unity State shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Twic Mayardit community during an attempted cattle raid in Ayien village, Turalei Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, armed Nuer youths attacked and opened fire on Ayien village, killing one civilian. in a cross-border cattle raid attempt, opened fire and killed the victim. The attackers were reportedly repulsed by the local armed Dinka Twic Mayardit youths and fled back across into Unity State without raiding any cattle. reportedly, in the ensuing confrontation, seven armed Nuer youths were shot and killed.

Location of Incident: Madiath village, Kirik Payam, Tonj North
Description: 6.	On 31 March, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Leir youths from Kirik Payam shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Noi community in Madiath village, Kirik Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Leir youths ambushed and opened fire on the victim and two personnel of the South Sudan National Police Service (SSNPS) while they were executing a cattle recovery order in Madiath village, killing them. Reportedly, the attackers also seized the recovered cattle and fled with them.

Location of Incident: Madiath village, Kirik Payam, Tonj North
Description: 6.
