Location of Incident: Bazungua residential area in Yambio Town, Yambio
Description: 8.	On 28 March, one primary source reported that on 20 March, unidentified armed elements raped and illtreated one 42-year-old woman in Bazungua residential area in Yambio Town, Yambio County. As recounted by the source, a group of four unidentified armed elements broke into the victim’s home where she was with her husband, captured and tied her to a tree outside, while her  husband managed to escape. Reportedly, one of the armed elements proceeded to rape the victim while restrained, and thereafter inserted a stick into her genitals, leaving the victim unconscious. The attackers also reportedly looted their property. The victim was taken to a health care facility in Yambio Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Juba city
Description: 1.	On 1 April, multiple sources reported that on 30 March, government security forces, arbitrarily arrested, detained and illtreated one male civilian (an activist) in Juba City, Juba County. According to the sources, the security forces opened fire on the victim’s car, severely beat him up and detained him at the Giada Military Detention Centre in Juba City, for unclear reasons. The victim was reportedly released the following day.

Location of Incident: Arimbe Village, Lujulo Payam, Morobo
Description:
2.	On 1 April, three secondary sources reported that on 21 March, NAS elements abducted six civilians (two men and four women) from the Keliko community in Arimbe Village, Lujulo Payam, Morobo County, and transferred them to an unknown location. According to the sources, the motive for the abductions is unclear; however, that the NAS has been known to target civilians in Lujulo Payam for recruitment into their ranks. Reportedly, the authorities dispatched the South Sudan People’s Defence Forces (SSPDF) to recover the abductees to no avail.

Comment: According to the sources, the abductions have heightened fear and distress among the residents of Arimbe Village. The local community has reportedly raised concerns about the rising levels of violence and the inability of security forces to adequately protect civilians from attacks by armed groups.

Location of Incident: Lokipo Boma, Ngarich Payam, Budi
Description: 3.	On 1 April, three secondary sources reported that on 24 March, armed Logir youths from Chahari Payam, Ikotos County shot and killed one 40-year-old male civilian and injured another 27-year-old male civilian from the Didinga community in Lokipo Boma, Ngarich Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, a group of 10 armed Logir youths attacked  and opened fire on a group of Didinga cattle herders, killing one. The attackers also seized over 700 heads of cattle and fled the scene. Reportedly, the local youths pursued the armed Logir youths; however, were unable to recover any of the stolen cattle. The incident was reported to the Chukudum Police Station, and investigations are reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: GPAA
Description: 4.	On 1 April, one 6-year-old boy from Kudo Payam, Torit County and a 15-year-old girl from Lafon County, who were abducted in February 2025 and 2020, respectively, by Murle armed elements and recovered by authorities in Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA), were reunited with their families by the authorities in Eastern Equatoria State (EES) in Torit. The recovery and reunification of the children marked a significant step in ongoing efforts to address child abduction and promote reconciliation between the communities involved.

Location of Incident: Burmath village, Nyandit Payam, Akobo
Description: 5.	On 1 April, multiple sources reported that on 28 March, suspected Murle armed elements shot and killed three boys (ages between 14 and 16 years old) from the Lou Nuer community in Burmath village, Nyandit Payam, Akobo County. According to the sources, assailants attacked the victims while they were traveling by canoe from Akobo town to Burmath for fishing, killing them. Reportedly, Lou Nuer youths who were on patrol discovered the bodies with one of the boys inside the canoe, while the other two bodies were found on the ground in the nearby area.

Location of Incident: Malek Payam, Rumbek Centre
Description:
6.	On 1 April, multiple sources reported that on 29 March, joint armed Dinka Kongor and Dinka Pagok youths of the Dinka Gok section from Duony Payam, Cueibet County shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Agaar community during an attempted cattle raid in Malek Payam, Rumbek Centre County. Reportedly, the security forces were deployed to Duony Payam and arrested and detained in proxy seven civilians alleged to be family members of the perpetrators. The sources further informed that the authorities confiscated some cattle from the community for blood compensation.

Comment: HRD will engage with the County authorities for the release of the detained civilians, as proxy and arbitrary arrest and detention, regardless of the justification, constitutes a violation of fundamental human rights and freedoms.

Location of Incident: Marial-Lou Payam, Tonj North
Description:
7.	On 1 April, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, an armed Dinka Lou-Paher youth stabbed and injured one male civilian from the Dinka Luanyjang community in Marial-Lou Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the assailant intercepted the victim while he was traveling on a motorcycle, stabbed him with a dagger and thereafter fled the scene. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Palieng Payam for medical treatment.

Comment: According to the sources, the attack was in revenge for the killing of the Lou-Paher civilian during the attack on the Dinka Jaluau community by the allied armed Dinka Luanyjang and Dinka Pan-Juaj youths on 29 March 2025 [see paragraph 9 below].

Location of Incident: Padeng village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj South
Description:
8.	On 1 April, multiple sources reported that on 30 March, armed Dinka Apuk-Jurwir youths from Thiet Payam shot and killed two male civilians and injured another from the Dinka Thony community in Padeng village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, armed Apuk-Jurwir youths attacked and opened fire on Padeng village, killing two of the residents and injuring another. Reportedly, three armed Apuk-Jurwir youths were shot and injured in the ensuing confrontation with armed Dinka Thony youths. The injured Dinka Thony victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Tonj Town for medical treatment. 

Comment: The attack was reportedly a revenge action in relation to recent violence between the Dinka Apuk-Jurwir and Dinka Thony communities [see HRD Daily Reports of 17, 20 and 21 March 2025].

Location of Incident: Padeng village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj South
Description:
8.	On 1 April, multiple sources reported that on 30 March, armed Dinka Apuk-Jurwir youths from Thiet Payam shot and killed two male civilians and injured another from the Dinka Thony community in Padeng village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, armed Apuk-Jurwir youths attacked and opened fire on Padeng village, killing two of the residents and injuring another. Reportedly, three armed Apuk-Jurwir youths were shot and injured in the ensuing confrontation with armed Dinka Thony youths. The injured Dinka Thony victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Tonj Town for medical treatment. 

Comment: The attack was reportedly a revenge action in relation to recent violence between the Dinka Apuk-Jurwir and Dinka Thony communities [see HRD Daily Reports of 17, 20 and 21 March 2025].

Location of Incident: Chotjok village of Guit
Description:
HRD gathered allegation of sexual violence affecting four females supposedly perpetrated by men in military attire in Chotjok village of Guit County

On 06 March 2025, HRD conducted a joint monitoring of the security and human rights situation in the IDP sites D and E with UNMO, GHANA FPU, GHANBAT, HRD and UNPOL. During the monitoring, HRD was informed of the alleged rape of four females by four men dressed in military attire. The informants described that the incident occurred last week (precise date not provided). 

Comment: HRD will follow up and to verify this rape allegation.

Location of Incident: Bazungua area, Yambio Town, Yambio
Description:
•	Two minors were reportedly raped by another minor in the Bazungua area, Yambio Town, Yambio County

On March 12, 2025, the HRD Yambio FO received and documented a report from the one-stop center regarding an alleged rape incident involving two minors, aged 12 and 14, (details on file) who were reportedly raped by a 13-year-old minor (details on file) in Bazungua, Yambio Town, Yambio County. The incident allegedly occurred sometime in February 2025 and was reported to the one-stop center on March 7, 2025.

The fact that both the victims and the alleged perpetrator are minors raises concerns about criminal responsibility and emphasizes the need for protection and support for the victims. The location of the incident, Bazungua, may indicate inadequate protection and supervision for children in the area.

Rape is a serious violation of human rights and can cause severe physical and emotional trauma to the victims. Ensuring that the victims receive appropriate support and protection and that the alleged perpetrator is held accountable for their actions is essential. 

These alleged rape cases raise serious concerns about the protection of children's rights in the state. The Convention on the Rights of the Child and the African Charter on the Rights and Welfare of the Child obligate states to ensure children's protection from all forms of violence, including sexual exploitation and abuse. The alleged perpetrator's age also raises questions about the criminal responsibility of minors in South Sudan. The South Sudan Child Act of 2008 sets the age of criminal responsibility at 12. Still, international human rights standards recommend that children below 14 years old should not be held criminally responsible.

The alleged rape cases may constitute violations of the right to protection from all forms of violence, including sexual exploitation and abuse, the right to protection from cruel, inhuman, and degrading treatment, and the right to a fair trial. The South Sudan Child Act, 2008, the South Sudan Penal Code, 2008, the Convention on the Rights of the Child, and the African Charter on the Rights and Welfare of the Child may have been violated.

A thorough investigation into the alleged rape cases should be conducted, ensuring the protection of the victims' rights and dignity. Psychological support and counseling should be provided to the victims and their families. 

Comment: The alleged perpetrator should be held accountable in accordance with South Sudan's juvenile justice system and international human rights standards. Existing laws and policies should be reviewed and strengthened to prevent similar incidents in the future. Training and capacity-building programs should be provided for law enforcement officials, judicial authorities, and social workers to ensure they are equipped to handle cases involving child victims and perpetrators.

Location of Incident: Yambio Town, Yambio County
Description:
•	17-year-old girl allegedly raped in Napere residential area, Yambio Town, Yambio County

On March 12, 2025, the HRD Yambio FO received and documented information from one-stop center regarding an alleged rape incident of a 17-year-old girl (details on file) on February 14, 2025, in the Napere residential area by a civilian male (details on file) also from Hai Kabasi. The incident was reported to the center on March 4, 2025, by a 27-year-old man (details on file) from Hai Kabasi, Yambio Town, Yambio County.

According to the report, the victim's father questioned her about a telephone she possessed, and she revealed that her boyfriend, who is the alleged perpetrator, had purchased it for her. This revelation led to the discovery that she had been having sexual intercourse with the alleged perpetrator. The alleged perpetrator is an adult man whose age was not disclosed.

The alleged perpetrator's relationship with the victim, reportedly being her boyfriend, may indicate a power imbalance and potential manipulation. This highlights the need for thorough investigation and support for the victim.  The case raises concerns about the protection of children's rights in the state, particularly regarding sexual exploitation and abuse. The Convention on the Rights of the Child and the African Charter on the Rights and Welfare of the Child obligate states to ensure children's protection from all forms of violence, including sexual exploitation and abuse.

A thorough investigation into the alleged rape case should be conducted, ensuring the protection of the victim's rights and dignity. Psychological support and counseling should be provided to the victim and her family. The alleged perpetrator should be held accountable in accordance with South Sudan's laws and international human rights standards.

The South Sudan Child Act, 2008, the South Sudan Penal Code, 2008, the Convention on the Rights of the Child, and the African Charter on the Rights and Welfare of the Child may have been violated. Existing laws and policies should be reviewed and strengthened to prevent similar incidents in the future.

Comment: Training and capacity-building programs should be provided for law enforcement officials, judicial authorities, and social workers to ensure they are equipped to handle cases involving child victims and perpetrators.

Location of Incident: Masia area, Yambio Town, Yambio
Description:
•	A 15-year-old girl was brutally assaulted by a 25-year-old civilian man in the Masia area, Yambio Town, Yambio County

On March 13, 2025, the HRD Yambio Field Office received disturbing information regarding an incident of gender-based violence that occurred in the Masia area of Yambio Town, Yambio County, on February 27, 2025. According to sources from the One Stop Centre, a 15-year-old girl (details on file) was brutally beaten by a 25-year-old civilian man (details on file) after she informed him that she was unaware of his wife's whereabouts. This violent act constitutes a severe violation of the girl's rights, including her right to freedom from torture and cruel, inhuman, and degrading treatment, as enshrined in Article 4 of the South Sudan Transitional Constitution (2011) and Article 7 of the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights.

The physical assault inflicted upon her resulted in severe nasal bleeding, which persisted for three days. Fortunately, she received timely medical attention at a local health facility.

Regrettably, the perpetrator remains at large, and no arrest has been made. This lack of accountability perpetuates a culture of impunity and undermines efforts to combat gender-based violence in the state.

The incident highlights the need for strengthened efforts to protect women and girls from violence, ensure accountability for perpetrators, and promote a culture of respect for human rights in the region.

Comment: From a human rights perspective, this incident underscores the systemic failures to protect women and girls from violence in the state. The fact that the perpetrator remains at large, despite the severity of the assault, suggests a lack of effective investigation and prosecution mechanisms. Furthermore, the incident highlights the need for comprehensive measures to address the root causes of gender-based violence, including discriminatory social norms, inadequate laws and policies, and insufficient support services for survivors.

Location of Incident: Bazungua Boma, Yambio
Description:
•	14-year-old minor allegedly raped by a 14-year-old boy in Bazungua Boma, Yambio County

On March 19, 2025, HRD Yambio FO received and confirmed reports from multiple community and one-stop center sources that on March 17, 2025, a 14-year-old girl (details on file) with mental health challenges was brought to the One Stop Center by her mother (details on file) after being allegedly raped by a 14-year-old boy (details on file), in Bazungua Boma, Yambio Town Payam, Yambio County.

The victim's mother narrated that the alleged perpetrator, also 14 years old, deceived the victim by telling her that there was corn inside the house, and when she entered, he grabbed, pushed her to the bed and raped her. The incident was reported to the victim's parents by neighbors.

This incident is a grave violation of human rights, specifically the right to bodily autonomy and dignity. The rape of a minor, particularly one with disabilities, highlights the alarming vulnerability of children to sexual violence and exploitation. It breaches several international human rights instruments, including the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights, and the Convention on the Rights of the Child. It also contravenes Section 244 of the South Sudan Penal Code Act 2008.

The incident underscores the urgent need for strengthened protection mechanisms and accountability for perpetrators of sexual violence against children.
The fact that the suspect is also a minor raises concerns about the lack of awareness and education about sexual and reproductive health, as well as the need for more significant support and protection for children in the state. The incident also underscores the importance of providing education and awareness about sexual and reproductive health, as well as more significant support and protection for children, particularly those with disabilities.

The victim should receive adequate medical and psychological support, as well as compensation for the harm she has suffered. The government should also provide support and protection to the victim's family, particularly her mother, who brought her to the One Stop Center.

Comment: This incident highlights the need for more significant efforts to prevent sexual violence and exploitation, particularly against children and persons with disabilities. The authorities should take immediate action to investigate this incident, hold the perpetrator accountable, and provide support and protection to the victim and her family.

Location of Incident: Pazuo Boma, Yambio Town Payam, Yambio
Description:
•	16-year-old minor allegedly raped by a 40-year-old man in Pazuo Boma, Yambio Town Payam, Yambio County

On March 19, 2025, HRD Yambio FO received and confirmed reports from multiple community and one-stop center sources. According to these reports, on March 13, 2025, the brother of a 16-year-old minor (details on file) reported to the One Stop Center that his sister, the victim, had allegedly been raped and impregnated by a 40-year-old man (details on file) from the same area. The incident reportedly occurred sometime in November 2024.

According to one of the sources, the brother confronted the victim on March 11, 2025, about her suspected pregnancy. She confirmed the pregnancy and revealed that she had engaged in sexual relations with the alleged perpetrator. The midwife at the One Stop Center confirmed the pregnancy, stating that the victim claimed the relationship was voluntary.

This incident raises serious human rights concerns, particularly regarding the protection of minors from sexual exploitation and abuse. The alleged perpetrator’s significant age advantage raises concerns about power imbalance and potential coercion. As a minor, the victim’s capacity to provide informed consent to sexual relations is questionable. International human rights law prohibits the sexual exploitation and abuse of minors, and states must protect children from harm.

The incident violates several human rights instruments, including the Convention on the Rights of the Child, the African Charter on the Rights and Welfare of the Child, and the South Sudan Child Act of 2008. These laws emphasize the need to protect children from sexual exploitation and abuse.

This incident constitutes a grave violation of the victim’s rights under the Convention on the Rights of the Child, particularly Article 19, which requires states to protect children from all forms of sexual exploitation and abuse. Furthermore, the incident breaches the principles of the best interests of the child (Article 3) and the right to protection from exploitation (Article 36). The alleged perpetrator's actions violate the victim's right to bodily autonomy and dignity, as enshrined in international human rights law.

Comment: To address this incident, it is essential to conduct a thorough investigation, interviewing the victim, suspect, and witnesses. The victim must receive medical and psychosocial support, including counseling and access to safe abortion services. Measures must be taken to protect the victim from further harm and hold the alleged perpetrator accountable. Strengthening measures to prevent the sexual exploitation and abuse of minors through education and awareness-raising programs is also crucial.

Location of Incident: Joppa residential area Gudele Block II, Juba, Juba
Description:
•	Rape of a ten-year-old girl by a Male adult civilian on 17 March 2025 at Joppa residential area Gudele Block II.
On 19 March 2025, during a human rights monitoring visit to the Gudele Police Division, HRD assessed the security and human rights situation in the Gudele residential area. As part of the visit, HRD engaged with the Gender Desk Focal Point, who reported a serious incident of sexual violence that occurred on March 17, 2025, at approximately 11:00 AM.
According to the official report, the victim’s father filed a complaint at the police division, stating that on the day of the incident, he had left for work while the victim’s mother was selling vegetables at Gudele Market. In their absence, the alleged perpetrator lured the victim into his house under the pretext of retrieving a household utensil. Once inside, the perpetrator sexually assaulted the victim. Upon returning home, the victim disclosed the assault to her father, who immediately reported the case to the police, leading to the arrest of the suspect.
The police investigator handling the case confirmed that the victim was promptly referred to a hospital, where a medical examination confirmed the occurrence of rape. During the police investigation, the suspect initially denied the allegations but later confessed to having raped the victim on multiple occasions, though he disputed committing the act on the day in question.
Comments: The perpetrator remains in custody, awaiting trial, as the legal process moves forward. HRD acknowledges the swift response by law enforcement authorities in apprehending the suspect and ensuring that the victim receives medical and legal support. However, continued monitoring is required to ensure access to justice, protection of the victim’s rights, and a fair trial process in accordance with national laws and international human rights standards.

Location of Incident: Hai-Logobero, yei twon, Yei
Description:
•	Rape of 16-year-old girl by civilian adult male in Hai-Logobero Yei Town, Yei River County

On March 19, 2025, HRD YFO, received and documented information from three reliable sources including a medical officer a psychosocial support provider and a gender desk officer about an incident of rape that took place in Hai-Logobero, Yei Town, Yei Town Payam,Yei River County as indicated below.

The case involves 16-year-old primary seven female (details on file), resident of Hai- Dilep and her 20-year-old civilian adult male teacher (details on file). The rape which resulted in pregnancy occurred in December 2024 and was reported to the police by the girl’s parents (details on file) on March 18, 2025. According to police reports on statements made by the victim’s parents, the teacher took the young girl from school to his residence at Hai- Logobero where he kept her for three days and raped her multiple times against her will and consent and without her parents’ knowledge. The police referred the victim to One Stop Centre for medical examination and the results revealed that she was 12 weeks pregnant. Both the victim and the perpetrator were said to be of the Kakwa clan. The perpetrator has been arrested, detained and the case has been charged to court for judgement and eventual prison sentence. 

Comments: The above incident is a clear case of rape, given that the victim is a minor and unable to give full consent. HRD YFO will follow up the case.

Location of Incident: Payangai, Rubkona
Description:
•	Alleged rape of an adult female by a truck driver of a company on 27 February 2025 in Payangai Payam of Rubkona County.

On 19 March 2025, during an SDP to Rotriak of Budang Payam, Rubkona County, the local authorities informed HRD of the alleged rape case on an adult female committed by a truck driving working with a company around the Unity Oil Fields (name of company on file). The perpetrator is an Ethiopian citizen, and that the incident occurred on 27 March 2027 in Payangai Payam of Rubkona County. The local authority reporting the case described that the rape happened when the driver had picked the lady from Rotriak and was to transport her to Payangai area. 

The driver instead of transporting the lady, decided to rape her in the truck. The victim was screaming for help but before the locals could arrive the scene, the driver had already sexually assualted her. The suspect was captured and detained at the Rotriak police and later transferred to the main police custody in Bentiu HQ. The informant concluded that the victim came to receive treatment in Bentiu. 

Comment: HRD will follow up the case with CID in Bentiu police station including the situation of the victim who came for treatment.

Location of Incident: Budan rubkona
Description:
•	Alleged sexual violence committed on five females by three unknown armed civilian men in Gol Cattle camp fish market in February 2025


During an SDP to Rotriak, Budang Payam of Rubkona County on 19 March 2025, the integrated UNMISS team gathered that five females were allegedly raped by three unknown armed civilians on an unspecified date in February 2025. The informants stated that the five females and three men had gone to the fish market at the Gol cattle camp in Rotriak to purchase fish to resell at their local market. On their way back to Rotriak, they were attacked by three armed men in civilian clothes who beat and chased away the men and then later raped the women. The attackers seized all their personal belongings including phones and merchandize. The sources also narrated that they police were later informed about the attack and when they arrived the location, the assailants had already fled the scene. They victims of the sexual violence did not receive any medical assistance and did not want to talk about the incident for fear of being stigmatized, the sources concluded.

Location of Incident: Gezira, Yei Town Payam, Yei River
Description:
•	Rape of 15-year-old mentally unstable female by alleged 70-year-old civilian male at Gezira, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County

HRD-YFO received and documented credible information from four secondary reliable sources, including a Medical Officer, Community Officer and two gender desk officers regarding the rape of a 15-year-old mentally unstable female (details on file) by a civilian male (details on file), suspected to be approximately 70 years Old. The incident happened on March 22, 2025, in Gezira, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County, and reported to the Police on March 25. According to police reports, the perpetrator visited the home of the mentally challenged girl during the absence of other family members and raped the victim. 

Besides reporting to police, the matter was also referred to one of the health facilities in Yei Town for medical care. The medical personnel confirmed rape of the victim. Further information, revealed this was the second time the victim had been raped, fist time being in 2023. The perpetrator was arrested and detained by the police, while investigations are ongoing. HRD will continue to follow up.

Location of Incident: Hai-Police, Yei Town Payam, Yei River
Description:
•	Gang-rape of 15-year-old female by six civilian males at Hai-Police, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County

On March 26, 2025, HRD-YFO received and documented information from multiple reliable secondary sources, including a medical officer, community officer, police officer, and a parent to the victim about gang rape of a 15-year-old female (details on file) by a gang of six civilian males  aged between 17 – 19 years (details on file) from different tribes including Dinka, Kakwa, and Nuba and other Bari speakers. The incident happened at about 8:00PM on March 24, 2025, at Hai-Police, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County. The case was reported to the police on March 25, 2025. According to police reports, the incident happened when the victim was returning from the neighboring shop to purchase groceries.

Sources indicated that the gang of six boys accosted girl and took her abandoned to a building where they raper her in turns. 

The case was referred one of the health centers for medical care on March 25, 2025. According to medical personnel the girl is in critical condition due to rape. 

Comment: HRD has established that four out of the six boys who committed the act have been arrested and detained at police as investigations continue, while two others are still in hiding. HRD will continue to follow up the case to ensure that there is accountability and fair administration of justice.

Location of Incident: Mitagi, Yei Town Payam, Yei River
Description:
•	Rape of 14-year-old female by 20-year-old civilian male at Mitagi, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County

On March 26, 2025, HRD-YFO received and documented information from four secondary reliable sources, including a Medical Officer, Community Officer and two gender desk officers about the rape of a 14-year-old female (details on file) from Kakwa tribe by a 20-year-old civilian male (details on file) also from the same Kakwa community. The incident happened on February 1, 2025, at Mitagi, Lasu road, Yei River County. 

According to police reports, the perpetrator who is said to be a relative of the victim invited her to his residence at Mitagi, Lasu Road on February 1, 2025, and raped her multiple times. No arrest has been made by the police as the perpetrator escaped after the incident and has not been seen till date. The case was reported to the Police on March 23, 2025, by the victim’s relative and referred to referred to a health facility on March 24, 2025, for medical care. 

Comment: HRD was not able to establish the reason for delayed reporting of the case to police and medical facilities. However, the late reporting present challenges of timely service provision to victims. This may affect timely investigations and prosecution of the case and further support with medical care to the victims.

Location of Incident: Isebi village, Lojulo Payam, Morobo
Description: 1.	On 2 April, three secondary sources reported that on 26 August 2024, one SSPDF raped one 40-year-old woman from the Keliko community in Isebi village, Lojulo Payam, Morobo County. According to the sources, the SSPDF soldier allegedly entered the homestead of the victim, threatened and forced the husband of the victim out of the house by firing rounds in the air and proceeded to rape the victim. Reportedly, the victim was taken to a health care facility in Morobo Town for medical examination and treatment. The perpetrator was arrested on 27 August 2024 and detained at the SSPDF barracks in Morobo Town, awaiting trial.

Location of Incident: Okera Boma, Bugilio Payam, Lafon
Description: 2.	On 2 April, three secondary sources reported that on 1 April, armed Toposa youths from Kapoeta North County, shot and killed one 40-year-old male civilian from the Toposa community and injured a 30-year-old male civilian in the Pari community during a cattle raid in Okera Boma, Bugilio Payam, Lafon County. According to the sources, a group of 10 armed Toposa youths stormed and opened fire on a grazing field in Okera Boma, injuring the 30-year-old victim. The attackers also seized  about 100 heads of cattle. Reportedly, the Pari youths pursued the armed Toposa youths and found the body of the 40-year-old victim on the outskirts of Bugilio Payam, allegedly killed by the armed Toposa youths. The injured victim was taken to a health care facility in Lafon County for medical treatment. The incident was reported to the police in Lafon Town and investigation is reportedly underway.

Location of Incident: Okera Boma, Bugilio Payam, Lafon
Description: 2.	On 2 April, three secondary sources reported that on 1 April, armed Toposa youths from Kapoeta North County, shot and killed one 40-year-old male civilian from the Toposa community and injured a 30-year-old male civilian in the Pari community during a cattle raid in Okera Boma, Bugilio Payam, Lafon County. According to the sources, a group of 10 armed Toposa youths stormed and opened fire on a grazing field in Okera Boma, injuring the 30-year-old victim. The attackers also seized  about 100 heads of cattle. Reportedly, the Pari youths pursued the armed Toposa youths and found the body of the 40-year-old victim on the outskirts of Bugilio Payam, allegedly killed by the armed Toposa youths. The injured victim was taken to a health care facility in Lafon County for medical treatment. The incident was reported to the police in Lafon Town and investigation is reportedly underway.

Description: 2.	On 2 April, three secondary sources reported that on 1 April, armed Toposa youths from Kapoeta North County, shot and killed one 40-year-old male civilian from the Toposa community and injured a 30-year-old male civilian in the Pari community during a cattle raid in Okera Boma, Bugilio Payam, Lafon County. Location of Incident: Yuai Payam, Uror
Description: 3.	On 2 April, multiple sources reported that on 1 April, one 11-year-old Murle child victim of abduction was recovered by the authorities in Yuai Payam, Uror County. According to the sources, the child was abducted in March 2025 from Gumuruk County, Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) by the joint armed Dinka Bor and Lou Nuer elements from Jonglei State, and taken to Yuai in Yuai Payam, Uror County.  Reportedly, protection partners are coordinating to reunite the child with her family in Gumuruk County, GPAA.

Location of Incident: Matangai Payam, Rumbek Center
Description: 4.	On 2 April, multiple sources reported that on 29 March, armed Dinka Gok youths from Duony Payam shot and killed one male civilian and injured three others from the Dinka Agaar community in Matangai Payam, Rumbek Center County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Gok youths attacked Meen-dem cattle camp and raided about 240 heads of cattle. Reportedly, in an ensuing confrontation with Dinka Agaar cattle keepers, one the assailants shot and killed one civilian was shot and killed and three others were injured. The  cattle owners reportedly recovered 110 heads of cattle.

Location of Incident: Matangai Payam, Rumbek Center
Description: 4.	On 2 April, multiple sources reported that on 29 March, armed Dinka Gok youths from Duony Payam shot and killed one male civilian and injured three others from the Dinka Agaar community in Matangai Payam, Rumbek Center County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Gok youths attacked Meen-dem cattle camp and raided about 240 heads of cattle. Reportedly, in an ensuing confrontation with Dinka Agaar cattle keepers, one the assailants shot and killed one civilian was shot and killed and three others were injured. The  cattle owners reportedly recovered 110 heads of cattle.

Location of Incident: Matangai Payam, Rumbek Center
Description: 4.	On 2 April, multiple sources reported that on 29 March, armed Dinka Gok youths from Duony Payam shot and killed one male civilian and injured three others from the Dinka Agaar community in Matangai Payam, Rumbek Center County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Gok youths attacked Meen-dem cattle camp and raided about 240 heads of cattle. Reportedly, in an ensuing confrontation with Dinka Agaar cattle keepers, one the assailants shot and killed one civilian was shot and killed and three others were injured. The  cattle owners reportedly recovered 110 heads of cattle.

Location of Incident: Abiemnom County, Ruweng Administrative Area
Description: 5.	On 2 April, multiple sources reported that on the same day April, four civilians were shot and killed and six others were injured, all from the Dinka Alor community, during fighting between armed Bul Nuer youths and allied armed Dinka Alor and Dinka Ngok youths in Abiemnom County, Ruweng Administrative Area. According to the sources, armed Bul Nuer youths from Mayom County attempted to retrieve over 1,500 heads of cattle that were raided allegedly by armed Dinka Ngok and Dinka Alor youths from of Abiemnom County at the Abiemnom cattle camp on 1 April, and in the ensuing confrontation, four civilians were killed and six others were injured in crossfire. Reportedly, armed Bul Nuer youths proceeded to loot civilian properties, commercial shops and burnt houses (exact number unspecified) in Abiemnom Town. The sources further informed that security forces from Mayom County were deployed to the location to reinforce the SSPDF based in Biemkhat to quell the situation.

Location of Incident: Abiemnom County, Ruweng Administrative Area
Description: 5.	On 2 April, multiple sources reported that on the same day April, four civilians were shot and killed and six others were injured, all from the Dinka Alor community, during fighting between armed Bul Nuer youths and allied armed Dinka Alor and Dinka Ngok youths in Abiemnom County, Ruweng Administrative Area. According to the sources, armed Bul Nuer youths from Mayom County attempted to retrieve over 1,500 heads of cattle that were raided allegedly by armed Dinka Ngok and Dinka Alor youths from of Abiemnom County at the Abiemnom cattle camp on 1 April, and in the ensuing confrontation, four civilians were killed and six others were injured in crossfire. Reportedly, armed Bul Nuer youths proceeded to loot civilian properties, commercial shops and burnt houses (exact number unspecified) in Abiemnom Town. The sources further informed that security forces from Mayom County were deployed to the location to reinforce the SSPDF based in Biemkhat to quell the situation.

Location of Incident: Abiemnom County, Ruweng Administrative Area
Description: 5.	On 2 April, multiple sources reported that on the same day April, four civilians were shot and killed and six others were injured, all from the Dinka Alor community, during fighting between armed Bul Nuer youths and allied armed Dinka Alor and Dinka Ngok youths in Abiemnom County, Ruweng Administrative Area. According to the sources, armed Bul Nuer youths from Mayom County attempted to retrieve over 1,500 heads of cattle that were raided allegedly by armed Dinka Ngok and Dinka Alor youths from of Abiemnom County at the Abiemnom cattle camp on 1 April, and in the ensuing confrontation, four civilians were killed and six others were injured in crossfire. Reportedly, armed Bul Nuer youths proceeded to loot civilian properties, commercial shops and burnt houses (exact number unspecified) in Abiemnom Town. The sources further informed that security forces from Mayom County were deployed to the location to reinforce the SSPDF based in Biemkhat to quell the situation.

Location of Incident: Mading-Ador village, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East
Description: 6.	On 2 April, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Pawen youths shot and killed one female civilian and injured another, both from the Dinka Pan-Juaj community, in Mading-Ador village, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Pawen youths attacked and opened fire on Mading-Ador village, killing one of the residents and injuring another, both women, and thereafter fled the scene. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Wunlit for medical treatment. The attack was reportedly a  revenge action linked to ongoing retaliatory violence between the two communities.

Location of Incident: Mading-Ador village, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East
Description: 6.	On 2 April, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Pawen youths shot and killed one female civilian and injured another, both from the Dinka Pan-Juaj community, in Mading-Ador village, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Pawen youths attacked and opened fire on Mading-Ador village, killing one of the residents and injuring another, both women, and thereafter fled the scene. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Wunlit for medical treatment. The attack was reportedly a  revenge action linked to ongoing retaliatory violence between the two communities.

Location of Incident: Biem-Kat village, Ajak-Kuac Payam, Twic
Description: 7.	On 2 April, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, armed Nuer youths from Unity State shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Twic Mayardit community during a cattle raid in Biem-Kat village, Ajak-Kuac Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, armed Nuer youths attacked and opened fire on a group of Dinka Twic Mayardit herders who were grazing their cattle in Biem-Kat village, killing one. The attacker also raided an unspecified number of cattle and fled with them across the border into Unity State.

Location of Incident: Biem-Kat village, Ajak-Kuac Payam, Twic
Description: 7.	On 2 April, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, armed Nuer youths from Unity State shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Twic Mayardit community during a cattle raid in Biem-Kat village, Ajak-Kuac Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, armed Nuer youths attacked and opened fire on a group of Dinka Twic Mayardit herders who were grazing their cattle in Biem-Kat village, killing one. The attacker also raided an unspecified number of cattle and fled with them across the border into Unity State.

Location of Incident: Bal-Akook village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East
Description:
8.	On 2 April, three secondary sources reported that on 1 April, armed Dinka Thiik youths shot and killed six civilians (two men, one girl, one boy, and two women) and injured seven male civilians, all from the Dinka Akook community, during a cattle raid in Bal-Akook village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Thiik youths attacked and opened fire on Bal-Akook village, killing six of the residents and injuring seven others. The attackers also raised over 35 heads of cattle. as part of the recent reported communal violence between the allied Dinka Thiik and Luanyjang, and the Dinka Akook in Tonj East County. Reportedly, the injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Ngabagok Payam for medical treatment.

Comment: According to the sources, the attack is a continuation violence between the allied Dinka Thiik and Luanyjang and the Dinka Akook communities.

Location of Incident: Bal-Akook village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East
Description:
8. Location of Incident: Kueny-Jur village, Awul Payam, Tonj North
Description:
9.	On 2 April three secondary sources reported that on 1 April, armed Dinka Leir youths from Kirik Payam shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Noi community in Kueny-Jur village, Awul Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Leir youths attacked and opened fire on the victim at his homestead, killing him. The attackers also raided seized 25 heads of cattle.

Comment: Despite efforts by the new County Commissioner to reconcile the communities, tension remains high between the two communities, with the likelihood of more violence.

Location of Incident: Kueny-Jur village, Awul Payam, Tonj North
Description:
9.	On 2 April three secondary sources reported that on 1 April, armed Dinka Leir youths from Kirik Payam shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Noi community in Kueny-Jur village, Awul Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Leir youths attacked and opened fire on the victim at his homestead, killing him. The attackers also raided seized 25 heads of cattle.

Comment: Despite efforts by the new County Commissioner to reconcile the communities, tension remains high between the two communities, with the likelihood of more violence.

Location of Incident: Umbili Boma, Kuajiena Payam, Jur River
Description: 11.	On 2 April, two secondary sources reported that on 21 March, one SPLA-IO abducted three children (one 13-year-old girl and two boys ages 10 and 15 years old) in Umbili Boma, Kuajiena Payam, Jur River County. According to the sources, the SPLA-Io element abducted the children in revenge for refusal of their mother to marry him. Reportedly, a case was opened at the Eastern Bank police station and investigations are ongoing. The suspect remains at large.

Location of Incident: Bandala Boma, Nagero Central Payam, Nagero
Description: 12.	On 2 April, three secondary sources reported that on 27 March, unidentified armed elements abducted and killed a 35-year-old male civilian from the Azande community in Bandala Boma, Nagero Central Payam, Nagero County. According to the sources, the victim left his homestead on 27 March to go fishing at the River Sue; however, he never returned, and after a frantic search by members of the community, his body was found on 2 April at the homestead of a Balanda suspect along the road to Nagero County. Reportedly, plans are underway by County authorities to recover his body and deploy security forces to search and arrest the suspect.

Location of Incident: Tenyteny Boma, Lomeyan Payam, Kapoeta North
Description: 1.	On 3 April, three secondary sources reported that on 1 April, armed Buya youths from Kimotong Payam, Budi County shot and killed two male civilians from the Toposa community (one eight-year-old boy and a 36-year-old man) in Tenyteny Boma, Lomeyan Payam, Kapoeta North County. According to the sources, the armed Buya youths entered a grazing field in Tenyteny Boma and opened fire on the victims, killing them. The attackers also seized over 400 goats and fled the scene. The incident was reported to the Kapoeta North Police Station and investigation is reportedly underway.

Location of Incident: Tenyteny Boma, Lomeyan Payam, Kapoeta North
Description: 1.	On 3 April, three secondary sources reported that on 1 April, armed Buya youths from Kimotong Payam, Budi County shot and killed two male civilians from the Toposa community (one eight-year-old boy and a 36-year-old man) in Tenyteny Boma, Lomeyan Payam, Kapoeta North County. According to the sources, the armed Buya youths entered a grazing field in Tenyteny Boma and opened fire on the victims, killing them. The attackers also seized over 400 goats and fled the scene. The incident was reported to the Kapoeta North Police Station and investigation is reportedly underway.

Location of Incident: Rupwaya village, Panchiengjok Payam, Panyijiar
Description: 2.	On 3 April, one secondary source reported that on 31 March, armed Dinka Ciec youths from Yirol East County, Lakes State shot and injured three male civilians including one 15-year-old boy from the Nyuong Nuer community during an attempted cattle raid in Rupwaya village, Panchiengjok Payam, Panyijiar County. According to the source, armed Dinka Ciec youths attacked and opened fire on a cattle camp in Rupwaya village, injuring three of the occupants. The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Pachiengjok Payam for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Chum village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj South
Description: 4.	On 3 April, three secondary sources reported that on 1 April, three male civilians (one Dinka Thony, one Dinka Yar, and one Dinka Muok) were shot and killed during violence between joint armed Dinka Yar and Muok and armed Dinka Thony youths in Chum village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, joint armed Dinka Yar and Dinka Muok youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Thony community in Chum village, killing one male Dinka Thony civilian and fled the scene. Reportedly, in retaliation, during a pursuit of the attackers, armed Dinka Thony youths shot and killed one Dinka Yar and one Dinka Muok civilian who were grazing in the area. The armed Dinka Thony youths reportedly also raided an unspecified number of cattle.

Location of Incident: Chum village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj South
Description: 4.	On 3 April, three secondary sources reported that on 1 April, three male civilians (one Dinka Thony, one Dinka Yar, and one Dinka Muok) were shot and killed during violence between joint armed Dinka Yar and Muok and armed Dinka Thony youths in Chum village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, joint armed Dinka Yar and Dinka Muok youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Thony community in Chum village, killing one male Dinka Thony civilian and fled the scene. Reportedly, in retaliation, during a pursuit of the attackers, armed Dinka Thony youths shot and killed one Dinka Yar and one Dinka Muok civilian who were grazing in the area. The armed Dinka Thony youths reportedly also raided an unspecified number of cattle.

Location of Incident: Yabongo Boma, Lirangu Payam, Yambio
Description:
5.	On 3 April, one secondary source reported that on 30 March, unidentified armed elements raped one 12-year-old girl from the Azande community in Yabongo Boma, Lirangu Payam, Yambio County. According to the source, unidentified armed elements accosted the victim and her mother at their farm, and proceeded to rape the survivor at gun point. Reportedly, the survivor was taken to a health care facility in Yambio Town for medical examination and treatment. The incident was reported to the police in Masia and an investigation is reportedly underway.

Comment: This incident follows a recurring pattern of attacks by unidentified armed elements dressed in military uniforms, targeting vulnerable civilian populations, particularly in Yambio County.

Location of Incident: Yeiba Village, Ombaci Boma, Otogo Payam, Yei River
Description: 1.	On 4 April, two secondary sources reported that on 26 March, one NAS element raped a 70-year-old woman from the Kakwa community in Yeiba Village, Ombaci Boma, Otogo Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, the suspected armed NAS element broke into the survivor’s house in the evening hours and raped her. The sources further informed that no report of the incident was made to the police, and the survivor did not receive any medical care.

Location of Incident: Lalanga Boma, Lohutok Payam, Imehejek Administrative Area
Description: 2.	On 4 April, three secondary sources reported that on 26 March, armed Lopit youths from Kimotong Payam, Budi County shot and killed one 25-year-old male civilian from the Buya community in Lalanga Boma, Lohutok Payam, Imehejek Administrative Area. According to the sources, the armed Lopit youths encountered and opened fire on the victim while they were returning from pursuing armed Buya youths who had earlier on the same day raided 50 heads of cattle from the Lopit community in the Kidepo Valley in Lalanga Boma, killing him. The armed Lopit youths reportedly recovered all of the raided cattle.

Location of Incident: Lalanga Boma, Lohutok Payam, Imehejek Administrative Area
Description: 2.	On 4 April, three secondary sources reported that on 26 March, armed Lopit youths from Kimotong Payam, Budi County shot and killed one 25-year-old male civilian from the Buya community in Lalanga Boma, Lohutok Payam, Imehejek Administrative Area. According to the sources, the armed Lopit youths encountered and opened fire on the victim while they were returning from pursuing armed Buya youths who had earlier on the same day raided 50 heads of cattle from the Lopit community in the Kidepo Valley in Lalanga Boma, killing him. The armed Lopit youths reportedly recovered all of the raided cattle.

Location of Incident: Pabierol, Duk
Description: 3.	On 5 April, multiple sources reported that on 4 April, Murle armed elements shot and injured two female civilians (ages 16 and 30 years old) from the Lou Nuer community in Pabierol, Duk County. According to the sources, the Murle armed elements ambushed and open fire on four commercial vehicles transporting passengers from Bor to Yuai in Uror County, injuring two. Reportedly, one boy (age unspecified) from the Lou Nuer community jumped off the vehicle in fright, ran into the bushes and has been missing since then.

Location of Incident: Pabierol, Duk
Description: 3.	On 5 April, multiple sources reported that on 4 April, Murle armed elements shot and injured two female civilians (ages 16 and 30 years old) from the Lou Nuer community in Pabierol, Duk County. According to the sources, the Murle armed elements ambushed and open fire on four commercial vehicles transporting passengers from Bor to Yuai in Uror County, injuring two. Reportedly, one boy (age unspecified) from the Lou Nuer community jumped off the vehicle in fright, ran into the bushes and has been missing since then.

Location of Incident: Tiam Boma, Tiam Payam, Uror
Description: 4.	On 5 April, multiple sources reported that on 2 April, Murle armed elements abducted one 16-year-old girl from the Lou Nuer community in Tiam Boma, Tiam Payam, Uror County. According to the sources, the motive for the abduction was to get information from the victim about the location of cattle camps in the area. Reportedly, after informing them of the displacement of herders and their cattle following the attack in March, the abductors released the victim, and they left the area.

Location of Incident: Newmew village, Walgak Payam, Akobo
Description: 5.	On 5 April, multiple sources reported that, on 1 April, Murle armed elements attacked and killed three female civilians (ages unspecified) and abducted another (age unspecified), all from the Lou Nuer community, in Newmew village, Walgak Payam, Akobo County. According to the sources, the Murle armed elements attacked a group of women from the Lou Nuer community who had gone into the bush in the outskirts of Walgak Payam to collect firewood, killing three and abducted another. The  authorities of Akobo County have reportedly contacted the authorities in Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) to secure the recovery of the victim.

Location of Incident: Newmew village, Walgak Payam, Akobo
Description: 5.	On 5 April, multiple sources reported that, on 1 April, Murle armed elements attacked and killed three female civilians (ages unspecified) and abducted another (age unspecified), all from the Lou Nuer community, in Newmew village, Walgak Payam, Akobo County. According to the sources, the Murle armed elements attacked a group of women from the Lou Nuer community who had gone into the bush in the outskirts of Walgak Payam to collect firewood, killing three and abducted another. The  authorities of Akobo County have reportedly contacted the authorities in Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) to secure the recovery of the victim.

Location of Incident: Manyangok Payam, Tonj South
Description: 6.	On 6 April, three primary sources reported that on 4 April, two male civilians were shot and killed (one Dinka Thony and one Dinka Yar) during violence between armed Dinka Yar and Dinka Thony youths in Manyangok Payam, Tonj South County. As recounted by the sources, armed Dinka Yar youths from Wanhalel Payam attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Thony community in Chum village, Manyangok Payam, killing one male civilian. In retaliation, armed Dinka Thony youths shot and killed one cattle herder from the Dinka Yar community in the swampy area in Manyangok Payam. The armed Dinka Thony youths also seized 12 of his cattle.

Location of Incident: Manyangok Payam, Tonj South
Description: 6.	On 6 April, three primary sources reported that on 4 April, two male civilians were shot and killed (one Dinka Thony and one Dinka Yar) during violence between armed Dinka Yar and Dinka Thony youths in Manyangok Payam, Tonj South County. As recounted by the sources, armed Dinka Yar youths from Wanhalel Payam attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Thony community in Chum village, Manyangok Payam, killing one male civilian. In retaliation, armed Dinka Thony youths shot and killed one cattle herder from the Dinka Yar community in the swampy area in Manyangok Payam. The armed Dinka Thony youths also seized 12 of his cattle.

Location of Incident: Pabuor village, Malual-Cum Boma, Ngapagok Payam, Tonj East
Description: 7.	On 6 April, three primary sources reported that on 3 April, armed Dinka Akook youths shot and injured two female civilians from the Dinka Akook community in Pabuor village, Malual-Cum Boma, Ngapagok Payam, Tonj East County. As recounted by the sources, the armed Dinka Akook youths, who had laid ambush for armed Dinka Thiik youths, opened fire on the victims while they were returning from Malual-Cum market, injuring them. Reportedly, the armed Dinka Akook youths mistook the victims to be Dinka Thiik aggressors. The victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Ngabagok for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Jebel Mabieu, Mapel Payam, Jur River
Description: 9.	On 3 and 4 March multiple primary sources reported that on 15 March, NSS personnel arbitrarily arrested, illtreated, and detained five male civilians (youth leaders) from the Luo community in Jebel Mabieu, Mapel Payam, Jur River County. As recounted by the sources, the NSS, allegedly on the instructions one official of Tonj County, arrested the victims in connection with the land dispute at Jebel Mabieu border area, transferred to Tonj South County, where they were detained for one day. Reportedly the victims were beaten up during the arrest. The sources further informed that the victims were subsequently released following the intervention of the Governors of Warrap and Western Bahr el Ghazal States.

Location of Incident: Hai Kuze residential area, Yambio Town, Yambio
Description: 10.	On 4 April, one secondary source reported that on 29 March, unidentified armed elements shot and injured one male civilian from the Jurbel community and raped one female civilian from the Azande community in the Hai Kuze residential area, Yambio Town, Yambio County. According to the sources, a group of five unidentified armed elements broke into the homestead of the victims, ordered the male victim to leave his homestead, and while he fled, one of the assailants opened fire injuring him. The assailants reportedly proceeded to rape the female survivor and subsequently used objects to sexually assault her. The attackers also looted their personal belongings. The survivor was taken to a healthcare facility in Yambio Town for medical examination and treatment. Reportedly, the survivor reportedly declined to report the case to the police for fear of retaliation.

Location of Incident: Hai Kuze residential area, Yambio Town, Yambio
Description: 10.	On 4 April, one secondary source reported that on 29 March, unidentified armed elements shot and injured one male civilian from the Jurbel community and raped one female civilian from the Azande community in the Hai Kuze residential area, Yambio Town, Yambio County. According to the sources, a group of five unidentified armed elements broke into the homestead of the victims, ordered the male victim to leave his homestead, and while he fled, one of the assailants opened fire injuring him. The assailants reportedly proceeded to rape the female survivor and subsequently used objects to sexually assault her. The attackers also looted their personal belongings. The survivor was taken to a healthcare facility in Yambio Town for medical examination and treatment. Reportedly, the survivor reportedly declined to report the case to the police for fear of retaliation.

Location of Incident: Hai Kuze residential area, Yambio Town, Yambio
Description: 10.	On 4 April, one secondary source reported that on 29 March, unidentified armed elements shot and injured one male civilian from the Jurbel community and raped one female civilian from the Azande community in the Hai Kuze residential area, Yambio Town, Yambio County. According to the sources, a group of five unidentified armed elements broke into the homestead of the victims, ordered the male victim to leave his homestead, and while he fled, one of the assailants opened fire injuring him. The assailants reportedly proceeded to rape the female survivor and subsequently used objects to sexually assault her. The attackers also looted their personal belongings. The survivor was taken to a healthcare facility in Yambio Town for medical examination and treatment. Reportedly, the survivor reportedly declined to report the case to the police for fear of retaliation.

Location of Incident: Gangara Emilia neighborhood, Yambio Town, Yambio
Description:
11.	On 4 April, one secondary source reported that on 13 March, unidentified armed elements raped one 21-year-old woman from the Azande Community in Gangara Emilia neighborhood, Yambio Town, Yambio County. According to the source, the unidentified armed elements broke into the homestead of the survivor’s family home, restrained two men and two minors (one girl and one boy), looted their property and thereafter proceeded to rape the survivor. The source further informed that the survivor was taken to a healthcare facility in Yambio Town for medical examination and treatment. Reportedly, a case was opened at Yambio Police Station; however, by the time of reporting, the survivor had not submitted the medical doctor's report to the police.
Comment: The recurring pattern of attacks in Yambio Town highlight the inadequate protection of civilians in the area.  The alleged involvement of individuals linked to the SSPDF exacerbates the vulnerability of civilians as it complicates accountability mechanisms and the enforcement of justice. Addressing this requires urgent and transparent investigations to identify and hold perpetrators accountable.

Location of Incident: Gangara Emilia neighborhood, Yambio Town, Yambio
Description:
11.	On 4 April, one secondary source reported that on 13 March, unidentified armed elements raped one 21-year-old woman from the Azande Community in Gangara Emilia neighborhood, Yambio Town, Yambio County. According to the source, the unidentified armed elements broke into the homestead of the survivor’s family home, restrained two men and two minors (one girl and one boy), looted their property and thereafter proceeded to rape the survivor. The source further informed that the survivor was taken to a healthcare facility in Yambio Town for medical examination and treatment. Reportedly, a case was opened at Yambio Police Station; however, by the time of reporting, the survivor had not submitted the medical doctor's report to the police.
Comment: The recurring pattern of attacks in Yambio Town highlight the inadequate protection of civilians in the area.  The alleged involvement of individuals linked to the SSPDF exacerbates the vulnerability of civilians as it complicates accountability mechanisms and the enforcement of justice. Addressing this requires urgent and transparent investigations to identify and hold perpetrators accountable.

Location of Incident: Yeiba Village, Ombaci Boma, Otogo Payam, Yei River
Description: 1.	On 7 April, one primary source and one secondary source reported that on 26 March, NAS elements abducted two male civilians from the Kakwa community in Yeiba Village, Ombaci Boma, Otogo Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, a group of seven NAS elements stormed Yeiba village demanding food items from civilians in the community, and subsequently abducted the vicitms after they failed to provide food (goats and casava flour) that perpetrators. Their whereabouts remain unknown.

Location of Incident: Burung and Loyoro Bomas, Chahari Payam, Ikotos
Description: 2.	On 7 April, three secondary sources reported that on 5 and 6 April, two male civilians (one 29-year-old from the Lutoko community and one 26-year-old from the Dongotono community) were shot and killed, and a 32-year-old male civilian from the Lotuko community was injured during violence between armed Lutoko youths from Loyoro Boma and armed Dongotono youths from Burung Boma in Burung and Loyoro Bomas, Chahari Payam, Ikotos County. According to the sources, on 5 April, armed Dongotono youths attacked Burung Boma with intent to raid cattle, opened fire on a group of Lutoko civilians who were at a social event, killing one and injuring another. In retaliation, on 6 April, armed Lutoko youths while pursuing the attackers shot and killed a 26-year-old male civilian from the Dongotono community while he was going to his farm. The injured victim was evacuated to a hospital in Isoke for medical treatment. The incident was reported at the Chahari Police station.

Location of Incident: Burung and Loyoro Bomas, Chahari Payam, Ikotos
Description: 2.	On 7 April, three secondary sources reported that on 5 and 6 April, two male civilians (one 29-year-old from the Lutoko community and one 26-year-old from the Dongotono community) were shot and killed, and a 32-year-old male civilian from the Lotuko community was injured during violence between armed Lutoko youths from Loyoro Boma and armed Dongotono youths from Burung Boma in Burung and Loyoro Bomas, Chahari Payam, Ikotos County. According to the sources, on 5 April, armed Dongotono youths attacked Burung Boma with intent to raid cattle, opened fire on a group of Lutoko civilians who were at a social event, killing one and injuring another. In retaliation, on 6 April, armed Lutoko youths while pursuing the attackers shot and killed a 26-year-old male civilian from the Dongotono community while he was going to his farm. The injured victim was evacuated to a hospital in Isoke for medical treatment. The incident was reported at the Chahari Police station.

Location of Incident: Gumuruk
Description: 4.	On 7 April, multiple sources reported that on 5 April, one 18-year-old boy from the Murle community Murle, who had been abducted by armed Lou Nuer elements from Gumuruk County, GPAA in 2009 when he was a minor, was recovered the authorities of GPAA and transferred to Pibor. He was reportedly based in Uganda and reached in Juba on 27 March after finding about his origin from the family of the abductor.

Location of Incident: Bich Bich area, Nanaam, Vulvet Payam, Gumuruk
Description: 5.	On 7 April, multiple sources reported that on 28 March, one 28-year-old woman and a 10-month-old girl from Vulvet Payam, Gumuruk County, GPAA were received by the authorities in Pibor, GPAA, after she escaped from her abductors. According to the sources, the woman along with her two girls (ages three and five years old) and two other children (ages unspecified) were abducted between 1 and 3 March by armed Lou Nuer youths from Bich Bich area, Nanaam, Vulvet Payam, Gumuruk County and transferred them to Pieri in Uror County. Reportedly, on 16 March, the woman and her 10-month-old baby escaped from her abductors to Wuno Payam, Likuangole County, GPAA, where she was received by a humanitarian organization and transferred to Pibor on 28 March leaving behind the other children with the abductors. Efforts are under way to reunite them with their families.

Location of Incident: an area between Ajak Kuac Payam, Warrap State and Abiemnom
Description:
6.	On 7 April, one secondary source reported that on 5 April, suspected armed Dinka Alor youths shot and killed eight male civilians from the Nuer community in an area between Ajak Kuac Payam, Warrap State and Abiemnom County, Ruweng Administrative Area. According to the source, the assailants attacked four commercial passenger vehicles enroute from Juba to Unity State through the Wau-Abiemnom-Road and ordered the passengers to disembark. Reportedly, upon identifying some of the passengers as belonging to the Nuer, they isolated and opened fire on eight, killing them. The other passengers and drivers reportedly proceeded and reached Mayom County where they reported the incident. 

Comment: HRD will follow up to gather more information on the incident.

Location of Incident: Kuany-Goi village, Awul Payam, Tonj North
Description: 7.	On 7 April, three secondary sources reported that on 6 April, armed Dinka Leir youths from Kirik Payam shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Noi community in Kuany-Goi village, Awul Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Leir youths attacked and opened fire on the victim at his homestead, killing him. The attack was reportedly a revenge action linked to past violence and unresolved past grievances between the Dinka Leir and Dinka Noi communities.

Location of Incident: Thurkueng Boma, River Jur
Description: 8.	On 6 and 7 April, multiple sources reported that on 6 April, one SSPDF soldier shot and killed one 45-year-old woman from the Dinka community in Thurkueng Boma, River Jur County. According to the sources, the SSPDF soldier opened fire on the victim during a dispute with the Victim’s family over unpaid portion of dowry. The suspect was subsequently arrested and detained by the SSPDF pending investigation and trial.

Location of Incident: Saura Boma, Yambio Payam, Yambio
Description: 9.	On 7 April, one secondary source reported that on 3 April, unidentified armed elements illtreated and abducted two male civilians (social workers of a local civil society organization) from the Azande community in Saura Boma, Yambio Payam, Yambio County. According to the source, the unidentified armed elements ambushed while they were returning from work, beat them up, and thereafter forced them into a military vehicle that went in the direction of Lirangu Payam. The whereabouts of the victims remains unknown.

Location of Incident: Ngauro Boma, Ngauro Payam, Budi
Description:
1.	On 8 April, three secondary sources reported that on 6 April, armed Didinga youths shot and killed three male civilians and injured one female civilian, all from the Didinga community, in Ngauro Boma, Ngauro Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, two armed Didinga youths from Ngauro Boma stormed the gold mine site, ordered those who are not from Ngauro Boma to vacate the site, and subsequently opened fire on the miners, killing three and injuring one. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Kapoeta for medical treatment. The incident was reported at the Ngauro Police Station and investigation is reportedly ongoing; however, no suspects have been apprehended yet.

Comment: According to the sources, the incident is linked to ongoing dispute over ownership of the local gold mine in Ngauro Payam, whereby the Didinga youths of Ngauro Payam claim exclusive access and ownership and regard other Didinga communities as trespassers.

Location of Incident: Ngauro Boma, Ngauro Payam, Budi
Description:
1.	On 8 April, three secondary sources reported that on 6 April, armed Didinga youths shot and killed three male civilians and injured one female civilian, all from the Didinga community, in Ngauro Boma, Ngauro Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, two armed Didinga youths from Ngauro Boma stormed the gold mine site, ordered those who are not from Ngauro Boma to vacate the site, and subsequently opened fire on the miners, killing three and injuring one. Location of Incident: Pieri Boma, Pieri Payam, Uror
Description: 2.	On 8 April, multiple sources reported that on 7 April, Murle armed elements shot and killed one male civilian and injured another, both from the Lou Nuer community in Pieri Boma, Pieri Payam, Uror County. According to the sources, the Murle armed elements attacked and opened fire on a group of Lou Nuer cattle herders in Pieri Boma, killing one and injuring another. The attackers also raided an unspecified number of cattle. Reportedly, the local Lou Nuer youths pursued the attackers and recovered all of the raided cattle. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Pieri for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Pieri Boma, Pieri Payam, Uror
Description: 2. According to the sources, the Murle armed elements attacked and opened fire on a group of Lou Nuer cattle herders in Pieri Boma, killing one and injuring another. The attackers also raided an unspecified number of cattle. Reportedly, the local Lou Nuer youths pursued the attackers and recovered all of the raided cattle. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Pieri for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: GPAA
Description: 3.	On 8 April, multiple sources reported that on 6 April, one woman and her two-year-old son, who had been abducted by armed Lou Nuer youths during the attack on Gumuruk County, Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) in March 2025 (exact date unspecified) were recovered by the authorities in Akobo Boma, Akobo Payam, Uror County. Reportedly, the victims escaped from their abductors in Motot Payam, Uror County and were found by Akobo community members who took  them to the County officials. They are placed under protective custody while awaiting family reunification.

Location of Incident: GPAA
Description: 4.	On 8 April, multiple sources reported that on 5 April, two child victims of abduction (one 14-year-old girl and a 12-year-old boy) from GPAA, were recovered by the authorities in Walgak Payam, Akobo County. According to the sources, the victims were abducted from Gumuruk and Likuangole Counties in GPAA during the attack armed Lou Nuer elements in March 2025. Authorities are reportedly coordinating with protection partners for their transfer to Pibor for family tracing and reunification.

Location of Incident: Ayieth village, Akop Payam, Tonj North
Description:
5.	On 8 April, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, armed Nuer youths from Unity State shot and killed five male civilians and injured three others including one girl, all from the Dinka Apuk-Patoc community, in Ayieth village, Akop Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, armed Nuer youths attacked and opened fire on a cattle camp in Ayieth village, killing five of the residents and injuring three others. The attackers also reportedly seized 45 heads of cattle; however, the local armed Dinka Apuk-Patoc youths pursued them and in the ensuing confrontation recovered some of the stolen cattle. Reportedly, four armed Nuer youths were shot and killed during the confrontation. The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Akop Payam for medical treatment.

Comment: Tension is reportedly mounting in the area with the likelihood of more retaliatory violence.
