Location of Incident: Naminitoit Boma, Lomeyen Payam, Kapoeta North
Description: 1.	On 9 April, three secondary sources reported that on 5 April, armed Buya youths from Kimotong Payam, Budi County shot and killed two male civilians (ages 25 and 30 years old) from the Toposa community in Naminitoit Boma, Lomeyen Payam, Kapoeta North County. According to the sources, the armed Buya youths stormed Naminitoit Boma and opened fire on the victims while they were grazing their cattle killing them. The attackers also raided 400 goats and fled with them towards Kimotong Payam. The incident was reported at the Kapoeta North County Police Station and investigations are reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: Naminitoit Boma, Lomeyen Payam, Kapoeta North
Description: 1.	On 9 April, three secondary sources reported that on 5 April, armed Buya youths from Kimotong Payam, Budi County shot and killed two male civilians (ages 25 and 30 years old) from the Toposa community in Naminitoit Boma, Lomeyen Payam, Kapoeta North County. According to the sources, the armed Buya youths stormed Naminitoit Boma and opened fire on the victims while they were grazing their cattle killing them. The attackers also raided 400 goats and fled with them towards Kimotong Payam. The incident was reported at the Kapoeta North County Police Station and investigations are reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: GPAA
Description: 2.	On 9 April, multiple sources reported that on 2 April, one woman from the Murle community and her infant son, who were abducted from Gumuruk County during the attack by armed Lou Nuer elements in Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) in March 2025 (exact date unspecified), were recovered by the authorities in Yuai Payam, Uror County. Reportedly, the former abductees have been placed under the protective custody of the authorities of Uror County officials, who are coordinating with protection partners to transfer them to Juba and subsequently to Pibor for family tracing and reunification.

Location of Incident: Mading village, Thiet Payam, Tonj South
Description: 3.	On 9 April, multiple sources reported that on 8 April, five male civilians were shot and killed (four from the Dinka Apuk-Jurwir community and one from the Dinka Thony community) and three others from the Dinka Apuk-Jurwir community were injured in Mading village, Thiet Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Thony youths attacked and opened fire on a cattle camp in Mading village, killing four Dinka Apuk-Jurwir civilians and injuring three others, and thereafter fled the scene. Reportedly, armed Dinka Apuk-Jurwir youths pursued the attackers, during which they shot and killed one Dinka Thony cattle herder who was attending to his cattle in the swampy area. Two armed Dinka Thony youths were also reportedly shot and injured during the pursuit. The injured Dinka Apuk-Jurwir civilians were evacuated to a health care facility in Tonj Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Mading village, Thiet Payam, Tonj South
Description: 3.	On 9 April, multiple sources reported that on 8 April, five male civilians were shot and killed (four from the Dinka Apuk-Jurwir community and one from the Dinka Thony community) and three others from the Dinka Apuk-Jurwir community were injured in Mading village, Thiet Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Thony youths attacked and opened fire on a cattle camp in Mading village, killing four Dinka Apuk-Jurwir civilians and injuring three others, and thereafter fled the scene. Reportedly, armed Dinka Apuk-Jurwir youths pursued the attackers, during which they shot and killed one Dinka Thony cattle herder who was attending to his cattle in the swampy area. Two armed Dinka Thony youths were also reportedly shot and injured during the pursuit. The injured Dinka Apuk-Jurwir civilians were evacuated to a health care facility in Tonj Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Bakiwiri Boma, Gangura Payam, Yambio
Description: 4.	On 9 April two secondary sources reported that on 2 April, one SSPDF soldier and two other armed elements illtreated three civilians (two women and one man) from the Azande community in Bakiwiri Boma, Gangura Payam, Yambio County. According to the sources, the perpetrators entered the homestead of the victims, bound them, beat them up, threatened to kill them, and thereafter looted their belongings. The incident was reported at Yambio Police Station and two of the suspects were reportedly apprehended, while a letter was sent by the police to the commander of the SSPDF demanding that the SSPDF suspect should be released into police custody for proper investigation.

Location of Incident: Kopei Boma, Kauto Payam, Kapoeta East
Description:
1.	On 10 April, three secondary sources reported that on 6 April, Murle armed elements from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) abducted one 14-year-old boy from the Toposa community in Kopei Boma, Kauto Payam, Kapoeta East County. According to the sources, the Murle armed elements attacked Kopei Boma, encountered the victim while he was tending to his goats and proceeded to abduct him. The incident was reported at Nanyangachor Police Station as well as in Narus Police Station and investigation is reportedly ongoing. 

Comment: According to the sources, the community of Kauto Payam is living in fear following  reports of mobilization of the Murle armed elements with the support of armed men who are stationed in the east-west of Kopei Plateau and planning to attack Kauto Payam.

Location of Incident: Ajiec-Wel village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj South
Description:
2.	On 10 April, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, allied armed Dinka Yar, Muok and Apuk-Jurwir youths from Wanhalel, Tonj and Thiet Payams shot and killed five male civilians and injured six others, all from the Dinka Thony community, in Ajiec-Wel village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked and opened fire on Ajiec-Wel village, killing five of the residents and injuring six others. The attackers reportedly also burnt 18 tukuls as well as raided 50 heads of cattle. The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Manyangok Payam for medical treatment. 

Comment: According to the sources, the attack was a revenge action for the attack by armed Dinka Thony youths on the Apuk-Jurwir community in Thiet Payam on 8 April [see HRD Daily Report 10 April 2025].

Description:

Location of Incident: IDP Camp 3, Juba
Description:
On 30 March 2025, HRD JFO received reliable reports including meeting call with some IDPs’ Camp 3 in Juba that a resident of the camp, a man aged around 25, was shot dead in the vicinity of the camp by the security forces and another was missing. According to the information received, gunfire was heard that day around 03:00 am from the IDP’s camp3 located near UNMISS Unhouse. When the situation calmed down, one male, later identified as a Camp resident, was been found dead outside the camp with multiple gunshot wounds.
The other camp residents led by the chairman to the site have confirmed the identity of the victim as a man, Giel Dech, aged 25 years, resident in the IDP’s camp3. They also confirmed that at the time of the incident, the deceased was with another man named Gatwech, aged 27 years, both from Upper Nile. The two had gone to prepare the well, which belongs to them, to ensure it was ready for sale of water to customers. Accordingly, their initiative was driven by the scarcity of water in IDP Camp 3, and the need for economic empowerment. A few items clearly belonging to the victims were found near the body including two pairs of shoes, one cap and a shirt. They also discovered six empty cartridges, a live bullet, military caps, and footprints of military boots at the place.
According to the sources, this information was brought to the attention of the police officers stationed at the checkpoints, who simply ordered the camp residents to bury the bodies.

On 31 March 2025, the sources confirmed that the body of the missing boy had been found in decomposed state in Melitor Village, about 1 km southeast of IDP Camp 03 by certain villagers, who then informed the IDP’s Camp 3 chairperson. Along with the boy's relatives to the village, the camp’s Community Watch Group went to the site and identified the deceased as Gatwech, a 27-year-old male, the same boy who went missing after gunshot near the IDP’s Camp3. This information was also reported to the attention of the Yei Checkpoint Police for further investigation. As at the first discovery, the police ordered the chairman and his team to bury the body without further comment. 
 Actions taken by HRD JFO since the receiving the information on the clashes. 
 To corroborate the initial information, HRD FOJ conducted a remote investigation, monitoring, and interviewing witnesses from IDP Camp 3 including the chairman, the humanitarian coordinator, victims’ family members through the chairman and the women association assistant. 
HRD JFO has not yet visited the IDP’s Camp3 to interview witnesses and other relatives of the victims, as a precaution to avoid exposing them to the SSPDF, who remain almost permanently present in the camp. Some UNMISS patrols have been backed up by the SSPDF.
 During the remote monitoring, HRD FOJ identified the following violations:
-	Casualties (2 killings) 

•	On 30 March 2025, HRD JFO received reliable reports including meeting call with some IDPs’ Camp 3 in Juba that a resident of the camp, a man aged around 25, was shot dead in the vicinity of the camp by the security forces and another missing.
•	On 31 March 2025, the body of the missing boy has been found in decomposed state in Melitor Village, about 1 km southeast of IDP Camp 03.

Next steps

HRD JFO will continue to monitor and report. When the security situation permits, some witnesses will be able to go to the HRD JFO in Tomping for interviews in complete confidence.

Location of Incident: Mura- Hatiha Boma, Hiyala Payam, Torit
Description: 1.	On 11 April, three secondary sources reported that on 7 April, armed Lotuko youths shot and killed one 27-year-old male civilian from Mura-Hatiha Boma in Mura- Hatiha Boma, Hiyala Payam, Torit County. According to the sources, armed Lotuko youths from Tirangore Boma in the same payam stormed Mura - Hatiha Boma and opened fire on the victim while he has working in his farm, killing him. Reportedly, the motive of the attack was to instill fear amongst the community of Mura- Hatiha Boma and deter them from claiming the disputed farmland. The incident was reported to the authorities of Torit County who subsequently visited Tirangore Boma on 8 April and instructed the Boma administration to apprehend the suspects and hand them over to the police in Hiyala Payam. The county authorities thereafter went to Mura-Hatiha Boma and urged the youths to remain calm as the government investigates the matter.

Location of Incident: Padiak and Tiam Payams, in Uror
Description: 2.	On 13 April, multiple sources reported that on 12 April, Murle armed elements shot and killed three male civilians and injured four others from the Lou Nuer community in Padiak and Tiam Payams, in Uror County. According to the sources, the Murle armed elements attacked a cattle camp in Pulthakbil, Padiak Payam and raided 1000 heads of cattle; however, the local armed Lou Nuer youths repulsed them and in the ensuing confrontation, the Murle armed elements shot and killed one Lou Nuer civilian and injured another in Padiak Payam; and shot and killed two Lou Nuer and injured three others in Tiam Payam. Reportedly, the Lou Nuer youths recovered all the raided cattle. Seven Murle armed elements were reportedly also killed during the confrontation. The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Pieri Payam for medical treatment.

Description: On 11 April, multiple sources reported that on the same day, Murle armed elements shot and killed one 25-year-old male civilian from the Lou Nuer community in the Bodil area in Juet Village, Wechkol Payam, Uror County. According to the sources, the Murle armed elements attacked and opened fire on the victim while he was tending to his cattle, killing him. The attackers also sized over 250 heads of cattle and fled the scene. Reportedly, the local Lou Nuer youths pursued the attackers and recovered the stolen cattle.

Location of Incident: Thiac village, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East
Description: 5. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Pawen youths attacked and opened fire on a cattle camp in Thiac village, killing one Dinka Thiik cattle herder who was gazing his cattle alongside the Dinka Pan-Juaj herders. Reportedly, the attackers also seized an unspecified number of cattle.

Location of Incident: Ayien-Amuol village, Turalei Payam, Twic
Description:
6.	On 11 April, four secondary sources reported that on 10 April, armed Dinka Twic Mayardit youths shot and killed three male civilians and injured another, all from the Dinka Apuk community, in Ayien-Amuol village, Turalei Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Twic Mayardit youths attacked and opened fire on the group of Dinka Apuk civilians from Gogrial East County, suspecting them to be armed Nuer youths, killing three and injuring one. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Turalei Town for medical treatment. 

Comment: Reportedly, the victims had visited their relatives in Ayien-Amuol village and were returning from a night traditional dance when they encountered the armed Twic Mayardit youths who were patrolling the area. This incident has reportedly enraged the Dinka Apuk community who have had a relatively peaceful relationship with the Dinka Twic Mayardit. The community leaders of both communities are reportedly seeking measures to resolve the issue traditionally.

Location of Incident: Ayien-Amuol village, Turalei Payam, Twic
Description:
6.	On 11 April, four secondary sources reported that on 10 April, armed Dinka Twic Mayardit youths shot and killed three male civilians and injured another, all from the Dinka Apuk community, in Ayien-Amuol village, Turalei Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Twic Mayardit youths attacked and opened fire on the group of Dinka Apuk civilians from Gogrial East County, suspecting them to be armed Nuer youths, killing three and injuring one. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Turalei Town for medical treatment. 

Comment: Reportedly, the victims had visited their relatives in Ayien-Amuol village and were returning from a night traditional dance when they encountered the armed Twic Mayardit youths who were patrolling the area. This incident has reportedly enraged the Dinka Apuk community who have had a relatively peaceful relationship with the Dinka Twic Mayardit. The community leaders of both communities are reportedly seeking measures to resolve the issue traditionally.

Location of Incident: Ukwany Boma, Pachidi Payam, Lafon
Description: 1.	On 14 April, three secondary sources reported that on 10 April, Murle armed elements from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) abducted a two-year-old boy from the Pari community in Ukwany Boma, Pachidi Payam, Lafon County. According to the sources, the Murle armed elements attacked and opened fire on a group of Pari civilians (businessmen and women) who were traveling along the Lafon-Mogiri-Road to Juba, captured one of the women and her two-year-old son and fled towards GPAA, while the others escaped into the nearby bushes for safety. The incident was reported at the Lafon Police station, and investigation is reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: Ukwany Boma, Pachidi Payam, Lafon
Description: 1.	On 14 April, three secondary sources reported that on 10 April, Murle armed elements from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) abducted a two-year-old boy from the Pari community in Ukwany Boma, Pachidi Payam, Lafon County. According to the sources, the Murle armed elements attacked and opened fire on a group of Pari civilians (businessmen and women) who were traveling along the Lafon-Mogiri-Road to Juba, captured one of the women and her two-year-old son and fled towards GPAA, while the others escaped into the nearby bushes for safety. The incident was reported at the Lafon Police station, and investigation is reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: Duony Payam, Cueibet
Description: 2.	On 14 April, multiple sources reported that on 12 April, allied armed Dinka Gok youths from Duony, Pagor and Abiriu Payams shot and killed three male civilians and injured seven others from the Rup subclan of Dinka Agaar section in Duony Payam, Cueibet County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Gok youths attacked Langchok and Apet villages of Malek Payam in Rumbek Centre County and raided an unspecified number of goats and cattle and abducted one male civilian and children (exact number unspecified) as they fled from the scene. Reportedly, local Rup and Kuei youths (of the Dinka Agaar section and residents of Malek Payam) pursued the attackers and in the ensuing confrontation, they recovered the raided goats and freed the abductees. Reportedly, the armed Dinka Rup and Kuei youths were joined by the Dinka Pakam (the Gak and Niel-Niel of Dinka Agaar Section) from Rumbek North County in pursuing the armed Dinka Gok youths, and in the ensuing clash, three Rup civilians were shot and killed and seven others were injured. The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Rumbek Town for medical treatment. The security forces were reportedly deployed to the area to contain the situation.

Location of Incident: Malakal Town, Malakal
Description:
3.	On 14 April, one primary source and one secondary source reported that on 11 April, a group of Dinka youths armed with sticks and machetes attacked and injured four civilians from the Nuer community in Malakal Town, Malakal County. According to the sources, the incident was in retaliation for the injury of 29 soldiers of the South Sudan People’s Defence Forces (SSPDF) most of whom were from the Dinka community, during the ongoing fighting between the SSPDF and the Nuer White army in Nyang Doma Payam, Ulang County. The injured Nuer victims were taken to a health care facility in Malakal Town for medical treatment. 

Comment: Reportedly, the incident resulted in the forced displacement of over 70 Nuer civilians who sought refuge at the SSPDF base in the Egyptian Irrigation settlement in Malakal Town.

Location of Incident: Malak village, Aliek Payam, Tonj North
Description: 4.	On 14 April, three secondary sources reported that on 13 April, armed Nuer youths from Unity State shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Kongor community during an attempted cattle raid in Malak village, Aliek Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the armed Nuer youths attacked and opened fire on a cattle camp in Malak village, killing one of the residents. The attackers also seized an unspecified number of cattle. Reportedly, the local Kongor youths repulsed tr attackers and recovered all of the raided cattle. One armed Nuer youth was reportedly shot and killed during the confrontation.

Location of Incident: Malak village, Aliek Payam, Tonj North
Description: 4.	On 14 April, three secondary sources reported that on 13 April, armed Nuer youths from Unity State shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Kongor community during an attempted cattle raid in Malak village, Aliek Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the armed Nuer youths attacked and opened fire on a cattle camp in Malak village, killing one of the residents. The attackers also seized an unspecified number of cattle. Reportedly, the local Kongor youths repulsed tr attackers and recovered all of the raided cattle. One armed Nuer youth was reportedly shot and killed during the confrontation.

Location of Incident: Ajak-Kuac Town, Ajak-Kuac Payam, Twic
Description:
5.	On 14 April three secondary sources reported that on 11 April, armed Dinka Twic Mayardit youths shot and injured one male civilian from the Dinka Ngok community in Ajak-Kuac Town, Ajak-Kuac Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Twic Mayardit youths intercepted a commercial vehicle at an illegal checkpoint in Ajak-Kuac Town and demanded an unspecified sum of money from the drivers (Somali nationals). Reportedly, the assailants identified the victim as belonging to the Ngok community and in an ensuing altercation, opened fire, injuring him. The victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Abyei for medical treatment.

Comment: According to the sources, one of the assailants was arrested while the others remain at large.

Location of Incident: Wau Town, Wau
Description:
6.	On 14 April, multiple sources reported that on 1 and 2 April, SSNPS personnel arbitrarily arrested and detained 63 male civilians including minors (three 17-year-old boys and one 16-year-old boy) from the Balanda community in Wau Town, Wau County, reportedly on the instructions senior police commanders in Juba. According to the sources, the victims were arrested and detained for their alleged involvement in gang-related activities. The vicitms were reportedly and illtreated (denied food, forced to lie on bare ground, and denied access to their families). The sources further informed that the victims were subsequently transferred to Juba (exact date unspecified) to be reportedly forcefully recruited into the SSNPS as an anti-crime strategy and to fight youth unemployment in the state. 

Comment: According to the sources, some of the victims are students and businesspersons. Reportedly, efforts were made by their family members to secure their release to no avail. The arbitrary arrest, detention, and forceful recruitment of minors and other civilians into the law enforcement constitutes a fundamental violation of their rights to freedom of expression, freedom from deprivation of liberty and a breach to their due process rights to be investigated for the alleged gang-related activities.

Location of Incident: Bungu village, Juba Payam, Juba
Description:
1.	On 15 April, two primary sources reported that on 6 April, suspected SSPDF soldiers raped two women (ages 44 and 70 years old) in Bungu village, Juba Payam, Juba County. As recounted by the sources, the assailants attacked a group of women from the Juba Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) camp 1, who had gone to collect charcoal from the area. Reportedly, the assailants threated to kill and rape them to death and thereafter proceeded to rape the victims. The assailants also confiscated their belongings. The sources further informed that about 40 other women fled into the bushes for safety and their whereabouts remains unknown. 

Comment: HRD will follow-up to gather more information on the incident.

Location of Incident: Bungu village, Juba Payam, Juba

Location of Incident: Ariel Village, Awila Payam, Abiemnom County, Ruwen Administrative Area
Description: 3.	On 15 April, multiple sources reported that on 12 April, armed Bul Nuer youths shot and injured one male civilian (a Somali national) in Ariel Village, Awila Payam, Abiemnom County, Ruwen Administrative Area. According to the sources, the assailants ambushed and opened fire on a convoy of eight commercial transport vehicles (belonging to a construction company) along the Mayom-Abiemnom-Road, injuring one of the drivers. One SSPDF soldier was also reportedly injured. The attackers also seized money and other valuables from the passengers and thereafter fled the scene. The injured civilian was evacuated to a health care facility in Abiemnom County for medical treatment and subsequently transferred to Wau, Western Bahr el Ghazal for advanced medical care for treatment. The injured SSPDF soldier was reportedly evacuated to a health care facility in Juba for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Kuajok Town, Warrap
Description:
4.	On 15 April, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, the NSS arbitrarily arrested, detained and illtreated three male civilians (Speaker of the Warrap State Legislative Assembly, the State Legal Advisor and another Member of Parliament – all affiliated to the Sudan People Liberation Movement – In Opposition (SPLM-IO)) in Kuajok Town, Warrap County. According to the sources, NSS personnel arrested the victims from the State Secretariat where they were attending to an official business and detained incommunicado at the NSS facility in Kuajok. Reportedly, the Legal Advisor suffered inhuman and degrading treatment for resisting arrest and questioning the legality of his arrest. The NSS reportedly denied access to some government officials who attempted to visit them. 

Comment: HRD will follow up to gather more information on the incident including the motive for the arrests.

Location of Incident: Kirik Payam in Kirik and Awul Payams, Tonj North
Description:
5.	On 15 April, multiple sources reported that on 14 April, nine male civilians were shot and killed (six Dinka Leir and three Dinka Noi) during violence between allied armed Dinka Noi and Dinka Nyang youths from Awul and Pagor Payams, respectively, and armed Dinka Lier youths from Kirik Payam in Kirik and Awul Payams, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the allied armed Dinka Noi and Nyang youths attacked and opened fire on a cattle camp of the Dinka Leir community in Kuany-Goi village, Kirik Payam, killing six male civilians. The attackers also seized over 600 heads of cattle and fled into Awul Payam. Reportedly, in retaliation, armed Dinka Leir youths attacked Awul Payam, and shot and killed three male Dinka Noi civilians, and killed one police officer and fled back into Kirik Payam. 

Comment: According to the sources, tension is mounting between the affected communities, with the likelihood of more revenge violence.

Location of Incident: Hai Calvario residential area, Wau Town, Wau
Description:
6.	On 15 April, one primary source and two secondary sources reported that on 13 April, one personnel of the NSS shot and injured one 28-year-old male civilian from the Ngondo community in Hai Calvario residential area, Wau Town, Wau County. According to the sources, the NSS personnel and another individual approached the victim and three other civilians at the victim’s homestead holding a firearm, and when the victim commented that the firearm appeared old, the suspect responded that he could test its functionality on him, and subsequently opened fire injuring the victim. The victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Wau Town for medical treatment. A case was opened at Wau North Police Station and investigations are ongoing, while the suspect remains at large. 

Comment: HRD will continue monitoring the case for due process is followed

Location of Incident: Hidongi Boma, Hiyala Payam, Torit
Description: 1.	On 16 April, three secondary sources reported that on 13 April, armed Lotuko youths from Huma Boma shot and killed one 30-year-old male civilian in Hidongi Boma, Hiyala Payam, Torit County. According to the sources, armed Lotuko youths from Hidongi Boma attacked Lotuko cattle traders from Huma Boma who were bringing their cattle to Torit Town for sale, and raided 20 heads of cattle. In response, the cattle owners and armed youths from Huma Boma attacked Hidongi Boma to recover the raided cattle and in the process, they shot and killed the victim. The armed Lotuko youths from Huma Boma reportedly recovered some of the raided cattle (exact number unspecified). The incident was reported at the Hiyala Police Station; however,  no suspects have been apprehended yet.

Location of Incident: Hidongi Boma, Hiyala Payam, Torit
Description: 1.	On 16 April, three secondary sources reported that on 13 April, armed Lotuko youths from Huma Boma shot and killed one 30-year-old male civilian in Hidongi Boma, Hiyala Payam, Torit County. According to the sources, armed Lotuko youths from Hidongi Boma attacked Lotuko cattle traders from Huma Boma who were bringing their cattle to Torit Town for sale, and raided 20 heads of cattle. In response, the cattle owners and armed youths from Huma Boma attacked Hidongi Boma to recover the raided cattle and in the process, they shot and killed the victim. The armed Lotuko youths from Huma Boma reportedly recovered some of the raided cattle (exact number unspecified). The incident was reported at the Hiyala Police Station; however,  no suspects have been apprehended yet.

Location of Incident: Jongor village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East
Description:
2.	On 16 April, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Thiik youths shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Akook community in Jongor village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the armed Thiik youths attacked and opened fire on Jongor village, killing one of the residents, reportedly in a revenge action for past violence and unresolved grievances between the Dinka Thiik and Dinka Akook communities. 

Comment: Tension is reportedly heightened in the area, with the likelihood of more retaliatory violence.

Location of Incident: in Ikpiro residential area of Yambio town
Description:
•	Unidentified armed elements shot and killed a pregnant woman in Ikpiro residential area, Yambio town;
On 18 April, three secondary sources including the police reported that at about 7:30 pm on 17 April, unidentified armed elements shot and killed a 29-year-old woman from the Azande community in Ikpiro residential area of Yambio town. According to the sources, the armed assailants opened fire on the homestead of the victim, which subsequently resulted in her death. Reportedly, the victim’s husband, a civilian, fled the scene during the incident. Reportedly, a neighbour of the victim is a South Sudan People’s Defence Forces (SSPDF) soldier; however, the motive behind the attack remains unknown at the time of reporting. The incident was reported at Yambio Police Station; however, no suspects have been apprehended.

Location of Incident: outside of Pieri in Pieri Payam, Uror
Description:
Armed Murle elements allegedly attack a cattle camp and shoot and kill a civilian and injure another and raid undetermined heads of cattle in Pieri, Pieri Payam, Uror County, Jonglei State

On 17 April HRD received information from multiple sources that include County officials and CSOs that on 16 April at around 13:30 hours, a group of armed Murle elements allegedly attacked a cattle camp just outside of Pieri in Pieri Payam, Uror County, Jonglei State (four hours walking from Yuai) and raided undetermined heads of cattle. Reportedly, during the raid the assailants shot at civilians present in the area killing one Lou Nuer male civilian and injuring another. According to the sources, local youth pursued the assailants and managed to recover some of the cattle, but 31 heads of cattle were not recovered. Reportedly, the youth returned to Pieri yesterday, and the injured victim is currently receiving treatment at the MSF clinic in Pieri

Location of Incident: Juong village of Kai Gai payam in Leer
Description:
•	Armed men shot and killed a 65-year-old local chief in Juong village, Kai gai payam of Leer County on 17 April 2025.

On 17 April 2025, multiple secondary sources from local authorities in Leer County informed HRD that a local chief (name on file) aged around 65, was shot and later succumbed to his wounds by unknown gunmen in Juong village of Kai Gai payam in Leer County on 17 April 2025. The sources described that the incident happened at around 1:30 AM when three unidentified arm men (two men with AK47 guns   and one unarmed) attacked the house of the local chief of Kai Gai Payam of Leer County at block 6 in Juong settlement. According to the sources, one among the two-armed men dressed in military attire (no precision of which military) and the victims was shoot three times on his armpit, hand and neck. He was taken immediately to Leer humanitarian hospital but succumbed to his injuries at around 7 AM on 17 April. The motive for the shooting and killing has been substantiated.  The local police were deployed to the scene, but the assailants had already fled, and the police are trying to trace their whereabout so they can be brought to justice. The sources added that despite the incident, the security and human rights situation in Leer County is calm and stable.

Comment: The killing of the chief happened when the mobile court is present in Leer. The Mobile Court investigators and prosecutors of the mobile court visited the scene this morning and will be involved in the investigation. HRD hopes the assailants are apprehended and the hearings are done in good time so that they are held accountable.

Location of Incident: Lomuko, Yei Town Payam, Yei River
Description:
•	A 19 -Year-Old girl raped by unidentified armed group of people in Lomuko, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County.

On April 17, 2025, HRD FYO received information from two secondary sources, the health service provider and social worker (details on file) regarding the unfortunate incident of rape of a 19-Year-old girl (details on file) from Kakwa community by unidentified armed group of men in Lomuko village, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County. 
Sources reported that around 22:00 hours on Wednesday, April 15, 2025, the girl aged 19 years (details on file) from Lomuko 2, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County while returning home  in company of  her three siblings,  was accosted by four unknown men armed with a gun, panga and knife   who forced her to nearby abandoned  building structure and raped. Three of the  perpetrators undressed and held her as  fourth one raped the girl. The survivor reported to one of the health centres for medical care. The survivor was also advised to report the matter to the police for further investigations.
Comment: This gruesome act of rape by armed elements is a serious human rights concern and violate the bodily integrity and privacy of the person  centrally to human rights standards and South Sudan national Laws. The incident was perpetrated by unidentified men an environment  and an  area which is still  in conflict zone which  may qualifies the incident to be  classified as conflict related sexual violence.

Location of Incident: Hai Simba, Yei Town Payam, Yei River
Description:
A 22-Year-old woman raped by unknown civilian in Hai Simba, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County
On April 17, 2025, HRD FYO received information from two secondary sources, the health service providers (details on file) regarding rape of a 22-Year-Old woman (details on file) from Kakwa community by unidentified civilian man  in Hai Simba, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County. 
Sources revealed that that on March 30, 2025, around 2145hrs a woman was raped by unknown person from her own house. The survivor reported to police and later to one of the health centres in Yei for medical care. The matter was referred  to police for further investigations.

Location of Incident: Tambura town, tambura
Description:
•	Unidentified armed elements abduct four male civilians in Tambura town, Tambura County;
On 17 April, multiple independent sources including the CID reported that from 11 to 12 April, unidentified armed elements suspected to be linked to the SPLA-IO abducted at least 4 male civilians, including a 17-year-old boy in Tambura town, Tambura County. According to the sources, the armed assailants abducted four male civilians from Hayat IDP camp and an unspecified number of male civilians from a funeral ceremony on 12 April. Reportedly, the abduction is part of an alleged attempt to forcibly recruit civilians into the SPLA-IO located in Duma payam, Tambura County. According to sources, one of the victims was released by his abductors on 13 April after falling ill. The incident was reported at the Tambura Police Station; however, no suspects have been identified or apprehended.

Location of Incident: Ukwany Boma, Pachidi Payam, Lafon County
Description:
On 17 April 2025, HRD followed up with three reliable secondary sources on the reported incident of inter-communal abduction related ambush attack where a 37-year-old unarmed Pari businessman was shot and injured by armed Murle youths and the respondents confirmed that the incident occurred on 9 April 2025 along Lafon-Mogiri Road in Ukwany Boma, Pachidi Payam, Lafon County along Lafon-Mogiri Road as earlier reported.
According to the respondents, at about 13:00 hours, on 9 April 2025, undetermined number of armed Murle youth laid an ambush along Lafon-Mogiri Road with the intention to abduct Pari children. Reportedly, about 15 unarmed Pari businessmen and women and four children accompanied by their mothers were on their way from Juba to Lafon when they fell into an ambush laid by armed Murle youths from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA). Sources have it that the armed Murle men attacked the travelers with the intent to abduct the children, but they failed because the driver did not stop the vehicle. The random shooting of the travelers resulted in the injuring of one 37-year-old Pari man. As noted by the sources, the motive of the shooting was to stop the driver and allow the armed Murle men to abduct the children.
 The injured man is reportedly receiving medical attention at the Lafon Primary Health Care Center and the incident was reported at the Lafon Police Station, where investigation is said to be ongoing, but no suspect has been apprehended.

Comment: HRD will continue to follow up on developments and report accordingly.

Location of Incident: Baggari Payam, Wau
Description:
5.	On 17 April, two secondary sources reported that, on 13 April, elements of the SPLA-IO illtreated, arbitrarily arrested and detained seven civilians (including two women) in Momoi Block B residential area of Baggari Payam, Wau County. According to the sources, the victims were ill-treated, arrested and detained following a squabble which broke out on the 12 April between a relative to the victims and a SPLA-IO element over a failed commercial arrangement with a senior SPLA-IO officer. Reportedly, during the altercation, the relative to the victims escaped with the firearm of the SPLA-IO element, and on the following day the SPLA-IO elements stormed the area, beating up other civilians including the victims and subsequently arresting and detaining them. 

Comment: The SPLA-IO elements have promised to release the victims only upon the return of the suspect and returning of the stolen firearm.

Location of Incident: Ngorok, Manyin-gak and Irith villages in Manyabol Payam, Gumuruk
Description: 1.	Between 17-22 April, one secondary source reported that on 3 March, allied armed Dinka Bor and Lou Nuer youths shot and killed three civilians (a 55-year-old woman, a 32-year-old man and a 20-year-old man), injured three other male civilians (aged 3, 23, and 47 years), and abducted 19 other civilians including three women (aged 19, 23, and 34 years) and 16 children (details unspecified) in Ngorok, Manyin-gak and Irith villages in Manyabol Payam, Gumuruk County- GPAA. According to the source, these incidents were part of the cyclical and retaliatory intercommunal violence between the communities in Jonglei State.

Location of Incident: Ngorok, Manyin-gak and Irith villages in Manyabol Payam, Gumuruk
Description: 1. According to the source, these incidents were part of the cyclical and retaliatory intercommunal violence between the communities in Jonglei State.

Location of Incident: Lokichar Mountain village, Vulvet Payam, Gumuruk
Description: 2.	Between 19-22 April, one secondary source reported that on 2 March, armed Lou Nuer youths from Jonglei State, shot and killed 14 civilians (six men, five women and three children-ages unspecified), injured six other civilians (four men and two children-ages unspecified) and abducted 15 children (ages unspecified) from the Murle community in Lokichar Mountain village, Vulvet Payam, Gumuruk County-GPAA. According to the source, the assailants proceeded to raid an unspecified number of cattle from 14 homesteads and fled the scene. Reportedly, this incident was part of the cycle of violence and retaliatory cattle raid between the communities in Jonglei State and GPAA.

Location of Incident: Lokichar Mountain village, Vulvet Payam, Gumuruk
Description: 2.	Between 19-22 April, one secondary source reported that on 2 March, armed Lou Nuer youths from Jonglei State, shot and killed 14 civilians (six men, five women and three children-ages unspecified), injured six other civilians (four men and two children-ages unspecified) and abducted 15 children (ages unspecified) from the Murle community in Lokichar Mountain village, Vulvet Payam, Gumuruk County-GPAA. According to the source, the assailants proceeded to raid an unspecified number of cattle from 14 homesteads and fled the scene. Reportedly, this incident was part of the cycle of violence and retaliatory cattle raid between the communities in Jonglei State and GPAA.

Location of Incident: Yuakuach Boma, Chuil Payam, Nyirol
Description: 3.	On 22 April, multiple sources reported that on 16 April, Murle armed elements from GPAA, shot and killed two male civilians (details unspecified) and injured six others all from the Lou Nuer community in Yuakuach Boma, Chuil Payam, Nyirol County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked and opened fire on the victims while they were tending to their cattle in Yuakuach Boma and proceeded to raid an unspecified number of cattle and fled the scene. Reportedly, the local Lou Nuer youths mobilized and pursued the assailants and recovered some of the stolen cattle (unspecified number), while the injured victims were evacuated to a health facility in Lankien Payam for treatment.

Location of Incident: Yuakuach Boma, Chuil Payam, Nyirol
Description: 3. According to the sources, the assailants attacked and opened fire on the victims while they were tending to their cattle in Yuakuach Boma and proceeded to raid an unspecified number of cattle and fled the scene. Reportedly, the local Lou Nuer youths mobilized and pursued the assailants and recovered some of the stolen cattle (unspecified number), while the injured victims were evacuated to a health facility in Lankien Payam for treatment.

Location of Incident: Lankien Payam, Nyirol
Description: 4.	On 22 April, multiple sources reported that on 21 April, Murle armed elements from GPAA, shot and killed one male Lou Nuer civilian and injured another in Thol swamps in Lankien Payam, Nyirol County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked a group of Lou Nuer cattle grazers tending to their cattle in Thol swampy area, killing one and injured another and raided an unspecified number of cattle and fled the scene. Reportedly, the local Lou Nuer youths mobilized and pursued the assailants killing two of them in the process and recovering all the raided cattle, while the injured victim was taken to a health facility in Lankien Payam for treatment.

Location of Incident: Lankien Payam, Nyirol
Description: 4. Location of Incident: Kuajok town, Warrap
Description: 5.	On 22 April, one secondary source reported that on 19 April, personnel of the NSS arbitrarily arrested and detained one male civilian (State Legal Advisor), in Kuajok town, Warrap County. According to the source, the victim and two other civilians (Speaker of Warrap Legislative Assembly and the Chairperson of the SPLM/IO in Warrap State and the Official Spokesmen of the SPLM/ IO) were arrested and detained by the NSS on 15 April [see HRD Daily Report 16 April 2025]. Reportedly, on 17 April, the victim was released from NSS detention and handed to the SSPDF military intelligence where he was coerced to pledge allegiance to the Sudan People Liberation Movement-In Government (SPLM-IG) or be killed. The victim was released on 18 April after a media statement declaring his defecting to SPLM-IG, but after he was confronted by his comrades of the SPLM-IO, he reported to have been coerced and that he is still loyal to the SPLM-IO. The NSS rearrested and detained the victim on 19 April, with the other two other victims who were still in their custody.

Location of Incident: Madhel village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East
Description: 6.	Between 18-22 April, three secondary sources reported that on 17 April, armed Dinka Thiik youths shot and killed one male Dinka Akook civilian (age unspecified) in Madhel village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County. According to the source the assailants attacked the Dinka Akook community in Madhel village, shot and killed the victim, in the context of intercommunal retaliatory violence. Reportedly, the armed Dinka Akook youths are mobilizing for a revenge attack against the Dinka Thiik community who violated the peace agreement and attacked their community.

Location of Incident: Ayom village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj South
Description:
7.	Between 18-22 April, three secondary sources reported that on 16 April, allied Dinka Yar and Muok youths shot and killed three male Dinka Thony civilians (ages unspecified) in Ayom village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked the Dinka Thony community in Ayom village in the context of retaliatory violence and cattle raid, shot and killed the victims and raided over 200 heads of cattle and fled the scene. Reportedly, no arrests have been made in connection with this incident.

Comment: HRD will continue to monitor these reports from Warrap State, as tension is reportedly being built up in these hot spots with the possibility of further violence.

Location of Incident: Ayom village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj South
Description:
7.	Between 18-22 April, three secondary sources reported that on 16 April, allied Dinka Yar and Muok youths shot and killed three male Dinka Thony civilians (ages unspecified) in Ayom village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked the Dinka Thony community in Ayom village in the context of retaliatory violence and cattle raid, shot and killed the victims and raided over 200 heads of cattle and fled the scene. Reportedly, no arrests have been made in connection with this incident.

Comment: HRD will continue to monitor these reports from Warrap State, as tension is reportedly being built up in these hot spots with the possibility of further violence.

Location of Incident: Mapiso boma, Tambura payam, Tambura
Description:
8.	On 22 April, two secondary sources reported that on 18 April, suspected SPLA-IO elements abducted one male civilian from the Balanda Community in Mapiso boma, Tambura payam, Tambura County. According to the sources, unidentified armed elements suspected to be members of the SPLA-IO ambushed and attacked two male civilians from the Balanda community while they were traveling with a motorcycle from Nagero County. Reportedly, one of the victims escaped and the abducted victim was released after a ransom of 10,000 South Sudanese Pounds (SSP) was paid to the abductors and the issue was reported to the Tambura Police although no arrests have been made. 

Comment: HRD will continue to follow up on the incident for more information.

Location of Incident: Kanamarues Boma, Kauto Payam, Kapoeta East
Description:
1.	On 23 April, three secondary sources reported that, on 22 April, Murle armed elements from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA), shot and killed one 21-year-old male Toposa civilian in Kanamarues Boma, Kauto Payam, Kapoeta East County. According to the sources, the assailants invaded Kanamarues Boma to raid cattle belonging to the Toposa community when they saw the victim in a grazing field in the area, shot and killed him to prevent him from raising an alarm. The incident was reported to the Nanyangachor Police Station and investigations are ongoing.

Comment: The armed Toposa youth mobilized and traced the assailants in the nearby bushes about 300 in number and could not retaliate because they were outnumbered. Reports have it that the Toposa armed youths are also mobilizing to retaliate against the Murle armed elements. HRD will continue to monitor the situation for more information.

Location of Incident: Patuet Village, Panyang Payam, Duk
Description: 2.	On 23 April, multiple sources reported that on 22 April, Murle armed elements from GPAA, shot and killed two civilians (male and female- ages unspecified) from the Dinka community in Patuet Village, Panyang Payam, Duk County. According to the sources, the incident happened when the Murle armed elements attacked a group of Dinka civilians while they were grazing their cattle, and the women were collecting firewood. Reportedly, the assailants proceeded to raid an unspecified number of cattle although the Dinka Bor youths mobilized the recovered the stolen cattle.

Location of Incident: Potpotni area, Dengjok Payam, Akobo
Description: 3.	On 23 April, multiple sources reported that, on 22 April, Murle armed elements shot and killed two male civilians (unspecified details) and injured three others (unspecified details) all from the Lou Nuer community in Potpotni area, Dengjok Payam, Akobo County. According to the sources, the assailants ambushed a group of Lou Nuer civilians (including men, women and children) traveling from Akobo East (Akobo town) to Akobo West (Walgak) for business and opened fire on the commercial passenger vehicles killing and wounding the victims. Reportedly, the injured victims were evacuated to a health facility in Akobo town for treatment as the local population fended off the assailants.

Location of Incident: Potpotni area, Dengjok Payam, Akobo
Description: 3.	On 23 April, multiple sources reported that, on 22 April, Murle armed elements shot and killed two male civilians (unspecified details) and injured three others (unspecified details) all from the Lou Nuer community in Potpotni area, Dengjok Payam, Akobo County. According to the sources, the assailants ambushed a group of Lou Nuer civilians (including men, women and children) traveling from Akobo East (Akobo town) to Akobo West (Walgak) for business and opened fire on the commercial passenger vehicles killing and wounding the victims. Reportedly, the injured victims were evacuated to a health facility in Akobo town for treatment as the local population fended off the assailants.

Location of Incident: Manyabol
Description: 4.	On 23 April, two secondary sources reported that, on 17 April, one child victim of abduction (one-year-old boy) from Eastern Equatoria State, was recovered by authorities in Manyabol Payam, GPAA. According to the sources, the child was abducted by the Murle armed elements from Vulvet Payam (date unspecified) during an attack on a commercial passenger vehicle traveling to Lafon County in which the victim’s mother was shot and killed. Reportedly, the abductors handed over the child to the authorities after an intense negotiation with GPAA authorities and some police officers. The child is under protective custody awaiting tracing and reunification with his family.

Location of Incident: Gok Machar town, Aweil North
Description: 5.	On 23 April, one secondary source reported that on 15 April, armed Rezeigat pastoralists from East Dafur state of Sudan, attacked and injured one male Dinka Malual civilian (commercial motorcyclist) in Gok Machar town, Aweil North County. According to the source, the victim was transporting the suspects from Gok Machar town to Kiir Adem area in Aweil North County, when he was ordered by the suspects to drive to an unknown location between Gok Macar and Kiir Adem. Reportedly, when the victim resisted, they attacked him with sticks and knives, injuring him in the process and stole his motorcycle and fled the scene. The injured victim was evacuated to a health facility in Nyamlel in Aweil West County for treatment.

Location of Incident: Malual-Muok village, Tonj Payam, Tonj South
Description: 6.	On 23 April, four secondary sources reported that on 22 April, armed Dinka Thony youths from Manyangok Payam shot and injured one male Dinka Apuk-jurwir civilian in Malual-Muok village, Tonj Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, the assailants ambushed and shot the victim, while he was traveling on his motorcycle from Thiet Town to Tonj Town and they fled into Manyangok Payam, in the context of past and unresolved grievances between the communities. Reportedly, the victim was taken to a health facility in Tonj town for treatment and the police and security forces are investigating the incident although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Akol-Awet village in Awul Payam, Tonj North
Description: 7.	On 23 April, three secondary sources reported that, on 18 April, suspected armed Dinka Awan youths from Rualbet Payam, shot and injured one male Dinka Apuk-Patoc civilian in Akol-Awet village in Awul Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the assailants ambushed and opened fire on one commercial vehicle contracted by a humanitarian organization for food distribution in Athieng-Pol village in Akop Payam, and in the process shot and injured the victim onboard the vehicle in the context of the ongoing intercommunal violence between the Dinka Noi and Leir in Awul Payam against the Dinka Awan of Kirik and Rualbet Payams. Reportedly, the victim was taken to a health facility in Warrap town and later transferred to Wau and evacuated to Juba for treatment.

Location of Incident: Akimo Village, Khor Jamus Boma, Rocrocdong Payam, Jur River
Description:
8.	On 23 April, one primary source and one two secondary sources reported that on 21 April, SPLA-IO elements gang-raped one 60-year-old woman in in Akimo Village, Khor Jamus Boma, Rocrocdong Payam, Jur River County. According to the sources, the suspects invaded the victim’s homestead in the late hours of 21 April, blindfolded and forced her out into the nearby bushes and gang-raped her at gunpoint. Reportedly, the victim reported the incident to the traditional authorities who referred the case to the police and two suspects have been apprehended and detained pending investigation. 

Comment: The primary source mentioned that the victim was able to identify one of the suspects before she was blindfolded, and he remains at large  while two others are detained.

Location of Incident: Hurchul farm area, Ngauro Boma, Ngauro Payam, Budi
Description: 1.	On 24 April, three secondary sources reported that, on 23 April, Armed Toposa youths from Namoruyang Payam, Kapoeta South County, shot and killed one 32-year-old male Didinga civilian in Hurchul farm area, Ngauro Boma, Ngauro Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked and opened fire on a group of Didinga farmers (male and female-other details unspecified) while they were   farming in Ngauro Boma, killing the victim in the process. Reportedly, the incident was based on a dispute between the two communities on the farmland over which the Toposa community laid exclusive claim. The incident was reported to the Ngauro police and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Pagak Payam, Duk
Description: 2.	On 24 April, multiple sources reported that on 22 April, Murle armed elements for Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA), shot and injured one male Dinka civilian in Pagak Payam, Duk County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked and shot at a group of Dinka cattle grazers while they were grazing their cattle, injuring the victim and raided an unspecified number of cattle and fled the scene. Reportedly, the local Dinka youths mobilized and pursued the assailants and recovered the raided cattle, while the injured victim was administered first aid while pending evacuation to Duk Padiet for treatment.

Location of Incident: Pagak Payam, Duk
Description: 2.	On 24 April, multiple sources reported that on 22 April, Murle armed elements for Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA), shot and injured one male Dinka civilian in Pagak Payam, Duk County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked and shot at a group of Dinka cattle grazers while they were grazing their cattle, injuring the victim and raided an unspecified number of cattle and fled the scene. Reportedly, the local Dinka youths mobilized and pursued the assailants and recovered the raided cattle, while the injured victim was administered first aid while pending evacuation to Duk Padiet for treatment.

Location of Incident: Tor Payam, Alieny County, RAA
Description:
3.	On 24 April, three secondary sources reported that on 23 April, one civilian (details unspecified) was shot and killed and three other male civilians injured during violence between the Leek Nuer youths from Rotriak Boma, Budang Payam in Rubkona County, and the SSPDF in Tor Payam, Alieny County, RAA. According to the sources, armed Leek Nuer youths invaded Tor Payam and attacked Tor cattle grazers injuring three male victims and raided over 350 heads of cattle. Reportedly, while they were attempting to leave, they clashed with the SSPDF and in the ensuing confrontation, three persons were shot and killed (one civilian victim from Tor Payam and two SSPDF soldiers), while 300 heads of cattle were recovered and the armed Leek Nuer youths escaped unscathed with 50 heads of cattle. 

Comment: The situation is reportedly tense in Alieny County as fighting is said to be ongoing. HRD will continue to monitor and report accordingly.

Location of Incident: Toch area, Akop Payam, Tonj North
Description:
4.	On 24 April, three secondary sources reported that on 13 April, armed Nuer youths from Unity State, shot and killed three male Dinka Apuk-Patoc civilians (ages unspecified) and injured another male civilian (age unspecified) in Toch area, Akop Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked and opened fire on a group of Dinka Apuk-Patoc cattle herders while they were grazing their cattle, killing and injuring the victims and raided over 100 heads of cattle and fled into Unity State. Reportedly, the injured victim was taken to a health facility in Akop Payam for treatment.

Comment: The situation is reportedly tense, with information circulating that many armed Nuer youths are still lurking in the area with the possibility for further attacks. HRD will continue to monitor the situation for more information.

Location of Incident: outskirt of Warowaro Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos
Description: 1.	On 25 April, three secondary sources reported that, on 21 April, armed Dongotono youths from Chahari Payam Ikotos County, shot and killed one male Buya civilian in outskirt of Warowaro Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos County. According to the sources, armed Buya youths from Kimotong Payam, Budi County attacked the Kraal cattle camp in Warowaro Boma to raid cattle, but they were fended off by the armed Dongotono youths. Reportedly, as the armed Dongotono youths pursued the assailants to the outskirts of Warowaro Boma, they found the victim and shot him dead. The incident was reported to the Chahari police and investigations are underway although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Yuai, Uror County, Jonglei State, to Gei Payam, Likuangole
Description: 2.	On 24 and 25 April, one primary source reported that, on 20 April, two victims of abduction (a 20-year-old woman and her two-year-old boy) were recovered by authorities in Likuangole County, GPAA. The source recounted that, the woman was abducted from Yuai, Uror County, Jonglei State, to Gei Payam, Likuangole County, GPAA, by the Murle armed elements in 2014. Reportedly, during this time, the victim was  subjected to varying forms of Sexual and Gender-Based Violence (SGBV) including early and forced marriage, physical assault, and raped by her imposed husband leading to the birth of her two-year-old son. According to the source, the victim managed to escape from her abductors and was transported by the South Sudan People’s Defense Forces (SSPDF) and handed over to the Likuangole County authorities who have traced her family in Uror County and awaiting family reunification.

Location of Incident: Tiap-Tiap Payam, Cueibet
Description: 3.	On 25 April, multiple sources reported that on 23 April, four male Dinka Kongor civilians (ages unspecified) were shot and killed and seven others (all male- ages unspecified) were injured during violence between armed Dinka Amuol youths and armed Dinka Kongor youths (both from the Panya Section of Dinka Gok) in Tiap-Tiap Payam, Cueibet County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Amuol youths attacked the Dinka Kongor community in revenge for the impregnation of a Dinka Amuol civilian by a man from the Kongor subsection. Reportedly, in the ensuing confrontation five people were killed (one Dinka Amuol and four Dinka Kongor) and ten were injured (three Dinka Amuol and seven Dinka Kongor). The injured victims were taken to a health facility in Cueibet town and one in critical condition was evacuated to a health facility in Rumbek town for treatment.

Location of Incident: Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East
Description: 4.	On 27 April, four secondary sources reported that, on 26 April, 12 male civilians (three Dinka Thiik, two Dinka Jalual, and seven Dinka Akook- ages unspeficied) were shot and killed and 20 others [six male Dinka Thiik, four Dinka Jalual-including two females (ages unspecified), and 10 Dinka Akook-including four females (ages unspecified)] in Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Akook civilians attacked two cattle camps in Waath and Jongor villages, in a classical cattle raid expedition, shot and killed three male Dinka Thiik and two Dinka Jalual civilians, injured six Dinka Thiik civilians and four Dinka Jalual civilians and raided 400 heads of cattle and fled the scene. Reportedly, in retaliation, the armed Dinka Thiik youths mobilized and pursued the assailants and attacked the Dinka Akook community in Wun-Yiik village killing seven male Dinka Akook civilians and injuring 10 others and burning over 18 homesteads. The injured victims in the first incident were taken to a health facility in Tonj town for treatment, while the injured in the retaliatory attack were taken to a health facility in Ngabagok Payam for treatment.

Location of Incident: Mareng village in Alabek Payam Tonj North
Description:
5.	On 27 April, three secondary sources reported that, on 26 April, armed Nuer youths from Unity State, shot and injured two male Dinka Lou-Ariik civilians in Mareng village in Alabek Payam Tonj North County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked the Lou-Ariik community in Mareng village, with intent to raid cattle, and opened fire on civilians, injuring the victims. Reportedly, the armed Lou-Ariik civilians mobilized and fended off the assailants while the injured victims were taken to a health facility in Alabek Payam for treatment. 

Comment: Tension remains high in the area as many armed Nuer youths are reportedly lurking in the area. HRD will continue to monitor the situation for more information.

Location of Incident: Ruom-yar Boma, Abiemnom County, Ruweng Administrative Area (RAA)
Description:
6.	Between 23-25 April, multiple primary sources reported that from 1-3 April allied Nuer White army and SPLA-IO elements, shot and killed 51 civilians (details unspecified) and injured 49 others (details unspecified), in Ruom-yar Boma, Abiemnom County, Ruweng Administrative Area (RAA). According to the sources, on 1 April, the assailants attacked and shot at local cattle grazers in Ruom-yar Boma, killing four civilians and raided an unspecified number of cattle and fled the scene. The following day, the same group of assailants reattacked the community and sporadically shot at civilians killing 43 civilians and injuring 49 others, and an unspecified number of children (details unspecified) reportedly drowned in a river while escaping from the violence. Reportedly, on 3 April, the assailants pursued the civilians who were dispaplace to Rubkona, there they shot and killed four others while the others fled to Ajakuac Payam in Twic County, Warrap State for safety. 

Comment: This incident resulted in the massive displacement of approximately 3,477 IDPs (1,200 males, 2,240 females, excluding 30 elderly persons and seven persons with disability) representing 827 households.

Location of Incident: Ruom-yar Boma, Abiemnom County, Ruweng Administrative Area (RAA)
Description:
6.	Between 23-25 April, multiple primary sources reported that from 1-3 April allied Nuer White army and SPLA-IO elements, shot and killed 51 civilians (details unspecified) and injured 49 others (details unspecified), in Ruom-yar Boma, Abiemnom County, Ruweng Administrative Area (RAA). •	51 Civilians killed and 49 others injured, all from the Dinka Ruweng community by SPLA-io elements and the While army community-based militia from the Nuer tribe, in the administrative area of the Ruweng Abimnom county in the Unity State.

On 23 April 2025, HRD visited the internally displaced persons (IDP) site in Hai Biliphm, Wau Municipality, Wau County, to document the experiences of IDPs from the Dinka Ruweng community displaced by intercommunal violence in Unity State. HRD collected testimonies detailing incidents of attacks, looting, killings, and destruction of civilian property. During the visit, HRD interviewed six civilians from the Dinka Ruweng tribe, including three females aged 24, 65, and 60, and three males aged 50, 48, and 62, all former residents of Abimnom County. The interviewees reported that their entire community was forcibly displaced and sought refuge in Wau town to escape the violence.
The survivors recounted that on 1 April 2025, at approximately 3 PM, armed SPLA-IO elements from the Nuer tribe, supported by community-based militias from the White Army under the command of SPLA-IO Major General Gai Mashik, attacked their community. The attackers opened fire on four local youths who were herding cattle, killing them (names on file), and raided an unspecified number of cattle. 
The following day, 2 April, at 7 AM, the attackers returned in larger numbers, storming the area and indiscriminately shooting at civilians. This second attack resulted in the deaths of 43 civilians and injuries to 49 others. The survivors described the attackers as well-organized, heavily armed, and wearing military uniforms. They looted civilian properties, raided all livestock, and burned homes to the ground. Amid the chaos, some children tragically drowned while attempting to escape by crossing a river (exact numbers and details were not provided).
Further testimonies revealed that IDPs from Abimnom fled to the UNMISS site in Rubkona, only to be denied access to the facilities and stuck at the gate. On 3 April 2025, at 9 PM, armed SPLA-IO elements and White Army militias followed the displaced civilians to the gate and launched a third attack, killing four civilians (names not provided). Fearing for their lives, the IDPs fled to Ajak Kuch village in Twic County, Warrap State, before eventually using commercial vehicles to travel to Wau, where they arrived seeking safety.
Among those killed in the attacks was a 65-year-old male executive chief of the Ruweng administrative area. HRD noted that approximately 3,477 IDPs, representing 827 households, have fled the conflict and continue to arrive in Wau town daily. The displaced population includes 1,200 males, 2,240 females, 30 elders, and 7 individuals with disabilities.

Location of Incident: Kergulu village, Goja Boma, Otogo Payam, Yei River
Description: 1.	On 28 April, four secondary sources reported that, on 26 April, suspected NAS elements shot and killed one pregnant 35-year-old woman and injured one 40-year-old woman and a 20-year-old man all from the Kakwa community, in Kergulu village, Goja Boma, Otogo Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, the assailants ambushed a commercial passenger vehicle transporting traders and one soldier of the South Sudan People’s Defence Forces (SSPDF) from the Omabachi market to Yei town. Reportedly, there was a shootout between the SSPDF soldier and the assailants which led to the death and injury of the victims including the SSPDF soldier. The injured civilian victims were taken to a health facility in Yei town for treatment and on 28 April, the injured woman was evacuated to Juba for advanced treatment. Security forces were deployed to the area, but the assailants had fled the scene.

Location of Incident: Yei town, Yei River
Description:
2.	On 28 April, three secondary sources reported that, on 26 April, an officer of the SSNPS, assaulted and killed one 35-year-old male civilian from the Kakwa community in Yei town, Yei River County. According to the sources, the incident happened after an altercation between the SSNPS officer and another male civilian (garage owner) over the ownership of disputed land on which a garage was built. Reportedly, the SSNPS officer was enraged, went home and returned with a machete and grievously assaulted the victim (another worker at the garage) who succumbed to his injuries before he could get medical attention, and the officer fled the scene. 

Comment: The SSNPS personnel officer reported himself to the police, after learning of the victim’s passing, while the garage owner and another male civilian and worker at the garage (aged 19 years) were arrested by the police for investigation.

Location of Incident: Bilingi village, Nyameni Boma, Lori Payam, Juba
Description:
3.	On 28 April, one primary source reported that on 28 March soldiers of the SSPDF, shot and killed one female civilian from the Nuer community (details unspecified) and arbitrarily arrested, detained, illtreated and extorted three other civilians (one female civilian and two male civilians from Western Equatoria State- other details unspecified) all from the Nuer community, in Bilingi village, Nyameni Boma, Lori Payam, Juba County. The source recounted that, the female civilian victim was shot and killed while escaping during an SSPDF attack on a Sudan People Liberation Army-In Opposition (SPLA-IO) position in Bilingi village. According to the source, the SSPDF proceeded to arrest, detain and ill-treated the other civilians after allegedly profiling them to be from the Nuer tribe, confiscated their valuables including 1,000,000 South Sudanese Pounds (SSP) and 700.00 United States Dollars (USD) which was shared between the soldiers and an extra 100,000 SSP from the female victim, used to get some basic food supplies for the victims after five days without food while the two male victims were beaten severely with the butt plate of their rifles while their feet were tied to trees. Reportedly, the victims were subsequently transferred to the SSPDF barracks in Juba, and upon arrival, the female victim was unconditionally released. The two male victims are still being detained. 

Comment: While there is need for further corroboration, this incident speaks into a developing trend of targeted attacks against the people from the Nuer community in different states and HRD will continue to monitor the situation.
