On 28 April, one primary source reported that on 28 March soldiers of the SSPDF, shot and killed one female civilian from the Nuer community (details unspecified) and arbitrarily arrested, detained, illtreated and extorted three other civilians (one female civilian and two male civilians from Western Equatoria State- other details unspecified) all from the Nuer community, in Bilingi village, Nyameni Boma, Lori Payam, Juba County. The source recounted that, the female civilian victim was shot and killed while escaping during an SSPDF attack on a Sudan People Liberation Army-In Opposition (SPLA-IO) position in Bilingi village. According to the source, the SSPDF proceeded to arrest, detain and ill-treated the other civilians after allegedly profiling them to be from the Nuer tribe, confiscated their valuables including 1,000,000 South Sudanese Pounds (SSP) and 700.00 United States Dollars (USD) which was shared between the soldiers and an extra 100,000 SSP from the female victim, used to get some basic food supplies for the victims after five days without food while the two male victims were beaten severely with the butt plate of their rifles while their feet were tied to trees. Reportedly, the victims were subsequently transferred to the SSPDF barracks in Juba, and upon arrival, the female victim was unconditionally released. The two male victims are still being detained. 

Comment: While there is need for further corroboration, this incident speaks into a developing trend of targeted attacks against the people from the Nuer community in different states and HRD will continue to monitor the situation.

Location of Incident: Odemo Boma, Lokiliri Payam, Juba
Description: 4.	On 28 April, three secondary sources reported that, on 24 April, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one 50-year-old male civilian in Odemo Boma, Lokiliri Payam, Juba County. According to the sources, the assailants intercepted the victim, forced him to his home and while the victim resisted them, they shot and killed him and fled the scene. Reportedly, the following day the same group of assailants ambushed a commercial passenger vehicle between Kubi and Aru Junction, traveling from Juba to Kampala (Uganda), and extorted money and other valuables from the passengers although no casualties were reported.

Location of Incident: Tirangore Boma, Hiyala Payam, Torit
Description: 5.	On 28 April, three secondary sources reported that, on 27 April, armed Lutoko youths from Mura-Hatiha Boma, shot and injured one 31-year-old male civilian from Tirangore Boma, in Tirangore Boma, Hiyala Payam, Torit County. According to the sources, the assailants shot and injured the victim while he was farming in Tirangore Boma, in retaliation for the killing of a 27-year-old male civilian from Mura-Hatiha Boma by armed youths from Tirangore Boma [see HRD Daily Report 14 April 2025]. Reportedly, the injured victim was taken to a health facility in Hiyala Payam for treatment, while the incident was reported to the Hiyala police and investigations are underway although no arrest has been made.

Location of Incident: Toi village, Pieri Payam, Uror
Description:
6.	On 28 April, multiple sources reported that on 26 April, Murle armed elements from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) shot and killed five male Lou Nuer civilians and injured another in Toi village, Pieri Payam, Uror County. According to the sources, the Murle invaded the Pullual grazing in Pieri Payam and raided over 3000 heads of cattle and fled the scene. Reportedly, the local Lou Nuer youth mobilized and pursued the assailants and in the ensuing confrontation, five Lou Nuer civilians were shot and killed, one injured and about 2940 heads of cattle were recovered from the Murle. The injured victim was taken to a health facility in Pieri Payam for treatment. 

Comment: it was reported that, one of the Murle armed elements was shot and killed and another injured. HRD will continue to follow up on this incident for more information.

Location of Incident: Toi village, Pieri Payam, Uror
Description:
6.	On 28 April, multiple sources reported that on 26 April, Murle armed elements from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) shot and killed five male Lou Nuer civilians and injured another in Toi village, Pieri Payam, Uror County. According to the sources, the Murle invaded the Pullual grazing in Pieri Payam and raided over 3000 heads of cattle and fled the scene. Reportedly, the local Lou Nuer youth mobilized and pursued the assailants and in the ensuing confrontation, five Lou Nuer civilians were shot and killed, one injured and about 2940 heads of cattle were recovered from the Murle. The injured victim was taken to a health facility in Pieri Payam for treatment. 

Comment: it was reported that, one of the Murle armed elements was shot and killed and another injured. HRD will continue to follow up on this incident for more information.

Location of Incident: Toi village, Pieri Payam, Uror
Description:
6.	On 28 April, multiple sources reported that on 26 April, Murle armed elements from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) shot and killed five male Lou Nuer civilians and injured another in Toi village, Pieri Payam, Uror County. According to the sources, the Murle invaded the Pullual grazing in Pieri Payam and raided over 3000 heads of cattle and fled the scene. Reportedly, the local Lou Nuer youth mobilized and pursued the assailants and in the ensuing confrontation, five Lou Nuer civilians were shot and killed, one injured and about 2940 heads of cattle were recovered from the Murle. The injured victim was taken to a health facility in Pieri Payam for treatment. 

Comment: it was reported that, one of the Murle armed elements was shot and killed and another injured. HRD will continue to follow up on this incident for more information.

Location of Incident: Wathkinyuk village, Abiriu Payam, Cueibet
Description: 7.	On 28 April, multiple secondary sources reported that, on 17 April, allied Dinka Tiek and Ajek Akook youths (both under Dinka Agaar section) from Rumbek Centre County, shot and killed one male civilian from the Pathiong clan of Dinka Gok, in Wathkinyuk village, Abiriu Payam, Cueibet County. According to the sources, the assailants invaded Abiriu Payam to raid cattle from the Pathiong community and clashed with the armed Pathiong youths in Wathkinyuk village leading to the death of the victim. Reportedly, the cattle raid was foiled, and the assailants were fended off and investigations are ongoing by state authorities although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Pibor village, Wangbuour Payam, Mayom
Description: 8.	On 28 April, multiple secondary sources reported that, on 26 April, armed Bul Nuer youths from the Cheingchuol Subclan, shot and killed one 55-year-old Bul Nuer woman and injured two children (a five-year-old boy and four-year-old girl) from the Bul Nuer community in Pibor village, Wangbuour Payam, Mayom County. According to the sources, the assailants targeted and shot at another armed youth during a traditional dance ceremony, and in the process, killed and wounded the victims and fled the scene. Reportedly, the injured victims were taken to a health facility in Mankien Payam for treatment and later evacuated to a health facility in Bentiu for advanced treatment.

Location of Incident: Pibor village, Wangbuour Payam, Mayom
Description: 8.	On 28 April, multiple secondary sources reported that, on 26 April, armed Bul Nuer youths from the Cheingchuol Subclan, shot and killed one 55-year-old Bul Nuer woman and injured two children (a five-year-old boy and four-year-old girl) from the Bul Nuer community in Pibor village, Wangbuour Payam, Mayom County. According to the sources, the assailants targeted and shot at another armed youth during a traditional dance ceremony, and in the process, killed and wounded the victims and fled the scene. Reportedly, the injured victims were taken to a health facility in Mankien Payam for treatment and later evacuated to a health facility in Bentiu for advanced treatment.

Location of Incident: Pakwa Obai Boma, Panyikang Payam, Panyikang
Description: 9.	On 28 April, one primary source reported that, on 11 April, elements of the Nuer White Army shot and killed one 38-year-old male civilian from the Shilluk tribe in Pakwa Obai Boma, Panyikang Payam, Panyikang County. The source recounted that the incident happened while the victim was escaping during an attack on the community by the Nuer White army. Reportedly, during the attack the Nuer White Army looted civilian properties left behind by those who were forcefully displaced to other locations for safety.

Location of Incident: Pakwa Obai Boma, Panyikang Payam, Panyikang
Description: 9.	On 28 April, one primary source reported that, on 11 April, elements of the Nuer White Army shot and killed one 38-year-old male civilian from the Shilluk tribe in Pakwa Obai Boma, Panyikang Payam, Panyikang County. The source recounted that the incident happened while the victim was escaping during an attack on the community by the Nuer White army. Reportedly, during the attack the Nuer White Army looted civilian properties left behind by those who were forcefully displaced to other locations for safety.

Location of Incident: Mayen village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East
Description:
10.	On 28 April, multiple sources reported that on 27 April, four male civilians were shot and killed (one Dinka Akook, one Dinka Lou-Paher, and two Dinka Thiik), during violence between allied armed Dinka Thiik and Lou-Paher against the armed Dinka Akook, in Mayen village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the allied armed Dinka Thiik and Lou-Paher youths attacked the Akook community in Mayen village to raid cattle and exact vengeance for past and unresolved grievances and shot dead one male Dinka Akook civilian and tried to raid cattle but were fended off by the armed Dinka Akook youth. In retaliation, the armed Dinka Akook mobilized and in the ensuing confrontation they shot and injured one Dinka Lou-Paher and two Dinka Thiik rustlers. Reportedly, as the assailants fled, they were pursued by the armed Dinka Akook youths who shot and killed three male civilians (one Dinka Lou-Paher and two Dinka Thiik) while they were grazing in Mayen village close to the border between Marial Lou and Ngabagok Payams.  

Comment: Tension is reportedly building up rapidly in the area, with the possibility of further violence. HRD will continue to monitor the situation.

Location of Incident: East Bank Residential Area, Wau town, Wau
Description: 11.	On 28 April, two secondary sources reported that, on 29 December 2024, a soldier of the SSPDF and three other civilians beat and killed one 25-year-old male civilian in the East Bank Residential Area, Wau town, Wau County. According to the sources, the incident was triggered by an allegation of adultery involving the victim and the wife of the SSPDF soldier. Reportedly, on 30 December 2024, the incident was reported to the police and on 31 December 2024, the three civilian suspects were remanded at the Wau Central Prison, while on 25 February 2025, the SSPDF officer was handed over to the police, and on 26 February, the soldier was remanded to the Wau Central Prison for investigation and trial.

Location of Incident: Ngo-Ngba Boma, Baggari payam, Wau
Description:
12.	On 28 April, multiple secondary sources reported that on 22 April, elements of the SPLA-IO unlawfully arrested and detained two male civilians (the Executive Chief of Momoi Block A and a security guard- other details unspecified) in Ngo-Ngba Boma, Baggari payam, Wau County. According to the source, this incident was triggered by a resistance put up by the security guard when SPLA-IO elements ordered him to open the Momoi school store where there allegedly were food supplies. Reportedly, upon learning of the unlawful arrest of the security guard, the Executive Chief called the commander of the SPLA-IO to inquire about the case and in response, the commander ordered the arrest and detention of the Executive Chief at the SPLA-IO base in Ngo-Ngba Boma. 

Comment: The Executive Chief was released on 27 April but was instructed to report to the SPLA-IO daily until he provided 80 bullets as compensation for the two bullets fired at him when they were executing the arrest order although he was not injured.

Location of Incident: Bussere Boma, Baggari Payam, Wau
Description: 13.	On 28 April, one primary source and one secondary source reported that, on 26 April elements of the SPLA-IO illtreated seven male civilians (aged between 18 and 25 years) in Bussere Boma, Baggari Payam, Wau County. According to the sources, the SPLA-IO elements apprehended the victims and beat them up with sticks and the butt plate of their guns resulting in bodily injuries, on allegations that the victims had alerted and caused the escape of an element of the SPLA-IO whom they are trying to arrest. Reportedly, following the intervention of a community leader, the victims were released, and the incident was reported to the police for investigation.

Location of Incident: Ngoni village, Duma Payam, Tambura
Description:
14.	On 28 April, multiple sources reported that on 25 and 27 April, suspected SPLA-IO elements abducted two male civilians (aged 38 and 45 years) from the Balanda community in Ngoni village, Duma Payam, Tambura County. According to the sources, on 25 April suspected SPLA-IO elements invaded the home of the 38-year-old victim and forcefully bound and took him out to an unknown location. Reportedly, on 27 April, the same suspects invaded the home of the 45-year-old victim (a community youth leader) and forcefully removed him to an unknown location.

Comment: There are growing concerns about the pattern of abductions carried out by the SPLA-IO elements in direct breach of national and international human rights laws on individual safety and personal liberties. HRD will continue to follow up these incidents for more information.

Location of Incident: Niikush Boma, Lotukei Payam, Budi
Description: 1.	On 29 April, three secondary sources reported that, on 26 April, armed Toposa youths from Natinga Boma, Natinga Payam, Kapoeta East County, shot and killed one 26-year-old male Didinga civilian in Niikush Boma, Lotukei Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, the assailants invaded Niikush Boma with intent to raid cattle belonging to the Didinga community, when they saw the victim grazing his cattle and shot in dead and raided 23 heads of cattle. Reportedly, while leaving the scene of the incident, the local Didinga youths mobilized and pursued the raiders, and in the ensuing confrontation, the Didinga youths were outnumbered and the raiders made away with the raided cattle into Natinga Payam, Kapoeta East County. The incident was reported to the Lotukei police station, and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Niikush Boma, Lotukei Payam, Budi
Description: 1.	On 29 April, three secondary sources reported that, on 26 April, armed Toposa youths from Natinga Boma, Natinga Payam, Kapoeta East County, shot and killed one 26-year-old male Didinga civilian in Niikush Boma, Lotukei Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, the assailants invaded Niikush Boma with intent to raid cattle belonging to the Didinga community, when they saw the victim grazing his cattle and shot in dead and raided 23 heads of cattle. Reportedly, while leaving the scene of the incident, the local Didinga youths mobilized and pursued the raiders, and in the ensuing confrontation, the Didinga youths were outnumbered and the raiders made away with the raided cattle into Natinga Payam, Kapoeta East County. The incident was reported to the Lotukei police station, and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: GPAA
Description: 2.	On 29 April, one primary source reported that, on 26 April, one 15-year-old girl from the Murle community was received by authorities in Pibor, GPAA. The source recounted that the survivor was abducted by the armed Lou Nuer youths on 2 March 2023 in Nanaam area of Vulvet Payam, Gumuruk County when during an attack on GPAA and taken to Yuai in Uror County, Jonglei State. According to the source, the survivor lived with her abductors until she escaped on 10 April and walked for 10 days to Kotomen village in Karyak Payam, Likuangole County in GPAA, where she was later transported to Pibor, awaiting family reunification.

Location of Incident: Aweil East, Raja, and Wau
Description:
3.	On 29 April, two secondary sources reported that, on 15 April, suspected SSPDF soldiers forcefully removed 15 male civilians (aged between 15-18 years- from Aweil East County- Northern Bahr el Ghazal) from detention in Raja County, Western Bahr el Ghazal State and transported them to Juba. According to the sources, on 7 April, the victims were arrested and detained for seven days in Wau town for alleged involvement in illicit gold mining. Reportedly, on 15 April government security forces suspected to be SSPDF, extracted the victims from detention and secretly transported them to Juba allegedly to recruit them into the SSPDF and deploy them to Nasir and Ulang Counties in Upper Nile State. It was also reported that on 15 April the SSPDF abducted and transported about 100 male civilians (aged between 15-19 years) from Wau County to an unknown location in Juba. 

Comment: While there is a need to further corroborate these allegations, testimonies from witnesses and family members of the victims raises a prima facie case of abduction with intent to conscript by government security forces. HRD will continue to investigate the allegations for more information.

Location of Incident: Abiemnom town, Abiemnom County, Ruweng Administrative Area (RAA)
Description:
4.	On 29 April, multiple secondary sources reported that on 1 April, soldiers of the SSPDF allegedly raped 24 female civilians from the Bul Nuer community (including 14 girls aged between 14-17 years and 10 women- ages unspecified) in Abiemnom town, Abiemnom County, Ruweng Administrative Area (RAA). According to the sources, the incident happened within the context of the conflict between the SSPDF supported by the armed Dinka Alor youths against the armed Bul Nuer youths. Reportedly, the victims were abducted by the SSPDF while they were returning to the Bul Nuer cattle camp in Abiemnom County from selling milk in the Abiemnom market. The soldiers took the victims to the Ambiemnom police, where they perpetrated acts of sexual violence including rape of the victims while in custody. Investigations are ongoing bring the perpetrators to justice. 

Comment: It was alleged that, this act by the SSPDF was the immediate cause of the violence in Abiemnom County as the armed Bul Nuer Youths attacked the SSPDF and rescued the survivors and took them to different cattle camps in Mayom County. It was also reported that, seven SSPDF soldiers were allegedly arrested in connection to this gruesome act and pending trial.

Location of Incident: Achol-Awakau village, Awul Payam in Tonj North
Description:
5.	On 29 April, four secondary sources reported that, on the same day, allied armed Dinka Leir and Awan youths from Kirik and Rualbet Payams in Tonj North County, shot and injured three male civilians from the Dinka Noi community (including a state government official), in Achol-Awakau village, Awul Payam in Tonj North County. According to the sources, the assailants ambushed and opened fire on a government vehicle transporting a government official with other civilians, injuring the victims. Reportedly, two of the victims were evacuated to a health facility in Wau town (Western Bahr el Ghazal state) for advanced treatment, while the last victim was taken to a health facility in Warrap town for treatment.

Comment: This incident was allegedly in perpetuation of the escalating communal violence between the Dinka Noi of Awul Payam and the Dinka Leir of Kirik Payam, and their Dinka Awan allies from Rualbet Payam, in Tonj North County.

Location of Incident: Danga-Chok village in Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East
Description: 6.	On 29 April, three secondary sources reported that, on 28 April, armed Dinka Akook youths shot and killed one male Dinka Lou-Paher civilian (age undetermined) from Marial Lou Payam, in Danga-Chok village in Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the incident happened while the victim visited Danga-Chok village to collect cattle in exchange for a debt owed to him by a friend. Reportedly, the assailants shot and killed the victim on accusation of being a spy, after questioning the victim on the motive for his visit and were not convinced by his response.

Location of Incident: different Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) camp, in Rejaf area, Juba town, Juba
Description:
1.	Between 28 and 30 April, one primary source reported that on 6 April, soldiers of the SSPDF raped eight female civilians (ages undetermined) from different Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) camp, in Rejaf area, Juba town, Juba County. The source recounted that, the victims left the camp to collect charcoal from Rejaf area, and while attempting to rush back to their camps following sounds of gunfire, they were intercepted by SSPDF soldiers who took all eight victims to a building in Hai Salam area and raped them repeatedly for several hours. Reportedly, the soldiers also confiscated valuables from the victims including money to the tune of 600,000 South Sudanese Pounds (SSPD) and 500 United State Dollars (USD). 

Comment: later, the soldiers transported the victims to a health facility in Buluk town although no medical, legal or psychosocial assistance was given to the victims, and they were forced to walk back to their respective IDP camps in pains and traumatized.

Location of Incident: different Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) camp, in Rejaf area, Juba town, Juba
Description:
1.	Between 28 and 30 April, one primary source reported that on 6 April, soldiers of the SSPDF raped eight female civilians (ages undetermined) from different Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) camp, in Rejaf area, Juba town, Juba County. The source recounted that, the victims left the camp to collect charcoal from Rejaf area, and while attempting to rush back to their camps following sounds of gunfire, they were intercepted by SSPDF soldiers who took all eight victims to a building in Hai Salam area and raped them repeatedly for several hours. Reportedly, the soldiers also confiscated valuables from the victims including money to the tune of 600,000 South Sudanese Pounds (SSPD) and 500 United State Dollars (USD). 

Comment: later, the soldiers transported the victims to a health facility in Buluk town although no medical, legal or psychosocial assistance was given to the victims, and they were forced to walk back to their respective IDP camps in pains and traumatized.

Location of Incident: Gorom area, Juba town, Juba
Description: 2.	Between 28 and 30 April, one primary source reported that on 28 March, soldiers of the SSPDF, raped nine female civilians in Gorom area, Juba town, Juba County. The source recounted that, the victims had gone to collect charcoal around the Anyuak camp in Gorom, when a group of SSPDF soldiers ambushed the victims and raped them in a nearby bush and confiscated 50,000 SSP from one of the victims. Reportedly, the SSPDF soldiers transported the victims to a checkpoint leading to Yei, where they were left to trace their way back.

Location of Incident: Gorom area, Juba town, Juba
Description: 2.	Between 28 and 30 April, one primary source reported that on 28 March, soldiers of the SSPDF, raped nine female civilians in Gorom area, Juba town, Juba County. The source recounted that, the victims had gone to collect charcoal around the Anyuak camp in Gorom, when a group of SSPDF soldiers ambushed the victims and raped them in a nearby bush and confiscated 50,000 SSP from one of the victims. Reportedly, the SSPDF soldiers transported the victims to a checkpoint leading to Yei, where they were left to trace their way back.

Location of Incident: Ngauro Boma, Ngauro Payam, Budi
Description: 3.	On 30 April, three secondary sources reported that, on 26 April, armed Toposa youths from Namoruyang Payam, Kapoeta South County, shot and injured one 28-year-old male civilian from the Didinga community in Ngauro Boma, Ngauro Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, the victim was shot and injured while he was collecting building materials from a disputed land between the two communities in Ngauro Boma over which the Toposa community claims exclusive control [see similar incident in HRD Daily Report of 24 April 2025]. Reportedly the victim was taken to a health facility in Kapoeta town for treatment and the incident was reported to the Ngauro police and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Toch North Payam, Gogrial East
Description: 4.	On 30 April, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, armed Nuer youths from unity state, shot and injured one male Dinka Apuk civilian in Toch North Payam, Gogrial East County. According to the sources the assailants invaded Toch to raid cattle belonging to the Dinka Apuk community when they met the victim, shot and injured him and seized his 30 heads of cattle. Reportedly, the armed Dinka Apuk youths mobilized and confronted the assailants, shot and killed one armed Nuer youth and recovered the stolen cattle. The injured Dinka Apuk civilian was taken to a health facility in Toch North Payam for treatment.

Location of Incident: Toch North Payam, Gogrial East
Description: 4.	On 30 April, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, armed Nuer youths from unity state, shot and injured one male Dinka Apuk civilian in Toch North Payam, Gogrial East County. According to the sources the assailants invaded Toch to raid cattle belonging to the Dinka Apuk community when they met the victim, shot and injured him and seized his 30 heads of cattle. Reportedly, the armed Dinka Apuk youths mobilized and confronted the assailants, shot and killed one armed Nuer youth and recovered the stolen cattle. The injured Dinka Apuk civilian was taken to a health facility in Toch North Payam for treatment.

Location of Incident: Bazia Payam, Wau
Description: 5.	On 30 April, one primary source reported that on 25 April, an element of the SPLA-IO, shot and injured one 29-year-old male civilian from the Balanda community in Bazia Payam, Wau County. The source recounted that the incident happened when the victim visited the SPLA-IO barracks in Bazia to deliver a message to the SPLA-IO commander about a proposed meeting with a community leader. Reportedly, upon seeing the victim the suspect open fire and injured the victim, who was taken to a health facility in Wau town for treatment, while the suspect was arrested and detained at the SPLA-IO facility and a case was opened at the Hai Kosti police station pending investigation.

Location of Incident: Bandala Payam, Nagero
Description:
6.	On 30 April, multiple secondary sources reported that, on 26 April, elements of the SPLA-IO shot and killed one male civilian (age unspecified) and abducted eight other male civilians (ages unspecified) in Bandala Payam, Nagero County. According to the sources, the incident happened during an altercation between the victim and the SPLA-IO elements, following an alleged conscription exercise by the assailants. Reportedly, the SPLA-IO elements abducted eight other male civilians to an unknown location, allegedly with intent to conscript them into the ranks of the SPLA-IO.

Comment: These actions by the SPLA-IO amount to a gross violation of human rights and jeopardizes the overall protection of civilians in the area.

Location of Incident: Bandala Payam, Nagero
Description:
6.	On 30 April, multiple secondary sources reported that, on 26 April, elements of the SPLA-IO shot and killed one male civilian (age unspecified) and abducted eight other male civilians (ages unspecified) in Bandala Payam, Nagero County. According to the sources, the incident happened during an altercation between the victim and the SPLA-IO elements, following an alleged conscription exercise by the assailants. Reportedly, the SPLA-IO elements abducted eight other male civilians to an unknown location, allegedly with intent to conscript them into the ranks of the SPLA-IO.

Comment: These actions by the SPLA-IO amount to a gross violation of human rights and jeopardizes the overall protection of civilians in the area.

Location of Incident: Old Fangak town centre, Fangak
Description:
1.	On 3 May, multiple sources reported that on the same day, seven civilians were killed (including one woman, and a nine-month-old baby- ages unspecified) and 27 others injured (unspecified details) during and aerial bombardment operation by the SSPDF in Old Fangak town centre, Fangak County. According to the sources, the SSPDF carried out indiscriminate aerial bombardments using two helicopters and a drone over Old Fangak town, leading to the reported casualties and destroying civilian objects including civilian houses, market and a hospital and pharmacy operated by an international humanitarian organization. Reportedly, over 30,000 civilians were forcefully displaced from Old Fangak, to neighbouring communities for their safety. About 14 of the injured victims, were evacuated to a health facility in Akobo town, Akobo County for treatment. 

Comment: HRD will continue to investigate this incident for more information on possible civilian casualties.

Location of Incident: Old Fangak town centre, Fangak
Description:
1.	On 3 May, multiple sources reported that on the same day, seven civilians were killed (including one woman, and a nine-month-old baby- ages unspecified) and 27 others injured (unspecified details) during and aerial bombardment operation by the SSPDF in Old Fangak town centre, Fangak County. According to the sources, the SSPDF carried out indiscriminate aerial bombardments using two helicopters and a drone over Old Fangak town, leading to the reported casualties and destroying civilian objects including civilian houses, market and a hospital and pharmacy operated by an international humanitarian organization. Reportedly, over 30,000 civilians were forcefully displaced from Old Fangak, to neighbouring communities for their safety. About 14 of the injured victims, were evacuated to a health facility in Akobo town, Akobo County for treatment. 

Comment: HRD will continue to investigate this incident for more information on possible civilian casualties.

Location of Incident: Old Fangak town centre, Fangak
Description:
1.	On 3 May, multiple sources reported that on the same day, seven civilians were killed (including one woman, and a nine-month-old baby- ages unspecified) and 27 others injured (unspecified details) during and aerial bombardment operation by the SSPDF in Old Fangak town centre, Fangak County. According to the sources, the SSPDF carried out indiscriminate aerial bombardments using two helicopters and a drone over Old Fangak town, leading to the reported casualties and destroying civilian objects including civilian houses, market and a hospital and pharmacy operated by an international humanitarian organization. Reportedly, over 30,000 civilians were forcefully displaced from Old Fangak, to neighbouring communities for their safety. About 14 of the injured victims, were evacuated to a health facility in Akobo town, Akobo County for treatment. 

Comment: HRD will continue to investigate this incident for more information on possible civilian casualties.

Location of Incident: Juba town, Juba
Description: 2.	On 4 May, multiple sources reported that on 2 May, personnel of the SSNPS, arbitrarily arrested and detained 40 civilians (students from Ruweng Administrative Area studying at different universities in Juba-details unspecified) in Juba town, Juba County. According to the sources, the SSNPS personnel arrested and detained the victims after a peaceful protest on 2 May, at the headquarters of an oil company in Juba town. The protest was because the company failed to pay the tuition of the students in line with an agreement between the company (operating in Ruweng Administrative Area) and the Ruweng community to pay tuition of the victims as part of its corporate social responsibility. Reportedly, the victims were arrested and detained and released after few hours without charge, while the SSNPS are tracking down two students, accused of being the ring leaders of the protest.

Location of Incident: Tonj Payam, Tonj South
Description:
3.	On 1 May, multiple secondary sources reported that, on 1 May, 24 civilians were shot and killed and 32 others injured during violence between allied armed Dinka Yar, Muok, and Apuk-Jurwir youths and the armed Dinka Thony youths in Akony-Chok and Wunkech villages in Manyangok Payam and Ameth village in Tonj Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, the allied armed Dinka Yar, Muok, and Apuk-Jurwir youths, attacked the Dinka Thony in Akony-Chok village in Manyangok Payam, shot and killed four male civilians and injured nine other male Dinka Thony civilians, and burnt down 12 tukuls. The assailants proceeded to Wunkech village still in Manyangok Payam, where they shot and killed seven Dinka Thony civilians (two female and five male), shot and injured seven other male civilians and burnt down 20 tukuls. Reportedly, in retaliation, the armed Dinka Thony youths invaded Ameth village in Tonj Payam, shot and killed 13 male civilians (10 Dinka Apuk-Jurwir and three Dinka Muok) and injured 16 other civilians (10 Dinka Apuk-Jurwir- including four females and six male Dinka Yar). The injured Dinka Thony civilians received local treatment while four in critical condition were taken to a health facility in Manyangok Payam for treatment. The injured Dinka Apuk-Jurwir and Yar victims in the attack on Ameth village, were taken to health facilities in Wanhalel and Tonj Payams for treatment. 

Comment: Tension has built up in the affected areas, with the possibility of further violence and in response, the authorities have deployed security forces to contain the situation. HRD will continue to monitor the situation for more information.

Location of Incident: Tonj Payam, Tonj South
Description:
3.	On 1 May, multiple secondary sources reported that, on 1 May, 24 civilians were shot and killed and 32 others injured during violence between allied armed Dinka Yar, Muok, and Apuk-Jurwir youths and the armed Dinka Thony youths in Akony-Chok and Wunkech villages in Manyangok Payam and Ameth village in Tonj Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, the allied armed Dinka Yar, Muok, and Apuk-Jurwir youths, attacked the Dinka Thony in Akony-Chok village in Manyangok Payam, shot and killed four male civilians and injured nine other male Dinka Thony civilians, and burnt down 12 tukuls. The assailants proceeded to Wunkech village still in Manyangok Payam, where they shot and killed seven Dinka Thony civilians (two female and five male), shot and injured seven other male civilians and burnt down 20 tukuls. Location of Incident: Mayen village, Manlor Payam, Tonj North
Description: 4.	On 1 May, three secondary sources reported that, on the same day, armed Dinka Leir youths from Kirik Payam, shot and killed two male Dinka Abiem civilians in Mayen village, Manlor Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked the Dinka Abiem community in Mayen village in the context of retaliatory violence for past and unresolved grievances, shot and killed the victims and fled the scene into Kirik Payam. Reportedly, no cattle were raided during the attack and the security situation remains fragile.

Location of Incident: Riebal village, Rualbet Payam, Tonj North
Description: 5.	On 2 May, three secondary sources reported that, on the same day, armed Dinka Atok youths from Awul Payam, shot and killed two male Dinka Jurbol civilians in Riebal village, Rualbet Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources the assailants attacked the Dinka Abiem community, shot and killed the victims in the context of retaliatory intercommunal violence between the allied Dinka Leir and Awan/Jurbol and the Awul Payam communities of Dinka Noi and Atok. Reportedly, the assailants fled the scene back into Awul Payam without raiding any cattle.

Location of Incident: Toch area, Aweng Payam, Twic
Description: 6.	On 2 May, three secondary sources reported that on 1 May, armed Nuer youths from Mayom County-Unity State, shot and killed one male Dinka Twic Mayardit civilian in Toch area, Aweng Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, the armed Nuer youths targeted and attacked a group of Twic cattle grazers, shot and killed one while the others escaped for their safety. Reportedly, the assailants raided 25 heads of cattle from the victim and fled with the cattle into Unity State unscathed.

Location of Incident: Ngadawan village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East
Description: 7.	On 4 May, three secondary sources reported that on 3 May, armed Dinka Thiik youths shot and killed one male Dinka Akook civilian and injured another, in Ngadawan village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the assailants ambushed and opened fire on the victims who were traveling on a motorcycle in Ngadawan village, killing and injuring the victims, within the context of cyclical and retaliatory violence between the communities. Reportedly, the injured victim was taken to a health facility in Ngabagok Payam for treatment while the assailants fled the scene and remain at large.

Location of Incident: Ngadawan village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East
Description: 7.	On 4 May, three secondary sources reported that on 3 May, armed Dinka Thiik youths shot and killed one male Dinka Akook civilian and injured another, in Ngadawan village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the assailants ambushed and opened fire on the victims who were traveling on a motorcycle in Ngadawan village, killing and injuring the victims, within the context of cyclical and retaliatory violence between the communities. Reportedly, the injured victim was taken to a health facility in Ngabagok Payam for treatment while the assailants fled the scene and remain at large.

Location of Incident: Rumbek town, Rumbek
Description:
HRD followed up on a case involving five females, including underage girls, reportedly under custody at Rumbek Central Police station, over suspicion of gangraping a male in Rumbek town

On 14 April 2025, HRD visited the Special Protection Unit (SPU) in the Rumbek Central Police station, to follow up on and crosscheck information earlier received indicating that five females, including underage girls had been arrested and put under custody in the facility, over suspicion of gangraping a male in Rumbek town, on 7 April. The officer in charge of the SPU confirmed the arrest and custody case of the reported five females. He specified that only one of the girls was adult (aged 19), while the remaining three were minor aged between 14 and 16. HRD learned that the alleged victim (the male) was aged 19. The officer in charge of the SPU however explained that following the investigations conducted by the Police have established that the primary allegations of ‘’gangrape’’ were baseless. HRD gathered that the charges framed against the suspects have now been turned to elopement; and the case is now reportedly involving only the male (formerly victim), along with one of the initial suspects (who is underage). The officer in charge of the SPU mentioned that this case has now been forwarded to the High Court for hearing and that its outcome was still pending.

As for the other three females suspected, HRD was informed that they have been released since 11 April. These girls reportedly confessed having an affair with the male.

Comments: HRD will continue following up on the case and the related Court hearing to understand how the initial rape charges were turned into elopement. HRD is also seeking to clarify why, after establishing that the adult male had not been gangraped, the Police did not frame the rape charges against him, as the suspects (three of whom are underage) has allegedly confessed having had sexual intercourses with him. HRD will additionally inquire further about the initial investigation process, as some details received tend to suggest that the Police might have resorted to pressures and even tortures when interrogating the suspects.

Location of Incident: Motoyo East residential area, Nimule Boma, Nimule Payam-Magwi
Description:
On 25April 2025, HRD followed up on a reported incident of rape and sexual assault of a 27-year-old Kakwa woman by an SSPDF Tiger Division soldier in Motoyo East residential area, Nimule Boma, Nimule Payam-Magwi County and spoke to three reliable secondary sources who confirmed that the incidents indeed happened on 22 April 2025 as earlier reported.

According to the sources, at approximately 23:00 hours on 22 April 2025, the 27-year-old Kakwa woman was attacked, raped and sexual assaulted by a 40-year-old Azande SSPDF Tiger Division soldier in her home at Motoyo East residential area in Nimule Boma, Nimule Payam, Magwi County. The sources said the soldier stormed her home and raped her and thereafter sexually assaulted her by putting foreign object into her private part and setting her ablaze. The sources equally intimated that the survivor is in critical condition at Nimule Hospital. The respondent further added that the soldier was arrested by the police on 23 April 2025 and detained at Nimule Police Station but was later released to the SSPDF Tiger Division in Nimule the same day, when they insisted that the police release the suspect to them. 

Comment: HRD will continue to follow up on developments and report accordingly.

Location of Incident: Hai Twara neighbourhood, Yambio town, Yambio
Hai Twara neighbourhood, Yambio town, Yambio
Gogrial town, Gogrial West
Description:
Rape case of a 6-year-old girl in Gogrial Town
HRD was informed by an investigator from the SPU that on 9 April 2025, a 6-year-old girl was allegedly raped by a 26-year-old man in Riang-Athieng village in Gogrial Town, Gogrial West County. The incident was reported to the Police Station in Gogrial Town on 18 April 2025 by the victim’s uncle, after she disclosed the incident to her uncle. The suspect was arrested on 19th April 2025 in Riang-Athieng village where he allegedly committed the crime.  
The SPU police informed that the victim received treatment at the Kuajok State Hospital and obtained the necessary documents required for prosecution and the case was referred to court today.

Location of Incident: Rumbek town, Rumbek
Description:
A 19-year-old girl escaped her home after her brother beat her and prevented her from going back to school in Rumbek town, Rumbek Centre County 

On 29 April 2025, at 17:00 hours, a 19-year-old girl presented herself at the UNMISS Rumbek Field Office gate claiming to have escaped a force marriage arranged by her brother. HRD contacted the one-stop centre at the Rumbek State Hospital who recommended the girl to be brought to the hospital. There, a doctor conducted a medical examination to check for injuries. As she suffered no serious injuries, the girl was referred to the Police Special Protection Unit (SPU) and was brought by HRD to the Rumbek Central Police station where she spent the night.

On 30 April 2025, HRD followed up on the case with the SPU. HRD learned that the girl’s brother had arranged a marriage for her over a year ago, in 2024, but that her father had refused to allow his daughter to marry, stating that she was too young and allowing her to continue her studies. On 29 April 2025, the girl was allegedly beaten by her brother who told her she would not be allowed to continue her studies next year and was instead expected to stay home and take care of the house. He told her that if she abides, he will not seek to arrange a marriage for her. The girl ran away from the house and went to the UNMISS compound for help. The Crime Officer and the SPU informed HRD that they will contact the parents before the end of the day to complete the investigation, following which they will refer the case to the Public Prosecutor. HRD encouraged the SPU to move forward for a prompt and appropriate resolution and to ensure the girl’s safety in the meantime. 

Comment: In such cases, the Public Prosecutor usually summons the family to warn them about the legal implications of forced marriage and the implications of denial of education. HRD will follow up on the case.

The referral of the victim to the Rumbek Central Police station to spend the night showcases shortcomings in the provision of assistance to victims of gender-based violence in Rumbek State. As there is no safehouse for victims, organisations are forced to rely on other solutions, which often do not provide for adequate security standards both for victims and staff, or to send victims to the Police station where they are held in “protective custody”.

Location of Incident: Magwi Boma, Magwi Payam, Magwi county
Description:
On 4th of April 2025, HRD followed up with three reliable secondary sources on a reported rape incident involving a 17-year-old Acholi girl that was raped by a 26-year-old Acholi man in Magwi Boma, Magwi Payam, Magwi county. All the respondents confirmed that the girl was indeed violated on the 2 of April 2025.
As narrated by the sources, at approximately 14:00 hours, the 26-year-old Acholi man lured the 17-year-old Acholi girl into his house and proceeded to raped her. The alleged perpetrator is reportedly neighbors with the survivor, who constantly made sexual advances towards the girl, which were rejected. On the 2 April 2025, the alleged perpetrator requested her perform some chores in his house, before she could respond, he dragged her into his house and raped her. The survivor reported the incident to her parents and the alleged perpetrator was apprehended and is currently in custody at the Magwi police station awaiting investigation. 
The 17-year-old was reportedly taken to Magwi Hospital where she got medical and psychosocial support.
Comment: HRD will continue to monitor and follow up.

Location of Incident: Biemkat within Abiemnom County (RAA).
Description:
•	HRD received an alleged rape case of a-10-year-old girl by a-36 plus year-old SSPDF Solider in Biemkat in Abiemnom County (RAA).  
On 01 April 2025, HRD was informed by a secondary source in Abiemnom about a rape case incident that reportedly occurred on 28 March 2025, in a place called Biemkat within Abiemnom County (RAA). The alleged rape incident involved a 10-year-old girl (name on file) from the Dinka Alor of Abiemnom County by a 36-year-old SSPDF soldier from the Dinka Bhar-El Ghazel region. The incident happened when the perpetrator went into the house of the victim and found her alone at home. The sources stated that the victim was taken to the local health facility for treatment and is reportedly still in bad condition in the hospital. The perpetrator was arrested and detained by the police in Abiemnom shortly after the incident. Additionally, the source also stated that the father of the victim is in distress situation and had promised to kill the perpetrator should he find him somewhere, so the police are also protecting the perpetrator from the victim’s father. 

Comment: HRD is following the case and will revert for more information on the case.

Location of Incident: Luparate, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County
Description:
•	Follow up of SGBV and CRSV cases at One Stop Centre, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County.

On April 2, 2025, HRD YFO and UNPOL conducted a joint monitoring visit to One Stop Centre, Yei Town, Yei Town Payam of Yei River County. The purpose of the visit was to follow up on SGBV and CRSV reported cases. During the and engagement with One Stop Centre Staff, the team confirmed   The rape case involved 25-year-old pregnant married woman (details on files) from Luparate, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County, who was reportedly gang-raped by three unidentified boys at about 4:00AM,  on March 31, 2025.The victim  was returning from a funeral  place when she got intercepted by a gang of many boys who overpowered her and three of them raped her in  turns. She was unable to identify or recognize any of the perpetrators and no arrest has been made by police. Medical examination confirmed the rape adding that she was raped while pregnant.

Comments: The above incidents are clear cases of rape and assault, given that the victims did not give consent. It is   violation of her bodily integrity and privacy as enshrined in the Universal declaration of Human rights (Article 5). HRD YFO will follow up the case.

Location of Incident: Kembe Boma, Lojulo Payam of Morobo County
Description:
•	Rape of a ten-year-old by a civilian relative in Kembe Boma, Lojulo Payam of Morobo County

On April 02, 2025, HRD YFO received and documented information from three reliable sources (details on file), including a police officer, a traditional leader, and a humanitarian worker, regarding the rape of a ten-year-old (details on file) from the Keliko tribe by a civilian relative in Kembe Boma, Lojulo Payam of Morobo County 21 November 2024.
According to sources, the 32-year-old father of the victim (details on file) returned to their home in Kembe Boma, Lojulo Payam, Morobo County, around 11 a.m. after coming from the roadside. At that time, the mother of the 10-year-old victim was working on the farm.
 The perpetrator asked the victim to bring water and took advantage of absence of other family members and raped the 10-year-old. The perpetrator was found in the act with the victim by father of the victim. The ten-year-old was brought to the medical facility in Morobo Town for treatment. The perpetrator was arrested and detained at the police station in Morobo Town, awaiting trial. 
Comments: Section 247 of the South Sudan Penal Code (2008) criminalizes rape as “sexual intercourse against another person’s will or without consent.” Since the victim is 10 years old, consent is legally impossible. Section 30 of the Child Act (2008) prohibits sexual abuse of children and mandates penalties up to seven years imprisonment. Article 34 of the Convention on the Rights of the Child (CRC) obligates states to protect children from sexual exploitation and abuse. South Sudan’s failure to prevent this rape violates this provision. While the perpetrator’s arrest is a positive step, prolonged pretrial detention without due process could violate rights to a fair trial under South Sudan’s legal framework.

Location of Incident: Hai Kuze neighborhood, Yambio town, Yambio County
Description:
•	HRD receives information on an alleged gang rape of a 17-year-old girl by three male civilians;
On 8 April, one secondary source reported that at about 6:00 pm on 1 April, three male civilians gang raped a 17-year-old girl from the Azande community in Hai Kuze neighborhood, Yambio town, Yambio County. According to the source, two of the assailants held her down while the third assailant raped her. Reportedly, the third assailant prior to the incident had been harassing the survivor in an attempt to initiate a relationship, which she had consistently rejected. The survivor received medical treatment at a local health facility in Yambio. Reportedly, the incident has yet to be reported to the police.

Location of Incident: Morobo Town, Morobo County
Description:
•	Rape of a 31-year-old civilian woman by civilian man in Morobo Town, Morobo County  

On 09 April 2025, HRD YFO received and documented information from three reliable secondary sources (details on file), including a police officer, a traditional leader, and a humanitarian worker, regarding the rape of a 31-year-old civilian woman (details on file) by civilian man in Nyori village Morobo Town, Morobo County on 03 November 2024. 
According to the sources, the incident occurred in the evening as the victim from the Lugbara tribe, was returning home from Morobo market. She passed by the house of a family acquaintance, civilian man (details on file) from the Kakwa tribe who turned against the victim threatening her with a machete and raped her in a nearby bush. Subsequently, he took her to his house and held her hostage threatening to kill her if she disclosed the incident to her husband. The victim was released on 04 November 2024 by the perpetrator. The 31-year-old woman disclosed incident to her husband a month later, who reported it to Morobo Police Station on 03 December 2024. She was later taken to a medical facility in Morobo Town for treatment. The perpetrator fled but was eventually arrested on 20 March 2025. He is currently detained at Morobo Police Station awaiting trial.
Comments: This case constitutes a violation of Section 247 of South Sudan’s Penal Code (2008), which criminalizes non-consensual sexual intercourse and prescribes up to 14 years imprisonment for perpetrators. Furthermore, it breaches international commitments such as the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination Against Women (CEDAW). The use of a machete to intimidate the victim underscores broader patterns of gender-based violence in South Sudan.

Location of Incident: Wudabi, Wudabi Payam of Morobo County
Description:
•	Rape of a 5-year-old girl by a civilian man in Wudabi, Wudabi Payam of Morobo County

On 09 April 2025, HRD YFO received and documented information from three reliable secondary sources (details on file), including a police officer, a traditional leader, and a humanitarian worker, regarding the unfortunate incident rape of a 5-year-old girl by a civilian man in Wudabi village, Wudabi Payam of Morobo County on 04 January 2025.
According to sources, in the afternoon of 04 January 2025, a 24-year-old civilian man (details on file) from the Keliko tribe, went to his sugarcane garden to farm in Wudabi village, Wudabi Payam, Morobo County. According to sources, a 5-year-old girl also from the Keliko tribe, followed him, seeking sugarcane. Taking advantage of the situation, the perpetrator allegedly raped her. Sources reported that the victim’s father, a 23-year-old discovered the incident and took immediate action by taking the victim to a medical facility in Morobo Town for treatment on the same day. And reporting to police. The Police in Wudabi Payam promptly arrested the perpetrator on 04 January 2025. He is currently detained at Morobo Police Station in Morobo Town and awaiting trial.
Comments: This case highlights South Sudan’s failure to prevent child sexual abuse as provided by law. Section 247 of South Sudan’s Penal Code (2008) criminalizes rape as “sexual intercourse against another person’s will or without consent.”  Since the victim is only five years old, legally there was consent. Section 30 of the Child Act (2008) prohibits sexual abuse of children and prescribes penalties of up to seven years imprisonment for such offenses. Additionally, Article 34 of the Convention on the Rights of the Child (CRC) obligates states to protect children from sexual exploitation and abuse. While the perpetrator’s immediate arrest is a positive step, prolonged pretrial detention could infringe upon his right to a fair and speedy trial under South Sudan’s legal framework.

Location of Incident: IDP’s Camp1 Residents,Juba
Description:
•	Follow up on SGBV case concerning IDP’s Camp1 Residents
On 15th April, the FOJ HRD and Gender Unit team conducted follow-up interviews regarding incidents of sexual and gender-based violence (SGBV) against women residing in IDP Camp 1. 
Two victims, aged 70 and 44, shared their traumatic experiences from an attack that occurred on the night of 6th April 2025. Approximately ten days prior, an unknown number of armed individuals besieged a forest area located about 25 miles from the Juba IDP camps, in the direction of Bungu. This location is often utilized by women from IDP camps who are involved in charcoal production, which is vital for the survival of their families. The victims, both from IDP Camp 1, reported that the assailants, dressed in attire resembling that of security forces – allegedly identified as members of the South Sudan People's Defense Forces (SSPDF) and others in mixed uniforms - were recognizable by their Dinka dialect. Armed with torches, these attackers overpowered the women they encountered, confiscating their belongings and subjecting them to repeated sexual assaults/rape. They operated in smaller groups to target multiple charcoal production sites. The women also stressed that the uniformed attackers stated that they will kill all the people from the Nuer ethnic community, and they will rape their women to death!
The 70-year-old victim described enduring severe physical trauma; her neck remained tight, and her feet pained from the assault. She recounted feeling almost unconscious during the rape incident and could not estimate how many men violated her. When she regained consciousness, she found herself abandoned in the woods. After a two-day journey of approximately 25 miles, she eventually made her way back to IDP Camp 1. Her body bears scars on her arms and feet, which serve as evidence of the brutality she suffered. She mentioned that, around 40 women who were in the charcoal production field with them, are still missing and have not yet returned to the camps.
The 44-year-old victim recounted being thrown to the ground by her assailants, who nearly fractured her wrist and gagged her during the assaults. Like her elder counterpart, she was unable to identify the number of her attackers.
Both women are still deeply traumatized by the events they endured. Since the incident, they have chosen to remain silent out of fear of stigma and cultural scrutiny, leading to their avoidance of medical facilities for necessary treatment or check-ups. They disclosed that many other women likely experienced similar violations but are reluctant to come forward.
The Gender Unit has committed to presenting their case to the One Stop Centre for further assistance and follow-up. Meanwhile, the Human Rights Division (HRD) will continue to monitor these incidents and seek information on additional women who may have suffered similar atrocities.

Location of Incident: Sherikat residential area, Juba County, Central Equatoria State
Description: Rape case of a 15-year-old girl in Sherikat Juba, Central Equatoria State: HRD and the PPA found an NSS (Juba based, Warrant Officer) suspect who was alleged to have raped a 15-year-old Dinka girl in June 2024 in Sherikat residential area, Juba County, Central Equatoria State and fled the crime scene. According to the SPU Police Investigator, the victim concealed the incident from her relatives until the relatives discovered that the rape victim was pregnant and she was forced to confess the incident. The victim who is originally from Mangar Ajak village, Gogrial West County of Warrap State was sent by her uncle from juba back to her parents in Kuajok. The victim`s uncle upon identifying the suspect, travelled from Juba to Kuajok and on 22 February 2025, he filed a case of rape against the suspect at the SPU. The Police issued a warrant of arrest for the suspect. The warrant was handed over to the suspect`s commander in Juba who in turn handed in the suspect for prosecution. On 14 April 2025, the suspect was transferred from Juba to Kuajok and charged with rape under section 247 of the Penal Code Act, 2008. As of today, an investigation was concluded, and the case file was sanctioned by the PPA to court. The suspect, in our presence was taken to court for trial.

Location of Incident: Kuajok Town,
Description:
Follow up: Rape case of a 14-year-old girl in Kuajok Town: HRD followed up the case of the 14-year-old girl who was raped by 25-year-old man in Kuajok (See DSR 2/April/2025). The Police investigator informed that the suspect was arrested on 4 April 2025 and charged with rape under section 247 of the Penal Code Act, 2008. The suspect was investigated and was later remanded at the Kuajok State prison. The Police investigator also informed that on 14 April 2025, the suspect appeared for trial before the High Court Judge and the case was then adjourned. The date for the next session is yet to be determined. HRD will monitor the case. HRD suspected on torture or degrading treatment of the  suspect.
HRD will closely monitor the progress of the above cases.

Location of Incident: Nagishot Boma, Loudo Payam, Budi
Description: 1.	On 5 May, three secondary sources reported that on 27 April, armed Didinga youths from Lotukei Boma, Lotukei Payam, shot and killed one 32-year-old male Didinga civilian from Ngauro Boma, Ngauro Payam, in Nagishot Boma, Loudo Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, the victim was shot and killed while in his farm, allegedly to avenge the killing of two civilians from Lotukei Boma by armed youths from Ngauro Boma at the Gold mine area of Ngauro Boma on 6 April 2025 [see HRD Daily Report 9 April 2025]. Reportedly, the incident was reported at the Chukudum Police Station, and investigation is said to be ongoing.

Location of Incident: Matyar village, Aweng Payam, Twic
Description: 2.	On 5 May, multiple sources reported that, on 4 May, armed Nuer youths from Unity State, shot and killed one male Dinka Twic Mayardit civilian (age unspecified) and injured three other male civilians (ages unspecified) in a cattle camp in Matyar village, Aweng Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, the incident was in the context of opportunistic cross-border violence with Warrap State largely for cattle theft or connected to past and unresolved grievances. Reportedly, the injured victims were evacuated to a health facility in Turalei town for treatment.

Location of Incident: Matyar village, Aweng Payam, Twic
Description: 2.	On 5 May, multiple sources reported that, on 4 May, armed Nuer youths from Unity State, shot and killed one male Dinka Twic Mayardit civilian (age unspecified) and injured three other male civilians (ages unspecified) in a cattle camp in Matyar village, Aweng Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, the incident was in the context of opportunistic cross-border violence with Warrap State largely for cattle theft or connected to past and unresolved grievances. Reportedly, the injured victims were evacuated to a health facility in Turalei town for treatment.

Location of Incident: Malek-Ngok village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj South
Description:
3.	On 5 May, three secondary sources reported that, on 4 May, soldiers of the SSPDF allied with armed Dinka Gok youths from Cueibet County-Lakes State, shot and killed two male Dinka Luanyjang civilians (ages unspecified) in Malek-Ngok village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, the assailants ambushed one renegade SSPDF Colonel, and while he resisted the arrest, the assailants opened fire, killing the renegade Colonel, the two civilian victims and injured two armed renegade SSPDF soldiers who accompanied the Colonel. 

Comment: It is important to recall that, the deceased Colonel was allegedly behind the declaration of war on the republic, he attacked the SSPDF, freed suspects and was allegedly responsible for triggering the terrible clash between allied armed Dinka Luanyjang-Dinka Pan-Juaj youths and armed Dinka Jaluau youths in Wunlit and Palieng Payams, Tonj East County wherein HRD recorded over 224 deaths [see HRD Daily Report 14 April 2025].

Location of Incident: Nyindeng-Ayuel-Dit village in Wunrok Payam, Twic
Description: 4.	On 5 May, three secondary sources reported that on 4 May, one male Dinka Twic Mayardit civilian was shot and killed and two other male civilians shot and injured, during violence between the SSPDF and armed Dinka Twic youths in Nyindeng-Ayuel-Dit village in Wunrok Payam, Twic County.  According to the sources, the incident was a direct consequence of a retaliation by armed Dinka Twic youths against the SSPDF in the area, following rumors of the alleged extrajudicial execution of two members of their ranks allegedly by the SSPDF. Reportedly, in retaliation the angry armed youths confronted the SSPDF and in the ensuing violence, one of the armed youths along with one SSPDF soldier were shot and killed, while the civilian victims were killed and injured while grazing their cattle by stray bullets from the confrontation.

Location of Incident: Nyindeng-Ayuel-Dit village in Wunrok Payam, Twic
Description: 4.	On 5 May, three secondary sources reported that on 4 May, one male Dinka Twic Mayardit civilian was shot and killed and two other male civilians shot and injured, during violence between the SSPDF and armed Dinka Twic youths in Nyindeng-Ayuel-Dit village in Wunrok Payam, Twic County.  According to the sources, the incident was a direct consequence of a retaliation by armed Dinka Twic youths against the SSPDF in the area, following rumors of the alleged extrajudicial execution of two members of their ranks allegedly by the SSPDF. Reportedly, in retaliation the angry armed youths confronted the SSPDF and in the ensuing violence, one of the armed youths along with one SSPDF soldier were shot and killed, while the civilian victims were killed and injured while grazing their cattle by stray bullets from the confrontation.

Location of Incident: Majak-Pagai village in Aweng Payam, Twic
Description:
5.	On 5 May, three secondary sources reported that on 29 April, soldiers of the SSPDF extrajudicially executed two male Dinka Twic maryadit civilians (accused of robbery and murder), in Majak-Pagai village in Aweng Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, on 28 April, the victims were lured from their hideout to Turalei town and arrested by the SSPDF and detained at the Turalei town Police station on accusation of persistent armed robbery and murder in Abyei and Wunrok towns in Twic County. Reportedly, on 29 April the victims were extracted from police custody allegedly by the orders of a senior SSPDF officer and taken to Majak-Pagai village, where they were tied to a tree and executed by firing squad and their bodies were given to their relatives the following day for internment. 

Comment: It was reported that the senior SSPDF commander who gave the order, allegedly informed the people that he was acting in line with the provisions of the Green Book, bringing the total number of extrajudicial executions in Warrap State to 154 cases since 2021.

Location of Incident: Young Star residential area of Tambura town, Tambura
Description: 6.	On 5 May, two secondary sources reported that, on 1 May, unidentified armed elements attacked and injured two civilians (husband- aged 44 years from Azande community and wife-aged 33 years from Balanda community) in the Young Star residential area of Tambura town, Tambura County. According to the sources the assailants threw a hand grenade into the home of the victims resulting in bodily injury and the assailants fled the scene. Reportedly, the East African Regional Forces (EARF) rushed to the scene and after investigation, handed the victims to the Police in Tambura town for protective custody, while further investigation is ongoing to ascertain the identity of the assailants and bring them to justice.

Location of Incident: Tambura Town, Tambura
Description: 7.	On 5 May, multiple sources reported that, on 18 April, soldiers of the SSPDF arbitrarily arrested and detained incommunicado, one 23-year-old male civilian from the Balanda community in Tambura Town, Tambura County. According to the sources, the arrest and detention was based on accusations that the victim was a member of the pro-Balanda armed elements involved in the intercommunal violence in Tambura. Reportedly, the victim was arrested and detained at the joint SSPDF and East African Community Regional Protection Force (EACRPF) base in Tambura without access to family or legal representation.

Location of Incident: New Fangak town (Phom El Zeraf), Fangak
Description: 2.	Between 5 and 6 May, multiple secondary sources reported that, on 5 May, two male civilians were injured following an aerial bombardment operation by the SSPDF with an Antonov in New Fangak town (Phom El Zeraf), Fangak County. According to the sources, the SSPDF in their military campaign against the Sudan People’s Liberation Army-In Opposition (SPLA-IO) allegedly dropped rounds of munitions between the house of the County Commissioner and the office of an Internation Humanitarian organization (not located close to any military objective) leading to the injuring of two male civilians and the destruction of a dike built by the community to prevent flooding. Reportedly, another round of aerial strikes with two helicopter gunships and an Antonov released bombs into Pakan and Bichulkon Bomas in Fangak County allegedly leading to the death of one civilian and injuring three others (details unspecified) and an unspecified number of civilians are unaccounted for after this operation.

Location of Incident: New Fangak town (Phom El Zeraf), Fangak
Description: 2.	Between 5 and 6 May, multiple secondary sources reported that, on 5 May, two male civilians were injured following an aerial bombardment operation by the SSPDF with an Antonov in New Fangak town (Phom El Zeraf), Fangak County. According to the sources, the SSPDF in their military campaign against the Sudan People’s Liberation Army-In Opposition (SPLA-IO) allegedly dropped rounds of munitions between the house of the County Commissioner and the office of an Internation Humanitarian organization (not located close to any military objective) leading to the injuring of two male civilians and the destruction of a dike built by the community to prevent flooding. Reportedly, another round of aerial strikes with two helicopter gunships and an Antonov released bombs into Pakan and Bichulkon Bomas in Fangak County allegedly leading to the death of one civilian and injuring three others (details unspecified) and an unspecified number of civilians are unaccounted for after this operation.

Location of Incident: Nyarel Boma, Koch
Description: 3.	On 6 May, multiple secondary sources reported that, on the same day, an armed Jagay Nuer youth shot and injured an eight-year-old Jagay Nuer girl in Nyarel Boma, Koch County. According to the sources, the assailant was cleaning his rifle, when he allegedly accidentally discharges a bullet severely injuring the victim. Reportedly, the victim was evacuated to a health facility in Bentiu for advanced treatment, while the suspect was arrested and detained by the police in Koch County.

Location of Incident: Mangol-Apuk village,Toch West Payam, Gogrial East
Description: 4.	On 6 May, multiple secondary sources reported that, on the same day, armed Nuer youths from Unity State, shot and killed 14 Dinka Apuk-Jurwir civilians (10 males and four girls-ages unspecified) and injured 16 others (12 males and four girls-ages unspecified) in a cattle camp in Mangol-Apuk village,Toch West Payam, Gogrial East County. According to the assailants attacked the Dinka Apuk community in the context of opportunistic cross-border violence, killed and injured the victims and raided over 300 heads of cattle and fled the scene. Reportedly, the armed Dinka Apuk youths mobilized and pursued the assailants and recovered some of the raided cattle (unspecified number), while the armed Nuer fled with the rest. The injured victims were evacuated to a health facility in Pathuon West Payam for treatment.

Location of Incident: Mangol-Apuk village,Toch West Payam, Gogrial East
Description: 4.	On 6 May, multiple secondary sources reported that, on the same day, armed Nuer youths from Unity State, shot and killed 14 Dinka Apuk-Jurwir civilians (10 males and four girls-ages unspecified) and injured 16 others (12 males and four girls-ages unspecified) in a cattle camp in Mangol-Apuk village,Toch West Payam, Gogrial East County. According to the assailants attacked the Dinka Apuk community in the context of opportunistic cross-border violence, killed and injured the victims and raided over 300 heads of cattle and fled the scene. Reportedly, the armed Dinka Apuk youths mobilized and pursued the assailants and recovered some of the raided cattle (unspecified number), while the armed Nuer fled with the rest. The injured victims were evacuated to a health facility in Pathuon West Payam for treatment.

Location of Incident: Mangol-Apuk village,Toch West Payam, Gogrial East
Description: 4.	On 6 May, multiple secondary sources reported that, on the same day, armed Nuer youths from Unity State, shot and killed 14 Dinka Apuk-Jurwir civilians (10 males and four girls-ages unspecified) and injured 16 others (12 males and four girls-ages unspecified) in a cattle camp in Mangol-Apuk village,Toch West Payam, Gogrial East County. According to the assailants attacked the Dinka Apuk community in the context of opportunistic cross-border violence, killed and injured the victims and raided over 300 heads of cattle and fled the scene. Reportedly, the armed Dinka Apuk youths mobilized and pursued the assailants and recovered some of the raided cattle (unspecified number), while the armed Nuer fled with the rest. The injured victims were evacuated to a health facility in Pathuon West Payam for treatment.

Location of Incident: outskirts of Ngabagok Town in Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East
Description: 5.	On 6 May, three secondary sources reported that, on 5 May armed Dinka Akook youths from Ngabagok Payam, shot and killed two male civilians (one Dinka Luanyjang and one Dinka Lou-Paher- ages unspecified) in the outskirts of Ngabagok Town in Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the assailants intercepted the victims while they were traveling on a motorcycle from Ngabagok Payam to Romic Town in Palieng Payam for a cultural ceremony and asked them to identify themselves. Reportedly, after disclosing their identities they were immediately shot and killed.

Location of Incident: Romic village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East
Description: 6.	Between 30 April and 6 May, during a follow up by HRD, one primary source reported that on 7 April, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one 30-year-old male civilian and injured another 27-year-old civilian in Romic village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the assailants opened fire on the victims for unspecified reasons and fled the scene after the incident. Reportedly, the injured victim was evacuated to a health facility in Wau town, Western Bahr el Ghazal for treatment and a case was opened with the police in Tonj East County and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Romic village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East
Description: 6.	Between 30 April and 6 May, during a follow up by HRD, one primary source reported that on 7 April, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one 30-year-old male civilian and injured another 27-year-old civilian in Romic village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the assailants opened fire on the victims for unspecified reasons and fled the scene after the incident. Reportedly, the injured victim was evacuated to a health facility in Wau town, Western Bahr el Ghazal for treatment and a case was opened with the police in Tonj East County and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Kunor cattle camp in Adior Payam, Yirol East
Description: 1.	On 7 May, multiple secondary sources reported that on 6 May, armed Nuer youths from Panyijar County-Unity State, shot and killed four civilians (three adult male civilians and a five-year-old child- other details unspecified) and injured another male civilian (details unspecified) all from the Dinka Ciec community in the Kunor cattle camp in Adior Payam, Yirol East County. According to the sources, the assailants invaded the Kunor cattle camp, while the cattle keepers were sleeping, shot and killed the victims and injured another and fled the scene in the context of a revenge operation for past and unresolved grievances between the communities. Reportedly, the injured victim was taken to a health facility in Nyang Payam for treatment.

Location of Incident: Kunor cattle camp in Adior Payam, Yirol East
Description: 1.	On 7 May, multiple secondary sources reported that on 6 May, armed Nuer youths from Panyijar County-Unity State, shot and killed four civilians (three adult male civilians and a five-year-old child- other details unspecified) and injured another male civilian (details unspecified) all from the Dinka Ciec community in the Kunor cattle camp in Adior Payam, Yirol East County. According to the sources, the assailants invaded the Kunor cattle camp, while the cattle keepers were sleeping, shot and killed the victims and injured another and fled the scene in the context of a revenge operation for past and unresolved grievances between the communities. Reportedly, the injured victim was taken to a health facility in Nyang Payam for treatment.

Location of Incident: Tong village, Kueryiek Payam, Mayom
Description:
2.	Between 6 and 7 May, multiple sources reported that, on 6 May, six civilians were killed (three females and three children- details unspecified) and 12 others injured (details unspecified) during an aerial bombardment operation by the SSPDF in Tong village, Kueryiek Payam, Mayom County. According to the sources the SSPDF allegedly carried out a targeted operation through airstrikes (allegedly by helicopter gunships or Antonov) allegedly against armed Bul Nuer youths in Tong village in response to an earlier cattle raid by the armed Bul Nuer in Toch West County in Warrap State leading to multiple civilian casualties [see HRD Daily Report 7 May 2025]. Reportedly, during this aerial operation, six civilians were killed and 12 others injured including women and children. 

Comment: While there is need to further corroborate these allegations of human rights violations, these indiscriminate and disproportionate acts by the SSPDF amount to violations of International Humanitarian Law, applicable to non-international armed conflicts.

Location of Incident: Tong village, Kueryiek Payam, Mayom
Description:
