Location of Incident: Pagak-Dit village in Awul Payam, Tonj North
Description: 3.	On 7 May, three secondary sources reported that on 6 May, armed Dinka Leir youths from Kirik Payam, shot and killed three male Dinka Noi civilians (ages unspecified) and injured another male civilian (age unspecified) in Pagak-Dit village in Awul Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the incident was part of the ongoing intercommunal violence and cattle raid between the communities, when the assailants attacked the Dinka Noi community in Pagak-Dit village to raid cattle. Reportedly, the armed Dinka Noi youths mobilized and repelled the assailants, killing one armed Dinka Leir youth in the process, while the injured Dinka Noi civilian was taken to a health facility in Warrap town for treatment and tensions remain high between the two communities.

Location of Incident: Pagak-Dit village in Awul Payam, Tonj North
Description: 3.	On 7 May, three secondary sources reported that on 6 May, armed Dinka Leir youths from Kirik Payam, shot and killed three male Dinka Noi civilians (ages unspecified) and injured another male civilian (age unspecified) in Pagak-Dit village in Awul Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the incident was part of the ongoing intercommunal violence and cattle raid between the communities, when the assailants attacked the Dinka Noi community in Pagak-Dit village to raid cattle. Reportedly, the armed Dinka Noi youths mobilized and repelled the assailants, killing one armed Dinka Leir youth in the process, while the injured Dinka Noi civilian was taken to a health facility in Warrap town for treatment and tensions remain high between the two communities.

Location of Incident: Sher Shok cattle camp, in Alek Payam, Gogrial West
Description: 5.	On 7 May, during a follow-up by HRD, one primary source reported that 22 April, suspected armed Nuer youths from Unity State, shot and injured one 39-year-old male civilian in the Sher Shok cattle camp, in Alek Payam, Gogrial West County in Warrap State. The source recounted that the incident happened in perpetuation of the opportunistic cross-border cattle raid activity, when the assailants attacked the Sher Shok cattle camp and opened fire on the victim and injured him with intent to raid his cattle but were fended-off by other cattle keepers in the area. Reportedly, the victim was evacuated to a health facility in Wau town for treatment.

Location of Incident: Naminitoit Boma, Lomeyen Payam, Kapoeta North
Description: 1.	On 8 May, three secondary sources reported that on 5 May, armed Buya youths from Napak Boma, Kimotong Payam of Budi County, shot and killed two male Toposa civilians (aged 21 and 23 years) in Naminitoit Boma, Lomeyen Payam, Kapoeta North County. According to the sources, the assailants invaded Naminitoit Boma to raid cattle, when they met the victims, shot and killed the and raided 49 heads of cattle belonging to the victims and fled the scene. Reportedly, when the armed Toposa youths heard the shots, they mobilized and pursued the assailants and recovered 33 heads of cattle while the assailants crossed into Kimitong Payam with 16 heads of cattle. The incident was reported to the Riwoto police and investigations are underway although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Naminitoit Boma, Lomeyen Payam, Kapoeta North
Description: 1.	On 8 May, three secondary sources reported that on 5 May, armed Buya youths from Napak Boma, Kimotong Payam of Budi County, shot and killed two male Toposa civilians (aged 21 and 23 years) in Naminitoit Boma, Lomeyen Payam, Kapoeta North County. According to the sources, the assailants invaded Naminitoit Boma to raid cattle, when they met the victims, shot and killed the and raided 49 heads of cattle belonging to the victims and fled the scene. Reportedly, when the armed Toposa youths heard the shots, they mobilized and pursued the assailants and recovered 33 heads of cattle while the assailants crossed into Kimitong Payam with 16 heads of cattle. The incident was reported to the Riwoto police and investigations are underway although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Wutbec village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj South
Description: 3.	On 8 May, three secondary sources reported that on 7 May, armed Dinka Apuk-Jurwir youths from Thiet Payam, shot and injured one male Dinka Thony civilian (age unspecified) in a cattle camp in Wutbec village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked the Dinka Thony community in Manyangok Payam, shot and injured the victim and raided over 200 heads of cattle and fled the scene into Thiet Payam. Reportedly, the victim was taken to a health facility in Manyangok Payam for treatment.

Location of Incident: Wutbec village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj South
Description: 3.	On 8 May, three secondary sources reported that on 7 May, armed Dinka Apuk-Jurwir youths from Thiet Payam, shot and injured one male Dinka Thony civilian (age unspecified) in a cattle camp in Wutbec village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked the Dinka Thony community in Manyangok Payam, shot and injured the victim and raided over 200 heads of cattle and fled the scene into Thiet Payam. Reportedly, the victim was taken to a health facility in Manyangok Payam for treatment.

Location of Incident: Ngabanet village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East
Description:
4.	On 8 May, Multiple sources reported that, on 7 May, armed Dinka Akook youths of Ngabagok Payam shot and injured one male Dinka Luac-Koth civilian in Ngabanet village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the incident happened while the victim was traveling from Ngabagok Payam to Romic town in Palieng Payam along the Ngabagok- Romic road, in the mistaken belief that the victim was from the Dinka Luanyjang community. Reportedly, the assailants immediately fled the scene, and the victim was taken to a health facility in Tonj town for treatment. 

Comment: This incident happened in the context of the ongoing intercommunal violence between the Dinka Akook and the Dinka Thiik/Luanyjang in Tonj East County.

Location of Incident: St. Mary IDP Camp in Tambura Town, Tambura
Description: 5.	On 8 May, two secondary sources reported that on the same day, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one 35-year-old male civilian from the Azande community in the St. Mary IDP Camp in Tambura Town, Tambura County. According to the sources, the assailants entered the tent of the victim in the early hours of 8 May, shot and killed the victim and looted personal belongings and fled the scene. Reportedly, the motive behind his killing remains unknown, and the County authorities have launched an investigation to identify and apprehend the perpetrators.

Location of Incident: Kiwa Boma, Katire Payam, Ikotos
Description: 1.	On 9 May, three secondary sources reported that, on 6 May, armed Imatong youths from Kiwa Boma, Katire Payam, shot and killed two civilians (a 55-year-old Lotuko female civilian, and a 60-year-old Lotuko male civilian) both from Himodongi Payam, Torit County, in Kiwa Boma, Katire Payam, Ikotos County. According to the sources, the assailants shot and killed the victims while they were working in their farm in Kiwa Boma allegedly in revenge for the killing of a 45-year-old unarmed Imatong civilian and the injuring of a 27-year-old Imatong civilian by armed Lotuko youths from Himodongi Payam, Torit County in Kiwa Boma, Katire Payam [see HRD Daily Report 12 November 2024]. Reportedly, the incident was reported to both Torit and Ikotos Police Stations and investigations are ongoing although no suspect has been apprehended.

Location of Incident: GPAA
Description: 2.	Between 7 and 9 May, multiple sources reported that on 6 May, three female victims of abduction (a 30-year-old woman, her two-year-old daughter and an 11-year-old girl) were reunited with their families in Gumuruk County, GPAA. According to the sources, the woman and her daughter, originally from Evino Payam, Gumuruk County, and the 11-year-old girl, from Nyacharavachiz village in Labo Payam, in Gumuruk County, were abducted between 2 and 4 March 2025 during attacks by suspected Lou Nuer armed elements from Jonglei State in GPAA. Reportedly, the woman and her daughter were recovered on 04 April in Kueli village, Pieri Payam, Uror County, while the girl was recovered earlier, on 28 March, in Juet village, Yuai Payam, in Uror County. The victims were transported from Uror County, through Walgaak, to Pibor on 02 May and to Pibor on 06 May to be reunited with their families.

Location of Incident: Wunchuei village, Palieng Payam, Tonj East
Description: 3.	On 11 May, three secondary sources reported that, on 10 May, armed Dinka Pan-Chol youths shot and killed one male Dinka Bar civilian in Wunchuei village, Palieng Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, this was a revenge mission over the elopement of a Dinka Pan-Chol girl by the members of the Dinka Bar community in Tonj East County. Reportedly, the assailants shot and killed the victim and fled the scene, while the security forces were deployed to identify and apprehend the perpetrators.

Location of Incident: Toch area, in Makuac Payam, Tonj East
Description: 4.	On 11 May, three secondary sources reported that on 9 May, armed Dinka Pan-Lual youths shot and killed one male Dinka Akok civilian in Toch area, in Makuac Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the incident was caused by a dispute relating to girls, cows and unresolved grievances between the communities in Tonj Est County. Reportedly, the suspects were apprehended by security forces and detained in Makuac Payam pending further investigation.

Location of Incident: New Fangak town, Fangak County
Description: 4.	On 12 May, multiple sources reported that on 8 May, five civilians were killed (one male, one female and three children- ages unspecified) and seven others injured (five males and two females- ages unspecified) during aerial bombardment operations by the SSPDF allegedly with the support of the Ugandan People Defence Forces (UPDF) in New Fangak town, Fangak County. According to the sources, during the first round of bombardments, one male civilian was killed and seven others injured including two females, with one injured victim (an 18-year-old man) receiving treatment at a health facility in New Fangak town. Reportedly in the second round of bombardments one mother and her three children were killed and several civilian objects destroyed including a church and the fence of an international humanitarian organization.

Location of Incident: New Fangak town, Fangak County
Description: 4.	On 12 May, multiple sources reported that on 8 May, five civilians were killed (one male, one female and three children- ages unspecified) and seven others injured (five males and two females- ages unspecified) during aerial bombardment operations by the SSPDF allegedly with the support of the Ugandan People Defence Forces (UPDF) in New Fangak town, Fangak County. According to the sources, during the first round of bombardments, one male civilian was killed and seven others injured including two females, with one injured victim (an 18-year-old man) receiving treatment at a health facility in New Fangak town. Reportedly in the second round of bombardments one mother and her three children were killed and several civilian objects destroyed including a church and the fence of an international humanitarian organization.

Location of Incident: Old Fangak town, Fangak County
Description: 5.	Between 10 and 12 May, multiple sources reported that on 10 May, two male civilians were killed (details unspecified) and two others injured (details unspecified) during an aerial bombardment operation by the SSPDF allegedly with the support of the UPDF in Old Fangak town, Fangak County. According to the sources, several homes were destroyed during this operation and the body of one victim was retrieved for burial by the family in Old Fangak town.

Location of Incident: Old Fangak town, Fangak County
Description: 5.	Between 10 and 12 May, multiple sources reported that on 10 May, two male civilians were killed (details unspecified) and two others injured (details unspecified) during an aerial bombardment operation by the SSPDF allegedly with the support of the UPDF in Old Fangak town, Fangak County. According to the sources, several homes were destroyed during this operation and the body of one victim was retrieved for burial by the family in Old Fangak town.

Location of Incident: New Fangak Town, Fangak County
Description:
3.	On 13 May, multiple sources reported that on 12 May, seven male civilians were injured during military operations by the SSPDF, allegedly with the support of the Ugandan People’s Defence Forces (UPDF), the Rapid Support Forces (RSF), the Agwelek and Aboushok militia against the SPLA-IO and allied Nuer White Army in New Fangak Town, Fangak County. According to the sources, the SSPDF and the allied forces targeted and captured SPLA-IO positions using aerial bombardment (with helicopter gunships and Antonov) and tactical ground operations in New Fangak Town, resulting in the injury of seven male civilians, as well as destruction of several civilian houses. Reportedly, the SSPDF and the allied forces/militia also captured Diel and Dore in Pigi County and extended their military campaign to parts of Tonga and Panyikang Counties in Upper Nile state. The military operation reportedly triggered large scale civilian displacement to nearby areas. 

Comment: HRD will continue to monitor and verify violations of international human rights law as well as international humanitarian law in the ongoing military operations.

Location of Incident: Wuntur and Wichmuon villages, New Fangak, Fangak County
Description:
2.	On 14 May, multiple sources reported that on the same day, three civilians were killed including one woman, and several others were injured (exact number unspecified) during aerial bombardment by the SSPDF and allied forces in Wuntur and Wichmuon villages, New Fangak, Fangak County. According to the sources, the SSPDF and allied forces, targeted Wuntur and Wichmuon civilian settlements with two gunships and one Antonov in continuation of military operations against the Sudan People’s Liberation Army – In Opposition (SPLA-IO) and the White Army in the area, killing three civilians and injuring an undetermined number of civilians. 

Comment: According to the sources, Wuntur and Wechmuon settlements hosted most of the displaced civilians who had sought refuge. Reportedly, approximately 27,000 civilians have been displaced due to the fighting

Location of Incident: Wuntur and Wichmuon villages, New Fangak, Fangak County
Description:
2. Location of Incident: Khorgana village, Mogiri Boma, Mangalla Payam, Juba
Description: 1.	Between 9-12 May, multiple secondary sources reported that on 8 May, Murle armed elements from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA), shot and killed one male civilian in Khorgana village, Mogiri Boma, Mangalla Payam, Juba County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked and opened fire on three male civilians (details unspecified), while they were producing charcoal in the area, killing the victim while the other two escaped. Reportedly, the body of the victim is yet to be retrieved by the family for a burial.

Location of Incident: St. Kizito and Jaborona residential areas respectively in Juba town, Juba
Description: 2.	On 12 May, multiple secondary sources reported that, on 9 May, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one 46-year-old male Azande civilian and injured another (a Sudanese national) in St. Kizito and Jaborona residential areas respectively in Juba town, Juba County.  According to the sources, in the first incident the assailants invaded the compound of the first victim, opened fire and killed the victim, while he was attending a family meeting, and fled the scene although there were no reports of casualties suffered by the other family members. Reportedly, in the second incident, the assailants shot and injured the victim while he was on his way to work and fled the scene immediately. The injured victim was taken to a health facility in Juba town for treatment and the motive for both attacks remains unknown. The incidents were reported to the Jebel and Western Police stations respectively and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: St. Kizito and Jaborona residential areas respectively in Juba town, Juba
Description: 2.	On 12 May, multiple secondary sources reported that, on 9 May, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one 46-year-old male Azande civilian and injured another (a Sudanese national) in St. Kizito and Jaborona residential areas respectively in Juba town, Juba County.  According to the sources, in the first incident the assailants invaded the compound of the first victim, opened fire and killed the victim, while he was attending a family meeting, and fled the scene although there were no reports of casualties suffered by the other family members. Reportedly, in the second incident, the assailants shot and injured the victim while he was on his way to work and fled the scene immediately. The injured victim was taken to a health facility in Juba town for treatment and the motive for both attacks remains unknown. The incidents were reported to the Jebel and Western Police stations respectively and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Mogos Boma, Mogos Payam, Kapoeta East
Description: 3.	On 12 May, three secondary sources reported that on 7 May, armed Jie youths from Kassengor Payam, shot and killed one 26-year-old male Toposa civilian in Mogos Boma, Mogos Payam, Kapoeta East County. According to the sources, the incident was a revenge action following a dispute and attack on the Jie cattle keepers by the Toposa cattle keeper over grazing land jointly occupied by both Jie and Toposa herders, but over which the Toposa claimed exclusive ownership. Reportedly, after the dispute and attack by the Toposa armed cattle keepers earlier on 7 May (no casualties recorded), the armed Jie youths met the victim in the outskirt of Mogos Boma, shot and killed him in retaliation and fled the scene. The incident was reported to Narus police station and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: GPAA
Description:
6.	Between 10 and 12 May, two primary sources reported that on 2 April and 3 March 2025, respectively, two child victims of abduction (14-year-old girl and a 13-year-old boy) from the Murle community, in Gumuruk County, GPAA, were recovered by the authorities in Walgak Payam, Akobo County. The sources recounted that the 14-year-old girl, from Lopoth village in Lotilla Payam, Gumuruk County, was abducted in December 2022 when Dinka Bor and Lou Nuer armed youths attacked GPAA and was taken to Walgaak Payam where she lived with her abductors until recovered by the authorities on 2 April 2025. Reportedly, the 13-year-old boy from Nyacharavachiz village in Labo Payam, Gumuruk County, was also abducted in 2022 (precise date unspecified) by Lou Nuer armed youths and taken to Walgak Payam in Akobo County. He escaped his abductors on 7 November 2024 and reported himself to local authorities in Walgak, Akobo County but was re-abducted and later re-recovered by the authorities on 3 March 2025.

Comment: on 9 May, both children were transferred to an intensive care unit in Bor town, awaiting family tracing and reunion.

Location of Incident: the Ameth-yic / Nyanyom cattle camp in Maper town, Rumbek North
Description: 7.	On 12 May, multiple secondary sources reported that on 11 May, armed Nyoung Nuer youths from Pachak, Pachengjok and Ganylel Payams (Pachar constituency) of Panyijiar County, shot and killed 21 civilians (eight children and five adults-including three women from the Gaak clan of the Pakam section of the Dinka Agaar; five Nuer male civilians, and three males from the Dinka Luanyjang of Warrap State- ages of victims unspecified) and injured 21 others (details unspecified) in the Ameth-yic / Nyanyom cattle camp in Maper town, Rumbek North County. According to the sources, this incident is part of the recurrent opportunistic cross-border violence and cattle raids by the armed Nuer youths in the area. Reportedly, the injured victims were taken to a health facility in Maper town and those in critical conditions were evacuated to a health facility in Rumbek town for treatment. The security forces were deployed to the area to contain the situation and with the help of the armed Dinka Pakam youths, they recovered all raided cattle from the assailants who escaped through the bushes.

Location of Incident: the Ameth-yic / Nyanyom cattle camp in Maper town, Rumbek North
Description: 7.	On 12 May, multiple secondary sources reported that on 11 May, armed Nyoung Nuer youths from Pachak, Pachengjok and Ganylel Payams (Pachar constituency) of Panyijiar County, shot and killed 21 civilians (eight children and five adults-including three women from the Gaak clan of the Pakam section of the Dinka Agaar; five Nuer male civilians, and three males from the Dinka Luanyjang of Warrap State- ages of victims unspecified) and injured 21 others (details unspecified) in the Ameth-yic / Nyanyom cattle camp in Maper town, Rumbek North County. According to the sources, this incident is part of the recurrent opportunistic cross-border violence and cattle raids by the armed Nuer youths in the area. Reportedly, the injured victims were taken to a health facility in Maper town and those in critical conditions were evacuated to a health facility in Rumbek town for treatment. The security forces were deployed to the area to contain the situation and with the help of the armed Dinka Pakam youths, they recovered all raided cattle from the assailants who escaped through the bushes.

Location of Incident: Meen Payam of Rumbek North
Description: 8.	Between 10-12 May, multiple sources reported that, on 9 and 10 May, five civilians were killed (three male Panawer and two male Panruop- ages unspecified) and seven others (all male from the Panawer sub-clan) during and intracommunal violence between the Panruop and Panawer sub-clans of the Pakam section of Dinka Agaar in Meen Payam of Rumbek North County. According to the sources, on 9 May, the armed Dinka Panruop youths attacked the Pac/Thol cattle camp in Meen Payam, shot and killed three male civilians and injured seven others in revenge for the alleged impregnation of a Dinka Panruop girl by a Dinka Panawer male civilian. Reportedly, on 10 May, the armed Dinka Panawer youths in retaliation, shot and killed two male Dinka Panruop civilians. The injured victims were taken to a health facility in Maper town for treatment.

Location of Incident: Meen Payam of Rumbek North
Description: 8.	Between 10-12 May, multiple sources reported that, on 9 and 10 May, five civilians were killed (three male Panawer and two male Panruop- ages unspecified) and seven others (all male from the Panawer sub-clan) during and intracommunal violence between the Panruop and Panawer sub-clans of the Pakam section of Dinka Agaar in Meen Payam of Rumbek North County. According to the sources, on 9 May, the armed Dinka Panruop youths attacked the Pac/Thol cattle camp in Meen Payam, shot and killed three male civilians and injured seven others in revenge for the alleged impregnation of a Dinka Panruop girl by a Dinka Panawer male civilian. Reportedly, on 10 May, the armed Dinka Panawer youths in retaliation, shot and killed two male Dinka Panruop civilians. The injured victims were taken to a health facility in Maper town for treatment.

Location of Incident: Bur village, Wunlit Payam in Tonj East
Description: 9.	On 12 May, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, suspected armed Dinka Luanyjang youths shot and injured one male Dinka Jaluau civilian in Bur village, Wunlit Payam in Tonj East County. According to the sources, the incident was in perpetuation of cyclical and retaliatory violence between the two communities as the assailants shot and injured the victim who while he was seeing off his in-laws who had visited him earlier on. Reportedly, the victim was taken to a health facility in Wunlit Payam for treatment and no arrests have been made as the perpetrators are still at large.

Location of Incident: Ameth village, Akop Payam, Tonj North
Description: 10.	On 12 May, three secondary sources reported that on 11 May, two male civilians were shot and killed (one Dinka Apuk-Patoc and one Dinka Lou-Paher- ages unspecified) during violence between allied armed Dinka Luanyjang and Lou-Paher youths and the armed Dinka Apuk-Patoc youths in Ameth village, Akop Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the allied armed Dinka Luanyjang and Lou-Paher youths attacked a cattle camp in Ameth village to raid cattle belonging to the Dinka Apuk-Patoc community, and shot the killed one male civilian, but were fended off by the armed Dinka Apuk-Patoc youth who mobilized and retaliated killing one Dinka Lunayjang armed youth in the process. Reportedly, later the same day the armed Dinka Apuk-Patoc youths also shot and killed one male Dinka Lou-Paher civilian and raided 15 heads of cattle and fled the scene.

Location of Incident: Ameth village, Akop Payam, Tonj North
Description: 10.	On 12 May, three secondary sources reported that on 11 May, two male civilians were shot and killed (one Dinka Apuk-Patoc and one Dinka Lou-Paher- ages unspecified) during violence between allied armed Dinka Luanyjang and Lou-Paher youths and the armed Dinka Apuk-Patoc youths in Ameth village, Akop Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the allied armed Dinka Luanyjang and Lou-Paher youths attacked a cattle camp in Ameth village to raid cattle belonging to the Dinka Apuk-Patoc community, and shot the killed one male civilian, but were fended off by the armed Dinka Apuk-Patoc youth who mobilized and retaliated killing one Dinka Lunayjang armed youth in the process. Reportedly, later the same day the armed Dinka Apuk-Patoc youths also shot and killed one male Dinka Lou-Paher civilian and raided 15 heads of cattle and fled the scene.

Location of Incident: Kuany-Goi village, Awul Payam, Tonj North
Description: 11.	On 12 May, three secondary sources reported that on 11 May, armed Dinka Leir youths from Kirik Payam, shot and killed one male Dinka Noi civilian in Kuany-Goi village, Awul Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, this incident was in a classical revenge style mission for past and unresolved grievances between the communities, as the assailants shot and killed the victim and fled the scene without raiding any cattle from the victim or the community. Reportedly, tension is building in the area with the possibility of further violence if the situation is not contained.

Location of Incident: Ayat Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) camp in Tambura town, Tambura
Description: 12.	On 12 May, two secondary sources reported that on 9 May, an unidentified armed element stabbed and injured one 25-year-old male civilian from the Azande community in the Ayat Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) camp in Tambura town, Tambura County. According to the sources, the victim’s wife visited her family within the Ayat IDP camp and upon her return, the victim received a phone call allegedly from his wife’s phone number issuing threats. Reportedly, later that day, while the victim and family were sleeping the same number called the victim and upon answering the call, the victim was stabbed and injured and the perpetrated fled the scene. The victim was taken to a health facility in Tambura town for treatment and the incident reported to the police and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Lolianga Boma, Hiyala Payam, Torit
Description: 1.	On 13 May, three secondary sources reported that on 9 May, armed Lotuko youths from Lolianga Boma, Hiyala Payam assaulted and killed one 45-year-old woman in Lolianga Boma, Hiyala Payam, Torit County. According to the sources, a group of approximately 30 youths armed with matchets and sticks attacked the victim at her home and beat her to death on accusations of practicing witchcraft and for allegedly being responsible for the death of seven children through witchcraft. The incident was reported at the Hiyala Payam and Torit Police stations and investigation is reportedly ongoing; however, no suspects have been apprehended so far.

Location of Incident: Lohutok Boma, Lohutok Payam, Imehejek Administrative Area
Description: 2.	On 13 May, three secondary sources reported that on 29 April, armed Toposa youths from Riwoto Payam, Kapoeta North County shot and killed one 25-year-old male Lopit civilian during an attempted cattle raid in Lohutok Boma, Lohutok Payam, Imehejek Administrative Area. According to the sources, a group of six armed Toposa youths stormed the grazing land in Lohutok Boma, opened fire on the victim (a cattle herder), killing him and thereafter fled the scene when the Lopit youths mobilised to repulse them. The incident was reported at Imehejek Police Station and investigation is reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: Yuai, Uror County, Jonglei State, to Gei Payam, Likuangole
Description:
4.	On 13 May, one primary source and two secondary sources reported that on 11 May, one 19-year-old woman from Yuai Payam, Uror County was recovered by the authorities in Pibor, GPAA. According to the sources, the victim was abducted from Yuai Payam in 2022 (exact date unspecified) by the Murle armed elements and taken to Nyacharavachiz Payam, Gumuruk County where she remained with her abductors. Reportedly, on 9 May, she escaped from her abductors and reported to the authorities in Gumuruk County, who subsequently transferred her to Pibor on 11 May for protective custody, awaiting family tracing and reunification. The survivor was reportedly subjected to sexual slavery and rape while in captivity.

Comment: HRD is coordinating with the authorities and protection partners in Jonglei and GPAA to provide medical and psychosocial support to the survivor.

Location of Incident: Kuel-Aguang village in Awul Payam, Tonj North
Description: 6.	On 13 May, four secondary sources reported that on 12 May, armed Dinka Leir youths from Kirik Payam shot and killed one male civilian and injured another, both from the Dinka Apuk community, in Kuel-Aguang village in Awul Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Leir youths ambushed and opened fire on the victims while they were traveling on a motorcycle from Luanyaker in Pathuon West Payam, Gogrial East County to Warrap Town, killing one and injuring another. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Warrap Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Kuel-Aguang village in Awul Payam, Tonj North
Description: 6.	On 13 May, four secondary sources reported that on 12 May, armed Dinka Leir youths from Kirik Payam shot and killed one male civilian and injured another, both from the Dinka Apuk community, in Kuel-Aguang village in Awul Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Leir youths ambushed and opened fire on the victims while they were traveling on a motorcycle from Luanyaker in Pathuon West Payam, Gogrial East County to Warrap Town, killing one and injuring another. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Warrap Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Manyiel village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj North
Description:
7.	On 13 May, three secondary sources reported that on 12 May, armed Dinka Gok youths from Cueibet County, Lakes State shot and killed one civilian from the Dinka Thony community in Manyiel village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Gok youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Thony community Manyiel village, killing one of the residents, and thereafter fled the scene. The attack is reportedly a revenge action linked to past violence and unresolved grievances between the two communities. 

Comment: Tension is reportedly mounting in the area, amidst reports of mobilization by the armed Dinka Thony youths for a revenge attack.

Location of Incident: Nagarhad Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi
Description: 1.	On 14 May, three secondary sources reported that on 13 May, armed Logir youths from Chahari Payam, Ikotos County shot and injured one 35-year-old male civilian (a cattle herder) from the Buya community in Nagarhad Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, the armed Logir youths attacked a grazing area in Nagarhad Boma and opened fire on the victim, injuring him. The attackers also raided over 400 heads of cattle. The injured victim was taken to a health care facility in Loriyok for medical treatment. The incident was reported at Loriyok Police Station and investigation is reportedly ongoing; however, no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Nagarhad Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi
Description: 1.	On 14 May, three secondary sources reported that on 13 May, armed Logir youths from Chahari Payam, Ikotos County shot and injured one 35-year-old male civilian (a cattle herder) from the Buya community in Nagarhad Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, the armed Logir youths attacked a grazing area in Nagarhad Boma and opened fire on the victim, injuring him. The attackers also raided over 400 heads of cattle. The injured victim was taken to a health care facility in Loriyok for medical treatment. The incident was reported at Loriyok Police Station and investigation is reportedly ongoing; however, no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Ameth village, Akop Payam, Tonj North
Description: 3.	On 14 May, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Apuk-Patoc youths shot and killed three male civilians from the Dinka Luanyjang community in Ameth village, Akop Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the assailants ambushed and opened fire on the victims as they were traveling on a motorcycle from Romic Town in Palieng Payam to Tonj Town via Marial-Lou and Akop Payams, killing them. The sources further informed that the attack was a revenge action linked to ongoing violence between the communities.

Location of Incident: Akop Payam, Tonj North
Description: 4.	On 14 May, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, armed Nuer youths from Mayom County, Unity State shot and killed two male civilians from the Dinka Apuk-Patoc community during an attempted cattle raid in Akop Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the armed Nuer youths, who were retreating from being pursued by armed Dinka Apuk-Patoc youths after a foiled cattle raid, opened fire on the victims who were fishing in the Toch area, killing them. The armed Nuer youths also seized their fishing gear, catch of fish and personal items and fled back into Unity state.

Location of Incident: Akop Payam, Tonj North
Description: 4.	On 14 May, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, armed Nuer youths from Mayom County, Unity State shot and killed two male civilians from the Dinka Apuk-Patoc community during an attempted cattle raid in Akop Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the armed Nuer youths, who were retreating from being pursued by armed Dinka Apuk-Patoc youths after a foiled cattle raid, opened fire on the victims who were fishing in the Toch area, killing them. The armed Nuer youths also seized their fishing gear, catch of fish and personal items and fled back into Unity state.

Location of Incident: Ameth-Chok village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj North
Description: On 14 May, three secondary sources reported that on 13 May, armed Dinka Apuk-Jurwir youths from Thiet Payam shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Thony community in Ameth-Chok village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Apuk-Jurwir youths attacked  and opened fire on Ameth-Chok village, killing one of the residents and thereafter fled the scene. The attack was reportedly a revenge action in the context of ongoing violence between the two communities sides and unresolved grievances.

Location of Incident: the Manqatiin locality of Momoi B Boma, Baggari Payam, Wau
Description:
6.	On 14 May, one primary source and one secondary source reported that on 15 February 2024, and 20 January 2025, SPLA-IO elements raped one 16-year-old girl from the Balanda community in the Manqatiin locality of Momoi B Boma, Baggari Payam, Wau County. According to the sources, the victim was raped twice by the SPLA-IO elements with the complicity of her mother and stepfather for financial and other gains. On these occasions, the victim was confined in a room with the SPLA-IO elements and raped at gunpoint and was reportedly threatened by her mother and stepfather to not report the issue to anyone. Reportedly, the victim escaped to her father’s residence in Agok, Wau Town, whereupon the father filed a complaint with the Special Protection Unit and arrests warrants were issued for the perpetrators including the mother and stepfather of the victim on grounds of complicity to commit rape; however, the perpetrators are yet to be apprehended. The victim was taken for medical examination, which confirmed the rape and a two-month pregnancy.

Comment: HRD will follow up on the case for accountability of the perpetrators.

Location of Incident: Pebokoi Boma, Lotukei Payam, Budi
Description: 1.	On 15 May, three secondary sources reported that on 10 May, armed Toposa youths from Natinga Payam, Kapoeta East County shot and injured one 19-year-old male civilian from the Didinga community in Pebokoi Boma, Lotukei Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, three armed Toposa youths, while retreating from raiding 50 goats from Pebokoi Boma, encountered and opened fire on the victim as he was returning from his farm on the outskirts of Pebokoi, injuring him. The youth reportedly shot him in the arm before fleeing with the stolen livestock.

Location of Incident: Pebokoi Boma, Lotukei Payam, Budi
Description: 1.	On 15 May, three secondary sources reported that on 10 May, armed Toposa youths from Natinga Payam, Kapoeta East County shot and injured one 19-year-old male civilian from the Didinga community in Pebokoi Boma, Lotukei Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, three armed Toposa youths, while retreating from raiding 50 goats from Pebokoi Boma, encountered and opened fire on the victim as he was returning from his farm on the outskirts of Pebokoi, injuring him. The youth reportedly shot him in the arm before fleeing with the stolen livestock.

Location of Incident: Buaw Payam, Mar Boma, Koch
Description: 3.	Between 14 and 15 May, multiple secondary sources reported that on 14 May, armed Jagay-Nuer youths from the Reangyian sub-clan in Jaak Payam shot and killed one 21-year-old Jagay-Nuer male civilian from Chotyiel sub-clan in Buaw Payam, Mar Boma, Koch County. According to the sources, the incident was in retaliation for an armed attack against the Reangyian subclan allegedly conducted by armed elements from the Chotyiel sub-clan in Koch Town in December 2024. Reportedly, the County authorities and the police have opened an investigation to apprehend the perpetrators.

Location of Incident: Buaw Payam, Mar Boma, Koch
Description: 3.	Between 14 and 15 May, multiple secondary sources reported that on 14 May, armed Jagay-Nuer youths from the Reangyian sub-clan in Jaak Payam shot and killed one 21-year-old Jagay-Nuer male civilian from Chotyiel sub-clan in Buaw Payam, Mar Boma, Koch County. According to the sources, the incident was in retaliation for an armed attack against the Reangyian subclan allegedly conducted by armed elements from the Chotyiel sub-clan in Koch Town in December 2024. Reportedly, the County authorities and the police have opened an investigation to apprehend the perpetrators.

Location of Incident: Phannyadit Boma, Barmalual Payam, Rubkona
Description:
4.	On 14 May, multiple sources reported that on 8 May, unidentified armed elements raped three female civilians (ages unspecified) in Phannyadit Boma, Barmalual Payam, Rubkona County. According to the sources, a group of five unidentified armed elements accosted the victims while they had gone searching for waterlilies in the river and proceeded to rape them at gunpoint. 

Comment: Several rape incidents have been reported in Rubkona County, with armed men targeting women and girls who go in search of waterlilies, food, or firewood. HRD will conduct further investigations into the incidents

Location of Incident: Magak village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj North
Description: 5.	On 15 May, three secondary sources reported that on 14 May, armed Dinka Apuk-Jurwir youths from Wanhalel Payam shot and killed one unarmed prison officer (off-duty) from the Dinka Thony community in Magak village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources the assailants ambushed and opened fire on the victim while he was traveling from Tonj Town to Manyangok Payam, killing him. Reportedly, the attack is linked to the ongoing violence between the Dinka Apuk-Jurwir and Dinka Thony communities.

Location of Incident: Malual-Cum village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East
Description: 6.	On 15 May, three secondary sources reported that on 14 May, armed Dinka Akook youths shot and injured one male civilian from the Dinka Thiik community in Malual-Cum village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Akook youths attacked and opened fire on the victim while he was grazing his cattle in the area, injuring him.

Location of Incident: Aworo village, Kendre Boma, Lujulo Payam, Morobo
Description: 1.	On 16 May, one primary source and two secondary sources reported that on 15 May, suspected NAS elements abducted four male civilians including one traditional leader in Aworo village, Kendre Boma, Lujulo Payam, Morobo County. As recounted by the sources, the NAS elements first abduct the traditional leader (45-year-old) from the Keliko community from his residence, reportedly for being a government collaborator, and thereafter proceeded to abduct one 60-year-old man from his home. The other two victims were reportedly abducted by the NAS elements as they exited the village. The sources further informed that the abductions were in retaliation for comments made by community leaders during a recent visit by the Governor of Central Equatoria State to Lujulo Payam. Reportedly, two of the abductees were subsequently released, while the traditional leader and another victim remain in NAS custody in an unknown location.

Location of Incident: Bereka Boma, Lainya Payam, Lainya
Description:
2.	On 16 May, three secondary sources reported that on 13 May, armed Mundari cattle keepers shot and killed one 50-year-old male civilian in Bereka Boma, Lainya Payam, Lainya County. According to the sources, a group of armed Mundari cattle keepers attacked and opened fire on the victim at his homestead, killing him. The attackers also seized an unspecified number of goats and thereafter fled the area. 

Comment: Reportedly, community leaders in the area report a growing pattern of insecurity linked to the presence of armed cattle keepers in the area, who continue to graze their cattle on community farmlands without consent, leading to frequent confrontations with local farmers, as well as cattle theft, looting of civilian property, intimidation, and in some instances, killing of community members.

Location of Incident: Bereka Boma, Lainya Payam, Lainya
Description:
2.	On 16 May, three secondary sources reported that on 13 May, armed Mundari cattle keepers shot and killed one 50-year-old male civilian in Bereka Boma, Lainya Payam, Lainya County. According to the sources, a group of armed Mundari cattle keepers attacked and opened fire on the victim at his homestead, killing him. The attackers also seized an unspecified number of goats and thereafter fled the area. 

Comment: Reportedly, community leaders in the area report a growing pattern of insecurity linked to the presence of armed cattle keepers in the area, who continue to graze their cattle on community farmlands without consent, leading to frequent confrontations with local farmers, as well as cattle theft, looting of civilian property, intimidation, and in some instances, killing of community members.

Location of Incident: Kuku community in Juba City
Description: 3.	On 6 May, three secondary sources reported that on 13 May, one NSS personnel shot and killed a 23-year-old male civilian from the Kuku community in Juba City. According to the sources, the victim and a relative were having an altercation at the staff residence at the Main Campus of the University of Juba when an armed man dressed in civilian clothing approached and opened fire on them killing, killing the victim. Reportedly, the perpetrator attempted to flee the scene; however, he was apprehended by the university security guards and handed over to the Police Emergency Unit based at Nyakuron East where he was detained and an investigation is underway. The police and university guards identified the perpetrator as an officer of the NSS. The motive for the attack remains unknown.

Location of Incident: irangore Boma, Hiyala Payam, Torit
Description: 4.	On 16 May, multiple sources reported that on 15 May, armed Lotuko youths shot and injured two male civilians (ages 30 and 35 years old) from the Lotuko community in Tirangore Boma, Hiyala Payam, Torit County. According to the sources, three armed Lotuko youths ambushed a commercial vehicle transporting approximately 50 goats from Kapoeta South County via Hiyala Payam en route to Juba for sale, injuring two of the passengers. The injured victims were evacuated to a hospital in Torit for medical treatment. Reportedly, the 35-year-old victim who was severely injured has been referred to Juba for advanced medical treatment. A case has been opened at the Torit Police Station, and investigations are reportedly ongoing; however, no suspect has been apprehended so far.

Location of Incident: Yuai, Uror
Description:
5.	On 15 May, multiple sources reported that on 2 May, two women (ages 18 and 25 years old) from the Murle community who had been abducted by armed elements from Jonglei State when they attacked Gumuruk County on 2 March 2025 were recovered in Yuai, Uror County. As recounted by the sources, the women escaped from their abductors in Yuai and reached the border between Jonglei and GPAA where they spent four days with the Murle armed youths who supported their transfer to Wuno Payam, Likuangole County, and thereafter transferred by protection actors to Pibor for family tracing and reunification. Reportedly, the 25-year-old woman was subjected to rape and sexual slavery during her captivity, while the 18-year-old denied any sexual violence. 

Comment: HRD is working with protection actors to provide medical and psychosocial support to the victims as a preventive measure.

Location of Incident: Yuai, Uror
Description:
5.	On 15 May, multiple sources reported that on 2 May, two women (ages 18 and 25 years old) from the Murle community who had been abducted by armed elements from Jonglei State when they attacked Gumuruk County on 2 March 2025 were recovered in Yuai, Uror County. As recounted by the sources, the women escaped from their abductors in Yuai and reached the border between Jonglei and GPAA where they spent four days with the Murle armed youths who supported their transfer to Wuno Payam, Likuangole County, and thereafter transferred by protection actors to Pibor for family tracing and reunification. Reportedly, the 25-year-old woman was subjected to rape and sexual slavery during her captivity, while the 18-year-old denied any sexual violence. 

Comment: HRD is working with protection actors to provide medical and psychosocial support to the victims as a preventive measure.

Location of Incident: in Ngapagok Payam, Tonj East
Description:
7.	On 18 May, three primary sources reported that on 17 May, five civilians were shot and killed (three from the Dinka Akook community and two from the Dinka Thiik community) and 19 others were injured (10 Dinka Akook including three women and nine Dinka Thiik) during violence between armed Dinka Thiik and Dinka Akook youths in Ngapagok Payam, Tonj East County. A recounted by the sources, armed Dinka Thiik youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Akook community in Ngabagok Town, killing three male civilians and injuring 10 others including three women. The attackers also reportedly burnt down at least 18 houses (tukuls). In retaliation, armed Dinka Akook youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Thiik community in Malual-Chum village, killing two male civilians and injuring nine others. The injured victims from the Dinka Akook community are reportedly receiving medical treatment at a health care facility in Ngabagok, while those from the Dinka Thiik community were evacuated to a hospital in Tonj Town for medical treatment.

Comment: According to the sources, armed Dinka Akook youths are mobilising for another revenge attack against the Dinka Thiik community. Observably, the violence between the two communities continues, despite several interventions and peace initiatives including by their respective leaders to avert cyclic retaliatory violence.

Location of Incident: in Ngapagok Payam, Tonj East
Description:
7.	On 18 May, three primary sources reported that on 17 May, five civilians were shot and killed (three from the Dinka Akook community and two from the Dinka Thiik community) and 19 others were injured (10 Dinka Akook including three women and nine Dinka Thiik) during violence between armed Dinka Thiik and Dinka Akook youths in Ngapagok Payam, Tonj East County. A recounted by the sources, armed Dinka Thiik youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Akook community in Ngabagok Town, killing three male civilians and injuring 10 others including three women. The attackers also reportedly burnt down at least 18 houses (tukuls). In retaliation, armed Dinka Akook youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Thiik community in Malual-Chum village, killing two male civilians and injuring nine others. The injured victims from the Dinka Akook community are reportedly receiving medical treatment at a health care facility in Ngabagok, while those from the Dinka Thiik community were evacuated to a hospital in Tonj Town for medical treatment.

Comment: According to the sources, armed Dinka Akook youths are mobilising for another revenge attack against the Dinka Thiik community. Observably, the violence between the two communities continues, despite several interventions and peace initiatives including by their respective leaders to avert cyclic retaliatory violence.

Location of Incident: in Ngapagok Payam, Tonj East
Description:
7. The attackers also reportedly burnt down at least 18 houses (tukuls). In retaliation, armed Dinka Akook youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Thiik community in Malual-Chum village, killing two male civilians and injuring nine others. Location of Incident: Ameth village, Akop Payam, Tonj North
Description: 8.	On 18 May, three primary sources reported that on 17 May, armed Dinka Luanyjang youths shot and killed three civilians (one woman and two boys) from the Dinka Apuk-Patoc community in Ameth village, Akop Payam, Tonj North County. As recounted by the sources, armed Dinka Luanyjang youths attacked and opened fire on a homestead in Ameth village, killing the victims. The sources further informed that the attack was a revenge action linked to cyclic retaliatory violence between the two communities.

Location of Incident: Tiap-Tiap village, Cueibet County, Lakes State and Wunlit Payam, Tonj East
Description: 9.	On 18 May, three primary sources reported that on 16 May, six civilians (four from the Dinka Jaluau community and two from the Dinka Gok community) were shot and killed during a cattle-related violence between armed Dinka Jaluau and Dinka Gok youths in Tiap-Tiap village, Cueibet County, Lakes State and Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Jaluau youths attacked and opened fire on a Dinka Gok cattle camp in Tiap-Tiap village, killing two male civilians. The attackers also seized approximately 200 heads of cattle and fled back into Wunlit Payam. Reportedly, in retaliation, armed Dinka Gok youths shot and killed four Dinka Jaluau male civilians who were grazing and watering their cattle in the swampy area along the common border. The likelihood of more revenge violence between the two communities remains high.

Location of Incident: Tiap-Tiap village, Cueibet County, Lakes State and Wunlit Payam, Tonj East
Description: 9.	On 18 May, three primary sources reported that on 16 May, six civilians (four from the Dinka Jaluau community and two from the Dinka Gok community) were shot and killed during a cattle-related violence between armed Dinka Jaluau and Dinka Gok youths in Tiap-Tiap village, Cueibet County, Lakes State and Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Jaluau youths attacked and opened fire on a Dinka Gok cattle camp in Tiap-Tiap village, killing two male civilians. The attackers also seized approximately 200 heads of cattle and fled back into Wunlit Payam. Reportedly, in retaliation, armed Dinka Gok youths shot and killed four Dinka Jaluau male civilians who were grazing and watering their cattle in the swampy area along the common border. The likelihood of more revenge violence between the two communities remains high.

Location of Incident: Logo Boma, Otogo Payam, Yei River County
Description: 1.	On 19 May, one primary source and two secondary sources reported that on 17 May, NAS elements momentarily abducted three male civilians in Logo Boma, Otogo Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, the NAS elements intercepted the victims while they were travelling on their motorcycles along the Yei-Maridi-Road in Logo Boma,  forcibly took them into nearby bushes at gunpoint and held them for approximately one hour. The NAS elements  reportedly accused the victims for not supporting the NAS rebellion and siding with the Government of South Sudan. The NAS elements also sized their mobile phones and money, and subsequently released them with their motorcycles.

Location of Incident: Iteso Boma, Ikotos Payam, Ikotos County
Description:
2.	On 19 May, three secondary sources reported that on 5 May, armed Lango youths from Ngaluma Boma shot and killed two male civilians (ages 45 and 50 years old) from the Lango community in Iteso Boma, Ikotos Payam, Ikotos County. According to the sources, three armed Lango youths attacked and opened fire on Iteso Boma, killing two civilians, reportedly in retaliation for the incident on 12 May whereby one man from Iteso Boma allegedly eloped with a married woman from the Lango community of Ngaluma Boma.

Comment: the attack heightened tensions within the area, with threats of further violence, as armed Lango youth from Iteso Boma began mobilizing for a potential retaliatory attack against Ngaluma Boma. In response, on 16 May, the Ikotos County Commissioner accompanied by the Police visited the area to calm the situation and prevent escalation. One of the suspects was arrested during the visit, while the other two remain at large. The case has been formally registered, and the arrested individual has been detained at the Ikotos Police Station

Location of Incident: Kong Kong village, Likuangole County, Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA)
Description: 3.	On 19 May, multiple sources reported that on 17 May, one woman from the Murle community, who had been abducted by armed Lou Nuer youths from Kong Kong village, Likuangole County, Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) in 2022, and her two-year-old girl was recovered by the authorities in Akobo, Akobo County. According to the sources, on 14 May, the victim escaped her from her abductors in Rim Village, Waat Payam, Nyirol County and walked for three days reaching Akobo on 17 May. The authorities in Akobo subsequently transferred her to Likuangole to be reunited with her family. The victim was subjected to rape and sexual slavery during her captivity

Location of Incident: Kong Kong village, Likuangole County, Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA)
Description: 3.	On 19 May, multiple sources reported that on 17 May, one woman from the Murle community, who had been abducted by armed Lou Nuer youths from Kong Kong village, Likuangole County, Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) in 2022, and her two-year-old girl was recovered by the authorities in Akobo, Akobo County. According to the sources, on 14 May, the victim escaped her from her abductors in Rim Village, Waat Payam, Nyirol County and walked for three days reaching Akobo on 17 May. The authorities in Akobo subsequently transferred her to Likuangole to be reunited with her family. The victim was subjected to rape and sexual slavery during her captivity

Location of Incident: in Bul-Ayuel village, Wunlit Payam in Tonj East County
Description:
4.	On 19 May, three primary sources reported that on 18 May, armed Dinka Luanyjang youths shot and injured one male civilian from the Dinka Jaluau community in Bul-Ayuel village, Wunlit Payam in Tonj East County. As recounted by the sources, armed Dinka Luanyjang youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Jaluau community in Bul-Ayuel village, injuring one civilian. The attackers reportedly attempted to raid cattle; however, armed Dinka Jaluau youths repulsed them. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in  Wunlit for medical treatment.

Comment: The incident was reportedly a revenge action linked to the violence between allied armed Dinka Luanyjang-Dinka Pan-Juaj youths and armed Dinka Jaluau youths in Wunlit and Palieng Payams, Tonj East County on 29 March 2025 during which 195 civilians were shot and killed and 60 others were injured [see HRD Daily Report 7 April 2025]. Reportedly, tension is mounting between in the area amidst reports of mobilization by armed Dinka Luanyjang youths for another revenge attack on the Dinka Jaluau community.

Location of Incident: one primary source and one secondary source
Description:
5.	On 19 May, one primary source and one secondary source reported that on 15 May, one SSPDF soldier (52-years-old man) raped a six-year-old girl from the Bango community in Hai Daraja residential area, Wau Town, Wau Municipality. As recounted by the sources, the SSPDF soldier raped the victim at her family home when her mother had gone to the market and left her alone at home with the suspect, who shares the same residential compound. Reportedly, the perpetrator had raped the on three occasions prior to the incident on 15 May. The suspect threatened the survivor not to disclose the incident to her mother; however, on 17 May, the survivor informed her mother about the incident, who then reported the case at the Jou Market Police Station and police Form 8 was issued to facilitate medical examination for the survivor.

Comments: HRD will follow up on the case for accountability of the perpetrator.

Location of Incident: Akorogbodi-1 residential area, Yambio Town, Yambio County
Description:
6.	On 19 May, multiple sources reported that on 15 May, the SSPDF ill-treated and injured one male civilian in Akorogbodi-1 residential area, Yambio Town, Yambio County. According to the sources, a group of five SSPDF soldiers from Li-Rangu entered the homestead of the victim in the Akorogbodi-1 residential area, beat him up with fists, injuring him, and thereafter took his valuable possessions. The sources further informed that the victim filed a formal complaint with the Masia Police Station. The police subsequently wrote a letter to the SSPDF commander in Lirangu, requesting cooperation in investigating the matter; however, the commander declined the request and reportedly issued threats against the police.

Comment: This incident raises significant concerns regarding potential violations of fundamental human rights, including the right to security and protection and the integrity of private property, and the essential right to as well as highlights systemic challenges in access to justice and accountability.

Location of Incident: in Dodo Village, Mugwo Payam, Yei River County
Description:
1.	On 20 May, one primary source and two secondary sources reported that on 19 May, suspected NAS elements abducted two civilians (one man and one woman – humanitarian workers) in Dodo Village, Mugwo Payam, Yei River County. As recounted by the sources, the suspected NAS element intercepted a vehicle belonging to a local humanitarian organization with 12 staff aboard enroute to Mugwo for a data collection mission, and forced two of them to disembark. The NAS elements reportedly demanded a ransom of 30,000 United States Dollars for their release and threatened that failure to comply would result in the killing of the abductees. The driver was reportedly instructed to return to Yei with the remaining nine staff members. The whereabout of the two abductees remains unknown. 

Comments: This incident indicates an increasing pattern of targeted abductions of humanitarian workers, particularly those affiliated with local non-governmental organizations (NGOs). The recurrence of such incidents along major humanitarian access routes (Yei–Kaya and Yei–Maridi) demonstrates a deteriorating security environment for humanitarian operations in the Greater Yei area.

Location of Incident: in Motti Boma, Ifwoto Payam, Torit County
Description: 2.	On 19 May, three secondary sources reported that on 15 May, armed Lotuko youths from Lohula Boma, Ifwoto Payam shot and killed one 35-year-old male civilian from the Lotuko community in Motti Boma, Ifwoto Payam, Torit County. According to the sources, armed Lotuko youths attacked and opened fire on the victim while he was herding goats in a grazing area in Motti Boma, injuring him. The attackers attempted to raid the goats; they reportedly fled the scene without taking any livestock. The victim was evacuated to a hospital in Torit, where he succumbed to the injuries.

Location of Incident: Palabaach, Makuach Payam, Bor South County
Description: 3.	On 20 May, multiple sources reported that on 19 May, Murle armed elements shot and killed one 18-year-old male civilian and injured another 20-year-old male civilian in Palabaach, Makuach Payam, Bor South County. According to the sources, Mule armed elements attacked and opened fire on three male civilians in the Palabaach area as they were to Baidit, killing one, injuring another, while the third person escaped unharmed and alerted the local youths who responded to the scene and evacuated the injured victim to a hospital in Bor for medical treatment. The victim was subsequently transferred to Juba for specialized medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Palabaach, Makuach Payam, Bor South County
Description: 3.	On 20 May, multiple sources reported that on 19 May, Murle armed elements shot and killed one 18-year-old male civilian and injured another 20-year-old male civilian in Palabaach, Makuach Payam, Bor South County. According to the sources, Mule armed elements attacked and opened fire on three male civilians in the Palabaach area as they were to Baidit, killing one, injuring another, while the third person escaped unharmed and alerted the local youths who responded to the scene and evacuated the injured victim to a hospital in Bor for medical treatment. The victim was subsequently transferred to Juba for specialized medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Kuanyar village, Rualbet Payam, Tonj North County
Description: 4.	On 20 May, three primary sources reported that on 19 May, armed Dinka Atok youths shot and killed two male civilians and injured another from the Dinka Jurbol community in Kuanyar village, Rualbet Payam, Tonj North County. As recounted by the sources, armed Dinka Atok youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Jurbol community in Kuanyar village, killing two civilians and injuring another, and thereafter fled the scene. Reportedly, the attack was a revenge action in relation to the recent violence in which the Dinka Jurbol and Dinka Awan youth supported the Dinka Leir of Kirik Payam in attacks on the Dinka Noi and Dinka Atok of Awul Payam.

Location of Incident: Kuanyar village, Rualbet Payam, Tonj North County
Description: 4.	On 20 May, three primary sources reported that on 19 May, armed Dinka Atok youths shot and killed two male civilians and injured another from the Dinka Jurbol community in Kuanyar village, Rualbet Payam, Tonj North County. As recounted by the sources, armed Dinka Atok youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Jurbol community in Kuanyar village, killing two civilians and injuring another, and thereafter fled the scene. Reportedly, the attack was a revenge action in relation to the recent violence in which the Dinka Jurbol and Dinka Awan youth supported the Dinka Leir of Kirik Payam in attacks on the Dinka Noi and Dinka Atok of Awul Payam.

Location of Incident: Bilnyang, Aliek Payam, Tonj North County
Description: 5.	On 20 May, three primary sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Kongor youths shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Twic Mayardit community in Bilnyang, Aliek Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, armed Kongor youths attacked and opened fire on the victim who was fishing in the river in Bilnyang village, killing him. The attackers also reportedly stole the fish, fishing gear and personal items of the victim.

Location of Incident: Farere village, Haforere Boma, Hiyala Payam, Torit County
Description: 2.	On 21 May, multiple sources reported that on 17 May, armed Lotuko youths from Howuro village shot and killed one 21-year-old male civilian from the Lotuko community in Farere village, Haforere Boma, Hiyala Payam, Torit County. According to the sources, two armed Lotuko youths stormed Farere village and opened fire on the victim, killing him, reportedly in a revenge action linked to violence between Lotuko youths in Haforere Boma on 5 April 2023, during which one individual was shot and killed and two others were injured. The sources further informed that, in retaliation, armed youths from Farere village attacked Howuro village and burnt down five houses, damaging others, and stole an unspecified number of goats. The police have reportedly been deployed to Haforere Boma to restore calm, conduct investigations, and apprehend the perpetrators.

Location of Incident: Gawar Nuer community in Manedyay village, Pagil Payam, Ayod County
Description: 3.	On 21 May, multiple sources reported that on 18 May, Murle armed elements abducted one 19-year-old woman and six children (two girls ages one- and seven-year-old and four boys ages two, four, and six years old) from the Gawar Nuer community in Manedyay village, Pagil Payam, Ayod County. According to the sources, the Murle armed elements abducted the victims while they were playing in front of their house. Reportedly, on 20 May, the 19-year-old woman escaped from the abductors and reported to the authorities in Pagil Payam.

Location of Incident: Dinka Panyar community in Tiap-Tiap Payam, Cueibet County
Description: 4.	On 20 May, multiple sources reported that on 17 May, armed Dinka Waat youths from Pagor Payam, Cueibet County shot and killed three civilians and injured eight others all from the Dinka Panyar community in Tiap-Tiap Payam, Cueibet County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Waat youths attacked a police station in Tiap-Tiap Payam where members of the Dinka Panyar section had taken refuge following a revenge attack on them by armed Dinka Waat youths on 16 May, killing three and injuring eight. Reportedly, two soldiers of the South Sudan People’s Defence Forces (SSPDF) and one Police officer were killed and four SSPDF soldiers and one Police officer were injured during the attack. The sources further informed that the armed Dinka Waat youths also burnt sown houses (tukuls) and vandalized/looted properties belonging to the Dinka Panyar as they retreated towards Pagor Payam.

Location of Incident: Dinka Panyar community in Tiap-Tiap Payam, Cueibet County
Description: 4.	On 20 May, multiple sources reported that on 17 May, armed Dinka Waat youths from Pagor Payam, Cueibet County shot and killed three civilians and injured eight others all from the Dinka Panyar community in Tiap-Tiap Payam, Cueibet County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Waat youths attacked a police station in Tiap-Tiap Payam where members of the Dinka Panyar section had taken refuge following a revenge attack on them by armed Dinka Waat youths on 16 May, killing three and injuring eight. Reportedly, two soldiers of the South Sudan People’s Defence Forces (SSPDF) and one Police officer were killed and four SSPDF soldiers and one Police officer were injured during the attack. The sources further informed that the armed Dinka Waat youths also burnt sown houses (tukuls) and vandalized/looted properties belonging to the Dinka Panyar as they retreated towards Pagor Payam.

Description: 4. According to the sources, armed Dinka Waat youths attacked a police station in Tiap-Tiap Payam where members of the Dinka Panyar section had taken refuge following a revenge attack on them by armed Dinka Waat youths on 16 May, killing three and injuring eight. Location of Incident: Dinka Panyar community in Tiap-Tiap Payam, Cueibet County
Description: 4.	On 20 May, multiple sources reported that on 17 May, armed Dinka Waat youths from Pagor Payam, Cueibet County shot and killed three civilians and injured eight others all from the Dinka Panyar community in Tiap-Tiap Payam, Cueibet County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Waat youths attacked a police station in Tiap-Tiap Payam where members of the Dinka Panyar section had taken refuge following a revenge attack on them by armed Dinka Waat youths on 16 May, killing three and injuring eight.
