Location of Incident: Leek Nuer community in Thuowmaangor Boma, Panhiany Payam, Rubkona County
Description: 5.	On 21 May, one primary source reported that on 12 May, unidentified armed elements gang raped one woman (age unspecified) from the Leek Nuer community in Thuowmaangor Boma, Panhiany Payam, Rubkona County. As recounted by the source, the unidentified armed elements accosted the victim while she was returning from collecting waterlilies in a swampy area and proceeded to gang rape her at gunpoint. Reportedly, the victim received medical care at a health care facility in Bentiu and filed a case with the police.

Location of Incident: Dinka Lou-Paher community in Malou-Dit village, Marial-Lou Payam, Tonj North County
Description:
6.	On 21 May, three primary sources reported that on 20 May, armed Dinka Luanyjang youths shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Lou-Paher community in Malou-Dit village, Marial-Lou Payam, Tonj North County. As recounted by the sources, armed Dinka Luanyjang youths opened fire on a group of Dinka Apuk-Patoc herders grazing their cattle in Malou-Dit village, killing one Dinka Lou-Paher civilian herder (reportedly a mistaken identity). The attackers also reportedly seized 300 heads of cattle and fled with them into Palieng Payam, Tonj East County.

Comment: According to the sources, the armed Dinka Luanyjang youths were tracking a group of Dinka Apuk-Patoc herders who moved into Marial-Lou Payam to graze their cattle, following recent violence between the Dinka Luanyjang and the Dinka Apuk-Patoc of Akop Payam.

Location of Incident: Dinka Lou-Paher community in Malou-Dit village, Marial-Lou Payam, Tonj North County
Description:
6.	On 21 May, three primary sources reported that on 20 May, armed Dinka Luanyjang youths shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Lou-Paher community in Malou-Dit village, Marial-Lou Payam, Tonj North County. As recounted by the sources, armed Dinka Luanyjang youths opened fire on a group of Dinka Apuk-Patoc herders grazing their cattle in Malou-Dit village, killing one Dinka Lou-Paher civilian herder (reportedly a mistaken identity). The attackers also reportedly seized 300 heads of cattle and fled with them into Palieng Payam, Tonj East County.

Comment: According to the sources, the armed Dinka Luanyjang youths were tracking a group of Dinka Apuk-Patoc herders who moved into Marial-Lou Payam to graze their cattle, following recent violence between the Dinka Luanyjang and the Dinka Apuk-Patoc of Akop Payam.

Location of Incident: in Malek village, Palieng Payam, Tonj East County
Description: 7.	On 21 May, three primary sources reported that on 20 May, armed Dinka Lou-Paher youths shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Luanyjang community in Malek village, Palieng Payam, Tonj East County. As recounted by the sources, armed Dinka Lou-Paher youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Luanyjang community in Malek village, killing one civilian and thereafter fled towards Marial-Lou Payam. The attack was reportedly in revenge for the shooting and killing of one Dinka Lou-Paher civilian by armed Luanyjang youths as they pursued Apuk-Patoc herders in Marial-Lou Payam, Tonj North County [see incident in paragraph 6 above].

Location of Incident: Nambara Bridge along the Tambura Road in Yangiri Payam, Ezo County
Description:
8.	On 21 May, multiple sources reported that on 20 May, unidentified armed elements killed two male civilians (including one Ugandan national) at the Nambara Bridge along the Tambura Road in Yangiri Payam, Ezo County. According to the sources, a group of unidentified armed elements suspected to be affiliated with the Sudan People's Liberation Army in Opposition (SPLA-IO) attacked a group of 18 workers as they were working at the Nambara Bridge site on the banks of the Biki River in Yangiri Payam, killing two, while the others fled for safety. 

Comment: The construction project is funded through UNMISS) Quick Impact Projects (QIPs) and implemented by Rural Development Action (RDAA).

Location of Incident: Kanja Boma, Gulumbi Payam, Morobo County
Description: 1.	On 22 May, multiple sources reported that on the same day, suspected SPLA-IO elements shot and killed one male civilian and injured five others in including one elderly woman in Kanja Boma, Gulumbi Payam, Morobo County. As recounted by the sources, suspected SPLA-IO elements ambushed and opened fire on two commercial passenger vehicles along the Yei–Morobo road, killing one 42-year-old man and injuring five others including a 72-year-old woman. The victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Morobo Health Centre for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Kanja Boma, Gulumbi Payam, Morobo County
Description: 1.	On 22 May, multiple sources reported that on the same day, suspected SPLA-IO elements shot and killed one male civilian and injured five others in including one elderly woman in Kanja Boma, Gulumbi Payam, Morobo County. As recounted by the sources, suspected SPLA-IO elements ambushed and opened fire on two commercial passenger vehicles along the Yei–Morobo road, killing one 42-year-old man and injuring five others including a 72-year-old woman. The victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Morobo Health Centre for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Lou Nue community in Diror Paya, Akobo County
Description: 2.	On 22 May, Multiple sources reported that on 20 May, Murle armed elements shot and killed one male civilian (a sub-chief) from the Lou Nue community in Diror Paya, Akobo County. According to the sources, the Murle armed elements attacked and opened fire on the victim while he was grazing his cattle on the outskirts of Diror village, killing him. The attackers reportedly looted his gun; however, did not seize any cattle.

Location of Incident: the Chiengket section of the Jabany subclan, in Limpout Village, Patit Boma, Ngony Payam, Koch County
Description: 3.	On 21 and 22 May, multiple sources td that on 21 May, armed Jagay Nuer youths from the Chiengleah section of the Jabany sub-clan shot and killed two male civilians (ages 25 and 35 years old) and injured one 32-year-old man, all from the Chiengket section of the Jabany subclan, in Limpout Village, Patit Boma, Ngony Payam, Koch County. According to the sources, the armed Jagay Nuer youths stormed Limpout Village opened fire indiscriminately on a group of six civilians, killing two and injuring another, reportedly in a revenge attack linked to the killing of one humanitarian worker (from the Chiengleah section) on 15 January 2025, allegedly by armed elements from the Chiengket section. Reportedly, the injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Koch Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: the Chiengket section of the Jabany subclan, in Limpout Village, Patit Boma, Ngony Payam, Koch County
Description: 3.	On 21 and 22 May, multiple sources td that on 21 May, armed Jagay Nuer youths from the Chiengleah section of the Jabany sub-clan shot and killed two male civilians (ages 25 and 35 years old) and injured one 32-year-old man, all from the Chiengket section of the Jabany subclan, in Limpout Village, Patit Boma, Ngony Payam, Koch County. According to the sources, the armed Jagay Nuer youths stormed Limpout Village opened fire indiscriminately on a group of six civilians, killing two and injuring another, reportedly in a revenge attack linked to the killing of one humanitarian worker (from the Chiengleah section) on 15 January 2025, allegedly by armed elements from the Chiengket section. Reportedly, the injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Koch Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Dangar village, Ngapagok Payam, Tonj East County
Description: 4.	On 22 May, three primary sources reported that on 21 May, armed Dinka Thiik youths shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Akook community in Dangar village, Ngapagok Payam, Tonj East County. As recounted by the sources, armed Dinka Thiik youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Akook community in Dangar village, killing one civilian, and thereafter fled the scene. The attack was reportedly a revenge action for the violence between the two communities on 17 May [see HRD Daily Report 19 May 2025].

Location of Incident: Wunkuel village, Marial-Lou Payam, Tonj North County
Description: 5.	On 22 May, three primary sources reported that on 21 May, armed Dinka Luanyjang youths from Palieng Payam, Tonj East County shot and injured one male civilian from the Dinka Lou-Paher community during an attempted cattle raid in Wunkuel village, Marial-Lou Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Luanyjang youths attacked and opened fire on Wunkuel village, and attempted to raid cattle; however, armed Dinka Lou-Paher youths repulsed them, and in the ensuing confrontation one Lou-Paher civilian was shot and killed. The injured victim was evacuated to a hospital in Marial-Lou and subsequently transferred to a hospital in Wau, Western Bahr el Ghazal State for advanced medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Dinka Malual community of Northern Bahr el Ghazal State in Tharkueng village, Kuac South Payam, Gogrial West County
Description:
6.	On 22 May, three primary sources reported that on 20 May, suspected armed Dinka Marial-Bai youths from Jur River County, Western Bahr el Ghazal State attacked and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Malual community of Northern Bahr el Ghazal State in Tharkueng village, Kuac South Payam, Gogrial West County. As recounted by the sources, the assailants ambushed the victim in Tharkueng village along the Warrap-Western Bahr el Ghazal State border as he was travelling on a motorcycle to Aweil Town, and stabbed him to death with a dagger, and thereafter fled across the border back into Jur River County.

Comment: According to the sources, the victim was mistakenly killed in a revenge attack that targeted Dinka Apuk civilians in the context of earlier territorial dispute violence between the Dinka Bai community of Jur River County and the Dinka Apuk of Gogrial East County over the ownership of Manyang village.

Location of Incident: in Nabiama Boma, Tambura Payam, Tambura County
Description:
7.	On 22 May, multiple sources reported that on the same day, suspected SPLA-IO elements shot and killed one male civilian (a State Member of Parliament from the Balanda community) and injured another (a commercial motorcycle operator from the Azande community) in Nabiama Boma, Tambura Payam, Tambura County. As recounted by the sources, three suspected SPLA-IO elements intercepted the victims as they were travelling on a motorcycle to a farm in Kpangima Boma and opened fire them, killing one and injuring another. Reportedly, soldiers of the South Sudan People’s Defence Forces (SSPDF) responded to the scene, recovered the body and took it to the Tambura Police Station before transferring it to Tambura Hospital. The injured victim is reportedly receiving medical treatment at a hospital in Tambura.

Comment: According to the sources, the deceased member of parliament, originally from Namutina Payam, Nagero County, had been actively promoting peace in the area. Specifically, he had reportedly convinced 78 members of the SPLA-IO from Namutina to defect from the rebellion and join the SSPDF, and that those opposed to his efforts likely orchestrated the attack to prevent further defections.

Location of Incident: in Nabiama Boma, Tambura Payam, Tambura County
Description:
7.	On 22 May, multiple sources reported that on the same day, suspected SPLA-IO elements shot and killed one male civilian (a State Member of Parliament from the Balanda community) and injured another (a commercial motorcycle operator from the Azande community) in Nabiama Boma, Tambura Payam, Tambura County. Location of Incident: Dinka Thiik communities in Pabor and Ador villages, and Malual-Cum Town, Ngapagok Payam, Tonj East County
Description:
1.	On 23 and 25 May, multiple sources reported that on 23 and 25 May, 17 male civilians were shot and killed (11 from the Dinka Thiik community and six from the Dinka Akook community) and 11 were injured (nine Dinka Thiik including two women and two Dinka Akook) in Ngapagok Payam, Tonj East County, in continuation of revenge violence between the two communities. As recounted by the sources, on 23 May, armed Dinka Akook youths simultaneously attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Thiik communities in Pabor and Ador villages, and Malual-Cum Town, killing nine male civilians and injuring nine others including two women. The attackers also burnt down 10 houses. Reportedly, while pursuing the armed Dinka Akook youths, armed Dinka Thiik youths attacked Dangar village and shot and killed six Dinka Akook male civilians and injured two others. In further retaliation, on 25 May, armed Dinka Akook youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Thiik community in Akot village, killing two male civilians. The injured Dinka Thiik civilians were reportedly evacuated to a hospital in Marial-Lou Payam, Tonj North County, whereas those from the Dinka Akook community were evacuated to a hospital in Tonj Town for medical treatment.

Comment: The attacks are a continuation of escalating revenge violence between the Dinka Akook and Dinka Thiik. The ensuing clash between the armed youths reportedly triggered the displacement of the local population. Reportedly, tension remains high between the two communities with the likelihood of more retaliatory violence.

Location of Incident: Dinka Apuk-Patoc community in Pachaweng village, Akop Payam
Description:
2.	Between 23 and 25 May, multiple sources reported that from 23 – 25 May, five civilians were shot and killed (three from the Dinka Apuk-Patoc community and two from the Dinka Luanyjang community) and another from the Dinka Luanyjang community was injured during revenge violence between armed Dinka Luanyjang and Dinka Apuk-Patoc youths in Akop and Kirik Payams, Tonj North County and Paweng Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, on 23 May, armed Dinka Luanyjang youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Apuk-Patoc community in Pachaweng village, Akop Payam, killing two men and one girl. In retaliation, on 24 May, armed Dinka Apuk-Patoc youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Luanyjang community in Nyingor village, Paweng Payam, killing two men. Similarly, on 25 May, armed Dinka Apuk-Patoc youths shot and injured one male civilian from the Dinka Luanyjang community in Aluk-Luk village, Kirik Payam, while the victim was travelling on a motorcycle from Romic Town to Tonj Town, via Rualbet and Kirik Payams. The victim was reportedly evacuated to a hospital in Tonj Town, Tonj South County for medical treatment.

Comment: The attacks occurred in the context of ongoing revenge violence between the Dinka Luanyjang and Dinka Akook communities. Observably, revenge attacks continue to exacerbate violence between the two communities as well as in the Greater Tonj area.

Location of Incident: Dinka Luanyjang community in Nyingor village, Paweng Payam
Description:
2. Location of Incident: Dinka Kongor community in Riil-Bar village, Akop Payam, Tonj North County
Description: 3.	On 25 May, multiple sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Apuk-Patoc youths shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Kongor community in Riil-Bar village, Akop Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Apuk-Patoc youths opened gunfire on the victim when he attempted to recover his cattle, killing him. The cattle were reportedly stolen from his homestead in Aliek Payam, Tonj North County, earlier in the week, and he subsequently located them in a homestead in Riil-Bar village.

Location of Incident: the Dinka Lou-Ariik community in Awul Payam, Tonj North County
Description: 4.	On 25 May, three primary sources reported that on 23 May, suspected armed Dinka Atok youths shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Lou-Ariik community in Awul Payam, Tonj North County. As recounted by the sources, armed Dinka Atok youths ambushed and opened fire on the victim while he was travelling on a motorcycle to Alabek Payam through Awul Payam, killing him. The sources further informed that the incident was a mistaken revenge attack, that was targeting civilians from the Dinka Apuk-Patoc or Dinka Awan communities in the context of the ongoing intercommunal violence between the Dinka communities in Tonj North County.

Location of Incident: Dinka Luanyjang community in Tonj Payam, Tonj South County
Description: 5.	On 24 May, three primary sources reported that on 23 May, suspected armed Dinka Thony youths from Manyangok Payam shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Luanyjang community in Tonj Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, armed Thony youths ambushed and opened fire on the victim while he was travelling on a motorcycle in the outskirts of Tonj Town, killing him. Reportedly, the incident was a mistaken revenge attack as the assailants mistook him to be from the Dinka Muok community – in the context of persistent retaliatory violence between the Dinka Thony and the allied Dinka Yar, Muok and Apuk-Jurwir.

Location of Incident: Dinka Thiik community in Manyiel village, Kirik Payam, Tonj North County
Description: 4.	On 26 May, three primary sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Akook youths from Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County shot and injured two male civilians from the Dinka Thiik community in Manyiel village, Kirik Payam, Tonj North County. As recounted by the sources, armed Dinka Akook youths ambushed and opened fire on the victims as they were travelling on a motorcycle to Tonj Town through Rualbet and Kirik, injuring them, in an attack linked to the ongoing violence between the two communities. The victims were evacuated to a hospital in Tonj Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Dinka Leir community in Akoi village, Kirik Payam, Tonj North County
Description: 5.	On 26 May, multiple sources reported that on 24 May, armed Dinka Noi youths shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Leir community in Akoi village, Kirik Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Noi youths attacked and opened fire on the victim while he was walking back home from a local market, killing him. The attack was reportedly a continuation of revenge violence between the Dinka Noi and Dinka Leir communities.

Location of Incident: the Kakwa community, in Nyori village, Jabara Boma, Lasu Payam, Yei River County
Description:
1.	On 26 May, three secondary sources reported that on 22 May, NAS elements abducted 15 civilians including five women and three children (boys), all from the Kakwa community, in Nyori village, Jabara Boma, Lasu Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, NAS elements abducted the victims while they were at a funeral and transferred them to a NAS hideout situated between Lasu and Tokori Boma within Lasu Payam. The NAS elements reportedly beat up and harassed civilians, robbing them of valuables such as money, phones, and food items. The sources further informed that the five women and the three children were released later on the same day. Reportedly, on 24 May, two of the remaining abductees escaped from captivity, one of whom was severely beaten. On 25 May, another abductee also escaped, while four abductees remain in captivity.

Comment: According to the sources, the civilians may have been abducted for recruitment into NAS forces.

Location of Incident: the Kakwa community, in Nyori village, Jabara Boma, Lasu Payam, Yei River County
Description:
1.	On 26 May, three secondary sources reported that on 22 May, NAS elements abducted 15 civilians including five women and three children (boys), all from the Kakwa community, in Nyori village, Jabara Boma, Lasu Payam, Yei River County. Location of Incident: in New Fangak Town, Fangak County
Description: 2.	On 26 May, multiple sources reported that on 25 May, the SSPDF and allied forces shot and killed one male civilian in New Fangak Town, Fangak County, in unclear circumstances. According to the sources, the victim had a mental disability and would occasionally return to New Fangak Town from Wechmuon village where he was displaced along with other civilians. Reportedly, family members who had attempted to recover the body were shot at and denied access to the body.

Location of Incident: in Jiech Payam, Panyijiar County
Description: 3.	On 26 May, multiple sources reported that on 22 May, armed Nyoun Nuer youths from the Chiengnyaluoh sub-clan attacked and injured three male civilians (ages 40, 35 and 30 years) from the Chienglual sub-clan in Jiech Payam, Panyijiar County. According to the sources, the assailants shot and injured two of the vicitms, while the third one was injured with a spear, reportedly in revenge for the killing of four civilians from the Chiengnyaluoh sub-clan by armed elements from the Chienglual sub-clan in January 2025.  The sources further informed that security forces were deployed to the scene to restore calm and prevent escalation of violence. The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Panyijiar for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Jebel Kujur on the outskirts of Juba City.
Description:
1.	On 27 May, a primary source reported that on 4 May, the SSPDF and NSS personnel arbitrarily arrested, detained incommunicado, and ill-treated one 42-year-old male civilian in Jebel Kujur on the outskirts of Juba City. As recounted by the source, a group of five security officers apprehended the victim from a local market near Yei Checkpoint and transferred him to Jebel Kujur Police Station, where he was beaten, on allegations of disguising as a soldier. The victim was subsequently transferred to Giadda military barracks, where he was detained incommunicado for three weeks, during which he reportedly repeatedly ill-treated. The victim was released without charge following the intervention of one SSPDF soldier who recognized him as a civilian labourer.

Comment: This case constitutes grave violations of the rights to liberty and the security of person. HRD will follow up on the case for accountability.

Location of Incident: Zone A, internally displaced persons (IDP) Camp 3, Jebel Kujur, Juba City
Description:
2.	On 27 May, one primary source reported that on 16 May, SSNPS personnel arbitrarily arrested, detained and ill-treated one male civilian in Zone A, internally displaced persons (IDP) Camp 3, Jebel Kujur, Juba City. As recounted by the source, a group of four SSNPS personnel arrested the victim for his alleged involvement in an armed robbery incident on the previous day between IDP Camps 1 and 3 and detained him at the Yei Checkpoint Police Station. Despite no firearm being found during a search in his residence and the victim having denied any involvement, he was reportedly subjected to ill-treatment during interrogation including . burning his back with melted plastic. He was released the following day without charge and received treatment at the camp's medical facility. The victim has declined to file a formal complaint with the police due to fear of reprisal.

Comment: The arrest and ill-treatment of the victim constitute violations of due process guarantees. HRD will follow up on the report for accountability of the perpetrators.

Location of Incident: Hai Falata, Wau Town, Wau Municipality
Description:
5.	On 26 and 27 May, a primary source and two secondary sources reported that on 21 April, one SSPDF soldier and seven other male civilians gangraped a 17-year-ol girl from the Dinka community in Hai Falata, Wau Town, Wau Municipality. As recounted by the sources, the SSPDF soldier who also operates as a boda-boda rider, transported the victim from Tiger Hotel in Hai Daraja where she had attended a classmate’s birthday party to Gardiner, an isolated area where he physically assaulted and proceeded to gang-raped her with the complicity of seven other individuals, all civilians. The survivor sustained bodily injuries, and on 22 April, the incident was reported to the Special Protection Unit at the police station in Khor Mudier, where she was issued Form 8 to facilitate a medical examination. The survivor was admitted to a hospital in Wau for three days for medical treatment. Reportedly, the SSPDF soldier and the other suspects were arrested on 17 May and remanded to Wau Central Prison. The case was referred to Wau High Court on 20 May 2025 for trial proceedings.

Comments: HRD will follow up on the case for accountability of the perpetrators.

Location of Incident: Tambura Town, Tambura County,
Description:
6.	On 27 May, three primary sources reported that in early April (exact date unspecified), three male civilians were unlawfully detained and ill-treated in Tambura Town, Tambura County, on the instructions of the acting Paramount Chief on accusation of causing the deaths of some individuals through witchcraft—an allegation they denied.  According to the sources, the victims were first detained at the chief’s home were they were subjected to forced labour on his farm and subsequently transferred to Tambura Prison on April 29 after they complained about the harsh conditions and exploitation.

Comment: The incident raises serious human rights concerns of arbitrary detention, forced labour, and lack of access to justice. HRD will engage with relevant authorities to advocate for the rights of these individuals.

Location of Incident: Rum-Akoc, Payii and Agerbac villages, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County
Description:
3.	On 27 May, three primary sources reported that on the same day, eight civilians were shot and killed (one from the Dinka Jaluau community and seven from the Dinka Luanyjang community) and 90 others were injured ( 40 including five women from the Dinka Jaluau community and 50 including eight women from the Dika Luanyjang community) during violence between armed Dinka Luanyjang and Dinka Jaluau youths in Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County. As recounted  by the sources, armed Dinka Luanyjang youths simultaneously attacked and opened fire on Rum-Akoc, Payii and Agerbac villages, killing one male civilian and injuring 40 others including five women, all from the Dinka Jaluau community. The attackers also reportedly burnt down almost all the houses in these villages. In retaliation, armed Dinka Jaluau youths attacked the outskirts of Maparah Boma and shot and killed seven male Dinka Luanyjang civilians and injured 50 others including eight women. The injured victims from the Dinka Jaluau community were reportedly being evacuated to health care facilities in Tonj Town and Wau, while those form the Dinka Luanyjang community were evacuated to health care facilities in Makuac Payam and Romic Town, Palieng Payam.

Comment: Reportedly, the fighting between the armed Dinka Jaluau and Dinka Luanyjang youths continued through the evening and the casualty figures are likely to rise. The latest incident is a continuation of revenge violence between the Dinka Luanyjang and Dinka Jaluau communities [see HRD Daily Reports 1 and 2 April 2025].

Location of Incident: Rum-Akoc, Payii and Agerbac villages, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County
Description:
3.	On 27 May, three primary sources reported that on the same day, eight civilians were shot and killed (one from the Dinka Jaluau community and seven from the Dinka Luanyjang community) and 90 others were injured ( 40 including five women from the Dinka Jaluau community and 50 including eight women from the Dika Luanyjang community) during violence between armed Dinka Luanyjang and Dinka Jaluau youths in Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County. Location of Incident: Rum-Akoc, Payii and Agerbac villages, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County
Description:
3.	On 27 May, three primary sources reported that on the same day, eight civilians were shot and killed (one from the Dinka Jaluau community and seven from the Dinka Luanyjang community) and 90 others were injured ( 40 including five women from the Dinka Jaluau community and 50 including eight women from the Dika Luanyjang community) during violence between armed Dinka Luanyjang and Dinka Jaluau youths in Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County. As recounted  by the sources, armed Dinka Luanyjang youths simultaneously attacked and opened fire on Rum-Akoc, Payii and Agerbac villages, killing one male civilian and injuring 40 others including five women, all from the Dinka Jaluau community. The attackers also reportedly burnt down almost all the houses in these villages. In retaliation, armed Dinka Jaluau youths attacked the outskirts of Maparah Boma and shot and killed seven male Dinka Luanyjang civilians and injured 50 others including eight women. The injured victims from the Dinka Jaluau community were reportedly being evacuated to health care facilities in Tonj Town and Wau, while those form the Dinka Luanyjang community were evacuated to health care facilities in Makuac Payam and Romic Town, Palieng Payam.

Comment: Reportedly, the fighting between the armed Dinka Jaluau and Dinka Luanyjang youths continued through the evening and the casualty figures are likely to rise. The latest incident is a continuation of revenge violence between the Dinka Luanyjang and Dinka Jaluau communities [see HRD Daily Reports 1 and 2 April 2025].

Location of Incident: Awul Payam, Tonj North County
Description: 4.	On 27 May, three primary sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Noi youths shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Kongor community in Awul Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Noi youths attacked and opened fire on the victim who was visiting his relatives in Warrap Town, killing him. The attack is reportedly linked to ongoing conflict between the Dinka Noi and the Dinka Leir and their allies.

Location of Incident: in Jabara Boma, Lasu Payam, Yei River County.
Description:
1.	On 28 May, three secondary sources reported that on 27 May, suspected NAS elements abducted 16 civilians including three women and three children (boys) in Jabara Boma, Lasu Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, a group of suspected NAS elements attacked and abducted some civilians at the Libogo weekly market in Jabara Boma and thereafter established a roadblock along the route between Nyori village and Libogo market, and abducted additional civilians, totaling 16 victims. Reportedly, the incident also resulted in widespread looting of money, mobile phones, and other personal belongings. The sources further informed that eight of the abductees including the three women and three boys were subsequently released by the abductors, while three others later escaped. The other five abductees remain in captivity and are reportedly being held for recruitment purposes by the NAS.

Comment: Notably, this is the second incident of abduction by NAS elements in the same area in one week [see HRD Daily Report 27 May 2025]. The situation in the area remains highly volatile due to the presence active armed actors, posing significant threats to the protection of civilians and hindering humanitarian access and livelihood activities. The abduction and alleged forced recruitment of youth by NAS represents a grave violation of international humanitarian and human rights law.

Location of Incident: in the Hai Atlabara, Malekia residential area in Nyong Payam, Torit County
Description: 2.	On 28 May, three secondary sources reported that on 25 May, one personnel of the Civil Defence Force shot and injured a 28-year-old female civilian in the Hai Atlabara, Malekia residential area in Nyong Payam, Torit County. According to the sources, the perpetrator opened fire on the victim at a local bar, injuring her. The victim was evacuated  to a hospital in Torit for medical treatment. The perpetrator was reportedly apprehended by community members who handed him over to the Torit Municipal Police.

Location of Incident: in Ageer Payam, Duk County
Description: 3.	On 28 May, multiple sources reported that on 26 May, Murle armed elements shot and injured two male civilians from Dinka community during an ambush on four vehicles in Ageer Payam, Duk County. According to the sources, Murle armed elements ambushed and opened fire on the four vehicles with passengers aboard enroute from Duk Padiet to Poktap in Ageer Payam, injuring two of the passengers. The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Poktap for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Dinka Jaluau community, in Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County
Description:
4.	On 28 May, three primary sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Luanyjang youths shot and killed seven male civilians and injured 10 others including two women, all from the Dinka Jaluau community, in Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County. As recounted by the sources, armed Dinka Luanyjang youths launched coordinated attacks on Abyei, Palum-Gor, Nyiel and Pabang-Loc villages, killing seven civilians and injuring 10 others. The attackers also reportedly burnt down over 30 houses in these villages. The injured victims were evacuated to a hospital in Tonj Town for medical treatment.

Comment: The attack was reportedly continuation of the violence on 27 May [see HRD Daily Report 28 May 2025], and the fighting between the armed Dinka Luanyjang and Dinka Jaluau youths was reportedly going on by the evening of 28 May.

Location of Incident: Dinka Jaluau community, in Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County
Description:
4.	On 28 May, three primary sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Luanyjang youths shot and killed seven male civilians and injured 10 others including two women, all from the Dinka Jaluau community, in Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County. As recounted by the sources, armed Dinka Luanyjang youths launched coordinated attacks on Abyei, Palum-Gor, Nyiel and Pabang-Loc villages, killing seven civilians and injuring 10 others. The attackers also reportedly burnt down over 30 houses in these villages. The injured victims were evacuated to a hospital in Tonj Town for medical treatment.

Comment: The attack was reportedly continuation of the violence on 27 May [see HRD Daily Report 28 May 2025], and the fighting between the armed Dinka Luanyjang and Dinka Jaluau youths was reportedly going on by the evening of 28 May.

Location of Incident: Dinka Panaruu community, in Kumagon village, Yar Payam, Touch County, RAA
Description:
1.	On 28 May, multiple sources reported that on 27 May, armed Leek Nuer elements from Rubkona County shot and killed one male civilian and injured three others, all from the Dinka Panaruu community, in Kumagon village, Yar Payam, Touch County, RAA. According to the sources, the armed Leek Nuer elements attacked a cattle camp in Kumagon village and opened fire on the victims while they were tending their cattle in a grazing area. The attackers also raided approximately 400 heads of cattle, which were all reportedly recovered by soldiers of eh South Sudan People’s Defence Fores (SSPDF) and the local armed Dinka Panaruu elements as they pursued the attackers. Reportedly one SSPDF soldier was killed in the ensuing clashes. The injured victims were reportedly receiving medical treatment at a hospital in Pariang Town, RAA.

Comment: On 29 May, the Minister of Information, Culture, Youth and Sports, RAA issued a statement condemning the attack and commended the recovery of the stolen cattle by the SSPDF and armed Dinka Panaruu elements as well as the cooperation from the authorities of Unity State in enabling the recovery process. The intervention of government authorities and  security forces in recovering cattle raided from neighboring states and areas is a positive move that if sustained would help in preventing the perpetuation of retaliatory attacks which have had devastating consequences on civilians.

Location of Incident: Dinka Jaluau community, in Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County
Description:
2.	On 29 May, four primary sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Luanyjang youths shot and killed 26 civilians including four women and injured 30 others including eight women, all from the Dinka Jaluau community, in Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County, in continuation of revenge violence between the two communities. As recounted by the sources, armed Dinka Luanyjang youths attacked and opened fire on the villages of villages of Abyei, Palum-Gor, Nyiel, Pabang-Loc, Mayen-Ador and Wunlit Town, killing 26 civilians and injuring 30 others. The injured victims were reportedly evacuated to a hospital in Tonj Town, while others were reportedly transferred to a hospital in Wau Town, Western Bahr el Ghazal State for advanced medical treatment.

Comment: To-date, 40 civilians including four women (seven Dinka Luanyjang and 33 Dinka Jaluau) have been killed and 130 others including 23 women (50 Dinka Luanyjang and 80 Dinka Jaluau) have been injured since the resumption of violence between the two communities on 27 May [see HRD Daily Reports of 28 and 29 May 2025]. Tension remains high in the area with the likelihood of more revenge violence in the absence of concrete measures by the authorities to avert further violence.

Location of Incident: Dinka Jaluau community, in Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County
Description:
2. Location of Incident: Avukaya community in Bangol Payam, Mundri East County
Description: 3.	On 29 May, two secondary sources reported that on 15 May, one SSPDF officer raped a 16-year-old girl from the Avukaya community in Bangol Payam, Mundri East County. According to the sources, the SSPDF officer called and asked the survivor to fetch water for him, and  after delivering the water, he forcibly dragged her into his room and raped her. The sources further informed that the incident was reported to the Payam chief as there is no police station in the locality; however,  no further action was taken. The survivor did not receive any medical or psychosocial support due to the remoteness of the area and the absence of health care facilities.

Location of Incident: in Akobo, Nyirol, and Uror Counties
Description: 1.	On 30 and 31 May, multiple sources reported that between 27 and 30 May, four children (two girls and two boys) from the Murle community were recovered by the authorities in Akobo, Nyirol, and Uror Counties. Reportedly, one girl was recovered in Nyirol County, one boy from Uror County, and one boy and one girl from Akobo County. The victims were reportedly abducted by armed Lou Nuer elements during the attack on Gumuruk County in March 2025. The children are currently being sheltered by the authorities in Akobo, while protection partners are coordinating with the authorities for their transfer and family tracing and reunification process.

Location of Incident: Dinka Muok community during a cattle raid in Tonj Payam, Tonj South County
Description: 2.	On 31 May, three primary sources reported that on 30 May, armed Dinka Thony youths from Manyangok Payam shot and killed one male civilian and injured two others from the Dinka Muok community during a cattle raid in Tonj Payam, Tonj South County. As recounted by the sources, armed Dinka Thony youths attacked and opened fire on a cattle camp in Ayuath village, Tonj Payam. The attackers also seized 20 heads of cattle and fled with them into Manyangok Payam. The injured victims were evacuated to a hospital in Tonj Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Dinka Muok community during a cattle raid in Tonj Payam, Tonj South County
Description: 2.	On 31 May, three primary sources reported that on 30 May, armed Dinka Thony youths from Manyangok Payam shot and killed one male civilian and injured two others from the Dinka Muok community during a cattle raid in Tonj Payam, Tonj South County. As recounted by the sources, armed Dinka Thony youths attacked and opened fire on a cattle camp in Ayuath village, Tonj Payam. The attackers also seized 20 heads of cattle and fled with them into Manyangok Payam. The injured victims were evacuated to a hospital in Tonj Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Dinka Muok community during a cattle raid in Tonj Payam, Tonj South County
Description: 2.	On 31 May, three primary sources reported that on 30 May, armed Dinka Thony youths from Manyangok Payam shot and killed one male civilian and injured two others from the Dinka Muok community during a cattle raid in Tonj Payam, Tonj South County. As recounted by the sources, armed Dinka Thony youths attacked and opened fire on a cattle camp in Ayuath village, Tonj Payam. The attackers also seized 20 heads of cattle and fled with them into Manyangok Payam. The injured victims were evacuated to a hospital in Tonj Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Dinka Jaluau community in Tonj Payam, Tonj South County
Description: 3.	On 1 June, three primary sources reported that on 31 May, suspected armed Dinka Luanyjang youths shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Jaluau community in Tonj Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Luanyjang youths ambushed and opened fire on the victim at Hi-Mango spot in Tonj Town while he was transporting his children to school in Tonj Town, injuring him. The victim was evacuated to a hospital in Tonj Town where he succumbed to the injuries. The attack is reportedly a revenge action linked to the ongoing violence between the Dinka Luanyjang and Dinka Jaluau communities.

Location of Incident: Dinka Yar community in Mabior-Yar village, Wanhalel Payam, Tonj South County
Description: 1.	On 2 June, three primary sources reported that on 31 May, armed Dinka Thony youths from Manyangok Payam shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Yar community in Mabior-Yar village, Wanhalel Payam, Tonj South County. As recounted by the sources, the armed Dinka Thony youths attacked and opened fire on a homestead in in Mabior-Yar village, killing one civilian, and thereafter fled back to Manyangok Payam. The attack is linked to ongoing violence between the Dinka Thony of Manyangok Payam and the allied Dinka Yar, Muok and Apuk-Jurwir communities in Tonj South County.

Location of Incident: from the Logir community in Momoria Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos County.
Description: 1.	On 3 June, three secondary sources reported that on 24 May, armed Logir youths from Mohina Boma shot and killed two male civilians (ages 23 and 40 years old) from the Logir community in Momoria Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos County. According to the sources,  three armed Logir youths entered Momoria Boma and opened fire on the victims, killing them, reportedly  in retaliation for the killing of one 27-year-old Logir male civilian (cattle keeper) from Mohina Boma by armed youths from Momoria Boma during an attempted cattle raid on 7 April 2024. The incident was reported at Ikotos Police Station and investigation is reportedly ongoing; however, no suspects have been apprehended so far.

Location of Incident: Torit Municipal Police Detention Facility
Description:
2.	On 2 June, two secondary sources reported that on the same day, one 17-year-old boy from the Lokoya community died in custody at the Torit Municipal Police Detention Facility. According to the sources, on 1 June, the protection guards of the Governor of Eastern Equatoria State arrested the victim for his alleged involvement in the stabbing of one of the bodyguards of the Governor, transferred him to the Governor’s residence, where he was allegedly tortured to near-death. Later that evening, the Governor’s guards reportedly summoned a joint patrol team from the municipality, which transported the unconscious boy to the Torit Municipal Police Station, and was subsequently referred to the police clinic where he succumbed to his injuries.

Comment: The victim was suspected of being a member of an armed group allegedly responsible for the stabbing of the Governor’s bodyguard (from the Toposa community). News of the victim’s death sparked a protest by members of the alleged armed group and sections of the local community in Torit, which escalated and overwhelmed local police capacity, prompting intervention by the South Sudan People’s Defence Forces(SSPDF). The body of the deceased was released to his family on the morning of 3 June for burial.

Location of Incident: Chienglien sub-clans in Wangdhoali village, Wangkei Payam, Mayom County
Description:
3.	On 3 June, multiple sources reported that on 2 June, five male civilians from the Bul Nuer community were killed and another was injured during retaliatory violence between armed Bul Nuer elements from the Chiengnyaluoh and Chienglien sub-clans in Wangdhoali village, Wangkei Payam, Mayom County. According to the sources, armed Bul Nuer elements from the Chiengnyaluoh sub-clan shot and injured one male Bul Nuer civilian from the Chienglien sub-clan, before setting him on fire, resulting in his death. Later on the same day, in retaliation, armed Bul Nuer elements from the Chienglien sub-clan attacked the Chiengnyaluoh community, killing four male civilians and injuring another. Government security forces were reportedly dispatched to restore calm to the area. 

Comment: Reportedly, the incidents are retaliatory attacks connected to the extrajudicial execution (burning alive) by the SSPDF of another SSPDF officer who had joined the South Sudan People's Movement/Army (SSPM/A) and was accused of being involved in the killing of the former commissioner of Mayom County on 22 July 2022. Tensions remains high in the area with the likelihood of further retaliatory attacks unless prompt action is taken to address the escalating tensions.

Location of Incident: Chiengnyaluoh sub-clans in Wangdhoali village, Wangkei Payam, Mayom County
Description:

Location of Incident: Chiengnyaluoh sub-clans in Nyingar Boma, Kuerbona Payam, Mayom County
Description:
1.	On 4 June, multiple sources reported that on 3 June, one male civilian was shot and killed and six others were injured during retaliatory violence between armed Bul Nuer elements from the Chiengding and Chiengnyaluoh sub-clans in Nyingar Boma, Kuerbona Payam, Mayom County. According to the sources, armed Bul Buer elements from the Chiengding sub-clan shot and killed one 26-year-old Bul Nuer male civilian from the Chiengnyaluoh sub-clan in Nyingar, reportedly in revenge for the killing of a 48-year-old Bul Nuer man from the Chiengding sub-clan allegedly by a relative of the victim on March 2025 [see HRD Daily Report 11 March 2025]. In retaliation, armed Bul Nuer elements from the Chiengnyaluoh and Chiengpareng sub-clans attacked and opened fire on the Chiengding community injuring six male civilians. Reportedly, the injured victims were receiving medical treatment at a health care facility in Nyingar Boma.

Comment: According to the sources, in the evening of the same day, fighting erupted between the armed elements from the three sub-clans, resulting in the killing of two armed elements from the Chiengding sub-clan and an armed element from the from Chiengnyaluoh sub-clan as well as injuring of three armed elements (two Chiengding and one Chiengpareng). Government security forces were reportedly deployed to the scene to restore calm. Tensions reportedly remains high in the area with reports of mobilization by the armed for further retaliatory attacks.

Location of Incident: Chiengding sub-clans in Nyingar Boma, Kuerbona Payam, Mayom County
Description:
1.	On 4 June, multiple sources reported that on 3 June, one male civilian was shot and killed and six others were injured during retaliatory violence between armed Bul Nuer elements from the Chiengding and Chiengnyaluoh sub-clans in Nyingar Boma, Kuerbona Payam, Mayom County. Location of Incident: in Deer-Kuony village, Tonj Payam, Tonj South County
Description:
2.	On 4 June, three primary sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Thony youths shot and killed two male civilians and injured two female civilians, all from the Dinka Muok community, during a cattle raid in Deer-Kuony village, Tonj Payam, Tonj South County. As recounted by the sources, the armed Dinka Thony youths attacked and opened fire on a group of Dinka Muok herders who were grazing their cattle in the village, killing two of the herders and injuring to women who were preparing their gardens near the grazing area. The attackers also seized approximately 50 heads of cattle and fled with them into Manyangok Payam. The injured victims were evacuated to a hospital in Tonj Town for medical treatment.

Comment: Reportedly, the attack is linked to the cyclic revenge violence between the Dinka Thony and the allied Dinka Yar, Muok and Apuk-Jurwir communities.

Location of Incident: in Deer-Kuony village, Tonj Payam, Tonj South County
Description:
2.	On 4 June, three primary sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Thony youths shot and killed two male civilians and injured two female civilians, all from the Dinka Muok community, during a cattle raid in Deer-Kuony village, Tonj Payam, Tonj South County. As recounted by the sources, the armed Dinka Thony youths attacked and opened fire on a group of Dinka Muok herders who were grazing their cattle in the village, killing two of the herders and injuring to women who were preparing their gardens near the grazing area. The attackers also seized approximately 50 heads of cattle and fled with them into Manyangok Payam. The injured victims were evacuated to a hospital in Tonj Town for medical treatment.

Comment: Reportedly, the attack is linked to the cyclic revenge violence between the Dinka Thony and the allied Dinka Yar, Muok and Apuk-Jurwir communities.

Location of Incident: in Deer-Kuony village, Tonj Payam, Tonj South County
Description:
2.	On 4 June, three primary sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Thony youths shot and killed two male civilians and injured two female civilians, all from the Dinka Muok community, during a cattle raid in Deer-Kuony village, Tonj Payam, Tonj South County. As recounted by the sources, the armed Dinka Thony youths attacked and opened fire on a group of Dinka Muok herders who were grazing their cattle in the village, killing two of the herders and injuring to women who were preparing their gardens near the grazing area. The attackers also seized approximately 50 heads of cattle and fled with them into Manyangok Payam. The injured victims were evacuated to a hospital in Tonj Town for medical treatment.

Comment: Reportedly, the attack is linked to the cyclic revenge violence between the Dinka Thony and the allied Dinka Yar, Muok and Apuk-Jurwir communities.

Location of Incident: Bagugu village, Ndoromo Boma, Basukangbi Payam, Nzara County
Description:
3.	On 4 June, one primary source and multiple secondary sources reported on 3 June, unidentified armed elements abducted at least seven civilians in Bagugu village, Ndoromo Boma, Basukangbi Payam, Nzara County. As recounted by the sources, a group of eight unidentified armed elements intercepted at gunpoint eight civilians travelling on motorcycles enroute to a market located at the border of South Sudan and the Democratic Republic of Congo and took them to a nearby abandoned home, where they were tied and threatened with death if anyone attempted to escape. The abductors reportedly continued to bring in more abductees. The sources further informed that one of the eight abductees escaped and subsequently reported the incident at the Basukangbi Police post. On 4 June, the joint security forces were dispatched to the area.

Comment: HRD will follow up to gather more information on the incident.

Location of Incident: Dodo Village, Mugwo Payam, Yei River County
Description:
1.	On 5 June, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, suspected NAS elements abducted 12 civilians (humanitarian workers) in Dodo Village, Mugwo Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, the suspected NAS elements intercepted a vehicle carrying 12 staff members of a local non-governmental organization (NGO) enroute to Mugwo and abducted all occupants. Reportedly, the armed elements initially demanded a ransom of 15,000 United States Dollars (USD) for the safe release of the abductees; however, nine (one woman) were subsequently released, while three (two women) remained in captivity. The abductors reportedly reduced the ransom to 5,000 USD after the release on the nine abductees. 

Comment: This incident indicates an increasing pattern of targeted abductions of humanitarian workers, particularly those working with local NGOs. The recurrence of such incidents along major humanitarian access routes (Yei–Kaya and Yei–Maridi) demonstrates a deteriorating security environment for humanitarian operations as well as heightened safety concerns for humanitarian personnel in the Greater Yei area [see HRD Daily Report 21 May 2025].

Location of Incident: Didinga community of Nagishot Boma in Ngauro Boma, Ngauro Payam, Budi County
Description: 2.	On 5 June, three secondary sources reported that on 25 May, a group of three Didinga youths from Ngauro Boma killed one 28-year-old woman from the Didinga community of Nagishot Boma in Ngauro Boma, Ngauro Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked the victim while she was fetching water at a stream within Ngauro Boma,  strangled her to death and thereafter disposed of her body in the stream. The incident is reportedly linked to ongoing tensions and retaliatory violence between Didinga youths from Ngauro and Nagishot Bomas and in revenge for the killing of a 32-year-old farmer from Ngauro Boma by armed Didinga youth from Nagishot Boma on 27 April [see HRD Daily Report 6 May 2025].

Location of Incident: Anyuak Community, in Burtor Payam, Pochalla North County, GPAA
Description: 3.	On 7 June, multiple sources reported that on 5 June, Murle armed elements shot and killed one 13-year-old boy, injured one 28-year-old man, and abducted a six-year-old boy, all from the Anyuak Community, in Burtor Payam, Pochalla North County, GPAA. According to the sources, the armed Murle elements attacked and opened fire on a group of four civilians travelling on two bicycles, killing one, injuring another, and  a minor, while the other escaped unharmed. The attackers reportedly destroyed the two bicycles and looted personal properties of the victims before escaping with the abductee. The injured victim was evacuated to a hospital in Pochalla for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Anyuak Community, in Burtor Payam, Pochalla North County, GPAA
Description: 3.	On 7 June, multiple sources reported that on 5 June, Murle armed elements shot and killed one 13-year-old boy, injured one 28-year-old man, and abducted a six-year-old boy, all from the Anyuak Community, in Burtor Payam, Pochalla North County, GPAA. According to the sources, the armed Murle elements attacked and opened fire on a group of four civilians travelling on two bicycles, killing one, injuring another, and  a minor, while the other escaped unharmed. The attackers reportedly destroyed the two bicycles and looted personal properties of the victims before escaping with the abductee. The injured victim was evacuated to a hospital in Pochalla for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Dinka Agaar community in Amongpiny Payam, Rumbek Centre County
Description: 4.	On 5 June, multiple sources reported that on 4 June, suspected armed Nuer elements from Panyijar County, Unity State shot and killed two male civilians from the Dinka Agaar community in Amongpiny Payam, Rumbek Centre County. According to the sources, the suspected armed Nuer elements attacked and opened fire on a group of 10 civilians at the  Afirnhom fishing site in Amongpiny Payam, killing two. The attackers were reportedly on their way back from a failed cattle raid.

Location of Incident: Dinka Muok community in Tonj Town, Tonj Payam, Tonj South County
Description:
5.	On 8 June, four primary sources reported that on 4 June, eight civilians were shot and killed (three including one woman from the Dinka Muok community, two Dinka Yar, and three from the Dinka Thony) and three others including one girl from the Dinka Muok community were injured during revenge violence between armed Dinka Thony and armed Dinka Muok-Dinka Yar youths in Tonj Payam, Tonj South County. As recounted by the sources, the armed Dinka Thony youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Muok community in Tonj Town, killing three Dinka Muok civilians including one woman and two Dinka Yar male civilians, and injuring two male civilians and one girl from the Dinka Muok community. The attackers also reportedly seized an unspecified number of cattle and escaped with them into Manyangok Payam. In retaliation, joint armed Dinka Muok and Dinka Yar youths while pursuing the armed Dinka Thony shot and killed three Dinka Thony civilians who were watering their cattle at a water point in the swampy area. The injured victims are reportedly receiving medical treatment at a hospital in Tonj Town. 

Comment: The incident is reportedly linked to the ongoing retaliatory violence between the Dinka Thony and the allied Dinka Yar, Muok and Apuk-Jurwir communities.

Location of Incident: Dinka Muok community in Tonj Town, Tonj Payam, Tonj South County
Description:
5.	On 8 June, four primary sources reported that on 4 June, eight civilians were shot and killed (three including one woman from the Dinka Muok community, two Dinka Yar, and three from the Dinka Thony) and three others including one girl from the Dinka Muok community were injured during revenge violence between armed Dinka Thony and armed Dinka Muok-Dinka Yar youths in Tonj Payam, Tonj South County. As recounted by the sources, the armed Dinka Thony youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Muok community in Tonj Town, killing three Dinka Muok civilians including one woman and two Dinka Yar male civilians, and injuring two male civilians and one girl from the Dinka Muok community. Location of Incident: Dinka Pan-Juaj community in Payii village, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County
Description: 6.	On 8 June, three primary sources reported that on 5 June, armed Dinka Jaluau shot and killed one female civilian from the Dinka Pan-Juaj community in Payii village, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County. As recounted by the sources, the armed Dinka Jaluau youths attacked and opened fire on the victim at her homestead in Payii village, killing her. The attack is reportedly a  revenge action linked to the violence between the Dinka Luanyjang and the allied Dinka Pan-Juaj and the Dinka Jaluau communities [see HRD Daily Report 3 June 2025].

Location of Incident: in  Awut-Wut village, Toch West Payam, Gogrial East County
Description: 7.	On 8 June, four primary sources reported that on 5 June, one male civilian from the Dinka Apuk community was injured during aerial bombardment by the SSPDF in  Awut-Wut village, Toch West Payam, Gogrial East County. According to the sources, the SSPDF was pursuing, with  a helicopter gunship, armed Dinka Apuk and Dinka Lou-Ariik youths from Alabek Payam, Tonj North County,  who were reportedly massing in the swampy area along the border with Unity State to carry out armed attacks. The victim reportedly suffered shrapnel burns to his limbs and was evacuated to a health care facility in Lietnhom Town, Pathuon West Payam for medical treatment. The sources further informed that at least eight houses were burnt down during the shelling by the SSPDF.

Location of Incident: Luo community in Khor Jamus, Jur River County
Description:
8.	On 5 June, one primary source and a secondary source reported that on 7 February, NSS personnel arbitrarily arrested, detained and ill-treated one 24-year-old male civilian from the Luo community in Khor Jamus, Jur River County. As recounted by the sources, the NSS personnel arrested the victim (a shop owner) on accusation of storing weapons inside his shop, which he denied. The NSS reportedly searched his shop and no  weapons were found; however, they allegedly stole 5,000,000 South Sudan Pounds (SSP) and 42 pieces of clothing from the shop. Reportedly, the NSS personnel thereafter took the victim to the Khor Jamus SSPDF checkpoint, where he was subjected to severe ill-treatment including beatings with a baton and burning with plastic to coerce a confession of affiliation with the SPLA-IO and illegal firearm possession. Despite the torture, the victim denied the accusations. The victim was subsequently transferred to the NSS headquarters in Wau, where he was detained for four days. The victim was released on 11 February  after paying 150,000 SSP to the NSS personnel.

Comment: The operations conducted by government security forces in Kuanya and surrounding areas in February 2025, which were purportedly aimed at maintaining security, have resulted in widespread human rights violations. The arbitrary arrests and severe mistreatment of victims, including actions amounting to torture, reflect a deliberate effort to inflict suffering and fear among local populations, many of whom are perceived as SPLA-IO sympathizers. The extortion of 150,000 SSP further underscores systemic abuses of power by NSS personnel.

Location of Incident: in Gangara Pisi, Saura Boma, Yambio Town Payam
Description:
•	SSPDF soldiers reportedly abducts and rape four Girls in two separate incidents in Yambio County.

On June 6, 2025, HRD conducted a monitoring visit to the GBV One Stop Centre at Yambio State Hospital and documented two rape cases involving four victims aged 13, 14, 16, and 16, implicating the South Sudan Peoples Defence Forces (SSPDF), who are stationed at the Nambia Checkpoint and Li-Rangu military barracks in Lirangu Payam, Yambio County.

According to the records of One Stop Center, on 2 June, a community social worker reported that on May 30, 2025, six SSPDF members raided a funeral vigil in Gangara Pisi, Saura Boma, Yambio Town Payam, and abducted three young girls at gunpoint. Two of the victims were taken to the Nambia Checkpoint, while the third was taken to the Li-Rangu Barracks, where all three girls were reportedly raped. After the incident, two of the girls were released the following day with warnings not to report the case. However, they confided in a social worker at the Saura medical facility, who referred them to the One Stop Centre in Yambio for medical assistance. The third victim was released on June 1, 2025. The incident has been reported to the Saura Police Station, and all three victims have received necessary psychological support and medical treatment at Yambio State Hospital.

In a separate case, three armed SSPDF personnel abducted a 16-year-old girl from Gangara Amelia on the night of May 30, taking her to the SSPDF barracks in Nambia Boma, Lirangu Payam. It was reported that one soldier raped her for three nights before releasing her on June 2. Reportedly, the victim received medical assistance but chose not to pursue legal action against the perpetrator, whose details are on file, due to fear of reprisals.

Comments: HRD will collaborate with the UNMO section to engage with the Division 16 Brigade Commander in Yambio town t advocate for justice for the victim and accountability of the suspects.

Location of Incident: Lirangu Payam, Yambio County
Description:
•	SSPDF soldiers reportedly abducts and rape four Girls in two separate incidents in Yambio County.
