Location of Incident: Bor town, Bor South, Jonglei State
Description:
Gang rape of a woman in Bor town, Bor South, Jonglei State

On 09 May, HRD received information from protection actors and civil society organizations that on 04 April at around 20:00 hours a 19-year-old Dinka woman was subjected to gang rape by three men in Pakwan, Bor town, Bor South County, Jonglei State. According to sources, the survivor had gone to recharge credits in her phone in town when the perpetrators allegedly forced her to get on a motorcycle and took her to an abandoned building approximately 10 minutes from the town center, where they gang-raped her until she lost consciousness. The survivor reportedly sought medical attention on 05 May and received treatment at a local hospital. 

Comment: UNFPA was the main donor supporting the operations of the Bor One-Stop Centre, but funding was discontinued in December 2024. Since then, the Centre has been operating through volunteer efforts and did not receive new funding since then.

Location of Incident: Yambio Town
Description:
•	Report on the Gang Rape of a Pregnant Woman in Yambio Town

On May 5, one secondary source reported an incident involving a pregnant woman from the Azande community in Yambio Town, Yambio County. According to the source, unidentified individuals in civilian clothes allegedly entered her homestead in the Tiindoka neighborhood on the afternoon of April 28 and reportedly ganged raped her. The woman allegedly received medical attention at a local health facility in Yambio.

HRD is still contacting other sources for further verification; if verified, this incident could raise concerns about civilians' safety and security. Relevant laws and provisions violated may include the Transitional Constitution of the Republic of South Sudan 2011, which guarantees the right to life, dignity, and protection from harm. The Penal Code Act (9 of 2008) may also apply to address potential criminal offenses.

Comment: HRD notes that the incident involving a pregnant woman from the Azande community in Yambio Town raises concerns about the protection of human rights, particularly the rights to safety, security, and dignity. If substantiated, such incidents can have significant impacts on individuals and communities, highlighting the need for effective measures to prevent and respond to violence. Ensuring accountability and supporting affected individuals are crucial to upholding human rights.

Location of Incident: Haibakindo area of Yambio Town
Description: Moreover, HRD documented an assault case involving a 32-year-old suspect who attacked his 21-year-old wife. According to the police, upon returning home intoxicated and unable to find food, the suspect assaulted his wife. She sustained injuries and reported the incident to the police on May 6; the husband was arrested the same day. The incident occurred in the Haibakindo area of Yambio Town on May 5, and the victim was sent to the hospital with a Form 8 on May 6. The police stated that an investigation would commence once the victim returns the form.

Location of Incident: Haibakindo area of Yambio Town
Description: HRD recorded a serious rape case involving a 15-year-old victim and a 22-year-old male suspect. The victim disclosed that she was raped and impregnated by the suspect in the Haibakindo area of Yambio Town since January 2025. Although the suspect denied any sexual relations, the victim maintained that they had been in a relationship. The case was reported to the police on April 30 and has been sent to court, where the suspect was arraigned in Yambio County Court today. Additionally, another 15-year-old victim reported being raped and impregnated by an unknown man in Ikpiro, Yambio Town. This incident occurred on December 1, 2024, but was only reported to the police on May 6, 2025. Initially, the victim's family attempted to settle the matter privately, but upon the suspect denying responsibility, the victim's father took the appropriate action to report the case to the police. A warrant for the suspect’s arrest has since been issued, and he remains at large.

Location of Incident: Yuai, Uror County
Description:
Recovery of a Nuer abductee from Gumuruk County, GPAA 

On 13 May, HRD received information from GPAA authorities, social workers and the victim that a 19 year old Nuer woman abductee was recovered and protected by the GPAA authorities in the Interim Care Centre in Pibor, GPAA. According to the sources, the victim was abducted from Yuai, Uror County in Jonglei State by armed Murle elements in 2022 and was taken to Nyacharavachiz Payam in Gumuruk County, GPAA where she continued to remain until her escape. Reportedly, on 09 May she managed to escape her abductors and sought protection with the Gumuruk County authorities in Gumuruk on the same day who managed to give her protection and transfer to Pibor on 11 May. GPAA authorities in coordination with protection partners are taking action for family tracing and reunification. HRD has confirmed that she was subjected to violations of sexual slavery and rape during her captivity. HRD is also confirming if she was a minor at the time of her abduction. HRD will continue to work with Jonglei and GPAA authorities and partners to ensure that she receives medical and psychosocial support as required.

Location of Incident: Yuai, Uror County
Description:
Two Murle abductees managed to escape their abductors in Jonglei State and reach the border areas and to Pibor with support from Murle youth and protection actors, GPAA – victims subjected to SV during captivity
On 15 May, HRD received information from two victims, social workers in Interim Care Centre(ICC), Pibor and authorities in Pibor, GPAA that two Murle women aged 18 and 25 respectively managed to escape their abductors in Yuai, Uror County on 02 May, and reached the border between Jonglei and GPAA where they spent four days with the Murle armed youth who supported their transfer to Wuno Payam in Likuangole County, after which protection actors supported their move to Pibor. They are currently being sheltered at the ICC while family tracing and reunification are being carried out by protection actors and GPAA authorities. The victims are reportedly from Evino Village, Melegenya Payam in Gumuruk County from where they were abducted 02 March 2025 when the armed elements from Jonglei State attacked Gumuruk County. HRD was informed by the 25 year old woman that she was subjected to tape and sexual slavery during her captivity while the 18 year old denied any sexual violence. However, HRD is working with protection actors to provide medical and psychosocial support to both victims as a preventive measure, given the stigma around reporting of such cases and underreporting involved.

Location of Incident: Nagero County, Western Equatoria State (WES)
Description:
•	SSPDF elements allegedly raped, arbitrarily arrested and assaulted to death one female civilian in Nagero County, Western Equatoria State (WES)
On 8 May 2025, during an ILDP in Bazia/Kpaile HRD received information from two secondary sources that in March 2025 (date not specified) a 65-year-old female civilian, Balanda by tribe, was arbitrarily arrested, raped, and assaulted to death reportedly by the SSPDF elements station at the Bo River bridge. 
The SPLA-iO Brigade 2 Commander reported to HRD that, in March 2025 (exact date unspecified), SSPDF personnel arrested a 65-year-old female civilian (name on file) in Zamoi village as she attempted to cross from Nagero County, Western Equatoria State (WES), to Bazia Payam. She was accompanied by a young boy (name and age not provided) who reportedly managed to escape and subsequently informed local leaders at the Bazia Payam headquarters about the incident. The commander alleged that the woman was physically assaulted during the arrest and was held in prolonged, unlawful detention at the SSPDF post near the Bo River bridge. The Commander informed HRD, according to their sources at the Bo River, during her captivity, the victim was reportedly denied adequate food and subjected to repeated acts of rape and physical assault, which ultimately resulted in her death (date unspecified).
The Commander further recounted that on 27 April 2025, the SPLA-iO elements discovered the mutilated body of the deceased abandoned near a telecommunication tower close to the Bo River bridge. The SPLA-iO in the Bazia area recovered the remains, which were later identified and buried by her relatives the same day in Nakpataguru, approximately 6 km south of Bazia Payam center. Despite phone call interventions by SPLA-iO to both the SSPDF Bussere commander and the unit at the Bo River bridge, the commanders in question denied any knowledge of the incident.
HRD also interviewed a 53-year-old male civilian in-law of the deceased, Balanda by tribe, an IDP who fled from Nagero, WES. He corroborated the above account and confirmed the recovery and burial of her body by the community at Nakpataguru. He further reported to HRD that the young boy who escaped arrest had since relocated to Wau town with other relatives due to the hardship of living conditions in the Bazia area. The case has not been reported to the police so far. 
Comments: During a separate engagement with Bazia’s paramount chief, he disclosed to HRD that initial phone exchanges with his counterpart in Nagero County, Western Equatoria State (WES), had indicated the 65-year-old victim was alive. However, subsequent communications revealed she had been killed days after the initial reports

Location of Incident: Rumbek town, Rumbek Centre County
Description:
HRD referred a16-year-old girl, survivor of early and forced marriage to a service provider in Rumbek town

On 13 May 2025, a 16-year-old girl reached out to HRD on phone, seeking support. During the phone call, the girl was along with her aunt. She stated that she needed help to be extracted from the early and forced marriage in which she was living. The said early and forced marriage had allegedly been arranged by her relatives. The girl supported by the aunt, explained that she was withdrawn (without her consent) from a primary school (name on file) attended in Rumbek town by the family members who decided to stop paying her school fees and to marry her off to an elderly man within the community, in February 2025. HRD gathered that the girl has since attempted to escape from the house of the reported elderly man by three times, to not avail. The girl mentioned that through all these attempts to escape the forced marriage, her family members have been subjecting her to beatings and threaten to beat her to death, should she continue to resist.

After listening the account details, HRD ensured to primarily explain to the survivor and her aunt, the existing Protection mechanisms and the services available within the local system of reference (the Protection referral pathway). HRD was subsequently able to successfully refer the survivor and the aunt to a service provider (name on file) operating in Rumbek town, for further assistance.

Comments: HRD observes that the cases of early and/or forced marriages continue to be in the rise in Lake State, despite recurring Government’s campaigns and the measures undertaken to notably discourage the child marriages and protect especially, the children attending schools. HRD will raise the issue again at the next Protection cluster meeting.

Location of Incident: Luparate, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County
Description:
18-year-old girl reportedly gang-raped by four boys at Luparate, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County


On May 13, 2025, HRD-YFO received and documented information from three reliable sources including a police officer, medical officer and a community officer on the rape of an 18-year-old female by a gang of four boys in Luparate on April 16, 2025 

According to reports from the above sources, the 18-year-old victim (details on file), a resident of Hai Lomuku II from Kakwa tribe was fast asleep together with her four sisters when the four boys (details on file) stormed their home at about 1:00AM on April 16 and threatened to kill them with knives. The perpetrators, reported to be between the ages of 18 and 20, from mixed tribes, including Pojulu, Kakwa and Mundari abducted the victim and took her to an abandoned building in Luparate where they took turns in raping her until she passed out and only discovered herself in the morning, alone, naked and bleeding.  The victim was referred to a medical facility on same day, where the rape was established, and the case was reported to the police. The perpetrators were arrested and kept in detention for three weeks while investigation procedures are conducted. 

Comments: such a gruesome and inhumane act of the gang greatly violates the bodily integrity of the victim while the unnecessary delays in investigation procedures result in unlawful detention. HRD advised the police to take swift actions in ensuring accountability and facilitating the administration of justice. The police vouched to take the perpetrators in remand while awaiting court procedures. HRD will follow up closely to ensure compliance.

Location of Incident: Barmalual Payam, Rubkona County
Description:
•	Unidentified armed elements raped three Leek Nuer IDPs in Barmalual Payam, Rubkona County
On 14 May 2025 HRD participated in an integrated field mission to some IDP sites in Rubkona County. During the field mission, multiple sources informed HRD that on 8 May 2025, five unidentified armed men gang raped three women (ages unspecified) in Phannyadit Boma, Barmalual Payam, Rubkona County. The sources informed that the victims had gone in search of waterlilies in the river when the five men accosted them and raped them at gunpoint. They did not know if the victims had received any medical attention or reported the case to the police.
Comments: Several rape incidents have been reported especially in Rubkona County, with armed men targeting women and girls who go in search of waterlilies, food or firewood. HRD will conduct further investigations and report accordingly. HRD will meet with protection partners to refer the cases for medical and psychosocial assistance and will discuss with protection partners and the relevant UNMISS sections on prompt action to prevent and respond to the prevalence of sexual violence in parts of Unity State, including Rubkona County.

Location of Incident: Tambura
Description:
•	Report on Rape Incident in Tambura

On 13 May 2025, HRD Yambio Field Office received information from two secondary sources, including a member of a civil society organization in Tambura town, regarding the rape of a 30-year-old woman by her 35-year-old ex-husband, both from the Azande community.

According to the sources, the victim reported that she was married to the perpetrator, but their marriage was dissolved by the customary court (B Court) in Tambura town in December 2024 due to the husband's excessive abuse. A certificate of divorce was issued; however, prior to the dissolution, they had cultivated a piece of land together. During the court ruling, the customary chiefs determined that both parties could continue to cultivate the farmland until the crops were harvested, after which the woman would leave the plot, which belonged to her ex-husband.

On Friday, May 8, the victim went to the farm to harvest her crops. The perpetrator, who was also present, began making advances toward her. When she resisted, he forcibly grabbed her and raped her. The case was reported to the police on Saturday, May 9, and the perpetrator was subsequently arrested for investigation. The sources further stated that the victim received medical assistance at a local health facility in Tambura. 

Comments: The victim's right to personal safety and bodily autonomy was severely violated. The ex-husband had no right to force himself on his ex-wife without her consent and should be punished as stipulated in Article 247 of the South Sudan Penal Code Act of 2008. While the penal code does not recognize sexual intercourse between couples as rape, in this case, the couple was already divorced and had received a certificate from the customary court, making consent essential for any sexual contact. Rape is a grave infringement on an individual's rights and dignity, highlighting the urgent need for effective measures to protect women from gender-based violence. HRD will continue to monitor the situation and advocate for justice in this case.

Location of Incident: Rim Village, in Waat Payam, Nyirol County
Description:
Akobo (Jonglei) authorities recover and transfer a Murle abductee victim and her infant child to Likuangole, GPAA
On 19 May, HRD received information from Akobo County authorities confirming the recovery of a Murle abductee victim and her two year old girlchild. According to the sources, the victim escaped her Lou Nuer abductors in Rim Village, in Waat Payam, Nyirol County on 14 May and travelled on foot for three days to reach Akobo on 17 May. The victim was reportedly abducted from Kong Kong village in Likuangole County GPAA in 2022. The Akobo authorities supported her transfer to her village in Likuangole GPAA by tracing her family and seeking help from a commercial vehicle. The victim was subjected to rape and sexual slavery during her captivity.

Location of Incident: Yei Town Payam, Yei River County.
Description:
Rape of 16-year-old female by 17-year-old male in Yei Town Payam, Yei River County. 

On May 19, 2025, HRD-YFO and UNPOL conducted a joint monitoring visit to One Stop Center, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County. The primary purpose of the monitoring visit was to follow up on reported cases of CRSV and SGBV. 

The team met with two officers, including a Medical Officer and a Community Officer (details on file) who provided information on the rape of a 16-year-old female (details on file), a resident of Nyombe, from Kakwa tribe, by her 17-year-old boyfriend (details on file), resident of Yei Town and of Kakwa tribe. The incident reportedly happened on May 12, 2025, when the victim left her junior sister at home alone at about 7:00PM and spent the night at her boyfriend’s residence in Yei Town where she was raped multiple times and only returned home at about 5:00PM the following day to find that thieves had broken into their home in her absence. The victim was referred to a health center for medical examination and the case was reported to the Nyombe police after the rape was established by medical examiners and the perpetrator was arrested and detained. 

Comments: this act of rape of a minor violates International Humanitarian Law (Article 3 and 4 of the Geneva Convention) and International Human Rights Law (Articles 5 and 12 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights) on bodily integrity and arbitrary interference with privacy. HRD will follow up with the Nyombe police to ensure accountability and effective administration of justice. HRD recommends working sessions with teenagers in Yei town and other counties to educate them on basic human rights, including CRSV/SGBV concerns.

Location of Incident: Luzira, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County.
Description:
Rape of 13-year-old female by unidentified gang member in Luzira, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County. 

On May 20, 2025, HRD-YFO received and documented information from three reliable secondary sources (details on file) including two medical officers and a community officer on the rape of a 13-year-old female by unidentified gang member in Luzira, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County.

According to information reported by the above-mentioned sources, the inhumane incident happened on May 9, 2025, at about 10:00PM when the victim (details on file) and resident of Luzira had stepped out for nature’s call. She was spotted by a gang of unidentified boys and one of the boys succeeded to rape her. The parents of the young girl were alerted by her wails and only succeeded in getting to the scene shortly after the perpetrator and his fellow gang members had absconded. The case was not reported to the police, since the perpetrator and his gang members could not be identified. The victim was taken to a medical facility in Yei Town by her parents on May 10, 2025, where the rape was confirmed 

Comments: this is just one of several cases of SGBV /CRSV that occur daily yet, they go unreported thus revealing the limitations attempts to foster accountability and proper administration of justice. HRD will follow up with the police to ensure that proper investigation is conducted into the case and perpetrators are held accountable for their actions.

Location of Incident: Yei Town, Yei River County
Description:
•	Rape of 15-year-old girl by a civilian man in Yei Town, Yei River County
On 21 May 2025, HRD YFO received and documented information from two reliable secondary sources (medical officer and community worker), regarding the rape of 15-year-old girl from Kakwa tribe (details on file) by a 26-year-old civilian man from the same tribe (details on file) in Yei Town, Yei River County on 15 May 2025.

Sources reported that at around 4 am on 16 May 2025, a 15-year-old girl was found outside her home in Luzira village in Yei Town by her elder sister after spending the night at the “boyfriend’s” house where she was raped. On 17 May 2025, the victim was taken to a medical facility in Yei Town for medical care, and the perpetrator was arrested and detained at Yei Police Station pending further investigation. Even though the survivor claimed to have a relationship with the man and stayed with perpetrator, it does not negate statutory rape allegations, because consent is legally irrelevant for minors under South Sudanese law. 

Comments: The South Sudan Penal Code (2008) criminalizes statutory rape (Section 247) and defines sexual intercourse with a minor under 18 as a felony, punishable by up to 14 years’ imprisonment. South Sudan is party to the Convention on the Rights of the Child (CRC) and the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination Against Women (CEDAW) which protect from exploitation and mandates state intervention sexual abuse cases. This case underscores systemic challenges in addressing SGBV in South Sudan, particularly involving minors.

Location of Incident: Yambio Town, Yambio County
Description:
•	2-year-old child Allegedly Sexually Assaulted by a 7-year-old minor in Yambio Town, Yambio County

On May 20, 2025, HRD Yambio FO received and documented information from the One Stop Center concerning a usual incident of alleged sexual abuse involving a two-year-old child perpetrated by a seven-year-old minor. This distressing event occurred around 9:00 AM on May 19, 2025, in the Timbiro area of Yambio Town Payam, Yambio County. 

The information revealed that the mother of the victim caught the alleged perpetrator red-handed and, in a moment of anguish, physically confronted him before taking her child and the suspected perpetrator to the One Stop Center for help. 

Following this, the victim received a medical examination at the hospital; however, we currently lack details regarding the assessment's findings. The seven-year-old accused not only faced the repercussions of the physical confrontation with the victim's mother but was also subjected to psychological distress, including hurtful name-calling. 

Recognizing the complexity of this situation, he was promptly referred to a range of supportive services at the One Stop Center, including vital psychosocial support. 

Comment: HRD is committed to championing the needs of both children involved, ensuring that compassionate and age-appropriate support and counseling are provided to address their profound emotional and psychological needs.

Location of Incident: Gimunu Boma, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County
Description:
•	17-year-old girl raped by a civilian man in Gimunu Boma, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County 
On May 27, 2025, HRD Yei Field Office received and documented information from three reliable secondary sources (humanitarian worker, medical officer and police officer – details on file) regarding a 17-year-old girl from the Dinka community raped by a civilian man from the Kakwa tribe in Gimunu Boma, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County on 23 May 2025. 

According to sources, the 17-year-old (details on file) from the Dinka tribe visited the 26-year-old perpetrator’s (names on file) residence on 23 May 2025 and spent the night there. The following morning, 24 May 2025, she was intercepted by her relatives while returning home at 5 am. During interrogation, she was reportedly severely beaten by her family members. The perpetrator, upon learning of the assault on the victim by her relatives, voluntarily reported himself to the Yei Town Police Station, citing fear for his safety. Sources reported that both individuals are at risk of further harm due to inter-communal tensions and possible retaliatory actions. The victim was transported to a medical facility in Yei Town, where she received treatment on 24 May 2025. The victim’s brother subsequently filed a case at the police station on 24 May 2025. The perpetrator is currently in police custody pending further investigation.

Comments: HRD has established, both families have reportedly agreed to a compensation of 3 million South Sudanese Pounds (SSP), to be paid to the victim’s family within two weeks, pending the outcome of investigations. The incident constitutes a serious allegation of rape. Under South Sudanese law since the 17-year-old victim is a minor, she cannot legally give consent. The victim was subjected to severe physical violence by her own relatives following the alleged rape, raising concerns about secondary victimization. The initiation of a compensation agreement prior to the conclusion of police investigations may undermine due process and the rights of the victim to justice. HRD will continue to advocate for trial rather than amicably settling criminal cases by families.

Location of Incident: Rumbek town, Rumbek Centre County
Description:
On 29 May 2025, HRD visited the special protection unit (SPU) at Rumbek central police station, to follow up on a GBV case identified and referred to the SPU during the cell screening on 22 May 2025. The case involved a 26 -year-old woman who fled to police for protection after she was reportedly physically assaulted and issued death threats by her father and elder sister for reportedly getting pregnant for a man they don’t like. 
A follow up with the SPU, revealed that the survivor was referred to the PPA on 27 May; where the PPA subsequently summoned the survivor’s father and uncle and warned them against any attack against the woman and additionally made an assurance of the woman’s safety before handing her back to them.
Another case followed was another GBV case involving a 24-year-old woman who was physically assaulted by her husband and left unconscious before a passerby picked her up on the road (RFO DSR 23 May) . During an interaction with the police who was handling the case and who referred the case to hospital, HRD noted that the survivor was sent to hospital where she was treated and subsequently taken by her uncle to continue with the treatment. The police informed HRD that the lady and her uncle are supposed to report to police station on 30 May for the case to the forwarded to the PPA for intervention. 
HRD advised the police to properly investigate and follow up on the reported cases as some of the survivors sometimes end up being subjected to further harm by the alleged perpetrators. 
Comments: Information gathered from the police indicate that most of the GBV cases are now able to be forwarded to the PPA who would subsequently summon the alleged perpetrators to warn them against any harm on the survivors. HRD will continue to follow up and engage the police on the cases identified.

Location of Incident: Pibor, GPAA
Description:
Two civilian women abducted by suspected Murle armed elements in Waat Payam, Nyirol County of Jonglei State (ref DSR 28-02-2025) – one escaped and is currently awaiting transfer in Pibor, GPAA

On 07 May during the DAP field mission to Waat Payam, Nyirol County, HRD received information from the Payam authorities that an abducted Lou Nuer woman escaped from her abductors in Kyriak village, Wuno Payam, Likuangole County, GPAA and is awaiting transfer to Waat in the ICC, Pibor, GPAA.
According to the authorities, allegedly five Murle armed elements abducted the 26-year-old Lou Nuer woman and her 11-year-old sister (names on file) on 27 February and took the victims to Kyriak village, Wuno Payam, Likuangole County, GPAA (ref DSR 28-02-2025). Reportedly, the abduction happened along the Waat–Motot highway (two kilometers walking distance from Waat town) while the victims were returning to Waat after receiving WFP food ration in Motot Payam, Uror County, Jonglei State.
On 06 May 2025, HRD met the 26-year-old victim at ICC Pibor, GPAA. She reported that she had been abducted together with her sister, who is still believed to be in Kyriak Village. During the time she was abducted, she stated that she was physically assaulted and showed visible scars on her body. She also stated that the injuries were caused by her abductor after she went out to visit her sister within Kyriak village. The victim explained that her abductors intended to marry her off in exchange for cattle, which they planned to share between them. On 03 May at night, she escaped from her abductor, trekked to Likuangole Center, and reported herself to the local authorities, continuing her journey to Pibor and arrived on 05 May. She is currently at ICC Pibor and awaiting transfer to Waat to reunite with her family.

Location of Incident: Tirangore Boma, Hiyala Payam, Torit
Description: 2.	On 9 June, three secondary sources reported that on 6 June, armed Lotuko youths from Mura-Hatiha Boma shot and killed one 28-year-old civilian and injured a 31-year-old male civilian, both from the Lotuko community, in Tirangore Boma, Hiyala Payam, Torit County. According to the sources, un undetermined number of armed Lotuko youths attacked a farmland in Tirangore Boma and opened fire on the victims while they were working on their farm, killing one and injuring another. The attack is reportedly linked to a longstanding land dispute between the Lotuko communities of Mura-Hatiha and Tirangore Bomas, as well as a revenge action for the killing of a 27-year-old male civilian from Mura-Hatiha Boma by armed Lotuko youths from Tirangore Boma on 7 April [ see UNMISS HRD Daily Report 14 April 2025]. The injured victim is reportedly receiving medical treatment at a hospital in Torit. The incident was reported at the Hiyala Police Station and an investigation is reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: Gumuruk
Description: 3.	On 9 June, one secondary source informed that on the same day, one two-year-old boy victim of abduction from the Murle community was recovered by the authorities in Bor Town, Bor South County. Reportedly, the minor was abducted by armed Lou Nuer elements during the attack in Gumuruk County, Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) in March 2025 and transferred to Uror. The minor had come to Bor Town from Uror along with his Lou Nuer abductor and was recovered by the authorities and sent to the Special Protection Unit (SPU) for safe custody. The authorities are reportedly coordination with protection partners for his transfer to Pibor, GPAA for family tracing and reunification.

Location of Incident: Adior town, Adior, Yirol East
Description: 4.	Between 7 – 9 June, multiple sources reported that on 6 June, armed Nuer youths from Panyijar County, Unity State shot and killed one male civilian (a student) during cattle raid in Adior Town, Adior Payam, Yirol East County. According to the sources, the  armed Nuer youths attacked and opened fire on the victim while he was working in his farm, killing him. The attackers also seized three heads of cattle.

Location of Incident: Acuol-Lok village, Awul Payam, Tonj North
Description: 5.	On 9 June, multiple sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Leir and Jurbol youths shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Atok community in Acuol-Lok village, Awul Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the joint armed Dinka Leir and Dinka Jurbol youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Atok community in a cattle camp in Acuol-Lok village, killing one of the residents. The attackers also seized 40 heads of cattle and fled with them to Kirik Payam.

Location of Incident: Tonj Payam, Tonj South
Description: 6.	On 9 June, three primary sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Thony youths shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Muok community during a cattle raid in Tonj Payam, Tonj South County. As recounted by the sources, the armed Dinka Thony youths opened fire on a homestead in the War-Chum suburb of Tonj Town, killing one civilian. The attackers also reportedly seized 30 heads of cattle and attempted to flee towards Manyangok Payam; however, the armed Dinka Muok youths and their allied Dinka Yar youths pursued the attackers and recovered all the cattle.

Location of Incident: Tharwangyiela village, Budang Payam, Rubkona
Description:
2.	On 10 June, two secondary sources reported that on 7 June, NSS personnel shot and killed one male civilian from the Bul Nuer community and ill-treated another male civilian from the Leek Nuer community in Tharwangyiela village, Budang Payam, Rubkona County. According to the sources, NSS personnel based at Kilo 24 and Kilo 30 area in Budang Payam opened fire on the Bul Nuer civilian while he was on his way from Wangkai Payam, Mayom County, killing him. Reportedly, the Leek Nuer civilian was also severely beaten with sticks by the NSS personnel at the same location. The motive for the killing and ill-treatment remain unknown.

Comment: According to the sources, NSS personnel have been harassing civilians for the past one week around the area of Unity Oil Field and civilians are allegedly living in fear. HRD will follow up to gather roe information on the incidents.

Location of Incident: Alilang Payam, Alieny County, RAA
Description: 3.	On 9 June, two secondary sources reported that on 6 June, unidentified armed elements shot and injured one 25-year-old male civilian from the Dinka Panaruu community during an attempted cattle raid in Alilang Payam, Alieny County, RAA. According to the sources, four armed elements infiltrated Alilang Payam with the intention of raiding cattle; however, they were detected by the cattle owners, and opened fire on the victim when he attempted get closer to them, injuring him. The armed elements thereafter fled the scene without raiding any cattle. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Pariang for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Ayiet-Maper village, Aweng Payam, Twic
Description: 4.	On 10 June, multiple sources reported that on the same day, armed Nuer youths from Mayom County, Unity State shot and injured two male civilians from the Dinka Twic Mayardit community during a cattle raid in Ayiet-Maper village, Aweng Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, the armed Nuer youths attacked and opened fire on the Twic Mayardit community in a cattle camp in Ayiet-Maper village, injuring two civilians. The attackers also seized 30 heads of cattle and fled back into Unity State. The injured victims are reportedly receiving treatment at a hospital in Turalei Town.

Location of Incident: Tit-Thony village,  Manyangok Payam, Tonj South
Description: 5.	On 10 June, three primary sources reported that on 9 June, armed Dinka Apuk-Jurwir youths shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Luac-Koth community in Tit-Thony village,  Manyangok Payam, Tonj South County. As recounted by the sources, the armed Dinka Apuk-Jurwir youths attacked the Dinka Thony community in Tit-Thony village and opened fire on a homestead, killing one civilian, who was reportedly visiting his relatives in Manyangok Payam. The attackers also seized 40 heads of cattle and fled away with them to Thiet Payam. The attack is reportedly linked to the ongoing revenge violence between the Dinka Thony and the allied Dinka Yar, Muok and Apuk-Jurwir in Tonj South County. The victim was reportedly   an unintended target.

Location of Incident: Napak Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi
Description: 2.	On 11 June, three secondary sources reported that on 6 June, suspected armed Toposa youths killed one 10-year-old-boy from the Buya community in Napak Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, armed Toposa youths attacked the victim while he was watering cattle at a stream on the outskirts of Napak Boma and slit his throat, killing him. The attackers also raided approximately 30 heads of cattle. The incident was reported at Loriyok Police Station and investigation is reportedly underway.

Location of Incident: New Fangak Town, Fangak
Description: 3.	On 11 June, multiple sources reported that on the same day, one male civilian was injured during fighting between the SPLA-IO and allied White Army and the SSPDF and in New Fangak Town, Fangak County. According to the sources, in the early morning of 11 June, the SPLA-IO and the allied White Army attacked SSPDF positions and took control of most N Fangak Town, except for the area surrounding the compound of the County Commissioner, where Lou Nuer militia allied to the SSPDF remained and carried on ground fighting. In response, the SSPDF barge stationed near the town withdrew, reportedly due to concerns over potential artillery strikes and continued to shell the town from their positions along the River Nile. Reportedly, one civilian was injured in crossfire. A large part of New Fangak Town reportedly remained under the control of SPLA-IO and their allied forces.

Location of Incident: Pokic village, Meen Payam, Rumbek North
Description: 4.	On 11 June, two secondary sources reported that on the same day, Nuer armed elements from Panyijar County, Unity State shot and killed one male civilian (cattle herder) from the Dinka Agaar community during a cattle raid in Pokic village, Meen Payam, Rumbek North County. According to the sources, the Nuer armed elements had attacked Malek Town in Malek Payam, Rumbek Center County and raided an unspecified large number of cattle, and the cattle owners joined by the South Sudan National Police Service (SSNPS) and the SSPDF patrolling in the area pursued the attackers to recover the raided cattle, and in the ensuing confrontation in Pokic village, one civilian was shot and killed. One SSNPS personnel was also reportedly shot and killed during the fighting. The attackers reportedly fled away with all the raided cattle.

Location of Incident: Ayiet-Maper village, Aweng Payam, Twic
Description: 5.	On 10 June, multiple sources reported that on the same day, Nuer armed elements from Mayom County, Unity State shot and injured two male civilians from the Dinka Twic Mayardit community during a cattle raid in Ayiet-Maper village, Aweng Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, the Nuer armed elements attacked and opened fire on a cattle camp in Ayiet-Maper village, injuring two civilians. The attackers also seized 30 heads of cattle and fled with them across the swampy area into Unity State. The injured victims were evacuated to a hospital in Turalei Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Ayiet-Maper village, Aweng Payam, Twic
Description: 5. Location of Incident: Keet village, Ngapagok Payam, Tonj East
Description: 6.	On 11 June, three primary sources reported that on 10 June, armed Dinka Gok elements from Cueibet County, Lakes State shot and injured one male civilian from the Dinka Akook community during a cattle raid in Keet village, Ngapagok Payam, Tonj East County. As recounted by the sources,  the armed Dinka Gok elements attacked and opened fire on a cattle camp in Keet village, injuring one civilian. The attackers also seized 40 heads of cattle and fled with them into Lakes State. The injured victim was evacuated to an health care facility in Ngapagok for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Mankalo Village, Loka West, near Kenyi Payam, Lainya
Description:
2.	On 12 June, three secondary sources reported that on 11 June, suspected SPLA-IO elements abducted two male civilians in Mankalo Village, Loka West, near Kenyi Payam, Lainya County. According to the sources, a group of SPLA-IO elements who were moving to Yaribe through Kupera in Lainya county intercepted the victims while travelling on two separate motorcycles and abducted them. The abandoned motorcycles were later picked by the SSPDF who had responded to the scene in attempts to recover the abductees. Reportedly, the victims were released on the same day in Yaribe, in Panyume Payam, Morobo County after the perpetrators entered their camp. The SPLA-IO elements reportedly informed civilians in Panyume  that the area is under SPLA-IO control and that civilians should vacate the area since there was a likelihood of fighting in the area.

Comment. The abduction and warnings by the SPLA-IO elements have reportedly heightened anxiety, fear, and distress among the civilians in Yaribe, who are reportedly leaving the area, with the majority being displaced to Kuapera Payam, Lainya County.

Location of Incident: Banaye and Lobira Bomas in Chahari Payam, Ikotos
Description:
3.	On 12 June, three secondary sources reported that on 29 and 30 May, three male civilians from the Lotuko community were injured during intracommunal revenge violence in Banaye and Lobira Bomas in Chahari Payam, Ikotos County. According to the sources, on 29 May, an undetermined number of armed Lotuko youths from Banaye Boma stormed a cultural dance event in Lobira Boma and a dispute reportedly broke out during a song competition, escalating into violence, which resulted in the injury of one 32-year-old civilian from Lobira Boma. In retaliation, on 30 May, armed youths from Lobira Boma opened fire at a dance event in Banaye Boma, injuring two civilians (ages 20 and 24 years old). The injured victim from Lobira Boma was evacuated to a health care facility in Chahari Payam, while the other two injured victims from Banaye Boma were  evacuated to a hospital in Torit for medical treatment.

Comment: According to the sources, tensions between the two communities remain high, with the likelihood of more retaliatory violence.

Location of Incident: Banaye and Lobira Bomas in Chahari Payam, Ikotos
Description:
3.	On 12 June, three secondary sources reported that on 29 and 30 May, three male civilians from the Lotuko community were injured during intracommunal revenge violence in Banaye and Lobira Bomas in Chahari Payam, Ikotos County. According to the sources, on 29 May, an undetermined number of armed Lotuko youths from Banaye Boma stormed a cultural dance event in Lobira Boma and a dispute reportedly broke out during a song competition, escalating into violence, which resulted in the injury of one 32-year-old civilian from Lobira Boma. Comment: According to the sources, tensions between the two communities remain high, with the likelihood of more retaliatory violence.

Location of Incident: Panlou village, RAA
Description:
4.	On 12 June, multiple sources reported that on the same day, one civilian was killed and four others were injured during a cattle raid attack by suspected armed Bul Nuer youths from Unity State in Panlou village, RAA. According to the sources, a large number of suspected armed Bul Nuer youths stormed Panlou village and attacked a cattle camp, raiding approximately 500 heads of cattle. Reportedly, the SSPDF deployed in Pariang and other security forces including the South Sudan National Police Service (SSNPS), National Prison Service of South Sudan (NPSSS), and the Fire Brigade repulsed the attackers and in the ensuing confrontation five civilians from the Dinka Panaruu community were injured and two fire brigade personnel were killed. Seven of the attackers were also killed during the fighting. One of the injured civilians reportedly succumbed to the injuries. The sources further informed that about 300 heads of cattle were recovered during the fighting. The other four injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Pariang for medical treatment.

Comment: Following the attack, the Acting Minister of Information, Culture, Youth and Sports of RAA issued a press statement condemning the attack and called on the government of Unity State to hold the perpetrators accountable.

Location of Incident: Akop Payam, Tonj North
Description:
5.	On 12 June, three primary sources reported that on 11 June, two male civilians from the Dinka Apuk-Patoc community were injured during aerial bombardments by the SSPDF in Akop Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the SSPDF was responding to a cattle raid attack by armed Dinka Lou-Paher youths of Marial-Lou Payam on the Dinka Apuk-Patoc community in Ameth Village, Akop Payam.

Comment: Reportedly, the SSPDF was alerted by concerned community members of the ongoing cattle raid. HRD will follow up to gather more information about the incident to ascertain the number of civilian casualties.

Location of Incident: Machar-Abiel village, Turalei Payam, Twic
Description: 6.	On 12 June, three primary sources reported that on the same day, Nuer armed elements from Mayom County, Unity State shot and injured one male civilian from the Dinka Twic Mayardit community during a cattle raid in Machar-Abiel village, Turalei Payam, Twic County. As recounted by the sources, the Nuer armed elements attacked and opened fire on Machar-Abiel village, injuring one civilian. The attackers also seized 50 heads of cattle and fled with them into Unity State. The injured victim was evacuated to a hospital in Turalei Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Machar-Abiel village, Turalei Payam, Twic
Description: 6. Location of Incident: Kuzee residential area, Yambio Town, Yambio
Description: 7.	On 12 June, one primary source reported that on 11 June, unidentified armed elements shot and injured one male civilian in the Kuzee residential area, Yambio Town, Yambio County. As recounted by the source, a group of five unidentified armed elements ambushed and held the victim at gunpoint before opening fire on him, injuring him. The motive for the attack remains unknown. Following the attack, members of the community police intervened, and evacuated the victim to a hospital in Yambio for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Degalla village, Kansuk Boma, Rejaf Payam, Juba
Description: 3.	On 13 June, two secondary sources reported that on 12 June, Mundari armed elements shot and killed one elderly male civilian from the Bari community in Degalla village, Kansuk Boma, Rejaf Payam, Juba County. According to the sources, three Mundari armed elements opened fire on the victim when they attempted to raid his goats, killing him. The incident was reported at Gorom Police Station and investigations are reportedly underway.

Location of Incident: Murahatika Boma, Hiyala Payam, Torit
Description: 4.	On 13 June, three secondary sources reported that on 12 June, armed Lotuko youths from Tirangore Boma shot and killed one 30-year-old male civilian from the Lotuko community in  in Murahatika Boma, Hiyala Payam, Torit County. According to the sources, armed Lotuko youths from Murahatika attacked and opened fire on a group of farmers from Tirangore Boma who were cultivating on a disputed piece of land on the outskirts of Tirangore Boma, and set fire to their temporary shelters. In retaliatory, armed Lotuko youths from Tirangore Boma attacked and opened fire indiscriminately on residents of Murahatika Boma, injuring one civilian who subsequently succumbed to the injuries. The incident is reportedly linked to ongoing revenge violence between the two communities over unresolved land disputes [see HRD Daily Report 10 June 2025].

Location of Incident: Tirangore Boma, Hiyala Payam, Torit
Description:
5.	On 13 June, three secondary sources reported that on 15 April, armed Lotuko youths from Murahatika Boma shot and killed one 47-year-old female civilian from the Lotuko community in Tirangore Boma, Hiyala Payam, Torit County. According to the sources, armed Lotuko youths opened fire on the victim while she was collecting firewood at a farmland on the outskirts of Tirangore Boma, killing her. The incident was reported at Hiyala Police Station and investigation is reportedly ongoing. 

Comment: The land dispute in Hilaya Payam has become a trigger for repeated, deadly attacks, despite local government efforts to de-escalate tensions through temporary land use bans. Both communities are actively mobilizing youth for armed action, suggesting a deepening entrenchment of collective grievances and diminishing prospects for community-led reconciliation. Civilians, particularly those engaging in routine livelihood activities such as farming or collecting firewood, are increasingly at risk, making the dispute not only a territorial conflict but also a threat to survival and daily life. The absence of arrests or visible progress in police investigations, despite multiple incidents, may be contributing to the perception of impunity and encouraging further violence. Without timely and credible interventions, both in terms of conflict resolution and justice enforcement, the situation risks spiraling into a sustained pattern of revenge killings that could destabilize the broader Hiyala area.

Location of Incident: Paliadhiam area, Duk
Description: 6.	On 14 June, multiple sources reported that that on 13 June, Murle armed elements shot and injured one male civilian (a humanitarian worker) in the Paliadhiam area, Duk County. According to the sources, Murle armed elements ambushed and opened fire on two humanitarian vehicles along the Poktap-Duk Padiet road enroute from Poktap to Duk Padiet, injuring one humanitarian worker, while the other escaped unharmed.  The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Padiet, and subsequently transferred to Juba for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Gumuruk and Nyirol
Description: 7.	On 13 June, one secondary source reported that on 27 May, three children (one 17-year-old girl, and two 15-year-old boys) escaped from their abductors in Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) and arrived in Akobo, Akobo County. On 11 June, the minors were transferred to Bor with the support of a humanitarian organization for family tracing and reunification. The children were reportedly abducted two years ago from their villages by Murle armed elements and were taken to Gumuruk County. Reportedly, the girl is from Uror and one boy is from Nyirol, while the origin of the other boy was yet to be ascertained.

Location of Incident: Adior Payam, Yirol East
Description: 8.	On 13 June, two secondary sources reported that on 5 June, Nuer armed elements from Panyijar County, Unity State killed one male civilian from the Dinka Ciek community in Adior Payam, Yirol East County. According to the sources, the Nuer armed elements abducted the victim and his spouse while they were working in their farm, took them about one kilometre away from their farm location, where they slaughtered the man and thereafter instructed the woman to return to Adior Town. Reportedly, the Nuer armed elements were returning from a cattle raid near Adior Payam.

Location of Incident: Pariang Town, RAA
Description: 9.	On 13 June, two secondary sources reported that on 12 June, Dinka Panaruu armed elements killed two male civilians (traders) from the Bul Nuer community in Pariang Town, RAA. According to the sources, assailants attacked the victims while they wen to the market in Pariang Town and beat them to death with sticks. The attack was reportedly a revenge action linked to the incident on 12 June in which one civilian was killed and four others were injured, all from the Dinka Panaruu community, during confrontation between Bul Nuer armed elements and government security forces following a cattle raid by the Bul Nur armed elements [see HRD Daily Report 13 June 2025].

Location of Incident: Makuac Payam, Tonj East
Description: 10.	On 14 June, one primary source and two secondary sources reported that on 13 June, armed Dinka Jaluau youths shot and killed two male civilians from the Dinka Luanyjang community during a cattle raid in Makuac Payam, Tonj east County. As recounted by the sources, the armed Dinka Jaluau youths attacked the three village of Paireu, Panhom and Thiik in Makuac Payam, and opened fire on the victims while they were grazing their cattle, killing them. The attackers also seized 150 heads of cattle and fled with them to Wunlit payam. reportedly, the attack is a revenge action linked to ongoing retaliatory violence between these two communities.

Location of Incident: Makuac Payam, Tonj East
Description: 10.	On 14 June, one primary source and two secondary sources reported that on 13 June, armed Dinka Jaluau youths shot and killed two male civilians from the Dinka Luanyjang community during a cattle raid in Makuac Payam, Tonj east County. As recounted by the sources, the armed Dinka Jaluau youths attacked the three village of Paireu, Panhom and Thiik in Makuac Payam, and opened fire on the victims while they were grazing their cattle, killing them. The attackers also seized 150 heads of cattle and fled with them to Wunlit payam. reportedly, the attack is a revenge action linked to ongoing retaliatory violence between these two communities.

Location of Incident: Bori Boma, Kangapo II Payam, Kajo Keji
Description: 1.	On 16 June, one secondary source reported that on 14 June, unidentified armed elements shot and killed two civilians and injured another, all from the Kuku community, in Bori Boma, Kangapo II Payam, Kajo Keji County. According to the source, a group of unidentified armed elements indiscriminately opened fire randomly on civilians at the Nyangi Muda marketplace in Bori Boma, killing two civilians and injuring another. The attackers also looted properties from the market. Reportedly, the county authorities deployed a joint operation force to secure the area to protect the residents and their property. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Wudu for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Bori Boma, Kangapo II Payam, Kajo Keji
Description: 1. Location of Incident: Wotogo village, Otogo Payam, Yei River
Description:
Gaag rape of a 38-year-old female by two suspected elements of the SSPDF in Otogo Payam, Yei River County

On June 16, 2025, HRD Yei Field Office received and documented information from two reliable secondary sources (police officer and a health service provider – details on file) regarding the rape of a 38-year-old female by two suspected elements of the South Sudan People’s Defense Forces (SSPDF) in Wotogo village, Otogo Payam, Yei River County.

Sources revealed that a 38-year-old civilian female (details on file) from the Kakwa tribe was on her way to a funeral at about 10:00PM on 06 June 2025, when she was accosted by two unidentified soldiers in uniform, suspected to belong to the SSPDF. They pulled her into the nearby bush, raping her and fled the scene immediately after the act. The survivors believed that the perpetrators belonged to SSPDF since they dressed in SSPDF uniform and the area of incident is closer to the area occupied by the government forces. The following morning, she reported the case to the area chief and on 08 June, the case was reported to the Yei Police Headquarters. The survivor was also referred to a medical facility for medical. Medical sources reported that examination revealed penetration which resonated with allegations of rape.

Comments: HRD-YFO conducted a follow-up visit on the case at the Gender Desk of the Yei Police Headquarters where it was reported that no investigations have been carried out since the survivor was unable to identify the two perpetrators.  However, HRD notes that there is always reluctance for police to follow and investigate cases that involve military personnel.  The fact this committed by suspected men in Uniform and in an area with active armed conflict, qualifies to classified as CRSV.   HRD will continue following up on the case to ensure proper accountability and administration of justice.

Location of Incident: Morugoro Boma, Lopeat Payam, Kapoeta East
Description: 3.	On 16 June, three secondary sources reported that on 10 June, Murle armed elements from Moruo Payam, Vertet County, Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) shot and killed one 30-year-old male civilian from the Jie community during an attempted cattle raid in Morugoro Boma, Lopeat Payam, Kapoeta East County. According to the sources, a group of Murle armed elements stormed a grazing field in Morugoro Boma and opened fire on the victim in his farm near the grazing field, killing him. The Murl armed elements thereafter fled the scene when the Jie youths after hearing the gunshot responded to the scene. The incident was reported at Narus Police Station where investigation is said reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: Gadiang, Payuel Payam, Duk
Description: 4.	On 16 June, multiple sources reported that on 14 June, Murle armed elements shot and killed one 53-year-old male civilian (cattle keeper) and injured two others (ages 42 and 51 years old) during a cattle raid in Gadiang, Payuel Payam, Duk County. The attackers also seized over 200 heads of cattle as well as an unspecified number of goats and fled towards Manyabol, GPAA. The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Gadiang for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Gadiang, Payuel Payam, Duk
Description: 4. Location of Incident: Greater Akobo
Description: 5.	On 16 June, multiple sources reported that on 15 June, two women from the Lou Nuer community with their two children were recovered in Akobo Town, Akobo County. According to the sources, the survivors were abducted separately from within Greater Akobo by Murle armed elements and taken to Likuangole County in GPAA, and subjected to sexual slavery and rape. from an undetermined location in Likuangole County of GPAA, and arrived in Akobo town.  The sources further informed that  the women escaped with their children born out of rape (one boy and one girl aged two years old) and arrived in Akobo Town having walked for five days. The local authorities are providing medical and psychosocial support to the survivors as well as initiated the family tracing and reunification process.

Location of Incident: Tit-guong village, Mayom-Lok Boma, Adior Payam, Yirol East
Description:
6.	On 16 June, one secondary source reported that on 15 June, Nuer armed elements from Panyijar County, Unity State shot and killed one male civilian and one female civilian during a cattle raid in Tit-guong village, Mayom-Lok Boma, Adior Payam, Yirol East County. According to the source, the Nuer armed elements attacked and opened fire on the victims at their homestead in Tit-guong village, killing them. The attackers also raided an unspecified number of cattle.

Comment: Observably, there has been increase in cattle-related attacks by Nuer armed elements on the Dibka communities along the Lakes State – Unity State border, posing protection risks  the local population.

Location of Incident: Akok village, Alabek Payam, Tonj North
Description: 7.	On 16 June, multiple sources reported that on 15 June, Nuer armed elements from Mayom County, Unity State shot and killed 11 male civilians and injured 17 others, all from the Dinka Lou Ariik community, during a cattle raid in Akok village, Alabek Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the Nuer armed elements attacked and opened fire on a group of Dinka Lou Ariik cattle herders in Akok Village, killing 11 and injuring 17.  The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Alabek for medical treatment.

Description: 7. Location of Incident: But-diir village, Akop Payam, Tonj North
Description: 8.	On 16 June, multiple sources reported that on 15 June, Dinka Lou Paher armed youths from Marial-Lou Payam shot and killed four male civilians from the Apuk Patoc community in in But-diir village, Akop Payam, Tonj North County. The attack was reportedly a revenge action for past unresolved grievances between these two communities. tensions is reportedly mounting in the area amidst ports of mobilisation by the  Dinka Apuk Padoc armed youths for a retaliation attack.

Location of Incident: Tambura Town, Tambura
Description:
9.	On 16 June, multiple sources reported that on 14 June, one SSPDF officer abducted and attempted forced marriage of a 15-year-old girl from the Baka Community in Tambura Town, Tambura County. According to the sources, the SSPDF officer deployed three of his bodyguards in a military Land Cruiser pickup to forcibly take the victim from her family home in Tambura Town and took her to the SSPDF barracks. Reportedly, attempts by the victim’s father to have her released were futile. The SSPDF officer reportedly refused to free her on grounds that he intended to marry her.

Comment: HRD together with UNMISS CPU will engage and advocate with the relevant military authorities to ensure the protection of the victim’s rights, her safe return, and accountability for the perpetrator.

Location of Incident: Longamere, Mugwo Payam, Yei River
Description: 2.	On 17 June, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one 70-year-old male civilian in Longamere, Mugwo Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, an undetermined number of armed elements extracted the victim from his home, ill-treated him and other family members, and thereafter after took him away from his homestead claiming that they were taking him to the payam headquarters; however, after short distance, they shot and killed him. Reportedly, an unspecified amount of money was also looted from the victim’s home.

Location of Incident: Longamere, Mugwo Payam, Yei River
Description: 2.	On 17 June, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one 70-year-old male civilian in Longamere, Mugwo Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, an undetermined number of armed elements extracted the victim from his home, ill-treated him and other family members, and thereafter after took him away from his homestead claiming that they were taking him to the payam headquarters; however, after short distance, they shot and killed him. Reportedly, an unspecified amount of money was also looted from the victim’s home.

Location of Incident: Lowayapuru Boma, Chumakori Payam, Kapoeta North
Description: 3.	On 17 June, three secondary sources reported that on 14 June, armed Buya youths from Napak Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County shot and killed one 21-year-old male civilian from the Toposa community during an attempted cattle raid in Lowayapuru Boma, Chumakori Payam, Kapoeta North County. According to the sources, the armed Buya youths stormed Lowayapuru Boma and opened fire on the victim while he was watering his cattle at the water point, killing him. The attackers also attempted to raid the 48 head of cattle; however, they were repulsed by the local Toposa armed youths who were at the vicinity, and the armed Buya youths escaped without raiding any of the cattle.

Location of Incident: Nyirol
Description: 4.	On 17 June, multiple sources reported that on 16 June, one 15-year-old boy, who was abducted by Murl armed elements from Nyirol County in December 2024 and transferred to Likuangole County in the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA), escaped from his abductor and arrived in Nyandit Payam, Akobo County after walking for at least five days. The local authorities have provided him with protection and are coordinating with humanitarian partners for family tracing and reunification.

Location of Incident: Amongpiny Town, Amongpiny Payam, Rumbek Centre
Description: 5.	On 17 June, two secondary sources reported that on the same day, Nuer armed elements from Panyijar County, Unity State shot and killed two civilians and injured another from the Dinka Agaar community during a cattle raid in Amongpiny Town, Amongpiny Payam, Rumbek Centre County. According to the sources, the Nuer armed elements armed youths attacked and opened fire on a cattle camp in Amongpiny Town, injuring one civilian. The attackers also reportedly seized over 100 head of cattle. Two SSPDF soldiers were also reportedly injured during the attack. The sources further informed that the Dinka Agaar cattle keepers subsequently pursued the attackers to retrieve their cattle, and in the ensuing clash, two Dinka Agaar civilians were shot and killed by the Nuer armed elements.

Location of Incident: Amongpiny Town, Amongpiny Payam, Rumbek Centre
Description: 5.	On 17 June, two secondary sources reported that on the same day, Nuer armed elements from Panyijar County, Unity State shot and killed two civilians and injured another from the Dinka Agaar community during a cattle raid in Amongpiny Town, Amongpiny Payam, Rumbek Centre County. According to the sources, the Nuer armed elements armed youths attacked and opened fire on a cattle camp in Amongpiny Town, injuring one civilian. The attackers also reportedly seized over 100 head of cattle. Two SSPDF soldiers were also reportedly injured during the attack. The sources further informed that the Dinka Agaar cattle keepers subsequently pursued the attackers to retrieve their cattle, and in the ensuing clash, two Dinka Agaar civilians were shot and killed by the Nuer armed elements.

Location of Incident: Wau Town, Wau
Description:
7.	On 16 June, a primary source reported that on 13 June, the NSS arbitrarily detained one male civilian (Chairperson of the Western Bahr el Ghazal State Civil Society Organizations (CSOs)) in Wau Town. Reportedly, on 12 June, the victim was summoned after an interview with a local media outlet, later posted on social media, in which he denounced the government's shoot-to-kill order, a decision made by the state security committee to tackle gang-related criminal activities—drawing attention to its severe human rights implications and the risk it posed to innocent civilians. He further called on the authorities to reconsider the directive while advocating for a comprehensive response that prioritizes a community-based approach with tailored rehabilitation programmes. On 13 June, after responding to a second summon, the victim was detained on accusations of having empowered the gang youths through his public statement, an action viewed by the NSS as contributing to an increase in crime rates in Wau Town. The victim was released on 14 June following sustained engagement by the UNMISS Head of Field Office and Human Rights Division.

Comment: The detention of the Chairperson of the CSOs’ network without any legal basis constitutes a violation of his human rights, particularly his right to freedom of expression. His criticism of the “shoot to kill” directive falls within his role as a human rights defender and civil society leader, exercising his watchdog function to ensure that government policies and interventions uphold fundamental human rights. The NSS’s action amounts to arbitrary arrest and detention, further undermining civic space and silencing dissenting opinions.

Location of Incident: Ifute Boma, Imotong Payam, Ikotos
Description: 2.	On 18 June, three secondary sources reported that on 4 and 6 June, two male civilians from the Imotong community were shot and killed during violence between armed youths from Lomou and Lomogoro villages in Ifute Boma, Imotong Payam, Ikotos County. According to the sources, a group of armed Imotong youths from Lomogoro village stormed Lomou village and opened fire on a 32-year-old male civilian (a youth leader), killing him, for allegedly supporting a 16-year-old boy from Lomou village who was accused of raping one 14-year-old girl from Lomogoro village on 4 June 2025 in Ifute Boma. In retaliation, on 6 June, armed youths from Lomou village attacked Lomogoro village and shot and killed 27-year-old male civilian. The County authorities deployed law enforcement agents to the locations, and subsequently, the Ikotos County Commissioner visited the scene and spoke to both communities and was able to calm down the tension.

Location of Incident: Ifute Boma, Imotong Payam, Ikotos
Description: 2.	On 18 June, three secondary sources reported that on 4 and 6 June, two male civilians from the Imotong community were shot and killed during violence between armed youths from Lomou and Lomogoro villages in Ifute Boma, Imotong Payam, Ikotos County. According to the sources, a group of armed Imotong youths from Lomogoro village stormed Lomou village and opened fire on a 32-year-old male civilian (a youth leader), killing him, for allegedly supporting a 16-year-old boy from Lomou village who was accused of raping one 14-year-old girl from Lomogoro village on 4 June 2025 in Ifute Boma. The County authorities deployed law enforcement agents to the locations, and subsequently, the Ikotos County Commissioner visited the scene and spoke to both communities and was able to calm down the tension.

Location of Incident: Athieng-Puol village, Akop Payam, Tonj North
Description: 4.	On 18 June, three secondary sources reported that on 17 June, Nuer armed elements from Mayom County, Unity State shot and killed four male civilians and injured three others from the Dinka Apuk Padoc community during an attempted cattle raid in Athieng-Puol village, Akop Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the Nuer armed elements opened fire on a group of Dinka Apuk Padoc cattle herders killing four and injuring three. community with the aim of stealing cattle that resulted in civilian casualties. The armed Dinka Apuk Padoc youths reportedly repulsed the attackers who retreated without raiding any cattle. The injured victims were reportedly evacuated to a hath care facility in Akop for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Athieng-Puol village, Akop Payam, Tonj North
Description: 4. Location of Incident: Mayen Abun Village, Wunrok Payam, Twic
Description: 5.	On 17 June, multiple sources reported that on 15 June, the SSPDF extrajudicially executed one SSNPS personnel in Mayen Abun Village, Wunrok Payam, Twic County, for killing two male civilians from the Dinka Twic Mayardit community. As recounted by the sources, the two Dinka Twic Mayardit men had a financial dispute which led to a fist fight, and the police was called to intervene. However, when the two men refused to be taken to the police station for their issue to be addressed, one of the police officers opened fire, killing them. The police officer was subsequently arrested by his colleagues and detained at Mayen Abun Police Station. Reportedly, upon being informed about the incident, the County Commissioner  ordered for the execution of the police officer, and the SSPDF extracted him from Mayen Abun Police Station, transferred him to the outskirts of Mayen Abun where he was executed by firing squad. The body was handed over to his relatives for interment.

Location of Incident: along the road between Lui and Laney Payams, Mundri East County
Description: 6.	On 18 June, multiple sources reported that on 17 June, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one male civilian  from the Baka community when thy ambushed and opened fire on a truck along the road between Lui and Laney Payams, Mundri East County. The driver of the vehicle reportedly escaped unharmed. The motive for the attack remains unknown, as the assailants did not loot anything from the vehicle. The incident was reported at the Lui police station, and investigations are reportedly underway.

Location of Incident: Yei Town Payam, Yei River
Description: 2.	On 19 June, three secondary sources reported that on 14 June, an unidentified armed element shot and injured one 18-year-old male civilian (a Congolese refugee) in Yei Town Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, the assailant attacked and opened fire on the victim at his homestead in Kanjero area, injuring him. The reason for attack remained unclear; however, the attacker reportedly stole one rabbit and fled. The victim was evacuated to a health care facility in the area for medical treatment; however, on 16 June, he was transferred to Juba for advanced medical care. The incident was reported to the police and investigation is ongoing.

Location of Incident: Camp 15, Loriyok Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi
Description: 3.	On 19 June, three secondary sources reported that on 5 June, armed Buya youths shot and killed one 30-year-old male civilian from the Toposa community in Camp 15, Loriyok Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, armed Toposa youths from Katiko Payam, Kapoeta South County had earlier in the day raided unspecified number of cattle from  Loriyok Boma and the armed Buya youths while pursuing them encountered and opened fire on the victim, killing him. The incident was reported at the Loriyok Police Station, and investigation is said to be ongoing; however, no suspects have been apprehended.

Location of Incident: Camp 15, Loriyok Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi
Description: 3. Location of Incident: Ageer Payam, Duk
Description: 4.	On 19 June, multiple sources reported that on 17 June, Murle armed elements shot and injured one 25-year-old female civilian from the Lou Nuer community in Ageer Payam, Duk County. According to the sources, the Murle armed elements ambushed and opened fire on a vehicle with a group of Lou Nuer civilians (traders) aboard between Duk Padiet and Payuel enroute from Juba to Yuai in Uror County, injuring one of the passengers. The injured victim is reportedly receiving treatment in Yuai.

Location of Incident: Adior Payam, Yirol East
Description: 5.	Between 17 – 19 June, multiple sources reported that on 17 June, Nuer armed elements from Panyijar County, Unity State shot and killed five male civilians and injured four others from the Dinka Ciec community during a cattle raid in Adior Payam, Yirol East County. According to the sources, the Nuer armed element attacked and opened fire on a cattle camp in Adior Payam, killing five civilians and injuring four others. The attackers also shot and killed two soldiers of the South Sudan People’s Defence Forces (SSPDF) who was escorting a group of Dinka Ciec cattle keepers. The Nuer armed elements reportedly raided over 1000 cattle from Pacon and Alooth cattle camps.

Location of Incident: Rubkona Town, Rubkona
Description: 6.	On 19 June, one secondary source reported that on 17 June, two SSNPS personnel arrested, detained and illtreated one 20-year-old male civilian in Rubkona Town, Rubkona County. According to the source, the SSNPS arrested and detained the victim on allegations of theft of items in the Rubkona market, after which the suspects proceeded to ill-treat the victim by pouring hot water over his body, resulting in severe injuries to his head before releasing the victim. Reportedly, on 18 June, the SSNPS personnel involved were arrested and detained for investigation, while the victim was taken to a health care facility in Rubkona Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Makuei-Karthiith village, Tonj Payam, Tonj South
Description: 7.	On 19 June, three secondary sources reported that on 18 June, armed Dinka Thony youths from Manyangok Payam, Tonj South County shot and killed one male civilian and injured another from the Dinka Jurbol community in Makuei-Karthiith village, Tonj Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Thony youths ambushed and opened fire on a commercial vehicle carrying food commodities enroute from Juba to Wau in Western Bahr el Ghazal State, killing one of the passengers and injuring another, and thereafter fled the scene. The injured victim was evacuated to a hospital in Tonj Town for medical treatment. The incident was reported at Tonj Town Police Station for investigation.

Location of Incident: Makuei-Karthiith village, Tonj Payam, Tonj South
Description: 7.	On 19 June, three secondary sources reported that on 18 June, armed Dinka Thony youths from Manyangok Payam, Tonj South County shot and killed one male civilian and injured another from the Dinka Jurbol community in Makuei-Karthiith village, Tonj Payam, Tonj South County.
