The injured victim was evacuated to a hospital in Tonj Town for medical treatment. The incident was reported at Tonj Town Police Station for investigation.

Location of Incident: Keijko Village, Otogo Payam, Yei River
Description:
•	Two young civilian men were arbitrarily arrested and detained by the South Sudan People Defense Forces (SSPDF) soldiers in Yei Town, Yei River County

On 20 June 2025 HRD-YFO received and documented information from two reliable secondary sources, including, a community member and a humanitarian worker (details on file), about the arbitrary arrest and detention of two young men (details on file – ages not provided) reportedly by South Sudan People Defense Force (SSPDF) soldiers in Keijko Village, Otogo Payam, Yei River County on 15 June 2025

Sources informed HRD-YFO, on 15 June 2025, National Salvation Front (NAS) elements came to Kejiko areas and conducted heavy random shooting as they crossed the area towards Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC). Consequently, SSPDF soldiers in the area were alerted and deployed to respond to NAS elements. During their operations, SSPDF arrested two you men they found in the area and detained them at the SSPDF barracks in the same area accusing them of supporting NAS. Sources reported the young men have not been allowed to be visited by their family members or relatives. They further added that it was not clear if the men have been transferred to main barracks in Yei.

The circumstances surrounding men’s arrest and detention raise serious human rights concerns. The deployment and behavior of SSPDF soldiers in response to NAS activities in the area have been of great concern to civilians. Civilians found themselves in precarious situations since they are either arrested by government forces accusing them of supporting NAS or NAS elements target them, claiming that civilians who remain in government-controlled areas support SSPDF.

Comments: The situation reflects broader challenges related to human rights in conflict areas. It underscores the importance of ensuring that security operations respect fundamental rights, particularly those of vulnerable populations and that responses to security threats do not result in further human rights violations and abuses.

Location of Incident: Hiriafit Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos
Description:
On 20 June 2025, HRD spoke with three reliable secondary sources on the reported killing of a 25-year-old Logir male civilian and the wounding of a 27-year-old Dongotono male civilian in an inter-communal revenged related attacks in Hiriafit Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos County and the sources confirmed that the incidents indeed happened on 7 June 2025 as earlier reported.   
According to the respondents, at approximately 14:00 hours on 7 June 2025, an undetermined number of armed Dongotono youths  from Chahari  Boma, Chahari  Payam, Ikotos County, attacked and shot dead a 25 year-old Logir male civilian. The sources intimated that the motive for the killing was to avenge the death of a 23-year-old Dongotono unarmed male civilian who was shot dead in an inter-communal revenge related incident by armed Logir youths in Ihode Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos County on 11 March 2024, (see 2024-03-13 UNMISS HRD FOT Daily Report). 
The sources further informed that consequent upon the above killing at 14:00 hours on 7 June 2025, at about 15:00 hours on 7 June 2025, armed Logir youths in Hiriafit Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos County quickly mobilized and attacked a 27-year-old Dongotono male civilian in his house in Hiriafit Boma, shot and injured him. The sources noted that the tension was very high as both communities were mobilizing to attack each other. However, the police have been deployed to deter further violence in the area.
The incident was reported to the Chahari Police Station, where an investigation is ongoing, but no suspect has been apprehended.  The injured man is currently receiving medical treatment at Isoke Mission Hospital.
Comment: HRD will continue to follow up on any developments, and report accordingly.

Location of Incident: Kiir Adem village, Gok Machar Payam, Aweil North
Description: 3.	On 22 June, one primary source reported that on 19 June, SSPDF soldiers arbitrarily arrested and detained incommunicado one male civilian (a youth leader) in Kiir Adem village, Gok Machar Payam, Aweil North County. As recounted by the source, the victim was arrested and detained on account for publicly challenging the mass recruitment exercise of youths into the ranks of the SSPDF by county authorities, alleging that rather than recruiting and deploying the youths who might be killed in combat, the county authorities should empower the youths through training and skill acquisition, and employment. The victim was subsequently released on 20 June.

Location of Incident: Mayom village, Marial-Lou Payam, Tonj North
Description:
4.	On 20 June, three secondary sources reported that on 19 June, armed Dinka Apuk Padoc youths from Akop Payam shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Luanyjang community in Mayom village, Marial-Lou Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Apuk Padoc youths attacked and opened fire on the victim while he was returning to Paliang Payam in Tonj East County following a visit to his relative in Marial-Lou Payam, reportedly in revenge for past unresolved grievances between the two communities. The incident was reported at the Marial-Lou Police Station and investigations are reportedly ongoing. 

Comment: According to the sources, tension is mounting in the area with the likelihood of more revenge violence, amidst reports of mobilization by armed Dinka Luanyjang youths to attack the Dinka Apuk Padoc community.

Location of Incident: Anuol, Yirol West
Description:
A female aged 18, beaten to death by her brothers who intended to force her into a marriage, in Anuol Payam of Yirol West County

On 17-18 June, HRD followed up to crosscheck and corroborate information received from UNMISS sources and spread on local social media, involving the case of a female aged 18, beaten to death by her brothers who intended to force her into a marriage, in Anuol Payam of Yirol West County.

HRD linked up with Police in Yirol West County on the phone, which confirmed the incident that reportedly occurred on 15 June. The Police explained that the victim was beaten to death by three brothers for allegedly resisting a marriage that her family had arranged for her with a man. HRD also gathered that the Police has already arrested the three suspects, that are currently under initial investigations, in Anuol Payam. It was additionally specified that the suspects would later be taken to custody in Yirol town, HQ of Yirol West County, where the investigations and prosecution works would be finalized.

Comments: HRD will continue to follow up on the case.

Location of Incident: Wuluturu, Yei River
Description:
•	Rape of 16-year-old female by 17-year-old civilian man in Wuluturu, Yei River County

On June 17, 2025, HRD-YFO received and documented information from two reliable sources including (one medical officer and one psychosocial support officer – details on file) regarding the rape of a 16-year-old female in Wuluturu, Yei River County in March 2025 (date not specified).

According to reports, the 16-year-old survivor (details on file), a resident of Wuluturu in Yei River County from Kakwa tribe was visited by the 17-year-old perpetrator (details on file) who is also a resident of Wuluturu and from the Kuku tribe. The visit happened at the survivor’s residence in March 2025 (date not specified). According to sources, the perpetrator raped the victim multiple times, and it resulted in pregnancy that was only discovered by the girl’s parents in June 2025. The survivor’s parents reported the case to the police on 09 June 2025, and she was referred to a health facility on same day for medical examination which confirmed that she was about four months pregnant. 

Comments: The South Sudan Penal Code (2008) criminalizes statutory rape (Section 247) and defines sexual intercourse with a minor under 18 as a felony, punishable by up to 14 years’ imprisonment. South Sudan is party to the Convention on the Rights of the Child (CRC) and the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination Against Women (CEDAW) which protect from exploitation and mandates state intervention sexual abuse cases. The late reporting of the case underscores systemic challenges in timely addressing SGBV in South Sudan, particularly involving minors.  HRD will follow up with the police to ensure accountability and effective administration of justice.

Location of Incident: Kanjoro, Yei River
Description:
•	Rape of 14-year-old female by a 19-year-old civilian male in Kanjoro, Yei River County

On June 16, 2025, HRD Yei Field Office received and documented information from two reliable secondary sources, the health service providers (details on file) regarding the rape of a 14-year-old female by a 19-year-old civilian male on 09 June 2025 in Kanjoro Yei River County.

According to sources, the 14-year-old (details on file) from the Dinka tribe visited her female friend in the same neighborhood on 09 June 2025 and the friend reportedly locked her up in the same room with her brother, a 19-year-old civilian male (details on file) who raped her multiple times.  After the incident, the survivors but unfortunately her mother beat her, forcing her to disclose the incident before reporting the case to the police. She was also taken to medical facility for medical care.

Comments: the repeated rape of a 14-year-old constitutes gross violation of the victim’s bodily integrity as enshrined in South Sudan’s Transitional Constitution and the UDHR as they are considered incapable of giving sexual consent. HRD will continue to follow up to ensure accountability and proper administration of justice

Location of Incident: Mahad, Yei River
Description:
On 16 June 2025, HRD Yei Field Office received and documented information from two reliable secondary sources (medical officer and psychosocial worker – details on file) regarding the rape of a 15-year-old girl from the Kakwa community by a civilian man from the Pojulu tribe in Mahad, on December 12, 2024, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County.

According to sources, the 15-year-old (details on file) from the Kakwa tribe was reportedly visited by the 21-year-old perpetrator (details on file) at her residence in Mahad on 12 December. The perpetrator who was said to be from the Pojulu tribe raped the survivor repeatedly resulting into pregnancy which was only discovered by the survivor’s parents in June 2025. The survivor’s sister reported the case to the police on 12 June 2025 where a case was opened. The police referred the case to a medical facility for examinations where she was confirmed to be six months pregnant.

Location of Incident: Kupera Boma, Yei Town Payam, Lainya
Description:
•	18-year-old girl raped by a civilian man in Kupera Boma, Yei Town Payam, Lainya County 

On June 12, 2025, HRD Yei Field Office received and documented information from two reliable secondary sources (police officer and a local chief – details on file) regarding an 18-year-old girl from the Kakwa community raped by a 35-year-old civilian male in Kupera Boma, Kupera Payam, Lainya County on 09 June 2025. 

According to sources, the 18-year-old (details on file) from the Kakwa tribe was asleep at her residence in Kupera Boma when the 35-year-old perpetrator (names on file) who happens to be the victim’s relative living in the same neighborhood forcefully entered the house of the victim at about 1:00AM on 09 June 2025. He reportedly threatened her with a Panga before raping her and fleeing the scene to unknow location.   The matter was reported to the police who are following up with investigations. 

Comments: such gruesome act violates bodily integrity as victim was subjected to severe sexual violence by her own relative following the alleged rape, raising concerns about secondary victimization. HRD will follow up to ascertain whether any medical procedures were conducted and ensure that due investigation procedures are followed by the police for proper accountability and administration of justice.

Location of Incident: Wau Town, Wau
Description:
•	A member of the National Police Services (NPS) raped and impregnated a 17-year-old girl in the Nazareth residential area of Wau town.
On 13 June 2025, HRD interviewed an 18-year-old girl from the Balanda tribe who was allegedly raped and impregnated by a 27-year-old male National Police Services (NPS) Warrant Officer from the Kresh community, attached to Urok locality in Warrap state.

The victim recounted that the alleged perpetrator began courting her in January 2024 when she was 17 years old. He invited her to his house in the Nazareth residential area of Wau town that same month, where he succeeded in raping her multiple times, resulting in her becoming pregnant. She fled to Juba by the end of March 2024, fearing her parents' reaction where she spent three months there, and upon her return, a case (case #1724) was filed with the Wau town police station under section 247 of the South Sudan Penal Code 2008 on 24 September, after the identification of the alleged perpetrator.

HRD visited the Wau town police station and interacted with the investigator handling the case, who informed that the suspect had been arrested on 10 June 2025 and immediately detained at the Wau town police station. The case will be transferred to the Wau High Court on 16 June 2025.

Comments: The victim delivered a baby girl in September 2024. HRD will continue to follow up to ensure the accountability of the perpetrator.

Location of Incident: Latta Boma, Lasu Payam, Yei River
Description:
•	Rape of 15-year-old female by 18-year-old civilian man in Latta Boma, Lasu Payam, Yei River County

On June 9, 2025, HRD-YFO and UNPOL conducted a joint monitoring visit to One Stop Center, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County. The primary purpose of the monitoring visit was to follow up on reported cases of CRSV and SGBV. 

The team met with four staff members of the ONE Stop Center, including two medical officers, and two psychosocial support officers (details on file) who provided information on the rape of a 15-year-old female (details on file), a resident of Latta, Lasu Payam and from Kakwa tribe, by her 18-year-old man (details on file), resident of same area and same tribe. The incident reportedly happened on May 06, 2025, when the survivor visited the boyfriend at his residence, and he raped her multiple times. The case was reported to the police on May 30, 2025, by the survivor’s parents and later referred by police to a health facility for medical care on same day.

Comments: The South Sudan Penal Code (2008) criminalizes statutory rape (Section 247) and defines sexual intercourse with a minor under 18 as a felony, punishable by up to 14 years’ imprisonment. South Sudan is party to the Convention on the Rights of the Child (CRC) and the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination Against Women (CEDAW) which protect from exploitation and mandates state intervention sexual abuse cases. The late reporting of the case underscores systemic challenges in timely addressing SGBV in South Sudan, particularly involving minors.  HRD will follow up with the police to ensure accountability and effective administration of justice.

Location of Incident: Nyinh-Aluk Boma in Aweil town
Description:
17-year-old schoolgirl raped by 19 YO boy in Nyinh-Aluk Boma in Aweil town

On 9 June, HRD visited Maper Akot police station in Aweil town to follow up on a rape case and met with police investigator in-charge of the case who inform that a 17-year-old schoolgirl reported raped by 19 YO boy in Nyinh-Aluk Boma in Maper Akot. Police investigator stated that according to the victim statement, the accused (name provided) was in love with her girlfriend (name provided) almost six months and they were in the same school, Kind Solomon Secondary school in Maper Akot. The victim is living along the road to Gateway School and the accused is living at Nyinh-Aluk boma.

On 10th April, around 7:30pm, the boy invited her girlfriend to come to Nyinh-Aluk place, where the public bricks where made. The girl come alone for conversation. According to the victim while returning home around 9.00 pm, the boy grabbed the girl and took her into the bush and raped her. After the rape, the rapist helped the victim to reach to her family home at the same night. But the lady did not report to her mother for one month until her mother recognized that her daughter got pregnant.

On 31 May, the victim realized that she got pregnant by the boy, she decided to come to the house of the boy, but the boy and his mother have beaten the lady and chased her outside house. The uncle went to Maper Akot police station and opened the case of rape, and the alleged perpetrator was arrested and detained in Maper Akot police station on 5 June 2025. On 9th June, the victim was taken to Aweil civil hospital. The Police have issued Form 8 which has to be sign by the medical team at Aweil civil hospital. The mother immediately opened a case to initiate judicial proceedings.

Location of Incident: Wau town, Wau Municipality
Description:
•	A member of the fire brigade sexually assaulted his own 18-year-old daughter and, in complicity with an NSS personnel, had her arbitrarily arrested and detained in Wau town, Wau Municipality.
On 2 June 2025, HRD visited the One-Stop Centre at Wau Teaching Hospital in Wau town and interviewed an 18-year-old girl from the Lou tribe (name on file). She reported that she was sexually assaulted by her own father, a 50-year-old male, also from the Lou tribe, who is a member of the fire brigade with the rank of Corporal stationed at Wau Airport (name on file).
The victim recounted that on 7 February 2025, at approximately 3:00 PM, while she was sleeping with her younger sister, the suspect entered their room and attempted to rape her. She resisted and managed to escape. The victim further reported that the suspect had attempted to rape her on three separate occasions (specific dates not provided), threatening her not to disclose the incidents to anyone.
Fearing for her safety, the victim fled the family home and sought refuge at her aunt's place in the New Side area of Wau town. Subsequently, on 15 May 2025, the suspect, allegedly with the complicity of an NSS personnel, had her arbitrarily arrested and detained under false accusations that she had eloped with her boyfriend to force her to return home. However, due to the intervention of her uncle, and in coordination with the Special Protection Unit, she was released the following day from the NSS post at Jou Market where she was detained.
The police investigator also informed HRD that the case is currently open with the SPU. The suspect was arrested on 16 May 2025 but was granted bail by the fire brigade unit on 17 May 2025. The case has since been referred to the Wau High Court for trial. The victim has also received psychosocial counselling support.

Location of Incident: Mogos Boma, Mogos Payam, Kapoeta East
Description: 1.	On 23 June, three secondary sources reported that on 17 June, Murle armed elements from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) abducted one four-year-old boy from the Toposa community in Mogos Boma, Mogos Payam, Kapoeta East County. According to the sources, the Murle armed elements invaded Mogos Boma with intent to raid cattle; however, failing to find any, proceeded to abduct the victim who was playing at a cattle camp while his brothers had taken cattle for grazing. The incident was reported at Narus Police Station and investigations are reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: GPAA
Description: 2.	On 23 June, multiple secondary sources reported that on 6 June, one 15-year-old girl, who was abducted by Lou Nuer armed elements from GPAA (exact date unspecified) and taken to Yuai Payam, Uror County, was recovered by the authorities in Gakdong Boma, Dengjok Payam, Akobo County. According to the sources, the survivor escaped from her abductors and was received by County authorities in Akobo County who are coordinating with humanitarian partners to facilitate family tracing and reunification.

Location of Incident: Ngadiang village, Paliang Payam, Tonj East
Description:
3.	On 23 June, three secondary sources reported that on 22 June, armed Dinka Jalwau youths from Wunlit Payam shot and killed one male civilian and injured two others from the Dinka Luanyjang community in Ngadiang village, Paliang Payam, Tonj East County – a revenge action linked to past unresolved grievances between the two communities. Reportedly, the assailants also burnt down several houses. The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Romic Town for medical treatment. 

Comment: According to the sources, armed Dinka Luanyjang youths are mobilizing for a retaliation against the Dinka Jalwau community.

Location of Incident: Ngadiang village, Paliang Payam, Tonj East
Description:
3.	On 23 June, three secondary sources reported that on 22 June, armed Dinka Jalwau youths from Wunlit Payam shot and killed one male civilian and injured two others from the Dinka Luanyjang community in Ngadiang village, Paliang Payam, Tonj East County – a revenge action linked to past unresolved grievances between the two communities. Location of Incident: Ayool village, Marial-Lou Payam, Tonj North
Description: 4.	On June 23, three secondary sources reported that on 21 June, armed Dinka Luanyjang youths from Paliang Payam shot and killed four male civilians from the Dinka Lou Paher community in Ayool village, Marial-Lou Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the attack was a retaliation for the killing of a Dinka Luanyjang civilian in Marial-Lou Payam, Tonj North County by armed Dinka Apuk Padoc youths from Marial Lou Payam [see HRD Daily Report 23 June 2025].

Location of Incident: Hai Kisanga suburb of Yambio
Description:
HRD Monitored the GBV One Stop Centre at Yambio State Hospital

During the monitoring visit to the GBV One Stop Centre at Yambio State Hospital today, HRD documented 23 cases of gender-based violence (GBV) recorded between May 1 and June 4, 2025. 

The documented GBV cases predominantly involve female minors, with many victims aged 13 to 17, as well as notably young survivors aged 2 and 5. The documented cases involve victims and 12 individual perpetrators. All victims are female, indicating a troubling trend of gender-based violence primarily directed at women and girls. Perpetrators range from young boys, as young as 8 and 10, to adults in their late teens and early twenties, highlighting significant involvement of young men in these offenses. Most cases involve individuals from the Azande community, suggesting a potential community-specific issue, though perpetrators from the Dinka and Moru communities are also represented. The types of violence include rape and attempted rape, reflecting a severe spectrum of abuse faced by young females. 

The first case involved a 22-year-old female from the Azande community, who was reportedly raped by an unidentified armed man in the Hai Kisanga suburb of Yambio on May 2. The second and third cases occurred in Ikpiro, a residential area in Yambio, on April 24, where a male civilian raped a 17-year-old girl, and another civilian raped a 13-year-old minor. Both survivors and perpetrators in these cases were from the Azande community.

The fourth case took place on April 29 in Akorogbodi-1 (AK-1), where a 15-year-old girl was raped by her 19-year-old brother while they were working on a farm. This incident was reported to the One Stop Centre on May 5.

The fifth case, which occurred on May 5 in Naagori, involved a 23-year-old male from the Moru community who allegedly raped a 15-year-old girl from the Azande community.
The sixth rape case happened on May 28 in the Naduru residential area, where an 18-year-old male from the Azande community raped a 17-year-old female from the same community. The seventh case involved a 19-year-old man from the Azande community who raped a 17-year-old female, also from the Azande community, in the Kpirabe area of Yambio.

Furthermore, the eighth case took place in the Hai-Kuba residential area on May 25, where a 38-year-old man from the Dinka community allegedly raped a 17-year-old female from the Dinka community. Additionally, a 28-year-old Azande man raped a 17-year-old girl from the Azande community in the Napere area on May 28.
Another case involved an attempted rape by a 12-year-old male from the Azande community against a 2-year-old female in the Gangara Amelia residential area. There was also a case on May 22 in Mukongo, where a 52-year-old man raped a 15-year-old girl.

In another disturbing incident, an elderly man allegedly raped his 9-year-old granddaughter in Mukongo. Additionally, a 23-year-old man from the Azande community raped a 13-year-old girl in Kpirabe.

On May 19, at the SSPDF barracks near the airstrip in Yambio, a soldier from the Dinka community raped a 14-year-old girl from the same community. Another case involved a 35-year-old suspect from the Democratic Republic of Congo who allegedly raped a 14-year-old female in Napere.

Finally, a gang rape incident occurred on June 4 in Kpirabe, where two brothers, aged 10 and 8, raped a 5-year-old girl. All parties involved in this incident were from the Azande community.

Comments: The trends in this report underscore the urgent need for targeted interventions to protect young girls and enhance community education on rights and responsibilities. Some of these cases were reported at the Special Protection Unit in Yambio Police Station, while others were not reported. The HRD’s monitoring reveals that some victims followed the guidance of their parents to pursue out-of-court settlements. HRD has discouraged this practice during workshops with the police and CSOs in Western Equatoria State; however, it continues to persist. HRD will continue to sensitize the community on seeking judicial accountability for such grave offenses as rape to ensure deterrence in the community and seek justice for the victims.

Location of Incident: Naduru residential area, Yambio
Description:
RD Monitored the GBV One Stop Centre at Yambio State Hospital

Most cases involve individuals from the Azande community, suggesting a potential community-specific issue, though perpetrators from the Dinka and Moru communities are also represented. The types of violence include rape and attempted rape, reflecting a severe spectrum of abuse faced by young females. 

The first case involved a 22-year-old female from the Azande community, who was reportedly raped by an unidentified armed man in the Hai Kisanga suburb of Yambio on May 2. The second and third cases occurred in Ikpiro, a residential area in Yambio, on April 24, where a male civilian raped a 17-year-old girl, and another civilian raped a 13-year-old minor. Both survivors and perpetrators in these cases were from the Azande community.

The fourth case took place on April 29 in Akorogbodi-1 (AK-1), where a 15-year-old girl was raped by her 19-year-old brother while they were working on a farm. This incident was reported to the One Stop Centre on May 5.

The fifth case, which occurred on May 5 in Naagori, involved a 23-year-old male from the Moru community who allegedly raped a 15-year-old girl from the Azande community.
The sixth rape case happened on May 28 in the Naduru residential area, where an 18-year-old male from the Azande community raped a 17-year-old female from the same community. The seventh case involved a 19-year-old man from the Azande community who raped a 17-year-old female, also from the Azande community, in the Kpirabe area of Yambio.

Furthermore, the eighth case took place in the Hai-Kuba residential area on May 25, where a 38-year-old man from the Dinka community allegedly raped a 17-year-old female from the Dinka community. Additionally, a 28-year-old Azande man raped a 17-year-old girl from the Azande community in the Napere area on May 28.
Another case involved an attempted rape by a 12-year-old male from the Azande community against a 2-year-old female in the Gangara Amelia residential area. There was also a case on May 22 in Mukongo, where a 52-year-old man raped a 15-year-old girl.

In another disturbing incident, an elderly man allegedly raped his 9-year-old granddaughter in Mukongo. Additionally, a 23-year-old man from the Azande community raped a 13-year-old girl in Kpirabe.

On May 19, at the SSPDF barracks near the airstrip in Yambio, a soldier from the Dinka community raped a 14-year-old girl from the same community. Another case involved a 35-year-old suspect from the Democratic Republic of Congo who allegedly raped a 14-year-old female in Napere.

Finally, a gang rape incident occurred on June 4 in Kpirabe, where two brothers, aged 10 and 8, raped a 5-year-old girl. All parties involved in this incident were from the Azande community.

Comments: The trends in this report underscore the urgent need for targeted interventions to protect young girls and enhance community education on rights and responsibilities. Some of these cases were reported at the Special Protection Unit in Yambio Police Station, while others were not reported. The HRD’s monitoring reveals that some victims followed the guidance of their parents to pursue out-of-court settlements. HRD has discouraged this practice during workshops with the police and CSOs in Western Equatoria State; however, it continues to persist. HRD will continue to sensitize the community on seeking judicial accountability for such grave offenses as rape to ensure deterrence in the community and seek justice for the victims.

Location of Incident: Loynure Boma, Ikotos Payam, Ikotos
Description: 1.	On 24 June, three secondary sources reported that on 21 June, armed Lango youths from Huma Boma shot and injured two male civilians (ages 27 and 30 years old) from the Longo community in Loynure Boma, Ikotos Payam, Ikotos County. According to the sources, the armed Lango youths stormed Loynure Boma and opened fire on the victims, injuring them, reportedly in revenge for the shooting and injuring of two Lango male civilians (30 and 38-years old) from Huma Boma by armed Lango youths of Loynure Boma on 25 February 2024 [see HRD Daily Report 29 February 2024]. The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Isoke Town for medical treatment. The incident was reported at Ikotos police station and investigations are reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: Mapiso village, Tambura Payam, Tambura
Description: 2.	On 24 June, multiple secondary sources reported that on 21 June, armed Balanda elements abducted one male civilian (a local businessman) from the Azande community in Mapiso village, Tambura Payam, Tambura County. According to the sources, the armed Balanda youths ambushed and abducted the victim while he was transporting his merchandise from Nagero Town to the Tambura Market. Reportedly, relatives of the victim engaged the local chief and the leader of the armed Balanda elements on the incident to no avail.  A case has been opened at the Tambura police station.

Location of Incident: Kejiko village, Ombaci Boma, Otogo Payam, Yei River
Description:
1.	On 25 June, two secondary sources reported that on 18 May, NAS elements abducted one male civilian (a religious leader) from the Kakwa community in Kejiko village, Ombaci Boma, Otogo Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, the NAS elements abducted the victim from his homestead in Kejiko village for unknown reasons. The whereabouts of the victim remain unknown. 

Comment: Reportedly, this incident is part of a broader pattern of targeted attacks and intimidation against civilians perceived to be supporting government forces in the area.

Location of Incident: Chukudum Payam, Budi
Description: 2.	On 25 June, three secondary sources reported that on 22 June, two male civilians (ages 20 and 25 years old) from the Didinga community were shot and killed during violence between armed Didinga youths from Kikilai and Batalado Bomas in Chukudum Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, armed Didinga youths from Kikilai Boma attacked Batalado Boma and opened fire on the 20-year-old victim from Batalado Boma to avenge the killing of one 29-year-old Didinga male civilian from Kikilai Boma on 20 May 2025. Reportedly, in retaliation, armed Didinga youths from Batalado Boma while pursuing the armed Didinga youths from Kikilai Boma shot and killed the 25-year-old victim in his farm. The incident was reported at Ikotos police.

Location of Incident: Pachar, Pachak, Pulmok and Pachinjok Payams in Panyijar County
Description:
3.	On 24 and 25 June, multiple sources reported that on 23 and 24 June, 12 Nyoung Nuer civilians were killed and 17 others were injured during aerial bombardments by the SSPDF in Pachar, Pachak, Pulmok and Pachinjok Payams in Panyijar County. According to the sources, on 23 June, following the aerial bombardments by the SSPDF in Pulmok and Pariel Bomas in Pachar Payam, Pumalual village in Pachak Payam and Chueh village in Pachinjok Payam, 10 Nyoung Nuer civilians were injured and several civilian properties were destroyed including injury to 52 cattle, and 35 cattle killed. On 24 June, the aerial bombardments resulted in the death of 12 Nyuong Nuer civilians and injury to seven others. The injured victims (mostly women and children) were taken to a health care facility in the area for medical treatment. 

Comment: These bombardments reportedly resulted in the displacement of over 29,300 civilians to nearby villages. HRD will continue to gather more information on the reported casualties.

Location of Incident: Rubkway Town, Mayendit
Description: 4.	On 24 and 25 June, multiple sources reported that on 22 June, one NPSSS officer attacked and injured a female civilian from the Haak Nuer community in Rubkway Town, Mayendit County. According to the sources, the NPSSS officer attacked the victim with a spear, injuring her, in relation to a land dispute. Reportedly, the NPSSS officer was arrested by the police and while being transferred to the police station, he was attacked and injured by a relative of the victim. The sources further informed that the injured woman is receiving medical treatment at a health care facility in Bentiu, while the prison officer is receiving medical treatment under police protection at a hospital in Leer. The local authorities and the police are reportedly awaiting the medical treatment of the victim and the alleged perpetrator before proceeding with the case.

Location of Incident: Nyingor village, Paweng Payam, Tonj East
Description:
1.	On 26 June, three secondary sources reported that on 25 June, suspected armed Dinka Lou Paher youths from Marial Lou Payam shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Luanyjang community in Nyingor village, Paweng Payam, Tonj East County. The attack was reportedly a revenge action linked to the cyclical retaliatory violence for past and unresolved grievances between the communities. 

Comment: According to the sources, tension is mounting in the area amidst reports of mobilizations by armed Dinka Luanyjang youths for retaliation against the Dinka Lou Paher community.

Location of Incident: Lokoloko residential area in Wau Town, Wau
Description: 2.	On 26 June, one primary source and two secondary sources reported that on 20 June, NSS personnel shot and injured one 20-year-old male civilian from the Forga community in the Lokoloko residential area in Wau Town, Wau County. According to the sources, the NSS personnel intercepted the victim while he was on his way home and ordered to sit on the ground for unknown reasons. Reportedly, the victim defied the order and tried to escape, and one of the NSS personnel opened fire and injuring the victim. The victim was taken to a health care facility in Wau Town for medical treatment. The suspects were subsequently arrested and detained at the NSS facility.

Location of Incident: Nyeli village, Odemo Boma, Lokiliri Payam, Juba
Description: 1.	On 27 June, multiple secondary sources reported that, on 21 June, suspected Murle armed elements shot and killed one 47-year-old male civilian from the Lolubo community in Nyeli village, Odemo Boma, Lokiliri Payam, Juba County. According to the sources, the assailants shot and killed the victim while he was returning to his homestead. Reportedly, the assailants plotted an ambush intending to abduct children in the area, and upon seeing the victim, they immediately shot and killed him and fled the scene as the local youths immediately mobilized and rushed to the area of the incident. The victim’s body was retrieved and buried on the same day.

Location of Incident: Chahari Payam, Ikotos
Description: 2.	Between 26 and 27 June, three secondary sources reported that, on 19 June, one 22-year-old male civilian was shot and killed, and one 26-year-old male civilian was shot and injured during violence between armed Logir youths from Chorokol and Chahari Bomas, Chahari Payam, Ikotos County. According to the sources, armed Logir youths from Chahari Boma, invaded Chorokol Boma, shot and killed the 22-year-old victim, raided an unspecified number of cattle belonging to the victim and fled the scene. Reportedly, in retaliation, armed Logir youth from Chorokol Boma, invaded Chahari Boma and shot and wounded the 26-year-old victim in his homestead and fled the scene. The injured victim was taken to a health facility in Chahari Payam for treatment, and the incidents were reported to the Ikotos and Chahari police stations where investigations are ongoing.

Location of Incident: Chahari Payam, Ikotos
Description: 2.	Between 26 and 27 June, three secondary sources reported that, on 19 June, one 22-year-old male civilian was shot and killed, and one 26-year-old male civilian was shot and injured during violence between armed Logir youths from Chorokol and Chahari Bomas, Chahari Payam, Ikotos County. Location of Incident: Namorunyang Boma, Namorunyang Payam, Kapoeta South
Description: 3.	On 27 June, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, armed Didinga youths from Kilanya Boma, Ngauro Payam, Budi County, shot and killed two civilians (a 25-year-old Toposa woman and a 17- year-old Toposa boy) in Namorunyang Boma, Namorunyang Payam, Kapoeta South County. According to the sources, the assailants invaded Namorunyang Boma, shot and killed the victims, and fled the scene. Reportedly, this incident was in retaliation to the killing of one 32-year-old Didinga farmer by armed Toposa cattle herders in Hurchul farm, Ngauro Boma, Ngauro Payam, Budi County on 22 April 2025 [see HRD Daily Report 24 April 2025]. The incident was reported to the Kapoeta Police Station and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Chuor village, Wangkei Payam, Mayom
Description: 4.	On 27 June, two secondary sources reported that on the same day, armed Chiengjock youths from Chiengding subclan in Kuerbona Payam-Mayom County, shot and killed five male civilians and injured another (from the Chiengbliew section of Chiengnyaloth subclan of Bul Nuer of Riak Payam) in Chuor village, Wangkei Payam, Mayom County. According to the sources, the assailants invaded Chuor village, and opened fire on the residents, killing four male and injuring two others, although one injured victim, later succumbed to his injuries. Reportedly, this attack was in retaliation for the killing of four armed Chiengjock youths in May 2025 (exact date unspecified), by armed Chiengbliew youths. Security forces were deployed to the area, but no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Chuor village, Wangkei Payam, Mayom
Description: 4.	On 27 June, two secondary sources reported that on the same day, armed Chiengjock youths from Chiengding subclan in Kuerbona Payam-Mayom County, shot and killed five male civilians and injured another (from the Chiengbliew section of Chiengnyaloth subclan of Bul Nuer of Riak Payam) in Chuor village, Wangkei Payam, Mayom County. Security forces were deployed to the area, but no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Marial Lou town Payam, Tonj North
Description: 5.	On 28 June, three secondary sources reported that on 27 June, suspected armed Dinka Luanyjang youths from Tonj East County, shot and killed two male Dinka Lou Paher civilians (ages unspecified) in Marial Lou town Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked Marial Lou town, shot and killed the victims (security guards at the Marial Lou Hospital), looted food items and fled towards Paliang Payam in Tonj East County. Reportedly, this incident is linked to past and unresolved grievances between the communities.

Location of Incident: Marial Lou town Payam, Tonj North
Description: 5.	On 28 June, three secondary sources reported that on 27 June, suspected armed Dinka Luanyjang youths from Tonj East County, shot and killed two male Dinka Lou Paher civilians (ages unspecified) in Marial Lou town Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked Marial Lou town, shot and killed the victims (security guards at the Marial Lou Hospital), looted food items and fled towards Paliang Payam in Tonj East County. Reportedly, this incident is linked to past and unresolved grievances between the communities.

Location of Incident: Danga-Chok village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East
Description: 6.	On 28 June, three secondary sources reported that on 27 June, allied Dinka Akook and Jalwau youths shot and killed two male Dinka Luanyjang civilians (ages unspecified) in Danga-Chok village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the assailants jointly ambushed a commercial passenger vehicle traveling from Tonj Town-Tonj South County to Paliang Payam Tonj East County, shot and killed two male Dinka Luanyjang civilians and injured two others and looted the property belonging to the passengers and fled the scene. Reportedly, the injured victims were evacuated to a health facility in Paliang Payam for treatment and the incident was reported to the police for investigation.

Location of Incident: Danga-Chok village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East
Description: 6.	On 28 June, three secondary sources reported that on 27 June, allied Dinka Akook and Jalwau youths shot and killed two male Dinka Luanyjang civilians (ages unspecified) in Danga-Chok village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the assailants jointly ambushed a commercial passenger vehicle traveling from Tonj Town-Tonj South County to Paliang Payam Tonj East County, shot and killed two male Dinka Luanyjang civilians and injured two others and looted the property belonging to the passengers and fled the scene. Reportedly, the injured victims were evacuated to a health facility in Paliang Payam for treatment and the incident was reported to the police for investigation.

Location of Incident: Baiparu suburb of Yambio town
Description:
•	HRD monitored the One Stop Centre and documented 8 cases of SGBV;

On 25 June, HRD monitored the GBV One Stop Centre at Yambio State Hospital in Yambio town and documented 08 cases of gender-based violence (GBV) recorded between 7 and 25 June 2025. 

The documented cases predominantly affected female minors, with survivors ranging in age from 10 to 15 years. HRD documented a total of 12 cases involving 12 survivors, all of whom are from the Azande community. All the survivors are female minors, which highlights a concerning pattern of GBV perpetuated by adult males targeting female minors.

The first case involved a 13-year-old girl from the Azande community, who was reportedly raped on 3 June by a 23-year-old male civilian from the Bari community at Baiparu suburb of Yambio town. Reportedly, the perpetrator forcibly entered the home of the survivor and raped her knowing that her parents had gone to cultivate their garden. The case was opened at the police.  

In the second case, on 7 June, a 28-year-old male civilian from the Azande community reportedly raped a 15-year-old girl from the Azande community in Kpirabe, a residential area in Yambio town. Reportedly, the perpetrator accosted the survivor while she was on her way to fetch water from a waterpoint, pulled her into a nearby bush and raped her.  The case was also opened at the Yambio police station.


In the third case, on an unspecified date in April, an 18-year-old boy from the Azande community reportedly raped a 14-year-old female girl from the Azande community in Asanza suburb of Yambio town. Reportedly, the perpetrator physically assaulted the survivor before raping her while she was returning home from visiting a sickly family member.

In the fourth case, on 17 June, a where a 24-year-old male civilian from the Baka community reportedly raped a 14-year-old girl from the Azande community in Hai-Kabash residential area, Yambio town. Reportedly, the perpetrator accosted the survivor while she was returning from school, pulled her into his home and raped her. The status of the case is unknown as the legal advisor attached to the one stop center was not present during the visit.

Location of Incident: Rorbai village of Pagor Payam under Cueibet County
Description:
A 13-year-old girl was reportedly raped by a man in Rorbai village of Pagor Payam under Cueibet County

On 27 June 2025, as part of the CAD-led integrated SDP to Cueibet town, HRD engaged with local authorities who informed the team that, on 26 June 2025, a 13-year-old girl was raped by a 20-year-old man in Rorbai village of Pagor Payam, located in Cueibet County. The survivor has been admitted to Cueibet hospital where she is undergoing treatment. Authorities indicated that the perpetrator has yet to be arrested. During the engagement, the team advised the authorities to send the survivor to the One-Stop Centre where comprehensive treatment and support will be available for the survivor. HRD also advised them not to allow any proposed marriage between the alleged perpetrators and the survivors. 

Comment: HRD will follow up on the case, the arrest of the suspect and the transfer of the victim to appropriate support services.

Location of Incident: Rumbek North
Description:
A 15-year-old girl escaped an attempted forced marriage in Rumbek town

On 25 June 2025, while conducting a cell screening visit at the Rumbek Central Police Station, HRD documented the presence in custody of a 15-year-old girl (name on file) who escaped an attempt by her maternal uncle and two brothers to force her into marriage. The girl was reportedly brought to the Mabor Ngap Police Post in Rumbek town on 16 June 2025 by her mother who opposed the marriage. The girl was later transferred to the Rumbek Central Police Station at the request of the Special Protection Unit (SPU) who investigated her case and transferred it to the Prosecutor. According to the SPU, the Court has summoned the three suspects to hold a discussion about the girl’s rights with them. However, none of them have presented themselves before authorities and two have allegedly fled to Maper town of Rumbek North County.  

At the time of the visit, the girl had been in custody for 11 days. Both the SPU and the mother of the girl decided to keep her at Rumbek Central Police Station for her safety, fearing retaliation from her family. In the absence of a safehouse, the Police Station is often used for protective custody.

Comment: In cases of attempted forced marriage, it is standard practice in Lakes State for authorities to summon the family of the victim to educate them on the legislation surrounding forced marriages in South Sudan and to make them sign a letter in which they commit to refrain from attempting to marry the girl again.

Location of Incident: Murongor Boma, Katiko Payam, Kapoeta South
Description: 1.	On 30 June, three secondary sources reported that on 27 June, armed Toposa youths from Murongor Boma, shot and killed three Buya male civilians (aged 20, 27, and 35 years) and injured two others (aged 29, and 30 years) in Murongor Boma, Katiko Payam, Kapoeta South County. According to the sources, the assailants stormed a grazing land on the outskirts of Murongor Boma, over which they claimed exclusive ownership, when they met the victims grazing their cattle. Reportedly, the shot and killed the victims, injured others and raided 30 heads of cattle from them and fled the scene. The injured victims were later taken to a health facility in Kapoeta South County, while the incident was reported at the Kapoeta South and Loriyok Police Stations and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Shambe port, Adior Payam, Yirol East
Description:
2.	On 30 June, multiple secondary sources reported that, on 27 June, armed Dinka Ciec youths shot and killed Nuer civilians (details unspecified) and injured another, at the Shambe port, Adior Payam, Yirol East County. According to the sources, on 27 June, armed Dinka Ciec youths opened fire on 53 Nyoung Nuer civilians (traders and students) traveling on a maritime vessel from Panyijar County to Juba via Yirol East County (Lakes State) Bor (Jonglie State), after confiscating and collecting over 2,000,000 South Sudanese Pounds (SSP) from the passengers and vessel owners. Reportedly, of the 53 civilians, 42 were rescued by Sudan People’s Liberation Army-In Opposition (SPLA-IO) forces from the swaps, four reported dead, one injured and six others unaccounted for, while the assailants made away with unspecified sums of money, valuable property and the boat used by the travellers. The surviving victims are under the custody of the SPLA-IO forces in Kotlier Port in Panyijar County while a search team is looking for the missing six civilians. 

Comment: following the deteriorating communication between Lakes State and Unity State following recent cross-border cattle raids and aerial bombardments in Panyijar County by SSPDF forces, authorities in Panyijar County could not establish links with their counterparts in Lakes due to the breach of trust. Tension is building up in the area and it can spiral to further violence. HRD will continue to monitor.

Location of Incident: Rubkona town, Rubkona
Description: 3.	On 30 June, three secondary sources reported that, on 28 June, soldiers of the SPLA-IO (RM), arbitrarily detained and illtreated one 23-year-old female civilian at the Tong military facility in Rubkona town, Rubkona County. According to the sources, between 26 and 27 June the victim was arbitrarily detained by her husband at the Joint Police Unit in the Rubkona IDP camp on allegations of extra-marital affairs with another man and was later released on 27 June. Reportedly, on 28 June she was taken to the Tong Military facility under the SPLA-IO (RM) where she was flogged severely which a customized whip made from animal skin “sjambok” to force a confession from here and leading to severe bodily injury. Her family is making plans to transfer her to a health facility in Bentiu for treatment.

Location of Incident: Awul Payam, Tonj North
Description: 4.	On 30 June, four secondary sources reported that on 29 June, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one Dinka Abiem male civilian (age unspecified) from Manlor Payam Tonj North County and injured another Dinka Atok male civilian (age unspecified) in Awul Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the incident happened while the victims were traveling on a motorcycle along the Warrap-Wau route in Awul Payam, returning to Wau after attending a traditional wedding ceremony in Tonj North County. Reportedly, the assailants stole the motorcycle of the victims and fled the scene, while the injured victim was later evacuated to a health facility in Wau town for treatment, and the incident was reported to the police in Warrap town and investigations are ongoing.

Location of Incident: Awul Payam, Tonj North
Description: 4.	On 30 June, four secondary sources reported that on 29 June, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one Dinka Abiem male civilian (age unspecified) from Manlor Payam Tonj North County and injured another Dinka Atok male civilian (age unspecified) in Awul Payam, Tonj North County. Location of Incident: Raja town, Raja County
Description: 5.	On 30 June, multiple sources reported that on 25 June, soldiers of the SSPDF illtreated, arbitrarily arrested and detained four male civilians (ages unspecified) from the Kresh and Fourgi communities, in Raja town, Raja County.  According to the sources, the victims were undertaking a road maintenance activity on the road from Raja Khor Shamam to Aweil, when they had an altercation with some youths from Aweil who refused to support the victims financially. Reportedly, the SSPDF arriving at the scene severely beat up the victims, arrested and detained them at the SSPDF barracks and only released them the following day following the intervention of the Raja County authorities.

Location of Incident: Mupoi-Mabia road, Mupoi Payam, Tambura
Description: 6.	On 30 June, multiple secondary sources reported that, on 29 June, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one male civilian (age unspecified) from the Azande community and a police officer along the Mupoi-Mabia road, Mupoi Payam, Tambura County. According to the sources, the victims were traveling on a motorcycle from Mupoi Payam, while returning from church service when they were shot and killed by the assailants. Reportedly, the assailants stole personal belongings, the uniform and gun belonging to the victims and fled the scene. The incident was reported to the Police and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Hai Khaisma residential area in Wau town
Description:
•	A 15-year-old girl allegedly raped by an unidentified induvial in uniform in Hai Khaisma residential area in Wau town.
On 16 June 16, the Human Rights Division (HRD) documented a case of rape involving a 15-year-old girl from the Balanda community. The victim was allegedly raped by an unknown individual in uniform in a bushy area in Hai Khaisma, Wau town.

The HRD team visited the Special Protection Unit (SPU) and engaged with the police investigator handling the case. The investigator informed that the rape incident, which occurred back in November 2024, was officially reported on 13 June Section 247, Paragraph 2 of the South Sudan Penal Code (2008) after the family discovered the victim was seven months pregnant. The police investigator remarked that this was the first reported rape case in the area but acknowledged the possibility of similar incidents occurring, particularly between 10 a.m. and 3 p.m., when such areas are less crowded.

On the same day, HRD interviewed the survivor, who shared her traumatic experience. She explained that the sexual assault happened while she and her two siblings were collecting firewood near Hai Khaisma. While she was distant from her siblings, the perpetrator took the opportunity to drag her into the bush, covered her mouth, threatened her, and raped her before fleeing the scene. The victim did not initially disclose the assault but was forced to explain it due to her visible pregnancy, prompting her uncle to file a case with the Special Protection Unit (SPU). She added that she could not recognize the perpetrator, who remains at large.

HRD also spoke with the complainant, the girl’s uncle, who corroborated the accounts of the victim.

Comment: The case is being investigated by the police, and the HRD will continue to follow up to ensure progress and that the alleged perpetrator is apprehended and brought to justice.

Location of Incident: Ngauro Boma, Ngauro Payam, Budi
Description:
2.	On 1 July, three secondary sources reported that on 30 June, armed Didinga youth from Kilanya Boma, shot and injured one 32-year-old male civilian in Ngauro Boma, Ngauro Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, the assailants shot and injured the victim (employee of the gold mine company) on the company premises, on allegations that the company has recognized the Toposa community’s claim over the disputed piece of land between the Didinga and Toposa community (the land on which the company is built). Reportedly, the incident was reported to the police station and investigations are ongoing.

Comment: The ongoing dispute over ownership of the gold mining area between the Didinga and Toposa communities has led to significant loss of innocent lives. HRD will continue to monitor the situation.

Location of Incident: Duk Boma, Doma Payam, Ulang
Description:
3.	On 1 July, three secondary sources reported that on 30 June, 12 civilians were shot and killed including one female civilian (details unspecified), during violence between the Chieng Rom and the Chieng Man-bath clans in Duk Boma, Doma Payam, Ulang County. According to the sources, members of the Chieng Rom clan attacked the Chieng Man-bath community in the context of past and unresolved grievances between the communities, killing the victims. Reportedly, three of the assailants were also killed in the process while the remaining assailants fled the scene. 

Comment: The County authorities are yet to initiate steps to resolve the grievances between the two communities. HRD will continue to monitor the situation for more information.

Location of Incident: Bombil village of Ajak-Kuac Payam, Twic
Description: 4.	On 1 July, three secondary sources reported that on 30 June, armed Bul Nuer youths from Mayom County-Unity State, shot and injured one Dinka Twic Mayardit civilian (age unspecified) in Bombil village of Ajak-Kuac Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, the incident happened during a cattle raid attempt by the armed Bul Nuer youths in Bombil village, although they were immediately fended off, as the armed Twic Mayardit youths in the area mobilized and pursued the assailants towards Mayom County. Reportedly, the injured victim was evacuated to a health facility in Turalei Paya for treatment.

Location of Incident: Napere residential area in Yambio town, Yambio
Description: 5.	On 1 July, multiple sources reported that on 30 June, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one male civilian from the Azande community in Napere residential area in Yambio town, Yambio County. According to the sources, the victim (youth leader) and two other civilians fell into an ambush set by the assailants who were looting valuables from civilians in the area, and in the ensuing confrontation, the assailants shot and injured the victim. Reportedly, the victim was retrieved by the National Security Service (NSS) team on patrol, and taken to a health facility in the area, where he succumbed to his injuries. A case was opened at the Masia police station for investigation although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Napere residential area in Yambio town, Yambio
Description: 5.	On 1 July, multiple sources reported that on 30 June, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one male civilian from the Azande community in Napere residential area in Yambio town, Yambio County. A case was opened at the Masia police station for investigation although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Kanja village, Gulumbi Payam in Morobo
Description: 1.	On 2 July, three secondary sources reported that, on 1 July, suspected SPLA-IO elements shot and killed one male civilian (age unspecified) from the Kakwa community in Kanja village, Gulumbi Payam in Morobo County. According to the sources, the assailants shot and killed the victim who was traveling on a motorcycle from Uganda to Yei town, at an illegal checkpoint in Kanja village, after the victim defied an order to stop and they fled the scene. Reportedly, the victim’s body was retrieved and taken for medical examination at a health facility in Morobo town, with plans set for internment.

Location of Incident: Loriyok Boma, Kimotong Payam Budi
Description: 2.	On 2 July, three secondary sources reported that on 18 June, armed Toposa youths from Machi Boma, Katiko Payam, Kapoeta South County, shot and killed two male civilians (aged 20 and 25 years) from the Buya community in Loriyok Boma, Kimotong Payam Budi County. According to the sources, the armed Toposa youths attacked a cattle camp in Loriyok Boma with intent to raid cattle, when they found the victims, shot and killed them. Reportedly, the assailants fled the scene into Machi Boma without any raided cattle, following the rapid mobilization and pursuit by the armed Buya youths in the area. The incident was reported to the Loriyok police station where investigations are underway although no arrests were made.

Location of Incident: Aguet village, Bach Boma, Pagor Payam in Cueibet
Description: 3.	Between 1 and 2 July, multiple secondary sources reported that, on 30 June, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one male civilian (sub-chief of the Waat clan) in Aguet village, Bach Boma, Pagor Payam in Cueibet County. According to the sources the victim was shot and killed while he was traveling on foot to Pagor town for a community meeting. Reportedly, tension is building in the area, as the Waat community members suspect the assailants to be members of the Panyar clan in Tiap-tiap Payam-Cueibet County. Security forces were deployed in the area to deescalate the situation and prevent further retaliatory violence.

Location of Incident: Kiir Adem town, Aweil North
Description:
4.	On 2 July, three secondary sources reported that on 27 June, armed Reizigat pastoralists from Sudan, attacked and killed one 54-year-old male civilian in Kiir Adem town, Aweil North County. According to the sources, the incident followed a herder-grazer dispute between the victim and the pastoralists after the cattle belonging to the pastoralists had grazed on the victim’s farm. Reportedly, the Reizigat pastoralist attacked the victim and left him unconscious, and the victim was taken to health facility in Aweil town for treatment although he later succumbed to his injuries on 30 June. 

Comment: On 2 July, one of the assailants was reportedly arrested and detained in connection to this incident. This incident feeds into the bigger farmer-grazer conflict persistent in the area. HRD will continue to monitor the situation for more information.

Location of Incident: Koab Boma, Nhialdiu Payam, Rubkona
Description:
5.	On 2 July, one primary source reported that, on 25 June, unidentified armed elements raped two female civilians (ages unspecified) in Koab Boma, Nhialdiu Payam, Rubkona County. The source recounted that, the perpetrators invaded Koab Boma, looting civilian property and other valuables and proceeded to rape the victims and other female civilians (yet to-be identified) in the area. Reportedly, the two identified victims were taken to a health facility in the area for medical examination and treatment. 

Comment: information about the other survivors is yet unknown as they are still within the community and have not received medical and/or psychosocial assistance. HRD will gather more information on this incident.

Location of Incident: Nguaro Boma, Nguaro Payam, Budi
Description: 1.	On 3 July, three secondary sources reported that on 1 July, soldiers of the SSPDF (Dinka), shot and injured one 19-year-old male civilian in Nguaro Boma, Nguaro Payam, Budi County. According to the source, the soldiers stormed a gold mine in Nguaro Payam and opened fire on civilians working in the mine, injuring the victim in the process. Reportedly, this incident was in retaliation to the shooting and injuring of one 32-year-old male Dinka civilian and employee of the gold mine in Nguaro Boma [see HRD Daily Report 2 July 2025]. The incident was reported at the Ngauro police station and investigations are ongoing.

Location of Incident: Gaan cattle camp in Pagang Boma, Paloch Payam, Rumbek East
Description:
2.	On 3 July, multiple secondary sources reported that, on 28 June, three male civilians were shot and killed (one Boor and two Niel Niel- ages unspecified) and seven others injured (seven male Boor civilians-ages unspecified) in the Gaan cattle camp in Pagang Boma, Paloch Payam, Rumbek East County. According to the sources, an armed Niel Niel man, accidentally shot and killed two male Niel Niel civilians during an altercation with a man from the Boor clan and fled for refuge amongst the Boor clan members in the Gaan cattle camp. Reportedly, the armed Niel Niel youths mobilized and attacked the Boor clan members in the cattle camp, killing one Boor male civilian and injuring seven others. 

Comment: During this clash on 28 June, seven men from the Niel Niel clan were killed and seven others injured including one female in Pagang Boma. The Boor clan members had escaped to Akuoth cattle camp in Akuoth Boma of Paloch Payam, and on 29 June, the armed Niel Niel youths launched a second attack on Boor in Akuoth Boma, but no casualties were recorded during this second attack. HRD will continue to monitor the situation for more information.

Location of Incident: Gaan cattle camp in Pagang Boma, Paloch Payam, Rumbek East
Description:

Location of Incident: Udhuba Boma, Nyalath Payam, Aweil Centre
Description: 3.	On 3 July, one secondary source reported that on 2 July, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one male civilian on Udhuba Boma, Nyalath Payam, Aweil Centre County. According to the source, the victim was ambushed, while traveling on a motorcycle along the Aweil-Aroyo-Road in Nyalath Payam, and robbed of an unspecified sum of money, shot and killed and his motorcycle also taken by the assailants. Reportedly, the incident was reported to the Aweil Centre Police station where an investigation was initiated and on 3 July, four men suspected to be accessory to this incident were arrested and detained by the police while a search is ongoing to identify and arrest the other suspects.

Location of Incident: Udhuba Boma, Nyalath Payam, Aweil Centre
Description: 3.	On 3 July, one secondary source reported that on 2 July, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one male civilian on Udhuba Boma, Nyalath Payam, Aweil Centre County. According to the source, the victim was ambushed, while traveling on a motorcycle along the Aweil-Aroyo-Road in Nyalath Payam, and robbed of an unspecified sum of money, shot and killed and his motorcycle also taken by the assailants. Reportedly, the incident was reported to the Aweil Centre Police station where an investigation was initiated and on 3 July, four men suspected to be accessory to this incident were arrested and detained by the police while a search is ongoing to identify and arrest the other suspects.

Location of Incident: Machar-Amuol village, Turalei Payam Twic
Description: 4.	On 3 July, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, armed Bul Nuer youths from Mayom Payam-Unity State, shot and killed one male Dinka Twic Mayardit civilian in Machar-Amuol village, Turalei Payam Twic County. According to the sources, the assailants invaded Machar-Amuol village, found the victim asleep, slit his throat and raided over 100 heads of cattle belonging to the victim and fled the scene towards Mayom County. Reportedly, the armed Twic Mayardit youths mobilized and pursued the assailants to no avail and insecurity is growing in the Twic community as other armed Bul Nuer youths were allegedly spotted in the bushes.

Location of Incident: Machar-Amuol village, Turalei Payam Twic
Description: 4.
