Location of Incident: Ajak village, Kirik Payam, Tonj North
Description: 5.	On 3 July, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one female civilian in Ajak village, Kirik Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the assailants shot and killed the victim while she was asleep in her homestead for unspecified reasons and fled the scene. Reportedly the incident was reported to the police and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Akop and Marial-Lou Payams in Tonj North
Description:
1.	On 6 July, multiple sources reported that on 5 July, nine male civilians (ages unspecified) were shot and killed during violence between the Dinka Lou-Paher and Apuk-Patoc in Akop and Marial-Lou Payams in Tonj North County.  According to the sources, on 5 July, armed Dinka Lou-Paher youths invaded Bundiir village in Akop Payam, shot and killed four male civilians in the context of recent past and unresolved grievances and fled the scene into Marial-Lou Payam. Reportedly, on the same day the aggrieved armed Dinka Apuk-Patoc youths crossed into Marial- Lou Payam, shot and killed five male Dinka Lou-Paher civilians while they were watering their cattle in the area and fled the scene. 

Comment: These events have worsened the security situation in the area as tension is rapidly building up with the possibility of further violence if measures are not taken by authorities to de-escalate the situation. HRD will continue to monitor the situation for more information.

Location of Incident: Ameth-Chok village in Manyangok Payam, Tonj South
Description: 2.	On 6 July, multiple sources reported that, on 4 July, armed Dinka Muok youths shot and killed three male Dinka Thony civilians (ages unspecified) and gang-raped two girls (including a 17-year-old) in Ameth-Chok village in Manyangok Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, these incidents were perpetrated to exact vengeance for past and unresolved grievances between the communities in Tonj South County. Reportedly, the rape survivors were taken to a health facility in Tonj town and later evacuated to a health facility in Wau for advanced treatment.

Location of Incident: Ameth-Chok village in Manyangok Payam, Tonj South
Description: 2.	On 6 July, multiple sources reported that, on 4 July, armed Dinka Muok youths shot and killed three male Dinka Thony civilians (ages unspecified) and gang-raped two girls (including a 17-year-old) in Ameth-Chok village in Manyangok Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, these incidents were perpetrated to exact vengeance for past and unresolved grievances between the communities in Tonj South County. Reportedly, the rape survivors were taken to a health facility in Tonj town and later evacuated to a health facility in Wau for advanced treatment.

Location of Incident: Nzara town, Nzara County
Description:
3.	On 4 July, multiple sources reported that, on 23 June, personnel of the SSNPS shot and killed one male civilian (age unspecified) from the Azande community in Nzara town, Nzara County. According to the sources, the SSNPS personnel stormed the victim’s home, shot and killed him following allegations that the victim was involved in suspicious activities and in keeping of a large of South Sudanese Pounds (SSP). Reportedly, the personnel involved in this incident were arrested and detained for a few days and later released. 

Comment: the arbitrary deprivation of life by the SSNPS flagrantly violates the most fundamental and sacrosanct right to life of the victim and their release from detention without legal due process depicts the prevalence of impunity within the ranks of law enforcement and security personnel.

Location of Incident: Yei town, Yei River
Description:
1.	On 7 July, three secondary sources reported that, on the same day suspected NAS elements abducted three civilians in Yei town, Yei River County. According to the sources, a group of five civilians (four humanitarian workers with a local NGO and a traditional leader- details unspecified) were traveling from Yei town to Logo Boma, Otogo Payam, along the Yei-Maridi-Road, for a peacebuilding activity, when they were all abducted by armed elements suspected of belonging to the NAS. Reportedly, the victims were forced into a nearby bush, where they were interrogated and robbed of their belongings, and two victims were later released while the location of three remains unknown. 

Comment: the abductors have demanded a ransom fee of 16,000 United States Dollar (USD) for their release. HRD will continue to follow up on this incident for more information.

Location of Incident: Yei town, Yei River
Description:
1.	On 7 July, three secondary sources reported that, on the same day suspected NAS elements abducted three civilians in Yei town, Yei River County. According to the sources, a group of five civilians (four humanitarian workers with a local NGO and a traditional leader- details unspecified) were traveling from Yei town to Logo Boma, Otogo Payam, along the Yei-Maridi-Road, for a peacebuilding activity, when they were all abducted by armed elements suspected of belonging to the NAS. Reportedly, the victims were forced into a nearby bush, where they were interrogated and robbed of their belongings, and two victims were later released while the location of three remains unknown. 

Comment: the abductors have demanded a ransom fee of 16,000 United States Dollar (USD) for their release. HRD will continue to follow up on this incident for more information.

Location of Incident: Mangala Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos
Description:
2.	On 7 July, three secondary sources reported that on 1 July, armed Dongotono youths from Chahari Boma, shot and killed two male Logir civilians (aged 20 and 24 years) in Mangala Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos County. According to the sources, the assailants shot and killed the victims in the context of a cattle raid, while the victims were returning their cattle into the cattle camp. Reportedly, the assailants raided 20 heads of cattle and fled the scene, while the incident was reported to the Chahari police station and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made.

Comment: Tension is reportedly building up in the Logir community as armed youths have mobilized to retaliate following this incident. However, security forces have been deployed to maintain calm in the area. HRD will continue to monitor the situation for updates.

Location of Incident: Mangala Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos
Description:
2.	On 7 July, three secondary sources reported that on 1 July, armed Dongotono youths from Chahari Boma, shot and killed two male Logir civilians (aged 20 and 24 years) in Mangala Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos County. According to the sources, the assailants shot and killed the victims in the context of a cattle raid, while the victims were returning their cattle into the cattle camp. Reportedly, the assailants raided 20 heads of cattle and fled the scene, while the incident was reported to the Chahari police station and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made.

Comment: Tension is reportedly building up in the Logir community as armed youths have mobilized to retaliate following this incident. However, security forces have been deployed to maintain calm in the area. HRD will continue to monitor the situation for updates.

Location of Incident: Bulkan area, Manyabol Payam, Gumuruk
Description: 3.	Between 6 and 7 July, multiple sources reported that on 2 July, suspected armed Dinka Bor youths shot and injured one male civilian (Ethiopian national-age unspecified) in the Bulkan area, Manyabol Payam, Gumuruk County, GPAA. According to the sources, the assailants ambushed and attacked six commercial trucks along the Bor – Manyabol – Pibor road, and precisely in-between the Anyidi and Manyabol axis of the road, transporting road construction material (red maram) from Juba to Pibor injuring the victim in the process. Reportedly, four of the trucks reached Pibor while two returned to Bor and the reason for the attack remains unknown.

Location of Incident: Ajalo village, Bor town, Bor South
Description: 4.	On 7 July, multiple sources reported that on 4 July, suspected Murle armed elements shot and injured three male civilians (ages unspecified) in Ajalo village, Bor town, Bor South County. According to the sources, the abductors attacked a truck belonging to a humanitarian organization while it was returning from delivering aid to affected communities in Poktap, Duk County, injuring the victims in the process. Reportedly, this incident was an attempt to stop the distribution of humanitarian assistance to Greater Bor. The injured victims were taken to a health facility in Bor town for treatment, while one victim in critical condition was referred to a health facility in Juba for advanced treatment.

Location of Incident: Nyacharavachiz, Gumuruk County
Description: 5.	On 7 July, one secondary source reported that, on 6 July, authorities in Pibor, GPAA, recovered one 13-year-old girl, a victim of abduction in Pibor, GPAA. According to the sources, the victim was abducted in Nyacharavachiz, Gumuruk County by the armed Lou Nuer elements in March 2025 during the attack on Gumuruk County and taken to an unknown location in Jonglei State. Reportedly, she escaped from her abductors (date unspecified) and was received by authorities in Pibor, who coordinated with humanitarian partners and reunited the victim with her biological mother on 7 July.

Location of Incident: Kiir Adem Payam, Aweil North
Description: 6.	Between 6 and 7 July, three secondary sources reported that on 6 July, armed Rezeigat Pastoralists from Eastern Darfur- Sudan, shot and injured two male Dinka Malual civilians (traders- ages unspecified) in Kiir Adem Payam, Aweil North County. According to the sources, the victims travelled from Gok Machar (Capital town of Aweil North County) to Kiir Adem (the border town between Sudan and South Sudan) to conduct business activities and while returning on a motorcycle, they were attacked by the assailants. Reportedly, the victims were shot and injured and the assailants made away with over 5,000,000 South Sudanese Pounds (SSP) belonging to the victims and took their motorcycle, while one of the victims escaped. The other injured victim was evacuated to a health facility in Aweil town for treatment.

Location of Incident: Kiir Adem Payam, Aweil North
Description: 6.	Between 6 and 7 July, three secondary sources reported that on 6 July, armed Rezeigat Pastoralists from Eastern Darfur- Sudan, shot and injured two male Dinka Malual civilians (traders- ages unspecified) in Kiir Adem Payam, Aweil North County. According to the sources, the victims travelled from Gok Machar (Capital town of Aweil North County) to Kiir Adem (the border town between Sudan and South Sudan) to conduct business activities and while returning on a motorcycle, they were attacked by the assailants. Reportedly, the victims were shot and injured and the assailants made away with over 5,000,000 South Sudanese Pounds (SSP) belonging to the victims and took their motorcycle, while one of the victims escaped. The other injured victim was evacuated to a health facility in Aweil town for treatment.

Location of Incident: Kolier Village, Pachienjok Payam, Panyijar
Description: 8.	On 7 July, three secondary sources reported that on 5 July, two civilians (a 27-year-old Nyuong Nuer woman and a 10-year-old boy) were injured following air strikes by the SSPDF in Kolier Village, Pachienjok Payam, Panyijar County. According to the sources, the airstrikes targeted a Sudan People’s Liberation Army- In Opposition (SPLA-IO) checkpoint in the area, located within a civilian fishing area in Kolier leading to the injury of the victims. Reportedly, the victims were taken to a health facility in Panyijar County for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Pagak-Dit village in Awul Payam, Tonj North
Description: 10.	On 7 July, three secondary sources reported that on 6 July, armed Dinka Leir youths shot and killed four Dinka Noi female civilians (ages unspecified) in Pagak-Dit village in Awul Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Lei youths attacked the Dinka Noi community in Pagak-Dit village, shot and killed the victims who returned to collect food items from their homesteads after being displaced by past conflicts between the communities. Reportedly, the assailants fled the scene, and no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Tonj town, Tonj Payam, Tonj
Description: 11.	On 7 July, three secondary sources reported that on 6 July, armed Dinka Thony youths from Manyangok Payam, gangraped one 46-year-old woman from the Bongo community in Tonj town, Tonj Payam, Tonj County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Thony youths invaded the residence of the victim in search of her husband, whom they believed was responsible for killing three Dinka Thony civilians in Ameth-Chok village on 4 July 2025 [see HRD Daily Report 7 July 2025]. Reportedly, failing to find the husband, they grabbed the survivor and took her to a riverside, where they raped her in turns and left her injured. The survivor was later taken to a health facility in Tonj town, where she received medical and psychosocial support. The incident was reported to the police and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Pathuei village in Wunlit Payam Tonj East
Description: 12.	On 7 July, three secondary sources, reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Gok youths from Cueibet County-Lakes State, shot and killed two male Dinka Jaluau civilians (ages unspecified) and injured one female civilian (age unspecified), in Pathuei village in Wunlit Payam Tonj East County. Reportedly, the incident was within the context of cross-border violence against the bordering Warrap State communities and the assailants fled the scene into Cueibet County and no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Pathuei village in Wunlit Payam Tonj East
Description: 12.	On 7 July, three secondary sources, reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Gok youths from Cueibet County-Lakes State, shot and killed two male Dinka Jaluau civilians (ages unspecified) and injured one female civilian (age unspecified), in Pathuei village in Wunlit Payam Tonj East County. Reportedly, the incident was within the context of cross-border violence against the bordering Warrap State communities and the assailants fled the scene into Cueibet County and no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Marial-Lou Payam, Tonj North
Description: 13.	On 7 July, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Apuk-Patoc youths shot and killed one male Dinka Lou Paher civilian (age unspecified) in Pulbar village in Marial-Lou Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked the Dinka Lou Paher community in Pulbar village, in the context of retaliatory violence for past and unresolved grievances [see HRD Daily Report 7 July 2025]. Reportedly, they shot and killed the victim and fled the scene and no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: (IDP) in Mupoi Payam, Tambura
Description: 14.	On 7 July, multiple secondary sources reported that, on the same day unidentified armed elements shot and killed one civilian (details unspecified) from the Azande community, in an Internally Displaced Persons Camp (IDP) in Mupoi Payam, Tambura County. According to the sources, the assailants opened fire on civilians within the IDP camp for unknown reasons leading to the demise of the victim. Reportedly, since the IDP camp is located near the South Sudan People’s Defense Forces (SSPDF) barracks, one soldier was injured by stray bullets and the assailants fled the scene. No arrests have been made in connection with this incident.

Location of Incident: Marju village, Pakula Boma, Yei Town Payam, Yei River
Description:
1.	On 8 July, three secondary sources reported that on 7 and 8 July, suspected SPLA-IO elements abducted nine male civilians from the Kakwa community in Marju village, Pakula Boma, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, on 7 July, a group of suspected SPLA-IO elements abducted five male civilians from their farms and forced them to carry looted goods to their hideout in the Pakula hills; however, the abductees were reportedly released later on the day. Similarly, on 8 July, the SPLA-IO elements abducted four other young men to carry looted property (goats, chickens, personal belongings). The four abductees reportedly remain in captivity.

Comment: According to the sources, the suspected SPLA-IO elements came from the Panyume cantonment site in Morobo County and may have been displaced/destabilized following SSPDF operations in Panyume Payam in April 2025. Notably, the presence of armed elements continue to pose protection risks for civilians and endanger their livelihoods in the Greater Yei area.

Location of Incident: Wonduruba Boma, Wonduruba Payam Administrative Area
Description:
2.	On 7 July, two secondary sources reported on 7 June, two SSPDF soldiers raped two women (ages 34 and 45 years old) from the Pojulu community in Wonduruba Boma, Wonduruba Payam Administrative Area. According to the sources, two SSPDF soldiers accosted the victims while they were returning home from their farms and proceeded to rape them. The sources further informed that the vicitms reported the incident to their local chief on the same day and on 8 June, the chief reported the case to the Commander of the SSPDF garrison in Wonduruba. The two soldiers were subsequently arrested and on 9 June, they were reportedly transferred to Lainya.

Comments: According to the community leaders, no further information or feedback has been received from the authorities regarding the legal proceedings or disciplinary measures taken against the suspects, raising concerns over accountability and transparency. HRD will follow up on the case.

Location of Incident: Wonduruba Boma, Wonduruba Payam Administrative Area.
Description:
3.	On 7 July, two secondary sources reported that on 30 June, unidentified elements killed one 36-year-old male civilian from the Pojulu community in Wonduruba Boma, Wonduruba Payam Administrative Area. According to the sources, the victim was found dead at the Togolo gold mining stream, where he had been working as part of a local artisanal mining group. The victim had reportedly left his camp to mine independently near the stream. The victim’s mobile phone and gold were allegedly missing at the time his body was recovered. The incident was reported to the police at Kuda on 1 July and investigations are reportedly underway.

Comments: Community leaders expressed concern that the killing may have been perpetrated by individuals from a nearby group of miners—specifically members of the Dinka community—due to tensions over access to and control of the goldmine. HRD is closely following up on the case.

Location of Incident: Mogos Boma, Mogos Payam, Kapoeta East
Description: 4.	On 8 July, three secondary sources reported that on 6 July, armed Jie youths shot and killed two male civilians (ages 28 and 32 years old) from the Toposa community in Mogos Boma, Mogos Payam, Kapoeta East County. According to the sources, the Jie armed youths opened fire on the victims at the outskirt of Magos Boma as they pursued armed Toposa youths who had raided 150 heads of cattle belonging to the Jie community. The armed Jie youths reportedly recovered all of the raided cattle during the pursuit.

Location of Incident: Mogos Boma, Mogos Payam, Kapoeta East
Description: 4.	On 8 July, three secondary sources reported that on 6 July, armed Jie youths shot and killed two male civilians (ages 28 and 32 years old) from the Toposa community in Mogos Boma, Mogos Payam, Kapoeta East County. According to the sources, the Jie armed youths opened fire on the victims at the outskirt of Magos Boma as they pursued armed Toposa youths who had raided 150 heads of cattle belonging to the Jie community. The armed Jie youths reportedly recovered all of the raided cattle during the pursuit.

Location of Incident: Kuer-Aguak village, Awul Payam, Tonj North
Description:
5.	On 9 July, three primary sources reported that on 6 July, the SSPDF and SSNPS extrajudicially executed one 15-year-old male juvenile from the Dinka Noi community in Kuer-Aguak village, Awul Payam, Tonj North County. As recounted by the sources, on 5 July, security personnel arrested the victim while committing cattle theft in Awul Payam and detained him at the Warrap Town Police Station. Reportedly, on 6 July, joint SSPDF and SSNPS personnel extracted the victim from Warrap Town Police Station and transferred him to Kuer-Aguak village along Wau road, where he was executed by firing squad, allegedly on the orders of two senior state officials. The body of the victim was reportedly handed over to his relatives the next day for interment.

Comment: The latest incident brings to 16 the number of extrajudicial executions recorded in Warrap State since January 2025.

Location of Incident: Apor-Lok village, Kirik Payam, Tonj North
Description: 6.	On 8 July, three primary sources reported that on 6 July, armed Dinka Noi youths shot and killed two male civilians from the Dinka Leir community in Apor-Lok village, Kirik Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Noi youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Leir community in Apor-Lok village, killing two civilians and thereafter fled back into Awul Payam. The attack was reportedly a revenge action linked to ongoing retaliation violence between the Dinka Noi and Dinka Leir communities.

Location of Incident: Bafuro village, Nabanga Boma, Tambura Town Payam, Tambura
Description:
7.	On 8 July, multiple sources reported that on 6 July, unidentified armed elements shot and injured two girls (ages 12 and 15 years old) from the Azande community in Bafuro village, Nabanga Boma, Tambura Town Payam, Tambura County. According to the sources, the armed assailants attacked Bafuro village, forcing residents to flee for safety, and in the ensuing chaos, opened fire on the victims, injuring them. The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Tambura Town for medical treatment. The incident was reported to the Tambura police; however, no arrests have been made so far.

Comment: The escalating insecurity in Tambura County continues to heighten tensions, severely impacting civilians daily life and disrupting livelihood activities. This climate of fear and instability is undermining fundamental rights and restricting freedom of movement and access to essential services, further exacerbating the local population's vulnerability.

Location of Incident: Munuki residential area, Juba
Description:
1.	On 10 July, two secondary sources reported that on 1 July, joint security personnel arbitrarily arrested, detained and conscripted one male civilian (a final-year student from the Catholic University of South Sudan) in Munuki residential area, Juba City. According to the sources, the joint security forces arrested the victim while he was sitting outside a retail shop in the Munuki residential area, detained him, and subsequently transferred him to Nasir County, where he is reportedly being detained in a remote area.

Comment: HRD will continue to follow up on the report.

Location of Incident: Tirangore Boma, Hiyala Payam, Torit
Description: 2.	On 10 July, three secondary sources reported that on 8 July, SSPDF soldiers arbitrarily arrested, ill-treated and detained one 32-year-old male civilian from the Lutoko community in Tirangore Boma, Hiyala Payam, Torit County. According to the sources, the SSPDF soldiers stormed Tirangore Boma and began an illegal search of houses in the area without a warrant and without stating the objective of the search. Reportedly, the soldiers arrested the victim from his house while he was preparing to go to his farm and beat him up as they transferred him to their barracks in Tirangore Boma, where he remains in incommunicado detention without any charge.

Location of Incident: Greater Akobo
Description: 3.	On 10 July, multiple sources reported that between 8 and 9 July, three child victims of abduction (three boys aged between 14 – 17 years old) were recovered by the authorities in Akobo Town, Akobo County. According to the sources, the children were abducted from different locations in Greater Akobo by Murle armed elements (exact date unspecified) and transferred to Likuangole County, GPAA. One of the victims (aged 14 years) was abducted from Kaikuiny, Buong Payam, Akobo County in December 2024. Reportedly, the victims escaped from their abductors (date unspecified) and were recovered by the authorities in Akobo County and placed in protective custody, pending family tracing and reunification.

Location of Incident: Walgak Payam, Akobo
Description: 4.	On 10 July, one primary source reported that on 8 July, one female victim of abduction (23-year-old) from the Lou Nuer community was recovered by the authorities in Pibor, GPAA. As recounted by the source, Murle armed elements abducted the survivor together with many other civilians from Walgak Payam, Akobo County in 2023 (exact date unspecified) and transferred them to Wunkok Payam, Likuangole County. The survivor was reportedly subjected to physical and sexual assault while in captivity. The survivor reportedly escaped on 8 July and was received by authorities in Pibor, and on 9 July, the police referred the survivor to the intensive care centre, where she received medical and psychosocial support and awaiting family tracing and reunification.

Location of Incident: Dindin Boma, Bow Payam, Leer
Description:
5.	On 10 July, multiple secondary sources reported that on 6 July, allied SPLA-IO and armed Dok Nuer youths shot and killed one 19-year-old male civilian from the Dok Nuer male in Dindin Boma, Bow Payam, Leer County. According to the sources, the victim (son of the newly appointed Payam Administrator) was shot and killed during an armed confrontation between the allied SPLA-IO and armed Dok Nuer youths (opposing the appointment of the new Payam Administrator) and another group of armed youths (providing security to the newly appointed Payam Administrator). Reportedly, security forces from another division of the SPLA-IO have been deployed to the area to de-escalate the situation although no arrests have been made.

Comment: The allied SPLA-IO and armed Dok Nuer youths opposed the appointment of the new Payam Administrator by the Leer County Commissioner on allegations that the Payam Administrator has allegiance to the SPLM-IG and not to SPLA/M-IO.

Location of Incident: Akop and Paweng Payams in Tonj North and East
Description:
6.	On 10 July, multiple sources reported that on the same day, 38 civilians were shot and killed and at least eight others were injured during violence between allied armed Dinka Lou-Paher-Dinka Luanyjang youths and armed Dinka Apuk-Patoc in Akop and Paweng Payams in Tonj North and East Counties, respectively. According to the sources, the allied armed Dinka Lou-Paher and Dinka Luanyjang youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Apuk-Patoc community in Akop Town, Ako Payam, Tonj North County, killing eight civilians including one woman and injuring eight other male civilians. In retaliation, the armed Dinka Apuk-Patoc youths reportedly attacked Abuong village in Paweng Payam, Tonj East County, killing 30 male civilians (11 Dinka Lou-Paher and 19 Dinka Luanyjang) while they were grazing and watering their cattle, and injuring an unspecified number of civilians. The sources further informed that  six armed Dinka Lou-Paher youths were also shot and killed during the fighting. The injured victims from the Dinka Apuk-Patoc community were evacuated to a health care facility in Akop Payam for medical treatment.

Comment: The attack is linked to ongoing revenge violence between the Dinka Apuk-Patoc, Dinka Lou-Paher and Dinka Luanyjang communities. Reportedly, the State authorities are planning to visit the area in an attempt to de-escalate tensions and resolve the grievances between these communities.

Location of Incident: Akop and Paweng Payams in Tonj North and East
Description:
6.	On 10 July, multiple sources reported that on the same day, 38 civilians were shot and killed and at least eight others were injured during violence between allied armed Dinka Lou-Paher-Dinka Luanyjang youths and armed Dinka Apuk-Patoc in Akop and Paweng Payams in Tonj North and East Counties, respectively. According to the sources, the allied armed Dinka Lou-Paher and Dinka Luanyjang youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Apuk-Patoc community in Akop Town, Ako Payam, Tonj North County, killing eight civilians including one woman and injuring eight other male civilians. In retaliation, the armed Dinka Apuk-Patoc youths reportedly attacked Abuong village in Paweng Payam, Tonj East County, killing 30 male civilians (11 Dinka Lou-Paher and 19 Dinka Luanyjang) while they were grazing and watering their cattle, and injuring an unspecified number of civilians. The sources further informed that  six armed Dinka Lou-Paher youths were also shot and killed during the fighting. The injured victims from the Dinka Apuk-Patoc community were evacuated to a health care facility in Akop Payam for medical treatment.

Comment: The attack is linked to ongoing revenge violence between the Dinka Apuk-Patoc, Dinka Lou-Paher and Dinka Luanyjang communities. Reportedly, the State authorities are planning to visit the area in an attempt to de-escalate tensions and resolve the grievances between these communities.

Location of Incident: Akal-Keu village in Tonj Payam, Tonj South
Description: 7.	On 10 July, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Thony youths shot and injured one boy from the Dinka Muok community during a cattle raid in Akal-Keu village in Tonj Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Thony youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Muok community in Akal-Keu village, injuring one child. The attacker also raided 16 heads of cattle from the victim’s homestead and thereafter fled into Manyangok Payam. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Tonj Payam for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Akal-Keu village in Tonj Payam, Tonj South
Description: 7.	On 10 July, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Thony youths shot and injured one boy from the Dinka Muok community during a cattle raid in Akal-Keu village in Tonj Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Thony youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Muok community in Akal-Keu village, injuring one child. The attacker also raided 16 heads of cattle from the victim’s homestead and thereafter fled into Manyangok Payam. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Tonj Payam for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Tserentegy Boma, Ikotos Payam, Ikotos
Description: 1.	On 10 and 11 July, three secondary sources reported that on 7 July, armed Logir youths from Rumola Boma, Chahari Payam shot and injured one 26-year-old male civilian from the Lango community in Tserentegy Boma, Ikotos Payam, Ikotos County. According to the sources, a group of seven armed Logir youths attacked and opened fire on the victim while he was travelling on motorcycle along the Tserentegy-Ikotos Road, injuring him, reportedly in revenge for the killing of a 30-year-old Logir male civilian by armed Lango youths in Ikotos Boma, Ikotos Payam on 3 November 2023 [see HRD Daily Report 7 November 2023]. Reportedly, the victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Ikotos Payam for medical treatment. The Incident was reported at Ikotos Police Station and investigation is reportedly ongoing; however,  no arrest has been made.

Location of Incident: in Walgak Payam, Akobo
Description:
2.	On 11 July, multiple sources reported that on 10 July, two civilians were shot and killed and four others were injured during violence between armed youths from the Cie-Luony and Cie-rut sub-clans of the Lou Nuer community in Walgak Payam, Akobo County. According to the sources, armed Cie-Luony youths shot and killed one male civilian from the Cie-rut sub-clan for past unresolved grievances between the two communities. Reportedly, in retaliation, armed Cie-rut youths attacked the Cie-Luony community,  killing of two male civilians (one from Cie-rut and one Cie-Luony) and injuring of four others (two Cie-Luony and two Cie-rut). The sources further informed that the Akobo County Commissioner, who was on peace tour within Akobo West sub-county, responded to the and calmed the situation.  

Comment: The incident has reportedly worsened the security situation in the area as tension is rapidly building up with the likelihood of more revenge violence in the absence of  concrete measures taken by the authorities to de-escalate the situation.

Location of Incident: in Walgak Payam, Akobo
Description:
2.	On 11 July, multiple sources reported that on 10 July, two civilians were shot and killed and four others were injured during violence between armed youths from the Cie-Luony and Cie-rut sub-clans of the Lou Nuer community in Walgak Payam, Akobo County. According to the sources, armed Cie-Luony youths shot and killed one male civilian from the Cie-rut sub-clan for past unresolved grievances between the two communities. Reportedly, in retaliation, armed Cie-rut youths attacked the Cie-Luony community,  killing of two male civilians (one from Cie-rut and one Cie-Luony) and injuring of four others (two Cie-Luony and two Cie-rut). The sources further informed that the Akobo County Commissioner, who was on peace tour within Akobo West sub-county, responded to the and calmed the situation.  

Comment: The incident has reportedly worsened the security situation in the area as tension is rapidly building up with the likelihood of more revenge violence in the absence of  concrete measures taken by the authorities to de-escalate the situation.

Location of Incident: Dengdor village, Nyirol County and Walgak and Bilkey Payams, Akobo
Description:
3.	On 11 July, multiple sources reported that on 10 July, three child victims of abduction (between 9 – 14 years old), who had been abducted by Murle armed elements from Dengdor village, Nyirol County and Walgak and Bilkey Payams, Akobo County [exact dates unspecified], were recovered by the authorities in Akobo Town, Akobo County. According to the sources, the survivors escaped from their abductors (date unspecified) in Lokormach Payam, Likuangole County, Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) and were received by the authorities in Akobo Town and placed under protective custody. The local authorities and humanitarian partners have reportedly initiated family tracing and reunification process for the survivors. 
Comment: Notably, between 14 June 2025 and 11 July 2025, 10 victims of abduction (two women and eight boys including two infant) have been recovered by the authorities in Akobo County and awaiting family re-unification.

Location of Incident: Zhobor fishing area in Kuerguini Payam, Guit
Description:
4.	On July, one primary source reported that on 3 July, unidentified armed elements raped five female civilians (ages unspecified) from the Leek Nuer community in the Zhobor fishing area in Kuerguini Payam, Guit County. As recounted by the source, the unidentified armed elements attacked a group of nine Leek Nuer female civilians while they were harvesting waterlilies in Zhobor fishing area, proceeded to rape five of them at gunpoint while the others managed to escape. The incident was reported at the Thoan Police Station. The survivors were taken to a health care facility in Bentiu for medical examination and psychosocial support. 

Comment: HRD will follow up to gather more information on the report.

Location of Incident: Makuac and Wunlit Payams, Tonj East County
Description:
5.	On 13 July, multiple sources reported that on 11 and 12 July, 51 civilians were shot and killed (34 from the Dinka Luanyjang community and 17 from the Dinka Jaluau community) and eight others from the Dinka Jaluau including three women were injured during violence between the armed Dinka Jaluau and Dinka Luanyjang youths in Makuac and Wunlit Payams, Tonj East County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Jaluau youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Luanyjang community in Acom-Wot village, Makuac Payam, killing 34 male civilians. The attackers also burnt over 16 homesteads. In retaliation, armed Dinka Luanyjang youths attacked the Dinka Jaluau community in Bul-Dit village, Wunlit Payam and killed 17 male civilians and injured eight others including three women. The injured victims were evacuated to a health facility in Tonj Town for medical treatment. 

Comment: The incident is linked to ongoing revenge violence between the two communities.

Location of Incident: Makuac and Wunlit Payams, Tonj East County
Description:
5.	On 13 July, multiple sources reported that on 11 and 12 July, 51 civilians were shot and killed (34 from the Dinka Luanyjang community and 17 from the Dinka Jaluau community) and eight others from the Dinka Jaluau including three women were injured during violence between the armed Dinka Jaluau and Dinka Luanyjang youths in Makuac and Wunlit Payams, Tonj East County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Jaluau youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Luanyjang community in Acom-Wot village, Makuac Payam, killing 34 male civilians. The attackers also burnt over 16 homesteads. In retaliation, armed Dinka Luanyjang youths attacked the Dinka Jaluau community in Bul-Dit village, Wunlit Payam and killed 17 male civilians and injured eight others including three women. The injured victims were evacuated to a health facility in Tonj Town for medical treatment. 

Comment: The incident is linked to ongoing revenge violence between the two communities.

Location of Incident: Makuac and Wunlit Payams, Tonj East County
Description:
5.	On 13 July, multiple sources reported that on 11 and 12 July, 51 civilians were shot and killed (34 from the Dinka Luanyjang community and 17 from the Dinka Jaluau community) and eight others from the Dinka Jaluau including three women were injured during violence between the armed Dinka Jaluau and Dinka Luanyjang youths in Makuac and Wunlit Payams, Tonj East County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Jaluau youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Luanyjang community in Acom-Wot village, Makuac Payam, killing 34 male civilians. In retaliation, armed Dinka Luanyjang youths attacked the Dinka Jaluau community in Bul-Dit village, Wunlit Payam and killed 17 male civilians and injured eight others including three women. The injured victims were evacuated to a health facility in Tonj Town for medical treatment. 

Comment: The incident is linked to ongoing revenge violence between the two communities.

Location of Incident: Tonj Town, Tonj Payam, Tonj South
Description: 7.	On 13 July, four secondary sources reported that on 10 July, one SSNPS personnel shot and injured two male civilians from the Dinka Muok community in Tonj Town, Tonj Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, the SSNPS personnel, who was officially providing security at a function, opened fire on the attendees some of whom had trampled on him, injuring two civilians and killing one officer of the National Security Service (NSS. Reportedly, the suspect surrendered himself to the police and was placed under police custody pending investigation. The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Tonj Payam for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Tonj Town, Tonj Payam, Tonj South
Description: 7.	On 13 July, four secondary sources reported that on 10 July, one SSNPS personnel shot and injured two male civilians from the Dinka Muok community in Tonj Town, Tonj Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, the SSNPS personnel, who was officially providing security at a function, opened fire on the attendees some of whom had trampled on him, injuring two civilians and killing one officer of the National Security Service (NSS. Reportedly, the suspect surrendered himself to the police and was placed under police custody pending investigation. The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Tonj Payam for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Yieth-Liet village, Kuac South Payam, Gogrial West
Description: 8.	On 13 July, three secondary sources reported that on 8 July, one SSNPS personnel shot and killed one male civilian in Yieth-Liet village, Kuac South Payam, Gogrial West County. According to the sources, the SSNPS officer was attempting to arrest the victim following a dispute between the officer and the victim for disregarding a police order involving the payment of some goats. Reportedly, while the victim stopped to explain himself, the SSNPS officer opened fire, killing him. The SSNPS officer was arrested and detained at Kuajock South Police Station.

Location of Incident: Zangia village, Tambura Payam, Tambura
Description: 9.	On 12 July, two secondary sources reported that on the same day, unidentified armed elements shot and killed four civilians including one eight-year-old girl and a 12-year-old boy and injured another male civilian, all from the Balanda community, in Zangia village, Tambura Payam, Tambura County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked and opened fire on the victims at their homestead, killing four and injuring one. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Tambura Town for medical treatment. The incident was reported to the police and the security forces; however, no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Zangia village, Tambura Payam, Tambura
Description: 9.	On 12 July, two secondary sources reported that on the same day, unidentified armed elements shot and killed four civilians including one eight-year-old girl and a 12-year-old boy and injured another male civilian, all from the Balanda community, in Zangia village, Tambura Payam, Tambura County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked and opened fire on the victims at their homestead, killing four and injuring one. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Tambura Town for medical treatment. The incident was reported to the police and the security forces; however, no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Tambura Town Payam, Tambura
Description:
10.	On 12 July, two secondary sources reported that on the same day, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one male civilian from the Azande community on the Maiku bridge in Tambura Town Payam, Tambura County. According to the sources, the assailnats attacked and opened fire on the victim while he was returning to his shelter in an internally displaced persons (IDP) camp, killing him, for unknown reasons. The incident was reported to the police for investigation. 

Comment: The security situation in Tambura remains dire, with repeated attacks on civilians, including children by unidentified armed elements. Despite the deployment of organized forces

Location of Incident: Roni, Yei River
Description: 1.	On 14 July, four secondary sources reported that on 7 July, one SSNPS officer raped a 33-year-old woman from the Kakwa community in Roni, Yei River County. As recounted by the sources, the survivor had a fight with another woman who sustained and the issue was reported to the police officer, who subsequently arrested the survivor and took her to the area chief in the night. However, the chief advised police officer to take the woman back to her home and return the following morning since it was already late. Reportedly, on their way back home, he threatened the woman and raped her. The case was reported to the police on 8 July and the survivor was referred to a health care center in Yei Town on same day for medical examination, which confirmed the rape. The sources further informed that the perpetrator escaped after the incident and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Location of Incident: Magos, Kapoeta East
Description: 2.	On 14 July, three secondary sources reported that on 12 July, armed Toposa youths from Moga Payam shot and injured one 36-year-old male civilian from the Jie community in Mogos Boma, Mogos Payam, Kapoeta East County. According to the sources, a group of five armed Toposa youths ambushed and opened fire on a commercial vehicle carrying Jie and Murle businesspeople travelling to Boma County, Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) via Lopiet, injuring one of the passengers. The sources further informed that the attack was a revenge action for the killing of two male civilians from the Toposa community by armed Jie youths during a cattle raid in Mogos Boma on 6 July [see HRD Daily Report 10 July 2025].

Location of Incident: Tiap-Tiap Payam, Cueibet
Description: 3.	On 13 and 14 July, one secondary source reported that on 10 July, suspected armed Dinka Jaluau youths from Tonj East County, Warrap State shot and killed two civilians (one 14-year-old girl and one man) and injured two others (one pregnant woman and one man), all from the Dinka Gok community, in Tiap-Tiap Payam, Cueibet County. According to the source, the suspected armed Dinka Jaluau youths attacked and opened fire on the victims at their homestead, resulting in the reported casualties and thereafter fled the scene. The motive for the attack remains unknown. The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Cueibet Town for medical treatment. The authorities in Tiap-Tiap have reportedly initiated an investigation into the incident.

Location of Incident: Tiap-Tiap Payam, Cueibet
Description: 3.	On 13 and 14 July, one secondary source reported that on 10 July, suspected armed Dinka Jaluau youths from Tonj East County, Warrap State shot and killed two civilians (one 14-year-old girl and one man) and injured two others (one pregnant woman and one man), all from the Dinka Gok community, in Tiap-Tiap Payam, Cueibet County. According to the source, the suspected armed Dinka Jaluau youths attacked and opened fire on the victims at their homestead, resulting in the reported casualties and thereafter fled the scene. The motive for the attack remains unknown. The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Cueibet Town for medical treatment. The authorities in Tiap-Tiap have reportedly initiated an investigation into the incident.

Location of Incident: Malakia residential area in Rumbek Town, Rumbek Central
Description: 4.	Between 12 and 14 July, one secondary source reported that on 11 July, two SSNPS officers gangraped a 14-year-old girl from the Dinka Ngok community in the Malakia residential area in Rumbek Town, Rumbek Central County. According to the source, the victim was accosted by a group of SSNPS and SSPDF personnel while she stepped out of her residence, took her into a nearby tukul where she was raped by two SSNPS officers. The victim was taken to a health care facility in Rumbek Town for medical treatment. The incident was reported to the police and three suspects have been arrested and detained at the Rock City military detention center for further investigations.

Location of Incident: Neemchidong village, Thoan Boma, Kuerguini Payam, Guit
Description: 5.	On 14 July, one primary source reported that on 21 April, unidentified armed elements raped 10 female civilians (ages unspecified) from the Leek Nuer community in Neemchidong village, Thoan Boma, Kuerguini Payam, Guit County. As recounted by the source, the armed elements accosted the victims while they had gone out from the IDP camp in Bentiu in search of firewood and raped them at gunpoint. The survivors reported the incident to the police in Bieh IDP camp in Rubkona County.

Location of Incident: Akol-Awet village, Awul Payam, Tonj North
Description: 7.	On 14 July, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Noi youths shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Lou-Ariik community in Akol-Awet village, Awul Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Noi youths ambushed and opened fire on the victim while he was travelling on a motorcycle to Alabek through Akop Payam, killing him. The incident is linked to the ongoing violence between the Dinka Noi of Awul Payam and the Dinka Leir of Kirik Payam and their allies (Apuk-Patoc, Awan, Jurbol, Lou-Ariik).

Location of Incident: Tit-Magak village Manyangok Payam, Tonj South
Description: 8.	On 14 July, three secondary sources reported that on 13 July, armed Dinka Muok youths from Tonj Payam, shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Thony community in Tit-Magak village Manyangok Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Muok youths ambushed and opened fire on the while he was returning from Manyangok to Tonj Town, killing him. The incident is reportedly linked to escalating communal violence between the Dinka Thony and the allied Dinka Yar, Muok and Apuk-Jurwir in Tonj South County. The sources further informed that security forces were deployed to the area to investigate and apprehend the perpetrators.

Location of Incident: Manyatta Block area, Tonj Town, Tonj Payam, Tonj South
Description: 9.	On 14 July, four secondary sources reported that on 11 July, one SSPDF soldier shot and killed one civilian from the Dinka Muok community in Manyatta Block area, Tonj Town, Tonj Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, the SSPDF opened fire on the victim during an altercation between the two at a local brewery in Manyatta Block area, killing the victim. Reportedly, the soldier surrendered himself to the police in Tonj Town.

Location of Incident: Manyatta Block area, Tonj Town, Tonj Payam, Tonj South
Description: 10.	Consequently, on 12 July, joint SSPDF and NSS personnel extrajudicially executed the SSPDF soldier in Tonj Town. Reportedly, the joint security forces, allegedly on the orders of a senior state official, extracted the soldier from the Tonj Town Police Station and took him to the outskirts of Tonj Town where he was executed by firing squad.

Location of Incident: Makuei-Karthiith village, Tonj Town, Tonj Payam, Tonj South
Description: 11.	On 14 July, four secondary sources reported that on 11 July, combined SSPDF and NSS personnel, extrajudicially executed one male SSNPS officer in Makuei-Karthiith village, Tonj Town, Tonj Payam, Tonj South County, reportedly for the killing of one NSS officer and injuring of two civilians in Tonj Town on 10 July [see HRD Daily Report 14 July 2025]. Reportedly, the joint security forces, allegedly acting on the orders of a senior state officer, extracted the victim from police custody and transferred him to Makuei-Karthiith village in the outskirts of Tonj Town where they executed him by firing squad.

Location of Incident: Nimule Municipality, Magwi
Description: 1.	On 15 July, three secondary sources reported that on 1 July, joint security forces [South Sudan People’s Defense Forces (SSPDF), South Sudan National Police Service (SSNPS), Wildlife authority, and the National Prison Service of South Sudan (NPSSS)] shot and killed one 43-year-old male civilian (Sudanese national) in Nimule Municipality, Magwi County. According to the sources, a group of 15 joint state security forces who were patrolling Nimule Town opened fire on the victim at the market area in Nimule Town when he attempted to escape after they ordered him to come to them, killing him. The incident was reported to the police in Nimule.

Location of Incident: Kuerganchew village, Fangak
Description: 2.	On 15 July, multiple sources reported that on 2 July, the SSPDF and allied forces shot and killed one male civilian, injured another, and abducted three others (ages 17, 18 and 19 years old) in Kuerganchew village, Fangak County. According to the sources, a group of SSPDF soldiers and allied forces came to Kuerganchew village on speedboat guised as humanitarian workers and requested to see the commander of the Sudan People’s Liberation Army-In Opposition (SPLA-IO). However, upon reaching at the commander’s location, they opened fire, but the commander and the soldiers escaped. Reportedly, in fury, the SSPDF attempted to abduct some youths in the area, and as they resisted, one was shot and killed, another was injured, and three others abducted and taken to New Fangak County. The three abductees were subsequently released on 5 July.

Location of Incident: Kuerganchew village, Fangak
Description: 2.	On 15 July, multiple sources reported that on 2 July, the SSPDF and allied forces shot and killed one male civilian, injured another, and abducted three others (ages 17, 18 and 19 years old) in Kuerganchew village, Fangak County. According to the sources, a group of SSPDF soldiers and allied forces came to Kuerganchew village on speedboat guised as humanitarian workers and requested to see the commander of the Sudan People’s Liberation Army-In Opposition (SPLA-IO). However, upon reaching at the commander’s location, they opened fire, but the commander and the soldiers escaped. Reportedly, in fury, the SSPDF attempted to abduct some youths in the area, and as they resisted, one was shot and killed, another was injured, and three others abducted and taken to New Fangak County. The three abductees were subsequently released on 5 July.

Location of Incident: Kuerganchew village, Fangak
Description: 2.	On 15 July, multiple sources reported that on 2 July, the SSPDF and allied forces shot and killed one male civilian, injured another, and abducted three others (ages 17, 18 and 19 years old) in Kuerganchew village, Fangak County. According to the sources, a group of SSPDF soldiers and allied forces came to Kuerganchew village on speedboat guised as humanitarian workers and requested to see the commander of the Sudan People’s Liberation Army-In Opposition (SPLA-IO). However, upon reaching at the commander’s location, they opened fire, but the commander and the soldiers escaped. Reportedly, in fury, the SSPDF attempted to abduct some youths in the area, and as they resisted, one was shot and killed, another was injured, and three others abducted and taken to New Fangak County. The three abductees were subsequently released on 5 July.

Location of Incident: Lou-Noi village, Awul Payam, Tonj North
Description: 3.	On 15 July, three secondary sources reported that on 13 July, the SSPDF extrajudicially executed one 28-year-old male civilian from the Dinka Noi community in Lou-Noi village, Awul Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the security forces arrested the victim on 10 July in Awul Payam and detained him at Warrap Town Police Station for the murder of one woman from the Dinka Leir community woman in Manlor Payam on 6 July. on 13 July, the SSPDF extracted the victim from detention and took him to Lou-Noi village where they executed him by firing squad, allegedly on the orders of a senior SSPDF officer. The body of the victim was retrieved the following day by his relatives.

Location of Incident: Wut-Kec village, Tonj Payam in Tonj South
Description: 4.	On 15 July, three secondary sources reported that on 14 July, armed Dinka Thony youths from Manyangok Payam, shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Muok community in Wut-Kec village, Tonj Payam in Tonj South County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Thony youths attacked and opened fire on the victim at his homestead in Wut-Kec village, killing him and thereafter fled the scene. The attack is linked to ongoing retaliatory violence between the Dinka Thony and the allied Dinka Yar, Muok and Apuk-Jurwir communities.

Location of Incident: Panhom-Mir village, Aliek Payam, Tonj North
Description: 5.	On 15 July, three secondary sources reported that on 14 July, armed Dinka Atok youths from Awul Payam shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Kongor community in Panhom-Mir village, Aliek Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Atok youths attacked and opened fire on the victim at his homestead in Panhom-Mir village, killing him and thereafter fled the scene.  The attack was reportedly a revenge action connected to the cyclical retaliatory violence for past attacks and unresolved grievances between the Dinka Noi (and their Atok allies) and the Dinka Leir and their allies in Tonj North County.

Location of Incident: Hai Agok residential area of Wau Town, Wau
Description:
6.	On 15 July, multiple sources reported that on 9 July, two SSPDF soldiers and one male civilian raped three girls (ages 14, 15, 16 years old) in Hai Agok residential area of Wau Town, Wau County. According to the sources, the victims were tricked into taking photos with the suspects in nearby bushes in the Hai Agok area, after which the suspects forced them into the bush where they raped the girls and held them for three days. Reportedly, on 12 July, the victims escaped, and the incident was reported to the police. One of the SSPDF soldiers and the civilian man were subsequently apprehended while the other SSPDF soldier remains at large.

Comment: The suspects were later released on bail, pending an age assessment of the victims by the police and a letter will be sent to the commander of the SSPDF to hand over the other suspect for legal proceedings.

Location of Incident: Tambura town, Tambura
Description: 7.	On 15 July, two secondary sources reported that on the same day, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one male civilian (a refugee from the Democratic Republic of Congo) in Tambura Town, Tambura County. According to the sources, the assailants ambushed and opened fire on the victim as he was travelling from Tambura Town to Source Yubo, killing him. Reportedly, the East African Community Regional Force (EACRF) deployed to Tambura County responded to the scene and retrieved the body of the victim and handed it to the police in Tambura for investigation.

Location of Incident: Gurei residential area, Juba City
Description: 1.	On 16 July, one secondary source reported that on the same day, SSPDF soldiers arbitrarily arrested and detained two civilians (one man and one woman) in Gurei residential area, Juba City. According to the source, the SSPDF forcibly entered a residential compound in Gurei and arrested the victims without a warrant or charge and detained them at the South Sudan National Police Service (SSNPS) Criminal Investigation Department detention facility at the Northern Police Division. The motive for the arrest and detention remain unclear. Reportedly, access has been denied to the victim’s relatives.

Location of Incident: Lolepan Boma, Najie Payam, Kapoeta North
Description: 2.	On 16 July, three secondary sources reported that on 9 July, armed Buya youths from Kimotong Payam-Budi County shot and killed one 27-year-old male Toposa civilian in Lolepan Boma, Najie Payam, Kapoeta North County. According to the sources, the armed Buya youths attacked a cattle camp in Lolepan Boma and opened fire on the victim, killing him. The attackers also raided 150 heads of cattle. The incident was reported at Riwoto Police Station and investigations are reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: Lolepan Boma, Najie Payam, Kapoeta North
Description: 2.	On 16 July, three secondary sources reported that on 9 July, armed Buya youths from Kimotong Payam-Budi County shot and killed one 27-year-old male Toposa civilian in Lolepan Boma, Najie Payam, Kapoeta North County. According to the sources, the armed Buya youths attacked a cattle camp in Lolepan Boma and opened fire on the victim, killing him. The attackers also raided 150 heads of cattle. The incident was reported at Riwoto Police Station and investigations are reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: Wulang village, Ajak Kuac Payam, Twic
Description: 3.	On 16 July, three secondary sources reported that on 15 July, armed Nuer elements from Mayom County, Unity State shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Twic Mayardit community in Wulang village, Ajak Kuac Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, the armed Nuer elements ambushed the victim while he was travelling from Abiemnom in the Ruweng Administrative Area. The attack is reportedly linked to the cross-border violence involving communities along the Warrap-Unity border.

Location of Incident: Banzua area, Tambura Town, Tambura
Description: 4.	On 16 July, two secondary sources reported that on the same day, suspected SPLA-IO elements shot and killed two male civilians from the Azande community in Banzua area, Tambura Town, Tambura County. According to the sources, the suspected SPLA-IO elements ambushed and opened fire on the victims while they were returning from their farms killing them. Reportedly, the East African Community Regional Force (EACRF) were deployed to the area to retrieve the bodies of the victims, while the SSPDF were also deployed to maintain security in the area.

Location of Incident: Batalado Boma, Chukudum Payam, Budi
Description:
1.	On 17 July, three sources reported that on 11 July, armed Didinga youths from Kikilai Boma shot and killed one 50-year-old male civilian from the Didinga community in Batalado Boma, Chukudum Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, a group of 20 armed Didinga youths stormed Batalado Boma and opened fire on the victim, killing him, reportedly in revenge for the killing of one 25-year-old Didinga male civilian from Kikilai Boma by armed Didinga youths from Batalado Boma on 22 June 2025 [see HRD Daily Report 25 June 2025]. 

Comment: According to the sources, the incident heightened tensions in the area amidst reports of armed youths from Batalado Boma mobilizing for further revenge. Reportedly, the authorities of Budi County have intervened to de-escalate the situation and apprehend the perpetrators.

Location of Incident: Meleganyi Payam in Gumuruk
Description: 2.	On 17 July, one secondary source reported that on 15 July, a three-year-old boy from the Murle community, who had been abducted by Lou Nuer armed elements from Meleganyi Payam in Gumuruk County in March 2025 (exact date unspecified) and taken to an unknown location in Jonglei State, was recovered and reunited with his family in Pibor, GPAA. Reportedly, the victim escaped from his abductors and was recovered by the authorities in Jonglei State (exact date unspecified) and on 15 July he was transferred to Pibor and placed under intensive care. He was subsequently reunited with his family on 17 July.

Location of Incident: Hai Sinaeeya suburb of Tonj Town, Tonj Payam, Tonj South
Description:
3.	On 17 July, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Thony youths from Manyangok Payam shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Yar community in Hai Sinaeeya suburb of Tonj Town, Tonj Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked and opened fire on the victim at home, injuring him. The victim was evacuated to a hospital in Tonj Town for medical treatment; however, he succumbed to the injury. Reportedly, security forces were deployed to investigate the incident, but no arrests have been made.

Comment: The attack reportedly occurred in the context of ongoing retaliatory violence between the Dinka Thony and the allied Dinka Yar, Muok and Apuk-Jurwir in Tonj South County.

Location of Incident: Lui Payam, Mundri East
Description: 4.	On 17 July, two secondary sources reported that on 16 July, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one female civilian and injured a male civilian in Lui Payam, Mundri East County. According to the sources, the assailants ambushed a private vehicle with passengers aboard along the Mundri-Juba Road in Lui Payam, killing one of the passengers and injuring another, while others managed to escape.

Location of Incident: Lui Payam, Mundri East
Description: 4.	On 17 July, two secondary sources reported that on 16 July, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one female civilian and injured a male civilian in Lui Payam, Mundri East County. According to the sources, the assailants ambushed a private vehicle with passengers aboard along the Mundri-Juba Road in Lui Payam, killing one of the passengers and injuring another, while others managed to escape.

Location of Incident: Nyium Payam, Otalo town in Pochalla North County, GPAA
Description:
Suspected armed Murle elements shot and killed one person and injured another in Otallo, Pochalla North County in GPAA.

On 18 and 19 July, HRD investigated allegations of attack from multiple sources, including the Secretary General of GPAA government, by suspected armed Murle elements that shot and killed Anyuak man and injured another man on 15 July, around 20:00 hours, at Nyium Payam, Otalo town in Pochalla North County, GPAA. According to the sources, the victims were travelling on two motorbikes when the suspected Murle elements attacked them. 

The deceased was a businessperson who went to Ethiopia’s Gambella region to buy goods while the other injured victim is a mechanic who was going to repair the motorbike off the deceased businessperson where the attack occurred. 

Comment: This is the second attack against Anyuak civilians within Pochalla North County of GPAA by suspected Murle armed elements in three weeks. If no measure is taken, this could further deteriorate the security and human rights situation as Anyuak youth could retaliate by attacking Murle locations within GPAA.

Location of Incident: Nyium Payam, Otalo town in Pochalla North County, GPAA
Description:
Suspected armed Murle elements shot and killed one person and injured another in Otallo, Pochalla North County in GPAA.

On 18 and 19 July, HRD investigated allegations of attack from multiple sources, including the Secretary General of GPAA government, by suspected armed Murle elements that shot and killed Anyuak man and injured another man on 15 July, around 20:00 hours, at Nyium Payam, Otalo town in Pochalla North County, GPAA. According to the sources, the victims were travelling on two motorbikes when the suspected Murle elements attacked them. 

The deceased was a businessperson who went to Ethiopia’s Gambella region to buy goods while the other injured victim is a mechanic who was going to repair the motorbike off the deceased businessperson where the attack occurred. 

Comment: This is the second attack against Anyuak civilians within Pochalla North County of GPAA by suspected Murle armed elements in three weeks. If no measure is taken, this could further deteriorate the security and human rights situation as Anyuak youth could retaliate by attacking Murle locations within GPAA.

Location of Incident: Jebel Boma town, Jebel Boma County in GPAA
Description:
Unidentified armed criminals shot and killed one businessperson in ambush style attack in Jebel Boma County, GPAA.

On 18 and 19 July, HRD documented information from multiple sources, that on 15 July, at around 15 00 hours, unidentified armed criminals ambushed, shot and killed a group of six businesspersons killing one of them traveling from Kissengor payam to Jebel Boma town, Jebel Boma County in GPAA. The incident occurred at a location called Lochere. The deceased businessperson was reportedly a 18-year-old man from Jie ethnic group within GPAA. HRD documented that an investigation into the incident was ongoing.

Comments: HRD will follow up.

Location of Incident: Pathai, Uror
Description:
Suspected armed Gawaar Nuer elements shot and killed one person along Ngundeng Highway in Pathai Payam, Uror County of Jonglei State

On 18 July, HRD obtained information from multiple sources, including County authorities, CSOs and community members, that on 17 July, at around 1600 hours, a group of armed criminals suspected to be Gawaar Nuer shot and killed a Lou Nuer civilian along Ngundeng highway between Paluony and Pathai villages, Paluony Sub-Payam, Uror County.  According to the sources, about ten armed criminals who were travelling from unidentified location within Uror County heading towards Ayod County along Ngundeng highway. 

HRD documented that the deceased victim was in company of about ten female travelers when the armed Gawaar Nuer criminals with no apparent reason shot and killed him. Sources believe the incident was a criminal act as no evidence of revenge due to past conflicts was obtained. Eyewitnesses said the armed attackers spoke in Nuer language with Gawaar Nuer accents as they tried to silence the crying female witnesses. Personal belongings of the killed victim including his bag were reportedly looted. 

Comment: The bordering areas between Lou Nuer and Gawaar Nuer has been engulfed in intracommunal tensions characterized by lootings and revenge attacks that claimed civilian lives. Attempts by the concerned County authorities has been futile. HRD will follow up.

Location of Incident: Pathai, Uror
Description:
Suspected armed Gawaar Nuer elements shot and killed one person along Ngundeng Highway in Pathai Payam, Uror County of Jonglei State
