Location of Incident: Nadapal Boma, Narus Payam-Kapoeta East
Description: 1.	On 18 July, three secondary sources reported that on 5 July, armed Toposa youths from Nadapal Boma, shot and injured one 19-year-old male civilian from the Toposa community of Natinga Payam in Nadapal Boma, Narus Payam-Kapoeta East County. According to the sources, the armed Toposa youths from Nadapal Boma, who were pursuing armed Toposa youths from Natinga Boma following a cattle raid in Nadapal Boma, encountered and opened fire on the victim while he was collecting building materials from the nearby bushes, injuring him. The armed Toposa youths from Natinga Boma had reportedly raided 50 heads of cattle from the Toposa community in Nadapal Boma. The victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Natinga Boma for medical treatment. The incident was reported at Narus Police Station and investigation is reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: Nadapal Boma, Narus Payam-Kapoeta East
Description: 1.	On 18 July, three secondary sources reported that on 5 July, armed Toposa youths from Nadapal Boma, shot and injured one 19-year-old male civilian from the Toposa community of Natinga Payam in Nadapal Boma, Narus Payam-Kapoeta East County. According to the sources, the armed Toposa youths from Nadapal Boma, who were pursuing armed Toposa youths from Natinga Boma following a cattle raid in Nadapal Boma, encountered and opened fire on the victim while he was collecting building materials from the nearby bushes, injuring him. The armed Toposa youths from Natinga Boma had reportedly raided 50 heads of cattle from the Toposa community in Nadapal Boma. The victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Natinga Boma for medical treatment. The incident was reported at Narus Police Station and investigation is reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: Awul Payam, Tonj North
Description: 5.	On 20 July, three secondary sources reported that on 19 July, armed Dinka Atok youths shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Lou-Ariik community of Alabek Payam in Awul Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Atok youths ambushed the victim while he was travelling on a motorcycle from Alabek Payam to sell agricultural produce in Warrap Town, killing him. The attack is reportedly linked to ongoing revenge violence between the allied Dinka Noi and Atok of Awul Payam and the Dinka Leir of Kirik Payam and their allies.

Location of Incident: Machar village, Palieng Payam in Tonj East
Description: 6.	On 20 July, three secondary sources reported that on 19 July, armed Dinka Luanyjang youths shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Pan-Juaj community in Machar village, Palieng Payam in Tonj East County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Luanyjang youths attacked and opened fire on the victim (from Wunlit Payam) while on a visit to his relatives in Machar village, killing him. The incident is reportedly a revenge action for past grievances between the two communities.

Location of Incident: Lumonit Sub-Boma, Ladu Payam, Juba County
Description: Three Dinka civilians (Charcoal Burners) killed by suspected SPLA/IO soldiers in Lumonit Sub-Boma in Ladu Payam. On 23 April 2025, CAD CES received a report from the Payam Director (PD) of Ladu Payam, Juba County. The PD informed that on 22 April 2025, three civilians (charcoal burners) of Dinka ethnicity, were allegedly killed by some Nuer soldiers affiliated with the SPLA/IO in Lumonit Sub-Boma, Ladu Payam. According to the PD, one of the victims managed to disclose the identities of the suspects before succumbing to injuries. Additionally, CAD contacted the Head Chief of the area to verify reports of recent deployments by the SSPDF to the area. The Chief confirmed, and stated that on 22 April 2025, SSPDF soldiers entered the village of Mobil and engaged in harassment and looting of civilian properties, including food supplies and money.

Location of Incident: Lochet Boma, Kassengor Payam, Kapoeta East
Description: 3.	On 21 July, three secondary sources reported that on 15 July, Murle armed elements from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) shot and killed one 15-year-old boy from the Jie community in Lochet Boma, Kassengor Payam, Kapoeta East County. According to the sources, a group of Murle armed elements attacked and opened fire on the victim while he and three other children were on their way to a water point in Lochet Boma. Reportedly, the other three children fled after the victim alerted them. The incident was reported at the Narus Police Station and investigations are reportedly underway.

Location of Incident: Ngop village, Kaikuiny Payam, Akobo
Description:
4.	On 21 July, multiple sources reported that on 20 July, Murle armed elements from GPAA shot and killed three civilians (students) from the Lou Nuer community in Ngop village, Kaikuiny Payam, Akobo County. According to the sources, the victims were students from Akobo County and were returning from universities in Ethiopia on vacation with their families Akobo West sub-county.

Comment: Reportedly, Ngop is an uninhabited village located about 20 kilometres from Kaikuiny Boma, Akobo West sub county and due to lack of transportation, civilians travelling on foot are at high risk of attacks by Murle armed elements.

Location of Incident: Panawac village, Pacong Payam, Rumbek East
Description: 5.	On 19 and 21 July, multiple secondary sources reported that on 19 July, one SSNPS personnel ( part of joint security forces comprising of the SSNPS and the South Sudan People’s Defence Forces (SSPDF)) shot and killed one male civilian (suspected of cattle theft) from the Kook section of Dinka Agaar in Panawac village, Pacong Payam, Rumbek East County. According to the sources, while the joint security forces were executing an arrest of two male suspects of cattle theft, one SSNPS personnel opened fire one of the suspected who resisted the arrest and attempted to escape, killing him. Reportedly, in retaliation, relatives of the victim from the nearby cattle camps attacked the Pacong Payam Police post and in the ensuing clash, six members of the joint security force were shot and injured. Additional SSPDF were subsequently deployed to Pacong Payam to avert more violence and arrest the youths involved in the attack on the Police post.

Location of Incident: Panawac village, Pacong Payam, Rumbek East
Description: 5.	On 19 and 21 July, multiple secondary sources reported that on 19 July, one SSNPS personnel ( part of joint security forces comprising of the SSNPS and the South Sudan People’s Defence Forces (SSPDF)) shot and killed one male civilian (suspected of cattle theft) from the Kook section of Dinka Agaar in Panawac village, Pacong Payam, Rumbek East County. According to the sources, while the joint security forces were executing an arrest of two male suspects of cattle theft, one SSNPS personnel opened fire one of the suspected who resisted the arrest and attempted to escape, killing him. Reportedly, in retaliation, relatives of the victim from the nearby cattle camps attacked the Pacong Payam Police post and in the ensuing clash, six members of the joint security force were shot and injured. Additional SSPDF were subsequently deployed to Pacong Payam to avert more violence and arrest the youths involved in the attack on the Police post.

Location of Incident: Shambe Port area, Adior Payam, Yirol East
Description: 6.	On 18 and 21 July, one primary source reported that on 26 and 27 June, armed Dinka Ciec youths from Yirol East County abducted and gang-raped one female civilian from the Nyuong Nuer community in Shambe Port area, Adior Payam, Yirol East County. As recounted by the source, on 26 June, the survivor was abducted by seven armed Dink Ciec youths during an attack by a group of 15 armed Dinka Ciec youths on 52 Nyuong Nuer civilians who were traveling by boat to Bor and Juba through Shambe [see HRD Daily Report 30 June 2025]. Reportedly, upon arrival in the Shambe Port area, the survivor was taken into a nearby bush where she beaten and gang raped by the seven armed Dinka Ciec youths. The source further informed that following the intervention of a Dinka man who spoke Nuer, the incident was reported to the SSPDF, who placed her under protective custody, and after seven days, handed her over to the Sudan People’s Liberation Army-In Opposition (SPLA-IO). She was subsequently transferred by boat to Panyijar County and later to Ganyliel Payam where she received first aid before being referred to a local NGO for advanced care.

Location of Incident: Wut-Angui village, Paweng Payam, Tonj East
Description: 7.	On 21 July, three secondary sources reported that on 20 July, armed Dinka Lian youths shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Kongor community in Wut-Angui village, Paweng Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Lian youths attacked and opened fire on the victim while he was visiting his relatives in Paweng Payam, killing him, reportedly in revenge for past unresolved grievances between the two communities. The sources further informed that the police have commenced an investigation to apprehend the suspects.

Location of Incident: Pariak village, Kirik Payam, Tonj North
Description: 8.	On 21 July, three secondary sources reported that on 20 July, armed Dinka Noi youths abducted one 12-year-old boy from the Dinka Leir community during a cattle raid in Pariak village, Kirik Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Noi youths attacked the Dinka Leir community in Pariak village in Kirik Payam, confronted the victim who was herding cattle, tied him up and proceeded to seized 54 heads of cattle. Reportedly, upon arriving in Awul Payam, the victim was released, and he reported the incident to SSNPS who alerted the SSPDF. The SSPDF subsequently pursued the armed Dinka Noi youths and in the ensuing confrontation, recovered 35 of the raided cattle. Reportedly, the police in Warrap Town have initiated the family tracing process to reunite the victim with his family.

Location of Incident: Pariak village, Kirik Payam, Tonj North
Description: 8.	On 21 July, three secondary sources reported that on 20 July, armed Dinka Noi youths abducted one 12-year-old boy from the Dinka Leir community during a cattle raid in Pariak village, Kirik Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Noi youths attacked the Dinka Leir community in Pariak village in Kirik Payam, confronted the victim who was herding cattle, tied him up and proceeded to seized 54 heads of cattle. Reportedly, upon arriving in Awul Payam, the victim was released, and he reported the incident to SSNPS who alerted the SSPDF. The SSPDF subsequently pursued the armed Dinka Noi youths and in the ensuing confrontation, recovered 35 of the raided cattle. Reportedly, the police in Warrap Town have initiated the family tracing process to reunite the victim with his family.

Location of Incident: Ayien-Amuol village, Turalei Payam, Twic
Description:
9.	On 21 July, three secondary sources reported that on 19 July, armed Nuer elements from Mayom County, Unity State, shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Twic Mayardit community during a cattle raid in Ayien-Amuol village, Turalei Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, the armed Nuer elements attacked the Twic Mayardit community in Ayien-Amuol village, opened fire on the victim while he was grazing cattle, killing him. The attackers also seized 100 heads of cattle and fled back into Unity State. 

Comment: Reportedly, tension is mounting in the area and the armed Dinka Twic Mayardit youths have crossed into Unity State for revenge attack.

Location of Incident: Ayien-Amuol village, Turalei Payam, Twic
Description:
9.	On 21 July, three secondary sources reported that on 19 July, armed Nuer elements from Mayom County, Unity State, shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Twic Mayardit community during a cattle raid in Ayien-Amuol village, Turalei Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, the armed Nuer elements attacked the Twic Mayardit community in Ayien-Amuol village, opened fire on the victim while he was grazing cattle, killing him. The attackers also seized 100 heads of cattle and fled back into Unity State. 

Comment: Reportedly, tension is mounting in the area and the armed Dinka Twic Mayardit youths have crossed into Unity State for revenge attack.

Location of Incident: Kangi Payam, Jur River
Description:
10.	On 21 July, multiple sources reported that on 14 July, one SSNPS officer raped one 11-year-old girl from the Luo community in Kangi Payam, Jur River County. According to the sources, the perpetrator accosted the victim while she was had one to the Kangi town market, forced her into his house, threatened to hurt her with a spear, raped her and abandoned her by the roadside. Reportedly, the survivor was found by her father who had gone looking of her after she delayed to return home, and reported the incident at Kangi Police Station, where police Form 8 was issued and the survivor was referred to the Special Protection Unit in Wau. The perpetrator was apprehended on 14 July and remanded at the Wau Central Prison. 

Comments: HRD will follow up on the case for accountability of the perpetrator.

Location of Incident: Masia area, Yambio Town, Yambio
Description: 11.	On 21 July, multiple sources reported that on 17 July, NSS personnel arbitrarily arrested, illtreated and detained one male civilian from the Azande community in Masia area, Yambio Town, Yambio County. According to the sources, the NSS personnel raided the home of the victim in the Napere area, Yambio town, assaulted the victim and another civilian, and arrested the victim on allegations that he was communicating with and supporting SPLA-IO commanders. Reportedly, the victim was subjected to ill-treatment while in detention, and was released on 21 July after paying over 1,000,000 South Sudanese Pounds (SSP).

Location of Incident: Chahari Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos
Description: 1.	On 22 July, three secondary sources reported that on 20 July, armed Logir youths from Mangala Boma shot and killed two male civilians (one 20-year-old and a 45-year-old) from the Dongotono community in Chahari Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos County. According to the sources, the armed Logir youths attacked Chahari Boma and opened fire on a group of Dongotono civilians, killing two. The attack was reportedly a retaliation for the killing of two male civilians from the Logir community by armed Dongotono youths from Chahari Boma during a cattle raid attack on 1 July 2025 [see HRD Daily Report 8 July 2025]. The incident was reported to the police in Chahari Payam and investigations are reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: Moimoi Boma, Baggari Payam, Wau
Description: 2.	On 21 July, one primary source reported that on 21 March, SPLA-IO elements arbitrarily arrested, ill-treated and detained one 60-year-old male civilian from the Balanda community in Moimoi Boma, Baggari Payam, Wau County. As recounted by the source, one SPLA-IO officer arrived at the victim’s home accusing him of possessing an illegal weapon, and after conducting a thorough search of the house and finding nothing, the officer reportedly took the victim to the Brinji neighborhood, where he ordered three of his soldiers to beat him up. Reportedly, the victim sustained injuries and was subsequently detained for one week despite his injury. He was subsequently released following the intervention of one SPLA-IO General. A case was later filed at Wau Police Station, and the victim received medical treatment at a hospital in Wau.

Location of Incident: Dem village, Canal Payam, Pigi
Description:
1.	On 23 July, multiple sources reported that on 20 July, allied SSPDF, SSNPS and Agwelek forces shot and killed two male civilians (cattle keepers) from the Gawaar Nuer community in Dem village, Canal Payam, Pigi County. According to the sources, the joint forces attacked and opened fire on the victims, killing them, as well as raided over 90 heads of cattle. Reportedly, this incident followed a similar attack by the SSPDF on a group of Dinka Pigi cattle keepers in Canal Payam on 22 July, injuring an unspecified number of civilians and allegedly raided over 100 heads of cattle.

Comment: According to the sources, these incidents triggered widespread displacement of the civilians who were initially displaced by floods and settled in Canal Payam. The civilians facing attacks at Dem village were allegedly accused by the SSPDF of being loyal to SPLA-IO.

Location of Incident: Dem village, Canal Payam, Pigi
Description:
1.	On 23 July, multiple sources reported that on 20 July, allied SSPDF, SSNPS and Agwelek forces shot and killed two male civilians (cattle keepers) from the Gawaar Nuer community in Dem village, Canal Payam, Pigi County. According to the sources, the joint forces attacked and opened fire on the victims, killing them, as well as raided over 90 heads of cattle. Reportedly, this incident followed a similar attack by the SSPDF on a group of Dinka Pigi cattle keepers in Canal Payam on 22 July, injuring an unspecified number of civilians and allegedly raided over 100 heads of cattle.

Comment: According to the sources, these incidents triggered widespread displacement of the civilians who were initially displaced by floods and settled in Canal Payam. The civilians facing attacks at Dem village were allegedly accused by the SSPDF of being loyal to SPLA-IO.

Location of Incident: Naivasha residential area, Aweil Municipality
Description:
2.	On 23 July, four primary sources reported that on 21 July, joint security forces (SSPDF, SSNPS, National Security Service (NSS) and the Wildlife Authority) arbitrarily arrested, detained, and illtreated four male civilians in the Naivasha residential area, Aweil Municipality. According to the sources, the joint security forces arrested the victims from Naivasha market and transferred them to the Naivasha Police Station, where they were reportedly subjected to ill-treatment and interrogated on suspicion of being involved in criminal activities. Reportedly, the victims were released the following day after having shown proof of being enrolled in an educational institution. 

Comment: This action comes after an executive order by the State authorities directing security forces to arrest and detain any found loitering in the night between 21:00 and 05:30.

Location of Incident: Wunlit, Makuac and Paweng Payams, Tonj East
Description:
3.	On 23 July, four primary sources reported that on the same day, 38 civilians were shot and killed (13 including one woman and one girl from the Dinka Jaluau community and 25 including three woman from the Dinka Luanyjang community) and 38 others injured [20 Dinka Jaluau and 18 Dinka Luanyjang – all men) during violence between armed Dinka Luanyjang and Dinka Jaluau youths in Wunlit, Makuac, and Paweng Payams, Tonj East County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Luanyjang youths from Makuac and Paweng Payams simultaneously attacked and opened fire on three cattle camps (Nyangac, Angec and another) near Wunlit Town, killing 13 Dinka Jaluau civilians including two females and injuring 20 male civilians. The attackers also raided an unspecified number of cattle and fled the scene. Reportedly, in retaliation, armed Dinka Jaluau youths simultaneously attacked Makuac and Paweng Payams, and opened fire on Dinka Luanyjang civilians, some of whom were grazing cattle in the wide grazing land, while many others were also cultivating and attacked homes that are nearby the grazing land, killing 25 civilians including three females and injuring 18 male civilians. The armed Dink Jaluau youths reportedly also burnt down 28 homesteads. The injured Dinka Jaluau victims were evacuated to health care facilities in Wunlit Payam and Tonj Town, while those from the Dinka Luanyjang community were evacuated to a health care facility in Palieng Payam for medical treatment.

Comment: The incident occurred in the context of protracted cyclical and retaliatory violence between these communities in Tonj East County, accounting for more than 300 civilian deaths between March and July 2025.

Location of Incident: Wunlit, Makuac and Paweng Payams, Tonj East
Description:
3.	On 23 July, four primary sources reported that on the same day, 38 civilians were shot and killed (13 including one woman and one girl from the Dinka Jaluau community and 25 including three woman from the Dinka Luanyjang community) and 38 others injured [20 Dinka Jaluau and 18 Dinka Luanyjang – all men) during violence between armed Dinka Luanyjang and Dinka Jaluau youths in Wunlit, Makuac, and Paweng Payams, Tonj East County. Location of Incident: Machar village, Turalei Payam, Twic
Description: 4.	On 23 July, three primary sources reported that on 20 July, armed Bul Nuer youths from Mayom County, Unity State shot and injured one male civilian from the Dinka Twic Mayardit community during a cattle raid in Machar village, Turalei Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, the armed Bul Nuer youths attacked and opened fire on Machar village, injuring the victim while he was watering and grazing his cattle. the attackers also seized 30 heads of cattle and fled the scene. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Turalei Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Machar village, Turalei Payam, Twic
Description: 4.	On 23 July, three primary sources reported that on 20 July, armed Bul Nuer youths from Mayom County, Unity State shot and injured one male civilian from the Dinka Twic Mayardit community during a cattle raid in Machar village, Turalei Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, the armed Bul Nuer youths attacked and opened fire on Machar village, injuring the victim while he was watering and grazing his cattle. the attackers also seized 30 heads of cattle and fled the scene. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Turalei Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Goja Boma, Otogo Payam, Yei River
Description:
1.	On 24 July, multiple sources reported that on 25 April, suspected NAS elements gang-raped one 23-year-old female civilian and abducted one 24-year-old male civilian (spouse of the rape victim) both from the Kakwa community in Goja Boma, Otogo Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, the suspected NAS elements attacked civilians in Goja Boma, forced them out of their homes, and three of the armed elements reportedly proceeded to gang-raped the woman and thereafter abducted her husband. Reportedly, the woman was left unconscious and was rescued by police the following morning who transferred to Yei Town in critical condition for urgent medical treatment. The whereabouts of the abductee remain unknown. 

Comments: The incident highlights the recurring human rights violations, including abduction, sexual violence, physical abuse, and psychological trauma, suffered by civilians, more so vulnerable women and girls, in conflict-affected area in Greater Yei.

Location of Incident: Goja Boma, Otogo Payam, Yei River
Description:
1.	On 24 July, multiple sources reported that on 25 April, suspected NAS elements gang-raped one 23-year-old female civilian and abducted one 24-year-old male civilian (spouse of the rape victim) both from the Kakwa community in Goja Boma, Otogo Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, the suspected NAS elements attacked civilians in Goja Boma, forced them out of their homes, and three of the armed elements reportedly proceeded to gang-raped the woman and thereafter abducted her husband. Reportedly, the woman was left unconscious and was rescued by police the following morning who transferred to Yei Town in critical condition for urgent medical treatment. The whereabouts of the abductee remain unknown. 

Comments: The incident highlights the recurring human rights violations, including abduction, sexual violence, physical abuse, and psychological trauma, suffered by civilians, more so vulnerable women and girls, in conflict-affected area in Greater Yei.

Location of Incident: Mogos Boma, Mogos Payam, Kapoeta East
Description:
2.	On 24 July, three secondary sources reported that on 17 July, armed Jie youths from Lopyet Payam attacked and killed one 15-year-old boy from the Toposa community in Mogos Boma, Mogos Payam, Kapoeta East County. According to the sources, the armed Toposa youths stormed Lopyet Boma and raided an unspecified number of goats. Reportedly, as the armed Jie youths pursued the armed Toposa youths, they encountered the victim along the Lopyet-Mogos road, questioned him about the raiders and failing to get valuable information from the victim, they beat him with sticks to death. The incident was reported at the Narus Police Station and investigations are reportedly ongoing.

Comment: According to the sources, the Toposa community leaders have reached out to their Jie counterparts, who have allegedly identified the perpetrators. The perpetrators are expected to be handed over to the police once apprehended.

Location of Incident: Mogos Boma, Mogos Payam, Kapoeta East
Description:
2.	On 24 July, three secondary sources reported that on 17 July, armed Jie youths from Lopyet Payam attacked and killed one 15-year-old boy from the Toposa community in Mogos Boma, Mogos Payam, Kapoeta East County. According to the sources, the armed Toposa youths stormed Lopyet Boma and raided an unspecified number of goats. Reportedly, as the armed Jie youths pursued the armed Toposa youths, they encountered the victim along the Lopyet-Mogos road, questioned him about the raiders and failing to get valuable information from the victim, they beat him with sticks to death. The incident was reported at the Narus Police Station and investigations are reportedly ongoing.

Comment: According to the sources, the Toposa community leaders have reached out to their Jie counterparts, who have allegedly identified the perpetrators. The perpetrators are expected to be handed over to the police once apprehended.

Location of Incident: Maat village, Alam Payam, Pigi
Description:
3.	On 24 July, multiple sources reported that on 2 June, joint SSPDF, SSNPS and Agwelek forces shot and killed four male civilians (cattle keepers) from the Gawaar Nuer and Dinka Pigi communities in Maat village, Alam Payam, Pigi County. According to the sources, the joint forces attacked and opened fire on the victims, killing them. The joint forces also seized an unspecified number of cattle and burned undetermined number of houses.

Comment: According to the sources, the deployment of the SSPDF and allied militias from Khorfulus and Canal to Maat Boma is negatively impacting on civilian safety. The affected population are reportedly targeted because of perceived affiliation to SPLA-IO.

Location of Incident: Maat village, Alam Payam, Pigi
Description:
3.	On 24 July, multiple sources reported that on 2 June, joint SSPDF, SSNPS and Agwelek forces shot and killed four male civilians (cattle keepers) from the Gawaar Nuer and Dinka Pigi communities in Maat village, Alam Payam, Pigi County. According to the sources, the joint forces attacked and opened fire on the victims, killing them. The joint forces also seized an unspecified number of cattle and burned undetermined number of houses.

Comment: According to the sources, the deployment of the SSPDF and allied militias from Khorfulus and Canal to Maat Boma is negatively impacting on civilian safety. The affected population are reportedly targeted because of perceived affiliation to SPLA-IO.

Location of Incident: Maper Town, Rumbek North County and Malek Payam, Rumbek Center
Description:
4.	On 24 July, one secondary source reported that on 23 July, suspected armed Dinka Pakam youths shot and killed one male civilian and injured another (cattle traders) both from the Dinka Luanyjang community in the area between Maper Town, Rumbek North County and Malek Payam, Rumbek Center County. According to the source, the armed Dinka Pakam youths ambushed a group of cattle traders (from various communities including Dinka Luanyjang and Dinka Agaar) while enroute to Rumbek Town market in Rumbek Center County, killing one and injuring another. The attackers also reportedly seized approximately 70 heads of cattle, which were subsequently recovered by the cattle traders as they repulsed the attackers. The injured victim was reportedly evacuated to a hospital in  Rumbek Central for medical treatment. 

Comment: Reportedly, the authorities of Rumbek Center and Rumbek North Counties visited the scene and have instructed the local security forces to search for and apprehend the perpetrators.

Location of Incident: Maper Town, Rumbek North County and Malek Payam, Rumbek Center
Description:

Comment: Reportedly, the authorities of Rumbek Center and Rumbek North Counties visited the scene and have instructed the local security forces to search for and apprehend the perpetrators.

Location of Incident: Kon-Biong village, Makuac Payam, Tonj East
Description: 5.	On 24 July, three primary sources reported that on the same day, armed Bul Nuer elements from Mayom County, Unity State shot and killed two civilians (one woman and one man) and injured two male civilians, all from the Dinka Luanyjang community, in Kon-Biong village, Makuac Payam, Tonj East County. As recounted by the sources, the armed Nuer elements attacked and opened fire on a cattle camp in Kon-Biong village, killing two civilians and injuring two others. The attackers also reportedly seized approximately 300 heads of cattle. The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in  Makuac for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Kon-Biong village, Makuac Payam, Tonj East
Description: 5.	On 24 July, three primary sources reported that on the same day, armed Bul Nuer elements from Mayom County, Unity State shot and killed two civilians (one woman and one man) and injured two male civilians, all from the Dinka Luanyjang community, in Kon-Biong village, Makuac Payam, Tonj East County. As recounted by the sources, the armed Nuer elements attacked and opened fire on a cattle camp in Kon-Biong village, killing two civilians and injuring two others. The attackers also reportedly seized approximately 300 heads of cattle. The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in  Makuac for medical treatment.

Description: 5. Location of Incident: Tikasu village, Longamere Boma, Mugwo Payam, Yei River
Description:
1.	On 25 July, two secondary sources reported that on 24 July, suspected NAS elements abducted one 40-year-old male civilian from the Kakwa community in Tikasu village, Longamere Boma, Mugwo Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, armed assailants believed to be members of NAS invaded Tikasu village and abducted the victim from his homestead to an unknown location, on allegations that the victim is in support of the state government. Reportedly, during the process, the abductors allegedly identified themselves as those responsible for the abduction and subsequent killing of one 70-year-old male civilian (brother to the 40-year-old victim) from the Kakwa community [see HRD Daily Report 18 July 2025]. 

Comment: this incident is part of the broader pattern of targeted attacks and abduction of civilians by the NAS elements in the area. During this incident, the abductors threatened the community members, warning them not to reveal any information to government officials about their presence in the community and if they disclose, they would be targeted.

Location of Incident: Gumbo market area, Rejaf Payam, Juba
Description:
2.	On 25 July, four secondary sources reported that on 24 July, personnel of the SSNPS arbitrarily arrested, illtreated and detained 11 male civilians (masons) in Gumbo market area, Rejaf Payam, Juba County. According to the sources, the SSNPS personnel stormed a brick production site, arrested, ill-treated and detained 11 workers on accusation of being affiliated with gangs operating in the area. Reportedly, the SSNPS informed the victims that they will be released only upon payment of 25,000 South Sudanese Pounds (SSP) to which one of the victims complied. 

Comment: It has been noted that this pattern is used by the police to extort money from civilians, targeting mostly children and young adults on the pretext of them being members of gangs.

Location of Incident: Mangala Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos
Description: 3.	On 25 July, three secondary sources reported that on 23 July, armed Dongotono youths from Chahari Boma, shot and killed one 26-year-old male civilian from the Logir community in Mangala Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos County. According to the sources, the assailants shot and killed the victim in his homestead in Mangala Boma, in retaliation to the killing of two Dongotono civilians (aged 20 and 45 years) by armed Logir youths on 20 July 2025 [see HRD Daily Report 23 July 2025]. Reportedly, the assailants fled the scene, and the incident was reported to the Chahari police station and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Meen town, Meen Payam, Rumbek North County
Description:
4.	On 25 July, one secondary source reported that, on 23 July, one male Manuer civilian (age unspecified) was shot and killed and other from the Niel Niel clan was shot and injured (age unspecified) during violence between an armed youth from the Manuer clan and armed youths from the Niel Niel clan in Meen town, Meen Payam, Rumbek North County. According to the sources, the armed Manuer youth visited the home of an elderly male from the Niel Niel community and following a brief exchange and ensuing altercation, the armed youth shot and injured the man and fled the scene. Reportedly, the sons of the victim mobilized other youths and armed themselves, and pursued the assailant, to no avail and in frustration, they opened fire at a house in Amok village in Meen Payam, killing one male civilian in the process. 

Comment: the victim killed was in the company of an SSNPS officer, who was reportedly spared by the armed Niel Niel youths for the sake of being a personnel member of the SSNPS. Tensions are rising following these incidents although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Meen town, Meen Payam, Rumbek North County
Description:
4.	On 25 July, one secondary source reported that, on 23 July, one male Manuer civilian (age unspecified) was shot and killed and other from the Niel Niel clan was shot and injured (age unspecified) during violence between an armed youth from the Manuer clan and armed youths from the Niel Niel clan in Meen town, Meen Payam, Rumbek North County. According to the sources, the armed Manuer youth visited the home of an elderly male from the Niel Niel community and following a brief exchange and ensuing altercation, the armed youth shot and injured the man and fled the scene. Reportedly, the sons of the victim mobilized other youths and armed themselves, and pursued the assailant, to no avail and in frustration, they opened fire at a house in Amok village in Meen Payam, killing one male civilian in the process. 

Comment: the victim killed was in the company of an SSNPS officer, who was reportedly spared by the armed Niel Niel youths for the sake of being a personnel member of the SSNPS. Tensions are rising following these incidents although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: between Limon and Pilual villages of Bieh Payam, Mayom County
Description:
5.	On 25 July, three secondary sources reported that, on 21 July, armed Dinka Twic youths from Warrap State, shot and injured three male Bul Nuer civilians (cattle keepers- ages unspecified) between Limon and Pilual villages of Bieh Payam, Mayom County. According to the sources, the assailants invaded Bieh Payam, and raided over 700 heads of cattle, while the cattle were grazing and the cattle keepers were attending an intra-Bul Nuer peace dialogue presided by the Governor of Unity State. Reportedly, the armed Bul nuer youths mobilized and pursued the raiders and in the ensuring confrontation, three male Bul Nuer were shot and injured, and six armed Dinka Twic were shot and killed, and all the raided cattle recovered. The injured Bul Nuer victims were taken to a health facility in Mankien Payam for treatment.

Comment: local Bul Nuer communities in Mayom had been raising concerns that the disarmament would leave them vulnerable to attacks, including cattle raids, from neighboring communities. Therefore, the cattle raid may serve as a disincentive for compliance with the Government’s directive for armed Bul Nuer community members to voluntarily surrender their weapons.

Location of Incident: between Limon and Pilual villages of Bieh Payam, Mayom County
Description:
5.	On 25 July, three secondary sources reported that, on 21 July, armed Dinka Twic youths from Warrap State, shot and injured three male Bul Nuer civilians (cattle keepers- ages unspecified) between Limon and Pilual villages of Bieh Payam, Mayom County. Location of Incident: Palieng market, Palieng Payam in Tonj East
Description:
6.	On 27 July, three secondary sources reported that on 25 July, armed Dinka Pan-Lual youths from Marial-Lou Payam in Tonj North County, shot and killed one male Dinka Pamun civilian (age unspecified) in Palieng market, Palieng Payam in Tonj East County. According to the sources, the assailants shot and killed the victim and fled the scene, in perpetuation of sub-clan retaliatory violence between these two related sub-clans which fall under the Dinka Lou-Paher section of Marial-Lou Payam in Tonj North County. Reportedly, the SSNPS intervened and de-escalated the situation, and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made. 

Comment: it was reported that the assailants and the victim had migrated from Marial-Lou Payam in Tonj North County fleeing from the current violence in the area.

Location of Incident: Hai-Naduru residential area, Yambio town, Yambio
Description: 7.	On 25 July, one secondary source reported that on 3 July, one soldier of the SSPDF raped one 16-year-old girl in Hai-Naduru residential area, Yambio town, Yambio County. According to the source, the SSPDF soldier intercepted the victim while she was returning home from school, solicited the victim for sexual relations and upon her rejection, the soldier forced her into his home and raped her. Reportedly, the soldier released the victim later that day to go home, where on 4 July, she suffered from excess bleeding and pains, and she disclosed the ordeal to her parents.

Location of Incident: Burator Payam, Pochalla North County, GPAA
Description:
Four schoolgirls abducted by suspected Murle armed elements at Burator Payam, Pochalla North County, GPAA

On 27 June HRD received information, from multiple sources, that on 25 June, four schoolgirls belonging to Anyuak ethnic group were abducted at 1100 hours local time on 25 June in an ambush style attack by persons identified as Murle from GPAA. The school children were reportedly travelling in group from Burator Payam, located about 70 km from Otale HQs to the nearby Ethiopian town of Pugnido where the children were expected to sit for the Ethiopian Secondary School exams. 

HRD sources said among the abducted children, two are reportedly Ethiopian nationals who happen to visit relatives in Burator Payam. The victims included two 16-year-old girls, one 20-year-old and one 18-year-old girl. Among the victims children were also undetermined number of schoolboys who managed to escape the Murle abductors and provided info on the identity of the alleged Murle perpetrators. 

Comment: HRD is concerned of the continued attacks and abduction of women and children including reports of cross border abduction cases. Pochalla North County authorities responded by reporting the incident to GPAA authorities and called for accountability and return of the child victims.

Location of Incident: Manyabol in Gumuruk County, GPAA
Description:
CAD follows cattle raids in Gumuruk County. On 16 June, CAD Bor and Pibor followed up reports of cattle raiding incident in Manyabol in Gumuruk County, GPAA. In a meeting with the Deputy Chief Administrator of GPAA, he confirmed the attack by suspected Dinka Bor youths on 15th June, in which six (6) persons (including 1woman) were killed in Ngorok settlement in the Irith community, and seven (7) women and children abducted along with an unspecified number of cattle. CAD Bor consulted interlocutors including Bor County Commissioner and Bor County youth leader who also confirmed the incident. The Bor youth leader however reported (also posted on social media) on 12 June indicating that on 12 June alleged Murle elements raided 37 cows from Kolnyang Payam of Bor county and the footprints were found heading to Manyikak near Manyabol.
Information from the Acting Director of National Security, GPAA on the incident of 15 June 2025 in Manyabol: That 09 civilians (02 women, 1 child-boy, 01 elderly man of about 55 years old, and the rest, that is 05 youth, were killed. Staff in the CA’s office also stated that 09 persons were killed but could bot aggregate. HRD’s HRO in Pibor, GPAA, was on leave when the incident occurred.

Location of Incident: Manyabol in Gumuruk County, GPAA
Description:
CAD follows cattle raids in Gumuruk County. On 16 June, CAD Bor and Pibor followed up reports of cattle raiding incident in Manyabol in Gumuruk County, GPAA. In a meeting with the Deputy Chief Administrator of GPAA, he confirmed the attack by suspected Dinka Bor youths on 15th June, in which six (6) persons (including 1woman) were killed in Ngorok settlement in the Irith community, and seven (7) women and children abducted along with an unspecified number of cattle. Staff in the CA’s office also stated that 09 persons were killed but could bot aggregate. HRD’s HRO in Pibor, GPAA, was on leave when the incident occurred.

Location of Incident: Skerikat area of Rejaf Payam
Description: HRD JFO also documented one incident of gang rape of a 16 years old  minor who was ganged raped by 10 suspects aged between 16-22 years old which  occurred in Skerikat area of Rejaf Payam on 19 June 2025. HRD JFO continue to monitor cases related to Sexual Violence and Gender-Base Violence and managed to document and followed up on a case of gang raped of 16 years old girl in Sherikat neighborhood in Rejaf Payam  by a group of ten members of  gangsters  whose  ages ranges between 16-22 years old.  HRD JFO followed up with  police at the Eastern Police division in Gumbo and gathered that all the  suspects had been apprehended and detained by the police at the Easten Police Division in Gumbo of Rejaf Payam pending investigations and trail. If found guilty the perpetrators face punishment of up to 14 years imprisonments as provided for by South Sudan Penal Code of 2008. HRD JFO is working together with partners towards supporting the victim and to ensure justice prevails.

Location of Incident: Gumbo and Adodi residential areas, Rejaf Payam, Juba County
Description: 1.	On 28 July, three secondary sources reported that on 27 July, SSNPS personnel arbitrarily arrested, detained, illtreated and extorted seven male civilians (ages between 17 and 18 years) in Gumbo and Adodi residential areas, Rejaf Payam, Juba County. According to the sources, the police accused the victims of being affiliated with local gangs operating in the area. Reportedly, the victims were beaten by the officers while in custody. The vicitms were reportedly released following the intervention of the local youth leader and after their families paid 60,000 South Sudan Pounds (SSP) each.

Location of Incident: Alero village, Ronyi Boma, Yei Town Payam, Yei River
Description: 2.	On 28 July, three secondary sources reported that on 25 July, suspected NAS elements abducted one female civilian (a midwife, working with the Ministry of Health and attached to an international humanitarian organization) in Alero village, Ronyi Boma, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, the NAS elements ambushed a vehicle belonging to an international humanitarian organization while enroute from Morobo to Yei and thereafter abducted the victim for unknown reasons, while other occupants were unscathed. The victim was reportedly released the following day.

Location of Incident: Tuhubak Boma, Hiyala Payam, Torit
Description: 3.	On 28 July, three secondary sources reported that on 20 July, armed Lutoko youths from Illeu Boma shot and killed one 32-year-old male civilian from the Lutoko community in Tuhubak Boma, Hiyala Payam, Torit County. According to the sources, the armed Lutoko youths attacked Tuhubak Boma and opened fire on a homestead, killing the victim, reportedly in revenge for the killing of a 28-year-old woman from the Lutoko community in Illeu Boma during a traditional dance ceremony in Tuhubak Boma in 2023 (exact date unspecified). The sources further informed that the matter was settled by the Boma Chiefs and the perpetrators were apprehended and asked to compensate; however, they failed to pay the compensation. The incident was subsequently reported at Hiyala Police Station and investigations are reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: Puot-Puotni village, Akobo West sub-county
Description: 4.	On 28 July, multiple sources reported that on 25 July, four female victims of abduction (one 25-year-old woman, her two daughters—ages unspecified, and a 16-year-old girl) from the Lou Nuer community were recovered by the authorities in Akobo County. Reportedly, the 25-year-old woman was abducted in 2011 (while she was 11-years old) by Murle armed elements in Puot-Puotni village, Akobo West sub-county, and taken to Likuangole County, Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA), where she was reportedly subjected to rape and bore two girls, while the 16-year-old girl was abducted in 2020 (exact date unspecified) from Akobo County (at 11 years old). They reportedly escaped from their abductors (date unspecified) and were received by Akobo County authorities who have initiated family tracing and reunification process.

Location of Incident: Puot-Puotni village, Akobo West sub-county
Description: 4.	On 28 July, multiple sources reported that on 25 July, four female victims of abduction (one 25-year-old woman, her two daughters—ages unspecified, and a 16-year-old girl) from the Lou Nuer community were recovered by the authorities in Akobo County. Reportedly, the 25-year-old woman was abducted in 2011 (while she was 11-years old) by Murle armed elements in Puot-Puotni village, Akobo West sub-county, and taken to Likuangole County, Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA), where she was reportedly subjected to rape and bore two girls, while the 16-year-old girl was abducted in 2020 (exact date unspecified) from Akobo County (at 11 years old). They reportedly escaped from their abductors (date unspecified) and were received by Akobo County authorities who have initiated family tracing and reunification process.

Location of Incident: Ameethic village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East
Description: 6.	On 28 July, three primary sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Jurbol youths from Rualbet Payam, Tonj North County shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Thiik community during an attempted cattle raid in Ameethic village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the Dinka Jurbol youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Thiik community in Ameethic village, killing one of the residents. The attackers also seized 45 heads of cattle. Reportedly, the armed Dinka Thiik youths pursued the attackers and in the ensuing confrontation, they shot and killed one armed Dinka Jurbol youth and recovered all of the raided cattle.

Location of Incident: Ameethic village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East
Description: 6.	On 28 July, three primary sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Jurbol youths from Rualbet Payam, Tonj North County shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Thiik community during an attempted cattle raid in Ameethic village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the Dinka Jurbol youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Thiik community in Ameethic village, killing one of the residents. The attackers also seized 45 heads of cattle. Reportedly, the armed Dinka Thiik youths pursued the attackers and in the ensuing confrontation, they shot and killed one armed Dinka Jurbol youth and recovered all of the raided cattle.

Location of Incident: Ameethic village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East
Description: 6.	On 28 July, three primary sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Jurbol youths from Rualbet Payam, Tonj North County shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Thiik community during an attempted cattle raid in Ameethic village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the Dinka Jurbol youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Thiik community in Ameethic village, killing one of the residents. The attackers also seized 45 heads of cattle. Reportedly, the armed Dinka Thiik youths pursued the attackers and in the ensuing confrontation, they shot and killed one armed Dinka Jurbol youth and recovered all of the raided cattle.

Location of Incident: Walallel suburb of Kuajok Town, Gogrial West
Description: 7.	On 28 July, four secondary sources reported that on 21 July, the SSPDF extrajudicially executed five male suspects (one 25-year-old Dinka Twic Mayardit and four Dinka Aguok - age 28, 32, 35 and 40 years old) in Walallel suburb of Kuajok Town, Gogrial West County. According to the sources, the joint security forces (SSNPS, SSPDF and the National Security Service (NSS)) arrested the victims and detained them at the Military Intelligence facility in Kuajok Town, on allegations of involvement in murder and the illegal possession and sale of firearms and ammunition. Reportedly, SSPDF soldiers extracted the victims from the Military Intelligence detention facility and transferred them to Walallel suburb, where they were executed by firing squad, allegedly on the orders of a senior SSPDF officer. The bodies of the victims were retrieved by their families the following day for interment.

Location of Incident: near the Yubu bridge along the Tambura-Nagero Road in Tambura Town, Tambura
Description: 8.	On 28 July, multiple secondary sources reported that on the same day, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one 34-year-old male civilian and injured another (age unspecified) from the Azande community near the Yubu bridge along the Tambura-Nagero Road in Tambura Town, Tambura County. According to the sources, the assailants intercepted and opened fire on the victims while they were travelling on a motorcycle from Tambura Town to the Ayat internally displaced persons (IDP) camp. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Tambura Town for medical treatment. The incident was reported to the police and investigations are reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: Isaru village, Loronyo Boma, Bur Payam, Torit
Description: 1.	On 29 July, three secondary sources reported that on 20 July, armed Lutoko youths from Hiyu village shot and injured five civilians (four 20, 27, 30 and 42 year old men and one 35-yer-old woman) in Isaru village, Loronyo Boma, Bur Payam, Torit County. According to the sources, a group of armed Lotuko youth stormed and opened fire on Isaru village injuring five civilians,  reportedly in revenge for the shooting and injury of three civilians from Hiyu village by armed Lutoko youths from Isaru village on 9 October 2024 [see HRD Daily Report 14 October 2024]. Reportedly, three male victims in critical conditions were evacuated to a health care facility in Torit Town and the fourth male victim with minor injury was taken to a health care facility in Loronyo Boma for medical treatment, while the female victim was evacuated to Juba for advanced medical care. The incident was reported at the Torit Municipal Police Station where investigation is reportedly underway; however, no suspects have been apprehended so far.

Location of Incident: Arul village, Rualbet Payam, Tonj North
Description: 2.	On 29 July, three primary sources reported that on 28 July, armed Dinka Thiik youths from Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County shot and killed one female civilian from the Dinka Jurbol community in Arul village, Rualbet Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Thiik youths attacked Arul village and opened fire on a homestead, killing one of the victim. The attack was reportedly a revenge action for the killing of one male Dinka Thiik civilian by armed Dinka Jurbol youths on 28 July [see HRD Daily Report 29 July 2025

Location of Incident: Wunrok Town, Wunrok Payam, Twic
Description:
3.	On 30 July, four primary sources reported that on 25 July, the SSPDF extrajudicially executed three male civilians (one Dinka Luanyjang and two Dinka Twic Mayardit – 23, 25, and 30 year olds) in Wunrok Town, Wunrok Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, on 24 July, joint security personnel arrested the victims in Pan-Nyok Payam, Twic County, along the border with Northern Bahr el Ghazal State, as thy were allegedly going to sell stolen cattle across the border, and transferred them to Wunrok Payam where they were detained at the Wunrok Town Police Station. Reportedly, on 25 July, SSPDF soldiers, allegedly acting on the orders of county authorities and senior SSPDF officers, extracted the victims from police detention, took them to the outskirts of Wunrok Town, along the road leading to Turalei Payam, and executed them by firing squad. The bodies of the victims were retrieved by their families the following day for interment.

Comment: Notably, 27 cases of extrajudicial executions by government security forces have so far been documented in Warrap States since January 2025.

Location of Incident: Bazi village, Morobo
Description:
1.	On 31 July, multiple secondary sources reported that on the same day, suspected SPLA-IO elements shot and killed one male civilian (Kenyan national) in Bazi village, Morobo County. According to the sources, the suspected armed SPLA-IO ambushed and opened fire on a private passenger vehicle enroute from Morobo Town along the Kaya road towards the Ugandan border, killing one of the passengers. The attackers reportedly also burnt down the vehicle with the body of victim inside. Another occupant of the vehicle (also a Kenyan national) is reportedly missing. The South Sudan People’s Defense Forces (SSPDF) responded to the scene and pursued the attackers killing one. 

Comment: According to the sources, the victims had been contracted to renovate the Catholic church buildings and were travelling to Kaya to purchase construction materials.

Location of Incident: Bazi village, Morobo
Description:
1.	On 31 July, multiple secondary sources reported that on the same day, suspected SPLA-IO elements shot and killed one male civilian (Kenyan national) in Bazi village, Morobo County. According to the sources, the suspected armed SPLA-IO ambushed and opened fire on a private passenger vehicle enroute from Morobo Town along the Kaya road towards the Ugandan border, killing one of the passengers. The attackers reportedly also burnt down the vehicle with the body of victim inside. Another occupant of the vehicle (also a Kenyan national) is reportedly missing. The South Sudan People’s Defense Forces (SSPDF) responded to the scene and pursued the attackers killing one. 

Comment: According to the sources, the victims had been contracted to renovate the Catholic church buildings and were travelling to Kaya to purchase construction materials.

Location of Incident: Kanja, Morobo
Description:
2.	On 29 and 31 July, three secondary sources reported that on 29 July, suspected SPLA-IO elements abducted one male civilian (staff of an international humanitarian organization) in Kanja, Morobo County, while he was returning from Morobo to Yei River County. The abductors reportedly demanded a ransom of 10,000 United States Dollars (USD). Reportedly, on 30 July, the victim was released unscathed. It was not clear whether the ransom was paid before the release.
Comment: Observably, the SPLA-IO have intensified their activities in the Greater Yei area with increased abductions of civilians, harassment and looting of civilian. The attacks on humanitarian workers in the region hamper relief efforts and pose a severe threat to humanitarian workers’ safety. These incidents undermine international humanitarian law.

Location of Incident: Hai Bambe, Hai SSTV, and Gumbo Centre residential areas in Rejaf Payam, Juba
Description:
3.	On 31 July, two secondary sources reported that on 29 and 30 July, joint security forces arbitrarily arrested and detained 10 boys (aged between 14 – 17 years) in Hai Bambe, Hai SSTV, and Gumbo Centre residential areas in Rejaf Payam, Juba County. The joint security forces allegedly demanded payments for the release of the detainees. Reportedly, one of the boys who was arrested in Gumbo Centre was released on 29 July after his parent paid 50,000 South Sudanese Pounds (SSP), while the other nine minors remain in custody pending similar payments. The sources further informed that the arrest and detention of minors by the joint security forces has become recurrent as a means of extorting money from the families of the victims for their release.

Comment: The practice of arbitrarily arresting minors and detaining them in unofficial facilities in exchange for money constitutes a serious violation of international human rights standards.

Location of Incident: Loriyok Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi
Description: 4.	On 31 July, 31 July, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, armed Logir youths from Chahari Payam, Ikotos County shot and killed four civilians(two women aged 23 and 26 years old and two men aged 33 and 37 years old)  from the Buya community and abducted one 20-year-old woman in Loriyok Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, a group of 15 armed Logir youths attacked and indiscriminately opened fire on the Buya community resident at the Kilong Gold Mine in Loriyok Boma, killing four civilians, reportedly in retaliation for the killing of one 27-year-old woman from the Logir community in Chahari Boma on 28 July 2025, and abducted one woman as they fled the scene. The incident was reported at Loriyok Police Station and investigations are reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: Loriyok Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi
Description: 4.	On 31 July, 31 July, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, armed Logir youths from Chahari Payam, Ikotos County shot and killed four civilians(two women aged 23 and 26 years old and two men aged 33 and 37 years old)  from the Buya community and abducted one 20-year-old woman in Loriyok Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, a group of 15 armed Logir youths attacked and indiscriminately opened fire on the Buya community resident at the Kilong Gold Mine in Loriyok Boma, killing four civilians, reportedly in retaliation for the killing of one 27-year-old woman from the Logir community in Chahari Boma on 28 July 2025, and abducted one woman as they fled the scene. The incident was reported at Loriyok Police Station and investigations are reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: Chahari Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos
Description: 5.	On 31 July, three secondary sources reported that on 28 July, armed Buya youths from Kimotong Payam, Budi County shot and killed one 27-year-old female civilian from the Logir community in Chahari Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos County. According to the sources, the armed Buya youths opened fire on the victim at her farm, as they retreated from a foiled cattle raid while being pursued by armed Logi youths. The incident was reported at Chahari Police Station and investigations are reportedly underway.

Location of Incident: Aguga village, Tonj Payam, Tonj South
Description:
6.	On 31 July, three primary sources reported that on 30 July, armed Dinka Gok youths from Cueibet County, Lakes State abducted one male civilian from the Bongo community in Aguga village, Tonj Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Gok youths attacked the victim while he was returning from Tonj Town where he had reportedly gone for shopping, and subsequently abducted him.  The whereabouts for the victim remain unknown. 

Comment: Reportedly, the incident is a revenge action for past unresolved grievances between communities along the Warrap-Lakes border. Notably, the Bongo and the Lou are the only two minority non-Dinka tribes in Warrap State, and their (Bongo) village (Aguga) directly shares a border with Cueibet County.

Location of Incident: Getan village, Bazia Payam, Wau
Description: 7.	On 29 and 31 July, multiple sources reported that on 16 June, SPLA-IO elements arbitrarily arrested and detained four male civilians (one Kenyan, one Ugandan and two South Sudanese nationals) in Getan village, Bazia Payam, Wau County. According to the sources, the SPLA-IO elements arrested the victims (subcontracted to undertake maintenance and expansion of the infrastructure of a telecommunications company in Bazia Payam) on accusation of operating in the area without prior notification to SPLA-IO authorities, Reportedly, the victims were transferred from Getan to a remote area near Bazia, and their work equipment were confiscated as well as other valuables and 200,000 SSP, and the SPLA-IO commander allegedly demanded 20,000,000 SSP for their release. Reportedly, on 19 June, following the intervention and negotiation by the National Security Service (NSS) and State authorities, all four victims were released from detention.

Location of Incident: Getan village, Bazia Payam, Wau
Description: 7.	On 29 and 31 July, multiple sources reported that on 16 June, SPLA-IO elements arbitrarily arrested and detained four male civilians (one Kenyan, one Ugandan and two South Sudanese nationals) in Getan village, Bazia Payam, Wau County. According to the sources, the SPLA-IO elements arrested the victims (subcontracted to undertake maintenance and expansion of the infrastructure of a telecommunications company in Bazia Payam) on accusation of operating in the area without prior notification to SPLA-IO authorities, Reportedly, the victims were transferred from Getan to a remote area near Bazia, and their work equipment were confiscated as well as other valuables and 200,000 SSP, and the SPLA-IO commander allegedly demanded 20,000,000 SSP for their release. Reportedly, on 19 June, following the intervention and negotiation by the National Security Service (NSS) and State authorities, all four victims were released from detention.

Location of Incident: Muni’bu village, Maridi town, Maridi County
Description:
8.	On 31 July, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one male civilian and injured another in Muni’bu village, Maridi town, Maridi County. According to the sources, the unidentified armed elements ambushed and opened fire on a private vehicle enroute from Juba Town to Maridi County, killing the driver and injuring one passenger. Reportedly, the injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Maridi Town for medical treatment. The incident was reported to the Maridi Police and investigations are reportedly ongoing. 

Comment: Reportedly, six commercial motorcycles traveling on the same road were also attacked and the motorcycles set ablaze during the attack, and the whereabouts of the motorcycle riders and passengers remain unknown.

Location of Incident: Muni’bu village, Maridi town, Maridi County
Description:
8.	On 31 July, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one male civilian and injured another in Muni’bu village, Maridi town, Maridi County. According to the sources, the unidentified armed elements ambushed and opened fire on a private vehicle enroute from Juba Town to Maridi County, killing the driver and injuring one passenger. Reportedly, the injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Maridi Town for medical treatment. The incident was reported to the Maridi Police and investigations are reportedly ongoing. 

Comment: Reportedly, six commercial motorcycles traveling on the same road were also attacked and the motorcycles set ablaze during the attack, and the whereabouts of the motorcycle riders and passengers remain unknown.

Location of Incident: Pisak, Otogo Payam, Yei River
Description:
1.	On 1 August, three secondary sources reported that on 29 July, suspected NAS elements abducted one 35-year-old male civilian (A driver attached to the County Department of Health) from the Kakwa community in Pisak, Otogo Payam, Yei River County. As recounted by the sources, while returning from Pisak to Yei Town, the vehicle that the victim was driving developed  a mechanical problem and he hired a motorcycle to seek the services of a mechanic to repair the vehicle; however, on their return, they were intercepted by suspected NAS elements who subsequently abducted the victim leaving the mechanic behind. The abductors reportedly demanded a ransom of 10,000 United states Dollars (USD) for his release.

Comment: Observably, abductions for ransom are increasing recurrent in the area, raising protection concerns for the civilians as well as humanitarian workers.

Location of Incident: Momoria Village, Chahari Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos
Description: 2.	On 1 August, three secondary sources reported that on 28 July, armed Dongotono youths from Imere Village, Chahari Payam shot and killed two male civilians (one 20-year-old and another 21-year-old) from the Dongotono community in Momoria Village, Chahari Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos County. According to the sources, the armed Dongotono youths attacked Momoria village and opened fire on the victims as they were grazing their cattle in the area, killing them. Reportedly, the local youths in Momoria village quickly mobilized and pursued the attackers who fled without raiding cattle any cattle. The incident was reported to the community leaders and at Chahari Police Station, where investigation is reportedly underway.

Location of Incident: Akuoc Island, Lith Payam, Twich East
Description:
3.	On 1 August, multiple sources reported that on 29 July, suspected armed youths from Hol sub-clan in Duk County shot and killed one male civilian and injured a six-year-old girl from the Ayuel sub-clan in Akuoc Island, Lith Payam, Twich East County. Reportedly, the assailants also looted four boats, radio communication equipment, and other personnel items. The attack reportedly triggered the displacement of an undetermined number of civilians in the area. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Bor Town for medical treatment.

Comment: According to the sources, the incident is linked to past and unresolved grievances between the Hol sub-clan of Duk County and the Ayuel sub-clan of Twich East County, that started on 4 June 2025 resulting into killing of 13 youths, injury of 30 others and five missing.

Location of Incident: Akuoc Island, Lith Payam, Twich East
Description:

Location of Incident: Gel-Achel training camp in Baliet County, Upper Nile State
Description: 4.	Between 29 July and 1 August, multiple sources reported that on 27 of July, 14 children who had been arbitrarily arrested and allegedly unlawfully recruited into the SSPDF escaped from the Gel-Achel training camp in Baliet County, Upper Nile State and were received by the authorities in Chuil Payam, Nyirol County on 28 July. According to the sources, the victims were students (including children aged between 15 – 17 years old) who were arbitrarily arrested by the SSPDF in Juba and Malakal Town (exact dates unspecified) and flown to Agel-Achel training site to be recruited into the ranks of the SSPDF. Reportedly, the victims were subjected to starvation and ill-treatment, which allegedly led to the death of three other victims.

Location of Incident: Nyium village, Burdoro Payam, Pochalla North
Description:
5.	On 28 July, one primary source reported that on 21 July, one 20-year-old woman who had been abducted by Murle armed elements from Nyium village, Burdoro Payam, Pochalla North County was recovered by authorities in Pibor, GPAA. Reportedly, the survivor was abducted by the Murle armed elements on 12 December 2016 (when she was nine-years-old) and transferred her to Othagon village in Lokormach Payam, Likuangole County, GPAA. On 12 July, the victim was taken to a health care facility in Pibor Town for medical examination and treatment, and subsequently transferred to the Interim Care Center in Pibor. The authorities are reportedly coordinating her family reunification.

Comment: The victim was reportedly subjected to varying forms of sexual and gender-based violence (SGBV) including being handed-off as blood compensation by her abductor, two instances of early and forced marriage in 2020 and 2022.

Location of Incident: Majak-Nyuon village, Toch North Payam, Gogrial East
Description: 6.	On 3 August, three primary sources reported that on 1 August, armed Nuer elements from Unity State, shot and killed one male civilian and injured another from the Dinka Apuk community in Majak-Nyuon village, Toch North Payam, Gogrial East County. According to the sources, the armed Nuer elements attacked and opened fire on Majak-Nyuon village, killing one civilian and injuring another. The attackers also seized 28 heads of cattle and fled back into Unity State. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Pathuon West Payam for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Majak-Nyuon village, Toch North Payam, Gogrial East
Description: 6.	On 3 August, three primary sources reported that on 1 August, armed Nuer elements from Unity State, shot and killed one male civilian and injured another from the Dinka Apuk community in Majak-Nyuon village, Toch North Payam, Gogrial East County. According to the sources, the armed Nuer elements attacked and opened fire on Majak-Nyuon village, killing one civilian and injuring another. The attackers also seized 28 heads of cattle and fled back into Unity State. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Pathuon West Payam for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Majak-Nyuon village, Toch North Payam, Gogrial East
Description: 6.
