According to the sources, the armed Nuer elements attacked and opened fire on Majak-Nyuon village, killing one civilian and injuring another. The attackers also seized 28 heads of cattle and fled back into Unity State. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Pathuon West Payam for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Marial-Lou Town, Marial-Lou Payam, Tonj North
Description: 7.	On 3 August, three secondary sources reported that on 31 July, armed Dinka Thiik youths from Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County shot and killed three civilians (two men and one girl) from the  Dinka Lou-Paher community in Marial-Lou Town, Marial-Lou Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Thiik youths attacked the Dinka Lou-Paher community in Marial-Lou Town, and opened fire on a homestead, killing the victims. Reportedly, the attack was a revenge action for past unresolved violence-related grievances between the two communities.

Location of Incident: Ajam-Nhom village, Rualbet Payam, Tonj North
Description: 8.	On 3 August, three secondary sources reported that on 31 July, armed Dinka Lou-Paher youths from Marial-Lou Payam shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Jurbol community during a cattle raid in Ajam-Nhom village, Rualbet Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Lou-Paher youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Awan community in Ajam-Nhom village, killing one civilian. the attackers also raided 15 heads of cattle. Reportedly, the armed Dinka Awan youths pursued the attackers and in the ensuing confrontation, one armed Dinka Lou-Paher youth was killed.

Location of Incident: Ajam-Nhom village, Rualbet Payam, Tonj North
Description: 8.	On 3 August, three secondary sources reported that on 31 July, armed Dinka Lou-Paher youths from Marial-Lou Payam shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Jurbol community during a cattle raid in Ajam-Nhom village, Rualbet Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Lou-Paher youths attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Awan community in Ajam-Nhom village, killing one civilian. the attackers also raided 15 heads of cattle. Reportedly, the armed Dinka Awan youths pursued the attackers and in the ensuing confrontation, one armed Dinka Lou-Paher youth was killed.

Location of Incident: Napere residential area, Yambio Town, Yambio
Description:
9.	On 3 August, multiple sources reported that on 2 August, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one male civilian (the Director General at the State Ministry of General Education and Instruction) in the Napere residential area, Yambio Town, Yambio County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked and opened fire on the victim in his home, killing him. The motive for the attack remains unknown. 

Comment: HRD will follow up to gather more information on the incident.

Location of Incident: Yirol town of Yirol West County
Description:
A 16-year-old girl escaped an attempted forced marriage and reported herself to the Police in Yirol town of Yirol West County 

On 1 July 2025, during the UNMO-led SDP to Yirol town, HRD visited the Yirol Police Station and met with the Crime Officer and Acting Police Commissioner. The Crime Officer informed the team that, on 29 June 2025, a 16-year-old girl (name on file) reported herself to the Police Station as she escaped an attempted forced marriage. According to the Crime Officer, the girl, who was from Yeri Payam of Mvolo County of Western Equatoria State, was told by her father that she should go to Juba for her studies. Her father took the road with her and brought her to Aluak Luak Payam of Yirol West County in Lakes State where they met with a man (name on file). Her father told her the man would accompany her to Juba and left her with him. As the girl travelled further with the man into towards Yirol town, the man informed her that he had reached an agreement with her father and that she was to be his wife. The girl refused and escaped during the night. She presented herself to the Yirol town Police Station where her case was handled by the Special Protection Unit (SPU) Officer and the Crime Officer. Both indicated to HRD that the girl was in good physical condition when she reached the Police Station and her case was subsequently transferred to the Public Prosecutor. The Public Prosecutor decided to refer the case to the Police and authorities in Western Equatoria where the girl and her father reside, as the father was back in Yeri Payam of Mvolo County at the time and refused to come to Yirol town when contacted by the Yirol Crime Officer. Hence, the Public Prosecutor sent a letter to the Police in Mvolo County requesting them to summon the father of the girl to the Police Station for case resolution. The Crime Officer and the SPU indicated to HRD that the girl was sent back to Mvolo County on the morning of 1 July 2025 with a Police escort. It is expected that, upon her arrival, the Police will refer both her and her father to the local Public Prosecutor who will ask the father to sign a letter of commitment according to which he will refrain from attempting to force his daughter into marriage. 

Comment: HRD will follow up with the Crime Officer to ensure that the girl reached Western Equatoria safely and that the case is being handled accordingly in her County.

Location of Incident: Hai Dilep village, Jansuk Boma, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County
Description:
•	Rape of a16-year-old girl by a civilian man in Hai Dilep village, Jansuk Boma, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County

On 01 June 2025, HRD-YFO received and documented credible information from two reliable secondary sources, a police officer and a medical office concerning the alleged rape of a 16-year-old girl by a civilian man in Hai Dilep village, Jansuk Boma, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County, South Sudan on the night of 27 May 2025.

Sources reported that on 27 May 2025, the 16-year-old girl, member of the Kakwa tribe (details on file) went to a nearby funeral place at Hai Dilep village, Jansuk Boma, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County. The incident happened when the survivor was returning from funeral and allegedly taken to her “boyfriend’s” house, where the rape occurred. The incident became known when the victim’s family learned of it from other sources, leading to the  victim  brother (details on file) to report the case to Luparate Police Station on 17 June 2025. Following the police report, the victim was issued Form 8 (medical examination request) and taken to a medical facility in Yei Town for examination and treatment. It was determined at the medical facility that the 16-year-old was found to be pregnant. The suspect (details on file), a civilian man, was arrested by police on 17 June 2025 and remains in custody for further investigations.

Comments: The alleged rape constitutes a grave violation of the victim’s right to personal security and bodily integrity, as enshrined in the South Sudanese Constitution and international human rights instruments (e.g., Convention on the Rights of the Child, CEDAW). HRD-YFO will continue to monitor the case and advocate for justice, survivor support, and broader community protection against sexual and gender-based violence.

Location of Incident: Dok Nuer girl in Touchriak payam, Leer County, Unity State
Description:
•	A Dok Nuer man raped a 16-year-old Dok Nuer girl in Touchriak payam, Leer County, Unity State
On 1 July 2025, a service provider in Thonyor, Leer County, informed HRD that on 07 June 2025, a 25-year-old Dok Nuer man raped a 16-year-old Dok Nuer girl in Touchriak Payam, Leer County. According to the source, the alleged perpetrator is the victim’s former primary school teacher and tricked the girl to visit his home around 2pm on the day of the incident. Reportedly, when the girl turned down the alleged perpetrator’s sexual advances, he raped her. The service provider informed that the victim received medical treatment at a health facility in Touchriak payam but did not report the case to the police. Reportedly, the perpetrator has not yet been arrested, and investigations are yet to be initiated by the police.
Comments: HRD will gather more details, refer the case to protection partners, and advocate for accountability. HRD will report accordingly.

Location of Incident: Yirol town of Yirol West County
Description:
HRD followed up on the case of the 16-year-old girl who escaped an attempted forced marriage in Yirol town of Yirol West County

On 4 July 2025, HRD followed up with the Yirol Police on the case of the 16-year-old girl who escaped an attempted marriage in Yirol town of Yirol West County on 29 June 2025.  HRD was able to confirm that the girl had safely been escorted back to her home County of Mvolo in Western Equatoria State where she was handed to the local Police on 1 July 2025. Reportedly, the Police summoned the girl’s father to the Police Station where they asked him to sign a commitment letter to the effect that he would refrain from attempting to marry his daughter by force again before handing her back to him. The Yirol Police stated that their colleagues in Mvolo County are expected to send them a copy of the letter.

Comment: The practice of using commitment letters as a tool to educate parents on the practice of forced marriages and to hold them accountable for future behaviors is usually done by Public Prosecutors in Lakes State. According to the Yirol Police, the procedure was handled by the Police in this case due to the reported absence of a Public Prosecutor in Mvolo County.

Location of Incident: Mboro Boma, Bisselia Payam, Wau county
Description:
•	A 19-year-old female was allegedly dragged in a bush and raped by a motorcycle rider, in Mboro Boma, Bisselia Payam, Wau county 

On 4 July 2025, HRD received the information from secondary sources about an alleged rape of a 19-year-old female from the Bai tribe along the Mboro-Wau road.

HRD met and interviewed the survivor, who recounted that on 27 June at around 11:00 AM, she was traveling on foot from Mboro to Wau town. Upon reaching the Mboro MTN phone antenna, a man on a motorcycle stopped and offered her a ride. She agreed and they traveled together until they reached a remote area with no farms or nearby settlements. The suspect stopped the motorcycle and dragged her into the bush. Despite her efforts to cry for help and resist, the suspect overpowered her, injured her neck, tore her clothes and underwear, and raped her before fleeing the scene. After the incident, the survivor managed to walk back to the roadside, where two men assisted her and took her to her cousin in Mboro. She was able to identify the suspect by name.

HRD interviewed the complainant, a 43-year-old male from the Bai tribe, who reported the incident involving his cousin, the survivor. He stated that on 27 June, he had asked his cousin to carry some of his luggage and travel ahead of him from Mboro to Wau. While on her journey, she was allegedly raped by a motorcycle rider (name on file). The complainant explained that the victim returned injured and distraught, and he immediately reported the incident to local authorities.

HRD visited the Special Protection Unit (SPU) to follow up on the alleged rape. The SPU informed HRD that the incident was reported to the unit after it was first reported to SPLA-IO elements in Mboro Boma on 28 June 2025, and later referred to the Jou Market Police on 3 July, where the victim was issued a Form 8. On 4 July, the case was formally filed at the SPU under Sections 225/247 of the South Sudan Penal Code 2008, and a warrant of arrest was issued for the suspect.

Comment: HRD will follow up on the case and advocate for the victim’s access to justice.

Location of Incident: Luzira Village, Yei Town, Yei River County
Description:
•	Alleged rape of a 22-year-old civilian woman in Luzira Village, Yei Town, Yei River County

On 03 July 2025, HRD-YFO received and documented credible information from four reliable secondary sources—medical officer and a community worker—concerning the alleged rape of a 22-year-old civilian woman (details on file) in Luzira Village, Yei Town, Yei River County on 22 April 2025. 

According to the sources, on 22 April 2025, the survivor from the Kakwa tribe left her husband’s (details not provided) house at approximately 11:00 AM to visit her ex-boyfriend (details on file), who was reportedly ill. Upon arrival, she was reportedly offered juice in a glass, while the ex-boyfriend drank directly from the packet. She later lost consciousness and, around 3:00 PM, found herself naked on the ex-boyfriend’s bed. The survivor received multiple phone calls during this period, which she did not answer, possibly due to incapacitation. She strongly suspects that the drink offered to her was drugged. After regaining consciousness, she left the premises but did not immediately disclose the incident due to fear and shame. She was particularly afraid to tell her husband.

On 23 June 2025, more than two months after the alleged rape, the survivor confided in her husband. Her decision to disclose was prompted by concern that her child’s increasing illness might be related to the sexual assault. The husband subsequently reported the case to the Yei Town police station. The survivor was then taken to a medical facility for a check-up, including a pregnancy test and further examination.

Comments: The survivor’s account indicates a grave violation of her right to personal security and bodily integrity, as protected under the South Sudanese Constitution and international human rights law. The delay in reporting highlights ongoing challenges faced by survivors of sexual violence, such as stigma, fear of reprisal, and lack of trust in authorities.

Location of Incident: IDP Camp 3 in Juba on 4 July 2025.
Description:
•	Rape of a 14-year-old girl by two gang members at the IDP Camp 3 in Juba on 4 July 2025.

On 7 July 2025, HRD received credible information from a cleric based at the IDP Camp in Juba that on 4 July 2025, at around 11 pm a 14 years old girl of Nuer ethnicity (One name on record)  was attacked and ganged raped by two young members of a gang group whose ages are 17 and 18 years old of Nuer ethnicity (Names on record) who are part of larger group of a gangsters operating at the IDP camp (III)  in Juba. 

The victim was attacked and raped by the two while returning from a public latrine at the site. The two suspects were reportedly apprehended and detained by the CMC and on the 6 July 2025, they were handed over to the police at the check point police station in Juba where they are currently being detained. He noted that the investigations are still underway.

Comments: HRD will continue to monitor the case.

Location of Incident: Cueibet town - Pagor Payam way, within Cueibet County
Description:
A girl aged between 14 and 15 reportedly raped by a man on the Cueibet town - Pagor Payam way, within Cueibet County

On 11 July 2025, HRD received preliminary information from a secondary source (a Government authority) to the effect that on 5 July, a girl aged between 14 and 15 was attacked by three men, while walking on the way between Cueibet town and Pagor Payam, within Cueibet County. The source specified that the incident took time at daytime (the exact time was not communicated), and during the attack, one of the assaulters reportedly raped the victim. Further, the source stated that after the incident, the victim was reportedly bleeding but proceeded home to Pagor Payam. HRD was unable to confirm whether she received proper medical attention.

The victim is allegedly a member of the Waat section of the Dinka Gok community established in Cueibet County. She reportedly indicated that during the assault, the other two men involved in the attack simply stole the food items she had carried from Cueibet town market.

At the time of the reporting, HRD also learned that all three suspected attackers were yet to be identified, and still at large, with the Police actively looking for them.

Comment: HRD continues to follow-up on the case.

Location of Incident: Rorbai village of Pagor Payam, located in Cueibet County, on 26 June 2025
Description:
HRD followed on the incident involving a 13-year-old girl reportedly raped by a 20-year-old man in Rorbai village of Pagor Payam, located in Cueibet County, on 26 June 2025

On 11 July 2025, HRD followed up with Cueibet County authorities on the incident involving a 13-year-old girl raped by a 20-year-old man in Rorbai village of Pagor Payam, located in Cueibet County, on 26 June 2025 . One Government source in Cueibet County informed that the alleged perpetrator (name on file) was arrested on 28 June in Pagor Payam and subsequently transferred to detention in Rumbek town of Rumbek Center County, on 30 June, for further prosecution.

Comment: HRD will continue following up on the prosecution process of the suspect in Rumbek town.

Location of Incident: Kongor payam in Likunagole county
Description:
A 16-year-old Murle girl forced into marriage escaped after suffering from SGBV to authorities in Pibor, GPAA.

On 10 July, HRD met and interviewed a victim of forced marriage at the Interim Care Center (ICC) in the Ministry of Gender, Child and Social Welfare in Pibor, GPAA. The 16-year-old girl (name on file) from Kongor payam in Likunagole county informed HRD that she was booked when she was around 7-year-old in 2018 and sometime between February-March 2025, the man of about 38-year-old who booked her with about 20 cattle, together with his age-set friends forced her into the man’s house as his wife. She said since then, the man has been beating her for styling her hair, abusing her sexually and threatening to kill her. 

Comments: HRD will follow up on the case

Location of Incident: Bebuzen payam in Likungole county
Description:
Two Murle female victims (girls) of GBV escaped their homes for safety at the Pibor Interim care Center, GPAA. 

On 10 July, HRD met and interviewed two female victims of GBV at the Interim Care Center (ICC) in the Ministry of Gender, Child and Social Welfare in Pibor, GPAA. The first girl (name on file) of about 17-year-old from Bebuzen payam in Likungole county informed that she has been married to her husband since around 2022 and all along she has been subjected to constant physical assault and sexual abuse, forcing her escape from home on 05 July and sought protection at the ICC. The second 17-year-old girl (name on file) also from Bebuzem payam in Likuangole county also reported to HRD that she suffered from constant and severe beatings from the husband simply because she has not been able to give to birth since she was forcefully married to the man around 2020. 

Comments: HRD will follow up on both cases.

Location of Incident: Nyacharavachiz village in Vulvet payam in Gumuruk county, GPAA
Description:
A 16-year-old Murle victim of forced marriage sought protection at the Pibor Police Station, GPAA

On 15 July, HRD met and interviewed a 16-year-old Murle girl (name on file) at the Pibor Police Station in Pibor, GPAA. The girl from Nyacharavachiz village in Vulvet payam in Gumuruk county, GPAA, escaped from her family around 01 July 2025 who were forcing her to marry 40-year-old man. She reported herself at the Police Station and has been in protective custody. The victim was reportedly booked into marriage where the supposed husband gave fifty cows as dowry to her parents. Because her parents couldn’t afford to return the fifty cows, forcing the girlchild into marriage remained the sole option. 
Comments: This is just one of the frequent cases of early and forced marriages that are reported as of recent in GPAA. It is believed that other cases of forced marriage went unknown and unreported, especially in remote villages.

Location of Incident: Manyirany village in Pibor
Description:
A 17-year-old girl forced to leave school to be married off

On 14 July, HRD documented a forced marriage case of a 17-year-old Murle girl at the Interim Care Center (ICC) in the Ministry of Gender, Child and Social Welfare in Pibor, GPAA.  The girl (name on file), originally from Manyirany village in Pibor told HRD, with tears in her eyes, she arrived Pibor on 13 July from where she was studying her Senior 8 in Jube to marry a 40-year-old man who booked her years ago.

In protest to this violation the victim escaped her family house in the morning of 14 July and reported herself to ICC for protection. HRD was informed by social workers at the ICC that she has been weeping since her arrival at the facility. The victim to pursue her education, but worried that not be able to return to her mother in Juba as that would put her mother into serious problem with her father.

Comments: As of recent cases of early and forced marriages have become rampant in GPAA. HRD will continue to advocate with the local authorities to sustain engagement with communities on ending this deeply entrenched cultural practice which violates the rights of girls, including their right to education.

Location of Incident: Roni, Yei River County
Description:
•	Rape of a 33-year-old civilian woman by an armed police officer in Roni, Yei River County

On 14 July 2025, HRD-YFO and UNPOL conducted a joint visit to One Stop Centre and the Police Headquarters in Yei Town. The purpose of the visits was to follow up on CRSV and SGBV cases. The team received and documented credible information from four reliable secondary sources including a medical officer a community worker and two gender desk police officers of Yei Police headquarters concerning the rape of a 33-year-old civilian woman from Kakwa tribe (details on file) in Roni, around 4 Miles, Kaya Road, Yei River County on 07 July 2025. 

According to the sources, the survivor had a fight with another lady on 07 July 2025 where the lady in question sustained some injuries and was hospitalized. The situation was reported to a police officer (details on file) who works at the Yei Police Headquarters in Yei town but stays in the same neighborhood with the survivor. He arbitrarily arrested the 33-year-old lady and took her to the area chief at about 10:00PM. When they got to the chief’s office, the police officer was advised by the chief to take the lady back to her home and return the following morning since it was already late. While on their way back home, the officer threatened the lady, raped her and fled the scene. The case was reported to the police on 08 July 2025, and the survivor was referred to a health center in Yei town on same day for medical examination and the rape was confirmed.

 HRD-YFO and UNPOL visited the Gender Desk of the Yie Police Headquarters to follow up on the case and to ascertain whether the concerned police officer was arrested. It was reported that the police officer escaped after the incident and his whereabouts has not been determined yet. 


Comments: The rape indicates grave violation of the survivor’s bodily integrity and the right to personal security as protected under the South Sudanese Constitution and international human rights law. Slogish or lack of proper investigations highlights ongoing challenges faced by survivors of sexual violence, such as stigma, fear of reprisal, and lack of trust in authorities. HRD will continue to follow up with the police to ensure accountability and proper administration of justice.

Location of Incident: Amia II in Yei Town Payam, Yei Rive County
Description:
•	Rape of a 16-year-old civilian female by a 17-year-old civilian male in Amia II in Yei Town Payam, Yei Rive County

On 15 July 2025, HRD-YFO and UNPOL conducted a joint monitoring visit to the Gender Desk of the Yei Police Headquarters in Yei Town Payam, Yei River County. The purpose of the visit was to follow up on police actions on Sexual Gender Based Violence (SGBV) and Conflict Related Sexual Violence (CRSV) reported cases and to get details of new cases. The team met with two officers of the Gender Desk (details on file) who reported on the rape of a 16-year-old civilian female of the Jur tribe by a 17-year-old civilian male of the Murle tribe, in Amia II between 10 and 12 July 2025.

According to the sources, the 17-year-old perpetrator (details on file) visited the 16-year-old survivor (details on file) at her residence in Amia II on 10 July 2025 where she stays with her parents and took her to his residence within the same neighborhood. He kept her for two nights without the knowledge of her parents and raped her multiple times. The young girl only returned home on 12 July 2025 at about 8:00AM after several failed attempts made by her parents to find her. After undergoing intense beatings from her 25-year-old father (details on file), the young girl revealed the perpetrator’s information. The case was reported to the police on 14 July, and the girl was referred to a health center for medical examination in Yei town, where the rape was confirmed. The perpetrator was arrested on the same day and kept in detention at the Yei Police Headquarters.  


Comments: The rape of a minor constitutes grave violation of the survivor’s bodily integrity as protected under the South Sudanese Constitution and in international human rights law (right to freedom from cruel, inhumane or degrading treatment – Article 5 of Universal Declaration of Human Rights - UDHR). HRD will follow up with the police to ensure accountability and proper administration of justice.

Location of Incident: Lasu Town, Lasu Payam, Yei River County
Description:
•	Rape of a 14-year-old civilian female in Lasu Town, Lasu Payam, Yei River County

On 14 July 2025, HRD-YFO received and documented credible information from four reliable secondary sources—medical officer and a community worker and two police officers—on the rape of a 14-year-old civilian female from the Kakwa tribe (details on file) in Lasu Town, Lasu Payam, Yei River County on 09 July 2025. 

According to the sources, a masked unidentified armed robber broke into the residence of the survivor on 09 July 2025 at about 9:00PM when the survivor and her 8-year-old sister were already asleep. After searching through the entire house and finding nothing to steal, he threatened the children with a gun and a panga and raped the 14-year-old girl in the presence of her 8-year-old sister. The case was reported to the Lasu Police Post during the morning hours on 12 July and was transferred to the Yei Police Headquarters for proper investigation. The survivor was also referred to a health facility in Yei town on the same day for medical examination where the rape was confirmed. HRD-YFO visited the Gender Desk of the Yei Police Headquarters to follow up on the case. The gender desk officers reported that they have not been able to uncover who the perpetrator is, since he was masked during the act. 

Comments: The gruesome act of rape of the 14-year-old in the presence of her 8-year-old sister constitutes gross violation of not just her bodily integrity, as protected under the South Sudanese Constitution and international human rights law but the right to privacy (Articles 5 and 12 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights). HRD-YFO urged the police gender desk to intensify investigation on the case to ensure accountability and proper administration of justice. We will continue to follow up with the police for developments.

Location of Incident: Naanzari village, Bazungua Payam, Yambio County
Description:
•	13-year-old girl reportedly raped at Naanzari village, Bazungua Payam, Yambio County 

On 22 July 2025, HRD Yambio Field Office received and documented information from multiple secondary sources, including CSOs and community leaders, regarding a rape case involving a 13-year-old female minor from the Azande Community and a 60-year-old man at Naanzari village located about 5 kilometers from Yambio town in Bazungua Payam. According to the sources, on 21 July, the victim went to fetch water at a nearby water point where the perpetrator accosted and dragged her to the nearby bush and repeatedly raped her.
The survivor received medical assistance at the One Stop Centre at the Yambio State Hospital; however, the perpetrator is still at large. 

On July 22, 2025, HRD Yambio FO received and documented disturbing information from various secondary sources, including Civil Society Organizations (CSOs) and community leaders, concerning a distressing case of sexual violence. The incident involved a 13-year-old girl from the Azande community and a 60-year-old man in Naanzari village, approximately 5 kilometers from Yambio town in Bazungua Payam.

According to reports gathered from community members, on July 21, the young victim had gone to a nearby water point to fetch water, a routine task she had likely performed many times before. It was during this brief excursion that the perpetrator approached her, forcibly dragging her into a secluded area within the nearby bush, where he subjected her to repeated sexual assault.

Following the heinous act, the survivor received urgent medical attention at the One Stop Centre located within the Yambio State Hospital. Medical professionals there provided care, addressing both her physical injuries and emotional trauma. Despite the serious nature of the crime, the perpetrator remains at large, evading justice and leaving the community in a state of fear and uncertainty. 

Comment: HRD is concerned about this sexual assault on a minor and urges authorities to take immediate action to apprehend the suspect and ensure the safety of all community members, particularly vulnerable children.

Location of Incident: Yambio Town, Yambio County
Description:
•	SSPDF soldier allegedly rapes a 16-year-old girl in Yambio Town, Yambio County 

On July 25, 2025, HRD Yambio FO received and documented information concerning the alleged rape of a 16-year-old girl by a soldier affiliated with the South Sudan People's Defense Forces (SSPDF) in Yambio Town, Yambio County. The initial details of the incident were relayed to HRD by both the One Stop Center at Yambio County Hospital and UNPOL, highlighting the collaborative efforts of local health and law enforcement agencies in responding to such grave allegations.

According to various sources, the incident occurred on July 3, when the victim was on her way home from school. As she walked through the Hai-Naduru area, she encountered the alleged perpetrator, a soldier stationed in Mundri East, who has a residence in Hai-Naduru where he frequently returns. After having approached her previously with intentions to initiate a romantic relationship, which she firmly declined, he subsequently assaulted her.

On July 4, the victim's parents discovered her in a state of distress, bleeding profusely. Concerned for their daughter’s well-being, they confronted her about the source of her injuries, at which point she revealed the traumatic encounter with the soldier. She recounted that he had forcibly taken her to his home, where the assault occurred, and that she was released only late in the evening, around 7:30 PM the previous night.

At the time of this report, HRD is still confirming whether the incident was officially reported to local law enforcement or if any action, such as the arrest of the suspect, has taken place. HRD plans to follow up with representatives from the One Stop Center and the Yambio Police Station to gather further information and ensure justice is pursued in this case. 

Comment: HRD remains committed to advocating for victims' rights and ensuring their voices are heard in the pursuit of accountability and assistance.

Location of Incident: Logoberoe, Yei River County
Description:
•	Rape of a 37-year-old civilian female by unknown man in Logoberoe, Yei River County
On 28 July 2025, HRD-YFO received and documented credible information from three reliable secondary sources including two medical officers and a community worker about the rape of a 37-year-old civilian female resident at the St. Mary area and of the Baka tribe (details on file) in Logobero, Yei River County on 23 July 2025. 

According to the sources, the incident occurred on 23 July 2025 when an unknown man armed an arrow and bow and pang stormed victims’ home about 10:00PM and threatened the family members with a panga and a bow and arrow. Subsequently, the perpetrator forcefully took the 37-year-old woman to Logobero neighborhood, far from her residence where he tore her clothes and raped her. The case was not reported to the police, but the even though she reported the matter to one of health facilities for medical care. 

Comments: The rape of a 37-year-old female constitutes gross violation of human rights, including bodily integrity, protection and liberty as protected under the South Sudanese Constitution and international human rights law including Articles 2, 3 and 5 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights. HRD-YFO will continue to engage with police and other county authorities to enforce the protection of civilians in Greater Yei.

Location of Incident: Wuluturu, Yei River County
Description:
•	Rape of a 16-year-old civilian Female by a civilian Male in Wuluturu, Yei River County
On 28 July 2025, HRD-YFO received and documented credible information from three reliable secondary sources including two medical officers and a community worker about the rape of a 16-year-old civilian female resident at Wuluturu and of the Kakwa tribe (details on file) in Wuluturu, Yei River County in May 2025. 

According to the sources, the incident occurred in May 2025 where the perpetrator, resident of Wuluturu and of the Kakwa tribe (details on file) invited the survivor to his residence in the Wuluturu and raped her multiple times and resulted in a pregnancy. The incident went unnoticed until the pregnancy signs became visible in July 2025. The mother of the survivor subjected her to serious interrogation, and she revealed the details of the perpetrator. The case was reported to the Yei Police Headquarters on 25 July 2025, and the survivor was referred to a medical facility in Yei Town for examination that confirmed pregnancy. 

Comments: The rape of a 16-year-old violates her right to protection from cruel, inhuman, or degrading treatment and punishment according to Article 5 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights. HRD-YFO will follow up with the police to ensure that due process is followed.

Location of Incident: Nyombe, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County
Description:
•	Rape of a 14-year-old civilian female in Nyombe, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County

On 28 July 2025, HRD-YFO received and documented credible information from three reliable secondary sources  including two medical officers and a community worker  about  the rape of a 14-year-old civilian female from the Kakwa tribe (details on file) in Nyombe, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County on 22 July 2025. 

According to the sources, the incident occurred between 22 and 23 July 2025 where the perpetrator, aged between 19 and 20 years of age, a resident of Nyombe and of the Baka tribe (details on file) invited the girl to his residence for a movie and she ended up spending a night at the perpetrators residence where she was raped. Multiple times. The sources revealed that when the young girl got home, her mother subjected her to serious beatings before revealing that she was raped. The matter was reported to Nyombe Police on 24 July 2025. The survivors were referred to one of the health facilities in Yei town for medical attention on same day, 24 July 2024. At Police, HRD, established, no arrest or any investigations have been conducted. 

Comments: The rape of a 14-year-old constitutes gross violation of human rights, it violates the bodily integrity, as protected under the South Sudanese Constitution and international human rights law including Article 5 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights. HRD-YFO urged the Nyombe police to conduct thorough investigations to ensure accountability and proper administration of justice. HRD will continue to follow up with the police.

Location of Incident: Ateko village, Lasu Payam, Yei River County
Description:
•	Rape of a 16-year-old married civilian female by her father-in-law in Ateko village, Lasu Payam, Yei River County

On 28 July 2025, HRD-YFO received and documented credible information from three reliable secondary sources including two medical officers, and a community worker regarding the rape of a 16-year-old married civilian female from the Kakwa tribe (details on file) in Ateko village, Lasu Payam, Yei River County on 16 July 2025. 

According to the sources, the survivor went out at around 8:00 PM on 16 July 2025, to fetch water at a nearby water point in Ateko without knowing that the perpetrator, the father-in-law (details not provided) with whom she lives was trailing her. When they had gotten to an isolated location the Father-in-law pounced on victim, raped and abandoned her at the scene. The husband of the survivor upon his return, established the incident and reported it to the Lasu Police station on 20 July 2025. The victim was subsequently taken to a health facility in Yei Town where she got medical care.  HRD found that no arrest was conducted by the Lasu police.  

Comments: The marriage and gruesome act of rape of a 16-year-old by an adult male constitutes gross violation of not just her bodily integrity, as protected under the South Sudanese Constitution, Child Act and international human rights law but the right to privacy and protection (Articles 5 and 12 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights). South Sudan law considers sex with a minor to be a crime under penal code act sec 247. HRD-YFO will follow up to ensure accountability and proper administration of justice.

Location of Incident: Yambio State Hospital in Yambio Town, Yambio County
Description:
•	HRD Monitors the One Stop Centre and Documents 18 Cases of SGBV

On July 28, 2025, HRD monitored the GBV One Stop Centre at Yambio State Hospital in Yambio Town, Yambio County, and documented 18 cases of gender-based violence (GBV) recorded between June 25 and July 27, 2025.

Most of the cases involved female minors and one male minor, with survivors ranging in age from 5 to 16 years. HRD documented a total of 18 cases involving 18 survivors, all from the Azande community. Ten of the survivors are female minors, highlighting a concerning pattern of GBV perpetrated by adult males targeting female minors. Additionally, one male minor was raped by another 15-year-old male.

The first case involved a 15-year-old girl from the Azande community who was reportedly gang-raped by two men on an unspecified date in May 2025 while returning from a funeral in the Tiimbiro neighborhood. According to sources, the victim identified one of the suspects, who was arrested but later escaped to Juba. The victim's parents reported the case to the One Stop Centre on July 10 after learning she had become pregnant due to the incident.

In the second case, on July 7, a 22-year-old male from the Azande community reportedly raped a 15-year-old girl in Yabongo, a residential area in Yambio Town. The perpetrator accosted the survivor while she was fetching water from a school, pulled her into his room with the help of friends, and raped her. This case was also opened at the Yambio Police Station.

The third case, also on July 7, involved a 22-year-old female from the Azande community who was physically assaulted by her 45-year-old father-in-law in the Hai Kabat suburb. The victim sustained injuries and reported the case to the Masia Police Station; however, the suspect was not arrested as he is believed to be a member of the South Sudan Prisons Service.

In the fourth case, on July 4, a 15-year-old female from the Azande community was raped by a 21-year-old civilian from the Balanda community in the Hai-Kuzee residential area. The perpetrator accosted her while she was returning from church practice, dragged her into an abandoned house, and raped her. The case was opened at the Masia Police Station, but the suspect remained at large at the time of this report.

The fifth case involved a 16-year-old female from the Azande community who was raped by a male civilian from the Sudanese community in Yabongo. On July 7, her parents discovered she was pregnant and brought her to the One Stop Centre. The perpetrator, who lived in the same neighborhood, forcibly entered her room when her parents were away and repeatedly raped her. A case was opened at the Yambio Police Station, and police were searching for the suspect.

In the sixth case, on July 5, a 23-year-old male from the Azande community raped a 16-year-old girl from the same community. The victim was returning from school when the suspect dragged her to his room and raped her. A case was filed at the Masia Police Station; however, the suspect was still at large.
The seventh case involved a 28-year-old man from the Azande community who reportedly raped a 16-year-old girl while she was visiting her uncle in Gitikiri Boma, Bazuangua Payam. The perpetrator, related to the victim, accosted her in the bush and raped her. The case was reported to the Yambio Police Station, but the perpetrator remained at large.

In the eighth case, on July 15, a 50-year-old male civilian from the Azande community raped a 13-year-old girl in Makpara village, Lirangu Payam. The perpetrator, the victim's grandmother's husband, assaulted her while his wife was at the farm. The case was reported to the police, and the suspect was arrested; however, the grandmother opted not to pursue legal action.

The ninth case occurred in Baawiri Boma, Gangura Payam, where an 18-year-old male from the Azande community raped a 16-year-old female on July 21. He accosted the victim while she was returning from a water point and raped her. He was arrested and detained by the police.

The tenth case involved a male civilian from the Azande community who raped a 14-year-old girl on July 16. The suspect followed the victim to her home in the ZVTC residential area, entered her room, and raped her. HRD could not obtain further details about this case.

The eleventh case occurred on July 13 in the Tiimbiro residential area, where a 15-year-old male civilian from the Azande community raped a 5-year-old male minor. The victim sustained injuries but received medical assistance at Yambio Hospital and was discharged.

Additionally, HRD documented seven incidents of domestic violence involving seven adult male perpetrators from the Azande and Jur communities, with the survivors being their wives. All survivors received medical and psychosocial support and ultimately chose not to initiate legal proceedings.

Comments: These incidents highlight a troubling pattern of violence against women and children within Yambio County, raising protection concerns. HRD shall follow up on the reported cases at the Yabio and Masia Police Stations to advocate for judicial accountability and justice for the victims.

Location of Incident: Yambio State Hospital in Yambio Town, Yambio County
Description:
•	HRD Monitors the One Stop Centre and Documents 18 Cases of SGBV

Additionally, HRD documented seven incidents of domestic violence involving seven adult male perpetrators from the Azande and Jur communities, with the survivors being their wives. All survivors received medical and psychosocial support and ultimately chose not to initiate legal proceedings.

Comments: These incidents highlight a troubling pattern of violence against women and children within Yambio County, raising protection concerns. HRD shall follow up on the reported cases at the Yabio and Masia Police Stations to advocate for judicial accountability and justice for the victims.

Location of Incident: Yambio State Hospital in Yambio Town, Yambio County
Description:
•	HRD Monitors the One Stop Centre and Documents 18 Cases of SGBV

On July 28, 2025, HRD monitored the GBV One Stop Centre at Yambio State Hospital in Yambio Town, Yambio County, and documented 18 cases of gender-based violence (GBV) recorded between June 25 and July 27, 2025.

Most of the cases involved female minors and one male minor, with survivors ranging in age from 5 to 16 years. HRD documented a total of 18 cases involving 18 survivors, all from the Azande community. Ten of the survivors are female minors, highlighting a concerning pattern of GBV perpetrated by adult males targeting female minors. Additionally, one male minor was raped by another 15-year-old male.

The first case involved a 15-year-old girl from the Azande community who was reportedly gang-raped by two men on an unspecified date in May 2025 while returning from a funeral in the Tiimbiro neighborhood. According to sources, the victim identified one of the suspects, who was arrested but later escaped to Juba. The victim's parents reported the case to the One Stop Centre on July 10 after learning she had become pregnant due to the incident.

In the second case, on July 7, a 22-year-old male from the Azande community reportedly raped a 15-year-old girl in Yabongo, a residential area in Yambio Town. The perpetrator accosted the survivor while she was fetching water from a school, pulled her into his room with the help of friends, and raped her. This case was also opened at the Yambio Police Station.

The third case, also on July 7, involved a 22-year-old female from the Azande community who was physically assaulted by her 45-year-old father-in-law in the Hai Kabat suburb. The victim sustained injuries and reported the case to the Masia Police Station; however, the suspect was not arrested as he is believed to be a member of the South Sudan Prisons Service.

In the fourth case, on July 4, a 15-year-old female from the Azande community was raped by a 21-year-old civilian from the Balanda community in the Hai-Kuzee residential area. The perpetrator accosted her while she was returning from church practice, dragged her into an abandoned house, and raped her. The case was opened at the Masia Police Station, but the suspect remained at large at the time of this report.

The fifth case involved a 16-year-old female from the Azande community who was raped by a male civilian from the Sudanese community in Yabongo. On July 7, her parents discovered she was pregnant and brought her to the One Stop Centre. The perpetrator, who lived in the same neighborhood, forcibly entered her room when her parents were away and repeatedly raped her. A case was opened at the Yambio Police Station, and police were searching for the suspect.

In the sixth case, on July 5, a 23-year-old male from the Azande community raped a 16-year-old girl from the same community. The victim was returning from school when the suspect dragged her to his room and raped her. A case was filed at the Masia Police Station; however, the suspect was still at large.
The seventh case involved a 28-year-old man from the Azande community who reportedly raped a 16-year-old girl while she was visiting her uncle in Gitikiri Boma, Bazuangua Payam. The perpetrator, related to the victim, accosted her in the bush and raped her. The case was reported to the Yambio Police Station, but the perpetrator remained at large.

In the eighth case, on July 15, a 50-year-old male civilian from the Azande community raped a 13-year-old girl in Makpara village, Lirangu Payam. The perpetrator, the victim's grandmother's husband, assaulted her while his wife was at the farm. The case was reported to the police, and the suspect was arrested; however, the grandmother opted not to pursue legal action.

The ninth case occurred in Baawiri Boma, Gangura Payam, where an 18-year-old male from the Azande community raped a 16-year-old female on July 21. He accosted the victim while she was returning from a water point and raped her. He was arrested and detained by the police.

The tenth case involved a male civilian from the Azande community who raped a 14-year-old girl on July 16. The suspect followed the victim to her home in the ZVTC residential area, entered her room, and raped her. HRD could not obtain further details about this case.

The eleventh case occurred on July 13 in the Tiimbiro residential area, where a 15-year-old male civilian from the Azande community raped a 5-year-old male minor. The victim sustained injuries but received medical assistance at Yambio Hospital and was discharged.

Additionally, HRD documented seven incidents of domestic violence involving seven adult male perpetrators from the Azande and Jur communities, with the survivors being their wives. All survivors received medical and psychosocial support and ultimately chose not to initiate legal proceedings.

Comments: These incidents highlight a troubling pattern of violence against women and children within Yambio County, raising protection concerns. HRD shall follow up on the reported cases at the Yabio and Masia Police Stations to advocate for judicial accountability and justice for the victims.

Location of Incident: Wejal, Walgak, Akobo
Description:
GPAA authorities providing protection to a Lou Nuer abductee woman and her son who escaped their abductor in Lokormach Payam, Likuangole County in GPAA.

On 04 July, HRD met and interviewed a Lou Nuer abductee woman at the Pibor Interim Care Center (ICC) after escaping her abductor in Likuangole County, GPAA. The 25-year-old woman originally from Wejal village in Walgak payam, Akobo County in Jonglei state narrated that she was abducted when she was about five months pregnant. The victim was abducted on an unspecified date in March 2024 along Walgak -Wejal highway and taken to Lokormach Payam in Likuangole County, GPAA. 

 The victim was later married off to a 40-year-old man by her abductor in Lokormach where she was allegedly mistreated and physically assaulted by her ‘co-wife’ prompting her escape in the night of 23 June. The victim and her child trekked to Likuangole Central and arrived Pibor on 24 June. She spent a night in the Pibor Police Station in protective custody. On 25 June the GPAA authorities reported her to the ICC in Pibor town where humanitarian partners are providing psychosocial support and family tracing and re-unification. 

Comments: With the woman and her son now safely under the care of GPAA authorities, HRD will follow up and work with partners on family tracing and reunification.

Location of Incident: Pibor
Description:
A case of forced marriage of 15 years old Murel girl – her father got her beaten and slapped a commissioner of the HRC of GPAA

On 08 July, HRD received information from multiple sources, including the Director in the GPAA Ministry of Gender, Child and Social Welfare and a social worker at the Pibor Interim Care Center (ICC) that on 29 June, a 15-year-old Murle girl based in Pibor town sought protect at the ICC in Pibor town because she was being forced to marry a 40-year-old SSPDF officer. According to the sources, the girl child was physically assaulted, by the order of her father who is a Wildlife Officer, in an attempt to coerce her into marriage. 

While girl stays at the ICC, in the afternoon of the 30 June, her father, dressed in uniforms stormed the ICC and ordered an assault against the child victim and in the process slapped the Human Rights Commissioner of GPAA who tried to stop him from his criminal act. UN Police officers who were at patrol witnessed the incident.

Comments: The Director in the Ministry of Gender informed HRD that the matter has been escalated to the Deputy CA of GPAA. HRD will follow up on the matter.

Location of Incident: Adobi area, Gumbo Rejaf, Juba
Description:
Gang rape of a 13-year-old Girl linked to Inter-Gang retaliation in Gumbo, Rejaf Payam, Juba on 19 July 2025.
On 25 July 2025, HRD received credible information from four community members in Gumbo, Rejaf Payam, regarding the gang rape of a 13-year-old schoolgirl. The incident reportedly occurred on 19 July 2025 in the Adodi area near Kadro Stream. According to the sources, the minor was abducted from her home by a 17-year-old male, identified as a member of a local gang, who threatened to rape and dismember her unless she disclosed the whereabouts of her brother—a member of a rival gang with whom the suspect had an ongoing conflict. When the victim refused to comply, the perpetrator called an associate, and both gang members allegedly raped her in succession.
The survivor reported the assault to her parents, who immediately contacted the police. The prime suspect was apprehended and is currently in custody at the Eastern Police Division in Gumbo, while the second suspect remains at large. 
Comment: This incident represents a grave violation of the rights of the child. HRD is following up on the case to monitor the legal process and advocate for the rights of the survivor, including access to medical, psychosocial, and legal support services.

Location of Incident: Gumbo, Rejaf, Juba
Description:
Rape and killing of a 38-year-old woman perpetrated by Armed gang group in Gumbo, Rejaf Payam on 15 June 2025.
On 24 July 2025, HRD received information during a meeting with four community leaders from Sherikat and surrounding neighborhoods regarding the killing of a 38-year-old woman in Gumbo, Rejaf Payam. According to the community representatives, the incident occurred on 15 June 2025 when the victim was reportedly intercepted by a group of unidentified gang members while en route to a local butchery near Kadro Stream at dawn. The perpetrators allegedly raped the victim and, upon realizing that she recognized them, they beheaded her to prevent her from reporting the crime.
The incident sparked outrage within the community, and local authorities launched an investigation. Three suspects were reportedly apprehended and are currently in detention at the Eastern Police Division in Gumbo. 
Comment: This incident constitutes a grave violation of the right to life. HRD will continue to follow up on the case, including monitoring due process and the protection of witnesses and survivors.

Location of Incident: Rotriak/Lalob Settlement , Budan, Rubkona
Description:
HRD received information on the alleged ‘temporal’ abduction and gang rape of two Leek Nuer females (including a 15-year-old girl) by armed Nuer elements in a bush area adjacent to Block 17 of the Rotriak/Lalob Settlement located within Budang Payam, Rubkona County, Unity State, sometime in June 2025

On 18 July 2025, during the integrated SDP to Rotriak/Lalob Settlement located within Budang Payam, Rubkona County of Unity State, HRD held a brief engagement meeting with 11 Nuer females who reported the alleged temporal abduction and gang rape of two Leek Nuer females, one aged 25 years old and the other a 15-year-old female minor (both names on file), by a ‘large’ but undetermined number of armed and masked Nuer elements dressed in civilian clothing, sometime in June 2025 in a bush area located adjacent to Block 17 of the Rotriak/Lalob Settlement. 

The sources stated that the gang rape incident was preceded by a security incident during which approximately seven armed Nuer males who were dressed in civilian clothing and masked with cloths to cover their faces, invaded the residents of Block 17 at the Rotriak/Lalob Settlement, and robbed residents of food rations they had received that day from WFP. The armed elements then reportedly proceeded to abduct three females, one 25-year-old female, an 18-year-old female and her younger sister, a 15-year-old female, all Leek Nuer from Rubkona County (names of all three females on file), and took them to the nearby bush area where the females later allegedly reported to have met a ‘larger’ group of armed elements also dressed in civilian clothing with their faces covered with cloths. The 18-year-old female reportedly managed to escape leaving the other two females who later alleged that they had been gang raped by an undetermined number of armed elements, and were later released to return to Block 17. 

Following the victims’ return, the sources stated that the victims accessed medical assistance at a local health care facility (name on file) but did not report the violations to the local police. The sources stated that women usually did not report such SGBV/CRSV cases to the Police for fear of being exposed, and that the Police usually do not take action.

The women added that women and girls in Rotriak/Lalob were facing insecurity owing to the presence of armed elements who were either armed with machetes, knives or guns, and even unarmed elements who would rob them, and threaten to kill or harm them. The women however stated that the armed/unarmed elements were always dressed in civilian clothing, not uniform, and would have their faces covered.

When HRD enquired from the sources whether they were aware of any sexual exploitation, including through prostitution, which may have been occurring in the area and affecting female minors, the sources reported that they were unaware of any such occurrence, but that it would be difficult to detect matters akin to prostitution since these were transactional based on consensual agreements between the parties involved. They added that they were not aware of any oil workers who were visiting Rotriak/Lalob and engaging in transactional sex.

Comment: HRD shall seek to trace the victims of the gang rape incident for purposes of conducting interviews with them. HRD shall also follow up on the cases with the local health care facility in Rotriak in order to further corroborate/verify the present report. Overall, HRD plans to conduct further on-site monitoring activities in Rotriak/Lalob Settlement in order to gather more information on the security and human rights situation of women and girls at the location, including whether there women and girls may be facing sexual exploitation (particularly through the prostitution of female minors) that could threaten their health and well-being as alleged in earlier unverified information received by HRD.

Location of Incident: between Tor boma within Norlamwel payam, and Chamthar boma within Budang payam, Rubkona
Description:
HRD recorded information on the alleged gang rape of four Nuer adult females by eight armed males on 17 July 2025 in Rubkona County 

On 25 July 2025, HRD together with CPU and RoLSIS engaged with a 19-year-old Nuer female (name on file) and recorded information on the alleged gang rape of the female and three other Nuer females by eight armed males dressed in civilian clothing, in a bush location between Tor boma within Norlamwel payam, and Chamthar boma within Budang payam, both within Rubkona County, on 17 July 2025. The victim reported that she and four other females, including her 12-year-old cousin (name on file), were moving from their village within Tor boma towards Chamthar in order to cultivate their farms, when they encountered eight Nuer males armed with rifles but dressed in civilian clothing, who proceeded to gang rape the four adult females. The Bul Nuer victim described that she was gang raped by two of the armed males, and that the other three adult females (names not known by the victim) were also each subjected to gang rape by two armed males. Further, that the attack occurred at 8:00 a.m. and that the females were later released by the armed attackers at 1:00 p.m.. She clarified that her 12-year-old cousin was not raped but was assaulted and suffered an injury on her head.

The victim reported that she had identified one of the armed males who had allegedly subjected her to gang rape, after her family had been alerted that a male had been arrested by the SSPDF in Tor for being in possession of stolen goods, and therefore she, her brother and their 12-year-old female cousin went to the SSPDF in Tor where they identified the 21-year old Leek Nuer male. The victim stated that the other male who had raped her had not been arrested by the SSPDF. The alleged perpetrator was then transferred to the SSPDF Division 4 HQ on 19 July 2025 where he remained in military detention.

The victim reported that she and her cousin reported their cases at the Bentiu Police Station HQ, and that they also received treatment at a local health care facility in Bentiu town (name on file). She also clarified that she did know the other three females who had also been gang raped, as they had only encountered each other when they were walking towards the farm areas in Chamthar.

Note: HRD held an initial interview with the arrested male civilian on 23 July 2025 when the civilian had just been transferred to the SSPDF Division 4 HQ in  Rubkona town. The detained male denied having committed the gang rape, but stated that he had seen the girls who had identified him sometime before. The detained male alleged that he also lived in Tor and that he was a farmer. When HRD enquired with the SSPDF military on when they were intending to transfer the alleged perpetrator and his case to the SSNPS, the SSPDF personnel stated that they would await the SSPDF Division 4 Commander, Lt. General Mathew Puol Jang Top, who was then in Mayom overseeing the ongoing disarmament exercise, to first return to the Rubkona HQ, review the case file and then provide the way forward.

Comment: HRD assesses that this incident may have a linkage to the earlier reported incident of the gang rape of two females, including one minor, which reportedly occurred in a bush area adjacent to Block 17 of the Rotriak/Lalob Settlement (see HRD Bentiu FO DSR of 18 July 2025). This is because both incidences occurred in locations near to/within Budang Payam, where they may be armed attackers who may be operating as an armed group within the general Budang area, where the Rotriak/Lalob Settlement is currently located. Further, owing to the proximity of the location of the present gang rape incident and the Rotriak/Lalob Settlement where women earlier reported that an armed group of males were robbing women and subjecting them to gang rape, it may be the same group or an affiliated group which is committing abuses and crimes in the area. Owing to this, HRD has classified the incident as CRSV. HRD continues to collect information on the case and shall revert.

Further, HRD is following up with the relevant security actors in order to ascertain the SSPDF’s interest in the case, and engage with the SSPDF to transfer the case for onward action to the Police in Bentiu.

Location of Incident: Neemchidong, Toan, Kuerguini, Guit
Description:
Two men raped a Leek Nuer woman in Kuerguini Payam, Guit County, Unity State

On 14 July 2025, one primary source (witness) informed that on 25 April 2025, two unidentified men gang raped a Leek Nuer woman in Neemchidong village, Thoan Boma, Kuerguini Payam, Guit County, Unity State. The victim had gone in search of firewood when the incident occurred. The source informed that the men were in civilian clothes and not bearing arms at the time of the incident. The source did not know if the perpetrators were civilians, but HRD has recorded other incidents in the same location perpetrated reportedly by armed elements, some in uniform and others in civilian clothes. The source informed that the victim sought medical attention at a health facility in Bentiu but did not report the case to the police.

Location of Incident: Gumbo residential area, Rejaf Payam, Juba
Description:
1.	On 4 August, multiple secondary sources reported that on 31 July, SSNPS personnel arbitrarily arrested, detained and extorted four boys (9 – 14 year olds) in Gumbo residential area, Rejaf Payam, Juba County. According to the sources, the SSNPS personnel randomly arrested and detained the victims at the Sector 6 base located at the SSTV compound, in Rejaf Payam, and reportedly coerced their parents into paying unspecified sums of money to secure their release from police custody.

Comment: Such arbitrary arrests, detention and extortion have become a routine by SSNPS, primarily targeting youths, including children, with financial demands made for their release.

Location of Incident: Camp III in Juba
Description: 2.	On 4 August, two secondary sources reported that on 2 August, armed Leek Nuer elements in the) Camp III in Juba, attacked and killed two male civilians (aged 20 and 25 years old) from the Dok sub-clan at the IDP Camp III in Jebel Kujur, Juba City. The incident was reportedly a retaliation for the attack and injury of one Leek Nuer youth by youths from the Dok sub-clan during a traditional dance event near the checkpoint area in Jebel Kujur on 28 July. Reportedly, the assailants attacked and killed one of the victims in his shelter and the other along a walking path within the IDP Camp III. The SSNPS have reportedly arrested 15 youths from both communities in connection to the incident and transferred them to the Checkpoint Police custody for investigation.

Location of Incident: Torit Town, Torit
Description: 3.	On 4 August, three secondary sources reported that on 1 August, NSS personnel arbitrarily arrested, ill-treated and detained three male civilians from the Lutoko community in Torit Town, Torit County. According to the sources, a group of 10 NSS personnel stormed Isaloro Boma in Kudo Payam, Torit County to apprehend suspected armed youths who attacked and confiscated three automatic rifles (AK-47) from NSS personnel in the area on 29 July 2025, and  arrested the victims while they were working in their farms, beat them up, and thereafter detained them at the NSS detention center in Torit Town. On 2 August, the vicitms were reportedly transferred to the NSS detention facility in Juba, where they are being held incommunicado without formal charge.

Location of Incident: Yuai Town Market, Yuai Payam, Uror
Description:
4.	On 4 August, multiple sources reported that on 3 August, suspected armed Lou Nuer youths shot and killed one male civilian (a businessman) from the Dinka Bor community in Yuai Town Market, Yuai Payam, Uror County. The attack is reportedly a revenge action for past and unresolved grievances between the Dinka Bor and Lou Nuer communities in the area. Reportedly, the SSPDF were deployed to the area to maintain calm the situation. 

Comment: Allegedly, the failed blood compensation of a Lou Nuer businessman who was shot and killed by Dinka Bor from Twich East could be the motive for the retaliatory attacks reported in Yuai.

Location of Incident: Malual-Kon Payam, Aweil East County
Description: 5.	On 4 August, one secondary source reported that on 2 August, one SSPDF soldier shot and injured two female civilians (traders) at the Malual-Kon market in Malual-Kon Payam, Aweil East County, in unclear circumstances. Reportedly, the soldier surrendered himself at the Malual-Kon Police Station and was thereafter transferred to SSPDF Military custody at Loki Prion in Wunyiik Payam within Aweil East County. The injured victims were reportedly taken to a health care facility in Malual-Kon Payam for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Wun-Kur village, Turalei Payam, Twic
Description: 6.	On 4 August, four primary sources reported that on the same day, armed Bul Nuer elements from Mayom County, Unity State shot and injured one male civilian from the Dinka Twic Mayardit community during a cattle raid in Wun-Kur village, Turalei Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, the armed Bul Nuer elements attacked Wun-Kur village and opened on a homestead, injuring one of the residents. The attackers also seized 40 heads of cattle and fled back into Unity State. The injured victim was reportedly evacuated to a health care facility in Turalei Payam for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Mongu Arab, Bazia/Kpaile Payam, Wau
Description:
7.	On 4 August, two primary sources reported that on 29 July, SPLA-IO elements arbitrarily arrested, detained, and ill-treated two male civilians (29 and 33 years old teachers at a local Primary School) from the Luo community in Mongu Arab, Bazia/Kpaile Payam, Wau County. As recounted by the sources, the victims were arrested and detained when they visited the SPLA-IO detention center to visit two other Luo male civilians (security guards at the local primary school) who had earlier been arrested and detained by SPLA-IO elements on allegations of theft and sale of plastic roofing sheets of the school. Reportedly, while inquiring about these suspects, the SPLA-IO elements accused the victims of interfering with SPLA-IO operations and detained them. On 2 August, the two teachers were released after the payment of 60,000 South Sudan Pounds (SSP) each and a pledge to pay an extra 40,000 SSP.

Comment: It was reported that one of the security guards was also released on 2 August, while the SPLA-IO demanded payment of 90,000 SSP for the release of the remaining detainee. The local chief of the area was also allegedly threatened by the SPLA-IO elements for having reported the incident to the state authorities.

Location of Incident: Idulang village, Chorokol Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos
Description:
1.	On 5 August, three secondary sources reported that on 3 August, armed Logir youths from Ramula Boma, Chahari Payam shot and killed one 25-year-old male civilian from the Dongotono community during an attempted cattle raid in Idulang village, Chorokol Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos County. According to the sources, a group of four armed Logir youths stormed Idulang village to raid cattle, and opened fire on the victim when he raised an alarm, killing him. The armed Dongotono youths reportedly repulsed the attackers who fled without raiding any cattle. 

Comment: The incident has reportedly heightened tensions in Chorokol and Ramula Bomas, prompting the authorities of Ikotos County to deployment of security forces in the area to deescalate the situation.

Location of Incident: Lolo Boma, Central Payam, Jebel Boma
Description:
2.	On 5 August, multiple sources reported that on 1 August, armed Toposa youths from Kapoeta North County, Eastern Equatoria State shot and killed one 34-year-old male civilian and injured another 29-year-old male civilian, both from the Murle community, during a cattle raid in Lolo Boma, Central Payam, Jebel Boma County, GPAA. According to the sources, the armed Toposa youths attacked a cattle camp on the outskirts of Itti, in Lolo Boma, killing one civilian and injuring another. The armed Toposa youths also raided 100 heads of cattle; however, 95 were recovered by the Murle armed elements during a pursuit of the attackers. 

Comment: There are concerns that this incident may revive hostility between the Murle community of Jebel Boma County and the communities in Eastern Equatoria State.

Location of Incident: Lolo Boma, Central Payam, Jebel Boma
Description:
2.	On 5 August, multiple sources reported that on 1 August, armed Toposa youths from Kapoeta North County, Eastern Equatoria State shot and killed one 34-year-old male civilian and injured another 29-year-old male civilian, both from the Murle community, during a cattle raid in Lolo Boma, Central Payam, Jebel Boma County, GPAA. Comment: There are concerns that this incident may revive hostility between the Murle community of Jebel Boma County and the communities in Eastern Equatoria State.

Comment: There are concerns that this incident may revive hostility between the Murle community of Jebel Boma County and the communities in Eastern Equatoria State.

Location of Incident: Mogiri Boma, Mangalla Payam, Juba
Description: 1.	On 6 August, multiple sources reported that on 5 August, suspected armed Dinka Bor youths from the Mangalla Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) camp shot and killed six male civilians (cattle keepers) from the Murle community, injured eight and abducted six other civilians in Mogiri Boma, Mangalla Payam, Juba County. According to the sources, armed elements suspected to be from the Dinka Bor community attacked workers at a charcoal field and abducted six victims and proceeded to attacked and opened fire on Murle cattle keepers, killing six and injuring eight others. Reportedly, one National Security Service (NSS) officer and a soldier of the South Sudan People’s Defense Forces (SSPDF) were also killed during a confrontation with the attackers. The armed Dinka Bor youths also seized an unspecified number of cattle.

Location of Incident: Mogiri Boma, Mangalla Payam, Juba
Description: 1.	On 6 August, multiple sources reported that on 5 August, suspected armed Dinka Bor youths from the Mangalla Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) camp shot and killed six male civilians (cattle keepers) from the Murle community, injured eight and abducted six other civilians in Mogiri Boma, Mangalla Payam, Juba County. According to the sources, armed elements suspected to be from the Dinka Bor community attacked workers at a charcoal field and abducted six victims and proceeded to attacked and opened fire on Murle cattle keepers, killing six and injuring eight others. Reportedly, one National Security Service (NSS) officer and a soldier of the South Sudan People’s Defense Forces (SSPDF) were also killed during a confrontation with the attackers. The armed Dinka Bor youths also seized an unspecified number of cattle.

The armed Dinka Bor youths also seized an unspecified number of cattle.

Location of Incident: Bur-Mutaram Boma, Bur Payam, Torit
Description: 2.	On 6 August, three secondary sources reported that on 3 August, eight Lutoko civilians (three men, three women, and two boys – two and five years old) were injured by a grenade explosion in Bur-Mutaram Boma, Bur Payam, Torit County. As recounted by the sources, According to the sources, one armed Lotuko man (a deserter from the SSPDF), while being questioned during a meeting by community members of Bur-Mutaram Boma for his involvement in the theft of medical and nutritional supplies from a local nutrition site on 2 August, detonated a grenade and threw it into the crowd, injuring eight civilians. The suspect reportedly escaped into the nearby bush. The injured victims are currently receiving medical treatment at a hospital in Torit Town.

Location of Incident: Madol Payam, Rumbek North County
Description: 3.	On 5 and 6 August, three secondary sources reported that on 5 August, suspected armed Nyuong Nuer youths from Panyijar County, Unity State shot and killed five male civilians (four from the Dinka Agaar community and one from the Dinka Gok community) in Madol Payam, Rumbek North County. According to the sources, the assailants ambushed and opened fire on the victims who were travelling on motorcycles transporting goods to Rumbek North County along the road between Maper Town and Madol Payam, killing them. The assailants also looted their goods. Reportedly, the police were deployed to the scene and retrieved the bodies of the victims and their motorcycles, and launched an investigation to apprehend the suspects.

Location of Incident: Madol Payam, Rumbek North County
Description: 3.	On 5 and 6 August, three secondary sources reported that on 5 August, suspected armed Nyuong Nuer youths from Panyijar County, Unity State shot and killed five male civilians (four from the Dinka Agaar community and one from the Dinka Gok community) in Madol Payam, Rumbek North County. According to the sources, the assailants ambushed and opened fire on the victims who were travelling on motorcycles transporting goods to Rumbek North County along the road between Maper Town and Madol Payam, killing them. The assailants also looted their goods. Reportedly, the police were deployed to the scene and retrieved the bodies of the victims and their motorcycles, and launched an investigation to apprehend the suspects.

Location of Incident: Madol Payam, Rumbek North County
Description: 3.	On 5 and 6 August, three secondary sources reported that on 5 August, suspected armed Nyuong Nuer youths from Panyijar County, Unity State shot and killed five male civilians (four from the Dinka Agaar community and one from the Dinka Gok community) in Madol Payam, Rumbek North County.
