The assailants also looted their goods. Reportedly, the police were deployed to the scene and retrieved the bodies of the victims and their motorcycles, and launched an investigation to apprehend the suspects.

Location of Incident: Mangol-Apuk village, Toch North Payam, Gogrial East
Description: 4.	On 6 August, three primary sources reported that on 5 August, armed Bul Nuer elements from Mayom County, Unity State shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Apuk community in Mangol-Apuk village, Toch North Payam, Gogrial East County. According to the sources, the armed Bul Nuer elements attacked Mangol-Apuk village and opened fire on the victim while he was tending to his cattle, killing him, the attackers also seized  15 heads of cattle and fled back into Unity State.

Location of Incident: Mangol-Apuk village, Toch North Payam, Gogrial East
Description: 4.	On 6 August, three primary sources reported that on 5 August, armed Bul Nuer elements from Mayom County, Unity State shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Apuk community in Mangol-Apuk village, Toch North Payam, Gogrial East County. According to the sources, the armed Bul Nuer elements attacked Mangol-Apuk village and opened fire on the victim while he was tending to his cattle, killing him, the attackers also seized  15 heads of cattle and fled back into Unity State.

Location of Incident: Rum-Cuer village, Aweng Payam, Twic
Description: 5.	On 6 August, three primary sources reported that on 5 August, armed Nuer elements from Unity State abducted three male civilians from the Dinka Twic Mayardit community in Rum-Cuer village, Aweng Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, the armed Nuer elements attacked a homestead in Rum-Cuer village, abducted the victims who were tending to cattle, and thereafter seized five heads of cattle. Reportedly, the armed Dinka Twic Mayardit youths pursued the attackers and in the ensuing confrontation, the three abductees were recovered, while the armed Nuer youths made away with the raided cattle into Unity State.

Location of Incident: Rum-Cuer village, Aweng Payam, Twic
Description: 5.	On 6 August, three primary sources reported that on 5 August, armed Nuer elements from Unity State abducted three male civilians from the Dinka Twic Mayardit community in Rum-Cuer village, Aweng Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, the armed Nuer elements attacked a homestead in Rum-Cuer village, abducted the victims who were tending to cattle, and thereafter seized five heads of cattle. Reportedly, the armed Dinka Twic Mayardit youths pursued the attackers and in the ensuing confrontation, the three abductees were recovered, while the armed Nuer youths made away with the raided cattle into Unity State.

Location of Incident: East Bank residential area, Wau Town, Wau
Description:
6.	On 6 August, one primary source and one secondary source reported that on 29 July, one SSPDF soldier arbitrarily arrested, detained and illtreated a 28-year-old female civilian from the Dinka community and abducted her three-year-old daughter in East Bank residential area, Wau Town, Wau County. According to the sources, the soldier (ex-husband to the 28-year-old woman) seized the victim from her residence and detained her at the SSPDF barracks where he subjected her to varying forms of ill-treatment and abducted the victim’s three-year-old daughter to an unknown location. Reportedly, on 2 August, the soldier released the woman from detention for health reasons. On 3 August, a case was filed at the East Bank Police Station and  the police sent a letter to the SSPDF Division 5 requesting the suspect to be handed over for investigation and legal proceedings.

Comment: HRD will follow up on the case for accountability of the perpetrator.

Location of Incident: East Bank residential area, Wau Town, Wau
Description:
6.	On 6 August, one primary source and one secondary source reported that on 29 July, one SSPDF soldier arbitrarily arrested, detained and illtreated a 28-year-old female civilian from the Dinka community and abducted her three-year-old daughter in East Bank residential area, Wau Town, Wau County. According to the sources, the soldier (ex-husband to the 28-year-old woman) seized the victim from her residence and detained her at the SSPDF barracks where he subjected her to varying forms of ill-treatment and abducted the victim’s three-year-old daughter to an unknown location. Reportedly, on 2 August, the soldier released the woman from detention for health reasons. On 3 August, a case was filed at the East Bank Police Station and  the police sent a letter to the SSPDF Division 5 requesting the suspect to be handed over for investigation and legal proceedings.

Comment: HRD will follow up on the case for accountability of the perpetrator.

Location of Incident: Hayat IDP camp in Tambura Town, Tambura
Description: 7.	On 6 August, one secondary source reported that on 15 July, two unidentified armed elements attacked and raped two female civilians (15 and 18 years old) from the Balanda community in the Hayat IDP camp in Tambura Town, Tambura County. According to the sources, the unidentified armed elements accosted a group of five women who had gone to fetch water and while the other three escaped, the two victims were forced into the nearby bushes and raped. Reportedly, the three who escaped mobilized the relatives of the victims who came to the scene and retrieved the 15-year-old girl who suffered severe injuries and was evacuated to Juba for advanced medical care, while the 18-year-old victim was taken to the Hayat IDP camp for local first-aid, due to the lack of adequate medical facilities and supplies.

Location of Incident: Kabo Boma, Luri Payam, Juba
Description: 1.	On 7 August, multiple sources reported that on 6 August, unidentified armed elements raped seven female civilians including a pregnant woman in the Jerra farming area in Kabo Boma, Luri Payam, Juba County. According to the sources, the unidentified armed elements accosted the victims while they were working on their farm and took them to the nearby bushes where they raped and beat them up for trying to resist the rape. The perpetrators also seized their  mobile phones. The survivors were reportedly taken to a specialized medical facility for immediate medical examination and treatment.

Location of Incident: Kabo Boma, Luri Payam, Juba
Description: 1.	On 7 August, multiple sources reported that on 6 August, unidentified armed elements raped seven female civilians including a pregnant woman in the Jerra farming area in Kabo Boma, Luri Payam, Juba County. According to the sources, the unidentified armed elements accosted the victims while they were working on their farm and took them to the nearby bushes where they raped and beat them up for trying to resist the rape. The perpetrators also seized their  mobile phones. The survivors were reportedly taken to a specialized medical facility for immediate medical examination and treatment.

Location of Incident: Bur-Mutaram Boma, Bur Payam, Torit County
Description: 2.	On 7 August, three secondary sources reported that on 2 August, armed Lotuko youths from Bur-Mutaram Boma shot and injured one 32-year-old male civilian from the Lutoko community from Osito Boma in Bur-Mutaram Boma, Bur Payam, Torit County. According to the sources, two armed Lotuko youths encountered the victim along the Torit-Bur-Road in Bur-Mutaram Boma and opened fire, injuring him. The attack was reportedly a revenge action for the shooting and injuring of two civilians from Bur-Mutaram Boma by armed youths from Osito Boma on 25 October 2024 [see HRD Daily Report 31 October 2024] and over unresolved disputes between the Osito and Bur-Mutaram communities over land and fishing sites. The incident was reported at the Torit Police Station and investigations are reportedly ongoing. The injured victim was evacuated to a hospital in Torit Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Chuil Boma, Chuil Payam, Nyirol
Description: 3.	On 7 August, multiple sources reported that on 5 August, two male civilian victims of abduction and unlawful recruitment (including a minor) by the SSPDF were recovered by authorities in Chuil Boma, Chuil Payam, Nyirol County. According to the sources, the victims were allegedly abducted by the SSPDF from Juba in March 2025 (exact date unspecified) and taken to the Gel Achel SSPDF training site in Baliet Payam, in Upper Nile State. The victims reportedly escaped from the training site (date unspecified) and arrived in Chuil Payam and placed under the protective custody of the Sudan People’s Liberation Army-In Opposition (SPLA-IO) in Nyirol County along with the other 14 victim who had escaped earlier [ see HRD Daily Report 4 August 2025].

Location of Incident: Machara village, Akop Payam, Tonj North
Description: 5.	On 7 August, three primary sources reported that on 5 August, armed Nuer elements from Mayom County, Unity State shot and injured one male civilian from the Dinka Apuk community in Machara village, Akop Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the armed Nuer elements attacked and opened fire on the victim while he was fishing in Toch area along the border with Unity State injuring him. Reportedly, the attackers also seized the victim’s catch of fish, fishing gear and bicycle and fled into Unity State. The victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Akop Payam for medical treatment and subsequently transferred to Wau, Western Bahr el Ghazal State for advanced medical care.

Location of Incident: Machara village, Akop Payam, Tonj North
Description: 5.	On 7 August, three primary sources reported that on 5 August, armed Nuer elements from Mayom County, Unity State shot and injured one male civilian from the Dinka Apuk community in Machara village, Akop Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the armed Nuer elements attacked and opened fire on the victim while he was fishing in Toch area along the border with Unity State injuring him. Reportedly, the attackers also seized the victim’s catch of fish, fishing gear and bicycle and fled into Unity State. The victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Akop Payam for medical treatment and subsequently transferred to Wau, Western Bahr el Ghazal State for advanced medical care.

Location of Incident: Gamanakpe residential area, Tambura town, Tambura
Description:
6.	On 7 August, two secondary sources reported that on 12 July, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one 35-year-old male civilian from the Azande community in the Gamanakpe residential area, Tambura town, Tambura County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked and opened fire on the victim while he was tending to his crops in his farm. The motive for the attack remains unknown. Reportedly, the security forces responded to the scene at the sound of the gunshots and retrieved the victim’s body. 

Comment: This incident highlights broader issues in Tambura County, such as ethnic tensions, a lack of accountability, inadequate security measures, and an overall worsening protective environment for the civilians in the area.

Location of Incident: Yembe and Abegi area in Lasu Payam, Yei River
Description:
1.	On 8 August, three secondary sources reported that on 7 August, suspected NAS elements abducted seven civilians including one woman (workers with an international humanitarian organization) in Yembe and Abegi area in Lasu Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, the suspected NAS elements intercepted the victims along the Lasu-Yei-Road while they were traveling in a convoy of three vehicles with medical supplies to the Lasu Payam Primary Health Care Center and abducted to an unknown location. Reportedly, four of the victims were released on the same day, while three others including the female victim remain in captivity.

Comment: The motive for the abduction remains unknown; however, the incident is indicative of growing pattern of targeted abductions of humanitarian workers, particularly those affiliated with the provision of health services by armed groups in Greater Yei area. The recurrence of such incidents further demonstrates a deteriorating protective environment for humanitarian operations in the area, as well as undermines respect for international human rights and humanitarian law, especially the Geneva Conventions.

Location of Incident: Tomping, Juba City
Description: 2.	On 8 August, three secondary sources reported that on 6 July, SSPDF soldiers arbitrarily arrested and detained one 24-year-old male civilian in the Kololo residential area in Tomping, Juba City. According to the source, the SSPDF soldiers stormed a car wash in the area and arrested several civilians (exact number unspecified) working there including the victim and detained them at the SSPDF Giada Military Barracks. Reportedly, the victim and other detainees have been flown to Nasir County in Upper Nile State allegedly to fight at the front lines.

Location of Incident: Gudele West, Juba
Description:
3.	On 7 and 8 August, one primary source reported that on 7 July, SSNPS personnel arbitrarily arrested five male civilians (15 – 17 years old) in the Gurei residential area, Gudele West Payam, Juba County. According to the source, the SSNPS personnel stormed a local car wash in the area and arrested the victims for unspecified reasons. Reportedly, the SSNPS personnel drove off with the victims towards Juba Town, and their whereabouts remain unknown.

Comment: These incidents raise serious concerns about arbitrary arrests, detention, and enforced disappearance by national security forces, in violation of international human rights law. HRD will investigate the reports.

Location of Incident: Nakwajore Village, Chorokol Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos County
Description: 4.	On 8 August, three secondary sources reported that on 6 August, armed Buya youths from Kimotong Payam, Budi County shot and killed three civilians from the Logir community in Nakwajore Village, Chorokol Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos County. According to the sources, the armed Buya youths stormed Nakwajore village and opened fire on the victim, killing them, reportedly in revenge for the  killing of four Buya male civilians and the abduction of another by armed Logir youths on 31 July [see HRD Daily Report 1 August 2025]. The incident was reported at Chahari Police Station and investigations are reportedly ongoing; however, no arrests have been made so far.

Location of Incident: Norlamwel Payam, Rubkona
Description:
5.	On 8 August, one secondary source reported that on 6 August, suspected armed Bul Nuer elements from Mayom County shot and killed one male civilian from the Leek Nuer community during a cattle raid in Norlamwel Payam, Rubkona County. According to the source, the suspected armed Bul Nuer elements attacked Norlamwel Payam, killing one civilian. The attackers also raided an unspecified number of cattle, which were subsequently recovered by the cattle owners and security forces.

Comment: Reportedly, on the same day, unidentified armed elements, suspected to be coming from Mayom County, raided 17 cattle in Rotriak Payam, Rubkona County; however, the cattle owners reportedly recovered the cattle. The authorities in Rotriak Payam have reported an increase in cattle raids in the area by suspected armed elements from Mayom County, posing protection risks to the civilian population in the area.

Location of Incident: Norlamwel Payam, Rubkona
Description:
5.	On 8 August, one secondary source reported that on 6 August, suspected armed Bul Nuer elements from Mayom County shot and killed one male civilian from the Leek Nuer community during a cattle raid in Norlamwel Payam, Rubkona County. According to the source, the suspected armed Bul Nuer elements attacked Norlamwel Payam, killing one civilian. The attackers also raided an unspecified number of cattle, which were subsequently recovered by the cattle owners and security forces.

Comment: Reportedly, on the same day, unidentified armed elements, suspected to be coming from Mayom County, raided 17 cattle in Rotriak Payam, Rubkona County; however, the cattle owners reportedly recovered the cattle. The authorities in Rotriak Payam have reported an increase in cattle raids in the area by suspected armed elements from Mayom County, posing protection risks to the civilian population in the area.

Location of Incident: Wau Town, Wau County
Description:
6.	On 8 August, one primary source and one secondary source reported that on 28 July, one SSNPS officer raped a 37-year-old woman from the Luo community in Wau Town, Wau County. According to the sources, the SSNPS officer attacked the victim in her shelter within the premises of a state ministry where she was temporarily sheltered with her children, raped her and fled the scene. The incident was reported to the police on the same day, and on 30 July, the SSNPS officer was apprehended and remanded at Wau Central Prison. The  case has been referred to the Wau High Court for trial. 

Comments: HRD will follow up on the trial proceedings for accountability of the perpetrator.

Location of Incident: Kegulu area, Yei Town Payam, Yei River
Description: 2.	On 11 August, two secondary sources reported that on 31 July, suspected SSPDF soldiers gang-raped one 48-year-old woman from the Kakwa community in Kegulu area, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, two SSPDF soldiers accosted the survivor in her farm and demanded for some money; however, when she could not give the money, they ill-treated her and thereafter took her to the nearby bushes and raped her. The survivor reportedly received medical care at a health care facility in Yei Town. However, the survivor did  not port the incident to the police for fear of reprisals by the perpetrators.

Location of Incident: Chahari Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos
Description:
3.	On 11 August, three secondary sources reported that on 8 August, armed Buya youths from Kimotong Payam, Budi County shot and killed one 56-year-old male civilian from the Logir community in Chahari Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos County. According to the sources, the armed Buya youths attacked and opened fire on the victim (a mentally challenged man) while he was walking along the Chahari-Chorokol-Road in Chahari Boma, reportedly in retaliation to the killing of four Buya civilians and the abduction of one female civilian by armed Logir youths on 31 July [see HRD Daily Report 1 August 2025]. The incident was reported at Chahari Police Station and investigations are reportedly ongoing. 
Comment: Reportedly, the local leaders in Chahari Payam have engaged the authorities of Budi County and expressed willingness to initiate dialogue aimed at ending the cycle of retaliatory killings between the Buya and Logir communities. HRD will follow up on the development.

Location of Incident: Waat Payam, Nyirol
Description: 4.	On 11 August, multiple sources reported that on 10 and 11 August, Murle armed elements abducted four civilians (10-year-old boy, 13-year-old girl, and two 30 and 32-year-old women) from the Lou Nuer community in Waat Payam, Nyirol County. According to the sources, on 10 August, the Murle armed elements abducted the minors while they were traveling from Walgak Payam, Akobo County for a meeting in Waat Payam. The minors were reportedly recovered by the local youths in Waat Payam as they pursued the abductors. The sources further informed that on 11, the same group of Murle armed elements abducted the two women who were traveling from Wunbil Boma to Panyim Boma in Waat Payam for a workshop. The two women were subsequently recovered during a pursuit of the abductors by the local youths in Waat Payam.

Location of Incident: Majer village, Aweng Payam, Twic
Description: 5.	On 11 August, multiple sources reported that on the same day, armed Bul Nuer elements from Mayom County, Unity State shot and killed one male civilian and injured another from the Dink Twic Mayardit community in Majer village, Aweng Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, the armed Bul Nuer elements attacked and opened fire on a group of  Dinka Twic-Mayardit civilians/herders who were grazing and watering their cattle in Maker village along the swampy area, killing one and injuring another. The attackers also seized 30 heads of cattle and fled back into Unity State. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Turalei Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Majer village, Aweng Payam, Twic
Description: 5.	On 11 August, multiple sources reported that on the same day, armed Bul Nuer elements from Mayom County, Unity State shot and killed one male civilian and injured another from the Dink Twic Mayardit community in Majer village, Aweng Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, the armed Bul Nuer elements attacked and opened fire on a group of  Dinka Twic-Mayardit civilians/herders who were grazing and watering their cattle in Maker village along the swampy area, killing one and injuring another. The attackers also seized 30 heads of cattle and fled back into Unity State. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Turalei Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Majer village, Aweng Payam, Twic
Description: 5.	On 11 August, multiple sources reported that on the same day, armed Bul Nuer elements from Mayom County, Unity State shot and killed one male civilian and injured another from the Dink Twic Mayardit community in Majer village, Aweng Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, the armed Bul Nuer elements attacked and opened fire on a group of  Dinka Twic-Mayardit civilians/herders who were grazing and watering their cattle in Maker village along the swampy area, killing one and injuring another. The attackers also seized 30 heads of cattle and fled back into Unity State. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Turalei Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Kergulu area, Yei Town Payam, Yei River
Description: 1.	On 12 August, two secondary sources reported that on 6 August, one suspected SSPDF soldier raped a 25-year-old woman from the Kakwa community in Kergulu area, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, a group of three suspected SSPDF soldiers approached the victim while she was tending to her maize garden and  requested some maize. Reportedly, after giving them some maize, one of the soldiers suggested that they should rape her, which the others decline; however, he proceeded to rape her while the other two soldiers stood guard. The survivor reported the incident to a health care facility in Yei Town where she received medical care. She however declined to report the matter to the police, indicating that she did not expect any redress from the police.

Location of Incident: Pariang Boma, Riwoto Payam, Kapoeta North
Description: 2.	On 12 August, three secondary sources reported that on 4 August, armed Toposa youths from Riwoto Payam shot and injured one 30-year-old male civilian from the Toposa community of Machi Boma, Katiko Payam, Kapoeta South County in Pariang Boma, Riwoto Payam, Kapoeta North County. According to the sources, the armed Toposa youths attacked and opened fire on two male civilians traveling from Kapoeta North County to Kapoeta South County with cattle for sale, injuring one. The attack was reportedly an attempt to raid the cattle; however, the armed Topo youth fled without seizing the cattle. The victim was evacuated to Kenya for advanced treatment. The incident was reported at Kapoeta South Police Station, and investigations are reportedly ongoing; however, no arrests have been made to date.

Location of Incident: Makuick, Amol-but, and Panarak villages in Abiriu Payam, Cueibet
Description: 3.	On 12 August, two secondary sources reported that on 11 August, armed Dinka Agaar youths from Matangai Payam, Rumbek Center County shot and killed three civilians and injured six others in Makuick, Amol-but, and Panarak villages in Abiriu Payam, Cueibet County. According to the sources, on 10 August, armed Dinka Gok youths from Abiriu, Duony and Mayath Payams in Cueibet County raided an unspecified number of cattle from the Dinka Agaar community in Mabor-ajiit cattle camp, Matangai Payam. Reportedly, the armed Dinka Agaar youths pursued the raiders to no avail and while returning, they attacked Makuick, Amol-but, and Panarak villages in Abiriu Payam, killing and injuring the victims. The armed Dinka Gok youths retaliated, killing five of the armed Dinka Agaar youths.

Location of Incident: Makuick, Amol-but, and Panarak villages in Abiriu Payam, Cueibet
Description: 3.	On 12 August, two secondary sources reported that on 11 August, armed Dinka Agaar youths from Matangai Payam, Rumbek Center County shot and killed three civilians and injured six others in Makuick, Amol-but, and Panarak villages in Abiriu Payam, Cueibet County. Location of Incident: Gorbele village, Sokare Boma, Liwolo Payam, Kajo-Keji
Description:
1.	On 13 August, four secondary sources reported that on 9 August, the UPDF shot and killed one 18-year-old male civilian in Gorbele village, Sokare Boma, Liwolo Payam, Kajo-Keji County. According to the sources, UPDF soldiers opened fire on a group of Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) including some women -details unspecified) from Nyainga-Muda village, Bori Boma, Kangapo II Payam along the border with Uganda while they were collecting food from their farms, killing one. The victim was reportedly among a group of youths who had accompanied the women to collect produce from their farms.

Comment: According to the sources, the UPDF is allegedly issuing threats to South Sudanese civilians and soldiers to vacate Nyainga-Muda and Merewa villages in Bori Boma (Kangapo II Payam), and Gorbele and Nyabare villages in Sokare Boma, Liwolo Payam and not return to these areas. On 12 August, the UPDF allegedly looted six shops in Nyainga-Muda trading Centre.

Location of Incident: Murahatika Boma, Hiyala Payam, Torit
Description:
2.	On 13 August, three primary sources reported that on 22 June, the SSPDF arbitrarily arrested and detained three male civilians (age 41, 42, and 58 years old) in Murahatika Boma, Hiyala Payam, Torit County. According to the sources, the SSPDF soldiers entered Murahatika Boma to recover cattle that were stolen on 2 February 2025. Reportedly, the SSPDF soldiers accused the victims of receiving part of the stolen cattle and proceeded to confiscate 313 heads of cattle from three kraals and transferred the cattle as well as the victims to Tirangore Boma, Hiyala Payam, where they were held for four nights. The victims were reportedly subjected to ill-treatment while in detention. The detainees were subsequently transferred to Torit and held at the municipal council for four nights before transferring them to Torit Police Station, where they were detained for seven days. On 8 July, the victims were reportedly transferred on warrant to Torit Prison until 25 September 2025; however, no formal charges have been made against them and they have not been presented before a court. 

Comment: Notably, the absence of a complainant, lack of evidentiary linkage between the accused and the alleged offence, prolonged detention without court appearance, and contradictory information from law enforcement raise serious due process and accountability concerns. HRD will follow up on the case for due process and accountability.

Location of Incident: Iyeri Boma, Iyeri Payam, Torit
Description:
3.	On 13 August, three secondary sources reported that on 6 August, SPLA-IO elements unlawfully detained and ill-treated two male civilians (local chiefs) in Iyeri Boma, Iyeri Payam, Torit County. According to the sources, a group of SPLA-IO elements from Irubi cantonment site in Ifwoto Payam entered Iyeri Boma and arrested the two sub-chiefs, one from Hafiye village and the other from Harumorock village, on allegations of having failed to mobilise new recruits for the SPLA-IO. The chiefs were allegedly tied together with ropes and beaten with sticks. The SPLA-IO elements also reportedly destroyed their maize farms by cutting down all the crops, as well as looted civilian property including livestock. 

Comment: Reportedly, the action of the SPLA-IO elements aimed to pressure the chiefs into mobilising civilians for recruitment, securing food supplies for new recruits, and facilitating the establishment of a new SPLA-IO barracks in Iyeri Boma. The incident has reportedly instilled fear among residents, prompting many youths to flee Iyeri Boma to Magwi and Torit Town.

Location of Incident: Iyeri Boma, Iyeri Payam, Torit
Description:

Location of Incident: Payangluel Boma, Pulturuk Payam, Nyirol County
Description: 4.	On 13 August, multiple sources reported that on 11 August, Murle armed elements from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) abducted four boys (aged between 10 – 16  years old) from Payangluel Boma, Pulturuk Payam, Nyirol County. The local youths reportedly pursued the abductors and recovered three of the victims while one 11-year-old boy was taken by the abductors to an unknown location.

Location of Incident: Gumuruk
Description: 5.	On 12 and 13 August, multiple secondary sources reported that on 29 July, one 19-year-old girl from Goali village, Gumuruk County, GPAA, who had been abducted by armed Nuer youths in March 2024 (exact date unspecified) and taken to Partet village, Weikol Payam, Uror County, was recovered by the authorities in Yuai Payam, Uror County. According to the sources, the victim escaped from her abductors (exact date unspecified) and on 29 July, she was received by authorities in Yuai Payam and placed under protective custody. On 8 August, the victim was reportedly transported to Juba and thereafter transferred to Pibor on 12 August for family tracing and reunification, facilitated by protection partners.

Location of Incident: Maper Town, Rumbek North
Description: 6.	On 13 August, two secondary sources reported that between 26 and 28 July, suspected armed Nuer elements from Panyijar County, Unity State shot and killed one male civilian in Maper Town, Rumbek North County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked the victim and his spouse while they were walking along the Yiga village-Maper Town road, killing him, while his spouse was left unharmed. The motive for the attack remains unknown.

Location of Incident: Katikiri Boma, Wonduruba Payam, Juba
Description: 1.	On 14 August, three secondary sources reported that on 6 August, SPLA-IO elements abducted 23 civilians from the Tigolo gold mine in Katikiri Boma, Wonduruba Payam, Juba County. According to the sources, the SPLM/A-IO elements abducted the victims while they were working in the gold mine and transferred them to an unknown location. Reportedly, 15 of the victims were subsequently released (exact date unspecified) and have returned to the gold mine.

Location of Incident: Bombil village, Ajak-Kuac Payam, Twic
Description: 2.	On 14 August, multiple sources reported that on the same day, armed Nuer elements from Unity State shot and killed two male civilians and injured two others including a minor from the Dinka Twic Mayardit community in Bombil village, Ajak-Kuac Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, the armed Nuer elements opened fire on a group of Dinka Twic Mayardit cattle keepers who were grazing their cattle in Bombil village close to the border with Unity State, killing two and injuring two others. The attackers also raided 35 heads of cattle and fled back into Unity State. Reportedly, the injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Turalei Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Bombil village, Ajak-Kuac Payam, Twic
Description: 2.	On 14 August, multiple sources reported that on the same day, armed Nuer elements from Unity State shot and killed two male civilians and injured two others including a minor from the Dinka Twic Mayardit community in Bombil village, Ajak-Kuac Payam, Twic County. Location of Incident: Lutaya village, Kondeko Boma, Yei town Payam, Yei River
Description: 1.	On 15 August, multiple sources reported that on 9 August, soldiers of the SSPDF Counter Military Intelligence, arbitrarily arrested and detained one 37-year-old male civilian from the Baka tribe in Lutaya village, Kondeko Boma, Yei town Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, the arrest was based on information alleging that the victim was in possession of an illegal firearm. Reportedly, the soldiers stormed a local bar in the area, arrested the victim and two police officers and detained them at the joint military operations facility in Yei town and the victim was released on 11 August without charge.

Location of Incident: Ngauro Boma, Ngauro Payam, Budi
Description: 2.	On 15 August, three secondary sources reported that on 12 August armed Toposa youths from Namorunyang Payam, Kapoeta South County, shot and killed one 32-year-old male Didinga civilian in Ngauro Boma, Ngauro Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, the assailants invaded Ngauro Boma, with intent to raid cattle, when they met the victim collecting building material from a nearby bush, shot and killed him. Reportedly, the assailants fled the scene towards Lopala village in Namorunyang Payam and the incident was reported to the Ngauro police station and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Ameth village and Toch area in Nyang Payam, Gogrial East
Description:
3.	On 17 August, three secondary sources reported that on 16 August, five male civilians (two Dinka Apuk and three Nuer- ages unspecified) were shot and killed in Ameth village and Toch area in Nyang Payam, Gogrial East County. According to the sources, armed Nuer youths from Unity State, invaded Ameth village to raid cattle, shot and killed two male civilians and raided 25 heads of cattle. Reportedly, while they left the scene, the armed Dinka Apuk youths mobilized and pursued the assailants and, on their way, they shot and killed three male Nuer civilians who were grazing in Toch area. In the ensuing confrontation with the armed Nuer youths inside Unity State, they shot and killed four of the armed Nuer youths and recovered 20 heads of cattle.

Comment: tension remains very high along the shared border between Warrap State and Unity State with the possibility of further violence.

Location of Incident: Ameth village and Toch area in Nyang Payam, Gogrial East
Description:
3.	On 17 August, three secondary sources reported that on 16 August, five male civilians (two Dinka Apuk and three Nuer- ages unspecified) were shot and killed in Ameth village and Toch area in Nyang Payam, Gogrial East County. According to the sources, armed Nuer youths from Unity State, invaded Ameth village to raid cattle, shot and killed two male civilians and raided 25 heads of cattle. Location of Incident: Pojulu tribe in Kenyi Center village, Kenyi Payam, Lainya County
Description: 1.	On 18 August, multiple sources reported that on 8 August, soldiers of the SSPDF, arbitrarily arrested and detained one 24-year-old male civilian from the Pojulu tribe in Kenyi Center village, Kenyi Payam, Lainya County. According to the sources, the victim was arrested by a soldier of the Military intelligence branch of the SSPDF on allegations of being a member of a rebel group and detained in Kenyi Payam. Reportedly, on 9 August, the victim was transferred to the SSPDF detention in Yei town, Yei River County, where he was detained for three days and released without charge on 12 August following the intervention of traditional leaders and a police officer.

Location of Incident: Acholi community in Khor-Muz Boma, Kudo Payam, Torit County
Description: 2.	On 18 August, three secondary sources reported that on 15 August, elements of the SPLA-IO abducted one 25-year-old woman from the Acholi community in Khor-Muz Boma, Kudo Payam, Torit County. According to the sources, a group of 10 SPLA-IO elements from Nyara Boma, Iyeri Payam, intercepted two civilians including the victim, traveling on a motorcycle from Torit to Magwi County, abducted the victim and ordered the motorcycle rider to leave the scene. Reportedly, the SPLA-IO elements fled the scene and took the victim to an unknown location. Personnel of the National Security Service (NSS) were deployed to the scene and determined that the assailants fled towards Nyara Boma. The incident was reported to the Magwi Police Station.

Location of Incident: Kony village, Nyandit Payam, Akobo County
Description: 3.	On 18 August, multiple sources reported that on 9 August, Murle armed elements from Likuangole County in Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA), shot and injured on Lou Nuer male civilian (age unspecified) in Kony village, Nyandit Payam, Akobo County. According to the sources, the Murle armed elements invaded Kony village, shot and injured the victim who was resisting the cattle raid and raided five heads of cattle and fled the scene towards Likuangole County. Reportedly, the armed Lou Nuer youths mobilized and pursued the assailants and in the ensuing confrontation, they recovered the raided cattle in Wech Yier-yier village in Nyandit Payam. The victim was taken to a health facility in Akobo town for treatment.

Location of Incident: in Chuek, Pakam, Dhorlwak/Thorlwak, and Kotlier Bomas in Panchienjok Payam, Panyijar County
Description:
4.	On 18 August, during a follow up on aerial bombardments by the SSPDF in Pachienjok Payam, Panyijar County, on 23 and 24 June, and 4 July, multiple sources reported that 30 civilians were killed, and 51 others injured in Chuek, Pakam, Dhorlwak/Thorlwak, and Kotlier Bomas in Panchienjok Payam, Panyijar County. According to the sources, on 23 June, the SSPDF bombarded Chek and Pakam Bomas in Panchienjok Payam, and Pachienjok town, killing 17 civilians [nine males, five females and three boys (in a school)- ages unspecified], injured eight others (seven males and one female- ages unspecified), killed 45 heads of cattle and injured 81 other heads of cattle. This attack reportedly took place following the inter-communal attacks allegedly perpetrated by armed Nyuong Nuer youth from Panyijiar against the Dinka communities in Yirol East County of Lakes State (see HRD Daily Report 19 and 20 June 2025). 

Comment; following these aerial bombardments, over 2,223 civilians had been displaced from Pachienjok Payam to Pariel Payam, and only 600 civilians have returned to date. These disproportionate and indiscriminate attacks by the SSPDF are in flagrant violation of international humanitarian law and international human rights law applicable to non-international armed conflicts, creating a dire humanitarian crisis in these areas.

Location of Incident: in Chuek, Pakam, Dhorlwak/Thorlwak, and Kotlier Bomas in Panchienjok Payam, Panyijar County
Description:
4. Location of Incident: in Chuek, Pakam, Dhorlwak/Thorlwak, and Kotlier Bomas in Panchienjok Payam, Panyijar County
Description:
Separately, on 24 June, the SSPDF bombarded Dhorlwak/Thorlwak Boma in Pachienjok Payam, destroying four civilian homesteads and six large animal barns (no civilian casualties were recorded). Additionally, on 4 July, the SSPDF equally bombarded Kotlier Boma in Pachienjok Payam, killing 13 civilians (seven males, four females and two children- a boy and a girl: ages unspecified) and injured 43 others (36 males, seven females, and an unspecified number of boys- ages undetermined) and one boat destroyed.

Comment; following these aerial bombardments, over 2,223 civilians had been displaced from Pachienjok Payam to Pariel Payam, and only 600 civilians have returned to date. These disproportionate and indiscriminate attacks by the SSPDF are in flagrant violation of international humanitarian law and international human rights law applicable to non-international armed conflicts, creating a dire humanitarian crisis in these areas.

Location of Incident: in Chuek, Pakam, Dhorlwak/Thorlwak, and Kotlier Bomas in Panchienjok Payam, Panyijar County
Description:

Additionally, on 4 July, the SSPDF equally bombarded Kotlier Boma in Pachienjok Payam, killing 13 civilians (seven males, four females and two children- a boy and a girl: ages unspecified) and injured 43 others (36 males, seven females, and an unspecified number of boys- ages undetermined) and one boat destroyed.

These disproportionate and indiscriminate attacks by the SSPDF are in flagrant violation of international humanitarian law and international human rights law applicable to non-international armed conflicts, creating a dire humanitarian crisis in these areas.

Location of Incident: in Mangol-Apuk village in Nyang Payam of Gogrial East County
Description: 5.	On 18 August, three secondary sources reported that on 15 August, armed Nuer youths from Unity State, shot and killed two male Dinka Apuk civilians (ages unspecified) and injured another in Mangol-Apuk village in Nyang Payam of Gogrial East County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked the Dinka Apuk community within the context of cross-border cattle raid and to exact revenge for past and unresolved grievances, when they shot, killed and injured the victims while they were fishing in the area and fled the scene. Reportedly, the injured victim was evacuated to a health facility in Pathuon West Payam in Gogrial East County for treatment.

Location of Incident: in Mangol-Apuk village in Nyang Payam of Gogrial East County
Description: 5.	On 18 August, three secondary sources reported that on 15 August, armed Nuer youths from Unity State, shot and killed two male Dinka Apuk civilians (ages unspecified) and injured another in Mangol-Apuk village in Nyang Payam of Gogrial East County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked the Dinka Apuk community within the context of cross-border cattle raid and to exact revenge for past and unresolved grievances, when they shot, killed and injured the victims while they were fishing in the area and fled the scene. Reportedly, the injured victim was evacuated to a health facility in Pathuon West Payam in Gogrial East County for treatment.

Location of Incident: Hai multimedia residential area in Wau town, Wau County
Description: 6.	On 18 August, one primary source and two secondary sources reported that on 16 August, an officer of the NSS raped one 15-year-old girl from the Balanda tribe (with an epileptic condition) in the Hai multimedia residential area in Wau town, Wau County. According to the sources, the suspect entered the home of the victim while her parents were attending a social function, dragged her into his home and raped her, fled the scene and remains at large. Reportedly, the victim was taken to a health facility in Wau town, for medical examination and treatment. The incident was reported to the Special Protection unit of the police, a case was opened, and a letter was sent to the Director of the NSS to hand over the suspect for investigation.

Location of Incident: Nyei Boma, Lojulo Payam, Morobo County
Description: 2.	On 19 August, multiple sources reported that, on 16 August, suspected NAS elements shot and injured one 27-year-old male civilian and abducted one 35-year-old male civilian in Nyei Boma, Lojulo Payam, Morobo County. According to the sources, four civilians were traveling on a motorcycle along the Wudabi-Lojulo-Road, when the were intercepted by Suspected NAS elements, who shot and injured the victim (bike rider), and abducted the 35-year-old passenger. Reportedly, the assailants robbed the victims of their valuables and fled the scene, and the injured victim reported the incident to the South Sudan People’s Defense Force, who rushed to the scene, but the assailants had left. The injured victim was taken to a health facility in Yei town for treatment.

Location of Incident: Nyei Boma, Lojulo Payam, Morobo County
Description: 2. The injured victim was taken to a health facility in Yei town for treatment.

Location of Incident: Loriyok Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County
Description: 3.	On 19 August, three secondary sources reported that on 15 August, armed Toposa youths from Machi Boma, Katiko Payam, Kapoeta South County, shot and killed one 21-year-old male Buya civilian in Loriyok Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, the armed Toposa youths attacked a cattle camp in Loriyok Boma, shot and killed the victim, raided 25 heads of cattle and fled the scene. Reportedly, the armed Buya youths mobilized and pursued the assailants to no avail since they had crossed into Machi Boma with the raided cattle. The incident was reported to the Loriyok Police Station and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Loriyok Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County
Description: 3.	On 19 August, three secondary sources reported that on 15 August, armed Toposa youths from Machi Boma, Katiko Payam, Kapoeta South County, shot and killed one 21-year-old male Buya civilian in Loriyok Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, the armed Toposa youths attacked a cattle camp in Loriyok Boma, shot and killed the victim, raided 25 heads of cattle and fled the scene. The incident was reported to the Loriyok Police Station and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: injured in Miir and Ayen villages in Malek Payam, Rumbek Center County
Description:
4.	On 19 August, one secondary source reported that on 18 August, one male civilian (from the Anin clan of Dinka Pakam section-age unspecified) was shot and killed and nine others (three from the Anin clan- including a female civilian, and five male civilians from the Gak clan) were shot and injured in Miir and Ayen villages in Malek Payam, Rumbek Center County. According to the sources, two youths from Anin and Gak clans engaged in an altercation (for unspecified reasons) resulting in the shooting and injuring of the Gak youth. In retaliation, the armed Gak youths attacked the Anin community in Miir village, shot and killed one male Anin civilian and injured three others including female civilian. Reportedly, the armed Anin youths in Ayen village, in Apet Boma, Malek Payam, attacked the Gak community members in Ayen village and injured five civilians. All the injured victims were evacuated to a health facility in Rumbek town for treatment.

Comment: Both Anin and Gak clans are under the Dinka Pakam section of the Dinka Agaar community, based in Rumbek North County. Tension remains very high in the area with the possibility of further violence.

Location of Incident: Aduweng village in Nyang Payam, Gogrial East County
Description:
5.	On 19 August, multiple sources reported that on 17 August, two male Dinka civilians (one Dinka Apuk-Patoc and one Dinka Lou-Paher- ages unspecified) were shot and killed during violence between armed Dinka Apuk- Patoc and armed Dinka Lou-Paher youths in Aduweng and Ding-Tok villages, in Nyang and Marial-Lou Payams, Gogrial East and Tonj North Counties. According to the sources, armed Dinka Apuk-Patoc youths, invaded Aduweng village in Nyang Payam, Gogrial East County shot and killed one male Dinka Lou-Paher civilian, raided 50 heads of cattle and 10 goats and fled the scene into Akop Payam. In retaliation, on the same day, the armed Dinka Lou-Paher youths shot and killed one male Dinka Apuk-Patoc civilian in Ding-Tok village, Marial-Lou Payam, while he was visiting his relatives in the area and fled the scene.

Comment: Marial-Lou Payam authorities have informed the State government about the built-up tension in the area, and the State Security Advisor will visit both Payams to de-escalate tensions and facilitate the arrest of the perpetrators.

Location of Incident: Aduweng village in Nyang Payam, Gogrial East County
Description:
5. Location of Incident: in Ding-Tok village, Marial-Lou Payam
Description:
5. Location of Incident: Tambura- Mupoi Payam Road in Tambura town, Tambura County
Description: 1.     On 19 August, two secondary sources reported that on the same day, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one 43-year-old male Azande civilian along the Tambura- Mupoi Payam Road in Tambura town, Tambura County. According to the sources, the victim left the Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) camp in Tambura town, to Mupoi Payam to collect food items from his house and on his way, he was shot and killed by the assailants for unspecified reasons. Reportedly, the victim’s body was retrieved and taken to a health facility in Tambura town for post-mortem and later given to his family to be buried.

Location of Incident: Balanda community (focal point of a local civil society organization) in Tambura town, Tambura County
Description: 7.	On 19 August, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, soldiers of the SSPDF, arbitrarily arrested one 30-year-old male civilian from the Balanda community (focal point of a local civil society organization) in Tambura town, Tambura County. According to the sources, the SSPDF soldiers arrived on motorcycles and arrested the victim for unspecified reasons, just after finishing a coordination meeting with some humanitarian workers from Juba. Reportedly, the victim was forced to mount one of the motorcycles and was taken to an unknown location.

Location of Incident: in Ngulere Boma, Liria Payam, Juba County
Description:
1.	On 19 and 20 August, three secondary sources reported that on 16 August, Murle armed elements (unspecified number) from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) abducted three children (details unspecified) in Ngulere Boma, Liria Payam, Juba County. According to the sources, the victims and their mother and other civilian passengers were traveling aboard a public transport vehicle from the Kakuma Refugee Camp in Kenya to South Sudan, when they were intercepted by the Murle armed elements. Reportedly, the passengers were robbed of their valuables and the Murle armed elements proceeded to abduct the three children leaving behind the other passengers and fled the scene. The incident was reported to the Juba Eastern Police Division for investigation. 

Comment: the security situation is volatile due to recent clashes between the Dinka Bor herders and Murle in Mogiri, as it was reported that the Murle armed elements attacked some other civilians on their farms in the area and confiscated their mobile phones.

Location of Incident: in Ngulere Boma, Liria Payam, Juba County
Description:
1.	On 19 and 20 August, three secondary sources reported that on 16 August, Murle armed elements (unspecified number) from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) abducted three children (details unspecified) in Ngulere Boma, Liria Payam, Juba County. The incident was reported to the Juba Eastern Police Division for investigation. 

Comment: the security situation is volatile due to recent clashes between the Dinka Bor herders and Murle in Mogiri, as it was reported that the Murle armed elements attacked some other civilians on their farms in the area and confiscated their mobile phones.

Location of Incident: the Dinka Pakam section of the Dinka Agaar community, in Mabor-anyaar village, Meen Payam, Rumbek North County
Description: 2.	On 20 August, one secondary source reported that on 19 August, a group of 16 armed Nuer elements from Panyijar County-Unity State, abducted five civilians (four females and one male- details unspecified) from the Dinka Pakam section of the Dinka Agaar community, in Mabor-anyaar village, Meen Payam, Rumbek North County. According to the source, the victims were traveling from Meen Payam to Malek Payam in Rumbek Centre County, when they were intercepted at gun point and taken into the nearby bushes for unspecified reasons. Reportedly, while on their way, the male victim, escaped from the abductors while the female victims were later subjected to ill-treatment by the abductors before all were released hours later.

Location of Incident: in Warlok village, Palal Payam, Tonj East County
Description: 3.	On 20 August, three secondary sources reported that, on 19 August, armed Dinka Akook elements from Ngabagok Payam (unspecified number), shot and killed one male Dinka Luanyjang civilian (age unspecified) in Warlok village, Palal Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Akook elements attacked the Dinka Luanyjang community in Warlok village within the context of retaliatory violence between the communities, shot and killed the victim and fled the scene towards Ngabagok Payam. Reportedly, the incident was reported to the police in Palal and Ngabagok Payams and investigations are ongoing, although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Ayen-Amol village in Turalei Payam, Twic County
Description:
4.	On 20 August, three secondary sources reported that on 19 August, armed Nuer elements from Unity State (unspecified number), shot and injured one male Dinka Twic-Mayardit civilian (age unspecified) in Ayen-Amol village in Turalei Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked the Dinka Twic-Mayardit community in Ayen-Amol village to raid cattle and exact violence for past and unresolved grievances, when they shot and injured the victim and raided 50 heads of cattle and fled the scene. Reportedly, the armed Dinka Twic-Mayardit elements mobilized and pursued the assailants and in the ensuing confrontation, they overpowered the armed Nuer elements, forcing them to flee and recovered all the raided cattle. The injured victim was taken to a health facility in Turalei town for treatment. 

Comment: these incidents of arbitrary deprivation of life and injury of civilians constitute a fundamental abuse of the right to life and the safety and security of the person as provided by international human rights law.

Location of Incident: Ayen-Amol village in Turalei Payam, Twic County
Description:
4.	On 20 August, three secondary sources reported that on 19 August, armed Nuer elements from Unity State (unspecified number), shot and injured one male Dinka Twic-Mayardit civilian (age unspecified) in Ayen-Amol village in Turalei Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked the Dinka Twic-Mayardit community in Ayen-Amol village to raid cattle and exact violence for past and unresolved grievances, when they shot and injured the victim and raided 50 heads of cattle and fled the scene. The injured victim was taken to a health facility in Turalei town for treatment. 

Comment: these incidents of arbitrary deprivation of life and injury of civilians constitute a fundamental abuse of the right to life and the safety and security of the person as provided by international human rights law.

Location of Incident: Lotiyen Boma, Mogos Payam, Kapoeta East County
Description: 1.	On 21 August, three secondary sources reported that on 13 August, an officer of the NSS shot and killed one 52-year-old male Toposa civilian in Lotiyen Boma, Mogos Payam, Kapoeta East County. According to the sources, the NSS officer shot and killed the victim at a gold mine on the suspicion that he was responsible for a theft incident in the community. Reportedly, the members of Lotiyen community attacked and assaulted the NSS officer, leaving the officer unconscious. The police intervened and took the NSS officer to a health facility in the area for treatment and opened an investigation on the killing of the 52-year-old victim at the Kapoeta South Police Station.

Location of Incident: Padulek village, Paweng Payam, Tonj East County
Description:
2.	On 21 August, multiple secondary sources reported that on 20 August, five civilians were shot and killed (one Dinka Luanyjang and four Dinka Lou-Paher- details unspecified) and one other injured (male Dinka Luanyjang- age unspecified), during violence between the armed Dinka Luanyjang and armed Dinka Lou-Paher elements in Padulek village, Paweng Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, an armed Dinka Lou-Paher element shot and killed one male Dinka Luanyjang civilian and injured another in Padulek village within the context of retaliatory violence for past and unresolved grievances between the communities. Reportedly, in retaliation, armed Dinka Lunayjang elements- number unspecified (and relatives to the deceased) attacked the Dinka Lou-Paher community in Padulek village, shot and killed four male Dinka Lou-Paher civilian (ages unspecified) and raided 40 heads of cattle and fled the scene. 

Comment: the authorities are working to deploy security forces to Padulek village to contain the situation following reports of rising tension with the possibility of further violence. HRD has recorded a history of cyclical violence between these communities between 2020 and 2021, with a staggering 150 deaths registered.

Location of Incident: Padulek village, Paweng Payam, Tonj East County
Description:
2. Location of Incident: Pojulu tribe (ages unspecified) in Mundu Boma, Kupera Payam, Lainya County
Description: 1.	On 22 August, three secondary sources reported that on 20 August, SPLA-IO elements abducted 19 male civilians from the Pojulu tribe (ages unspecified) in Mundu Boma, Kupera Payam, Lainya County. According to the sources, the SPLA-IO elements stormed the Mundu market, broke into shops and looted many items from the owners, and captured 25 civilians (details unspecified). Reportedly, six of the civilians escaped and the SPLA-IO elements took the remaining 19 male civilians, forcing them to transport the looted items. The victims were released the following day and some reported to have suffered from ill-treatment at the hands of the abductors.

Location of Incident: Isebi village, Lojulo Payam, Morobo County
Description:
2.	On 22 August, three secondary sources reported that on 20 August, suspected NAS elements abducted two civilians from the Keliko tribe (a 42-year-old man and his wife-details not specified) in Isebi village, Lojulo Payam, Morobo County. According to the sources, the suspected NAS elements mounted an illegal checkpoint near the Isebi market preventing the civilians from returning home, led them into nearby bushes and robbed them of their valuables. Reportedly the victims were isolated and taken captive for unspecified reasons, although the female victim eventually escaped while the abductors took the 42-year-old man to an unknown location allegedly in the Democratic Republic of Congo.

Comment: these incidents are indicative of a deteriorating protective environment and the lack of physical safety of the civilians in these areas. HRD will continue to engage with County authorities to increase the security measures in these communities.

Location of Incident: Logir community in Loriyok Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County
Description:
3.	On 22 August, three secondary sources reported that on 17 August, six armed Buya elements abducted two children (a four-year-old girl and an 11-year-old-boy) from the Logir community in Loriyok Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, the armed Buya elements ambushed and shot at a commercial transport vehicle, transporting about 20 civilians (South Sudanese returnees from the Kakuma region in Kenya) heading to Chahari Payam, Ikotos County. Reportedly, as the passengers ran into the bushes for safety, the assailants pursued them and abducted the victims and fled the scene to an unknown location.

Comment: it is alleged that this incident was a revenge operation for the killing of four Buya civilians (two females and two males- ages unspecified) by armed Logir elements from Chahari Payam on 28 July [see HRD Daily Report 1 August 2025].

Location of Incident: Bul-Gik village, Turalei Payam, Twic County
Description: 4.	On 24 August, three secondary sources reported that on 21 August, suspected armed Nuer elements from Mayom County-Unity State, shot and killed one male Dinka Twic- Mayardit civilian (age unspecified) in Bul-Gik village, Turalei Payam, Twic County, in the context of cross-border violence for past and unresolved grievances. According to the sources, the armed Nuer elements invaded Bul-Gik village, shot and killed the victim in his homestead and fled the scene into Unity State.  Reportedly, senior state officials are visiting Twic County to address the issue of rising cross-border attacks by the armed Nuer elements against the Twic-Mayardit community.

Location of Incident: in Ferga Payam, Raja County
Description:
5.	On 20 and 22 August two primary sources and one secondary source reported that on 22 March, two Wildlife officers illtreated and killed one 36-year-old man (Sudanese national) in Ferga Payam, Raja County. According to the sources, the officers beat and killed the victim with sticks while effecting an arrest order on allegation of theft involving the victim. Reportedly, the South Sudan People’s Defense Forces (SSPDF) arrested and detained the victim for one month and on 27 April 2025, they were remanded at the Raja prison.

Comment: The issue was later resolved between the victim’s family and the accused officers through the Raja customary court with the payment of 41 cows for blood compensation.

Location of Incident: from the Kresh tribe, in Wau El Jaded residential area, Raja town Raja County
Description: 6.	On 20 and 22 August, one primary and one secondary source reported that on 18 March, an element of the SPLA-IO raped one 17-year-old girl from the Kresh tribe, in Wau El Jaded residential area, Raja town Raja County. According to the sources, the victim was tending to her younger brothers while their parents were away for farming, when the SPLA-IO element entered their home and raped the victim at gunpoint. Reportedly, the incident was reported to the Raja Police Station on 18 August, and the police sent a letter to the SPLA-IO commander requesting that the suspect should be handed over for investigation.

Location of Incident: in Hiyala Payam, Torit County
Description:
1.	On 25 August, three secondary sources reported that on 24 August, three male Lutoko male civilians were shot and injured during violence between armed Lutoko elements from Ogelek and Murahatiha Bomas in Hiyala Payam, Torit County. According to the sources, three armed Lutoko elements from Ogelek Boma, stormed Murahatiha Boma, shot and injured two male Lutoko civilians (aged 20 and 40 years old) and fled the scene into Ogelek Boma in retaliation from the rape of one 27-year-old woman from Ogelek Boma by armed elements from Murahatiha Boma in June 2025 (exact date unspecified). Reportedly, in retaliation, the armed Lutoko elements from Murahatiha Boma mobilized and invaded Ogelek Boma, where they shot and injured one male Lutoko civilian (aged 48 years old) and returned to Murahatija Boma. The incident was reported to the Torit Police Station and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made.

Comment: These incidents highlight the fragile protective environment for civilians in the area. HRD will continue its engagements for immediate action from authorities to guarantee the physical safety and security of the civilian population.

Location of Incident: in Hiyala Payam, Torit County
Description:
1.	On 25 August, three secondary sources reported that on 24 August, three male Lutoko male civilians were shot and injured during violence between armed Lutoko elements from Ogelek and Murahatiha Bomas in Hiyala Payam, Torit County. According to the sources, three armed Lutoko elements from Ogelek Boma, stormed Murahatiha Boma, shot and injured two male Lutoko civilians (aged 20 and 40 years old) and fled the scene into Ogelek Boma in retaliation from the rape of one 27-year-old woman from Ogelek Boma by armed elements from Murahatiha Boma in June 2025 (exact date unspecified). Reportedly, in retaliation, the armed Lutoko elements from Murahatiha Boma mobilized and invaded Ogelek Boma, where they shot and injured one male Lutoko civilian (aged 48 years old) and returned to Murahatija Boma. The incident was reported to the Torit Police Station and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made.

Comment: These incidents highlight the fragile protective environment for civilians in the area. HRD will continue its engagements for immediate action from authorities to guarantee the physical safety and security of the civilian population.

Location of Incident: Apet Boma, Malek Payam, Rumbek Center County
Description:
2.	On 25 August one secondary source reported that on 19 August eight armed Dinka Gok elements from Duony Payam- Cueibet County, abducted five female civilians (including one 14-year-old girl and one pregnant woman), and raped four of the victims (excluding the pregnant woman) in Apet Boma, Malek Payam, Rumbek Center County. According to the source, the armed Dinka Gok elements abducted the victims while they were fetching wood in the bushes in Apet Boma, and on the night of 19 August, five of the assailants raped all except the pregnant woman. Reportedly, the victims were all released the following day in Real-Kou area bordering Malek Payam, Duony and Abiriu Payams in Cueibet County. 

Comment: HRD will corroborate this report with the police and the SSPDF in Malek Payam, during the planned integrated mission to the area.

Location of Incident: Apet Boma, Malek Payam, Rumbek Center County
Description:
2.	On 25 August one secondary source reported that on 19 August eight armed Dinka Gok elements from Duony Payam- Cueibet County, abducted five female civilians (including one 14-year-old girl and one pregnant woman), and raped four of the victims (excluding the pregnant woman) in Apet Boma, Malek Payam, Rumbek Center County. According to the source, the armed Dinka Gok elements abducted the victims while they were fetching wood in the bushes in Apet Boma, and on the night of 19 August, five of the assailants raped all except the pregnant woman. Reportedly, the victims were all released the following day in Real-Kou area bordering Malek Payam, Duony and Abiriu Payams in Cueibet County. 

Comment: HRD will corroborate this report with the police and the SSPDF in Malek Payam, during the planned integrated mission to the area.

Location of Incident: Thanom and Tiap Payams, Panyijar County
Description:
3.	On 24 and 25 August, three secondary sources reported that on 23 August, six male civilians including a minor (aged between two and three years old) were shot and killed and another injured during violence between armed elements from the Cheingmalual and Chiengnyaluoh sub-clans of Nyuong Nuer Section in Thanom and Tiap Payams, Panyijar County.  According to the sources, armed elements from Chiengmalual in Tiap Payam, invaded Thanom Payam, shot and killed one 32-year-old male civilian and injured another (age unspecified) from the Chiengnyaluoh sub-clan and fled the scene. Reportedly, on the same day, armed elements from Chiengnyaluoh sub-clan launched a counter offensive attack in Tiap Payam, and in the ensuing confrontation, four male civilians from the Chiengmalaul subclan and the minor (from the Haak Nuer clan in Mayendit County) were shot and killed in the crossfire. The injured victim was taken to a health facility in Ganyliel Payam for treatment.

Comment: Tension is high in the area as armed elements from the Tiap and Jiech areas are mobilizing for possible further violence. The County authorities have deployed the security forces to the area to de-escalate the situation and restore calm.

Location of Incident: Thanom and Tiap Payams, Panyijar County
Description:
3.	On 24 and 25 August, three secondary sources reported that on 23 August, six male civilians including a minor (aged between two and three years old) were shot and killed and another injured during violence between armed elements from the Cheingmalual and Chiengnyaluoh sub-clans of Nyuong Nuer Section in Thanom and Tiap Payams, Panyijar County.
