Location of Incident: Achol-Awakau village in Awul Payam, Tonj North County
Description:
4.	On 25 August, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Atok elements shot and injured one male Dinka Jurbol civilian (age unspecified) in Achol-Awakau village in Awul Payam, Tonj North County.  According to the sources, the victim was traveling on a motorcycle from Rualbet Payam when he was ambushed, shot and injured for unspecified reasons, since there have been sustained peace between the Dinka Jurbol and Dinka Atok communities. Reportedly, the victim was evacuated to Wau- Western Bahr El Ghazal State for treatment.

Comment: Although this was an isolated incident after a sustained period of reconciliation between the communities, this raises concerns about the fragility of peace and the risks of individual and collective safety of civilians in the area.

Location of Incident: Aru Junction area, Lokiliri Payam, Juba County
Description: 1.	On 25 and 26 August, two secondary sources reported that on 24 August, suspected Murle armed elements from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA)-Jonglei State, shot and killed two civilians (male and female- Husband and Wife- ages unspecified) and abducted five boys (aged one, four, four, six and seven years old) from the Lolubo community in Aru Junction area, Lokiliri Payam, Juba County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked the homes of civilians while they were sleeping and abducted children. Reportedly, they entered the home of the couple, shot and killed them, while they resisted the abduction attempt, and proceeded to abduct their two children and abducted the three other children from other homes in the area.

Location of Incident: Aru Junction area, Lokiliri Payam, Juba County
Description: 1.	On 25 and 26 August, two secondary sources reported that on 24 August, suspected Murle armed elements from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA)-Jonglei State, shot and killed two civilians (male and female- Husband and Wife- ages unspecified) and abducted five boys (aged one, four, four, six and seven years old) from the Lolubo community in Aru Junction area, Lokiliri Payam, Juba County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked the homes of civilians while they were sleeping and abducted children. Reportedly, they entered the home of the couple, shot and killed them, while they resisted the abduction attempt, and proceeded to abduct their two children and abducted the three other children from other homes in the area.

Location of Incident: Tataman Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County
Description: 2.	On 26 August, three secondary sources reported that on 20 August, armed Toposa elements from Kapoeta North County, shot and killed one 28-year-old male Buya civilian (cattle keeper) in Tataman Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked two cattle camps in the area, shot and killed the victim, raided 200 heads of cattle and fled the scene. Reportedly, the gunshot alerted the armed Buya elements who mobilized and pursued the assailants and recovered all the raided cattle. The incident was reported to the Loryok Police Station and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Tataman Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County
Description: 2.	On 26 August, three secondary sources reported that on 20 August, armed Toposa elements from Kapoeta North County, shot and killed one 28-year-old male Buya civilian (cattle keeper) in Tataman Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked two cattle camps in the area, shot and killed the victim, raided 200 heads of cattle and fled the scene. Reportedly, the gunshot alerted the armed Buya elements who mobilized and pursued the assailants and recovered all the raided cattle. The incident was reported to the Loryok Police Station and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Namosingo Boma, Lokwamor Payam, Kapoeta North County
Description:
1.	On 27 August, three secondary sources reported that on 22 August, armed Buya elements from Tataman Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County, shot and killed one 32-year-old male Toposa civilian from Namosingo Boma, and injured another 21-year-old male civilian in Namosingo Boma, Lokwamor Payam, Kapoeta North County. According to the sources, the assailants invaded Namosingo Boma to recover cattle raided by armed Toposa elements in Tataman Boma, during which one 28-year-old male Buya civilian was shot in killed [see HRD Daily Report 27 August 2025]. Reportedly, the assailants immediately shot and killed the victim and injured the other while they were transporting goats to the Kapoeta South Market for sale. The incident was reported to the Riwoto Police Station and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made. 

Comment: the authorities in Kapoeta North County have engaged their counterparts in Budi County to explore avenues of resolving the standing history of cyclical and retaliatory violence between these communities, which jeopardizes the protection of civilians.

Location of Incident: Namosingo Boma, Lokwamor Payam, Kapoeta North County
Description:
1.	On 27 August, three secondary sources reported that on 22 August, armed Buya elements from Tataman Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County, shot and killed one 32-year-old male Toposa civilian from Namosingo Boma, and injured another 21-year-old male civilian in Namosingo Boma, Lokwamor Payam, Kapoeta North County. According to the sources, the assailants invaded Namosingo Boma to recover cattle raided by armed Toposa elements in Tataman Boma, during which one 28-year-old male Buya civilian was shot in killed [see HRD Daily Report 27 August 2025]. Reportedly, the assailants immediately shot and killed the victim and injured the other while they were transporting goats to the Kapoeta South Market for sale. The incident was reported to the Riwoto Police Station and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made. 

Comment: the authorities in Kapoeta North County have engaged their counterparts in Budi County to explore avenues of resolving the standing history of cyclical and retaliatory violence between these communities, which jeopardizes the protection of civilians.

Location of Incident: Mayom-Biong village in Pathuon West Payam of Gogrial East County
Description: 3.	On 27 August, three secondary sources reported that on 26 August, armed Bul Nuer elements from Mayom County-Unity State, shot and injured one male Dinka Apuk civilian (age unspecified) in Mayom-Biong village in Pathuon West Payam of Gogrial East County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked the Dinka Apuk community in Mayom-Biong village, shot and injured the victim and raided 20 heads of cattle and fled the scene. Reportedly, the armed Dinka Apuk elements mobilized and pursued the assailants and in the ensuing confrontation, they shot and injured one armed Bul Nuer element and recovered all the raided cattle. The injured victim was taken to a health facility in Pathuon West Payam for treatment.

Location of Incident: Mayom-Biong village in Pathuon West Payam of Gogrial East County
Description: 3.	On 27 August, three secondary sources reported that on 26 August, armed Bul Nuer elements from Mayom County-Unity State, shot and injured one male Dinka Apuk civilian (age unspecified) in Mayom-Biong village in Pathuon West Payam of Gogrial East County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked the Dinka Apuk community in Mayom-Biong village, shot and injured the victim and raided 20 heads of cattle and fled the scene. Reportedly, the armed Dinka Apuk elements mobilized and pursued the assailants and in the ensuing confrontation, they shot and injured one armed Bul Nuer element and recovered all the raided cattle. The injured victim was taken to a health facility in Pathuon West Payam for treatment.

Location of Incident: Dinka community in Nyong Payam, Torit County
Description: 2.	On 28 August, three secondary sources reported that on 27 August, one SSPDF soldier (from the Murle community in Greater Pibor Administrative Area- GPAA) abducted one five-year-old girl from the Dinka community in Nyong Payam, Torit County. According to the sources, the child was returning home from making a purchase at a nearby shop, when she was intercepted and carried away by the SSPDF officer. Reportedly, following her sudden disappearance, the victim’s relatives informed the SSPDF soldiers in the area who alerted their counterparts at the Juba Checkpoint in Central Equatoria State. Later, on the same day, the abductor reached the Juba Checkpoint with the child and was immediately apprehended, while the child was recovered and reunited with her family in Torit County. The incident was reported to the SSPDF HQ in Juba and proceedings are ongoing.

Location of Incident: Marial-Guotjor village, Ajak-Kuac Payam, Twic County
Description: 3.	On 28 August, multiple sources reported that, on the same day, armed Bul Nuer elements from Mayom County- Unity State, shot and injured two male Dinka Twic-Mayardit civilians (ages unspecified) in Marial-Guotjor village, Ajak-Kuac Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, the assailants shot at Dinka Twic- Mayardit cattle herders while they were catering to their cattle, injured the victims and raided 18 heads of cattle and fled the scene into Unity State. Reportedly, the injured victims were evacuated to a health facility in Turalei Payam for treatment.

Location of Incident: Marial-Guotjor village, Ajak-Kuac Payam, Twic County
Description: 3.	On 28 August, multiple sources reported that, on the same day, armed Bul Nuer elements from Mayom County- Unity State, shot and injured two male Dinka Twic-Mayardit civilians (ages unspecified) in Marial-Guotjor village, Ajak-Kuac Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, the assailants shot at Dinka Twic- Mayardit cattle herders while they were catering to their cattle, injured the victims and raided 18 heads of cattle and fled the scene into Unity State. Reportedly, the injured victims were evacuated to a health facility in Turalei Payam for treatment.

Location of Incident: Matakurungu Boma, Tambura town Payam, Tambura County
Description:
4.	On 28 August, two secondary sources reported that on 27 August, unidentified armed elements shot and killed two civilians (Husband and wife: 55-year-old man from the Azande community and 45-year-old woman from Balanda community) in Matakurungu Boma, Tambura town Payam, Tambura County. According to the sources, the assailants shot and killed the victims while they were cultivating their farms for unspecified reasons. Reportedly, the police were deployed to the scene and retrieved the bodies of the victims and handed the bodies over to their families for internment.

Comment: This incident follows a backdrop of restricted movement by armed elements affiliated with the former governor of Western Equatoria State, preventing civilians from the Balanda community from entering Tambura town, with an active threat to shot or kill anyone who defied the order.

Location of Incident: in Morsak Boma, Otogo Payam, Yei River County
Description:
1.	On 29 August, three secondary sources reported that on 27 August, soldiers of the SSPDF arbitrarily arrested, detained, ill-treated and killed one 35-year-old male civilian from the Kakwa tribe in Morsak Boma, Otogo Payam, Yei River County, According to the sources, on 23 August, the victim was arrested by the SSPDF at the Ombaci market in Otogo Payam, on accusations of being affiliated to the National Salvation Front (NAS). Reportedly, while under detention at the SSPDF barracks in Morsak Boma, the victim was subjected to severe ill-treatment which allegedly led to his demise in detention. The body of the victim was given to his family on 28 August and was buried on 29 August.

Comment: The SSPDF declined responsibility for this incident and claimed it was a case of suicide. HRD will continue to follow up with the competent authorities for more information.

Location of Incident: Lotakawa Boma, Kauto Payam, Kapoeta East County
Description: 2.	On 29 August, three secondary sources reported that on 25 August, armed Suruma elements from the Gambela District of Ethiopia, shot and killed one 28-year-old male Toposa civilian in Lotakawa Boma, Kauto Payam, Kapoeta East County. According to the sources, the assailants invaded Lotakawa Boma, to raid cattle from the Toposa community, when they encountered the victim, shot and killed him while he was collecting fruits in the bushes. Reportedly, the gunshots alerted the armed Toposa elements in the area who mobilized and pursued the assailants into Gambela District, without any cattle being raided. The incident was reported to the Kapoeta East Police Station although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Lacharok Village, Ahirilo Payam, Imehejek Administrative Area, Lafon County
Description: 3.	On 29 August, four secondary sources reported that on 2 August, Murle armed elements from GPAA abducted two female civilians (aged 38 and 40 years old) in Lacharok Village, Ahirilo Payam, Imehejek Administrative Area, Lafon County. According to the sources, the victims were harvesting vegetables and collecting firewood, when about 10 Murle armed elements abducted them and took them to GPAA. Reportedly, after one week, the 40-year-old woman escaped from the abductors and was recovered by members of the Tenet community in Western Lopit in Lafon County, while the 38-year-old pregnant victim remained with the abductors.

Location of Incident: Greater Pibor Administrative Area [GPAA- precise location unspecified]
Description: 4.	On 29 August, multiple sources reported that on 20 August, 10 victims of abduction (two women, two girls, four boys, and two infants- details unspecified) from the Murle community were recovered by authorities in Ayod County. According to the sources, the victims were abducted on 23 July 2023, by armed Lou Nuer elements in Greater Pibor Administrative Area [GPAA- precise location unspecified] and taken to Karam Payam, Uror County- Jonglei State. Reportedly, on 20 August, the two women, gathered the children and fled from their abductors and arrived Ayod County and were received by County authorities and placed under the protective custody of the SSPDF. Efforts are underway to transfer the victims to GPAA for family tracing and reunification.

Location of Incident: Kuanyal village in Rualbet Payam, Tonj North County
Description: 5.	On 31 August, three secondary sources reported that on 28 August one armed Dinka Padiang-Bar element, shot and killed one male civilian (age unspecified) in Kuanyal village in Rualbet Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the assailant shot and killed the victim, while he was attending a customary court session allegedly for past and unresolved grievances between the communities. Reportedly, the assailant immediately fled the scene but was later arrested and detained in Thiet Payam in Tonj South County.

Location of Incident: Mambe Payam, Maridi County
Description: 6.	On 28 and 29 August, multiple sources reported that on 28 August, suspected SPLA-IO elements abducted seven civilians (including one female civilian and a minor- details unspecified) in Mambe Payam, Maridi County. According to the sources, armed elements suspected of being SPLA-IO attacked a group of civilians while working on the farm of a former County authority, looted farm produce, livestock and abducted the victims and fled the scene. Reportedly, the incident was reported to the SSPDF, who immediately pursued the abductors and in the ensuing confrontation, one SSPDF soldier was shot and killed, three others injured and three of the abducted victims escaped (details unspecified) while the abductors fled with the remaining four victims.

Location of Incident: Likuangole County, GPAA
Description:
A 15-year-old Murle girl forced into marriage in Likuangole County, GPAA
On 04 August, HRD interviewed a 15-year-old Murle girl, a victim of early/forced marriage and sexual violence, at the Interim Care Center (ICC) in Pibor, GPAA. According to the girl and social workers at the ICC, the victim was booked for marriage at around the age of 10 by the family of a boy, now approximately 20 years old and belonging to the Guzule age-set. As a result of this Murle tradition, reportedly 50 cattle were given to her late father and brothers as a bride price.
She reported that while living in Pibor town with her mother, she was sent to Likuangole town in October 2024 to collect sorghum. During that trip, the boy who had been promised to marry her, along with four of his age-set peers, abducted her and took her to his home in Longorket village, Kongor Payam, Likuangole County, where she sexually assaulted and forced to live as a wife. She further reported that since her abduction, the boy and his friends had repeatedly beaten her for resisting the marriage. The most recent incident occurred in early July 2025, after which she managed to escape to Pibor and report her case to the GPAA authorities on 06 July 2025. 
Comments: This is just one of the many early and forced marriages, involving GBV elements, that have been reported in GPAA as the numbers keep increasing.

Location of Incident: Burdoro Payam, Pochalla North County (GPAA)
Description:
An Anyuak abductee victim recovered by authorities in Pibor, GPAA
On 28 July, HRD met and interviewed a 20-year-old abductee at the Interim Care Center (ICC) in Pibor, Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA). The girl, originally from Nyium village in Burdoro Payam, Pochalla North County (GPAA), recounted her abduction and ordeal of human rights violations by suspected Murle armed elements. According to the victim, she was abducted on 12 December 2016 in Nyium by armed Murle youth who forcefully took her to Othagon village in Lokormach Payam, Likuangole County, GPAA. Upon arrival in Lokormach, she lived with her abductor and his family. However, after the abductor killed someone, she was given as blood compensation to the deceased's family on unspecified date. Around 2020, this family arranged her marriage to a man, and after the death of the to be husband, she was handed over to the deceased brother as a wife in 2022. 
The girl stated that she was abducted alongside another Anyuak girl, who is now 22 years old and currently living with her abductor in Gie Payam, Likuangole County. The victim said she escaped around 12 July at a time when was was brought to Pibor town for medical treatment to help her conceive. While in Pibor, she contacted members of the Anyuak community who supported her escape. As a result, on 21 July, she reported herself to the Interim Care Center (ICC) in Pibor.
Comments: The family members have been traced, and the girl is in communication with her parents, pending transportation arrangements and family reunification.

Location of Incident: Hai-Erap, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County
Description:
•	Rape of a 15-year-old girl in Hai-Erap, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County

On 04 August 2025, HRD-YFO received and documented credible information from three reliable secondary sources  including two medical officers and a community worker  (details on file)  about  the rape of a 15-year-old civilian female from the Kakwa tribe (details on file) by a 22-year-old Civilian male (details not provided) a resident of Hai-Erap from the Kakwa tribe in Hai-Erap, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County in February 2025 (date unknown). 

According to the sources, the incident occurred on unidentified date in February 2025 where the perpetrator invited the 15-year-old survivor to his residence within the Hai-Erap neighborhood and raped her multiple times. The rape resulted in pregnancy which the child concealed from her parents until July 2025 when she got sick and was taken to the hospital for medical checkup and established that she was 6 months pregnant. The case was reported to Yei Police Headquarters on 31 July 2025, and the perpetrator was arrested and detained on 1 August 2025.

Comments: Raping a minor constitutes a gross violation of her right to freedom from Cruel, inhuman, or degrading treatment and torture or punishment (Article 5 UDHR). HRD will follow up with the police for accountability and proper administration of justice.

Location of Incident: Tambura Town, Tambura County
Description:
•	HRD Yambio FO visits Tambura General Hospital to follow up on the Alleged Rape of a 14-Year-Old Female in Tambura Town, Tambura County

On August 6, 2025, HRD visited the Tambura General Hospital in Tambura Town, Tambura County, and interacted with hospital staff, including the administrative officer and the midwife responsible for the GBV desk. During this visit, the staff expressed that the hospital is experiencing numerous challenges. They reported two security incidents in July 2025 involving unidentified armed assailants. In one case, three armed individuals attacked the hospital, firing shots before escaping on a motorbike. In another incident, an armed person was seen near the hospital but fled when pursued by security personnel from the SSPDF assigned to the facility. Such attacks discourage patients from seeking care, and as a result, all hospital staff, including doctors, have relocated to Juba, leaving only one general practitioner at the facility.

Moreover, the midwife noted that in July, the hospital documented approximately four cases of gender-based violence (GBV), including the rape of a 14-year-old girl. The reported cases involved four women: one aged 25 who was assaulted by her husband, another aged 35 who was attacked by a woman with mental health issues, and a 16-year-old who became pregnant by her 16-year-old boyfriend. Concerning the rape of the 14-year-old, the midwife recounted that on July 27, the girl was brought to the hospital by her mother. The mother explained that she had gone to the garden that day, leaving her daughter home alone near St. Mary Catholic Church in Tambura Town. An unknown boy, who lived nearby, lured her into his room and raped her. The victim indicated that she screamed for help, but there was no one nearby to assist her during the assault.

The police were notified about the incident, leading to the boy's arrest. The victim was taken to the hospital for a medical examination and psychosocial support, using Form 8. The midwife also noted that the Tambura community sees numerous cases of gender-based violence (GBV), including those involving men, but many victims do not seek help from the hospital.

Comment: HRD will follow up with the police on the rape incident to gather more details. Concerning security around the hospital, the hospital administrative officer noted that the facility lacks proper protection and has no fence, which allows anyone armed to enter without difficulty, thereby increasing the insecurity. He called on UNMISS, as well as development and humanitarian partners, to assist in constructing a fence around the hospital to enhance security.

Location of Incident: Hayat IDP Camp near Tambura Town, Tambura County
Description:
•	Two Unidentified Armed Elements attacked five Women from Hayat IDP Camp near Tambura Town, Tambura County, and Sexually Assaulted Two of the Women.

On August 6, HRD Yambio FO received and documented information from the Acting Coordinator for the Relief and Rehabilitation Commission (RRC) in Tambura Town, Tambura County, about an alleged rape incident in which two unidentified armed elements attacked five women and eventually raped two of the women.

The Coordinator recounted an incident on July 15, 2025, within the Hayat IDP camp, which is about 6 kilometers from the town center. On that day, a group of five women from the camp from the Balanda community left to fetch water from the nearby River Boo. Unfortunately, as they traversed the route, they were ambushed by two unidentified armed assailants, both of whom were masked and wielding firearms. While three of the women managed to escape the terrifying encounter, two others were captured and forcibly taken into the surrounding bush, where they endured brutal sexual violence. Among the victims were a 15-year-old girl and an 18-year-old woman, both facing unimaginable trauma.

The three females who escaped quickly ran back to the IDP camp and informed their relatives about the incident, prompting a swift response. Fortunately, when the rescuers reached the location, the assailants had already fled, leaving the victims behind. Reports indicate that the 15-year-old girl sustained severe abdominal pain as a result of the incident and has since been transferred to Juba for urgent medical care. In contrast, the 18-year-old continuation of her recovery at the Hayat IDP camp raises concerns about the access and quality of medical assistance available locally. The source expressed uncertainty regarding whether the incident had been formally reported to the police, highlighting a gap in response mechanisms.

In response to the alarming reports surrounding the rape incident, HRD has taken steps to follow up at the Tambura health facility. The midwife overseeing the Gender-Based Violence (GBV) desk, established with the assistance of World Vision, indicated that no reports of the incident had reached the hospital. She pointed out that cases from the Balanda areas of Tambura town are infrequently disclosed, mainly due to the victims' fears of reprisals from their attackers. To ensure proper investigation and support, HRD plans to engage with the police inspector at the Tambura police station. Additionally, efforts are underway to gain access to the Hayat IDP camp to provide further assistance and conduct follow-up on the reported cases.

Location of Incident: Gudelle at Gudelle Block 2 in Juba
Description:
•	Follow up on a rape case involving a 12-year-old girl perpetrated allegedly by an SSPDF soldier in Gudelle at Gudelle Block 2 in Juba.

On 5 August 2025, HRD interview two relatives of the victim including the father. The father of the victim narrated that on 17 March 2025, at around 10am he went out of the house leaving behind the victim and her two siblings at home. Reportedly the victim was sent by her elder sister to a neighbor’s house to collect Tea Infusers/Strainers. However, she delayed compelling her elder sister to go in search of her. Upon arrival at the house, she found the door locked but could hear someone screaming. Instinctively she forced herself into the house and found the victim screaming tied up by the perpetrator who happens to be an SSPDF soldier (approximately 35 years old).  The victim told her sister that the perpetrators lured her into the room, closed the door and raped her.  

Upon receiving the information, the father immediately rushed to the house and took the victim to Gudelle Police Division where he reported the incident. The police noted down the case and advised them to seek medical support. Hence, the victim and her father proceeded to Juba Teaching Hospital where a doctor examined the victim and confirmed rape and provided some medical kits. The source further reported that after the incident, the suspect had escaped but was traced and arrested the same day (17 March 2025) and detained at Gudelle Police Division while investigations were ongoing. The suspect was charged under section 247 of SSPC and was taken to the Juba National Prison. The first and the second court session were scheduled to take place on 26 & 28 June 2025 respectively. 


However, the trials could not proceed for unclear reasons. He explained that since the third session has been slated for 8 August 2025.

Comment: The father of the victim has requested HRD’s support in ensuring that the scheduled trial proceeds without further delay, in order to uphold the rights of the child survivor to timely justice. HRD will follow up.

Location of Incident: Kabo Boma, Luri Payam, Juba County
Description:
•	Gang rape of seven women perpetrated by 13 unknown armed men in Kabo Boma, Luri Payam, Juba County on 6 August 2025.

On 7 August 2025, HRD followed up on reports of mass sexual violence involving seven women who were allegedly raped on 6 August 2025 by approximately13 masked and armed assailants in Jerra farming area, located in Kabo Boma of Luri Payam. The attack took place while the women were working on a groundnut farm approximately three kilometers from Kabo town.

A team including HRD visited the Kabo Police Station in the Gurei residential area to investigate the incident. The team engaged with the station inspector, representatives from the Directorate of Criminal Investigation Department (CID) of Juba County, the Special Protection Unit (SPU), and some of the survivors. According to two of the survivors’ testimonies, the assailants rape all seven women including a four-month pregnant woman. The women were dragged into nearby bushes, where the assaults occurred simultaneously. The survivors also recounted being severely beaten and kicked for attempting to resist. Before fleeing, the perpetrators confiscated all the victims' mobile phones. Ten of the attackers were reportedly armed with guns, while three carried machetes, and all were masked.

During the visit, HRD also met with a case worker from the NGO, Women for Justice and Equality, an organization supporting the victims. The case worker confirmed that the women were taken to CARE PLUS on 6 August 2025 for emergency medical attention. CARE PLUS, known for handling high-profile sexual violence cases, conducted examinations, including an ultrasound for the pregnant survivor, which confirmed the fetus was unharmed. However, the facility lacked Post-Exposure Prophylaxis (PEP), which was not administered at the time. Plans were reportedly underway to refer all survivors to Juba Teaching Hospital (JTH) to access comprehensive medical care, including PEP.

Comment: This incident constitutes a grave violation of international human rights and humanitarian law. HRD will continue to monitor the case closely and work in collaboration with law enforcement and support organizations to ensure survivors receive adequate medical, psychosocial, and legal support, and that the perpetrators are identified and held accountable.

Location of Incident: Nimule Municipality, Magwi County
Description: A 17-year-old Madi girl was gangraped by four Madi men in Nimule Municipality, Magwi County. The incident occurred on 05 July 2025, at approximately 2200hours when the 17-year-old girl was coming from a party and four men subsequently grabbed and took her to an uncompleted building where they raped her in turns. The following day, the girl reported the incident at the police station and two perpetrators were reportedly arrested and remanded in Nimule prison. The girl was referred to Nimule hospital and she received medical and psychosocial support.

Location of Incident: Omeo Boma, Magwi Payam, Magwi County
Description: A 16-year-old Acholi girl was raped by a 25-year-old Acholi man in Omeo Boma, Magwi Payam, Magwi County. The incident happened on 10 July 2025, at approximately 1700hours, when the 16-year-old Acholi girl was sent on an errand to a nearby village where she met the 25-year-old man who dragged her into a nearby bush by the roadside and raped her. The girl reportedly returned home and informed her parents about the incident. She was taken to Magwi police station where her statement was taken and referred to the hospital where she received medical treatment and psychosocial support. The perpetrator was arrested and remanded in Magwi County prison.

Location of Incident: Obbo Boma, Obbo Payam, Magwi County
Description: A 16-year-old Acholi girl was raped by a 23-year-old Acholi man in Obbo Boma, Obbo Payam, Magwi County. The incident happened on 14 July 2025, at approximately 1200hours, when the neighbor to the 16-year-old Acholi girl invited her to his house and raped her. The girl reportedly returned home and informed her parents about the incident. She was taken to Obbo health center where she received medical treatment. The incident was reported to the Magwi police station, and the perpetrator was arrested, while investigation is reported to be ongoing.

Location of Incident: Obbo Boma, Obbo Payam, Magwi County
Description: A 16-year-old Acholi girl was raped by a 21-year-old Acholi man in Obbo Boma, Obbo Payam, Magwi County. The incident happened from April 2025, when the 21-year-old man when into a relationship with the 16-year-old (a minor), raped and impregnated her. The incident was reported to the Magwi police station, and the perpetrator was arrested on 4 July 2025 and is still in police custody, while the investigation is reported to be ongoing. Meanwhile the minor received medical and psychosocial support.

Location of Incident: Aweil town
Description: 9.	On 1 July 2025, HRD visited the High Court in Aweil town to monitor the trial of a 59-year-old Sudanese man, Abdelkarim Mukthor Haroon, who was accused of raping a 30-year-old Dinka woman. The parties agreed to an out-of-court settlement, which was noted and recorded by the Court. The settlement requires the defendant to pay the survivor 4million SSP and nine (9) cows. The Court also imposed a fine of 300,000 SSP on the defendant. This notwithstanding, HRD remains concerned by the settlement of such a serious offence and the subsequent lack of accountability against the perpetrator.

Location of Incident: Zangia village, Tambura county
Description:
According to HRD source who provided update re- seven individuals subjected to arbitrary arrest and detention by the SSPDF in Ayat IDP camp, Tambura County  on 12 August, six out of seven victims (names on file) were killed on 1 September 2025, while the remaining one (name on file) was injured and managed to escape. Accordingly, upon their arrest, the victims were taken by the forces of M/Gen James Nando to their station at Mammenze Stream Source. On 1 September, four of the victims were shot to death while in detention, whose remains were later placed in a sack. Nando’s forces then ordered the remaining three victims at gun-point to carry and dump the dead bodies away from their camp where after dumping they were all shot at, killing the other two and injuring the other who sustained gunshot wound on his stomach and managed to escape. 

On the same day, prior to the killing, reportedly Nando’s men went to a village called Zangia and killed two men (with disability: a mentally challenged person and a blind man). In response, the Balanda militias pursued Nando’s men up to the their base at Mammenze Stream where they had confrontation. Not long after, Nando’s men then shot the detained individuals arrested on 12 August.

Location of Incident: at Mammenze Stream Source, Tambura county
Description:
According to HRD source who provided update re- seven individuals subjected to arbitrary arrest and detention by the SSPDF in Ayat IDP camp, Tambura County  on 12 August, six out of seven victims (names on file) were killed on 1 September 2025, while the remaining one (name on file) was injured and managed to escape. Accordingly, upon their arrest, the victims were taken by the forces of M/Gen James Nando to their station at Mammenze Stream Source. On 1 September, four of the victims were shot to death while in detention, whose remains were later placed in a sack. Nando’s forces then ordered the remaining three victims at gun-point to carry and dump the dead bodies away from their camp where after dumping they were all shot at, killing the other two and injuring the other who sustained gunshot wound on his stomach and managed to escape. 

On the same day, prior to the killing, reportedly Nando’s men went to a village called Zangia and killed two men (with disability: a mentally challenged person and a blind man). In response, the Balanda militias pursued Nando’s men up to the their base at Mammenze Stream where they had confrontation. Not long after, Nando’s men then shot the detained individuals arrested on 12 August.

Location of Incident: at Mammenze Stream Source, Tambura county
Description:
According to HRD source who provided update re- seven individuals subjected to arbitrary arrest and detention by the SSPDF in Ayat IDP camp, Tambura County  on 12 August, six out of seven victims (names on file) were killed on 1 September 2025, while the remaining one (name on file) was injured and managed to escape. Nando’s forces then ordered the remaining three victims at gun-point to carry and dump the dead bodies away from their camp where after dumping they were all shot at, killing the other two and injuring the other who sustained gunshot wound on his stomach and managed to escape.
