Not long after, Nando’s men then shot the detained individuals arrested on 12 August.

Location of Incident: Luparate area, Yei town Payam, Yei River County
Description: 1.	On 1 September, three secondary sources reported that, on 29 August an unidentified armed element shot and injured one 19-year-old man in Luparate area, Yei town Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, the assailant entered the victim’s home in the very early hours of 29 August, shot and injured the victim and fled the scene for unspecified reasons. Reportedly, the victim was taken to a health facility in Yei town for treatment and the incident was reported to the police and investigations are ongoing.

Location of Incident: Hai Thoura residential area in Juba town, Juba County
Description: 2.	On 1 September, three primary sources reported that on 26 August, soldiers of the SSPDF arbitrarily arrested and detained three male civilians (aged 36, 38, and 40 years old) in the Hai Thoura residential area in Juba town, Juba County. The sources recounted that the SSPDF arrested the victims from different locations in Juba town and detained them at SSPDF headquarters in Juba town for unspecified reasons. According to the sources, the victims were released between 29 and 30 August without any charges against them.

Location of Incident: Nadapal Boma, Narus Payam, Kapoeta East County
Description:
3.	On 1 September, three secondary sources reported that on 30 August, armed Turkana elements from the Lokichoggio District, Turkana County- Republic of Kenya, shot and killed one 18-year-old male Toposa civilian (cattle herder) in Nadapal Boma, Narus Payam, Kapoeta East County. According to the sources, the assailants crossed into South Sudan to graze their cattle at the Mogila grazing field in Nadapal Boma, when they met the victim, while he was grazing his cattle, shot and killed him and fled the scene. Reportedly, the Toposa youths rushed to the scene, and recovered the victim’s body and cattle, reported the incident to the Narus Police station and investigations are ongoing. 

Comment: the Mogila grazing field is a disputed border property between the Turcana community in Kenya and the Toposa community in Nadapal Boma, over which the Turcana community had claimed exclusive ownership rights and had warned the Toposa herders to stay off the land. Efforts are underway by the Nadapal Boma authorities to reach out to their counterparts in Turcana community for a lasting solution to this dispute.

Location of Incident: in Tiap-tiap Payam, Cueibet County
Description: 4.	On 1 September, two secondary sources reported that on 28 August, armed Dinka Gok elements from the Waat section of Dinka Gok, shot and killed one 18-year-old male civilian from the Panyar section of Dinka Gok in Tiap-tiap Payam, Cueibet County. According to the sources, the victim was walking his cattle from the Wunchil cattle camp towards the Cuei cattle camp in Tiap-tiap Payam when he was shot and killed by the assailants for unspecified reasons. Reportedly, the assailants took the victims gun and fled the scene leaving the cattle behind. The security forces (SSPDF and the South Sudan National Police Service- SSNPS) were deployed to the area to track down the assailants and de-escalate the situation.

Location of Incident: Nuer community in Manikauach village, Doma Payam, Ulang County
Description: 5.	On 1 September, multiple secondary sources reported that, on 29 August, armed Dinka Ngok elements shot and killed three civilians (details unspecified) and injured six others (one child, four females and one male- ages unspecified) from the Nuer community in Manikauach village, Doma Payam, Ulang County. According to the sources, this incident was in retaliation to an attack in August (exact date unspecified) during which armed Nuer elements from Ulang County attacked the Dinka Ngok community in Ulang County and raided over 800 heads of cattle.

Location of Incident: Nuer community in Manikauach village, Doma Payam, Ulang County
Description: 5.	On 1 September, multiple secondary sources reported that, on 29 August, armed Dinka Ngok elements shot and killed three civilians (details unspecified) and injured six others (one child, four females and one male- ages unspecified) from the Nuer community in Manikauach village, Doma Payam, Ulang County. According to the sources, this incident was in retaliation to an attack in August (exact date unspecified) during which armed Nuer elements from Ulang County attacked the Dinka Ngok community in Ulang County and raided over 800 heads of cattle.

Location of Incident: Warrap town, Awul Payam Tonj North County
Description:
6.	On 1 September, multiple secondary sources reported that on 29 August, Military Intelligence personnel of the SSPDF, extra-judicially executed one 35-year-old male Dinka Apuk-Patoc male suspect in Warrap town, Awul Payam Tonj North County. According to the sources, in June 2025 (exact date unspecified) the victim was arrested and detained at the Warrap town Police station in Awul Payam for the murder of one male Dinka Kongor civilian in Riil-Bar village, Akop Payam, Tonj North County [see HRD Daily Report 26 May 2025]. Reportedly, on 29 August the suspect was extracted from the Warrap town Police station and taken to the outskirts of Warrap town along the Warrap town-Akop Payam- Road, where he was tied to a tree and executed by firing squad allegedly on the orders of a commanding officer. The victim’s body was later given to his family for burial. 

Comment: extra-judicial executions are in flagrant violation of the most fundamental human right to life and a legal procedural breach of due process, fair trial and the presumption of innocence of the victims.

Location of Incident: in Mundri West town, Mundri West County
Description:
7.	On 1 September, multiple secondary sources reported that on 31 August, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one male civilian (a community leader from the Moru community- age unspecified) in Mundri West town, Mundri West County. According to the sources, the assailant invaded the victim’s homestead, shot and killed him for unspecified reasons and fled the scene. Reportedly, the incident was reported to the Mundri West Police station and investigations are ongoing. 

Comment: the victim is allegedly one of the chiefs known to adjudicate issues at the Mundri West County Bench Court and given the circumstances of his demise, it was alleged that it could have been a targeted attack. HRD will follow up for more information.

Location of Incident: outskirts of Mangala Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos County
Description: 1.	On 2 September, three secondary sources reported that on 31 August, three armed Logir elements from Mangala Boma Chahari Payam, shot and killed one 47-year-old male Dongotono civilian from Chahari Boma, in the outskirts of Mangala Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos County. According to the sources, the assailants shot and killed the victim on sight, while he was traveling from Chahari Boma to Mangala Boma, to visit his relatives. Reportedly, this incident was a revenge action for the killing of two male civilians from the Logir community by armed Dongotono elements on 1 July [see HRD Daily Report 8 July 2025]. The incident was reported to the Chahari Police Station and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Abyeicok village, Duony Payam, Cueibet County
Description:
2.	On 2 September, multiple secondary sources reported that on 1 September, soldiers of the SSPDF extra-judicially executed two male suspects (ages unspecified) from the Pagok clan of Dinka Gok, in Abyeicok village, Duony Payam, Cueibet County. According to the sources the victims were arrested and detained at the Abyeicok Police post (exact date unspecified) on accusation of cattle raiding and the exchange of the raided cattle with armed Dinka Agaar elements. Reportedly, on 1 September, the victims were extracted from the Abyeicok Police Station by the SSPDF and taken to a nearby bush in the area and executed by firing squad to the viewing of some community members allegedly on the instructions from the Lakes State and Cueibet County authorities.

Comment: it was reported that other victims were also extra-judicially executed on the same day by the SSPDF in Cueibet County, in total violation of the human right to life, legal due process and the rule of law. HRD will follow up for more information on these incidents and engage State and County authorities on the urgency to respect and protect the human rights of civilians, suspects and other accused persons in the area.

Location of Incident: Gorom residential area, Juba town Juba County
Description: 3.	On 2 September, one primary source and one secondary source reported that in March 2025 (precise day unspecified), a soldier of the SSPDF, raped, abducted and illtreated one 15-year-old girl (Sudanese national from the Maseria tribe) in Gorom residential area, Juba town Juba County. According to the sources, the SSPDF soldier lured the victim with an offer of employment as a maid, took her to his home, drugged her, raped her and abducted the victim from Juba to Wau town in Western Bahr el Ghazal State leaving behind the victim’s two younger sisters aged one and four years old. Reportedly, on 2 July, while at the soldier’s home in Wau, the victim was subjected to varying forms of ill-treatment including beating with sticks, which alerted the neighbors who came to the victim’s rescue and took the victim to a health facility in Wau town for treatment and reported the incident to the Wau North Police Station for investigation.

Location of Incident: Makpandu Boma, Bangasu Payam, Yambio County
Description: 4.	On 2 September, two secondary sources reported that on 31 August, unidentified armed elements suspected to be of the Sudan People’s Liberation Army- In Opposition (SPLA-IO) abducted two civilians (a 40-year-old woman from the Azande community and a 30-year-old male refugee from the Democratic Republic of Congo-DRC) in Makpandu Boma, Bangasu Payam, Yambio County. According to the sources, the female victim was abducted at the Yata stream while fetching water and the male victim was abducted while in his farm in Mabironi area in Makpandu Boma. Reportedly, the abductors demanded that the victims lead them to the Makpandu refugee camp, and in the process, ill-treated the male victim when he asserted that he does not know the right path. The victims were released separately on 1 September, and the incident was reported to the police station and investigations are ongoing.

Location of Incident: Machar village, Paweng Payam, Tonj East County
Description: 1.	On 3 September, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Pawer elements shot and killed one male Dinka Pamun-Bak civilian (age unspecified) in Machar village, Paweng Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the assailants shot and killed the victim on allegations of an extra-marital affair between the victim and the wife of the ringleader of the armed Dinka Pawer elements. Reportedly, the assailants immediately fled the scene, and the local authorities have begun a manhunt to track down the perpetrators.

Location of Incident: Pulbar village, Marial-Lou Payam, Tonj North County
Description: 2.	On 3 September, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Lou-Paher elements shot and injured one male Dinka Thiik civilian (from Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County- age unspecified) in Pulbar village, Marial-Lou Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the victim was shot and injured at the homestead of his relatives while on visit for unspecified reasons and the assailants fled the scene. Reportedly, the victim was taken to a health facility in Marial-Lou Payam for treatment, while the security forces were deployed to de-escalate the situation and apprehend the suspects.

Location of Incident: Farag Sika cattle camp in Adeu Boma, Marial Lou Payam, Tonj North County- Warrap State
Description: 3.	On 3 September, one primary source reported that on 25 August, unidentified armed elements shot and injured one 25-year-old male Dinka civilian at the Farag Sika cattle camp in Adeu Boma, Marial Lou Payam, Tonj North County- Warrap State. The source recounted that the victim was shot and injured while he was bathing at a waterpoint near the cattle camp for unspecified reasons and the assailants seized the victim’s mobile phone and fled the scene. Reportedly, the victim was evacuated the following day to a health facility in Wau town, Western Bahr el Ghazal State for treatment and the incident was reported to the Warrap town Police Station.

Location of Incident: Didinga community in Ngauro Boma, Ngauro Payam-Budi County
Description: 1.	On 4 September, three secondary sources reported that on 2 September, armed Toposa elements from Lopala village, Namorunang Boma, Namorunang Payam, Kapoeta South County, shot and killed one 13-year-old boy from the Didinga community in Ngauro Boma, Ngauro Payam-Budi County. According to the sources, the assailants invaded Ngauro Boma, to raid cattle when they saw the victim near a cattle camp, shot and killed him to prevent him from raising an alarm. Reportedly, the assailants immediately fled the scene as the gunshot mobilized the armed Didinga elements. The incident was reported to the Ngauro Police and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: in Dhorbona village, Boor Payam, Mayendit County
Description: 2.	On 4 September, multiple secondary sources reported that on 3 September, armed Nyuong Nuer elements from Panyijar County, shot and killed one 35-year-old male Haak Nuer civilian and injured two female civilians (aged 28 and 30 years old) in Dhorbona village, Boor Payam, Mayendit County. According to the sources, the assailants fled the scene and the reason for the attack is yet unknown. Reportedly, the injured victims were taken to a health facility in Leer County for treatment.

Location of Incident: in Dhorbona village, Boor Payam, Mayendit County
Description: 2.	On 4 September, multiple secondary sources reported that on 3 September, armed Nyuong Nuer elements from Panyijar County, shot and killed one 35-year-old male Haak Nuer civilian and injured two female civilians (aged 28 and 30 years old) in Dhorbona village, Boor Payam, Mayendit County. According to the sources, the assailants fled the scene and the reason for the attack is yet unknown. Reportedly, the injured victims were taken to a health facility in Leer County for treatment.

Location of Incident: Nyingor village, Paweng Payam, Tonj East County
Description: 3.	On 4 September, three secondary sources reported that on 3 September, armed Dinka Luanyjang elements shot and killed one male Dinka Lou-Paher civilian (age unspecified) in Nyingor village, Paweng Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the assailants shot and killed the victim while he was visiting his relatives in Nyingor village, for past and unresolved grievances between the Dinka Lou-Paher and Luanyjang communities. Reportedly, the assailants fled the scene after this incident and the security forces were deployed to the area to prevent further violence.

Location of Incident: Rualbet town, Rualbet Payam, Tonj North County
Description:
4.	On 4 September, four secondary sources reported that on 1 September, Military Intelligence personnel of the SSPDF, extrajudicially executed one 29-year-old male Dinka Jurbol civilian (accused of murder) in Rualbet town, Rualbet Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, on 31 August, the victim was arrested and detained at the SSPDF facility in Rualbet town on allegations of killing another male civilian on 28 August during a customary court hearing in Kuanyal village in Rualbet Payam. Reportedly, on 1 September, the victim was extracted from the SSPDF detention and taken to the outskirts of Rualbet town, tied to a tree and killed by firing squad allegedly on the orders of a senior commanding officer and his body was given to his family for internment. 

Comment: there is a noticeable surge in extrajudicial executions in Warrap State, in violation of the right to life, legal due process and it reflects the lack of accountability within the ranks of the SSPDF for such and other related violations.

Location of Incident: Luo community in Kapur Boma, Mapel Payam, Jur River County
Description: 5.	On 4 September, one primary source and two secondary sources reported that on 1 September, a soldier of the SSPDF, raped one 65-year-old woman from the Luo community in Kapur Boma, Mapel Payam, Jur River County. According to the sources, the SSPDF soldier invaded the homestead of the victim, restrained and raped her and fled the scene, while the victim was taken to the Mapel police station and to a health facility in Mapel Payam for medical attention. Reportedly, the SSPDF soldier was arrested by the SSPDF commander and transferred to the SSPDF barracks in Wau town for further investigation.

Location of Incident: Nabanga Boma, Tambura town Payam, Tambura County
Description: 6.	On 4 September, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, three civilians (details unspecified) were shot and injured during violence between the SSPDF and suspected SPLA-IO elements in Nabanga Boma, Tambura town Payam, Tambura County. According to the sources, armed elements suspected of being of the SPLA-IO launched an attack on SSPDF positions in Nabanga Boma and in the ensuing confrontation, three civilians were shot and injured. Reportedly, the SSPDF repelled the attack and pursued the SPLA-IO elements towards Sinakpuro village and one SSPDF soldier was killed in the process.

Location of Incident: Iloli Boma, in Iloli Boma, Hiyala Payam, Torit County
Description: 1.	On 5 September, three secondary sources reported that on 3 September, armed Lotuko elements from Loguruny Boma, shot and killed one 25-year-old Lotuko male civilian from Iloli Boma, in Iloli Boma, Hiyala Payam, Torit County. According to the sources, the assailants shot and killed the victim while he was grazing his cattle in the area, raided 12 heads of cattle and fled the scene. Reportedly, the local youths mobilized and pursued the assailants to no avail, returned and reported the incident to the Torit Police Station and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Iloli Boma, in Iloli Boma, Hiyala Payam, Torit County
Description: 1.	On 5 September, three secondary sources reported that on 3 September, armed Lotuko elements from Loguruny Boma, shot and killed one 25-year-old Lotuko male civilian from Iloli Boma, in Iloli Boma, Hiyala Payam, Torit County. According to the sources, the assailants shot and killed the victim while he was grazing his cattle in the area, raided 12 heads of cattle and fled the scene. Reportedly, the local youths mobilized and pursued the assailants to no avail, returned and reported the incident to the Torit Police Station and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: the outskirts of Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County
Description: 2.	On 7 September, three secondary sources reported that on 5 September, armed Dinka Pakiic elements shot and injured two male Dinka Pan-Juaj civilians (ages unspecified) in the outskirts of Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Pakiic elements attacked the Dinka Pan-Juaj community in Wunlit Payam, shot at a random homestead injuring the victims and raided five cows and 12 goats. Reportedly, one of the injured victims was taken to a health facility in Wunlit town, while the other was evacuated to a health facility in Tonj town, Tonj South County for advanced treatment. The authorities and security forces have commenced an investigation to apprehend the suspects.

Location of Incident: the outskirts of Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County
Description: 2.	On 7 September, three secondary sources reported that on 5 September, armed Dinka Pakiic elements shot and injured two male Dinka Pan-Juaj civilians (ages unspecified) in the outskirts of Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Pakiic elements attacked the Dinka Pan-Juaj community in Wunlit Payam, shot at a random homestead injuring the victims and raided five cows and 12 goats. Reportedly, one of the injured victims was taken to a health facility in Wunlit town, while the other was evacuated to a health facility in Tonj town, Tonj South County for advanced treatment. The authorities and security forces have commenced an investigation to apprehend the suspects.

Location of Incident: along the Juba-Torit-Road in Ngangalla Boma, Liria Payam, Juba County
Description: 1.	On 8 September, three secondary sources reported that on 5 September, 10 Murle armed elements from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA), abducted two children (a two-year-old boy from the Lokoya community and a two-year-old girl from the Kuku community) along the Juba-Torit-Road in Ngangalla Boma, Liria Payam, Juba County. According to the sources the victims were travelling with other civilian passengers in two commercial transport vehicles from Juba town to Torit County in Eastern Equatoria State through Liria Payam, when they were intercepted by the Murle armed elements. Reportedly, the Murle armed elements looted personal valuables from the passengers, abducted the victims and fled the scene. The youths in Liria Payam mobilized and pursued the abductors to no avail, they returned and reported the incident to the Police for investigation.

Location of Incident: Loriwo Boma, Lomeyen Payam, Kapoeta North County
Description: 2.	On 8 September, three secondary sources reported that on 5 September, armed Buya elements from Napak Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County, shot and killed one 26-year-old male Toposa civilian and injured a 20-year-old male civilian in Loriwo Boma, Lomeyen Payam, Kapoeta North County. According to the sources, the assailants invaded Loriwo Boma to raid cattle belonging to the Toposa community, when they met the victims grazing their cattle in the area, shot and killed and injured the other and raided their cattle. Reportedly, as they exited the scene, armed Toposa elements alerted by gunshots, retaliated and in the ensuing confrontation, recovered all the raided cattle and forced the assailants to flee from the scene. The injured victim was evacuated to a health facility in Riwoto town for treatment and the incident was reported to the Riwoto Police station and investigations are ongoing.

Location of Incident: Loriwo Boma, Lomeyen Payam, Kapoeta North County
Description: 2.	On 8 September, three secondary sources reported that on 5 September, armed Buya elements from Napak Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County, shot and killed one 26-year-old male Toposa civilian and injured a 20-year-old male civilian in Loriwo Boma, Lomeyen Payam, Kapoeta North County. According to the sources, the assailants invaded Loriwo Boma to raid cattle belonging to the Toposa community, when they met the victims grazing their cattle in the area, shot and killed and injured the other and raided their cattle. Reportedly, as they exited the scene, armed Toposa elements alerted by gunshots, retaliated and in the ensuing confrontation, recovered all the raided cattle and forced the assailants to flee from the scene. The injured victim was evacuated to a health facility in Riwoto town for treatment and the incident was reported to the Riwoto Police station and investigations are ongoing.

Location of Incident: in Liethni village, Mayom Payam, Panyijar County
Description:
3.	On 8 September, two secondary sources reported that on the same day, a group of armed Haak Nuer elements from Mayendit County, shot and killed one 25-year-old male Nyuong Nuer civilian in Liethni village, Mayom Payam, Panyijar County. According to the sources, the assailants entered Liethni village using canoes and attacked a fishing camp in the area, shot and killed the victim and one other 30-year-old male civilian was declared missing due to the attack. Reportedly, this incident was in retaliation to the shooting and killing of one 35-year-old male Haak Nuer civilian during an earlier attack by armed Nyuong Nuer elements in Dhorbona village, Mayendit County on 3 September [see HRD Daily Report 5 September 2025]. 

Comment: Tension is built up in the area with the fear of possible further violence as additional information indicates that a larger group of Haak Nuer armed youths, numbering over 20 canoes, were preparing to launch further attacks on Mayom Payam.

Location of Incident: Klo 24 village, Budang Payam, Rubkona County
Description: 4.	On 8 September, one secondary source reported that on the same day, seven unidentified armed elements shot and killed two Bul Nuer male civilians (aged 35 and 37 years old) in Klo 24 village, Budang Payam, Rubkona County. According to the source, the victims were shot and killed while in their farms for unspecified reasons. Reportedly, the security forces were immediately deployed to the scene, but the assailants had fled and investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Liet-Akuec village, Nyang Payam, Gogrial East County
Description: 5.	On 8 September, three secondary sources reported that on 5 September, allied armed Nuer and Dinka Apuk elements shot and injured one male Dinka Apuk civilian in Liet-Akuec village, Nyang Payam, Gogrial East County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Apuk elements from Gogrial East County and their allied Armed Nuer elements from Unity State, attacked the Dinka Apuk community in Liet-Akuec village, shot and injured the victim during a cattle raid attempt in the area. Reportedly, other opposing armed Dinka Apuk elements in the area mobilized, confronted and overpowered the assailants, shot and killed two armed Dinka Apuk elements allied with the armed Nuer elements, forcing the rest to flee into Unity State.

Location of Incident: Ayat Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) camp in Tambura town Payam, Tambura County
Description:
6.	On 8 September, multiple secondary sources reported that on 6 September, soldiers of the SSPDF attacked, ill-treated and injured civilians (details unspecified) at the Ayat Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) camp in Tambura town Payam, Tambura County. According to the sources, this incident was triggered by an earlier assault on 5 September during which suspected Sudan People’s Liberation Army – In Opposition (SPLA-IO) elements attacked and disarmed some soldier of the SSPDF deployed around the IDP camp. Reportedly, the SSPDF soldiers invaded the IDP camp, firing shots in the air, beating, injuring and looting an unspecified number of IDPs leading to further displacement to Mangburu and Bandala villages for protection.

Comment: the brewing insecurity in Tambura County further worsens the protection concerns of the civilians in the area and more so for the IDPs taking refuge at the Ayat IDP camp. Such indiscriminate conduct by the SSPDF violates the fundamental human right to safety, security and physical integrity of the civilians in the area.

Location of Incident: Wayimba village, Panyume Payam, Morobo County.
Description:
1.	On 9 September, two secondary sources reported that on 30 August, suspected SPLA-IO elements abducted three male civilians from the Kakwa tribe (including a minor) in Wayimba village, Panyume Payam, Morobo County. According to the sources, a group of SPLA-IO elements attacked Wayimba village, looted food, non-food items, and money as well as three male civilians. The victims were reportedly coerced into carrying the looted items to their hideout and were subsequently released on 31 August.

Comment: The abduction of civilians and forcing abductees to carry looted items have become recurrent in the area and part of the mode of operation of SPLA-IO elements, leaving civilians in more precarious conditions, insecure and in breach of their basic human rights.

Location of Incident: Dongotono community in Woroworo Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos County
Description: 2.	On 9 September, three secondary sources reported that on 8 September, armed Lutoko elements from Lolianga Boma, Hiyala Payam shot and killed one 27-year-old male civilian from the Dongotono community in Woroworo Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked and opened fire on the victim in his homestead and thereafter fled the scene. Reportedly, the incident was in retaliation for the killing of one 25-year-old Lutoko male civilian by armed Dongotono elements in Woroworo Boma on 20 September 2024. The incident was reported at Ikotos Police Station and investigations are reportedly ongoing. The authorities in Ikotos County are reportedly engaging with local leaders in Hiyala Payam to identify and hold the perpetrators accountable.

Location of Incident: Malakal Town, Malakal County
Description:
3.	On 8 and 9 September, multiple sources reported that on 8 September, two female civilians were shot and injured during armed confrontation among SSNPS personnel in Malakal Town, Malakal County. According to the sources, about 145 SSNPS personnel broke into the SSNPS armory and opened fire on the homestead of a senior County official, and in the ensuing confrontation with other SSNPS personnel, two SSNPS personnel, one personnel of the National Prison Service of South Sudan officer, and two female civilians were injured. The two SSNPS personnel subsequently succumbed to the injuries. Reportedly, joint SSNPS and South Sudan People’s Defence Forces (SSPDF) were deployed to the area to de-escalate the situation, and the assailants were disarmed, arrested and detained at the NSS and SSPDF facilities in the area.

Comment: Reportedly, the 145 SSNPS officers were rebelling against county authorities because they did not want to be deployed to Ulang County due to poor remuneration and treatment.

Location of Incident: Dinka Luanyjang community in Rumabuth village, Palieng Payam, Tonj East County
Description: 4.	On 9 September, three secondary sources reported that on 7 September, armed Dinka Akook elements from Ngabagok Payam shot and injured one 17-year-old female civilian from the Dinka Luanyjang community in Rumabuth village, Palieng Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Akook elements attacked Rumabuth village and opened fire on the victim’s homestead, injuring him. The victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Romic Town for medical treatment. The retaliatory attack is reportedly linked to recent violence between the two communities.

Location of Incident: Azande community in Bangasu Payam, Yambio County
Description: 5.	On 9 September, multiple sources reported that on 8 September, unidentified armed elements raped one female civilian from the Azande community in Bangasu Payam, Yambio County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked different villages in the area, looted livestock and other valuables belonging to the civilians, and proceeded to rape the victim in her homestead. Reportedly, security forces were deployed to the area to contain the situation.

Location of Incident: Azande community near the Sue bridge along the Yambio-Maridi-Road in Bangasu Payam, Yambio County
Description: 6.	On 9 September, multiple sources reported that on 7 September, suspected SPLA-IO elements abducted three male civilians from the Azande community near the Sue bridge along the Yambio-Maridi-Road in Bangasu Payam, Yambio County. According to the sources, the suspected SPLA-IO elements intercepted the victims while they were travelling on a motorcycle from Yambio to Juba, looted their valuables, set ablaze the motorcycle, and thereafter  abducted the victims and transferred them to an unknown location. Reportedly, the abductees were subjected to ill-treatment while in captivity, before being released the following day.

Location of Incident: Kura Angereb (Jalite) village, Nesitu Boma, Lokiliri Payam, Juba County.
Description:
1.	On 9 and 10 September, multiple secondary sources reported that on 9 September, suspected Murle armed elements attacked and killed one male civilian (a local chief) in Kura Angereb (Jalite) village, Nesitu Boma, Lokiliri Payam, Juba County. According to the sources, suspected Murle armed elements attacked the victim while he was walking on the outskirts of Kura Angereb  village, beat him up and strangled him to death. The motive for the attack remains unknown. 

Comment: According to the sources, a group of Murle armed elements recently arrived in the area in anticipation of the relocation of cattle from Nimule; however, the group has reportedly been attacking and abducting civilians in the area.

Location of Incident: Kimotong and Lomeyen Payams, Kapoeta North County.
Description: 2.	On 10 September, three secondary sources reported that on 28 August, two male civilians (one 19-year-old from the Toposa community and a 20-year-old from the Buya community) were shot and killed during violence between armed Toposa and Buya elements in Kimotong and Lomeyen Payams, Kapoeta North County. According to the sources, five armed Toposa elements from Lomeyen Payam attacked Kataman Boma in Kimotong Payam to raid cattle and opened fire on the 20-year-old victim while he was grazing his cattle in the area, killing him. Reportedly, as the armed Buya elements pursued the assailants, they encountered the 19-year-old victim on the outskirts of Kimotong Payam, and opened fire, killing him in retaliation. The incident was reported at Loriyok and Riwoto police stations and investigations are reportedly ongoing; however, no arrests have been made so far.

Location of Incident: Dinka Luanyjang community in Pulbar village, Marial-Lou Payam, Tonj North Country
Description: 3.	On 10 September, multiple sources reported that on 5 September, the SSPDF extrajudicially executed one 31-year-old male civilian from the Dinka Luanyjang community in Pulbar village, Marial-Lou Payam, Tonj North Country. According to the sources, SSPDF soldiers arrested the victim for the murder of another male civilian on 3 September in Nyingor village, Paweng Payam, Tonj East County [see HRD Daily Report 5 September 2025], transferred him to Marial-Lou Payam, where he was executed by firing squad, allegedly on the others of senior County authorities and commanding officers of the SSPDF. The victim’s body was handed to his relatives the following day for interment.

Location of Incident: Nuer community in Bisellia Payam, Wau County.
Description: 4.	On 10 September, one primary source and three secondary sources reported that on 20 August, one armed Dinka element raped a13-year-old girl from the Nuer community in Bisellia Payam, Wau County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka element intercepted the victim at gunpoint while she was returning home from visiting her sister, forced her into a nearby bush and raped her. On 3 September, the incident was reported to the police, and the suspect was arrested. The survivor was taken to a health care facility in the area for medical treatment and psychosocial support.

Location of Incident: Kakwa community in Goja residential area, Otogo Payam, Yei River County
Description: 1.	On 11 September, two secondary sources reported that on 30 August, an unidentified armed element raped one 18-year-old woman from the Kakwa community in Goja residential area, Otogo Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, the armed element accosted the victim while she was returning from her farm and proceeded to raped her. The survivor received medical care at a health care facility in Yei Town on 1 September; however, she reportedly did not report the incident to the police since she could not identify the perpetrator.

Location of Incident: Nesitu Boma, Lokiliri Payam, Juba County
Description: 2.	On 11 September, two secondary sources reported that on 10 September, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one male civilian (Ugandan national) and injured two others in Nesitu Boma, Lokiliri Payam, Juba County. According to the sources, the assailants ambushed and opened fire on a civilian passenger vehicle traveling along the Juba-Nimule-Road enroute to Uganda, killing the driver and injuring two passengers. Reportedly, the police responded to the scene and retrieved the body of the victim and evacuated the injured victims to Juba. The incident was reported at the Eastern Police Division in Gumbo and investigations are reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: Nesitu Boma, Lokiliri Payam, Juba County
Description: 2.	On 11 September, two secondary sources reported that on 10 September, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one male civilian (Ugandan national) and injured two others in Nesitu Boma, Lokiliri Payam, Juba County. According to the sources, the assailants ambushed and opened fire on a civilian passenger vehicle traveling along the Juba-Nimule-Road enroute to Uganda, killing the driver and injuring two passengers. Reportedly, the police responded to the scene and retrieved the body of the victim and evacuated the injured victims to Juba. The incident was reported at the Eastern Police Division in Gumbo and investigations are reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: Toposa community, during an attempted cattle raid in Napusare village, Naliel Boma, Narus Payam, Kapoeta East County
Description: 3.	On 11 September, three secondary sources reported that on 10 September, Murle armed elements from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) shot and killed two male civilians (28 and 30 years old), injured another 23-year-old male civilian, and abducted a nine-year-old boy, all from the Toposa community, during an attempted cattle raid in Napusare village, Naliel Boma, Narus Payam, Kapoeta East County. According to the sources, a group of nine Murle armed elements attacked and opened fire on a cattle camp in Napusare village, killing two civilians and injuring another. The attackers also abducted a nine-year-old boy who was grazing goats outside the cattle camp. Reportedly, armed Toposa elements repulsed the attackers and in the ensuing confrontation, recued the abductees. The incident was reported at Narus Police station and investigations are reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: Toposa community, during an attempted cattle raid in Napusare village, Naliel Boma, Narus Payam, Kapoeta East County
Description: 3.	On 11 September, three secondary sources reported that on 10 September, Murle armed elements from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) shot and killed two male civilians (28 and 30 years old), injured another 23-year-old male civilian, and abducted a nine-year-old boy, all from the Toposa community, during an attempted cattle raid in Napusare village, Naliel Boma, Narus Payam, Kapoeta East County. According to the sources, a group of nine Murle armed elements attacked and opened fire on a cattle camp in Napusare village, killing two civilians and injuring another. The attackers also abducted a nine-year-old boy who was grazing goats outside the cattle camp. Reportedly, armed Toposa elements repulsed the attackers and in the ensuing confrontation, recued the abductees. The incident was reported at Narus Police station and investigations are reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: Toposa community, during an attempted cattle raid in Napusare village, Naliel Boma, Narus Payam, Kapoeta East County
Description: 3.	On 11 September, three secondary sources reported that on 10 September, Murle armed elements from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) shot and killed two male civilians (28 and 30 years old), injured another 23-year-old male civilian, and abducted a nine-year-old boy, all from the Toposa community, during an attempted cattle raid in Napusare village, Naliel Boma, Narus Payam, Kapoeta East County. According to the sources, a group of nine Murle armed elements attacked and opened fire on a cattle camp in Napusare village, killing two civilians and injuring another. The attackers also abducted a nine-year-old boy who was grazing goats outside the cattle camp. Reportedly, armed Toposa elements repulsed the attackers and in the ensuing confrontation, recued the abductees. The incident was reported at Narus Police station and investigations are reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: Azande community in Gamunakpe village, Tambura Central Boma, Tambura town Payam, Tambura County
Description:
4.	On 11 September, two secondary sources reported that on the same day, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one male civilian from the Azande community in Gamunakpe village, Tambura Central Boma, Tambura town Payam, Tambura County. According to the sources, the assailants ambushed and opened fire on the victim while he was returning from the market, killing him, for unknown reasons. Reportedly, the SSPDF forces responded to the scene and engaged in an armed confrontation with the assailants.

Comment: Tensions continue to escalate in Tambura, and this incident has exacerbated the deplorable security situation.

Location of Incident: Lasu village, Lasu Payam, Yei River County
Description:
1.	On 12 September, multiple sources reported that on 16 August, NAS elements abducted eight civilians (four women and four children) in Lasu village, Lasu Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, the victims were abducted during a joint attack by NAS and SPLA-IO elements against the South Sudan People’s Defense Forces (SSPDF) in Lasu Payam on 16 August. Reportedly, two SSPDF soldiers were also abducted.

Comment: The abduction of civilians, including children especially during the conduct of hostilities, constitutes a breach of international humanitarian law and international human rights including the six grave violations of the rights of children. Reportedly, the international committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) has been informed and is currently tracking the abducted civilians to reunite them with their families.

Location of Incident: Toposa community during an attempted cattle raid in Kuron village, Kuron Boma, Kauto Payam, Kapoeta East County
Description: 2.	On 12 September, three secondary sources reported that on 27 August, Murle armed elements from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) shot and killed one 22-year-old male civilian (a cattle herder) from the Toposa community during an attempted cattle raid in Kuron village, Kuron Boma, Kauto Payam, Kapoeta East County. According to the sources, a group of six Murle armed elements stormed a cattle grazing land in  Kuron village and opened fire on the victim, killing him, reportedly to stop him from raising an alarm. Reportedly, the armed Toposa elements in the area pursued the attackers who fled back to GPAA without raiding any cattle.

Location of Incident: Gap village, Nyal Payam, Panyijar County
Description:
3.	On 12 September, multiple sources reported that on 11 September, armed Nyuong Nuer elements shot and killed one 25-year-old male civilian in Gap village, Nyal Payam, Panyijar County. According to the sources, a group of 10 armed Nyuong Nuer elements attacked and opened fire on the victim while he was traveling with another civilian from Katieth village to Gap village in Nyal Payam. The attack was reportedly a revenge action for alleged adultery involving the victim’s brother-in-law with the wife of one of the armed elements in 2024.

Comment: Observably, Revenge attacks are prevalent in many areas of Unity State, particularly in Panyijiar County, attributable to lack of accountability, proliferation of small arms as well as an absent rule of law.

Location of Incident: suspected SPLA-IO elements
Description: 4.	On 12 September, multiple sources reported that on the same day, suspected SPLA-IO elements abducted two male civilians (21 and 23 years old) from the Baka community in Mudubai Payam, Maridi County. According to the sources, the SPLA-IO elements stormed Mudubai Payam, looting valuables from civilian homesteads and while leaving the scene, they abducted the victims for unknown reasons. Reportedly, SSPDF soldiers stationed in the area responded to the scene, forcing the SPLA-IO elements to retreat towards Afa village.

Location of Incident: Kuku community in Rojo village, Rodo Boma, Nyepo Payam, Kajo-Keji County
Description: 1.	On 15 September, three secondary sources reported that on 12 September, one SSPDF soldier shot and killed a male civilian from the Kuku community in Rojo village, Rodo Boma, Nyepo Payam, Kajo-Keji County. According to the sources, the victim was traveling with another civilian (commercial motorcycle rider) on a motorcycle from Juba to Kajo-Keji, when they stopped after the Kaya bridge due to mechanical issues. Reportedly, the victim proceeded on foot and was later offered a lift by a vehicle driver transporting food items and three SSPDF soldiers from Kajo-Keji back towards Juba; however, when he declined the offer and attempted to flee, one of the soldiers opened fire injuring him. The victim was subsequently taken to a health care facility in Kajo-Keji Town where he succumbed to the on 15 September. The SSPDF soldier was later arrested and detained at the SSPDF facility in Kajo-Keji.

Location of Incident: in Tomping, Juba City
Description: 2.	On 15 September, three secondary sources reported that on 11 September, one SSPDF soldier (attached to personal security of an officer of the SSPDF) attacked and killed one male civilian (an employee at the University of Juba) in Tomping, Juba City. According to the sources, the SSPDF soldier attacked the victim while he was returning to his home in Tomping from and struck his head with a gun butt, injuring him, for unknown reasons. The victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Juba for medical treatment where he succumbed to the injuries on 12 September. The incident was reported to the police for investigation.

Location of Incident: Pojulu community in Rome Village, Biri Boma, Mukaya Payam, Lainya County
Description: 3.	On 15 September, two secondary sources reported that on 9 September, suspected NAS elements abducted two male civilians (35 and 40 years old) from the Pojulu community in Rome Village, Biri Boma, Mukaya Payam, Lainya County. According to the sources, a group of suspected NAS elements attacked a homestead in Rome village, burnt it down, looted personal valuables, and abducted the victims to an unknown location. Reportedly, on 10 September, the 35-year-old victim escaped from the abductors and returned to Mukaya Payam; however, the other victim remains in captivity.

Location of Incident: in Kidepo Boma, Loriyok Payam, Budi County
Description: 4.	On 15 September, three secondary sources reported that on 13 September, armed Logir elements from Romula Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos County shot and killed one 27-year-old male civilian from the Didinga community during a cattle raid in Kidepo Boma, Loriyok Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, the armed Logir elements stormed Kidepo Boma and opened fire on victim who was grazing his cattle, killing him. The attackers also raided his 32 heads of cattle. The incident was reported at Ikotos police station and investigations are reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: in Walkou village, Awul Payam, Tonj North County
Description: 5.	On 15 September, multiple sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Jurbol elements from Rualbet Payam shot and injured one male civilian from the Dinka Atok community in Walkou village, Awul Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Jurbol elements attacked and opened fire on a group of Dinka Atok herders who were grazing their cattle and goats in Walkou village, injuring one. The attacker also raided 16 goats and fled back to Rualbet Payam. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Warrap Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: in Walkou village, Awul Payam, Tonj North County
Description: 5.	On 15 September, multiple sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Jurbol elements from Rualbet Payam shot and injured one male civilian from the Dinka Atok community in Walkou village, Awul Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, armed Dinka Jurbol elements attacked and opened fire on a group of Dinka Atok herders who were grazing their cattle and goats in Walkou village, injuring one. The attacker also raided 16 goats and fled back to Rualbet Payam. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Warrap Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Azande community  in Gangara Emilia North residential area, Yambio town, Yambio County
Description: On 15 September, multiple secondary sources reported that on 13 September, unidentified armed elements shot and injured one male civilian from the Azande community  in Gangara Emilia North residential area, Yambio town, Yambio County. According to the sources, a group of four armed elements attacked the victim in his, demanding valuables and money. Reportedly, in an ensuing confrontation, the assailants opened fire on the victim, injuring him. The SSPDF reportedly responded to the gunshot and evacuated the victim to a health care facility in Yambio Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: the Azande community in the Napere residential area, Yambio town, Yambio County
Description: 7.	On 15 September, multiple secondary sources reported that on 11 September, the NSS arbitrarily arrested and detained one male civilian from the Azande community in the Napere residential area, Yambio town, Yambio County. According to the sources, the NSS personnel accused the victim of illegal possession of firearms, which the victim denied and requested that the NSS to search his home; however, the NSS personnel proceeded to arrest and detain him without searching his home. The victim remains in detention with limited access to his family and insufficient food, under deplorable conditions, which have allegedly led to health complications.

Location of Incident: Kakwa community in Kegulu village, Wutogo Payam, Yei River County
Description:
1.	On 16 September, two secondary sources reported that on 11 September, an unidentified armed element raped three female civilians (aged 20, 20 and 23 years) from the Kakwa community in Kegulu village, Wutogo Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, the unidentified armed element accosted the victims as they were returning home from the Lutaya market, raped them at gunpoint and seized their valuables and an unspecified sum of money. The incident was reported to the police in the area; however, no action was taken due to their inability to identify the perpetrator.  On 12 September, the survivors received medical care at a health care facility in Yei Town. 

Comment: This incident highlights the vulnerability of civilians especially women and girls in the Greater Yei area, following the operations/ activities of armed elements targeting civilians.

Location of Incident: Kakwa community in Kegulu village, Wutogo Payam, Yei River County
Description:
1.	On 16 September, two secondary sources reported that on 11 September, an unidentified armed element raped three female civilians (aged 20, 20 and 23 years) from the Kakwa community in Kegulu village, Wutogo Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, the unidentified armed element accosted the victims as they were returning home from the Lutaya market, raped them at gunpoint and seized their valuables and an unspecified sum of money. The incident was reported to the police in the area; however, no action was taken due to their inability to identify the perpetrator.  On 12 September, the survivors received medical care at a health care facility in Yei Town. 

Comment: This incident highlights the vulnerability of civilians especially women and girls in the Greater Yei area, following the operations/ activities of armed elements targeting civilians.

Location of Incident: Lotuko in Khor-Lakabata, Lohilang Boma, Kudo Payam-Torit County
Description: 2.	On 16 September, three secondary sources reported that on 14 September, Murle armed elements from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) shot and killed one 28-year-old male civilian from the Lotuko in Khor-Lakabata, Lohilang Boma, Kudo Payam-Torit County. According to the sources, a group of 10 Murle armed elements attacked and opened fire on two civilians from the Lotuko community as they were travelling on a motorcycle from Lofrika Boma, Kudo Payam to the Torit market in Torit Town to sell their goat, killing one, while the other escaped unharmed. The incident was reported at the Kudo Police station, and investigation is reportedly underway.

Location of Incident: Didinga community in Ngauro Payam, Budi County
Description: 3.	On 16 September, three secondary sources reported that on 7 September, armed Toposa elements from Namorunyang Payam, Kapoeta South County shot and killed one 17-year-old boy from the Didinga community in Ngauro Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, a group of three armed Toposa elements attacked and opened fire on the victim in his homestead revenge for the killing of two Toposa civilians (17-year-old boy and 25-year-old woman) by armed Didinga elements in Namorunyang Boma, Namorunyang Payam, Kapoeta South County on 27 June 2025 [see HRD Daily Report 30 July 2025]. The incident was reported at Ngauro Police Station and investigation is reportedly ongoing; however, no suspects have been apprehended.

Location of Incident: Dinka Panrup community in Matangai Payam
Description: 4.	On 15 and 16 September, two secondary sources reported that four male civilians from the Dinka Panrup where shot and killed during violence between the armed Dinka Panrup and allied Pandiang-boor, Panaweer and Pagot sub-clans, all from the Niel-Niel clan of Dinka Agaar community, in Matangai Payam, Rumbek Center County. According to the sources, a group of armed allied Pandiang-boor, Panaweer and Pagot elements attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Panrup community in Matangai Payam, killing four and  injuring several others (unspecified number). The motive for the attack remained unknown. for unspecified reasons, shot and killed four male Dinka Panrup civilians and of civilians. Reportedly, 12 of the attackers were killed in the ensuing confrontation between the attackers and armed Dinka Panrup elements.

Location of Incident: Dinka Panrup community in Matangai Payam
Description: 4.	On 15 and 16 September, two secondary sources reported that four male civilians from the Dinka Panrup where shot and killed during violence between the armed Dinka Panrup and allied Pandiang-boor, Panaweer and Pagot sub-clans, all from the Niel-Niel clan of Dinka Agaar community, in Matangai Payam, Rumbek Center County. According to the sources, a group of armed allied Pandiang-boor, Panaweer and Pagot elements attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Panrup community in Matangai Payam, killing four and  injuring several others (unspecified number). The motive for the attack remained unknown. for unspecified reasons, shot and killed four male Dinka Panrup civilians and of civilians. Reportedly, 12 of the attackers were killed in the ensuing confrontation between the attackers and armed Dinka Panrup elements.

Location of Incident: in the Chinakuet checkpoint area, Adior Payam, Yirol East County
Description:
5.	On 16 September, two secondary sources reported that on 13 September, armed Dinka Ciec elements shot and killed one male civilian from the Nyuong community and abducted three other civilians (two females including a minor and another male) in the Chinakuet checkpoint area, Adior Payam, Yirol East County. According to the sources, on 12 September a boat ferrying 31 Nyuong Nuer civilians (29 males and two females) and 40 heads of cattle enroute from Thanom Payam, Panyijar County to Juba through Yirol East County was attacked by armed Dinka Ciec youths on two speed boat on 13 September. One of the passengers was killed, three others were abducted, while the others jumped into the river to escape form the attackers. The boat driver was reportedly forced to take the other victims and the cattle to Golyar checkpoint in Adior Payam, where he offloaded the 40 cattle and the assailants released the victims, the boat driver and the boat.

Comment: The SSPDF riverine forces responded to the scene and rescued other passengers, some of whom were students heading to Juba for school. The remaining passengers were rescued by other boats, some of whom including the boat driver, steered towards Bor town in Jonglei State for their safety.

Location of Incident: in the Chinakuet checkpoint area, Adior Payam, Yirol East County
Description:
5.	On 16 September, two secondary sources reported that on 13 September, armed Dinka Ciec elements shot and killed one male civilian from the Nyuong community and abducted three other civilians (two females including a minor and another male) in the Chinakuet checkpoint area, Adior Payam, Yirol East County. According to the sources, on 12 September a boat ferrying 31 Nyuong Nuer civilians (29 males and two females) and 40 heads of cattle enroute from Thanom Payam, Panyijar County to Juba through Yirol East County was attacked by armed Dinka Ciec youths on two speed boat on 13 September. One of the passengers was killed, three others were abducted, while the others jumped into the river to escape form the attackers. The boat driver was reportedly forced to take the other victims and the cattle to Golyar checkpoint in Adior Payam, where he offloaded the 40 cattle and the assailants released the victims, the boat driver and the boat.

Comment: The SSPDF riverine forces responded to the scene and rescued other passengers, some of whom were students heading to Juba for school. The remaining passengers were rescued by other boats, some of whom including the boat driver, steered towards Bor town in Jonglei State for their safety.

Location of Incident: in the Chinakuet checkpoint area, Adior Payam, Yirol East County
Description:
5.	On 16 September, two secondary sources reported that on 13 September, armed Dinka Ciec elements shot and killed one male civilian from the Nyuong community and abducted three other civilians (two females including a minor and another male) in the Chinakuet checkpoint area, Adior Payam, Yirol East County. According to the sources, on 12 September a boat ferrying 31 Nyuong Nuer civilians (29 males and two females) and 40 heads of cattle enroute from Thanom Payam, Panyijar County to Juba through Yirol East County was attacked by armed Dinka Ciec youths on two speed boat on 13 September. One of the passengers was killed, three others were abducted, while the others jumped into the river to escape form the attackers. The boat driver was reportedly forced to take the other victims and the cattle to Golyar checkpoint in Adior Payam, where he offloaded the 40 cattle and the assailants released the victims, the boat driver and the boat.

Comment: The SSPDF riverine forces responded to the scene and rescued other passengers, some of whom were students heading to Juba for school. The remaining passengers were rescued by other boats, some of whom including the boat driver, steered towards Bor town in Jonglei State for their safety.

Location of Incident: Adjountok Payam, Jamjang County, Ruweng Administrative Area
Description: 6.	Between 14 and 16 September, multiple secondary sources reported that on 9 September, unidentified armed elements attacked, beat and killed one male civilian and injured one female civilian in Adjountok Payam, Jamjang County, Ruweng Administrative Area. According to the sources, the assailants attacked three civilians while they were returning from their farms, beat and killed the male victim and injured the female victim while the other female victim escaped unscathed. Reportedly, the injured victim was taken to a health care facility in Pariang Payam for medical treatment. The incident was reported to the police in Adjountok for investigations. The motive for the attack remained unknown.

Location of Incident: Adjountok Payam, Jamjang County, Ruweng Administrative Area
Description: 6.	Between 14 and 16 September, multiple secondary sources reported that on 9 September, unidentified armed elements attacked, beat and killed one male civilian and injured one female civilian in Adjountok Payam, Jamjang County, Ruweng Administrative Area. According to the sources, the assailants attacked three civilians while they were returning from their farms, beat and killed the male victim and injured the female victim while the other female victim escaped unscathed. Reportedly, the injured victim was taken to a health care facility in Pariang Payam for medical treatment. The incident was reported to the police in Adjountok for investigations. The motive for the attack remained unknown.

Location of Incident: Ombaci Boma, Otogo Payam, Yei River County
Description: 2.	On 17 September, three secondary sources reported that on 14 September, the SSPDF shot and injured two girls (12 and 14 years old) and arbitrarily arrested and detained one male civilian (a religious leader) in Ombaci Boma, Otogo Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, the SSPDF soldiers who were conducting routine patrols in the area opened fire on a homestead they suspected of harboring armed elements, injuring the two girls. Reportedly, the soldiers also arbitrarily arrested and detained the male victim when he attempted to rescue the injured victims. On 16 September, the injured victims were taken to a health care facility in Yei Town for medical treatment. It remains uncertain if the man was released.

Location of Incident: Ombaci Boma, Otogo Payam, Yei River County
Description: 2.	On 17 September, three secondary sources reported that on 14 September, the SSPDF shot and injured two girls (12 and 14 years old) and arbitrarily arrested and detained one male civilian (a religious leader) in Ombaci Boma, Otogo Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, the SSPDF soldiers who were conducting routine patrols in the area opened fire on a homestead they suspected of harboring armed elements, injuring the two girls. Reportedly, the soldiers also arbitrarily arrested and detained the male victim when he attempted to rescue the injured victims. On 16 September, the injured victims were taken to a health care facility in Yei Town for medical treatment. It remains uncertain if the man was released.

Location of Incident: Niikush Boma, Lotukei Payam, Budi County
Description: 3.	On 17 September, three secondary sources reported that on 15 September, armed Toposa elements from Natinga Boma, Narus Payam, Kapoeta East County shot and killed one 23-year-old male civilian and injured another 21-year-old male civilian, both from the Didinga community, during an attempted cattle raid in Niikush Boma, Lotukei Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, the armed Toposa elements stormed Niikush Boma and opened fire on two cattle herders as they were grazing their cattle in the area, killing one and injuring another. Reportedly, the armed Didinga elements pursued the attackers who fled without seizing any cattle. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Lotukei Town for medical treatment. The incident was reported at Chukudum Police Station and investigations are reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: Niikush Boma, Lotukei Payam, Budi County
Description: 3.	On 17 September, three secondary sources reported that on 15 September, armed Toposa elements from Natinga Boma, Narus Payam, Kapoeta East County shot and killed one 23-year-old male civilian and injured another 21-year-old male civilian, both from the Didinga community, during an attempted cattle raid in Niikush Boma, Lotukei Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, the armed Toposa elements stormed Niikush Boma and opened fire on two cattle herders as they were grazing their cattle in the area, killing one and injuring another. Reportedly, the armed Didinga elements pursued the attackers who fled without seizing any cattle. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Lotukei Town for medical treatment. The incident was reported at Chukudum Police Station and investigations are reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: Malou village, Citcok Payam, Cueibet County
Description:
4.	On 17 September, multiple secondary sources reported that on 15 September, five male civilians from the Dinka Panyar were shot and killed and eight others were injured during violence between armed Panyar elements and allied armed Rutrot, Waat, and Pagok elements (all under Dinka Gok section) in Malou village, Citcok Payam, Cueibet County. According to the sources, a group of Panyar youths from Tiap-Tiap Payam who were returning to their area through Citcok Payam from a dowry payment fired some shots in the air, which provoked the Rutrot youths, who together with armed Waat and Pagok elements mobilized and ambushed the Panyar youths in Malou village. In the ensuing confrontation, five male Panyar civilians were shot and killed and eight others were injured. Two armed Rutrot elements were also reportedly shot and killed and five others were injured including two from the Waat clan.

Comment: This attack on the Panyar youths was allegedly linked to a violent history between the Panyar clan and the Waat together with the allied Rutrot and Pagor clans in Cueibet County

Location of Incident: Malou village, Citcok Payam, Cueibet County
Description:

Location of Incident: the Dinka Twic Mayardit community in Abayok village, Turalei Payam, Twic County
Description: 5.	On 17 September, three primary sources reported that on 16 September, armed Nuer elements from Unity State shot and injure two male civilians from the Dinka Twic Mayardit community in Abayok village, Turalei Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, the armed Nuer elements attacked and opened fire on a group of Dinka Twic Mayardit herders while they were grazing and preparing to milk their cattle in Abayok village, injuring two. The attackers also raided 12 heads of cattle and fled back into Unity State. The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Turalei Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: the Dinka Twic Mayardit community in Abayok village, Turalei Payam, Twic County
Description: 5.	On 17 September, three primary sources reported that on 16 September, armed Nuer elements from Unity State shot and injure two male civilians from the Dinka Twic Mayardit community in Abayok village, Turalei Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, the armed Nuer elements attacked and opened fire on a group of Dinka Twic Mayardit herders while they were grazing and preparing to milk their cattle in Abayok village, injuring two. The attackers also raided 12 heads of cattle and fled back into Unity State. The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Turalei Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: the Dinka community in Wau municipality, Wau County.
Description:
6.	On 17 September, one primary source and one secondary source reported that on 20 April, one SSPDF soldier abducted and raped a 13-year-old girl from the Dinka community in Wau municipality, Wau County. According to the sources, the soldier abducted the survivor and took her to his home and raped her, before being released later the same day. Reportedly, under false pretense to pay dowry to the family of the survivor, the soldier took the victim to his village for four months and on 16 September, the victim’s family filed a complaint at the Wau Town Police Station against the SSPDF soldier for failure to pay the dowry. An arrest warrant was issued against the soldier, and a letter was sent by the police to the SSPDF commander to hand over the suspect for investigation. 

Comment: HRD will continue to monitor the case for accountability of the perpetrator.

Location of Incident: Afa village, Mambe Payam, Maridi County.
Description: 7.	On 17 September, multiple secondary sources reported that on 16 September, suspected SPLA-IO elements attacked and injured two male civilians in Afa village, Mambe Payam, Maridi County. According to the sources, the suspected SPLA-IO elements attacked four civilian civilians (commercial motorcyclists) along the Maridi-Juba-Road, looted their valuables and beat them up, injuring them. Reportedly, the SSPDF intervened and evacuated the injured victims to a health care facility in Maridi Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Afa village, Mambe Payam, Maridi County.
Description: 7.	On 17 September, multiple secondary sources reported that on 16 September, suspected SPLA-IO elements attacked and injured two male civilians in Afa village, Mambe Payam, Maridi County. According to the sources, the suspected SPLA-IO elements attacked four civilian civilians (commercial motorcyclists) along the Maridi-Juba-Road, looted their valuables and beat them up, injuring them. Reportedly, the SSPDF intervened and evacuated the injured victims to a health care facility in Maridi Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Kakwa community in Payume Payam, Morobo County
Description: 1.	On 18 September, two secondary sources reported that on 13 September, an unidentified armed element raped one 21-year-old woman from the Kakwa community in Payume Payam, Morobo County. According to the sources, the unidentified armed element accosted the victim at gunpoint while she had gone to her farm and raped her. The survivor reported the incident to her husband who further beat her up for failure to identify the perpetrator. The survivor subsequently received medical care and psychosocial support at a health care facility in Yei Town.

Location of Incident: Didinga community in Ngauro Boma, Ngauro Payam, Budi County
Description: 2.	On 18 September, three secondary sources reported that on 16 September, armed Toposa elements from Namorunyang Payam, Kapoeta South County shot and killed a one-year-old boy and injured his 32-year-old father from the Didinga community in Ngauro Boma, Ngauro Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, two armed Toposa elements stormed Ngauro Boma and opened fire on a homestead, killing the minor and injuring his father. The attack was reportedly a retaliation for the killing of two Toposa civilians (17-year-old boy and 25-year-old woman) by armed Didinga elements from Kilanya Boma, Ngauro Payam in Namorunyang Payam on 27 June 2025 [see HRD Daily Report 30 June 2025]. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Ngauro Payam for medical treatment. The incident was reported at the Ngauro Police Station and investigations are reportedly underway.

Location of Incident: Didinga community in Ngauro Boma, Ngauro Payam, Budi County
Description: 2.	On 18 September, three secondary sources reported that on 16 September, armed Toposa elements from Namorunyang Payam, Kapoeta South County shot and killed a one-year-old boy and injured his 32-year-old father from the Didinga community in Ngauro Boma, Ngauro Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, two armed Toposa elements stormed Ngauro Boma and opened fire on a homestead, killing the minor and injuring his father. The attack was reportedly a retaliation for the killing of two Toposa civilians (17-year-old boy and 25-year-old woman) by armed Didinga elements from Kilanya Boma, Ngauro Payam in Namorunyang Payam on 27 June 2025 [see HRD Daily Report 30 June 2025]. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Ngauro Payam for medical treatment. The incident was reported at the Ngauro Police Station and investigations are reportedly underway.

Location of Incident: Malual-Ador village, Pathuon East Payam, Gogrial East County
Description: 3.	On 18 September, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, armed Nuer elements from Unity State shot and injured one male civilian from the Dinka Apuk during a cattle raid in Malual-Ador village, Pathuon East Payam, Gogrial East County. According to the sources, the armed Nuer elements attacked and opened fire on a group of Dinka Apuk herders who were grazing their cattle in Malual-Ador village, injuring one. The attackers also 15 heads of cattle, seven of which were recovered  by armed Dinka Apuk elements as they pursued the armed Nur elements. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Pathuon West Payam for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Malual-Ador village, Pathuon East Payam, Gogrial East County
Description: 3. According to the sources, the armed Nuer elements attacked and opened fire on a group of Dinka Apuk herders who were grazing their cattle in Malual-Ador village, injuring one. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Pathuon West Payam for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Dinka community in Maluil area, Marial Bai Payam, Jur River County
Description:
4.	On 18 September, one primary and one secondary source reported that on 14 September, one SSPDF soldier raped a 17-year-old girl from the Dinka community in Maluil area, Marial Bai Payam, Jur River County. According to the sources, following a family dispute, the victim was left alone as other family members fled for their safety, and the suspect offered to accompany the victim to her grandmother’s house; however, while on the way, the soldier took the victim into a bushy path where he raped her at gunpoint and thereafter abandoned the survivor along the road. The survivor returned and reported the incident to her grandmother. The incident was reported to the police, who on 15 September in coordination with the SSPDF apprehended and detained the suspect. 

Comment: HRD will monitor the case for accountability of the perpetrator.

Location of Incident: Banzua village, Tambura Town Payam, Tambura County
Description: 5.	On 18 September, multiple secondary sources reported that on 15 September, suspected SPLA-IO elements abducted one 23-year-old woman in Banzua village, Tambura Town Payam, Tambura County. According to the sources, the suspected SPLA-IO elements accosted the victim and another male civilian (internally displaced persons) while they had gone to their home in Banzua village to harvest food and abducted the woman while the man escaped and reported the incident to Tambura Police Station.

Location of Incident: Murle community in Boma Payam, Jebel Boma County, Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA)
Description: 1.	On 18 and 19 September, multiple sources reported that on 15 September, armed Toposa elements from Eastern Equatoria State abducted one 25-year-old male civilian (a trader) from the Murle community in Boma Payam, Jebel Boma County, Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA). According to the sources, the armed Toposa elements ambushed the victim as he was travelling with food supplies from Boma to Nyalagor and subsequently abducted him. The local youth reportedly pursued the abductors; however, were unable to recover the abductee.  The whereabouts of the victim remain unknown.

Location of Incident: Malual-Ador village, Pathuon East Payam, Gogrial East County
Description: 3.	On 21 September, three primary sources reported that on 20 September, armed Nuer elements from Unity State shot and killed five civilians (four men and one woman) and injured three male civilians, all from the Dinka Apuk community, during a cattle raid in Malual-Ador village, Pathuon East Payam, Gogrial East County. As recounted by the sources, the armed Nuer attacked and opened fire on a homestead that had a large herd of cattle and goats in a kraal, killing five of the residents and injuring three others. The attackers also seized six heads of cattle and  25 goats, and thereafter fled back into Unity State. The injured victims were reportedly evacuated to a health care facility in Lietnhom, Pathuon West Payam for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Malual-Ador village, Pathuon East Payam, Gogrial East County
Description: 3.	On 21 September, three primary sources reported that on 20 September, armed Nuer elements from Unity State shot and killed five civilians (four men and one woman) and injured three male civilians, all from the Dinka Apuk community, during a cattle raid in Malual-Ador village, Pathuon East Payam, Gogrial East County. The injured victims were reportedly evacuated to a health care facility in Lietnhom, Pathuon West Payam for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Wunleng village, Ajak Kuac Payam, Twic County
Description:
4.	On 21 September, multiple sources reported that on 19 September, armed Nuer elements from Unity state shot and killed one male civilian and injured another from the Dinka Twic Mayardit community in Wunleng village, Ajak Kuac Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, the armed Nuer elements attacked and opened fire on the victims as they were transporting merchandise between Ajak Kuac Payam and Abiemnhom, Ruweng Administrative Area (RAA). The injured victim was reportedly evacuated to a hospital in Turalei Payam for medical treatment.

Comment: The attack was reportedly a revenge action for past violence and unresolved grievances between the two communities.

Location of Incident: Wunleng village, Ajak Kuac Payam, Twic County
Description:
4.
