Location of Incident: Buoi village of Malek Payam under Rumbek Centre
Description:
Police in Rumbek town arrested a 16-year-old boy for raping an 8-year-old girl in Buoi village in Malek Payam of Rumbek Centre County 

On 17 September 2025, HRD visited the One Stop Centre in Rumbek State Hospital to follow up on the case of 8-year-old girl who was reportedly raped on 11 September 2025 in Buoi village of Malek Payam under Rumbek Centre County. The initial information gathered from a secondary source (NGO partner) in Rumbek on 15 September 2025, suggested that the survivor had been brought for treatment at the One Stop Centre in Rumbek town on 12 September 2025 and that the suspect was still at large, despite Police actively searching for him. 

During a follow up visit to the One Stop Centre, the service provider confirmed the incident and the subsequent referral and admission of the 8-year-old girl (name on file) at the hospital on 12 September 2025. The source indicated that, based on information provided by the victim’s mother, the 16-year-old alleged perpetrator (name on file) is the cousin of the victim. On the morning of 11 September 2025, as the parents of the girl were away from the house, the 16-year-old boy entered the house and raped the girl. The alleged perpetrator was arrested on 15 September 2025 and placed in custody at the Rumbek Central Police Station. HRD visited the Police Station where the team spoke to the Crime Officer to verify the arrest and detention of the boy. Police confirmed that the investigation into the case is currently ongoing. 

Comments: Although HRD gathered that the case was set to be taken to court on 17 September 2025, the alleged perpetrator informed HRD that there is delay in sending the case to court as the parties involved have allegedly been asked to pay a fee for the case to proceed to court. In criminal cases however, parties involved, including the victim, are not supposed to be charged for their case to be transferred to court. The family is reportedly gathering the required money for transfer.

Location of Incident: Lomuku I, Yei Town Payam, Yei River
Description:
•	Rape of 15-year-old female by an 18-year-old civilian male in Lomuku I, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County

On 23 September 2025, HRD Yei Field Office received and documented information from two reliable secondary sources including a medical officer and a community worker regarding the rape of a 15-year-old female, resident at Lomuku I and of the Pojulu tribe by an 18-year-old civilian male of Kakwa tribe in June 2025 in Lomuku I, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County.

According to sources, the 15-year-old (details on file) was invited by the perpetrator (details on file) to his residence within the same neighborhood in June 2025 (exact date not given). During the moment spent together, the perpetrator raped the survivor multiple times, and it resulted in pregnancy. The parents of the survivor discovered symptoms of pregnancy and after interrogation, the victim revealed information about the incident. The case was reported at the Yei Police Headquarters by survivor’s father (details on file) on 16 September 2025 and the survivor was referred to a health facility on same day where she was found to be pregnant. The perpetrator was arrested for further investigation and prosecution.

Comments: in South Sudan, both the Child Act and the Penal Code condemn rape. Article 45(b) of the 2010 Child Act and Section 247(2) of the Penal Code Act of 2008 explicitly prohibits rape, especially involving minors.  Further rape of a minor is prohibited and contravenes the Convention on Rights of Children (CRC) and other international human rights law including the Universal Declaration of Human Rights (UDHR).

Location of Incident: rumbek town, rumbek cetre
Description:
A 15-year-old escaped an attempted forced marriage in Rumbek town of Rumbek Centre County 

On 22 September 2025, HRD received information regarding a case of attempted forced marriage in Rumbek town of Rumbek Centre County. HRD confirmed the report with the Special Protection Unit (SPU) of the Rumbek Central Police Station. According to the SPU, on the morning of 22 September 2025, a Police Officer from the station reported that his 15-year-old niece was at risk of being removed from school by her father who intended to marry her off (names on file). The Police Officer, who is the brother of the girl’s father, opposed the marriage and advocated for the girl to remain in school. He requested the intervention of the SPU to protect the girl. 

The SPU informed the Ministry of Gender, Child, and Social Welfare of the case and summoned the girl’s family to the Police Station. Two of her uncles reported themselves two the SPU office, namely the Police Officer and a maternal uncle, both of whom opposed the marriage. The girl’s father did not appear and instead went into hiding, allegedly fearing police involvement. At the SPU office, the girl and her two uncles met with the County Court Judge, who heard the case and subsequently ordered for the girl to be placed in the care of her uncles. The SPU is responsible for following up with the family to ensure that the Judge’s order is implemented and that the girl is protected.

Comment: HRD will follow up with the SPU on the protection of the girl.

Location of Incident: rumbek town, rumbek cetre
Description:
HRD attended a Rumbek town Bench Court hearing handling a case of early and forced marriage involving a 15-year-old schoolgirl 

On 24 September 2025, HRD joined the other members of local Protection cluster (including the State Ministry of Gender, Child and Social Welfare, the Civil Society Organization Network -CiSON and the Women Association activists as well as the Lakes State Catholic Diocese representatives) to the Bench Court (a traditional jurisdiction called Makunon), to attend and monitor the proceedings relating to a case of early and forced marriage involving a 15-year-old girl (name on file). The case opposed the said girl to her paternal uncles who reportedly withdrew her from the Comboni Primary School she attended in Rumbek town, to marry her off to a man of their choice.

During the Court hearing, HRD gathered that while on school holidays, the 15-year-old girl was collected from her maternal uncle home in Rumbek town (where she resides) on 9 September and taken to the house of the man chosen by her paternal uncles for the purpose of marriage. The girl subsequently escaped from this location, to report herself to the school and then to the office of the State Ministry of Gender, Child and Social Welfare and the Police station in Rumbek town, on 22 September. HRD further learned that the State Ministry of Education later on, engaged the relatives of the girl on the issue and the latter consented to stop the marriage plan and write-committed to allow the girl continuing with her education. However, not being satisfied with this development, the marriage suitor man who had already paid his dowry, filed a case against the girl’s family representatives putting them under pressure and forcing them to revoke their written commitment.

The Bench Court, after thoroughly examining the case, reiterated the submission of the State Ministry of Education backed by the provisions of the Lake State Customary and Public Order Law Act 2022, that protect young schoolgirls from early and forced marriages. The Bench Court, hence, granted immediate release to the girl and asked the family to return the cattle to the marriage suitor man. HRD also observed that during the hearing, the Bench Court made the girl’s family relatives verbally re-committing to protect and spare her from further early and forced marriage plans.

Comments: HRD likewise the other Protection cluster members who attended the hearing session were satisfied with this Bench Court ruling releasing the girl and reminding her family relatives of their obligation and duty of protecting her including through sparing her from early and forced marriage plans, as well as through allowing her to continue with her education.

Location of Incident: Juba
Description:
•	HRD JFO together with CPU provided support to a 17 years old victim of forced marriage seeking sanctuary. 
On 25 Sept 2025, HRD JFO received a 17-year-old victim of early and forced marriage seeking sanctuary who at the age of 15 was reportedly forced by her stepmother to marry a 40-year-old man against her will. The victim whose parents (Names on record) have since divorced was living with her stepmother (Name on record) at the protection of civilian’s camp in Juba where she went to school and successfully completed her primary leaving examinations and gain sponsorship from the daughters of Mary Immaculate (DMI) catholic sisters’ congregation in Juba. 
She narrated that after the death of her father in 2013, she continued to reside with her stepmother and her three daughters while attending school at the PoC 3 in Juba. However, she started to experience mistreatment from her to the extent that she once reproached the DMI sisters for offering her sponsorship after she excelled in the primary leaving certificate in 2018. According to her, life became so difficult especially after she objected to her proposal for marriage to a 40-year-old man. Reportedly, the stepmother became hostile and violent to her and burnt all her property including books. 
In 2022 her stepmother once more attempted to marry her off to a 4o years old man (Name on record) while leaving her daughter to continue with their education. However, she rejected and escaped to Malakal where she was located and brought back to Juba and handed over to her stepmother in 2023. Immediately after her return to Juba, she was subjected to all kinds of mistreatments and beatings to induce her to agree to the arranged marriage. Forcefully, her stepmother took her to the house of the 40 years old men and handed her over to him. While in his custody, the man allegedly raped her repeatedly until she conceived and bore her first female baby in November 2023 at the age of 15. 
In April 2025, she once again decided to escape away from the man and went to live in an abandoned house of the FVP at Hai Jaborona in Juba where an old woman advised her to seek sanctuary with any organization. She reported has been in the location for five months caring for herself and mother by selling water while hiding from the man who is in search her.
HRD together with CPU reviewed the case and reported the matter to the state Directorate of Child, Gender and Social Welfare which decided that the victim, together with her 2 years old baby girl, be handed over to a safe house in Juba. Hence, HRD JFO together with CPU facilitated her relocation to the safe house where she was warmly received by the social workers and offered a temporary place of accommodation.

Location of Incident: Ngauro Boma, Ngauro Payam, Budi County
Description: 1.	On 1 October, three secondary sources reported that on 30 September, Didinga armed elements shot and killed one 20-year-old male civilian and injured another 18-year-old male civilian, both from the Toposa community at the Lopour gold mining site in Ngauro Boma, Ngauro Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, a group of Didinga armed elements targeted the gold mining site and opened fire on two civilians, killing one and injuring another. The attack was reportedly a revenge action for the killing of a one-year-old Didinga boy and the injury of his 32-year-old father by Toposa armed elements on 16 September 2025 in Ngauro Payam [see HRD Daily Report 19 September 2025]. The injured victim was evacuated to a hospital in Kapoeta for medical treatment. The incident reported at both Ngauro and Kapoeta police stations and investigations are reportedly.

Location of Incident: Gawar Nuer community in Ayod Town, Ayod County
Description: 2.	On 1 October, multiple sources reported that on 30 September, suspected Lou Nuer armed elements shot and killed one male civilian (a cattle herder) from the Gawar Nuer community in Ayod Town, Ayod County. According to the sources, the suspected Lou Nuer armed elements attacked and opened fire on the victim while he was herding his cattle at the outskirts of Ayod Town, killing him, and thereafter fled the scene. Reportedly, the attack was a revenge in the context of ongoing retaliatory intercommunal violence between the Gawaar Nuer and Lou Nuer communities.

Location of Incident: in Mayom-Biong village, Pathuon West Payam, Gogrial East County
Description: 3.	On 1 October, three primary sources reported that on 30 September, Nuer armed elements from Unity State shot and injured one male civilian from the Dinka Apuk community during an attempted cattle raid in Mayom-Biong village, Pathuon West Payam, Gogrial East County. As recounted by the sources, the Nuer armed elements attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Apuk community at a cattle camp in Mayom-Biong village, injuring one of the residents. The attackers also seized approximately 30 heads of cattle and attempted to flee with them; however, armed Dinka Apuk youths pursued the attackers and in the ensuing confrontation, recovered all of the raided cattle. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Lietnhom for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: in Mayom-Biong village, Pathuon West Payam, Gogrial East County
Description: 3. Location of Incident: from the Azande community, in Yambio Town, Yambio County
Description:
4.	On 1 October, one secondary source reported that on 5 August, the SSPDF arbitrarily arrested and detained two male civilians, one from the Acholi community and the other from the Azande community, in Yambio Town, Yambio County. According to the source, SSPDF soldiers arrested the victims from their residences in the Napere area of Yambio Town and transferred them to the SSPDF barracks near Yambio Airstrip, where they remain in detention with no proper sanitation and leaking roofs causing health issues for the detainees. Reportedly, during the arrest, SSPDF personnel seized 7,000 United States Dollars (USD) and other valuables from the victims' homes. The source further informed that the victims were detained on accusations of facilitating the escape of another individual from a National Security Service detention facility in July 2025. However, the source noted that the detention might be politically motivated relative to the detainees’ association with a public figure.

Comment: Reportedly, efforts including a formal request to state authorities to secure the detainees' release or transfer to police custody and subsequent court proceedings have been unsuccessful.

Location of Incident: Kakwa community in Mugwo Payam, Yei River County
Description: 1.	On 2 October, two secondary sources reported that on 29 September, the SSPDF arbitrarily arrested and detained one 27-year-old male civilian from the Kakwa community in Mugwo Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, SSPDF soldiers who were on patrol in the area found the victim along the road and took him to their Mugwo barracks. The SSPDF soldiers reportedly accused him of belonging to rebels. He was released on 1 October after paying 100,000 South Sudan Pounds (SSP) without any charge.

Location of Incident: Buya community in Kirumu Boma, Ngarich Payam, Budi County
Description:
2.	On 2 October, three secondary sources reported that on 1 October, Didinga armed elements shot and killed two civilians (one 18-year-old man and a 22-year-old woman) from the Buya community in Kirumu Boma, Ngarich Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, a group of seven Didinga armed elements from Lobule Boma, Ngarich Payam stormed the gold mine in Kirumu Boma and opened fire on two Buya civilians while they were mining, killing them. The attack occurred in the context of ongoing dispute between the Didinga and Buya communities, wherein the Didinga community has long claimed ownership of the mining site and maintained that the Buya community should not engage in mining activities in the area. The incident was reported at Loriyok Police Station and investigation is reportedly ongoing.

Comment: The recurrence of violent incidents in mining areas in Budi County between several communities, mainly the Didinga, Buya and Toposa, highlights the volatile mix of resource competition, unresolved land claims, and inter-communal grievances. Civilians are increasingly exposed to armed violence in economic livelihood spaces.

Location of Incident: Pandit village, Wunrok Payam, Twic County
Description: 3.	On 2 October, three primary sources reported that on the same day, Nuer armed elements from Mayom County, Unity State shot and injured two male civilians from the Dinka Twic Mayardit community during a cattle raid in Pandit village, Wunrok Payam, Twic County. As recounted by the sources,  Nuer armed elements attacked and opened fire on a cattle camp in Pandit village, injuring two civilians. The attackers also forcibly seized 15 heads of cattle and fled back into Unity State. The injured victims were reportedly evacuated to a hospital in Turalei Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Pandit village, Wunrok Payam, Twic County
Description: 3. Location of Incident: Luo community in Kuanya Boma, Rocrocdong Payam, Jur River County
Description:
4.	On 1 October, multiple sources reported that on 29 September, the SSPDF arbitrarily arrested and detained three male civilians (18, 29, and 32 years old) from the Luo community in Kuanya Boma, Rocrocdong Payam, Jur River County. According to the sources, SSPDF soldiers arrested the victims from their houses following a confrontation with elements of the Sudan People’s Liberation Army – In Opposition (SPLA-IO) in the Agui-Tong area, Achot Boma, transferred and detained them to the SSPDF  Division 5 barracks in Grinti, Wau Town. Reportedly, the SSPDF soldiers accused the victims of being involved in the recent confrontation between the SSPDF and SPLA-IO elements.  

Comment: The ongoing military operation by the SSPDF against the SPLA-IO has  heightened risks to civilian safety, including exposure to arbitrary arrest and detention, harassment, intimidation and well as restriction of movement by civilians in the Achot area.

Location of Incident: Toposa community, during a cattle raid in Napetait Boma, Namorunyang Payam, Kapoeta South County
Description: 1.	On 3 October, three secondary sources reported that on 1 October, Didinga armed elements from Nagichod Payam, Budi County shot and killed one 27-year-old male civilian and injured a 20-year-old male civilian, both from the Toposa community, during a cattle raid in Napetait Boma, Namorunyang Payam, Kapoeta South County. According to the sources, a group of Didinga armed elements attacked Napetait Boma and opened fire on the vicitms who were herding cattle near a stream. The gunfire reportedly alerted the Toposa youths who repulsed the attackers, forcing them to flee without raiding any cattle. The injured victim was evacuated to a hospital in Kapoeta South for medical treatment. The case was reported at Kapoeta North Police Station; however, no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Toposa community, during a cattle raid in Napetait Boma, Namorunyang Payam, Kapoeta South County
Description: 1.	On 3 October, three secondary sources reported that on 1 October, Didinga armed elements from Nagichod Payam, Budi County shot and killed one 27-year-old male civilian and injured a 20-year-old male civilian, both from the Toposa community, during a cattle raid in Napetait Boma, Namorunyang Payam, Kapoeta South County. According to the sources, a group of Didinga armed elements attacked Napetait Boma and opened fire on the vicitms who were herding cattle near a stream. The gunfire reportedly alerted the Toposa youths who repulsed the attackers, forcing them to flee without raiding any cattle. The injured victim was evacuated to a hospital in Kapoeta South for medical treatment. The case was reported at Kapoeta North Police Station; however, no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: ferryboat between Bor Town, Jonglei and Shambek Port, Yirol East County
Description:
2.	On 2 October, multiples sources reported that on 27 September, Dinka Ciec armed elements from Yirol East County, Lakes State shot and killed one male civilian, injured seven others, and abducted seven others (four girls, one woman, and two elderly men) during an attack on ferryboat between Bor Town, Jonglei and Shambek Port, Yirol East County. As recounted by the sources, the Dinka Ciec armed elements from Nyang Payam, Yirol East County attacked the ferryboat carrying 78 civilians including two women and four girls along the River Nile near Shambek Port, killing one of the passengers, injured seven, and abducted seven others, while many other passengers reportedly jumped off the boat to escape the attack. The attackers reportedly confiscated the ferryboat and looted all the goods and personal belongings of the passengers and thereafter released the four girls and one woman; however, the whereabouts of the two elderly men and three other men remain unknown.

Comment: According to the sources, the passengers on the ferryboat were mostly traders and students mainly from the Nyuong Nuer community who had gone to Juba for various reasons and were returning to Panyijiar County.

Update: HRD followed up on the injuring of seven civilians and alleged perpetration of sexual violence on seven Nyoung Nuer females (five girls and two women) by Dinka Ciec armed elements near Shambek Port, Lakes State
On 07 and 8 October 2025, HRD followed up from two secondary sources (a county official and a humanitarian health service provider) on the 27 September 2025 boat attack which resulted in the killing of one civilian, injuring of seven others, and the abduction and alleged sexual violence on some Nyoung Nuer females by Dinka Ciec armed elements in a location between Bor town (Jonglei State) and Shambek Port, Yirol East (Lakes State) (see HRD Bentiu FO DSRs of 30 September and 3 October 2025). The incident occurred in the context of a cycle of retaliatory violence between armed Nyoung Nuer elements from Panyijiar County (Unity State) and armed Dinka elements from Lakes State.
On 7 October, the Panyijiar County Commissioner informed HRD that on 03 October 2025, at around 11pm, one woman and four girls, including two girls below the ages of ten, arrived Ganyliel Payam (Panyijiar County) from Shambek Port (Lakes State). On 8 October, a humanitarian service provider apprised that they received a total of seven females (five girls between the ages of 12 and 14 and two women between the ages of 19 and 20) who had been abducted on 27 September, subjected to sexual violence, including rape, by Dinka Ciec armed elements before being released on 1 October 2025. The two sources confirmed to HRD that on 04 October 2025, the victims (names on file) received post-rape care, including medical and psychosocial support at a humanitarian health facility in Ganyliel. They added that the victims were later released from the hospital and are currently staying with their families outside Ganyliel town. 
The CC further informed that among the seven people injured during the boat attack, two were transferred to Ganyliel for medical attention, two others taken to Bor town, and three others with more serious injuries had been airlifted to Juba by the ICRC for further medical treatment. 
Comments: It should be noted that, following the incident and the release of the victims, HRD had strongly recommended to the Panyijiar County Commissioner to refer the victims to humanitarian partners on the ground for urgent post-sexual violence care, including medical and psychosocial assistance. HRD will participate in a planned field mission to Panyijiar County HQ on 10 October 2025 and will gather more details on the incident.

Location of Incident: Dinka Leir community in Madiath village, Kirik Payam, Tonj North county
Description: 3.	On 5 October, three primary sources reported that on 4 October, five civilians were shot and killed (three from the Dinka Leir community and two from the Dinka Apuk-Patoc community) and four others were injured during violence between Dinka Apuk-Patoc and Dinka Leir armed elements in Kirik and Akop Payams, Tonj North County. As recounted by the sources, Dinka Apuk-Patoc armed elements attacked the Dinka Leir community in Madiath village, Kirik Payam, killing three male civilians and injuring two others (one woman and one man), allegedly to revenge the elopement of a girl from the Apuk-Patoc community by a Dinka Leir youth and refusal resolve the issue as per custom. In retaliation, armed Dinka Leir youths attacked and opened fire on Ainyet village in Akop Payam, killing two Dinka Apuk-Patoc male civilians and injuring two others. The injured victims from the Leir community were evacuated to  a health care facility in Kirik Payam for medical treatment, while those from the Dinka Apuk-Patoc community were reportedly receiving medical treatment at a health care facility in Akop Payam.

Description: 3. Location of Incident: Dinka Thiik community in Palieng Payam, Tonj East County
Description:
4.	On 5 October, three primary sources reported that on 4 October, one Dinka Luanyjang armed element shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Thiik community in Palieng Payam, Tonj East County. As recounted by the sources, the assailant attacked and opened fire on the victim (who is from Ngabagok Payam) in Palieng Town as he was paying a visit to his relatives in Palieng Payam, killing him, and fled the scene. The attack is viewed as a revenge action for past violence, cattle or girl related unresolved grievances. Reportedly, the local authorities and security forces subsequently mounted a search for the perpetrator, who was apprehended on 5 October and is being detained in Palieng Payam.

Comment: HRD will follow up with the authorities and advocate for due process for the perpetrators.

Location of Incident: in Buaiji Boma, Wito Payam, Mundri East County
Description: 5.	On 3 October, multiple sources reported that on 28 September, suspected SPLA-IO elements abducted two male civilians (one foreign national and one South Sudanese) in Buaiji Boma, Wito Payam, Mundri East County. According to the sources, the suspected SPLA-IO elements ambushed a private vehicle enroute from Maridi to Juba on the outskirts of Buaiji Boma, and  abducted the victims. Reportedly, the foreign national was reportedly released on 2 October following negotiations with local authorities, while the South Sudanese national remains in captivity at an undisclosed location.

Location of Incident: Ombaci Boma, Otogo Payam, Yei River County
Description: 1.	On 6 October, two secondary sources reported that on 20 September, the SSPDF arbitrarily arrested and detained two male civilians (32 and 82 years old) from the Kakwa community in Ombaci Boma, Otogo Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, SSPDF soldiers arrested the two men during an operation against elements of the National Salvation Front (NAS) on accusations of being NAS elements and transferred them to the SSPDF barracks in Morsak within Otogo Payam. The victims were reportedly released on 2 October; however, the 32-year-old man was rearrested later on the same day and remains in detention.

Location of Incident: Lobira Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos County
Description: 2.	On 6 October, three secondary sources reported that on 24 September, suspected Buya armed elements from Loriyok Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County shot and killed two male civilians (20 and 19 years old) from the Lotuko community in Lobira Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos County. According to the sources, a group of Buya armed elements attacked and opened fire on the victims near Lobira grazing land while they were traveling on two motorcycles carrying business items for sale at the Lobira business center, killing the 20-year-old man and injuring the 19-year-old victim – reportedly to prevent the victims from alerting Lobira youth of the attackers’ presence in the area. The injured victim was taken to a hospital in Torit for medical treatment, where he succumbed to his injuries three days later. The incident was reported to the police in Chahari Payam for investigation; however, no arrests have been made so far.

Location of Incident: Poktap Town, Duk County
Description:
3.	On 6 October, multiple sources reported that on 4 October, three male civilians were shot and injured during cattle-related violence between Dinka armed elements from Duk Padiet and armed Dinka youths from Twic County in Poktap Town, Duk County. According to the sources, Dinka armed elements from the Hol sub-clan in Duk Padiet attacked a group cattle herders from Twic East County in Poktap, and raided approximately 300 heads of cattle. The armed youth from Twic East County reportedly pursued the attackers and in the ensuing confrontation, three male civilians were injured (from Twic East County and one from Duk County). The sources further informed that the attackers also looted several shops in Poktap.

Comment: Reportedly, the cattle herders had temporally moved their livestock to Poktap in search of pasture following the recent flooding in Twic East County. The incident has reportedly heightened tensions between the two neighboring counties.

Location of Incident: Poktap Town, Duk County
Description:
3.	On 6 October, multiple sources reported that on 4 October, three male civilians were shot and injured during cattle-related violence between Dinka armed elements from Duk Padiet and armed Dinka youths from Twic County in Poktap Town, Duk County. The sources further informed that the attackers also looted several shops in Poktap.

Comment: Reportedly, the cattle herders had temporally moved their livestock to Poktap in search of pasture following the recent flooding in Twic East County. The incident has reportedly heightened tensions between the two neighboring counties.

Location of Incident: Khorwai and Wau Payams, in Ayod County.
Description: 4.	On 6 October, multiple sources reported that on 2 October, Lou Nuer armed elements from Nyirol and Uror Counties shot and killed 18 civilians and injured 12 others (cattle keepers) from the Gawaar Nuer community during cattle raids in Khorwai and Wau Payams, in Ayod County. According to the sources, the Lou Nuer armed elements attacked Wunkuel village, and Juolei villages in Wau Payam as well as Maluang and Kuerbadeng villages in Khorwai Payam, killing 18 civilians and injuring 12 others. The attackers also reportedly raided an unspecified number of cattle from these villages. Reportedly, the local Gawaar Nuer youth pursued the attackers and in the ensuing clashes, recovered all of the raided cattle.

Location of Incident: Khorwai and Wau Payams, in Ayod County.
Description: 4.	On 6 October, multiple sources reported that on 2 October, Lou Nuer armed elements from Nyirol and Uror Counties shot and killed 18 civilians and injured 12 others (cattle keepers) from the Gawaar Nuer community during cattle raids in Khorwai and Wau Payams, in Ayod County. According to the sources, the Lou Nuer armed elements attacked Wunkuel village, and Juolei villages in Wau Payam as well as Maluang and Kuerbadeng villages in Khorwai Payam, killing 18 civilians and injuring 12 others. The attackers also reportedly raided an unspecified number of cattle from these villages. Reportedly, the local Gawaar Nuer youth pursued the attackers and in the ensuing clashes, recovered all of the raided cattle.

Location of Incident: Khorwai and Wau Payams, in Ayod County.
Description: 4. Location of Incident: Meen Payam, Rumbek North County and Malek Payam, Rumbek Centre County
Description: 5.	On 6 October, multiple sources reported that on 4 October, three male civilians were shot and killed and another was injured during retaliatory violence between Dinka Pakam armed elements from the Pamuolnyic and Pan-Rup sub-clans in Meen Payam, Rumbek North County and Malek Payam, Rumbek Centre County. According to the sources, the Dinka Pakam armed elements from the Pamuolnyic sub-clan attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Pakam Pan-Rup sub-clan in Meen Town, killing one male civilian. Reportedly, in retaliation, Pan-Rup armed elements attacked the Pamuolnyic sub-clan members in Buoi cattle camp, Malek Payam, Rumbek Centre County, killing two male civilians and injuring another. The incident is reportedly linked to past violence/unresolved grievances between the two sub-clans.

Location of Incident: Meen Payam, Rumbek North County and Malek Payam, Rumbek Centre County
Description: 5.	On 6 October, multiple sources reported that on 4 October, three male civilians were shot and killed and another was injured during retaliatory violence between Dinka Pakam armed elements from the Pamuolnyic and Pan-Rup sub-clans in Meen Payam, Rumbek North County and Malek Payam, Rumbek Centre County. According to the sources, the Dinka Pakam armed elements from the Pamuolnyic sub-clan attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Pakam Pan-Rup sub-clan in Meen Town, killing one male civilian. Reportedly, in retaliation, Pan-Rup armed elements attacked the Pamuolnyic sub-clan members in Buoi cattle camp, Malek Payam, Rumbek Centre County, killing two male civilians and injuring another. The incident is reportedly linked to past violence/unresolved grievances between the two sub-clans.

Location of Incident: Loi village fishing camp, Lang Payam, Mayendit
Description: 6.	On 6 October, three secondary sources reported that on 2 October, suspected Nyuong Nuer armed elements from Panyijiar County shot and injured two male civilians (17 and 18 years old) from the Haak Nuer community in Loi village fishing camp, Lang Payam, Mayendit County. According to the sources, a group of Nyuong Nuer armed elements, who travelled by canoes into Loi village, attacked and opened fire on the Haak Nuer inhabitants, injuring two, reportedly in revenge for the earlier attack allegedly perpetrated by Haak Nuer armed elements from Mayendit County in the Lieth fishing camp, Mayom Payam, Panyijiar County in August 2025 which led to the killing of one Nyuong Nuer civilian. The injured vicitms were reportedly receiving medical treatment at a local health care facility in Mayendit.

Location of Incident: Bap-Chok village, Tonj Payam, Tonj South
Description: 7.	On 6 October, multiple sources reported that on 21 September, the SSPDF extrajudicially executed one male civilian from the Dinka Yar community in Bap-Chok village, Tonj Payam, Tonj South County. According to the sources, the victim was arrested on 13 September for alleged involvement in cattle theft and detained at the Tonj Town Police Station. On 21 September, SSPDF personnel reportedly extracted the victim from the Tonj Town Police Station and transferred him to Bap-Chok village on the outskirts of Tonj Town where he was executed by firing squad. The body of the victim was subsequently handed over to his relatives the following morning for interment in Wanhalel Payam.

Location of Incident: Gangara Osma village, Manikakara Payam, Ibba County
Description: 8.	On 6 October, multiple sources reported that 4 October, suspected SPLA-IO elements abducted four civilians from the Azande community in Gangara Osma village, Manikakara Payam, Ibba County. According to the sources, the suspected SPLA-IO elements ambushed the victims while they were travelling on motorcycle from Juba to Yambio, dragged them into a nearby bush, where they were looted of their properties and flogged with sticks. The victims were reportedly released later in the evening after enduring hours of captivity and brutality, with stern warnings to avoid using the roads in South Sudan.

Location of Incident: Gangara Osma village, Manikakara Payam, Ibba County
Description: 8.	On 6 October, multiple sources reported that 4 October, suspected SPLA-IO elements abducted four civilians from the Azande community in Gangara Osma village, Manikakara Payam, Ibba County. According to the sources, the suspected SPLA-IO elements ambushed the victims while they were travelling on motorcycle from Juba to Yambio, dragged them into a nearby bush, where they were looted of their properties and flogged with sticks. The victims were reportedly released later in the evening after enduring hours of captivity and brutality, with stern warnings to avoid using the roads in South Sudan.

Location of Incident: Ombaci Boma, Otogo Payam, Yei River
Description: 1.	On 7 October, two secondary sources reported that on 16 September, suspected NAS elements abducted one 27-year-old male civilian (a businessman) from the Kakwa community in Ombaci Boma, Otogo Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, the NAS elements abduced the victim from his homestead in Ombaci Centre on accusation of supporting the government forces. The incident reportedly occurred following the deployment of a SSPDF Unit from Juba in Ombaci Market/trading center to conduct operations to drive NAS elements out from the area. The whereabouts of the victim remains unknown.

Location of Incident: Namonichek Boma, Lokwamor Payam, Kapoeta North
Description: 2.	On 7 October, three secondary sources reported that on 2 October, suspected Buya armed elements from Napak Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County shot and killed five male civilians and injured another from the Toposa community during an attempted cattle raid in Namonichek Boma, Lokwamor Payam, Kapoeta North County. According to the sources, a group of armed Buya elements stormed Namonichek Boma and opened fire on a 33-year-old Toposa while he was watering his cattle at Namonichek stream, killing him. A group of  Toposa men who were nearby reportedly returned fire, prompting the attackers to retreat. Reportedly, in the evening of the same day, the Buya armed elements returned and opened fire on residents in Namonichek village, killing four Toposa male civilians (ages 24, 27, 27, and 30 years old) and injured a 30-year-old man. The Toposa youth reportedly repulsed the attackers who fled without raiding any cattle. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in  Riwoto for medical treatment. The incident was reported at Kapoeta North Police Station.

Location of Incident: Namonichek Boma, Lokwamor Payam, Kapoeta North
Description: 2.	On 7 October, three secondary sources reported that on 2 October, suspected Buya armed elements from Napak Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County shot and killed five male civilians and injured another from the Toposa community during an attempted cattle raid in Namonichek Boma, Lokwamor Payam, Kapoeta North County. According to the sources, a group of armed Buya elements stormed Namonichek Boma and opened fire on a 33-year-old Toposa while he was watering his cattle at Namonichek stream, killing him. A group of  Toposa men who were nearby reportedly returned fire, prompting the attackers to retreat. Reportedly, in the evening of the same day, the Buya armed elements returned and opened fire on residents in Namonichek village, killing four Toposa male civilians (ages 24, 27, 27, and 30 years old) and injured a 30-year-old man. The Toposa youth reportedly repulsed the attackers who fled without raiding any cattle. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in  Riwoto for medical treatment. The incident was reported at Kapoeta North Police Station.

Location of Incident: Rikrik village, Malek Payam, Yirol East
Description: 3.	On 7 October, multiple sources reported that on the same day, Nyuong Nuer armed elements from Panyijiar County, Unity State shot and injured one male civilian from the Dinka Ciec community in Rikrik village, Malek Payam, Yirol East County. According to the sources, a group of three Nyuong Nuer armed elements ambushed and opened fire on two male civilians while they were travelling on a motorcycle enroute to Yirol West County, injuring one. Reportedly, Dinka Ciec youths living nearby responded to the scene, forcing the attackers to escape.

Location of Incident: in Turalei Payam, Twic County
Description:
4.	On 7 October, four primary sources reported that on 6 and 7 October, six civilians were shot and killed during an attack allegedly by SSPDF deserters affiliated to the SPLA-IO and Nuer armed elements in Turalei Payam, Twic County. As recounted by the sources, on 6 October, a disagreement broke out between the SPLA-IO commander Colonel Peter Gatjiek and the SSPDF Commander Colonel Jamus at their joint deployment location in Athony village, Turalei Payam, along the border with Abyei Administrative Area, allegedly about the planned defection (from the SSPDF) and declaration of war on the government by the SPLA-IO commander. The disagreement reportedly degenerated into an armed clash between SSPDF and SPLA-IO soldiers which resulted in the deaths of  two soldiers (one from either side). Allegedly, the SPLM-IO commander and his followers then withdrew from the area into the bush. On 7 October, the SPLA-IO soldiers with allied Nuer armed elements reportedly jointly attacked the SSPDF Detach and the civilian community in Athony and Ayok villages, killing six male civilians from the Dinka Twic Mayardit community. Six SSPDF soldiers and six SPLA-IO elements were also reportedly killed during the attack. The attackers also reportedly burnt down eight houses. Two Dinka Twic Mayardit civilians are reported missing. The sources further informed that forces from UNISFA responded and evacuated the women, children and the elderly from the affected area.

Comment: HRD will follow up and gather more information on the incident and its impact on human rights.

Location of Incident: in Turalei Payam, Twic County
Description:
4. Location of Incident: Lual-Gol village, Alabek Payam, Tonj North
Description:
5.	On 7 October, three primary sources reported that  on 5 October, the SSPDF shot and injured one male civilian from the Dinka Lou-Ariik community during a disarmament exercise in Lual-Gol village, Alabek Payam, Tonj North County. As recounted by the sources, SSPDF soldiers entered Lual-Gol village and ordered the civilians to surrender their guns; however, the one of the residents reportedly questioned and resisted the approach by the SSPDF and attempted to escape. The SSPDF soldiers then opened gunfire, injuring the victim. The SSPDF subsequently recovered one firearm from the victim’s homestead. The victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Aliek Town for medical treatment.

Comment: The attack is viewed as an instance of use of excessive force by the SSPDF during the disarmament exercise. The incident has reportedly heightened tensions between the SSPDF and the Lou-Ariik community due to continued use of excessive force during the voluntary phase of the disarmament. Notably, this is the third incident of reported use of force by the SSPDF during the voluntary disarmament exercise in Alabek Payam [see HRD Daily Reports of  29 and 30 September 2025].

Location of Incident: Kuajena payam, Jur River
Description: 6.	On 7 October, one primary source reported that on 3 October, SPLA-IO elements shot and injured two female civilians (one from the Kerish community and another from the Dunka Community) in Kuajena payam, Jur River County. As recounted by the source, a group of three SPLA-IO elements attempted to intercept a commercial vehicle carrying 12 passengers along the Wau-Tonj road enroute from Wau to Juba; however, the driver did not stop prompting one of the armed elements to open fire on the vehicle, injuring two women. The driver proceeded to Kuajena Centre and reported the incident at Kuajena Police Station. The injured women were taken to a health care facility in Kuajena for initial medical attention, and subsequently transferred to a hospital in Wau for further medical care.

Location of Incident: Nagbagi Boma, Nagero Central Payam, Nagero County
Description:
7.	On 7 October, three secondary sources reported that on 6 October, the SSPDF allegedly extrajudicially executed six civilians including three minors in Nagbagi Boma, Nagero Central Payam, Nagero County. According to the sources, SSPDF soldiers, who had responded to an attack/looting of a local health facility in Nagero Payam by SPLA-IO elements, encountered nine civilians and detained them without formal charges. Some of these victims had allegedly gone out in search of food and were caught in the crossfire. After verification, the SSPDF released three individuals identified as health workers; however, reportedly executed the remaining six detainees. The motive for the executions remain unclear.

Comment: The alleged executions and detention without trial breach the right to life and principles of liberty and security. HRD will follow up to gather more information on the report.

Location of Incident: Mangalla, Juba
Description:
1.	On 8 October, two secondary sources reported that on 7 October, unidentified armed elements shot and injured two male civilians during an ambush on a commercial passenger vehicle in Mangalla Payam, Juba County. According to the sources, the unidentified armed elements ambushed and opened fire on the passenger vehicle with 10 passengers aboard along the road between Bilinyang and Mogiri Bomas, injuring two male passengers, while the others escaped unhurt. Reportedly, the attackers looted cash and other valuables belonging to the passengers. The security forces were reportedly deployed to the location; however, the attackers had fled the scene. The incident was subsequently reported at the Eastern Police Division in Gumbo.

Comment: The recurrence of armed attacks on vehicles along the Juba–Bor road highlights ongoing risks to civilian movement, freedom of travel, and personal security. Strengthening law enforcement presence and accountability for perpetrators remain essential to protecting civilians from such ambushes.

Location of Incident: Bangasu Payam, Yambio County, Western Equatoria State
Description: 2.	On 8 October, two secondary sources reported that in January 2025 (exact date unspecified), armed Ambororo cattle keepers abducted one 54-year-old male civilian from Bangasu Payam, Yambio County, Western Equatoria State and transferred him to Morobo County. According to the sources, three armed Ambororo cattle keepers abducted the victim while he was at his farm in Bangasa Payam and subjected him to forced labour herding cattle in the bushes in different areas. Reportedly, in September (exact date unspecified), the abductors reportedly abandoned the victim in Kendira Boma, where he went to the South Sudan People’s Defence Forces (SSPDF) barracks for safety and any other necessary support. The SSPDF reportedly reached out to his family and preparation are under way to take him back in Yambio.

Location of Incident: Napak Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County
Description: 3.	On 8 October, three secondary sources reported that on 3 October, Toposa armed elements from Namonichek Boma, Lokwamor Payam, Kapoeta North County shot and killed six civilians (two men and two women) from the Buya community in Napak Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, a group of Toposa armed elements attacked Napak Boma and opened fire on two unarmed Buya women (30 and 31 years old) who were cultivating in their garden, killing them. The attackers thereafter advanced to nearby cattle kraals and opened fire indiscriminately, killing four male civilians (22, 25, 26, and 28 years). The attack was reportedly in retaliation for the attack on Namonichek Boma by Buya armed elements from Napak Boma on 2 October, during which five Toposa male civilians were killed and another was injured [see HRD Daily Report 8 October 2025].

Location of Incident: Loriyok Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi
Description: 1.	On 9 October, three secondary sources reported that on 7 October, Buya armed elements shot and killed three civilians (two women and one man) from the Toposa community in Loriyok Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, a group of Buya armed elements attacked and opened fire on the victims while they were cutting poles in the bushed in Khor Galerio along Loriyok-Kapoeta Road, killing them. The attack was reportedly a revenge action for the  killing of a 17-year-old Buya woman from Kimotong Payam by Toposa armed elements on  20 September 2025 [see HRD Daily Report 23 September 2025]. The incident was reported at the Kapoeta South County and Loriyok Police Stations and investigation is reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: Panyikang County, Upper Nile State
Description: 2.	On 8 October, multiple sources reported that on 30 August, at unknown hours, the SSPDF and allied forces allegedly abducted 18 children from Fangak Nuer community in Panyikang County, Upper Nile State. According to the sources, the children (between five to 16 years old) were abducted during the capture of the headquarters of the Sudan People’s Liberation Army – In Opposition (SPLA-IO) in Tonga, Panyikang County by the SSPDF and allied forces. The children were reportedly abducted from five payams inhabited by Fangak Nuer following the 2020 displacement by floods.

Location of Incident: Wuriang Payam, Rumbek North County
Description:
3.	On 9 October, one secondary source reported that on 8 October, Dinka Pakam armed elements  shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Luanyjang community in Wuriang Payam, Rumbek North County. According to the source, two armed elements from the Gak clan of the Dinka Pakam section attacked the victim to avenge the killing of their two male relatives during past violence between the Dinka Pakam and Dinka Luanyjang. Reportedly, the local authorities intervened and launched a search to apprehend the perpetrators; meanwhile the authorities have reportedly arrested their father in proxy, allegedly as a goodwill gesture to the Luanyjang community with whom the Dinka Pakam recently signed a peace agreement.

Comments: HRD will follow up and engage with the county authorities to address the issue of proxy arrest.

Location of Incident: Maker village, Aweng Payam, Twic
Description: 4.	On 9 October, three primary sources reported that on the same day, Nuer armed elements shot and injured two male civilians from the Dika Twic Mayardit community during a cattle raid in Maker village, Aweng Payam, Twic County. As recounted by the sources, the Nuer armed elements attacked and opened fire on a group of Dinka Twic Mayardit civilian herders who were grazing their cattle in the shared swampy area in Maker village, injuring two. The attackers also reportedly seized 30 heads of cattle and fled back into Unity State. The injured victims were reportedly evacuated to a hospital in Turalei Town, for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Maker village, Aweng Payam, Twic
Description: 4.	On 9 October, three primary sources reported that on the same day, Nuer armed elements shot and injured two male civilians from the Dika Twic Mayardit community during a cattle raid in Maker village, Aweng Payam, Twic County. As recounted by the sources, the Nuer armed elements attacked and opened fire on a group of Dinka Twic Mayardit civilian herders who were grazing their cattle in the shared swampy area in Maker village, injuring two. The attackers also reportedly seized 30 heads of cattle and fled back into Unity State. The injured victims were reportedly evacuated to a hospital in Turalei Town, for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Tambura Town, Tambura
Description:
5.	On 9 October, multiple sources reported that on 7 October, the SSPDF arbitrarily arrested and detained two civilians (from the Azande and Balanda communities, respectively) in Tambura Town, Tambura County. According to the sources, SSPDF soldiers arrested the vicitms while they had travelled from Mapiso village to Tambura Town to purchase essential goods, including salt and soap, and detained them on suspicion of supplying these items to SPLA-IO elements, that control Mapiso and surrounding villages.

Comment: Reportedly, internally displaced persons (IDPs) in Mapiso, Manguru, and other nearby villages are facing a dire humanitarian needs, having been displaced for the second time from the Ayat IDP camp. The IDPs are reportedly unable to access Tambura town to purchase necessities due to fear of arrest by the SSPDF.

Location of Incident: Pisak village, Tokori Boma, Lasu Payam, Yei River
Description: 1.	On 10 October, three secondary sources reported that on 15 July, NAS elements abducted one 52-year-old male civilian (a health care worker) in Pisak village, Tokori Boma, Lasu Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, the NAS elements abducted the victim from his homestead and took him to an unknown location. The victim was released on 18 July 2025 unharmed.

Location of Incident: Lolim Boma, Narus Payam, Kapoeta East
Description: 2.	On 10 October, multiple sources reported that on 4 October, suspected SPLA-IO elements shot and injured one 40-year-old  male civilian (a businessman) in Lolim Boma, Narus Payam, Kapoeta East County. According to the sources, a group of 10 SPLA-IO elements ambushed and opened fire on the victim while he was travelling on a motorcycle along the Narus-Kapoeta road in Lolim Boma, injuring him. The victim was reportedly evacuated to Kenya for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Rum-Athian village, Palieng Payam, Tonj East
Description: 3.	On 12 October, three primary sources reported that on 10 October, Dinka Jaluau armed elements abducted one male juvenile from the Dibka Luanyjang community during a cattle raid in Rum-Athian village, Palieng Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources,  the Dinka Jaluau armed elements attacked a cattle camp in Rum-Athian village and seized 86 heads of cattle, as well as abducted one boy who was attending to the cattle, and thereafter fled to Wunlit Payam. The minor was reportedly released unharmed and returned home.

Location of Incident: Rum-Athian village, Palieng Payam, Tonj East
Description: 3.	On 12 October, three primary sources reported that on 10 October, Dinka Jaluau armed elements abducted one male juvenile from the Dibka Luanyjang community during a cattle raid in Rum-Athian village, Palieng Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources,  the Dinka Jaluau armed elements attacked a cattle camp in Rum-Athian village and seized 86 heads of cattle, as well as abducted one boy who was attending to the cattle, and thereafter fled to Wunlit Payam. The minor was reportedly released unharmed and returned home.

Location of Incident: Kuanya Boma, Rocrocdong Payam, Jur River
Description:
4.	On 10 October, a primary source reported that on 2 October, the SSPDF arbitrarily arrested and detained one 36-year-old male civilian (the Deputy Supervisor Relief and rehabilitation Commission (RRC)) in Kuanya Boma, Rocrocdong Payam, Jur River County. As recounted by the source, a group of 30 SSPDF soldiers accosted the victim after he concluded meetings with local chiefs from Alunga and Nyikijo neighborhoods as part of an RRC assessment mission, confiscated and inspected his personal mobile phone. One of the phone contact  number was reportedly linked to SPLA-IO General Bol Wek, which prompted his arrest. The victim was thereafter transferred to the SSPDF Division 5 Military Intelligence (MI) detention facility at Grinti Barracks in Wau, where he was detained for one week without adequate food or access to sanitary facilities. Reportedly, on 8 October 2025, he was temporarily granted permission to visit his home in Hai Nazareth, with instructions to return on 9 October.

Comment: Reportedly, 26 male civilians (from the Luo community, ages between 14 and 48 years old) are detained at the military detention facility in Grinti, despite assurances by the  Military Advocate at Grinti Barracks that all civilians previously detained in connection with tensions in Rocrocdong Payam had been released. HRD will follow up on the on the case as well as advocate for release of all the civilian victims in detention or be transferred to police for investigations.

Location of Incident: Isebi village, Lojulo Payam, Morobo County
Description:
1.	On 13 October, three secondary sources reported that on 11 October, NAS elements abducted three male civilians from the Keliko community in Isebi village, Lojulo Payam, Morobo County. According to the sources, a group of eight NAS elements attacked Isebi village and abducted the victims from their houses. The NAS elements also reportedly seized livestock and food items. The whereabouts of the abductees remains unknown.

Comment: The incident has reportedly heightened tensions in the area since the attack/abduction occurred about 500 meters from the SSPDF barracks. The SSPDF reportedly dispatched soldiers to pursue the assailants who crossed into the Democratic Republic of (DRC).

Location of Incident: Mathiang village, Tiap Payam, Panyijiar
Description: 2.	On 10 and 13 October, three secondary sources reported that on 5 October, three Nyoung Nuer armed elements raped a 13-year-old girl from the Nyuong Nuer community in Mathiang village, Tiap Payam, Panyijiar County. According to the sources, the three Nyoung armed elements accosted the victim as she was returning from a traditional ceremony in Mathiang village, and two of the attackers reportedly held her down at gunpoint while the other raped her. Reportedly, the three suspects were subsequently arrested by the local police and detained  at the Criminal Investigation Division in Tiap Payam, pending investigation. The survivor reportedly received medical treatment on the same day at a health care facility in Ganyliel Payam Panyijiar County and returned home to her family.

Location of Incident: Bentiu IDP Camp, Rubkona
Description:
3.	Between 10 and 13 October, multiple sources reported that informed in June 2025 (exact date unspecified), one SSPDF officer raped a 30-year-old woman from the Leek Nuer community (an IDP)) at the Bentiu IDP Camp, Rubkona County. According to the sources,  the SSPDF officer, who is deployed at the Joint Police Unit (JPU) at the Bentiu IDP camp, asked the victim who operates a tea shop in the Southern Gate area of the Bentiu IDP camp, to  bring tea to his nearby shelter. Reportedly, when the woman entered the home of the SSPDF officer, he assaulted and raped her. The victim reportedly cried for help, attracting several neighbours and some police officers who rushed to her rescue; however, the perpetrator brought out his service rifle and threated to kill anyone who would attempt to intervene. The sources further informed that the SSPDF Division 4 Commander dispatched SSPDF soldiers to extract the suspect from the IDP camp, and thereafter invited the victim and her family to find an “amicable” solution to the issue. He allegedly paid the family one million South Sudan Pounds (SSP) to cater for the victim’s medical treatment and to dissuade the family from pursuing legal action. The SSPDF Commander and some senior officers reportedly threatened the victim’s family as well as the JPU not to report or pursue the matter further otherwise, they would face reprisal.

Comments: According to the sources, the alleged perpetrator has been suspected to have committed several other sexual violence acts against various victims before and his redeployment is not just an affront to justice but also places women and girls in the area high risk of sexual violence, especially rape, and fosters impunity for sexual violence crimes. HRD will engage with relevant stakeholders and state for the perpetrator and accomplices to be held accountable and for the victim and witnesses to be protected.

Location of Incident: Ameth-Chok village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj South
Description: 4.	On 13 October, three primary sources reported that the same day, Dinka Gok armed elements from Lakes State shot and injured two male civilians from the Dinka Thony community during a cattle raid in Ameth-Chok village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj South County. As recounted by the sources, the armed Dinka Gok youths attacked Ameth-Chok village and opened fire on a group of Dinka Thony cattle herders who were grazing and watering their livestock in the shared swampy land, injuring two. The attackers also seized 25 heads of cattle and escaped back into Lakes State. The injured victims were reportedly evacuated to a hospital Tonj Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Ameth-Chok village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj South
Description: 4.	On 13 October, three primary sources reported that the same day, Dinka Gok armed elements from Lakes State shot and injured two male civilians from the Dinka Thony community during a cattle raid in Ameth-Chok village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj South County. As recounted by the sources, the armed Dinka Gok youths attacked Ameth-Chok village and opened fire on a group of Dinka Thony cattle herders who were grazing and watering their livestock in the shared swampy land, injuring two. The attackers also seized 25 heads of cattle and escaped back into Lakes State. The injured victims were reportedly evacuated to a hospital Tonj Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Movurumo village, Mabaiko Boma, Tambura Town, Tambura
Description:
5.	On13 October, multiple sources reported that on 12 October, suspected SPLA-IO elements shot and killed three civilians (one 38-year-old woman, and two men – 20 and 35 years old) from the Azande community in Movurumo village, Mabaiko Boma, Tambura Town, Tambura County. According to the sources, the suspected SPLA-IO elements ambushed and opened fire on the victims, killing them, and subsequently seized their motorcycle and personal belongings. The motive behind the attack remains unknown.  

Comment: The incident reflects the ongoing security challenges faced by civilians in Tambura County, which has adversely affected the humanitarian situation, limiting access to essential services, livelihoods, and humanitarian assistance.

Location of Incident: Movurumo village, Mabaiko Boma, Tambura Town, Tambura
Description:
5.	On13 October, multiple sources reported that on 12 October, suspected SPLA-IO elements shot and killed three civilians (one 38-year-old woman, and two men – 20 and 35 years old) from the Azande community in Movurumo village, Mabaiko Boma, Tambura Town, Tambura County. The motive behind the attack remains unknown.

Location of Incident: Mambe and Ras-Olo Payams, Maridi County
Description:
6.	On 10 October, multiple sources reported that between 29 September and 10 October, suspected NAS and SPLA-IO elements abducted 40 male civilians (predominantly youth) in Mambe and Ras-Olo Payams, Maridi County. According to the sources, the NAS and SPLA-IO elements raided villages in and around Mambe and Ras-Olo Payams, forcibly abducted approximately 40 civilians and took them towards Yei River County, Central Equatoria State along the border of South Sudan and the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC). The armed groups have allegedly opened training camps in the DRC along the border with Western Equatoria State and are conscripting young men into their ranks. The incident has reportedly caused panic among the youth in the greater Maridi area, with many fleeing to Yambio County for safety.

Comments: Reports of abductions and alleged forceful recruitment of young men into armed groups raises grave concerns regarding the protection of civilian and safeguarding fundamental rights in Maridi County and the state at large. Due to government imposed restrictions on movement, UNMISS has been unable to conduct patrols, substantially limiting HRD’s capacity to verify and document information on emerging human rights incidents.

Location of Incident: Kagumakori Boma, Kauto Payam, Kapoeta East
Description: 1.	On 14 October, three secondary sources reported that on 13 October, Murle armed elements from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) shot and killed one 13-year-old boy, injured a 17-year-old boy, and abducted one 11-year-old boy, all from the Toposa community, in Kagumakori Boma, Kauto Payam, Kapoeta East County. According to the sources, a group of Murle armed elements attacked Kagumakori Boma intending to raid cattle, encountered the three children as they were walking from Lobokoreng Boma to Kagumakori Boma and subsequently abducted the 11-year-old child and thereafter opened fire on the other two, killing one and injuring another. The Murle armed elements reportedly proceeded to Kalobeleny where they raided 40 goats and fled towards greater Pibor Administrative Area.

Location of Incident: Kagumakori Boma, Kauto Payam, Kapoeta East
Description: 1.	On 14 October, three secondary sources reported that on 13 October, Murle armed elements from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) shot and killed one 13-year-old boy, injured a 17-year-old boy, and abducted one 11-year-old boy, all from the Toposa community, in Kagumakori Boma, Kauto Payam, Kapoeta East County. The Murle armed elements reportedly proceeded to Kalobeleny where they raided 40 goats and fled towards greater Pibor Administrative Area.

Location of Incident: Manyiel village, Kirik Payam, Tonj North
Description: 2.	On 14 October, three primary sources reported that on the same day, suspected Dinka Leir armed elements shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Lou-Paher community in Manyiel village, Kirik Payam, Tonj North County. As recounted by the sources, suspected Dinka Leir armed elements ambushed and opened fire on two civilians (a motorcycle rider and a female passenger) enroute from Rualbet Payam to Awul Payam, killing the rider. The attackers reportedly seized the motorcycle; however, they did not harm the female passenger.

Location of Incident: Dangar village, Ngapagok Payam, Tonj East
Description: 3.	On 14 October, three primary sources reported that on 13 October, suspected Dinka Thiik and Dinka Jaluau armed elements attacked and injured two male civilians (traders) from the Dinka Apuk-Jurwir community in Dangar village, Ngapagok Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, Dinka Thiik and Dinka Jaluau armed elements jointly ambushed the traders as they were transporting 53 heads of cattle for sale at the local livestock market in Tonj East County, held them at gunpoint and severely beat them up. The attackers reportedly seized 26 heads of cattle and thereafter fled the scene. The injured victims were reportedly evacuated to a hospital in Tonj Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Kongor Bridge area, Wau Municipality
Description:
4.	On 14 October, one primary source and a secondary source reported that on 6 October, one NSS personnel raped a 19-year-old female civilian from the Dinka community in the Kongor Bridge area, Wau Municipality. As recounted by the sources, the survivor had delivered food for her husband who was reportedly detained at the NSS outpost in the Kongo Bridge area of Wau Town, and as she left the premises, one NSS personnel dragged her into a nearby bush and raped her. The suspect reportedly threatened to kill the survivor if she attempted to report the incident. Despite the threat, the survivor returned to the NSS post and reported the incident to the commander, who reportedly instructed his personnel to apprehend the perpetrator; however, they were unable to find him in the area. On 8 October, the survivor reported the case to Jau Market Police Station, which subsequently referred the matter to the Special Protection Unit (SPU) for further investigation and to the One Stop Center for medical examination and psychosocial support.

Comments: HRD will follow up on the case for accountability of the perpetrator.

Location of Incident: Kuel-Aguak village, Awul Payam, Tonj North
Description:
1.	On 15 October, three primary sources reported that on the same day, Dinka Leir armed elements shot and injured two male civilians from the Dinka Noi community during a cattle raid in Kuel-Aguak village, Awul Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the Dinka Leir armed elements attacked and opened fire on a cattle camp in Kuel-Aguak village, injuring two civilians. The attackers also seized 16 heads of cattle and fled with them back into Kirik Payam. The injured victims were reportedly evacuated to a health care facility in Warrap Town for medical treatment.

Comment: It is envisaged that as the dry season sets in, the likelihood of cattle raids among rival Dinka communities will increase, including in the context of retaliation for past violence and/or unresolved grievances.

Location of Incident: Kuel-Aguak village, Awul Payam, Tonj North
Description:
1. Location of Incident: Kuajena Payam, Jur River
Description:
2.	On 15 October, multiple sources reported that on 14 August, a SPLA-IO element raped a 17-year-old girl from the Luo community in Kuajena Payam, Jur River County. As recounted by the sources, the suspect raped the victim in his house, and the survivor reportedly feared to disclose the incident to her family. On 6 October, the survivor’s family reportedly noticed the physical change and took her to a health care facility in Kuajena, whereupon the medical examination confirmed that she was three months pregnant. On 14 October, the case was reported to the Special Protection Unit, and the police issued Form 8 for further medical assessment, while a police warrant of arrest was also issued against the suspect, who is currently at large.

Comments: HRD will follow up on the case for accountability of the perpetrator.

Location of Incident: Sinawari village, Tambura
Description:
3.	On 15 October, two secondary sources reported that on 12 October, suspected SPLA-IO elements abducted and killed two male civilians from the Azande community in Sinawari village, Tambura County. According to the sources, SPLA-IO elements abducted the victims and subsequently shot and killed them. The bodies of the victims were reportedly retrieved by the South Sudan People’s Defence Forces (SSPDF) personnel in Movurumo village, Mabaiko Boma. The motive for the abduction and killing remains unknown.

Comment: According to the sources, the victims had stayed back in their homes in Sinawari despite widespread displacement of the civilians from the area to IDP camps in Tambura for safety.

Location of Incident: Logere Boma, Burgilo Payam, Lafon
Description: 1.	On 16 October, three secondary sources reported that on 13 October, Murle armed elements from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) shot and injured two male civilians (cattle traders – 32 and 37 years old) from the Pari community in Logere Boma, Burgilo Payam, Lafon County. According to the sources, the Murle armed elements ambushed and opened fire on a group of 10 Pari cattle traders while they were taking their cattle for sale in Juba, Central Equatoria State, injuring two. The injured victims were evacuated to a hospital in Juba for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Pul-Bar village, Marial-Lou Payam, Tonj North
Description: 2.	On 16 October, thee primary sources reported that on the same day, suspected Dinka Apuk-Patoc armed elements shot and killed one male civilian and injured another from the Dinka Lou-Paher community during a cattle raid in Pul-Bar village, Marial-Lou Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the suspected Dinka Apuk-Patoc armed elements attacked and opened fire on Pul-Bar village, killing one of the residents and injuring another. The attackers also seized an unspecified number of cattle and fled with them to Akop Payam. The injured victim was evacuated to a hospital in Marial-Lou Payam for medical treatment. The attack was reportedly a revenge action connected to past violence between the two communities.

Location of Incident: Pul-Bar village, Marial-Lou Payam, Tonj North
Description: 2.	On 16 October, thee primary sources reported that on the same day, suspected Dinka Apuk-Patoc armed elements shot and killed one male civilian and injured another from the Dinka Lou-Paher community during a cattle raid in Pul-Bar village, Marial-Lou Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the suspected Dinka Apuk-Patoc armed elements attacked and opened fire on Pul-Bar village, killing one of the residents and injuring another. The attackers also seized an unspecified number of cattle and fled with them to Akop Payam. The injured victim was evacuated to a hospital in Marial-Lou Payam for medical treatment. The attack was reportedly a revenge action connected to past violence between the two communities.

Location of Incident: Pul-Bar village, Marial-Lou Payam, Tonj North
Description: 2. The attack was reportedly a revenge action connected to past violence between the two communities.

Location of Incident: Ayaar village, Wadallelho Boma, Rocrocdong Payam, Jur River County
Description: 3.	On 16 October, multiple sources reported that on 9 October, SPLA-IO elements unlawfully detained and ill-treated one 20-year-old male civilian from the Luo community in Ayaar village, Wadallelho Boma, Rocrocdong Payam, Jur River County. As recounted by the sources, 20 SPLA-IO elements arrested the victim on allegation of having impregnated a woman out of wedlock and detained him at the SPLA-IO barracks in Maleng, where he was reportedly ill-treated and beaten up. The victim was reportedly denied access to medical treatment by the SPLA-IO elements. On 11 October, the SPLA-IO elements reportedly handed over the victim to the Hai Masana Police Station for prosecution; however, no formal charges were filed against the victim, and that the case would be referred to the customary court.

Location of Incident: Paywa Boma, Mugwo  Payam, Yei River
Description: 1.	On 17 October, one primary source and two secondary sources reported that on 14 October, one SSPDF soldier raped a 30-year-old female civilian from the Kakwa community in Paywa Boma, Mugwo  Payam, Yei River County. As recounted by the sources, the suspected SSPDF soldier accosted the victim while she was on her way to attend a workshop organized by Women for Women (a local NGO), physically assaulted and thereafter raped her. The incident was reported at Mugwo Police Station and survivor was referred to a health care facility for medical examination, which confirmed the rape. The survivor subsequently received medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Logoomotoit Boma, Lomeyen Payam, Kapoeta North
Description: 2.	On 17 October, three secondary sources reported that on 16 October, Buya armed elements from Napak Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County shot and killed one 20-year-old male civilian and injured a 16-year-old boy, both from the Toposa community, during a cattle raid in Logoomotoit Boma, Lomeyen Payam, Kapoeta North County. According to the sources, the Buya armed elements stormed Logoomotoit Boma and opened fire on the two civilians who were grazing cattle in the area, killing one and injuring another. The attackers also seized approximately 250 heads of cattle. Reportedly, the local Toposa youth pursued the attackers and recovered eight of the raided cattle. The injured victim was reportedly evacuated to a health care facility in Riwoto for medical attention. The incident was reported at Kapoeta North Police Station; however, no suspects have been apprehended so far.

Location of Incident: Logoomotoit Boma, Lomeyen Payam, Kapoeta North
Description: 2.	On 17 October, three secondary sources reported that on 16 October, Buya armed elements from Napak Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County shot and killed one 20-year-old male civilian and injured a 16-year-old boy, both from the Toposa community, during a cattle raid in Logoomotoit Boma, Lomeyen Payam, Kapoeta North County. According to the sources, the Buya armed elements stormed Logoomotoit Boma and opened fire on the two civilians who were grazing cattle in the area, killing one and injuring another. The incident was reported at Kapoeta North Police Station; however, no suspects have been apprehended so far.
