The incident was reported at Kapoeta North Police Station; however, no suspects have been apprehended so far.

Location of Incident: Naita Boma, Kauto Payam, Kapoeta East
Description: 3.	On 17 October, three secondary sources reported that on 12 October, Murle armed elements from GPAA shot and killed two male civilians (20 and 26 years old) from the Toposa community during a cattle raid in Naita Boma, Kauto Payam, Kapoeta East County. According to the sources, the Murle armed elements attacked Naita Boma, encountered the victims as they were walking from Naita Boma to Lotakawa Boma, opened fire, killing them. The attackers reportedly raided approximately 110 heads of Toposa. The incident was reported at Nanyangachor and Narus Police Stations and investigations are reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: Naita Boma, Kauto Payam, Kapoeta East
Description: 3.	On 17 October, three secondary sources reported that on 12 October, Murle armed elements from GPAA shot and killed two male civilians (20 and 26 years old) from the Toposa community during a cattle raid in Naita Boma, Kauto Payam, Kapoeta East County. According to the sources, the Murle armed elements attacked Naita Boma, encountered the victims as they were walking from Naita Boma to Lotakawa Boma, opened fire, killing them. The attackers reportedly raided approximately 110 heads of Toposa. The incident was reported at Nanyangachor and Narus Police Stations and investigations are reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: Pieri Payam, Uror
Description: 4.	On 15 October, three primary sources reported that on 13 October, three victims of abduction from the Lou Nuer community were recovered by the authorities in Pibor, GPAA. As recounted by the sources, one of the survivors, a 12-year-old girl was abducted in 2019, while the other two survivors, 18-year-old woman and a 15-year-old boy, were reportedly abducted in 2020 by Murle armed elements from Pieri Payam, Uror County. The abductees were reportedly taken to Manyloden Payam, Gumuruk County, GPAA. Reportedly, the 18-year-old survivor was forced by her abductor to marry another Murle man in Manyloden Payam, with whom she later had a daughter, now six months old, as a result of rape. The abductees were reportedly rescued by the SSPDF and handed them over to the authorities in Pibor, who are  coordinating with protection partners on their family tracing and reunification.

Location of Incident: Pieri Payam, Uror
Description: 4.	On 15 October, three primary sources reported that on 13 October, three victims of abduction from the Lou Nuer community were recovered by the authorities in Pibor, GPAA. As recounted by the sources, one of the survivors, a 12-year-old girl was abducted in 2019, while the other two survivors, 18-year-old woman and a 15-year-old boy, were reportedly abducted in 2020 by Murle armed elements from Pieri Payam, Uror County. The abductees were reportedly taken to Manyloden Payam, Gumuruk County, GPAA. Reportedly, the 18-year-old survivor was forced by her abductor to marry another Murle man in Manyloden Payam, with whom she later had a daughter, now six months old, as a result of rape. The abductees were reportedly rescued by the SSPDF and handed them over to the authorities in Pibor, who are  coordinating with protection partners on their family tracing and reunification.

Location of Incident: Toch West Payam, Gogrial East
Description:
5.	On 19 October, three primary sources reported that on 16 October, seven male civilians were shot and killed during a cattle-related violence between Dinka Apuk and Nuer armed elements in Toch West Payam, Gogrial East County. As recounted by the sources, Dinka Apuk armed elements attacked and opened fire on the Nuer community in the Toch area in Mayom County, Unity State, killing one male Nuer civilian. The attackers reportedly seized an unspecified number of cattle and fled with them back into Toch West Payam. In retaliation, Nuer armed elements reportedly attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Apuk community in Mangol-Apuk village, Toch West Payam, killing six male civilians and fled back into Unity State.

Comment: It is envisaged that this incident will most likely trigger a rise in of cross-border violence between the two communities as the dry season sets in.

Location of Incident: Toch West Payam, Gogrial East
Description:
5.	On 19 October, three primary sources reported that on 16 October, seven male civilians were shot and killed during a cattle-related violence between Dinka Apuk and Nuer armed elements in Toch West Payam, Gogrial East County. As recounted by the sources, Dinka Apuk armed elements attacked and opened fire on the Nuer community in the Toch area in Mayom County, Unity State, killing one male Nuer civilian. The attackers reportedly seized an unspecified number of cattle and fled with them back into Toch West Payam. In retaliation, Nuer armed elements reportedly attacked and opened fire on the Dinka Apuk community in Mangol-Apuk village, Toch West Payam, killing six male civilians and fled back into Unity State.

Comment: It is envisaged that this incident will most likely trigger a rise in of cross-border violence between the two communities as the dry season sets in.

Location of Incident: Malek village, Marial-Lou Payam, Tonj North
Description: 6.	On 19 October, three primary sources reported that on 16 October, Dinka Pan-Lual armed elements shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Pamum community in Malek village, Marial-Lou Payam, Tonj North County. As recounted by the sources, the Dinka Pan-Lual armed attacked and opened fire the victim on suspicion of having stolen their cattle in the past, killing him. The security forces have reportedly mounted a search for the perpetrators to hold them accountable and avoid an escalation.

Location of Incident: Magok village, Toch North Payam, Tonj North
Description: 7.	On 19 October, three primary sources reported that on 13 October, suspected Nuer armed elements attacked and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Apuk community in Magok village, Toch North Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the Nuer armed elements attacked the victim at gunpoint while he was fishing in the river along the border with Unity State and subsequently decapitated him with machetes. The attack was reportedly a revenge action linked to cross-border cattle-related violence/unresolved grievances between the two communities.

Location of Incident: Kunya Boma, Rocrocdong Payam, Jur River County
Description: 8.	On 17 October, one primary source reported that on 29 September, a SSPDF soldier arbitrarily arrested, detained and ill-treated a 27-year-old male civilian from the Luo community in Kunya Boma, Rocrocdong Payam, Jur River County. As recounted by the source, the SSPDF soldier arrested the victim on suspicion of being a SPLA-IO element, which he denied. Reportedly, the victim was detained in retaliation for the killing of one SSPDF soldier during a road ambush in the Jebel Tek area of Kuajena Payam. The victim was reported released later on the same day due to a lack of evidence against him; however, was rearrested on the same day and subsequently transferred to the SSPDF Division 5 Barracks in Wau, where he was detained incommunicado for 16 days. On 13 October, the victim was released following the intervention of a local chief. The victim reportedly declined to file a case against the perpetrators due to a lack of confidence in the justice system.

Location of Incident: Mambe Payam, Maridi
Description:
9.	On 17 October, three secondary sources reported that on 15 October, suspected SPLA-IO and NAS elements abducted two male civilians from the Baka community in Mambe Payam, Maridi County. According to the sources, the suspected SPLA-IO and NAS elements raided a funeral gathering in Mambe Payam, abducted the two civilians and took them towards the border with the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC). 

Comment: Reportedly, the motive for the abduction was likely for forced recruitment into the ranks of the armed groups. The incident had reportedly caused fear and panic among other young men in the area, who have fled into nearby bushes for safety.

Location of Incident: Buong Boma, Buong Payam, Akobo
Description:
1.	On 20 October, multiple sources reported that on 18 October, Murle armed elements from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) shot and killed one male Lou Nuer civilian (age unspecified) in Buong Boma, Buong Payam, Akobo County. According to the sources, the victim and other Lou Nuer civilians were transporting smoked fish from the Pulbuoch fishing camp to Buong Boma when they fell into the ambush set by the assailants. Reportedly, the assailants opened fire on the civilians killing the victim in the process while the other civilians escaped unscathed. 

Comment: The Akobo County authorities reported that the Pulbuoch-Buong Boma- Road in Akobo West, is known for recurrent and targeted attacks on civilians and other travelers by the Murle armed elements.

Location of Incident: Madol Payam, Rumbek North
Description:
2.	On 20 October, multiple sources reported that, on 18 October, armed Nyuong Nuer elements from Panyijar County- Unity State, shot and injured two male Dinka Agaar civilians (ages unspecified) at the Yiga fishing camp in Madol Payam, Rumbek North County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked the Yiga fishing camp for unspecified reasons, shot and injured the victims, and shot and killed two personnel of the South Sudan National Police Service (SSNPS) in the area. Reportedly, the injured victims were taken to a health facility in Maper town for treatment while the assailants fled the scene. 

Comment: This incident is the fourth account received since the beginning of the month of October 2025, indicative a resurgence of cross-border intercommunal violence between the communities. HRD will continue to monitor.

Location of Incident: Madol Payam, Rumbek North
Description:
2.	On 20 October, multiple sources reported that, on 18 October, armed Nyuong Nuer elements from Panyijar County- Unity State, shot and injured two male Dinka Agaar civilians (ages unspecified) at the Yiga fishing camp in Madol Payam, Rumbek North County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked the Yiga fishing camp for unspecified reasons, shot and injured the victims, and shot and killed two personnel of the South Sudan National Police Service (SSNPS) in the area. Reportedly, the injured victims were taken to a health facility in Maper town for treatment while the assailants fled the scene. 

Comment: This incident is the fourth account received since the beginning of the month of October 2025, indicative a resurgence of cross-border intercommunal violence between the communities. HRD will continue to monitor.

Location of Incident: Malual Baai Payam, Aweil East
Description:
3.	On 20 October, multiple secondary sources reported that on 13 October, personnel of the NSS arbitrarily arrested and detained one male civilian (Leader of the Aweil East Youth Association for Malual Baai Payam) in Malual Baai Payam, Aweil East County. According to the sources, the victim was arrested and detained allegedly on the orders of County authorities on allegations of insulting the Aweil East County Commissioner. Reportedly, the victim was arrested and taken to the NSS facility in Wanyjok town where he is detained incommunicado. 

Comment: the arrest and detention of civilians by security/military operatives or law enforcement officers in disregard of procedure constitutes a fundamental violation of human rights.

Location of Incident: Angach village, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East
Description: 4.	On 20 October, three secondary sources reported that on 19 October, armed Dinka Luanyjang elements from Palieng Payam abducted one male Dinka Jaluau civilian (a boy- age unspecified) in Angach village, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Luanyjang elements attacked Angach village in the context of unresolved grievances between the communities and abducted the victim while he was grazing cattle in the area. Reportedly, they also made away with 30 heads of cattle and fled to Palieng Payam unscathed although some of the raided cattle crossed back into Angach village.

Location of Incident: Angach village, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East
Description: 4.	On 20 October, three secondary sources reported that on 19 October, armed Dinka Luanyjang elements from Palieng Payam abducted one male Dinka Jaluau civilian (a boy- age unspecified) in Angach village, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the armed Dinka Luanyjang elements attacked Angach village in the context of unresolved grievances between the communities and abducted the victim while he was grazing cattle in the area. Reportedly, they also made away with 30 heads of cattle and fled to Palieng Payam unscathed although some of the raided cattle crossed back into Angach village.

Location of Incident: Abworo village, in Jor town, Abobo
Description:
1.	On 21 October, one primary source and multiple secondary sources reported that on 14 October, one 20-year-old female victim of abduction was recovered by the authorities in Pibor, GPAA. According to the sources, the victim and 12 other children (including her two sisters) were abducted in 2017 (exact date unspecified) from Abworo village, in Jor town, Abobo County in the Gambella region of Ethiopia and taken to Wotagon village, Lokotromach Payam, Likuangole County, GPAA by the Murle armed elements. Reportedly, on 14 October, the victim escaped from her abductor to whom she was forcibly married for years and was hosted in Pibor by the relatives of her abductor, from where she surrendered herself to the protective custody of the authorities in Pibor on 18 October. 

Comment: the whereabouts of the other 12 children remain unknown, while the GPAA authorities have located the family of the victim and efforts are underway for family reunification.

Location of Incident: Dongkei-Ajith village, Matangai Payam, Rumbek Center
Description: 2.	On 21 October, one secondary source reported that on 19 October, an armed Dinka Pakam element from the Paa-wan subclan of the Gak clan, shot and killed one male civilian from the Paa-buot subclan of the Gak clan in Dongkei-Ajith village, Matangai Payam, Rumbek Center County. According to the source, the reason for this incident was unspecified and the assailant fled the scene towards Cueibet County. Reportedly, this incident has heightened tension between the Paa-buot and the Paa-wan subclans with the possibility of further violence.

Location of Incident: Mareng village in Rualbet Payam, Tonj North
Description: 3.	On 21 October, three secondary sources reported that on 20 October, armed Dinka Atok elements shot and injured two male Dinka Jurbol civilians in Mareng village in Rualbet Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked the Dinka Jurbol community within the context of cattle theft and past grievances. Reportedly, they opened fire to a homestead, injured the victims and raided 15 heads of cattle and an unspecified number of goats and fled the scene. The injured victims were taken to a health facility in Rualbet town for treatment.

Location of Incident: Mareng village in Rualbet Payam, Tonj North
Description: 3.	On 21 October, three secondary sources reported that on 20 October, armed Dinka Atok elements shot and injured two male Dinka Jurbol civilians in Mareng village in Rualbet Payam, Tonj North County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked the Dinka Jurbol community within the context of cattle theft and past grievances. Reportedly, they opened fire to a homestead, injured the victims and raided 15 heads of cattle and an unspecified number of goats and fled the scene. The injured victims were taken to a health facility in Rualbet town for treatment.

Location of Incident: Mundri East town, Mundri East
Description: 4.	On 21 October, multiple secondary sources reported that on 18 October, soldiers of the SSPDF arbitrarily arrested, detained and ill-treated one male civilian (a local chief- age unspecified) in Mundri East town, Mundri East County. According to the sources, the SSPDF soldiers arrested, detained, and ill-treated the victim on accusations of not disclosing the locations of the Sudan People’s Liberation Army- In Opposition (SPLA-IO) and National Salvation Front (NAS) elements. Reportedly, the victim was released on 19 October after paying an unspecified number of cattle to the SSPDF.

Location of Incident: Dangar village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East
Description:
1.	On 22 October, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Akook elements shot and injured two male Dinka Luanyjang civilians (ages unspecified) in Dangar village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources the victims along with other civilians were returning from shopping in Tonj town, Tonj South County to Romic town in Palieng Payam in a commercial passenger vehicle when they were ambushed by the assailants. Reportedly, the armed Dinka Akook elements opened fire on the vehicle injuring the victims and robbed the other passengers of unspecified sums of money and other valuables and fled the scene. The injured victims were taken to a health facility in Romic town for treatment.

Comment: Although the incident bares the hallmarks of an armed robbery, sources reported that it was carried out within the context of retaliatory violence between the Dinka Akook and the Dinka Luanyjang communities for past and unresolved grievances.

Location of Incident: Yeiba village, Ombaci Payam, Yei River
Description: 1.	On 23 October, two secondary sources reported that on 20 and 21 October soldiers arbitrarily arrested and detained three male civilians from the Kakwa tribe in Yeiba village, Ombaci Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, on 20 October, during an investigation in Yeiba village, the SSPDF soldiers arrested and detained two male civilians (aged 19 and 21 years old) on allegations of being intelligence elements of the National Salvation Front (NAS). Reportedly, on 21 October, one traditional ruler followed up on their arrest with the SSPDF and was also arrested and detained. On 22 October all three victims were released although the 19- and 21-year-old victims paid 400,000 and 500,000 South Sudan Pounds (SSP) respectively to the SSPDF for their release.

Location of Incident: Nuier village, Maruwa Hills, Verthet County, GPAA
Description:
2.	On 23 October, multiple secondary sources reported that on 22 October, armed Toposa elements from Kapoeta East County- Eastern Equatoria State, shot and killed four male Murle civilians (ages unspecified) in Nuier village, Maruwa Hills, Verthet County, GPAA. According to the sources, the assailants invaded Nuier village and attacked a cattle camp in the area. Reportedly, in response, the Murle youths mobilized and attacked the assailants resulting in the death of four male Murle civilians and an unspecified number of armed Toposa elements and the assailants fled the scene.

Comment: HRD will continue to engage with County authorities for more information on this incident, especially for possible casualty updates.

Location of Incident: Nuier village, Maruwa Hills, Verthet County, GPAA
Description:
2.	On 23 October, multiple secondary sources reported that on 22 October, armed Toposa elements from Kapoeta East County- Eastern Equatoria State, shot and killed four male Murle civilians (ages unspecified) in Nuier village, Maruwa Hills, Verthet County, GPAA. According to the sources, the assailants invaded Nuier village and attacked a cattle camp in the area. Reportedly, in response, the Murle youths mobilized and attacked the assailants resulting in the death of four male Murle civilians and an unspecified number of armed Toposa elements and the assailants fled the scene.

Comment: HRD will continue to engage with County authorities for more information on this incident, especially for possible casualty updates.

Location of Incident: Nyin-Acuil village, Toch East Payam, Gogrial East
Description: 3.	On 23 October, three secondary sources reported that on 21 October, armed Nuer elements from Mayom County- Unity State, shot and killed two male Dinka Apuk civilians (ages unspecified) in Nyin-Acuil village, Toch East Payam, Gogrial East County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked the Dinka Apuk community and opened fire on a random homestead, killing the victims and they fled the scene into Mayom County. Reportedly, this incident is linked to a protracted history of cross-border violence between Nuer and Dinka communities along the shared border between Unity and Warrap States.

Location of Incident: Wadhallelo Boma, Rocrocdong Payam, Jur River
Description: 4.	On 23 October, one primary and one secondary source reported that on 21 October, elements of the SPLA-IO unlawfully arrested, detained and illtreated three male Luo civilians (25, 27 and 28 years old) in Wadhallelo Boma, Rocrocdong Payam, Jur River County. According to the sources, the 28-year-old victim was arrested by SPLA-IO elements at the Jur River, while trying to board a ferry to Wau, and detained at the SPLA-IO barracks on allegations of stealing rifles belonging to the SPLA-IO. Reportedly, the victim was subjected to ill-treatment while in detention until he escaped in the later hours and crossed the river into Wau and reported the incident to the Nazareth Police Post. The victim later received treatment at a health facility in Wau town, where he flagged that on the same day, his two brothers were also arrested and are still being detained by the SPLA-IO elements on the same allegations.

Location of Incident: Tambura town, Tambura
Description: 5.	On 23 October, four secondary sources reported that on 17 October, one soldier of the SSPDF raped a nine-year-old girl in Tambura town, Tambura County. According to the sources, the victim and her seven-year-old brother were returning to the Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) camp from selling bread when they were intercepted by the SSPDF soldier who lured the victim and her brother to his house to make allegedly make payment for some bread. The soldier locked the boy in a room, and took the victim to a nearby bush, raped her and fled the scene. The victim was found by her family and taken to a health facility in Tambura town where she received medical and psychological assistance and the incident was reported to the Tambura Police Station where investigations are ongoing.

Location of Incident: Ombaci Boma, Otogo Payam, Yei River
Description:
1.	On 24 February, two secondary sources reported that on 20 October, a soldier of the SSPDF raped one 19-year-old woman from the Keliko tribe in Ombaci Boma, Otogo Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, the soldier forced the victim out of her home at gunpoint to a nearby bush, coerced her to strip and raped her, after her family failed to give him food when he demanded. Reportedly, on 21 October, the victim was taken to a medical facility in Omabaci Boma where she was administered medical first aid. 

Comment: No arrest has been made in relation to this incident as the soldier is allegedly seen roaming the vicinity with impunity and a clear violation of international and national human rights laws and codes of military conduct.

Location of Incident: Loriyok Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi
Description: 2.	On 24 October, three secondary sources reported that, on 21 October, personnel of the NSS arbitrarily arrested, ill-treated and detained two male Buya civilians (aged 28 and 40 years old) in Loriyok Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County. According to the sources the NSS personnel arrested the victims at the Loriyok market and ill-treated them in the process and detained them at the NSS facility in Torit town. Reportedly, the victims were arrested on allegations of mobilizing the Buya armed youths to join the Sudan People’s Liberation Army- In Opposition (SPLA-IO) and plotting an attack on Loriyok Boma.

Location of Incident: Kathura village, Palieng Payam, Tonj East
Description: 3.	On 26 October, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Padhel elements shot and killed one male Dinka Kongor civilian (age unspecified) in Kathura village, Palieng Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the assailants shot and killed the victim on accusation of defrauding other cattle dealers in a cattle-related transaction. Reportedly, the assailants immediately fled the scene, and the security forces and local authorities have launched a manhunt for the ringleader who is alleged to have shot and killed the victim.

Location of Incident: Akoi village, Gogrial Payam, Gogrial West
Description: 4.	On 26 October, three secondary sources reported that on 24 October, suspected armed Dinka Kuac elements from Kuac North Payam, attacked, stabbed and killed one male Dinka Aguok civilian in Akoi village, Gogrial Payam, Gogrial West County. According to the sources, the assailants invaded the home of the victim, stabbed and killed him within the context of past and unresolved grievances between the communities following s protracted territorial dispute. Reportedly, the assailants fled the scene, and the authorities have opened an investigation into this incident to identify and apprehend the perpetrators.

Location of Incident: Rumabuth village, Palieng Payam, Tonj East
Description: 5.	On 26 October, four secondary sources reported that on 25 October, soldiers of the SSPDF extrajudicially executed two male Dinka Luanyjang civilian suspects (ages 25 and 28 years old) in Rumabuth village, Palieng Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, in April 2025 (exact date unspecified) the victims were arrested and detained at the Romic police Station on allegations of cattle theft. Reportedly, on 25 October, the victims were extracted from the Romic Police Station and taken to Rumabuth village, where they were tied to a tree and executed by firing squad allegedly on the petition of their local chiefs and on the orders of the SSPDF commander and their bodies were given to their relatives for burial.

Location of Incident: Makuei village, Manyangok Payam, Tonj South
Description: 5.	On 26 October, four secondary sources reported that on 25 October, soldiers of the SSPDF extrajudicially executed two male Dinka Luanyjang civilian suspects (ages 25 and 28 years old) in Rumabuth village, Palieng Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, in April 2025 (exact date unspecified) the victims were arrested and detained at the Romic police Station on allegations of cattle theft. Reportedly, on 25 October, the victims were extracted from the Romic Police Station and taken to Rumabuth village, where they were tied to a tree and executed by firing squad allegedly on the petition of their local chiefs and on the orders of the SSPDF commander and their bodies were given to their relatives for burial.

Location of Incident: Jombu Boma, Mugwo Payam, Yei River
Description:
1.	On 27 October, two secondary sources reported that in early October 2025 (exact date unspecified) three soldiers of the SSPDF raped one 39-year-old woman from the Kakwa tribe in Jombu Boma, Mugwo Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, the soldiers met the victim in her farm in Jombu Boma, and raped her at gunpoint, and fled the scene. Reportedly, the victim was taken to a health facility in Yei town for medical treatment but due to the victim’s inability to identify the soldiers, the incident was not reported to the police for investigation.

Comment: This incident is reflective of the general lack of accountability within the ranks of the security and defense forces and worsens the vulnerability of the civilians in the area especially women and children.

Location of Incident: Chahari Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos
Description: 2.	On 27 October, three secondary sources reported that, on 24 October, five armed Logir elements shot and injured one 56-year-old male civilians (a Sudanese National from Darfur) in Chahari Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos County. According to the sources, the assailants stormed Chahari Boma to raid cattle belonging to the Darfurian community, when they met the victim, shot and injured him, raided 12 heads of cattle and fled the scene. Reportedly, the victim was taken to a health facility in Chahari Boma for treatment and the incident was reported to the Chahari Police Station where investigations are ongoing although no arrests have been made.

Location of Incident: Keach village, Wangbuor Payam, Mayom
Description: 3.	On 27 October, three secondary sources reported that on 25 October, five Jagay Nuer civilians (four adult males and one 16-year-old girl) were shot and injured during violence between armed elements from the Chienglien subclan from Wangbuor Payam and Chiengdieng subclan from Kuerbona Payam in Keach village, Wangbuor Payam, Mayom County. According to the sources, the armed confrontation broke out during a traditional ceremony hosted by the Nul Nuer spiritual leader leading to the casualties. Reportedly, the injured victims were taken to a health facility in Mankien town for treatment, while security forces were deployed to the area to contain the situation.

Location of Incident: Majama area in Kuernguene village, Wathnyuotna Payam, Guit
Description:
4.	On 27 October, multiple sources reported that on 25 October, unidentified armed elements shot and killed tow male civilians (a 47-year-old Jagay Nuer Man from Koch County and a 29-year-old Nyuong Nuer man from Panyijiar County) in the Majama area in Kuernguene village, Wathnyuotna Payam, Guit County. According to the sources, the assailants opened fire on three male civilians while they were making charcoal, killing the two victims while the third civilian escaped unscathed.  Reportedly, the motive for this attack remains unknown, and the police are investigating this incident although no arrests have been made.

Comment: Sources have it that the assailants are allegedly from Ruweng Administrative Area (RAA) and that the incident could be linked to past and unresolved grievances between RAA and Unity State, following previous operations in RAA by armed elements from Unity State.

Location of Incident: Angotek village, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East
Description:
5.	On 27 October, multiple secondary sources reported that on the same day, four male Dinka Jaluau civilians (ages unspecified) were killed during aerial bombardments by the SSPDF in Angotek village, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the SSPDF conducted aerial bomardments in Angotek village in Wunlit Payam and Mader village in Ngabagok Payam while pursuing armed Dinka Luanyjang elements who had raided 30 heads of cattle from the Dinka Jaluau community in Riak-Ayien village in Wunlit Payam, the previous night. Reportedly, the victims were killed in Angotek village while an unspecified number of cattle were killed both in Angotek and Mader villages respectively. 

Comment: HRD will continue to monitor the situation and engage with authorities for more information on possible casualties and urge the leadership of the SSPDF to exercise restraint and respect international humanitarian law and international human rights law in their operations.

Location of Incident: Wunlit town, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East
Description: 6.	On 27 October, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Luanyjang elements shot and killed one male Dinka Jaluau civilian (age unspecified) in Wunlit town, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the assailants invaded Wunlit town, in the context of past and unresolved grievances between the communities, shot and killed the victim and fled the scene towards Paweng Payam. Reportedly, no cattle were raided, and no arrests have been made in connection with this.

Location of Incident: Jalweng village, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East
Description:
7.	On 27 October, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, armed Dinka Pan-Juaj elements shot and killed one male Dinka Pakiic civilian in Jalweng village, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the assailants opened fire on the victim’s family homestead in Jalweng village within the context of subclan violence, killing the victim and they fled the scene. Reportedly, security forces have been deployed to the area to investigate and apprehend the suspects, but no arrests have been made.

Comment: both Pan-Juaj and Pankiic are subclans under the Dinka Jaluau section in Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County. HRD will continue to follow up on this report for more information.

Location of Incident: Mupoi Payam, Tambura
Description: 8.	On 27 October, multiple secondary sources reported that on 24 October, soldiers of the SSPDF arbitrarily arrested and detained one male civilian (the Chief of Mupoi Payam – age unspecified) in Mupoi Payam, Tambura County. According to the sources, the SSPDF soldiers arrested the victim in Mupoi Payam, on allegations that the victim was responsible for the spread of misinformation about the operations of the SSPDF in the area. Reportedly, the victim was transferred to the SSPDF barracks in Tambura town where he was detained although Tambura County authorities are negotiating for his release.

Location of Incident: Ngauro and Loki Bomas, Ngauro Payam, Budi
Description: 1.	On 28 October, three secondary sources reported that on 13 and 14 October, three male civilians from the Didinga community were shot and killed during violence between armed Didinga elements in Ngauro and Loki Bomas, Ngauro Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, on 14 October, a group of five armed Didinga elements from Loki Boma attacked Ngauro Boma and opened fire on a 25-year-old male civilian, killing him, allegedly in revenge for the killing of one 29-year-old male Didinga civilian from Loki Boma by armed elements from Ngauro Boma during a cattle raid in Loki Boma on 13 October 2025. Reportedly, in retaliation, the armed Didinga elements from Ngauro Boma stormed Loki Boma, encountered and opened fire on a 27-year-old victim in his farm, killing him. The incidents were reported at Ngauro Police Station and investigations are reportedly ongoing; however, no arrests have been made so far.

Location of Incident: Pochalla Town
Description: 2.	On 28 October, two secondary sources reported that on 28 September, one female victim of abduction from the Anyuak community in Pochalla County was recovered by the authorities in Pibor, GPAA. According to the sources, the victim (three years old at the time) was abducted by Murle armed elements  in 2017 (exact date unspecified) from Pochalla Town and transferred to Lenyeris Payam, Pibor County, where she was forced to live with a female relative of one of the abductors.  Reportedly, in August 2025 (exact date unspecified) the victim was initially recovered by authorities in Pibor and taken to the interim care center, from where she escaped and was again recovered on 28 September 2025 and subsequently transferred to Juba for onward reunification with her family in Pochalla County.

Location of Incident: Thongura village, Nyiel Payam, Toch
Description: 3.	On 28 October, two secondary sources reported that on 25 October, unidentified armed elements from Unity State shot and killed two male civilians from the Nuer community in Thongura village, Nyiel Payam, Toch County, Ruweng Administrative Area. The motive for the attack remains unknown. Reportedly, security forces were deployed to Thongura village; however, the assailants had fled back to Unity State.

Location of Incident: Malual-Cum and Kacuat villages, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East
Description: 4.	On 28 October, three primary sources reported that on the same day, 20 civilians (11 Dinka Pajuker male civilians and 10 Dinka Pakiir civilians including one woman) were injured during violence between youths from the Dinka Pakiir and Pajuker sub-clans in Malual-Cum and Kacuat villages, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, a group of Dinka Pakiir youths armed with sticks attacked one Dinka Pajuker family in Malual-Cum village and injured 10 male civilians including a local government official on allegations of elopement of one female civilian from the Dinka Pakiir sub-clan without compliance with traditional rites. Reportedly, in retaliation, the Dinka Pajuker youths armed with sticks also attacked the Dinka Pakiir community in Kacuat village and injured 10 civilians including one woman, and burnt down three homesteads. The injured victims on both sides are reportedly being treated at health care facilities in Malual-Cum and Kacuat villages respectively, while five severe cases were evacuated to a health facility in Tonj Town for advanced treatment. Reportedly, security forces have been deployed to the area to quell the situation and apprehend the perpetrators.

Location of Incident: Malual-Cum and Kacuat villages, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East
Description: 4.	On 28 October, three primary sources reported that on the same day, 20 civilians (11 Dinka Pajuker male civilians and 10 Dinka Pakiir civilians including one woman) were injured during violence between youths from the Dinka Pakiir and Pajuker sub-clans in Malual-Cum and Kacuat villages, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, a group of Dinka Pakiir youths armed with sticks attacked one Dinka Pajuker family in Malual-Cum village and injured 10 male civilians including a local government official on allegations of elopement of one female civilian from the Dinka Pakiir sub-clan without compliance with traditional rites. Reportedly, in retaliation, the Dinka Pajuker youths armed with sticks also attacked the Dinka Pakiir community in Kacuat village and injured 10 civilians including one woman, and burnt down three homesteads. The injured victims on both sides are reportedly being treated at health care facilities in Malual-Cum and Kacuat villages respectively, while five severe cases were evacuated to a health facility in Tonj Town for advanced treatment. Reportedly, security forces have been deployed to the area to quell the situation and apprehend the perpetrators.

Location of Incident: Rukruk Boma, Lomeyen Payam, Kapoeta North
Description: 1.	On 29 October, three secondary sources reported that on 23 October, Buya armed elements from Napak Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County shot and killed one 28-year-old male civilian and injured a 21-year-old male civilian, both from the Toposa community, during an attempted cattle raid in Rukruk Boma, Lomeyen Payam, Kapoeta North County. According to the sources, Buya armed elements attacked Rukruk Boma and opened fire on two male civilians while they were walking from Rukruk Boma to Natiir Boma, killing one and injuring another. Reportedly, armed Toposa youth repulsed the attackers who fled without raiding any cattle. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Riwoto Town for medical treatment. The incident was reported at the Kapoeta North Police Station and investigations are reportedly underway.

Location of Incident: Rukruk Boma, Lomeyen Payam, Kapoeta North
Description: 1.	On 29 October, three secondary sources reported that on 23 October, Buya armed elements from Napak Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County shot and killed one 28-year-old male civilian and injured a 21-year-old male civilian, both from the Toposa community, during an attempted cattle raid in Rukruk Boma, Lomeyen Payam, Kapoeta North County. According to the sources, Buya armed elements attacked Rukruk Boma and opened fire on two male civilians while they were walking from Rukruk Boma to Natiir Boma, killing one and injuring another. Reportedly, armed Toposa youth repulsed the attackers who fled without raiding any cattle. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Riwoto Town for medical treatment. The incident was reported at the Kapoeta North Police Station and investigations are reportedly underway.

Location of Incident: Rumbek Town, Rumbek Center
Description: 2.	On 29 October, multiple secondary sources reported that on 28 October, one 25-year-old female civilian was shot and injured during violence between joint security forces  and a group of unidentified armed elements in the Deng Nhial residential area in Rumbek Town, Rumbek Center County. According to the sources, the joint security forces while on patrol encountered a group of unidentified armed elements and in pursuit of these armed elements, one female civilian was shot and injured in crossfire in the ensuing confrontation. The victim was reportedly evacuated to a health care facility in Rumbek Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Makuac Payam, Tonj East
Description: 3.	On 29 October, multiple secondary sources reported that on the same day, one male civilian from the Dinka Luanyjang community was killed during aerial bombardment by the SSPDF in Makuac Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the SSPDF conducted aerial bombardments in Ngadiang village in Makuac Payam, Meer village in Ngabagok Payam, and Nyingor village in Paweng Payam, all in Tonj East County, allegedly targeting positions occupied by armed elements reportedly planning multiple attacks on neighboring communities and refusing to voluntarily disarm. Reportedly, during the airstrikes in Makuac Payam, one male civilian was killed. In addition, eight heads of cattle were also reportedly killed in Makuac Payam, and six heads of cattle were killed each in Paweng and Ngabagok Payams.

Location of Incident: Makuac Payam, Tonj East
Description: 3.	On 29 October, multiple secondary sources reported that on the same day, one male civilian from the Dinka Luanyjang community was killed during aerial bombardment by the SSPDF in Makuac Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the SSPDF conducted aerial bombardments in Ngadiang village in Makuac Payam, Meer village in Ngabagok Payam, and Nyingor village in Paweng Payam, all in Tonj East County, allegedly targeting positions occupied by armed elements reportedly planning multiple attacks on neighboring communities and refusing to voluntarily disarm. Reportedly, during the airstrikes in Makuac Payam, one male civilian was killed. In addition, eight heads of cattle were also reportedly killed in Makuac Payam, and six heads of cattle were killed each in Paweng and Ngabagok Payams.

Location of Incident: Khor Jamus Boma, Rocrocdong Payam, Jur River
Description:
4.	On 29 October, four secondary sources reported that on 9 August, three SPLA-IO elements gang raped one 35-year-old female civilian from the Luo community in Khor Jamus Boma, Rocrocdong Payam, Jur River County. According to the sources, the SPLA-IO elements accosted the victim while she ascended the Khor Jamus hilly areas in search of network to communicate with her family in Wau and proceeded to gang rape her. The sources further informed that the victim reported the incident at the police station in Rocrocdong Payam and was subsequently evacuated to a health care facility in Wau Town for medical treatment. Reportedly, the suspects were apprehended and detained at the Rocrocdong Police Station; however, they were later extracted by the SSPDF commander and integrated into the ranks of the SSPDF.

Comment: The alleged interference by the SSPDF commander reflects a broader issue of accountability and highlights how military involvement undermines investigations and the rule of law. This lack of accountability contributes to the culture of impunity and perpetuates violence against women and girls in the region.

Location of Incident: Aweil Jadid residential area, Wau Town, Wau
Description: 5.	On 28 and 29 October, one primary source reported that in May 2024 (exact date unspecified) one SSPDF soldier raped a 16-year-old girl from the Bai community in Aweil Jadid residential area, Wau Town, Wau County. Reportedly, the SSPDF soldier (husband to the victim’s aunt) raped the victim after she was home alone while her aunt had gone to the market in Wau Town and the other children had gone to fetch water from a nearby pump. The survivor reported the incident to the police in Wau Town and was taken to a health care facility for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Alero Village, Mugwo Payam, Yei River
Description:
1.	On 30 October, three secondary sources reported that on 28 October, suspected NAS elements abducted two civilians (humanitarian workers – staff of a local non-governmental organisation (NGO)) in Alero Village, Mugwo Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, two suspected NAS elements intercepted and subsequently abducted the victims while they were returning from a data collection exercise. The abductors also reportedly confiscated their phones and assessment tablets. Reportedly, the abductors demanded 50,000 United States Dollars for their release and threatened to kill them if the ransom was not met. On 29 October, the family of one of the abductees reportedly paid 4,000,000 South Sudan Pounds (SSP) to secure his release, while the NGO reportedly negotiated the release of the other victim. Both victims were released on 29 October.

Comment: Observably, armed groups/elements continue to target humanitarian workers for ransom – in breach of international human rights and humanitarian law. including national penal laws.

Location of Incident: Tala Boma, Ngauro Payam, Budi
Description:
2.	On 30 October, three secondary sources reported that on 13 October, Didinga armed elements shot and killed one 16-year-old girl in Tala Boma, Ngauro Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, a group of five Didinga armed elements attacked a gold mine in Tala Boma and opened fire on the mine workers from Ngauro Boma, killing one. Reportedly, the attack was to deter non-indigenes of Tala Boma from accessing the goldmine, which the Tala community has claimed exclusive ownership. The incident was reported to the Ngauro police station and investigations are underway.

Comment: Reportedly, on 14 October, the armed youths from Ngauro Boma attacked Tala Boma and an armed confrontation ensue; however, no casualties were reported. Tension remains high in the area.

Location of Incident: Dour village, Chuil Payam, Nyirol
Description: 3.	On 29 October, multiple sources reported that on 1 October, Murle armed elements from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) shot and killed two male civilians, injured another, and abducted two female civilians (including an 11-year-old girl) in Dour village, Chuil Payam, Nyirol County. According to the sources, the Murle armed elements attacked and opened fire on a group of civilians (men, women and children) from the Lou Nuer community along the Yakuach–Lankien road, killing two male civilians, injuring another, and abducted a mother and her 11-year-old daughter. Reportedly, the abducted woman escaped from her abductors the following day, while the girl remains missing.

Location of Incident: Dour village, Chuil Payam, Nyirol
Description: 3.	On 29 October, multiple sources reported that on 1 October, Murle armed elements from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) shot and killed two male civilians, injured another, and abducted two female civilians (including an 11-year-old girl) in Dour village, Chuil Payam, Nyirol County. According to the sources, the Murle armed elements attacked and opened fire on a group of civilians (men, women and children) from the Lou Nuer community along the Yakuach–Lankien road, killing two male civilians, injuring another, and abducted a mother and her 11-year-old daughter. Reportedly, the abducted woman escaped from her abductors the following day, while the girl remains missing.

Location of Incident: Dour village, Chuil Payam, Nyirol
Description: 3.	On 29 October, multiple sources reported that on 1 October, Murle armed elements from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) shot and killed two male civilians, injured another, and abducted two female civilians (including an 11-year-old girl) in Dour village, Chuil Payam, Nyirol County. According to the sources, the Murle armed elements attacked and opened fire on a group of civilians (men, women and children) from the Lou Nuer community along the Yakuach–Lankien road, killing two male civilians, injuring another, and abducted a mother and her 11-year-old daughter. Reportedly, the abducted woman escaped from her abductors the following day, while the girl remains missing.

Location of Incident: Tit-lel-pakoi village, Malek Payam, Yirol East
Description: 4.	On 30 October, multiple sources reported that on 29 October, Nyuong Nuer armed elements from Panyijar County, Unity State shot and killed seven (two women) civilians and injured four others from the Dinka Ciec community in Tit-lel-pakoi village, Malek Payam, Yirol East County. According to the sources, the Nyuong Nuer armed elements Nyuong Nuer armed elements attacked a fishing camp in Malek Payam, opened fire on the occupants, killing seven and injuring four others. Reportedly, two of the injured victims in critical condition were evacuated to a health care facility in Yirol Town, Yirol West County for medical treatment. Tension remains high in the area with the possibility of retaliation by Dinka Ciec armed elements.

Location of Incident: Tit-lel-pakoi village, Malek Payam, Yirol East
Description: 4.	On 30 October, multiple sources reported that on 29 October, Nyuong Nuer armed elements from Panyijar County, Unity State shot and killed seven (two women) civilians and injured four others from the Dinka Ciec community in Tit-lel-pakoi village, Malek Payam, Yirol East County. According to the sources, the Nyuong Nuer armed elements Nyuong Nuer armed elements attacked a fishing camp in Malek Payam, opened fire on the occupants, killing seven and injuring four others. Reportedly, two of the injured victims in critical condition were evacuated to a health care facility in Yirol Town, Yirol West County for medical treatment. Tension remains high in the area with the possibility of retaliation by Dinka Ciec armed elements.

Location of Incident: Malual-Ador village, Pathuon East Payam, Gogrial East
Description: 5.	On 30 October, three primary sources reported that on the same day, Nuer armed elements from Mayom County, Unity State shot and killed two male civilians from the Dinka Apuk in Malual-Ador village, Pathuon East Payam, Gogrial East County. According to the sources, the Nuer armed elements attacked and opened fire on a cattle camp in Malual-Ador village, killing two civilians. The attackers also seized 25 heads of cattle and fled back to Unity State.

Location of Incident: Malual-Ador village, Pathuon East Payam, Gogrial East
Description: 5.	On 30 October, three primary sources reported that on the same day, Nuer armed elements from Mayom County, Unity State shot and killed two male civilians from the Dinka Apuk in Malual-Ador village, Pathuon East Payam, Gogrial East County. According to the sources, the Nuer armed elements attacked and opened fire on a cattle camp in Malual-Ador village, killing two civilians. The attackers also seized 25 heads of cattle and fled back to Unity State.

Location of Incident: Ombaci Boma, Yei Town Payam, Yei River
Description: 1.	On 31 October, two secondary sources reported that on 22 October, unidentified armed elements gangraped one 22-year-old woman (with disability) from the Kakwa community in Ombaci Boma, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, two unidentified armed elements accosted the victim while she was returning from the Ombaci market in Yei Town and gang raped her at gunpoint. Reportedly, the perpetrators also seized some of the victim’s food stuff and an unspecified sum of money. The incident was reported to the police on 24 October; however, no action was taken since the victim could not identify the assailants.

Location of Incident: Ombaci Boma, Yei Town Payam, Yei River
Description: 1.	On 31 October, two secondary sources reported that on 22 October, unidentified armed elements gangraped one 22-year-old woman (with disability) from the Kakwa community in Ombaci Boma, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, two unidentified armed elements accosted the victim while she was returning from the Ombaci market in Yei Town and gang raped her at gunpoint. Reportedly, the perpetrators also seized some of the victim’s food stuff and an unspecified sum of money. The incident was reported to the police on 24 October; however, no action was taken since the victim could not identify the assailants.

Location of Incident: Ngauro Boma, Ngauro Payam, Budi
Description: 2.	On 31 October, three secondary sources reported that on 15 October, Toposa armed elements from Namuruyang Payam, Kapoeta South County shot and killed one 30-year-old male civilian from the Didinga community in Ngauro Boma, Ngauro Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, the Toposa armed elements, while returning from pursuing Didinga armed elements who had earlier on attempted to raid cattle, opened fire on the victim who was bathing in a river in the outskirts of Ngauro Boma, killing him. Reportedly, the incident was reported at Ngauro Police Station and investigations are reportedly ongoing; however, no arrests have been made so far.

Location of Incident: Mayen village, Bombil Boma, Ajak Kuac Payam, Twic
Description:
3.	On 2 November, multiple secondary sources reported that on 1 November, SPLA-IO and allied Nuer armed elements shot and killed two male civilians from the Dinka Twic Mayardit community in Mayen village, Bombil Boma, Ajak Kuac Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, joint SPLA-IO and Nuer armed elements attacked the SSPDF barracks in Mayen village, killing two civilians who were in the vicinity. Reportedly, three SSPDF soldiers were shot and killed and three others were injured. The attackers also reportedly seized firearms and ammunition. 

Comment: The occurred within the context of heightened tensions and clashes between the SPLA-IO and the SSDPF in Twic County [see HRD Daily Report 8 and 9 October 2025].

Location of Incident: Mayen village, Bombil Boma, Ajak Kuac Payam, Twic
Description:
3.	On 2 November, multiple secondary sources reported that on 1 November, SPLA-IO and allied Nuer armed elements shot and killed two male civilians from the Dinka Twic Mayardit community in Mayen village, Bombil Boma, Ajak Kuac Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, joint SPLA-IO and Nuer armed elements attacked the SSPDF barracks in Mayen village, killing two civilians who were in the vicinity. Reportedly, three SSPDF soldiers were shot and killed and three others were injured. The attackers also reportedly seized firearms and ammunition. 

Comment: The occurred within the context of heightened tensions and clashes between the SPLA-IO and the SSDPF in Twic County [see HRD Daily Report 8 and 9 October 2025].

Location of Incident: Wunlit Payam, Tonj East
Description: 4.	On 2 November, three primary sources reported that on 31 October, Dinka Gok armed elements from Tiap-Tiap Payam, Cueibet County, Lakes State shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Jaluau community in Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the Dinka Gok armed elements attacked and opened fire on the victim while he was grazing his cattle in the Toch area along the shared border with Lakes State, killing him, and thereafter fled the scene. The attack was reportedly a revenge action linked to past/unresolved grievances in the context of cross-border violence between the two communities.

Location of Incident: Wau Town, Wau County
Description:
5.	On31 October, one primary source reported that on 25 August, NSS and SSPDF personnel arbitrarily arrested, detained and ill-treated one 30-year-old male civilian from the Luo community in Wau Town, Wau County. As recounted by the source, the victim was summoned to the police station by a member of the Crime and Investigation Division; however, upon arrival, he was forced into a vehicle belonging to the NSS and transferred to the NSS detention facility in Maz Bhar, where he was  detained for two days, allegedly for being the son of SPLA-IO General Bol Wek, who is being pursued by the SSPDF. The victim was reportedly subsequently transferred to the Police Emergency Response Unit where he spent one night before being transferred to the SSPDF Military Intelligence Unit where he was detained, beaten, and deprived of medical attention. Reportedly, the victim’s wife was also arrested and detained for one night when she visited the SSPDF facility to inquire about her husband, and she was released the following day.

Comment: The victim was reportedly released on 24 October; however, mobile phone, other personal belongings as well as 40,000 South Sudan Pounds (SSP) were confiscated. The victim was also warned by the SSPDF to not enter the Kuanya area.

Location of Incident: Kpangima Boma, Nabanga area, Tambura
Description: 6.	On  31 October, one secondary source reported that on the same day, suspected SPLA-IO elements abducted six civilians – three women (two 39 and one 38 years old) and three men (30 and 39 years old), from the Azande community in Kpangima Boma, Nabanga area, Tambura County. According to the source, the suspected SPLA-IO elements abducted the victims while they were farming in the area and transferred them to an unknown location. Reportedly, the 30-year-old abductee escaped and reported the incident to the police in Tambura Town. The whereabouts of the other five abducts remains unknown.

Location of Incident: Losawo village, Longiro Boma, Idali Payam, Imehejek Administrative Area
Description: 1.	On 3 November, three secondary sources reported that on 31 October, Lopit armed elements from Lobohang village, Longiro Boma, shot and killed one 32-year-old male civilian (a cattle herder) from the Lopit community during an attempted cattle raid in Losawo village, Longiro Boma, Idali Payam, Imehejek Administrative Area. According to the sources, a group of five Lopit armed elements stormed Losawo village and opened fire on the victim who was grazing his cattle in the area, killing him. Reportedly, the Lopit armed elements in Losawo village responded and repulsed the attackers who fled towards Lobohang village without raiding any of the cattle. The incident was reported at the Idali Police Station and investigations are reportedly underway.

Location of Incident: Apet Boma, Malek Payam, Rumbek Centre
Description: 2.	On 3 November, multiple sources reported that on 2 November, an unidentified armed element shot and killed three (one woman) civilians from the Dinka Gak clan/Pakam Section/Agaar community in Apet Boma, Malek Payam, Rumbek Centre County. According to the sources, the assailnats attacked and opened fire on the victims while they were driving their cattle from Rumbek Center County to Meen Payam in Rumbek North County, killing them, and thereafter fled the scene. The attack was reportedly a  suspected revenge action.

Location of Incident: Tam village, Fup Payam, Mayom
Description:
3.	On 2 and 3 November, three secondary sources reported that on 1 November, one Bul Nuer armed element shot and killed two male civilians (25 and 28 years old) from the Bul Nuer community in Tam village, Fup Payam, Mayom County. According to the sources, the assailant attacked and opened fire on the vicitms during a traditional ceremony in Tam village, killing them, reportedly in retaliation for a past unresolved altercation between the assailant and the 28-year-old victim in 2024 (exact date unspecified). Reportedly, security forces were deployed to contain the situation although the assailant had fled the scene.

Comments: Retaliatory attacks persist in various parts of Unity State due to unresolved grievances, exacerbated by the proliferation of small arms and light weapons as well as impunity.

Location of Incident: Romic Town, Palieng Payam, Tonj East
Description: 4.	On 3 November, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, the SSPDF shot and injured one male civilian (a cattle trader) from the Dinka Luanyjang community in Romic Town, Palieng Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, SSPDF soldiers arrested and detained 15 Dinka Luanyjang male civilians (cattle traders) allegedly on the orders of the local authorities on accusation to illegal sale of cattle; however, the victims reportedly challenged the legality of their arrest and the situation escalated into an altercation. The local authorities allegedly ordered the SSPDF to use force, during which one soldier shot and injured one of the traders. The victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Marial-Lou Payam, Tonj North County for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Tambura Town, Tambura
Description: 5.	On 3 November, multiple sources reported that on 28 October, the SSPDF arbitrarily arrested and detained one male civilian from the Azande community in Tambura Town, Tambura County. According to the sources, SSPDF soldiers arrested the victim on allegations of illegal purchase of ammunition from Azande armed elements who have been fighting in Tambura (an allegation he denied) and transferred him to their barracks, where he was detained and reportedly beaten up and deprived of food while in detention. County authorities reportedly attempted to secure his release to no avail.

Location of Incident: Malek-Agok, Rumbek East
Description:
An 18-year-old woman reportedly fleeing a forced marriage, reported to HRD office, seeking protection

On 2 October 2025, HRD interviewed an 18-year-old woman (names on file) who reported to its office, seeking protection. The woman stated that in May 2025, her parents withdrew her from a secondary (name on file) she was attending in Rumbek town of Rumbek Center County, to force her into a marriage with a man of their choice living in Malek-agok Payam of Rumbek East County. The woman explained that her parents arranged this marriage despite her manifested intention to continue studying. On 30 September 2025, her parents (with the support of her brother) reportedly handed her over to the suitor who had given them a dowry amounting to some 64 cows. She allegedly escaped from the latter’s house in Malek-agok Payam on the night of 1st October and arrived at the security gate of UNMISS FO compound in Rumbek town in the morning of 2 October. She declared seeking protection from her family relatives who reportedly threatened to beat her if she refused to marry the man they have chosen for her. The woman reiterated that she just wanted to go back to school, but mentioned, she was afraid of going back home where she is likely to be beaten up and mistreated by her family relatives whom she rejected the choice.

At the very time of this interview, HRD learned that some of the woman’s relatives, in her pursuit, had gathered in front of the FO compound’s security gate, waiting to apprehend her (when she will be leaving the UNMISS premises) and to forcefully take her back to her marital home.

Hence, HRD called and referred the case to the Lakes State Minister of Gender, Child and Social welfare, who upon consultation with the Acting State Governor came (in company of the Director General of her Ministry) to collect the woman inside UNMISS FO compound. HRD urged the Minister to carefully handle the case at her level, keeping in mind the woman’s right to education, her right to enter into marriage with her free and full consent as well as her right to physical integrity and her safety. 

Comments: HRD will continue following up on the case with the other local Protection cluster partners to advocate further for the woman’s right to education, her right to enter into marriage with her free and full consent as well as her right to physical integrity and her safety among others.

Location of Incident: Pibor, GPAA
Description:
Forced and early marriages of two minor girls involving physical abuse in Pibor, GPAA

On 01 October, HRD visited the Interim Care Center (ICC) in Pibor, GPAA, and interviewed two victims of forced and early marriage. 

The first victim interviewed, a 15-year-old girl (name on file), originally from Kongor Payam, Likuangole County, GPAA, reported that when she was approximately 10 years old, her father accepted 25 cows from a man in his around 45 years old, as part of a marriage arrangement with the victim. She reported that on 15 September, the man, accompanied by four of his age-set friends, came to her family’s house in Kondako village, Pibor County, and attempted to abduct her while she was collecting firewood, reportedly intending to take her to Kongor Payam. According to her, she managed to escape and sought refuge at the ICC the same day. The victim stated that she cannot return home as her father would reportedly force her to live with the man as his wife.

The second victim, a 16-year-old girl (name on file), reported that she was forced by her father to marry a 28-year-old man in mid-2024, to whom she had previously been promised by him. Over the past year, the man had repeatedly subjected her to physical violence, accusing her of adultery. HRD observed visible scars on her body, reportedly resulting from the abuse. She reported that she had fled to her father’s home several times but was each time sent back to the man involved in the forced marriage. She stated that the most recent incident of physical assault occurred on 27 September, after which her father again refused to shelter her, pushing her to seek protection at the ICC to escape further abuse.

Comments: HRD will follow up on the cases with the GPAA Ministry of Gender, Child and Social Welfare

Location of Incident: Pibor, GPAA
Description:
A 13-year-old Murle girl forced into marriage and raped escapes and seeks refuge with the authorities in Pibor, GPAA

On 06 October, HRD interviewed a 13-year-old Murle girl that was victim of forced marriage and rape at the Interim Care Center (ICC) in Pibor, GPAA. The Director of Gender in the GPAA Ministry of Gender, Child and Social Welfare reported that the girl from Manythakar village, Bebuzem Payam, Likuangole county, GPAA, escaped from forced marriage and arrived the ICC on 04 October 2025. According to the girl, her family accepted 12 cows from a Kurenen age-set man, aged around 27-year-old, as part of a marriage arrangement with the victim. According to the victim, the perpetrator, accompanied by his age-set friends, abducted her from her home at the beginning of September and took her to his residence in Manythakar village. She reported that she was forcibly held by the perpetrator for one month before fleeing to Pibor and reporting abdominal pain, mentioning that for the period she was held captive, she was sexual abused.

The Director of Gender informed HRD that when one of the women who had accompanied the girl in her escape to Pibor returned to Manythakar village, she was severely beaten by age-set men, who demanded that she bring the girl back. The Director stated that the woman reported the incident to the Ministry of Gender at the ICC on the morning of 06 October. According to the Director, the Ministry has called in the perpetrator and plans to report him to the police and has assured that the girl will be referred to a hospital for medical attention.

Location of Incident: Duk
Description:
A 14-year-old girl allegedly rape in Uror County and sought refuge in Duk County, Jonglei State

On 8 October HRD received information from community authorities in Jonglei State and social workers that on an unknown date a minor girl aged 14 years-old from Lou Nuer community was subjected to sexual violence by her father in Modit Payam, Uror County, Jonglei State. Reportedly, the survivor was in her residence when the perpetrator raped her. According to sources, the survivor fled her house on foot arriving in the house of her brother last week in Duk Padiet, Duk County, Jonglei State seeking protection. According to the protection partners, the brother of the victim reported the crime to social workers and authorities in Duk that contacted UNICEF GBV team in Juba to provide specialized treatment. Reportedly, the victim will be transferred to Juba for further treatment due to severe symptoms consistent with PTSD.

Location of Incident: Nzara county
Description:
On 10 October, HRD visited the GBV One-Stop Centre at Yambio State Hospital in Yambio Town and met with the Social Worker in charge of data management. The Social Worker reported that between 20 September and 9 October, a total of 25 GBV cases were documented. Of these, 15 were rape cases involving female minors aged between 6 and 16, and one case was attempted rape involving a female minor. Perpetrators were identified as male civilians aged 17 to 55 and unknown armed elements.

In addition, HRD documented eight cases of domestic violence, primarily physical assaults causing bodily injuries, with female adult survivors and male adult perpetrators, including two unidentified armed elements. Furthermore, the records indicated that 13 perpetrators were from the Azande community, while the remaining 11 were from the Dinka and Balanda communities. All survivors were from the Azande community.

The rapes cases included the following

1.	Mid September in Nzara County: An 8-year-old girl from the Azande community was raped by her uncle. Reportedly, the suspect was arrested and detained in Nzara police station, Nzara County, and later transferred to Yambio Prison where he is awaiting trial. Reportedly, the survivor received medical treatment.
2.	On 26 September, a 14-year-old girl from the Azande community was raped by an 18-year-old male from the Moru community in Baiparu residential area of Yambio town, Yambio County. The survivor received specialized medical care, and the family opted for an out-of-court settlement.
3.	On 30 August in Napere residential area, Yambio Town, a 13-year-old girl was raped at her residence by a 20-year-old male civilian. The survivor received psychosocial support (PSS) and was discharged. Reportedly, the perpetrator fled to Juba.

4.	In early September, a 13-year-old girl was dragged into an abandoned house and raped by a 17-year-old male Gangara Emilia residential area, Yambio Town. Reportedly, the perpetrator was arrested, but the victim’s family settled the case for monetary compensation out of court.
5.	On 12 September, a 15-year-old female was raped by a 19-year-old male civilian after being accosted on her way home from school in Hai Bakindo residential area, Yambio Town. Reportedly, the victim received medical treatment. Reportedly, the perpetrator was arrested and detained.
6.	On 26 September, a 16-year-old girl was gang-raped at night by four unknown men while returning from a traditional dance in Zambago suburb, Yambio Town.
7.	On an unspecified date in September, a 31-year-old female from the Azande community was raped by two unknown armed elements on her way back from an overnight church prayer in Asanza suburb, Yambio Town. Reportedly, the victim received psycho-social support but chose not to file a police case.
8.	On an unspecified date in September, a 14-year-old female from the Azande community was raped and impregnated by a 30-year-old male civilian from the Balanda community in Baiparu residential area, Yambio Town. The family settled the case out of court.
9.	In the middle of September, a 14-year-old female from the Azande community was raped and impregnated by an 18-year-old male civilian in Napere residential area, Yambio Town. Reportedly, the perpetrator was arrested and detained.
10.	On an unspecified date in September, a 14-year-old female from the Azande community was raped by a 19-year-old male civilian in Duduma residential area, Yambio town. Reportedly, the perpetrator subsequently fled to Juba.
11.	On 6 October, a 49-year-old female from the Azande community was raped by an unidentified suspect at her home during the night in Makperenga village, Bazungua Payam, Yambio County. Reportedly, the victim received psycho-social support.
12.	On an unspecified date in September, a 33-year-old male civilian attempted to rape his 6-year-old stepdaughter from the Azande community in Pazuo, Yambio Town. Reportedly, the neighbours intervened and rescued her. Reportedly, the perpetrator was arrested, but the complainant chose not to pursue legal action.
13.	On 20 September, two boys aged 13 and 15 raped an 8-year-old girl from the Azande community in Hai Kabashi residential area, Yambio Town. Reportedly, the perpetrators were arrested but later released when the complainants decided not to pursue the case.
14.	On an unspecified date in September, a 15-year-old girl was raped by an unidentified armed element in Kuzee, Yambio Town. Reportedly, the victim was found to be pregnant on 8 October.
15.	On 5 October, a 16-year-old girl from the Azande community was raped by an unidentified armed element wielding a machete in Naagori-2 residential area, Yambio Town. Reportedly, the perpetrator forced entry into the victim’s homestead and threatened her and subsequently raped her.

Reportedly, of all the cases recorded, only five survivors pursued legal action. The remaining opted for out-of-court settlements.

Location of Incident: Baiparu residential area of Yambio town, Yambio
Description:
On 10 October, HRD visited the GBV One-Stop Centre at Yambio State Hospital in Yambio Town and met with the Social Worker in charge of data management. The Social Worker reported that between 20 September and 9 October, a total of 25 GBV cases were documented. Of these, 15 were rape cases involving female minors aged between 6 and 16, and one case was attempted rape involving a female minor. Perpetrators were identified as male civilians aged 17 to 55 and unknown armed elements.

In addition, HRD documented eight cases of domestic violence, primarily physical assaults causing bodily injuries, with female adult survivors and male adult perpetrators, including two unidentified armed elements. Furthermore, the records indicated that 13 perpetrators were from the Azande community, while the remaining 11 were from the Dinka and Balanda communities. All survivors were from the Azande community.
