1.	Mid September in Nzara County: An 8-year-old girl from the Azande community was raped by her uncle. Reportedly, the suspect was arrested and detained in Nzara police station, Nzara County, and later transferred to Yambio Prison where he is awaiting trial. Reportedly, the survivor received medical treatment.
2.	On 26 September, a 14-year-old girl from the Azande community was raped by an 18-year-old male from the Moru community in Baiparu residential area of Yambio town, Yambio County. The survivor received specialized medical care, and the family opted for an out-of-court settlement.
3.	On 30 August in Napere residential area, Yambio Town, a 13-year-old girl was raped at her residence by a 20-year-old male civilian. The survivor received psychosocial support (PSS) and was discharged. Reportedly, the perpetrator fled to Juba.

4.	In early September, a 13-year-old girl was dragged into an abandoned house and raped by a 17-year-old male Gangara Emilia residential area, Yambio Town. Reportedly, the perpetrator was arrested, but the victim’s family settled the case for monetary compensation out of court.
5.	On 12 September, a 15-year-old female was raped by a 19-year-old male civilian after being accosted on her way home from school in Hai Bakindo residential area, Yambio Town. Reportedly, the victim received medical treatment. Reportedly, the perpetrator was arrested and detained.
6.	On 26 September, a 16-year-old girl was gang-raped at night by four unknown men while returning from a traditional dance in Zambago suburb, Yambio Town.
7.	On an unspecified date in September, a 31-year-old female from the Azande community was raped by two unknown armed elements on her way back from an overnight church prayer in Asanza suburb, Yambio Town. Reportedly, the victim received psycho-social support but chose not to file a police case.
8.	On an unspecified date in September, a 14-year-old female from the Azande community was raped and impregnated by a 30-year-old male civilian from the Balanda community in Baiparu residential area, Yambio Town. The family settled the case out of court.
9.	In the middle of September, a 14-year-old female from the Azande community was raped and impregnated by an 18-year-old male civilian in Napere residential area, Yambio Town. Reportedly, the perpetrator was arrested and detained.
10.	On an unspecified date in September, a 14-year-old female from the Azande community was raped by a 19-year-old male civilian in Duduma residential area, Yambio town. Reportedly, the perpetrator subsequently fled to Juba.
11.	On 6 October, a 49-year-old female from the Azande community was raped by an unidentified suspect at her home during the night in Makperenga village, Bazungua Payam, Yambio County. Reportedly, the victim received psycho-social support.
12.	On an unspecified date in September, a 33-year-old male civilian attempted to rape his 6-year-old stepdaughter from the Azande community in Pazuo, Yambio Town. Reportedly, the neighbours intervened and rescued her. Reportedly, the perpetrator was arrested, but the complainant chose not to pursue legal action.
13.	On 20 September, two boys aged 13 and 15 raped an 8-year-old girl from the Azande community in Hai Kabashi residential area, Yambio Town. Reportedly, the perpetrators were arrested but later released when the complainants decided not to pursue the case.
14.	On an unspecified date in September, a 15-year-old girl was raped by an unidentified armed element in Kuzee, Yambio Town. Reportedly, the victim was found to be pregnant on 8 October.
15.	On 5 October, a 16-year-old girl from the Azande community was raped by an unidentified armed element wielding a machete in Naagori-2 residential area, Yambio Town. Reportedly, the perpetrator forced entry into the victim’s homestead and threatened her and subsequently raped her.

Reportedly, of all the cases recorded, only five survivors pursued legal action. The remaining opted for out-of-court settlements.

Location of Incident: Yambio Town, Yambio
Description:
On October 24, HRD Yambio Field Office visited the GBV One-Stop Centre at Yambio State Hospital in Yambio Town and met with the Social Worker in charge of data management. The Social Worker reported that between October 10 and 24, a total of 18 GBV cases were documented. Of these, 13 were rape cases involving female minors aged between 5 and 16, and two were attempted rape cases involving female minors. The identified perpetrators were male civilians aged 14 to 60, as well as unknown armed individuals.

In addition, HRD documented five cases of domestic violence, primarily physical assaults causing bodily injuries, involving female adult survivors and male adult perpetrators, including three unidentified armed elements. Furthermore, the records indicated that 11 perpetrators were from the Azande community, while the remaining six were from the Moru and Baka communities. All survivors were from the Azande community.

The rape cases included the following:
1.	On October 11, in Bakindo residential area, Yambio town, a 5-year-old girl from the Azande community was reportedly raped by her stepbrother. The suspect was reportedly arrested and detained at Masia Police Station; however, he was released after the complainant opted for an out-of-court settlement. The survivor received medical treatment.
2.	On October 11, in Kpirabe residential area, Yambio town, a 16-year-old girl from the Azande community was reportedly raped by a 20-year-old male from the Baka community. The survivor received specialized medical care, and the family opted for an out-of-court settlement.
3.	On October 13, in Duduma Residential Area, Yambio town, a 12-year-old girl was reportedly raped at her residence by a 60-year-old male civilian. The survivor received psychosocial support and was discharged. The perpetrator was reportedly arrested and remanded to prison.
4.	On October 18, in Ikpiro residential area, in Yambio town a17-year-old girl was accosted by two unknown armed elements while returning from night church prayers and was raped by both. The perpetrators reportedly returned toward the Lirangu area. The victim received psychosocial support and medical care before being discharged from the hospital.
5.	On October 18, in Hai Pazuo residential area of Yambio town, a 13-year-old girl was reportedly raped by a 23-year-old male civilian after being accosted on her way home from school. The victim received medical treatment, and the perpetrator fled to Juba.
6.	On October 15, in Akorogbodi-1 suburb of Yambio town, a 16-year-old girl was reportdly raped by unknown men while returning from a traditional marriage.
7.	On October 16, in Baiparu residential area of Yambio town, a 21-year-old female from the Azande community was raped by a 43-year-old male civilian from the Moru community. The victim received psychosocial support but chose not to file a police report.
8.	On an unspecified date in October, Zamba-Sende Boma, Lirangu Payam, Yambio County, a 38-year-old female from the Azande community was physically assaulted by a 43-year-old male civilian from the Balanda community. The suspect fled and is currently in hiding.
9.	On October 20, Yabongo suburb of Yambio town, a 15-year-old female from the Azande community was reportedly raped and impregnated by a 34-year-old male civilian. The perpetrator was reportedly arrested and detained.
10.	On October 21, in Bakindo residential area, of Yambio town, a 17-year-old female from the Azande community was reportedly raped by a 19-year-old male civilian. A case was filed at Yambio Police Station; however, the perpetrator remains at large.
11.	On October 22, in Gangara Amelia residential area f Yambio town, a 55-year-old female from the Azande community was raped by her neighbor. The victim received psychosocial support and opted not to file a case.
12.	On October 19, in Kabash residential area of Yambio town, a 36-year-old male civilian attempted to rape his 6-year-old neighbor from the Azande community. Reportedly, neighbours intervened and rescued her. The perpetrator was reportedly arrested, but the complainant chose not to pursue legal action.
13.	On October 23, in Hai Bakindo residential area of Yambio town, an 18-year-old female from the Azande community was reportedly raped by a 17-year-old male civilian, who fled to Nzara after the incident and remains at large.

Location of Incident: Masia, Yambio town, ymbio
Description:
•	17-Year-Old Boy and Two Adults Allegedly Rape 26-Year-Old Woman in Masia, Yambio Town, Yambio County

On October 22, HRD conducted monitoring at Yambio Police Station and verified the detention of a 17-year-old male juvenile (name on file), detained on allegations of rape. According to the crime officer, the victim, a 26-year-old Azande woman (name on file) from Masia in Yambio town, reported the incident, stating that on the night of September 27, she attended a party in Yambio town. On her way home, she met the 17-year-old boy, who took her to his friend's house where they had consensual sex.

After the sexual encounter, the suspect left the victim in the room and went to call two other adult males who subsequently raped her. The victim reported the incident at Masia Police Station on September 28, and Form 8 was issued for her to seek medical attention. The 17-year-old male suspect was arrested the same day and detained at Masia Police Station. He was subsequently transferred to Yambio Police Station on October 10, 2025.

According to the crime officer, the detention warrant for the suspect was renewed by the Public Prosecution Attorney on October 14 to allow the police to complete the investigation of the case. The suspect denied the rape allegation, stating that he did not call any friends to the complainant. The other two suspects remain at large as their identities are unknown. The crime officer indicated that the suspect would be sent to prison for remand today while the investigation continues.

Comment: While the minor suspect denies involvement, HRD stressed to the police the victim’s right to a timely, trauma-informed investigation and the need to expedite the investigation process to ensure that the rights of the suspect are also respected. HRD will continue to follow up on the case to promote an accelerated judicial process and accountability.

Location of Incident: Kelerio village in Vulvet Payam, Gumuruk Coun
Description:
A 16-year-old Murle girl forced into early marriage was subjected to SGBV by two brothers in Kelerio, Gumuruk County, GPAA

On 20 October, HRD met and interviewed a 16-year-old survivor of SGBV at the Interim Care Center (ICC) in Pibor, GPAA. Reportedly the girl is from Kelerio village in Vulvet Payam, Gumuruk County, GPAA, reported that around 11 months ago (September 2024), she was forced to marry a man from the Lango age-set, aged approximately 35 years old, who had previously arranged to marry through the payment of 30 cows. According to her, after being forced to live with him for five months, his family decided that she should instead being forced to marry his younger brother, from the Kurenen age-set, aged approximately 28 years old. She subsequently was forced to leave the first man and went live with his younger brother as his wife. She stated that she forced lived with the younger brother for six months before he asked her to return to his elder brother. Reportedly, she refused, escaped and sought refuge at the ICC in Pibor on 10 October. She reported that both brothers sexually abused sexually her.

Comments: She is receiving psycho-social support from the GPAA Ministry of Gender, Child and Social Welfare

Location of Incident: Madile, Yei Town Payam, Yei River
Description:
•	21-year-old civilian woman gang-raped by four unidentified boys armed with panga in Madile, Yei Town, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County
On 28 October 2025, HRD-YFO received and documented information from two reliable secondary sources, including a medical personnel and a community worker, regarding gang-rape of a 21-year-old civilian woman resident in Rainbow Area, Yei Town and of the Kakwa tribe (details on file) by four unidentified masked boys armed with Panga in Madile, Yei Town Payam, Yei River County on 26 October 2025. 

According to the sources the survivor who is a Senior One student in one of the secondary schools in Yei Town was intercepted by the gang of five masked boys armed with panga, while she was returning from her farm in Madile (a border area with Lainya County) at about 5:00PM. Reportedly, the perpetrators threatened her with their pangas, four of them raped her and fled the scene immediately after. The survivor reportedly estimated the ages of the perpetrators between 18 and 20 years old. Additionally, the survivor did not report the case to the police, since she could not identify any of the victims. However, she reported to one of the health facilities in Yei Town where she received medical attention. 

Comments: The gruesome act of gang-raping a 21-year-old woman is a serious human rights concern and violates the bodily integrity and privacy of the survivor and requires serious attention by authorities. All these are enshrined in Articles 1, 2, 3, 5 and 12, of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights (UDHR), emphasizing equality, dignity, freedom from discrimination, liberty and security of persons, freedom from torture or cruel inhuman or degrading treatment and right to privacy and honour, respectively. HRD-YFO will follow up with police on the case for accountability purposes and proper administration of justice.

Location of Incident: Verthet
Description:
A 16-year-old Murle girl allegedly forced into marriage and beaten in Verthet county, GPAA
On 28 October, HRD met and interviewed a 16-year-old survivor of SGBV from Billet village, Verthet payam, Verthet county, GPAA at the Interim Care Center of the Ministry of Gender, Child and Social Welfare in Pibor, GPAA. She reported that around April 2025, her uncles forced her to marry a 28-year-old man from the Kurenen age group, with whom they had arranged a forced marriage with her in exchange for a dowry of 30 head of cattle when she was still a child.
She reported to HRD that she was taken by force to the house of her perpetrator and was severely beaten by her uncles and perpetrator Kurenen age group friends. According to the survivor, she was kept by force at the residence of her perpetrator for three days without food or water before managing to escape to her mother house. She further reported that around 20 October, the man returned to her family home with several of his age-set companions and beat her again, which led her to flee and report the incident to the authorities in Pibor on 22 October. HRD observed several scars and wounds in the body of the victim. Reportedly, the mother of the victim visited her at the ICC on 28 October and advised her to remain there for her safety. 
Comment: Women in the GPAA face extreme difficulties in protecting their young daughters from early and forced marriages, as they are often subjected to attacks by their husbands and by age-set members.

Location of Incident: Bentiu IDP Camp, Bentiu HQ
Description:
•	A 38-year-old Nuer gang member raped a 13-year-old Nuer female IDP at the Bentiu IDP Camp, Bentiu HQ, Unity State
On 29 and 30 October 2025, two secondary sources informed HRD that between 25 and 26 October 2025 (exact date not specified) a 38-year-old Nuer man, a member of a gang at the camp, raped a 13-year-old girl (an IDP) at the Bentiu IDP camp site B. Reportedly, on the night of the incident, the perpetrator, who was well-known to the victim, lured the victim into  an abandoned home frequently used by gangs (popularly referred to as “niggas”) for nocturnal social events at the IDP camp. The perpetrator reportedly fled after the incident and his current whereabouts are unknown. The victim received medical and psychosocial assistance at a health facility in Bentiu. One of the sources noted that the case has not yet been reported to the police but he planned to encourage the family of the victim to alert the police.

Comments: HRD will gather further details and advocate for the perpetrator to be arrested and held accountable before the competent court in a fair judicial process.

Location of Incident: Gumbo residential area, Rejaf Payam, Juba
Description:
•	Rape of a 13-year-old minor by a member of a religious congregation at Gumbo residential area on 27 October 2025.
On 30 October 2025, the HRD followed up on a reported rape case involving a 13-year-old girl in the Gumbo residential area. The incident occurred on 27 October 2025 and involved a member of a religious congregation (denomination not specified).
HRD contacted two reliable sources, the Director of Gender and Social Welfare at the Ministry of Gender and Social Welfare, and a Police officer from the Special Protection Unit (SPU). Both confirmed that the minor was raped last week by a congregation member who regularly asked her to buy water from a nearby shop. On the day of the incident, the perpetrator used this routine to lure the girl, and upon delivering the water, she was sexually assaulted.
Initially, the victim concealed the incident, but her parents noticed she was walking with difficulty. Upon questioning, she disclosed the assault. According to the Director of Social Welfare, the girl is currently receiving medical treatment at Saba children Hospital in Juba. The suspect is in custody of the Eastern Police Division, pending the outcome of the ongoing investigation.
Comment: HRD will continue monitoring the case by engaging with the investigating officer at Eastern Police Division and the case worker assigned to support the victim at Ministry of Gender and Social Welfare of CES.

Location of Incident: SPLA-IO (RM) Division 4A military HQ in Tong area , Pakur, Rubkona
Description:
•	HRD recorded information on the arbitrary arrest, detention and ill-treatment of a 20-year-old Nuer female by SPLA-IO (RM) military personnel at the SPLA-IO (RM) Division 4A Military HQ in Tong area of Pakur Payam, Rubkona County, Unity State

On 6 October 2025, HRD interviewed a 20-year-old Nuer woman (name on file) who reported that she had been arbitrarily arrested, detained and ill-treatment by SPLA-IO (RM) military personnel at the SPLA-IO (RM) Division 4A military HQ in Tong area of Pakur payam, Rubkona County, Unity State, from 26 June 2025 to 22 September 2025.

The victim reported that after being granted a divorce from her abusive husband during the deployment of the mobile formal court in Leer (April – May 2025), just over a month later, on 26 June 2025, her father followed her from Leer town to Rubkona town where she had moved to following her divorce. During the meeting, her father allegedly persuaded her to travel to the Tong area to visit one of their relatives. She embarked on this travel together with her young baby, aged less than two years old. Upon arriving in Tong, however, instead of meeting with any relatives, she was handcuffed by SPLA-IO (RM) military personnel who thereafter took her to the military detention area. Her father then reportedly took her baby and travelled back to Leer, where he allegedly gave the baby to one of their relatives who continues to care for the baby to date. 

The victim then stated that she was arbitrarily held at the SPLA-IO (RM) military detention from 26 June 2025 until 22 September 2025 when she escaped after receiving some advice and assistance from one of the SPLA-IO (RM) military personnel at the location. She reported that during her detention in Tong, during the day, she would be held in a fenced enclosure surrounded with trees but no roof together with men, including soldiers and civilians, and two other women. At night, the three women would then be taken out from the detention enclosure and put in a separate tukul where they would sleep for the night, and then be returned to the main detention enclosure the following morning. She estimated that there were about 35-40 suspects in the military detention, including an undetermined number of civilians who had been arrested in/from the Bentiu IDP Camp, the two other women who had been arrested on similar issues (forced marriage and pregnancy), and alleged SPLA-IO (RM) deserters. She added that she and the other two women had been beaten by SPLA-IO (RM) soldiers if they refused to clean the houses of SPLA-IO (RM) military commanders or fetch water from the river. She specified that she had been beaten on three separate occasions for those reasons.

On 22 September 2025, therefore, she managed to escape from detention with the assistance and advice of one SPLA-IO (RM) soldier who told her that she had overstayed in the detention without access to justice and without an official complainant being present/following up on the case. Thereafter, she stated that she reported the incident to the Public Prosecutor in Bentiu who referred the incident to the police for further investigation. 

Comment: The case evidences continued violations as allegedly perpetrated by the SPLA-IO (RM) military, particularly personnel deployed at the SPLA-IO (RM) Division 4A HQ in Tong area. The UNMISS FO continues to hold engagements with the relevant SPLA-IO (RM) commanders to seek their intervention to halt and effectively address human rights violations being perpetrated at the location and by their personnel, including requiring the urgent release of all civilians being held at the military detention facility. UNMISS shall also monitor formal justice mechanisms and processes, including the mobile court currently deployed to Bentiu which UNMISS is providing technical support to, that seek to hold alleged perpetrators of human rights violations accountable, possibly including alleged SPLA-IO (RM) military personnel.

Further, the case demonstrates the society’s lack of knowledge of, and appreciation on, human rights (especially women’s rights), formal accountability, and the rule of law. Despite the order of a formal court seeking to protect a woman subjected to GBV and other harmful cultural practices, including the judge’s warning to the father to cease any actions which may amount to an abuse of the victim’s rights, the victim’s father still disregarded the court’s orders, went after his daughter and took her to a military detention in order for her to be punished for refusing to marry yet another man that he wished to force her to marry. Therefore, the UNMISS FO continues to conduct awareness raising and sensitisation activities in order to educate the local populations on human rights, formal justice, accountability and the rule of law, in order to improve the communities’ respect for the formal justice system and respect for human rights and the [rule of] law.

In addition, owing to the nature of the case, the State Ministry of Gender, Child and Social Welfare intervened in the case and is leading on implementing the necessary victim protection measures.

Location of Incident: Nyara Boma, Iyire Payam, Torit
Description: 1.	On 4 November, three secondary sources reported that on 31 October, NSS personnel arbitrarily arrested, ill-treated and detained one 32-year-old male civilian from the Lutoko community of Hafiye Boma in Nyara Boma, Iyire Payam, Torit County. According to the sources, a group of four NSS personnel arrested the victim at the Nyara market on allegations of being affiliated to the Sudan People’s Liberation Army – In Opposition (SPLA-IO) and involvement in the ambushes on commercial vehicles along the Torit-Magwi-Road – allegations he refuted. The victim was reportedly beaten up and subsequently taken to the NSS facility in Magwi Town, where he was detained incommunicado for five days without charges and denied access to his relatives.

Location of Incident: Rubkona Town, Rubkona
Description: 2.	On 1 and 4 November, multiple sources reported that on 29 October, the SSPDF arbitrarily arrested and detained five civilians in Rubkona Town, Rubkona County. According to the sources, the victims were arrested together with seven SPLA-IO elements of the in the context of escalating tensions between the SSPDF and SPLA-IO in the area. Reportedly, the civilian victims were accused of being spies for the SPLA-IO. On 2 November, the civilian victims and the SPLA-IO elements were released without charge.

Location of Incident: Yikador village, Pathuon East Payam, Gogrial East
Description: 3.	On 4 November, three primary sources reported that on the same day, Nuer armed elements from Unity State shot and killed two male civilians from the Dinka Apuk community during a cattle raid in Yikador village, Pathuon East Payam, Gogrial East County. According to the sources, the Nuer armed elements attacked opened fire on a cattle camp in Yikador village, killing two of the residents. The attackers also seized 20 heads of cattle and fled back to Unity State.

Location of Incident: Yikador village, Pathuon East Payam, Gogrial East
Description: 3.	On 4 November, three primary sources reported that on the same day, Nuer armed elements from Unity State shot and killed two male civilians from the Dinka Apuk community during a cattle raid in Yikador village, Pathuon East Payam, Gogrial East County. According to the sources, the Nuer armed elements attacked opened fire on a cattle camp in Yikador village, killing two of the residents. The attackers also seized 20 heads of cattle and fled back to Unity State.

Location of Incident: Riak-Ayien village, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East
Description: 4.	On 4 November, three primary sources reported that on 3 November, Dinka Luanyjang armed elements from Palieng Payam abducted two boys from the Dinka Jaluau community during a cattle raid in Riak-Ayien village, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the Dinka Luanyjang armed elements attacked a group of  Dinka Jaluau male juveniles who were grazing their families’ cattle in Riak-Ayien and abducted two of them. The attackers also reportedly seized 60 heads of cattle and fled towards Palieng Payam. The abductees were released at the border of Wunlit Payam and Palieng Payam unharmed.

Location of Incident: Riak-Ayien village, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East
Description: 4.	On 4 November, three primary sources reported that on 3 November, Dinka Luanyjang armed elements from Palieng Payam abducted two boys from the Dinka Jaluau community during a cattle raid in Riak-Ayien village, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the Dinka Luanyjang armed elements attacked a group of  Dinka Jaluau male juveniles who were grazing their families’ cattle in Riak-Ayien and abducted two of them. The attackers also reportedly seized 60 heads of cattle and fled towards Palieng Payam. The abductees were released at the border of Wunlit Payam and Palieng Payam unharmed.

Location of Incident: Biti Boma, Amadi Payam, Mundri West
Description:
5.	On 4 November, multiple sources reported that on 30 October, the SSPDF shot and killed one 17-year-old girl from the Moru community in Biti Boma, Amadi Payam, Mundri West County. According to the sources, the SSPDF soldiers who were pursuing allied armed elements of the SPLA-IO and National Salvation Front (NAS) indiscriminately opened fire, injuring the victim. Reportedly, the injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Lui Payam, Mundri East County for medical treatment, where she succumbed to the injuries on 31 October.

Comment: Reportedly, the victim was among other civilians who were participating in a cash distribution exercise in Biti Boma conducted by the United Nations Office for Project Services (UNOPS). While the other civilians were dispersed by the shooting incident, the SSPDF soldiers allegedly went after them and confiscated their cash collected at the distribution site.

Location of Incident: Payawa Boma, Mugwo Payam, Yei River
Description: 1.	On 5 November, three secondary sources reported that on 4 November, the SSPDF shot and killed one 37-year-old male civilian and arbitrarily arrested and detained four others in Payawa Boma, Mugwo Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, SSPDF soldiers went to the 37-year-old victim’s home in connection with ongoing investigations into the death of on SSPDF soldier on 2 November 2025 in Payawa Boma, along the Yei–Mugwo road; and opened fire on the victim, killing him. The SSPDF soldiers also reportedly accused the victim of being a deserter from the Sudan People’s Liberation Army – In Opposition (SPLA-IO) and of being in possession of firearms. The sources further informed that four other civilians were arbitrarily arrested and transferred to the SSPDF barracks in Payawa Boma for interrogation.

Location of Incident: Payawa Boma, Mugwo Payam, Yei River
Description: 1.	On 5 November, three secondary sources reported that on 4 November, the SSPDF shot and killed one 37-year-old male civilian and arbitrarily arrested and detained four others in Payawa Boma, Mugwo Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, SSPDF soldiers went to the 37-year-old victim’s home in connection with ongoing investigations into the death of on SSPDF soldier on 2 November 2025 in Payawa Boma, along the Yei–Mugwo road; and opened fire on the victim, killing him. The SSPDF soldiers also reportedly accused the victim of being a deserter from the Sudan People’s Liberation Army – In Opposition (SPLA-IO) and of being in possession of firearms. The sources further informed that four other civilians were arbitrarily arrested and transferred to the SSPDF barracks in Payawa Boma for interrogation.

Location of Incident: Alero village, Payawa Boma, Mugwo Payam, Yei River
Description: 2.	On 5 November, three secondary sources reported that on 4 November, NAS elements abducted one male civilian (a contractor with a local company) in Alero village, Payawa Boma, Mugwo Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, the NAS elements intercepted the victim and his driver as they were traveling from Yei Town to Morobo Town, abducted the victim and confiscated an unspecified sum of money, mobile phones and other personal belongings, while they let his driver go unscathed and warned him to not disclose any information. The abductors have reportedly demanded a ransom of 25,000 United States Dollar for the release of the victim. The whereabouts of the abducted contractor remain unknown.

Location of Incident: Alero village, Payawa Boma, Mugwo Payam, Yei River
Description: 2. According to the sources, the NAS elements intercepted the victim and his driver as they were traveling from Yei Town to Morobo Town, abducted the victim and confiscated an unspecified sum of money, mobile phones and other personal belongings, while they let his driver go unscathed and warned him to not disclose any information. The abductors have reportedly demanded a ransom of 25,000 United States Dollar for the release of the victim. The whereabouts of the abducted contractor remain unknown.

Location of Incident: Isoke Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos
Description: 3.	On 5 November, three secondary sources reported that on 17 October, Dongotono armed elements from Hirafit Boma shot and killed one 27-year-old woman in Isoke Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos County. According to the sources, a group of five Dongotono armed elements attacked and opened fire on the victim while she was farming in the outskirts of Isoke Boma, killing her, reportedly in retaliation for the shooting and injuring of one 27-year-old Dongotono male civilian in Hirafit Boma by Logir armed elements on 7 June 2025 [see HRD Daily Report 23 June 2025]. The incident was reported at the Ikotos and Chahari Police Stations and investigations are reportedly underway.

Location of Incident: Cueicok village, Tiap Tiap Payam,  Cueibet
Description:
4.	On 5 November, multiple sources reported that on the same day, Dinka Gok armed elements from the Rutruot clan shot and injured three male civilians from the Panyar clan in Cueicok village, Tiap Tiap Payam,  Cueibet County. According to the sources, the suspected Dinka Gok armed elements attacked the Panyar community in Cueicok village, injuring three male civilians, reportedly in revenge for the clash between members of the Panyar clan and members of the allied Rutruot, Waat, and Pagok clans of the Dinka Gok community in Citcok Payam on 15 September 2025 [see HRD Daily Report 18 September 2025]. The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility Tiap Tiap for medical treatment.

Comments: These clans have a longstanding history of conflict fueled by series of revenge attacks. The Panyar youths are reportedly mobilizing for a retaliatory attack on the Rutruot clan in Citcok Payam.

3.	On 6 November, during a follow up on the incident in which Dinka Gok armed elements from the Rutruot clan shot and injured three male civilians from the Panyar clan in Cueicok village, Tiap Tiap Payam,  Cueibet County on 5 November [see HRD Daily Report 6 November 2025], multiple sources reported that one of the victims who was in critical condition succumbed to the injuries at a health care facility in Tiap-Tiap Payam. Reportedly, the Tiap Tiap Payam authorities have engaged with the angry Panyar youths and defused the situation.

Location of Incident: Cueicok village, Tiap Tiap Payam,  Cueibet
Description:
4.	On 5 November, multiple sources reported that on the same day, Dinka Gok armed elements from the Rutruot clan shot and injured three male civilians from the Panyar clan in Cueicok village, Tiap Tiap Payam,  Cueibet County. Location of Incident: Athony village, Turalei Payam, Twic
Description:
5.	On 5 November, four secondary sources reported that on the same day, suspected SPLA-IO elements and allied Nuer armed elements from Unity State shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Twic Mayardit and injured six others from the Dinka Ruweng community in Athony village, Turalei Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, the joint SPLA-IO and allied Nuer armed elements attacked a group of civilians (traders) along the border of Twic County while they were transporting merchandise from Twic County to Abiemnom County in Ruweng Administrative, killing three and injuring six others. The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Turalei Town for medical treatment.

Comment: This incident was a politically motivated attack by the SPLA/M-IO elements and armed Nuer elements, and that the alleged SPLM-IO elements are from the same group that clashed with the SSPDF on 6 – 7 October  in Turalei Payam [see HRD Daily Report 8 October 2025].

Location of Incident: Athony village, Turalei Payam, Twic
Description:
5. Location of Incident: Hai Daraja residential area, Wau Town, Wau
Description:
6.	On 5 November, one primary source and one secondary source reported that in December 2024 (exact date unspecified), one SSPDF soldier raped a 14-year-old girl in the Hai Daraja residential area, Wau Town, Wau County. According to the sources, the SSPDF soldier (a relative to the victim) raped the victim at gunpoint while the other family members had traveled to their village in Gogrial Payam, Warrap State. Reportedly, in July 2025 (exact date unspecified) the victim was found pregnant after medical examination and the incident was reported to police. The suspect was reportedly arrested and detained; however, was released on the same day following orders from the SSPDF Military Intelligence commander. A case was later opened at the Wau North Court and adjourned to 6 November for trial.

Comments: HRD will monitor the upcoming trial session.

Location of Incident: Aru Boma, Lokiliri Payam, Juba
Description: 1.	On 6 November, multiple sources reported that on 2 November, suspected Murle armed elements from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) abducted six children (one girl and five boys between two – eight years old) in Aru Boma, Lokiliri Payam, Juba County. According to the sources, a group of seven suspected Murle armed elements abducted the children had returned from church and while they were playing at the residence of one of the victims. Reportedly, some SSPDF soldiers who were in the area opened fire on the abductors and rescued two of the children; however, the abductors made away with the other four children whose whereabouts remain unknown. The incident was reported at the Aru Junction Police Station and investigations are reportedly underway.

Location of Incident: Magwi Town, Magwi
Description:
2.	On 6 November, three secondary sources reported that on 4 November, NSS and SSNPS personnel arbitrarily arrested, detained and ill-treated one male civilian (a local journalist) in Magwi Town, Magwi County. According to the sources, a group of 10 NSS and SSPNS personnel arrested the victim from a local radio station in Magwi own and detained him for six hours at the NSS facility in the area, during which time he was beaten with sticks and gun-butt for allegedly broadcasting misinformation about the government and the operations of security forces. Reportedly, the victim declined these allegations and after six hours, he was transferred to the police station in Magwi Town, where he was detained for another two hours and beaten with sticks. The victim was subsequently released without charge and warned to stop hosting such programmes on air.

Comment: It was alleged that the victim hosted a live call-in programme on radio, during which community members called in and recounted their ordeals suffered from security forces had mounted a checkpoint along the Torit-Magwi-Road and extorted money from road users. The callers reportedly requested the government to dismantle the roadblock and hold the perpetrators.

Location of Incident: Abiemnom County, Ruweng Administrative Area
Description: 4.	On 6 November, multiple secondary sources reported that on 5 November, unidentified armed elements shot and killed one 45-year-old male civilian from the Bul Nuer in Abiemnom County, Ruweng Administrative Area. The unidentified armed elements attacked and opened fire on a group of civilians (fishermen) who were walking from Turalei Payam, Twic County, Warrap State to Abiemnom County, killing one. The motive for the attack remains unknown.

Location of Incident: Madar village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East
Description: 5.	On 6 November, three secondary sources reported that on 5 November, suspected Dinka Luanyjang and allied Dinka Thiik armed elements abducted one minor (a boy) from the Dinka Akook community during a cattle raid in Madar village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the joint Dinka Luanyjang and Dinka Thiik armed elements attacked the minor while he was grazing family cattle in Madar village, abducted him, and thereafter seized 11 heads of cattle and fled towards Palieng Payam. The whereabouts of the victim remain unknown.

Location of Incident: Madar village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East
Description: 5.	On 6 November, three secondary sources reported that on 5 November, suspected Dinka Luanyjang and allied Dinka Thiik armed elements abducted one minor (a boy) from the Dinka Akook community during a cattle raid in Madar village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the joint Dinka Luanyjang and Dinka Thiik armed elements attacked the minor while he was grazing family cattle in Madar village, abducted him, and thereafter seized 11 heads of cattle and fled towards Palieng Payam. The whereabouts of the victim remain unknown.

Location of Incident: Kuzee residential area, Yambio Town, Yambio
Description: 6.	On 6 November, one secondary source reported that on the same day, the SSPDF shot and injured one male civilian from the Azande community in Kuzee residential area, Yambio Town, Yambio County. According to the source, one female civilian had approached the SSPDF personnel at the Sug-Siro military detachment seeking assistance with a domestic dispute. The SSPDF personnel responded to the scene and a confrontation ensued, in which the male civilian was shot and injured. Reportedly, the female civilian was arrested and detained at the Masia Police Station while the circumstances of the incident are being investigated.

Location of Incident: Yambio Town, Yambio
Description: 7.	On 6 November, one secondary source reported that on 17 October, personnel of the joint security forces arbitrarily arrested, detained and ill-treated one male civilian (a foreign national) in Yambio Town, Yambio County. According to the source, the joint security forces arrested the victim for unspecified reasons and detained at Masia Police Station where he was beaten up with sticks. The victim reportedly remains in detention.

Location of Incident: Napak Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi
Description: 1.	On 7 November, three secondary sources reported that on 5 November, Toposa armed elements from Lokwamor Payam, Kapoeta North County shot and killed two male civilians (30 and 31 years old) from the Buya community in Napak Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, three Toposa armed elements attacked Napak Boma, and opened fire on the victims, killing them, reportedly to avenge the killing of five male civilians and injuring of another from the Toposa community by Buya armed elements from Napak Boma on 2 October 2025 in Namonichek Boma, Lokwamor Payam [see HRD Daily report 9 October 2025]. The incident was reported at Kimotong Police Station and investigations are reportedly underway.

Location of Incident: Manhawan village, Ajak Kuac Payam, Twic
Description: 2.	On 9 November, multiple sources reported that on 8 November, Nuer armed elements from Unity State shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Twic-Mayardit and injured two others including a minor in Manhawan village, Ajak Kuac Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, the Nuer armed elements attacked and open fire on a group of Dinka Twic-Mayardit herders who were tending to their cattle in Manhawan village, killing one and injuring two. The attackers also reportedly seized 18 heads of cattle and fled back to Unity State. The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Turalei Payam for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Manhawan village, Ajak Kuac Payam, Twic
Description: 2.
