Location of Incident: Wau Town, Wau County
Description: 3.	On 7 November, two primary sources reported that on 3 October, the SSPDF arbitrarily arrested, ill-treated and detained two male civilians (17 and 37 years old) from the Luo community in Wau Town, Wau County. As recounted by the sources, the  SSPDF accosted the victims while they were returning from their farm, coerced to mount their vehicle and severely beaten during transit to the SSPDF barracks in Bar Wol area where they were subsequently detained for alleged association with Brigadier General Bol Wek of the Sudan People’s Liberation Army – In Opposition (SPLA-IO). Reportedly, the victims spent one night in detention and on the following day they were transferred to the SSPDF barracks in Wau Town, where they were interrogated on these charges. The victims were reportedly released on 27 October when other SPLA-IO elements who had defected and joined the SSPDF confirmed that the victims had no relations with the SPLA-IO commander.

Location of Incident: Monita Boma, Homiri Payam, Budi
Description: 1.	On 10 November, three secondary sources reported that on 9 November, Logir armed elements from Ramula Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos County shot and killed one 40-year-old male civilian from the Didinga Community during an attempted cattle raid in Monita Boma, Homiri Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, a group of six Logir armed elements attacked a cattle camp adjacent to a farm where the victim was clearing his farm, and opened fire, killing him, to prevent him from raising an alarm. Reportedly, the Didinga armed elements in the area responded to the scene and repulsed the attackers who fled without raiding any cattle.. The incident was reported at Chukudum Police Station and investigations are reportedly underway.

Location of Incident: Ngop Boma, Mankien Payam, Mayom
Description: 2.	On 7 and 9 November, multiple secondary sources reported that on 5 November, two civilians (one 17-year-old girl from the Bul Nuer Chieyok sub-clan and a 28-year-old man from the Bul Nuer Chieng-Jaak sub-clan) were shot and killed during violence between Bul Nuer armed elements from the Chieng-Jaak and Chieyok subclans in Ngop Boma, Mankien Payam, Mayom County. According to the sources, Bul Ner armed elements from the Chieyok sub-clan attacked the Chieng-Jaak community and shot and killed the 28-year-old victim in retaliation to the alleged killing of a Chieyok male civilian in 2024 (exact date unspecified) by armed elements from the Jaak. In retaliation, the armed elements from the Chieng-Jaak subclan reportedly, attacked a Chieyok cattle camp and shot and killed the 17-year-old girl who they allegedly mistook for one of the armed elements. The security forces were deployed to the area to quell the situation and prevent further violence.

Location of Incident: Romic Town, Palieng Payam, Tonj East
Description: 3.	On 10 November, three secondary sources reported that on 9 November, Dinka Luanyjang armed elements shot and injured one male civilian from the Dinka Luanyjang community in Romic Town, Palieng Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, on 8 November, the organized security personnel arrested nine Dinka Luanyjang armed elements involved in the transporting of cattle they raided from Akop Payam in Tonj North County and detained them at the NSS facility in Romic Town. Reportedly, on 9 November, a group of armed Dinka Luanyjang elements attacked the NSS holding facility, shot and injured the victim who was working at the Payam Headquarters, overpowered the NSS personnel and freed all nine suspects, and fled the scene.

Location of Incident: Maz Bahr residential area, Wau town, Wau
Description:
4.	On 10 November, one primary source and one secondary source reported that on 1 November, NSS personnel arbitrarily arrested and detained one 27-year-old male civilian (staff of an international humanitarian organization) from the Luo tribe in Maz Bahr residential area, Wau town, Wau County. As recounted by the sources, the NSS personnel intercepted the victim as he was traveling on his motorcycle, arrested and detained him at the NSS facility in Maz Bahr on accusation on being associated with General Bok Wek of the Sudan People’s Liberation Army- In Opposition (SPLA-IO) commander – an  accusation he denied. The victim was reportedly released on 5 November following the intervention of the area chief who clarified his identity and non-involvement with the SPLA-IO commander.

Comment: The victim’s mobile phone, his motorcycle and a sum of 21,300 South Sudan Pounds (SSP) were confiscated while in detention. He was also compelled to return to the NSS facility whenever he was summoned for questioning. The victim declined to pursue legal action for fear of reprisal.

Location of Incident: Tapari village, Jambo Boma, Wito Payam, Mundri East
Description: 5.	On 10 November, multiple secondary sources reported that on 7 November, suspected NAS elements shot and killed one male civilian in Tapari village, Jambo Boma, Wito Payam, Mundri East County. According to the sources, the suspected NAS elements ambushed four civilians including one female (traders) traveling in a commercial vehicle from Yambio to Juba, looted unspecified sums of money, opened fire, killing one of traders and thereafter ordered the driver to speed off to Juba with the other passengers. Reportedly, the soldiers of the South Sudan Peoples’s Defense Forces (SSPDF) were deployed to the area and retrieved the victim’s body for interment.

Location of Incident: Tapari village, Jambo Boma, Wito Payam, Mundri East
Description: 5.	On 10 November, multiple secondary sources reported that on 7 November, suspected NAS elements shot and killed one male civilian in Tapari village, Jambo Boma, Wito Payam, Mundri East County. According to the sources, the suspected NAS elements ambushed four civilians including one female (traders) traveling in a commercial vehicle from Yambio to Juba, looted unspecified sums of money, opened fire, killing one of traders and thereafter ordered the driver to speed off to Juba with the other passengers. Reportedly, the soldiers of the South Sudan Peoples’s Defense Forces (SSPDF) were deployed to the area and retrieved the victim’s body for interment.

Location of Incident: Akop Payam, Tonj North
Description: 1.	On 11 November, three primary sources reported that on 8 November, one male civilian was killed and 13 others were injured including one woman during violence between the Dinka Ming and the Dinka Mayay sub-clans of the Dinka Apuk Padoc section in Akop Payam, Tonj North County. As recounted by the sources, the sub-clan violence erupted when Dinka Mayay youths, armed with sticks, attacked a homestead in the Dinka Ming community in Rual-Malith Boma, beat up and killed one male civilian and injured four others. Reportedly, in retaliation, youths from the Dinka Ming community armed with sticks attacked the Dinka Mayay community in Achuol-Lok Boma, beat and injured nine civilians including one woman. The attackers also burnt down eight homesteads. The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Akop Payam for medical treatment, while five victims in critical condition were transferred to a hospital in Marial Lou Payam for advance medical treatment. The violence reportedly occurred in the context of past and unresolved grievances between the two sub-clans. Reportedly, the County authorities promptly intervened and de-escalated the situation.

Location of Incident: Akop Payam, Tonj North
Description: 1.	On 11 November, three primary sources reported that on 8 November, one male civilian was killed and 13 others were injured including one woman during violence between the Dinka Ming and the Dinka Mayay sub-clans of the Dinka Apuk Padoc section in Akop Payam, Tonj North County. As recounted by the sources, the sub-clan violence erupted when Dinka Mayay youths, armed with sticks, attacked a homestead in the Dinka Ming community in Rual-Malith Boma, beat up and killed one male civilian and injured four others. Reportedly, in retaliation, youths from the Dinka Ming community armed with sticks attacked the Dinka Mayay community in Achuol-Lok Boma, beat and injured nine civilians including one woman. The attackers also burnt down eight homesteads. The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Akop Payam for medical treatment, while five victims in critical condition were transferred to a hospital in Marial Lou Payam for advance medical treatment. The violence reportedly occurred in the context of past and unresolved grievances between the two sub-clans. Reportedly, the County authorities promptly intervened and de-escalated the situation.

Location of Incident: Tomping residential area, Juba
Description:
1.	On 12 November, one secondary source reported that on 11 November, NSS personnel arbitrarily arrested and detained one female civilian (details unspecified) in the Tomping residential area, Juba City. According to the source, NSS personnel arrested the victim while she was returning home from her work, on allegations of making a derogatory social media post against the President of the Republic of South Sudan, and transferred her to an unknown location.

Comment: HRD will follow up to gather more information on the incident with the relevant authorities for more information and advocate for due process.

Location of Incident: Kanja village, Gulumbi Payam, Yei River
Description: 2.	On 12 November, two secondary sources reported that on 24 October, suspected SPLA-IO elements gang-raped three female civilians in Kanja village, Gulumbi Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, a group of suspected SPLA-IO elements approached a group of seven civilians (including three woman and one child) whose vehicle broke down while enroute from Uganda to Yei Town, forced them into a nearby bush, tied the three men to trees took the women deeper into the bush where they gang raped them while one of the armed men guarded at gunpoint. The perpetrators also looted money and mobile phones from the victims and thereafter released them to continue their journey to Yei Town. The survivors received medical attention health care facilities in Yei Town on 30 October. The incident was not reported to police.

Location of Incident: Sahwa Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County and Rumola Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos
Description: 3.	On 12 November, three secondary sources reported that on 6 and 7 November, two male civilians (one 23-year-old from the Buya community and a 40-year-old from the Logir community) where shot and killed during violence between Logir and Buya armed elements in Sahwa Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County and Rumola Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos County. According to the sources, on 6 November, 20 Logir armed elements from Rumola Boma stormed a grazing land in Sahwa Boma and opened fire on the 23-year-old man who was herding his cattle, killing him. The attackers also raided 25 heads of cattle. In retaliation, on 7 November, Buya armed elements reportedly attacked Rumola Boma and opened fire on the 40-year-old man at his homestead, killing him. The incidents were reported at Ikotos and Loriyok Police Stations and investigations are reportedly underway.

Location of Incident: Sahwa Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County and Rumola Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos
Description: 3.	On 12 November, three secondary sources reported that on 6 and 7 November, two male civilians (one 23-year-old from the Buya community and a 40-year-old from the Logir community) where shot and killed during violence between Logir and Buya armed elements in Sahwa Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County and Rumola Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos County. According to the sources, on 6 November, 20 Logir armed elements from Rumola Boma stormed a grazing land in Sahwa Boma and opened fire on the 23-year-old man who was herding his cattle, killing him. The attackers also raided 25 heads of cattle. In retaliation, on 7 November, Buya armed elements reportedly attacked Rumola Boma and opened fire on the 40-year-old man at his homestead, killing him. The incidents were reported at Ikotos and Loriyok Police Stations and investigations are reportedly underway.

Location of Incident: Rumbek Town, Rumbek Centre
Description:
4.	On 12 November, multiple sources reported that on 6 November, the SSPDF arbitrarily arrested and detained one civilian (a teacher at a private school) in Rumbek Town, Rumbek Centre County. According to the sources, the victim was arrested and detained at the Rock City military detention on allegations of criticizing the Lakes State government through a social media post directed at the Lakes State Governor and the State Ministry of Education. Reportedly, the State Minister of General Education and Acting Minister of Information and Communication declined knowledge of his arrest and detention and stated that the victim is not listed on the State list of recognized teachers.

Comment: The victim was one of the 13 teachers arrested and detained by the SSPDF on 20 June 2022 in Rumbek Town, following a dispute with the Ministry of Education over unpaid salaries and unfair salary adjustments. This incident is indicative of a restricted civic space in Lakes State whereby individuals who criticize the Government often face intimidation or arrest and are denied due process.

Location of Incident: Maper village, Aweng Payam, Twic
Description:
5.	On 12 November, three secondary sources reported that on 11 November, Nuer armed elements from Unity State shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Twic Mayardit community in Maper village, Aweng Payam, Twic County. According to the source, the Nuer armed elements attacked and opened fire on the victim while he was fishing in a wetland along the border with Unity State, killing him. The attackers also reportedly seized the fish and other personnel properties of the victim and fled back into Unity State.

Comment: The attack is reportedly considered a revenge action in the context of cross-border violence against between communities along the Warrap-Unity States border.

Location of Incident: Maper village, Aweng Payam, Twic
Description:
5.	On 12 November, three secondary sources reported that on 11 November, Nuer armed elements from Unity State shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Twic Mayardit community in Maper village, Aweng Payam, Twic County. According to the source, the Nuer armed elements attacked and opened fire on the victim while he was fishing in a wetland along the border with Unity State, killing him. The attackers also reportedly seized the fish and other personnel properties of the victim and fled back into Unity State.

Comment: The attack is reportedly considered a revenge action in the context of cross-border violence against between communities along the Warrap-Unity States border.

Location of Incident: Wulang village, Ajak-Kuac Payam, Twic County
Description: 6.	On 12 November, multiple sources reported that on 10 November, Nuer armed elements from Mayom County, Unity State shot and killed two male civilians and injured two others, all from the Dinka Twic Mayardit community, during a cattle raid in Wulang village, Ajak-Kuac Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, the Nuer armed elements attacked and opened fire on a cattle camp in Wulang village, killing two of the occupants and injuring two others.  The attackers also seized 30 heads of cattle and fled back into Unity State. The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Turalei Payam for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Wulang village, Ajak-Kuac Payam, Twic County
Description: 6.	On 12 November, multiple sources reported that on 10 November, Nuer armed elements from Mayom County, Unity State shot and killed two male civilians and injured two others, all from the Dinka Twic Mayardit community, during a cattle raid in Wulang village, Ajak-Kuac Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, the Nuer armed elements attacked and opened fire on a cattle camp in Wulang village, killing two of the occupants and injuring two others.  The attackers also seized 30 heads of cattle and fled back into Unity State. The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Turalei Payam for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Wulang village, Ajak-Kuac Payam, Twic County
Description: 6.	On 12 November, multiple sources reported that on 10 November, Nuer armed elements from Mayom County, Unity State shot and killed two male civilians and injured two others, all from the Dinka Twic Mayardit community, during a cattle raid in Wulang village, Ajak-Kuac Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, the Nuer armed elements attacked and opened fire on a cattle camp in Wulang village, killing two of the occupants and injuring two others.  The attackers also seized 30 heads of cattle and fled back into Unity State. The injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Turalei Payam for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: East Bank Residential Area, Wau Town, Wau
Description: 7.	On 12 November, two secondary sources reported that on 2 November, joint security forces (NSS, SSPDF, and South Sudan National Police Service (SSNPS)) abducted one 23-year-old woman in the East Bank Residential Area, Wau Town, Wau County. According to the sources, the joint security forces, visited the homestead of one 46-year-old man from the Dinka community while the latter was away, threatened his children, and abducted the 23-year-old woman. The security personnel also reportedly seized 21 heads of cattle. On 11 November, the incident was reported to the Wau North Police Station, and a case was opened against the suspects and investigations are reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: East Bank Residential Area, Wau Town, Wau
Description: 7.	On 12 November, two secondary sources reported that on 2 November, joint security forces (NSS, SSPDF, and South Sudan National Police Service (SSNPS)) abducted one 23-year-old woman in the East Bank Residential Area, Wau Town, Wau County. According to the sources, the joint security forces, visited the homestead of one 46-year-old man from the Dinka community while the latter was away, threatened his children, and abducted the 23-year-old woman. The security personnel also reportedly seized 21 heads of cattle. On 11 November, the incident was reported to the Wau North Police Station, and a case was opened against the suspects and investigations are reportedly ongoing.

Location of Incident: Lakamadi Payam, Mundri East
Description: 8.	On 12 November, multiple sources reported that on 5 and 10 November, the SSPDF shot and killed three male civilians and injured one pregnant woman in Lakamadi Payam, Mundri East County. According to the sources, on 5 November, SSPDF soldiers arbitrarily arrested and detained four civilians including a pregnant woman under unclear circumstance, shot and killed two of the male victims, while the other male victim escaped and the woman sustained some injuries. Reportedly, on 10 November, while returning to the SSPDF base, following an ambush by allied SPLA-IO and National Salvation Front (NAS) elements in Kasiko Boma, during which two SSPDF soldiers and one armed element were killed, the SSPDF soldiers shot and killed one male civilian who was visiting his brother (a security guard) at Lakamadi Primary Health Care Center (PHCC). The injured pregnant woman was taken to a health facility in Mundri West town, where she was treated and later delivered her child.

Location of Incident: Lakamadi Payam, Mundri East
Description: 8.	On 12 November, multiple sources reported that on 5 and 10 November, the SSPDF shot and killed three male civilians and injured one pregnant woman in Lakamadi Payam, Mundri East County. According to the sources, on 5 November, SSPDF soldiers arbitrarily arrested and detained four civilians including a pregnant woman under unclear circumstance, shot and killed two of the male victims, while the other male victim escaped and the woman sustained some injuries. Reportedly, on 10 November, while returning to the SSPDF base, following an ambush by allied SPLA-IO and National Salvation Front (NAS) elements in Kasiko Boma, during which two SSPDF soldiers and one armed element were killed, the SSPDF soldiers shot and killed one male civilian who was visiting his brother (a security guard) at Lakamadi Primary Health Care Center (PHCC). The injured pregnant woman was taken to a health facility in Mundri West town, where she was treated and later delivered her child.

Location of Incident: Nyangong village, Wangkei Payam, Mayom
Description:
1.	On 13 November, two secondary sources reported that on 12 November, three Bul Nuer armed elements (one Bul Nuer and two Leek Nuer) shot and killed two male civilians from the Bul Nuer Chiengpareng sub-clan in Nyangong village, Wangkei Payam, Mayom County. The incident was reportedly a retaliation for the killing of a relative of the Bul Nuer armed element in 2024 (exact date unspecified) by a relative of the two victims. Reportedly, the security forces were deployed to the area; however, they arrived after the assailants had fled the scene. 

Comments: Retaliatory attacks continue to be a common feature across Unity State, exacerbated by the proliferation of arms and a climate of impunity with severe consequences on civilians.

Location of Incident: Yikador Town, Pathuon East Payam, Gogrial East
Description: 2.	On 13 November, multiple sources reported that on 11 November, one SSNPS personnel shot and injured one male civilian from the Dinka Apuk community in Yikador Town, Pathuon East Payam, Gogrial East County. According to the sources, the SSNPS carried out an operation to seize illegally processed and illegally sold alcohol in Yikador Market and an altercation ensued when the traders questioned the police on the rationality of such an operation. One of the SSNPS personnel subsequently opened gunfire, injuring one civilian and a SSNPS personnel. The injured civilian was evacuated to a health care facility in Yikador Town for medical treatment, while the police officer was evacuated to a medical facility in Lietnhom Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Nazareth residential area, Wau Town, Wau
Description:
3.	On 13 November, multiple sources reported that on 12 March, one SSNPS officer attacked and killed one 37-year-old man from the Jur Chad community in the Nazareth residential area, Wau Town, Wau County. According to the sources, the officer assaulted the victim for failure to repay a debt of 1,000 South Sudan Pounds (SSP) owed to him by the victim. Reportedly, the police officer later attacked and severely injured the victim who was evacuated to a health care facility where he succumbed to his injuries. 

Comment: The suspect was arrested, tried and found guilty of unintentional killing and sentenced to seven years imprisonment and compelled to pay blood compensation of 31 heads of cattle to the family of the victim in tandem with the Dinka customary law.

Location of Incident: Masia residential area, Yambio town, Yambio
Description: 4.	On 13 November, multiple secondary sources reported that in the early hours of the same day, NSS personnel shot and injured two male civilians from the Azande community in Masia residential area, Yambio town, Yambio County. According to the sources, following an altercation between the NSS and South Sudan People’s Defense Forces (loyal to General James Nando), the NSS personnel indiscriminately opened fired, injuring the victims. Reportedly, the victims were taken to a health care facility in Yambio Town for first aid while plans are underway to evacuate them for advanced medical care in Juba.

Location of Incident: idepo River, Lojon Boma, Himere Payam, Budi
Description: 1.	On 14 November, three secondary sources reported that on 8 November, Logir armed elements from Rumola Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos County, shot and killed one 27-year-old male civilian from the Didinga community at the Kidepo River, Lojon Boma, Himere Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, a group of five Logir armed elements stormed a water point at Kidepo River in Lojon Boma and opened fire on the 27-year-old Didinga herder, killing him. The attackers also seized 20 heads of cattle. the incident was reported at Chukudum Police Station and investigations are reportedly underway.

Location of Incident: idepo River, Lojon Boma, Himere Payam, Budi
Description: 1.	On 14 November, three secondary sources reported that on 8 November, Logir armed elements from Rumola Boma, Chahari Payam, Ikotos County, shot and killed one 27-year-old male civilian from the Didinga community at the Kidepo River, Lojon Boma, Himere Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, a group of five Logir armed elements stormed a water point at Kidepo River in Lojon Boma and opened fire on the 27-year-old Didinga herder, killing him. The attackers also seized 20 heads of cattle. the incident was reported at Chukudum Police Station and investigations are reportedly underway.

Location of Incident: Mumpiny area, Pajut Payam, Duk
Description: 2.	On 12 and 14 November, multiple sources reported that on 10 November, suspected Murle armed elements shot and killed one male civilian and abducted two boys (eight and 15 years old) in the Mumpiny area, Pajut Payam, Duk County. According to the sources, the suspected Murle armed elements attacked a group of Lou Nuer civilians traveling from Karam Payam, Uror County to Pajut Payam, killing one man (father of the two abductees) and abducted two minors. Reportedly, the 15-year-old boy was beaten and left unconscious in the bushes. On 11 November, after regaining consciousness, the 15-year-old moved to the nearby town of Pajut where he is receiving medical treatment at a local health care facility. The authorities in Duk County have reportedly traced his family and will reunite him after recovery from the injuries.

Location of Incident: Mumpiny area, Pajut Payam, Duk
Description: 2.	On 12 and 14 November, multiple sources reported that on 10 November, suspected Murle armed elements shot and killed one male civilian and abducted two boys (eight and 15 years old) in the Mumpiny area, Pajut Payam, Duk County. According to the sources, the suspected Murle armed elements attacked a group of Lou Nuer civilians traveling from Karam Payam, Uror County to Pajut Payam, killing one man (father of the two abductees) and abducted two minors. Reportedly, the 15-year-old boy was beaten and left unconscious in the bushes. On 11 November, after regaining consciousness, the 15-year-old moved to the nearby town of Pajut where he is receiving medical treatment at a local health care facility. The authorities in Duk County have reportedly traced his family and will reunite him after recovery from the injuries.

Location of Incident: Likuangole County, GPAA
Description: 3.	On 4 November, multiple sources reported that in October 2025 (exact date unspecified) two female victims of abduction (11 and 16 years old) from the Anyuak community were recovered by the authorities in Likuangole County, GPAA. According to the sources, Murle armed elements abducted the 16-year-old girl from Pochalla North County, GPAA in October 2024 (exact date unspecified) and the 11-year-old girl was abducted in 2017 (exact date unspecified) from Ottalo, Pochalla North County. Reportedly, the 16-year-old girl was taken to Thontol village, Gei Payam, Likuangole County, while the 11-year-old girl was taken to Likuangole Town. Both victims were recovered by the local authorities and transferred to Pibor Town, pending family tracing and reunification.

Location of Incident: Ananatak village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East
Description:
4.	On 16 November, three primary sources reported that on 15 November, Dinka Akook armed elements shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Thiik community in Ananatak village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the Dinka Akook armed elements ambushed and opened fire on the victim’s vehicle while he was travelling with his family from Ngabagok Payam to Tonj Town, Tonj South County, killing him, and thereafter fled the scene. The surviving members of the victim’s family were rescued by the community and the local authorities.

Comment: The attack was reportedly a revenge action linked to the cyclical retaliatory violence between the Dinka Akook and the allied Dinka Thiik- Dinka Luanyjang communities.

Location of Incident: Mayen-Ador village, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East
Description: 5.	On 16 November, multiple sources reported that on 14 November, Dinka Luanyjang armed elements from Palieng Payam gang raped two female civilians from the Dunka Jaluau community in Mayen-Ador village, Wunlit Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the Dinka Luanyjang armed elements accosted the victims while they were harvesting pumpkin and raped them at gunpoint. Reportedly, the victims suffered severe injuries and were on 15 November taken to a hospital in Tonj Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Achot Boma, Kuajiena Payam, Jur River
Description: 6.	On 14 November, one secondary source reported that on 11 November, SPLA-IO elements abducted one male civilian (a local chief) in Achot Boma, Kuajiena Payam, Jur River County. According to the source, the SPLA-IO elements abducted the victim from his home and took him to an unknown location. Reportedly, the youths in Achot Boma notified the South Sudan People’s Defense Forces (SSPDF) who ambushed the SPLA-IO elements while they were returning from Achot Boma, killing one SPLA-IO element, while the rest fled the scene with the victim. The whereabouts of the victim remains unknown.

Location of Incident: Ikpiro residential area, Yambio Town, Yambio
Description:
7.	On 14 November, multiple sources reported that on 13 November, joint security forces shot and killed one male civilian from the Azande community in Ikpiro residential area, Yambio Town, Yambio County. According to the sources, the joint security personnel who were on a night patrol responded to a call whereby the victim was accused of theft of an unspecified sum of money, and subsequently opened fire, killing the victim.

Comment: The indiscriminate shooting of the victim without due process constitutes a grave violation of fundamental human rights.

Location of Incident: ondukori, Mugwo payam, Yei river
Description:
1.	On 17 November, two secondary sources reported that in May 2025 (exact date unspecified) suspected NAS elements abducted two civilians (husband and wife) and proceeded to rape the woman (18 years old) in Ondukori village, Mugwo Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, the suspected NAS elements accosted the victims while they were traveling from Ondukori village to Mugwo market to purchase supplies. Reportedly, while at the NAS base, the victims were separated and the woman was repeatedly raped by one of the armed elements. The sources further informed that in August 2025 (exact date unspecified) during an attack by the South Sudan People’s Defense Forces (SSPDF) on the NAS base, the woman and other female civilian victims escaped. On 6 August 2025, the victim was taken to a health care facility in Yei Town, where she was diagnosed with multiple conditions and found pregnant and the male victim reportedly remains in captivity.

Comment: The abduction and rape of civilians constitute a fundamental breach of international human rights law and violation of international humanitarian law.

Location of Incident: ondukori, Mugwo payam, Yei river
Description:
1.	On 17 November, two secondary sources reported that in May 2025 (exact date unspecified) suspected NAS elements abducted two civilians (husband and wife) and proceeded to rape the woman (18 years old) in Ondukori village, Mugwo Payam, Yei River County. According to the sources, the suspected NAS elements accosted the victims while they were traveling from Ondukori village to Mugwo market to purchase supplies. Reportedly, while at the NAS base, the victims were separated and the woman was repeatedly raped by one of the armed elements. The sources further informed that in August 2025 (exact date unspecified) during an attack by the South Sudan People’s Defense Forces (SSPDF) on the NAS base, the woman and other female civilian victims escaped. On 6 August 2025, the victim was taken to a health care facility in Yei Town, where she was diagnosed with multiple conditions and found pregnant and the male victim reportedly remains in captivity.

Comment: The abduction and rape of civilians constitute a fundamental breach of international human rights law and violation of international humanitarian law.

Location of Incident: Enyif Boma, Ifwotu Payam, Torit County
Description: 2.	On 17 November, one primary source and a secondary source reported that on 13 November, two elements of the SPLA-IO gang-raped one 25-year-old woman from the Imatong community in Enyif Boma, Ifwotu Payam, Torit County. According to the sources, a group of five SPLA-IO elements attacked the victim in her farm at Enyif Boma and two of the armed elements proceeded to gang rape her while the other three watched at gunpoint. The SPLA-IO elements further extorted 30,000 South Sudan Pounds (SSP) from the victim. The victim received medical treatment at a health care facility in Torit Town. The survivor did not report the incident to the police due to fer of being stigmatized by the community.

Location of Incident: Enyif Boma, Ifwotu Payam, Torit County
Description: 2.	On 17 November, one primary source and a secondary source reported that on 13 November, two elements of the SPLA-IO gang-raped one 25-year-old woman from the Imatong community in Enyif Boma, Ifwotu Payam, Torit County. According to the sources, a group of five SPLA-IO elements attacked the victim in her farm at Enyif Boma and two of the armed elements proceeded to gang rape her while the other three watched at gunpoint. The SPLA-IO elements further extorted 30,000 South Sudan Pounds (SSP) from the victim. The victim received medical treatment at a health care facility in Torit Town. The survivor did not report the incident to the police due to fer of being stigmatized by the community.

Location of Incident: Werkok Boma, Makuach Payam, Bor County
Description:
3.	On 17 November, multiple secondary sources reported that on 14 November, suspected Murle armed elements from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA), attacked, stabbed and killed two female civilians in Werkok Boma, Makuach Payam, Bor County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked and killed the victims at their homestead in Werkok Boma for unknown reasons and fled the scene.

Comment: The victims were amongst the five elderly women who remained in Werkok Boma after the community was vacated the area due to security threats posed by the Murle armed elements.

Location of Incident: Tiem-Akon area, Malek Payam, Rumbek Centre
Description: 4.	On 17 November, multiple secondary sources reported that on 16 November, Nyuong Nuer armed elements from Panyijiar County, Unity State shot and killed one male civilian from the Lieth clan of Dinka Pakam community in Tiem-Akon area, Malek Payam, Rumbek Centre County. According to the sources, the Nyuong Nuer armed elements ambushed and opened fire on the victim (a businessman) while he was travelling from Rumbek Centre County to Rumbek North County, killing him, the assailants also seized his goods and fled the scene.

Location of Incident: Tiem-Akon area, Malek Payam, Rumbek Centre
Description: 4.	On 17 November, multiple secondary sources reported that on 16 November, Nyuong Nuer armed elements from Panyijiar County, Unity State shot and killed one male civilian from the Lieth clan of Dinka Pakam community in Tiem-Akon area, Malek Payam, Rumbek Centre County. According to the sources, the Nyuong Nuer armed elements ambushed and opened fire on the victim (a businessman) while he was travelling from Rumbek Centre County to Rumbek North County, killing him, the assailants also seized his goods and fled the scene.

Location of Incident: Amal sub-clan in Citcok Payam, Cueibet County
Description: 5.	On 17 November, multiple secondary sources reported that on 14 November, Dinka Gok armed elements from the Yeb sub-clan shot and injured one male civilian from the Amal sub-clan in Citcok Payam, Cueibet County. The attack was reportedly a revenge action linked to past violence between the two sub-clans. The victim is reportedly receiving medical treatment at a health care facility in Citcok.

Location of Incident: Adior Payam, Yirol East County
Description: 6.	On 15 – 17 November, multiple sources reported that on 14 November, Dinka Ciec armed elements from Yirol East County, Lakes State shot and killed four civilians (two Nyuong Nuer from Panyijar County and two Dinka Ciec from Yirol East County) and injured five Nyuong Nuer civilians at the Jerwaich checkpoint in Adior Payam, Yirol East County. According to the sources, the Dinka Ciec armed elements attacked and opened fire on a group of 45 civilians (traders) who were  travelling aboard a ferry from Juba to Panyijar County through Bor Town in Jonglei State and Shambe river port, killing four and injuring five others, while 36 of the other civilians escaped on another ferry unharmed. The injured victims were reportedly transported by another ferry back to Bor Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Adior Payam, Yirol East County
Description: 6.	On 15 – 17 November, multiple sources reported that on 14 November, Dinka Ciec armed elements from Yirol East County, Lakes State shot and killed four civilians (two Nyuong Nuer from Panyijar County and two Dinka Ciec from Yirol East County) and injured five Nyuong Nuer civilians at the Jerwaich checkpoint in Adior Payam, Yirol East County. According to the sources, the Dinka Ciec armed elements attacked and opened fire on a group of 45 civilians (traders) who were  travelling aboard a ferry from Juba to Panyijar County through Bor Town in Jonglei State and Shambe river port, killing four and injuring five others, while 36 of the other civilians escaped on another ferry unharmed. The injured victims were reportedly transported by another ferry back to Bor Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Adong Payam, Baliet
Description:
7.	On 14 and 17 November, multiple sources reported that on 14 November, the White Army and allied SPLA-IO elements shot and killed 63 civilians (including one pregnant woman and two) and injured 61 others (including 10 females) in Adong Payam, Baliet County. According to the sources, the White Army from Ching-Yul in Nassir County and Ching Pur and Ching Kueth in Ulang County, allegedly supported by SPLA-IO elements, attacked Adong Payam from three directions with intent to raid cattle, leading to the killing 63 civilians and injuring 61 others. The attackers also reportedly raided 300 heads of cattle. Some of the injured victims were reportedly taken to a health care facility in Baliet Town where three of the victims allegedly succumbed to their injuries. Six others injured victims who were in critical condition were evacuated to Juba for advanced medical treatment. The security forces were reportedly deployed to the area and quelled the situation.

Comment: HRD will continue to verify the number of civilian casualties as well as advocate for accountability of the perpetrators.

Location of Incident: Adong Payam, Baliet
Description:
7.	On 14 and 17 November, multiple sources reported that on 14 November, the White Army and allied SPLA-IO elements shot and killed 63 civilians (including one pregnant woman and two) and injured 61 others (including 10 females) in Adong Payam, Baliet County. According to the sources, the White Army from Ching-Yul in Nassir County and Ching Pur and Ching Kueth in Ulang County, allegedly supported by SPLA-IO elements, attacked Adong Payam from three directions with intent to raid cattle, leading to the killing 63 civilians and injuring 61 others. Comment: HRD will continue to verify the number of civilian casualties as well as advocate for accountability of the perpetrators.

Location of Incident: Wunkuel village in Palieng Payam in Tonj East
Description:
8.	On 17 November, three secondary sources reported that on the same day, Dinka Bar armed elements shot and killed one male civilian from the Dinka Ariau community in Wunkuel village in Palieng Payam in Tonj East County. According to the sources, the assailants attacked and opened fire on the victim, injuring him, reportedly in a revenge action linked to the cycle of retaliatory attacks between the Dinka Bar and Dinka Ariau sub-clans of the Dinka Luanyjang community in Palieng Payam. The victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Romic Town for medical treatment, where he succumbed to the injuries.

Comment: The County authorities reportedly intervened and averted  escalation.

Location of Incident: Bar Wol Boma, Rocrocdong Payam, Jur River
Description: 9.	On 17 November, two secondary sources reported that on 13 November, on SSPDF soldier shot and killed one 27-year-old male civilian from the Luo community in Bar Wol Boma, Rocrocdong Payam, Jur River County. According to the sources, SSPDF soldiers arrested the victim from his home and transferred him together with six other suspects to the SSPDF facility. Reportedly, while in transit, the victim was shot and killed by a senior SSPDF officer allegedly in retaliation for the involvement of the victim’s brother with the SPLA-IO during an armed confrontation between the SSPDF and the SPLA-IO in Aluor village on 11 November wherein the victim’s brother was shot and killed. The other six suspects were detained and released the following day after investigation.

Location of Incident: Daraja area, Wau Town, Wau
Description: 10.	On 17 November, one primary source and one secondary source reported that on 3 November, personnel of the SSNPS traffic control unit ill-treated one male civilian in the Daraja area, Wau Town, Wau County. According to the sources, seven traffic police officers intercepted the victim while he was traveling on his motorcycle to school, beat him up for failure to present documents for his motorcycle and failure to pay a fine of 15,000 SSP. Reportedly the victim offered to pay 7,000 SSP which was rejected. The victim was detained at the traffic police office and asked to pay 450,000 SSP to release his motorcycle.

Location of Incident: Yambio Town, Yambio
Description:
11.	On 15 and 17 November, multiple sources reported that on 15 and 16 November, three civilians (one male, one female and a 16-year-old girl) where shot and killed and four others (including one 18-year-old woman) were injured during violence between the NSS and the SSPDF in Yambio Town, Yambio County. The clash reportedly stemmed from pre-existing tensions between the NSS and SSPDF in Yambio. Reportedly, on 15 November, SSPDF soldiers attacked NSS personnel after the latter had allegedly taunted them during their patrol. Following the clashes, NSS personnel allegedly ill-treated, harassed, and looted civilian property.

Comment: Following the return of the Governor of Western Equatoria State on 16 November, relative calm has been restored after a series of engagements with the leadership of the different security institutions.

Location of Incident: Yambio Town, Yambio
Description:
11.	On 15 and 17 November, multiple sources reported that on 15 and 16 November, three civilians (one male, one female and a 16-year-old girl) where shot and killed and four others (including one 18-year-old woman) were injured during violence between the NSS and the SSPDF in Yambio Town, Yambio County. The clash reportedly stemmed from pre-existing tensions between the NSS and SSPDF in Yambio. Reportedly, on 15 November, SSPDF soldiers attacked NSS personnel after the latter had allegedly taunted them during their patrol. Following the clashes, NSS personnel allegedly ill-treated, harassed, and looted civilian property.

Comment: Following the return of the Governor of Western Equatoria State on 16 November, relative calm has been restored after a series of engagements with the leadership of the different security institutions.

Location of Incident: Moribongo village, Lojulo Payam, Morobo
Description: 1.	On 18 November, three secondary sources reported that on 18 September, NAS elements abducted three civilians (two men and one woman), all from the Keliko community, and subsequently shot and killed one of the me in Moribongo village, Lojulo Payam, Morobo County. According to the sources, the NAS elements entered Moribongo village and abducted a 70-year-old man and his 29-year-old son from their homestead, and seized two cows and several goats, and took them to the NAS base in Karagwa area in the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC). Reportedly, on 1 November, the victims escaped from their abductors and in the pursuit, the NAS elements shot and killed the 70-year-old man, while the 29-year-old man escaped. The NAS elements reportedly proceeded to abduct the deceased’s wife to compel his son to return; however, she was released three days later and she returned home.

Location of Incident: Moribongo village, Lojulo Payam, Morobo
Description: 1.	On 18 November, three secondary sources reported that on 18 September, NAS elements abducted three civilians (two men and one woman), all from the Keliko community, and subsequently shot and killed one of the me in Moribongo village, Lojulo Payam, Morobo County. According to the sources, the NAS elements entered Moribongo village and abducted a 70-year-old man and his 29-year-old son from their homestead, and seized two cows and several goats, and took them to the NAS base in Karagwa area in the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC). Reportedly, on 1 November, the victims escaped from their abductors and in the pursuit, the NAS elements shot and killed the 70-year-old man, while the 29-year-old man escaped. The NAS elements reportedly proceeded to abduct the deceased’s wife to compel his son to return; however, she was released three days later and she returned home.

The NAS elements reportedly proceeded to abduct the deceased’s wife to compel his son to return; however, she was released three days later and she returned home.

Location of Incident: in Akobo
Description:
2.	On 18 November, three secondary sources reported that on 15 November, suspected Murle armed elements from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) shot and killed four male civilians and injured another in Akobo County. According to the sources, the suspected Murle armed elements attacked and opened fire on a group of five male civilians travelling between Walgak Payam and Akobo Town, killing four and injuring one. The attackers also looted commercial goods and other valuables belonging to the victims. Reportedly, on 17 November, the injured victim arrived at a hospital in Akobo where he is receiving medical treatment.

Comment: As the dry season approaches, attacks by Murle armed elements are expected to increase, which will pose protection risks for the civilian population.

Location of Incident: in Akobo
Description:
2.	On 18 November, three secondary sources reported that on 15 November, suspected Murle armed elements from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) shot and killed four male civilians and injured another in Akobo County. According to the sources, the suspected Murle armed elements attacked and opened fire on a group of five male civilians travelling between Walgak Payam and Akobo Town, killing four and injuring one. Reportedly, on 17 November, the injured victim arrived at a hospital in Akobo where he is receiving medical treatment.

Comment: As the dry season approaches, attacks by Murle armed elements are expected to increase, which will pose protection risks for the civilian population.

Location of Incident: Citcok Town, Citcok Payam, Cueibet
Description:
3.	On 18 November, one secondary source reported that on 17 November, Dinka Gok armed elements from the Panyar section in Tiap-Tiap Payam shot and killed one male civilian (a businessman) from the Waat section of the Dinka Gok community in Citcok Town, Citcok Payam, Cueibet County. According to the source, the assailants attacked Citcok Town and opened fire on the victim  while he was returning home from his shop, injuring him. Reportedly, the victim was taken to his home, where he later succumbed to his injuries.

Comment: The incident has heightened tensions between the Waat and Panyar communities with reports of mobilization among the Waat youths for possible revenge. The incident was a continuation of the retaliatory attacks between the two communities in Cueibet County.

Location of Incident: Lake No County, RAA
Description: 4.	On 18 November, multiple sources reported that on 17 November, Jikany and Leek Nuer armed elements from Unity State shot and killed two civilians (workers at an oil refinery) in Lake No County, RAA. According to the sources, the Jikany and Leek Nuer armed elements jointly attacked the oil refinery, opened fire on the premises, killing two civilians. Three  soldiers of the South Sudan People’s Defense Forces (SSPDF) who were tasked to protect the premises were also injured. The attackers reportedly overpowered and occupied the SSPDF barracks in the area and set it ablaze. In response, the SSPDF deployed additional soldiers, who were also ambushed between Nyiel and Yar Payam in Aliny County, RAA, and in the ensuing confrontation one soldier was injured. The SSPDF soldiers recaptured their barracks.

Location of Incident: Dangar, Ngabagok, Tonj East
Description: 5.	On 18 November, three primary sources reported that on the same day, Dinka Akook armed elements shot and injured two male civilians (one Dinka Thiik and one Dinka Yar from Tonj South County) in Dangar village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the Dinka Akook armed elements ambushed and opened fire on a vehicle transporting traders and merchandise from Tonj Town to Romic Town, injuring two of the passengers. The attackers also seized several valuables from the passengers including unspecified sums of money, phones, watches and food items. Reportedly, the injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Tonj Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Dangar, Ngabagok, Tonj East
Description: 5.	On 18 November, three primary sources reported that on the same day, Dinka Akook armed elements shot and injured two male civilians (one Dinka Thiik and one Dinka Yar from Tonj South County) in Dangar village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the Dinka Akook armed elements ambushed and opened fire on a vehicle transporting traders and merchandise from Tonj Town to Romic Town, injuring two of the passengers. The attackers also seized several valuables from the passengers including unspecified sums of money, phones, watches and food items. Reportedly, the injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Tonj Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Achot Boma, Kuajiena Payam, Jur River
Description: 6.	On 18 November, multiple sources reported that on 11 November, SPLA-IO elements unlawfully detained one male civilian (Sultan of Achot Boma) in Achot Boma, Rocrocdong Payam, Jur River County. According to the sources, the SPLA-IO elements arrested and detained the victim for allegedly opposing their presence in Achot Boma and defying some of the SPLA-IO commanders in the area. Reportedly, on 14 November, the victim’s wife was allowed to visit him at the facility in Maleng area. Personnel of the military intelligence are reportedly investigating into the allegations.

Location of Incident: Kenyi and Panyume Payams, Lainya and Morobo
Description:
1.	On 18 November, three secondary sources reported that on 1 November, the SSPDF arbitrarily arrested and detained three male civilians including a local chief, all from the Pojulu community, in Kenyi and Panyume Payams, Lainya and Morobo Counties respectively. According to the sources, the SSPDF soldiers arrested one 70-year-old man in Birigo village, Wuji Payam, Lainya County on allegation of illegal possession of a firearm and detained him victim at the SSPDF barracks in Panyume Payam. Reportedly, the victim pled guilty to the charge and added that the firearm was in the keeping of his brother (one 52-year-old man) who was subsequently arrested from Bori village, Kupera Payam, Lainya County together with the Bori village chief and detained them at the SSPDF barracks in Limbe, Kenyi Payam, Lainya County.

Comment: Reportedly, the SSPDF soldiers claimed that although they recovered the firearm, it did not fit the description given to them by their informant and thus, the victims will remain in their custody pending an investigation.

Location of Incident: Torit Town, Torit
Description:
2.	On 18 and 19 November, multiple sources reported that on 18 November, one 40-year-old male civilian from the Lokoya community was shot and killed and a 35-year-old male civilian man from the Lotuko community was injured during an attack by armed elements affiliated to the SPLA-IO in Torit Town, Torit County. According to the sources, the armed elements simultaneously attacked the SSPDF barracks and ambushed the convoy of the Torit County Commissioner while enroute to the County headquarters, killing the 40-year-old man and the injuring the 35-year-old man (driver to the County Commissioner). Reportedly, three SSPDF soldiers were also shot and killed during the attack on the SSPDF barracks.

Comment: On 18 November, a joint press statement was issued by the National Salvation Front (NAS) and SPLA-IO claiming responsibility for the attacks. The Governor of Eastern Equatoria State also issued a statement condemning the attack and expressed the State’s commitment to protect its citizens and restore peace through dialogue.

Location of Incident: Torit Town, Torit
Description:
2.	On 18 and 19 November, multiple sources reported that on 18 November, one 40-year-old male civilian from the Lokoya community was shot and killed and a 35-year-old male civilian man from the Lotuko community was injured during an attack by armed elements affiliated to the SPLA-IO in Torit Town, Torit County. According to the sources, the armed elements simultaneously attacked the SSPDF barracks and ambushed the convoy of the Torit County Commissioner while enroute to the County headquarters, killing the 40-year-old man and the injuring the 35-year-old man (driver to the County Commissioner). Reportedly, three SSPDF soldiers were also shot and killed during the attack on the SSPDF barracks.

The Governor of Eastern Equatoria State also issued a statement condemning the attack and expressed the State’s commitment to protect its citizens and restore peace through dialogue.

Location of Incident: Lakamadi Payam, Mundri East
Description: 3.	On 19 November, multiple sources reported that on 11 November, 10 SSPDF soldiers gang-raped one 16-year-old girl from the Moru community in Lakamadi Payam, Mundri East County. According to the sources, while pursuing of SPLA-IO and NAS elements in the area, the SSPDF soldiers encountered the victim while she was farming and gang-raped her. Reportedly, the victim was evacuated to a hospital in Mundri East County where she received medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Jebel Boma Town, Jebel Boma County, GPAA
Description: 1.	On 20 November, multiple sources reported that on 11 November, Murle armed elements abducted two minors (one 11-year-old boy and a 13-year-old girl) from the Jie community in Jebel Boma Town, Jebel Boma County, GPAA. According to the sources, the Murle armed elements attacked and abducted the victims as they were walking from Jebel Boma Town towards Nawuyaopur Boma. The whereabouts of the abductees remains unknown. The incident was reported to the authorities in Likuangole County and Pibor Town.

Location of Incident: Kondako residential area, Pibor Town, GPAA
Description:
2.	On 20 November, multiple sources reported that on 3 November, suspected Murle armed elements attacked and killed two male civilians (15 and 18 years old primary school pupils) in the Kondako residential area, Pibor Town, GPAA. According to the sources, the suspected Murle armed elements attacked, strangled and drowned the victims for unknown reasons. Reportedly, on 9 November, the South Sudan People’s Defense Forces (SSPDF) arrested and detained four suspects in connection to this incident, while investigations are ongoing.

Comment: These two incidents reflect a fragile protective environment, rendering the civilian population vulnerable to attacks by armed elements. HRD will follow up and advocate with the local authorities on recovery the abductees.

Location of Incident: Maker village, Aweng Payam, Twic County
Description: 4.	On 20 November, multiple secondary sources reported that on the same day, Nuer armed elements from Mayom County, Unity State shot and injured two male civilians (cattle herders) from the Dinka Twic Mayardit community during a cattle raid in Maker village, Aweng Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, the Nuer armed elements attacked and opened fire on a group of  Dinka Twic-Mayardit herders who were grazing and watering their cattle at a water point in Maker village, injuring two. The attackers also raided 28 heads of cattle and 16 goats. The injured victims were reportedly evacuated to a hospital in Turalei Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Maker village, Aweng Payam, Twic County
Description: 4.	On 20 November, multiple secondary sources reported that on the same day, Nuer armed elements from Mayom County, Unity State shot and injured two male civilians (cattle herders) from the Dinka Twic Mayardit community during a cattle raid in Maker village, Aweng Payam, Twic County. According to the sources, the Nuer armed elements attacked and opened fire on a group of  Dinka Twic-Mayardit herders who were grazing and watering their cattle at a water point in Maker village, injuring two. The attackers also raided 28 heads of cattle and 16 goats. The injured victims were reportedly evacuated to a hospital in Turalei Town for medical treatment.

Location of Incident: Lajang Boma, Tonj East
Description: 5.	On 20 November, one primary source reported that on 17 November, unidentified armed elements shot and injured one 20-yer-old male civilian in Lajang Boma, Tonj East County. As recounted by the source, two unidentified armed elements accosted the victim while he was guarding a cattle camp in the area, seized one cattle and when the victim attempted to pursue them, they opened fire, injuring him. Reportedly, the following day, the victim was taken to a hospital in Wau Town, Western Bahr el Ghazal State for medical treatment. The incident was reported at the Tonj East Police Station for investigation; however, no arrests have been made so far.

Location of Incident: Lajang Boma, Tonj East
Description: 5.	On 20 November, one primary source reported that on 17 November, unidentified armed elements shot and injured one 20-yer-old male civilian in Lajang Boma, Tonj East County. As recounted by the source, two unidentified armed elements accosted the victim while he was guarding a cattle camp in the area, seized one cattle and when the victim attempted to pursue them, they opened fire, injuring him. Reportedly, the following day, the victim was taken to a hospital in Wau Town, Western Bahr el Ghazal State for medical treatment. The incident was reported at the Tonj East Police Station for investigation; however, no arrests have been made so far.

Location of Incident: Iyire Boma, Iyire Payam, Torit
Description:
1.	On 21 November, multiple secondary sources reported that on 20 November, SPLA-IO elements shot and killed five male civilians and injured two others in Iyire Boma, Iyire Payam, Torit County. According to the sources, the SPLA-IO elements attacked and opened fire on a group of civilians in Iyire Boma, killing five and injuring two. The SPLA-IO reportedly accused the Iyire Boma community of refusing to support and failing to mobilize food for them. Reportedly, a contingent of the South Sudan People’s Defense Forces (SSPDF) was deployed to the area to contain the situation. The injured victims were evacuated to a health facility in Magwi County for treatment.

Comment: Reportedly, following the attack, approximately 450 households, mostly women and children, have fled from Iyire Boma to Obbo Boma/Payam in Magwi County for refuge.

Location of Incident: Iyire Boma, Iyire Payam, Torit
Description:
1.	On 21 November, multiple secondary sources reported that on 20 November, SPLA-IO elements shot and killed five male civilians and injured two others in Iyire Boma, Iyire Payam, Torit County. According to the sources, the SPLA-IO elements attacked and opened fire on a group of civilians in Iyire Boma, killing five and injuring two. The SPLA-IO reportedly accused the Iyire Boma community of refusing to support and failing to mobilize food for them. Reportedly, a contingent of the South Sudan People’s Defense Forces (SSPDF) was deployed to the area to contain the situation. The injured victims were evacuated to a health facility in Magwi County for treatment.

Comment: Reportedly, following the attack, approximately 450 households, mostly women and children, have fled from Iyire Boma to Obbo Boma/Payam in Magwi County for refuge.

Location of Incident: Pokcok village, Citcok Payam, Cueibet County
Description: 2.	On 21 November, multiple secondary sources reported that on 20 November, Dinka Gok armed elements from the Panyaar section shot and killed six civilians and injured three others from the Dinka Gok Rutruot Section in Pokcok village, Citcok Payam, Cueibet County. According to the sources, a group of Dinka Panyaar armed elements attacked the Dinka Rutruot in Pokcok village, killing six civilians and injuring three, reportedly to avenge the killing of one man from the Dinka Panyaar community allegedly by armed elements from the Rutruot section in Citcok Payam on 19 November. Reportedly, one personnel of the South Sudan National Police Service (SSNPS) and four Dinka Panyaar armed elements were also shot and killed during the ensuing confrontation.

Location of Incident: Pokcok village, Citcok Payam, Cueibet County
Description: 2.	On 21 November, multiple secondary sources reported that on 20 November, Dinka Gok armed elements from the Panyaar section shot and killed six civilians and injured three others from the Dinka Gok Rutruot Section in Pokcok village, Citcok Payam, Cueibet County. According to the sources, a group of Dinka Panyaar armed elements attacked the Dinka Rutruot in Pokcok village, killing six civilians and injuring three, reportedly to avenge the killing of one man from the Dinka Panyaar community allegedly by armed elements from the Rutruot section in Citcok Payam on 19 November. Reportedly, one personnel of the South Sudan National Police Service (SSNPS) and four Dinka Panyaar armed elements were also shot and killed during the ensuing confrontation.

Location of Incident: Pabuor village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East
Description:
3.	On 23 November, three primary sources reported that on 22 November, Dinka Akook armed elements shot and injured two male civilians from the Dinka Thiik community during a cattle raid in Pabuor village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the Dinka Akook armed elements attacked and opened fire on a cattle camp in Pabuor village, injuring two civilians. The attackers also raided 170 heads of cattle. Reportedly, the injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Tonj Town, Tonj South County for medical treatment.

Comment: The incident has reportedly heightened tension among the Dinka Thiik community, with the likelihood of retaliatory violence.

Location of Incident: Pabuor village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East
Description:
3.	On 23 November, three primary sources reported that on 22 November, Dinka Akook armed elements shot and injured two male civilians from the Dinka Thiik community during a cattle raid in Pabuor village, Ngabagok Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the Dinka Akook armed elements attacked and opened fire on a cattle camp in Pabuor village, injuring two civilians. The attackers also raided 170 heads of cattle. Reportedly, the injured victims were evacuated to a health care facility in Tonj Town, Tonj South County for medical treatment.

Comment: The incident has reportedly heightened tension among the Dinka Thiik community, with the likelihood of retaliatory violence.

Location of Incident: Thiantuel village, Kuanya Boma, Rocrocdong Payam, Jur River
Description: 4.	On 21 November, one primary source and two secondary sources reported that on 20 November, one SSPDF soldier raped 22-year-old pregnant woman from the Luo community in Thiantuel village, Kuanya Boma, Rocrocdong Payam, Jur River County.  As recounted by the sources, the victim was at her homestead with her three-year-old son and father-in-law when two SSPDF soldiers came in and one soldier forced victim to a nearby bush where he raped her at gunpoint. The SSPDF soldiers also reportedly seized 5000 South Sudan Pounds (SSP) from the victim and including clothing belonging to her husband, as well as over 160,000 SSP and some clothing from the victim’s neighbor. On 22 November, the incident was reported to the police in Kunya Boma, who, in collaboration with other SSPDF soldiers, apprehended and detained the suspects. The survivor subsequently received medical care at a hospital in Wau.

Location of Incident: Thiantuel village, Kuanya Boma, Rocrocdong Payam, Jur River
Description: 4.	On 21 November, one primary source and two secondary sources reported that on 20 November, one SSPDF soldier raped 22-year-old pregnant woman from the Luo community in Thiantuel village, Kuanya Boma, Rocrocdong Payam, Jur River County.  As recounted by the sources, the victim was at her homestead with her three-year-old son and father-in-law when two SSPDF soldiers came in and one soldier forced victim to a nearby bush where he raped her at gunpoint. The SSPDF soldiers also reportedly seized 5000 South Sudan Pounds (SSP) from the victim and including clothing belonging to her husband, as well as over 160,000 SSP and some clothing from the victim’s neighbor. On 22 November, the incident was reported to the police in Kunya Boma, who, in collaboration with other SSPDF soldiers, apprehended and detained the suspects. The survivor subsequently received medical care at a hospital in Wau.

Location of Incident: Loriyok Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi
Description: 1.	On 24 November, multiple sources reported that on 22 and 23 November, SPLA-IO elements shot and killed six civilians (five men 14, 30, 35, 37 and 40 years old, and one 27-year-old woman) and injured a 24-year-old male civilian, all from the Buya community, in Loriyok Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, on three separate incidents beginning on 22 November, SPLA-IO elements attacked road construction workers along the Torit-Kapoeta Road, killing the 37- and 40-years old men. Reportedly, on 23 November, the attacked and opened fire on two civilians (one 24-year-old man and a  27-year-old woman) while they were traveling on a motorcycle, killing the woman and injuring the man. On the same day, the same group of assailants, shot and killed three male civilians (14, 30, and 35-years old) along the Torit-Kapoeta-Road. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Loriyok Boma for medical treatment. The SSPDF was reportedly deployed to  Loriyok Boma to contain the situation.

Location of Incident: Loriyok Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi
Description: 1.	On 24 November, multiple sources reported that on 22 and 23 November, SPLA-IO elements shot and killed six civilians (five men 14, 30, 35, 37 and 40 years old, and one 27-year-old woman) and injured a 24-year-old male civilian, all from the Buya community, in Loriyok Boma, Kimotong Payam, Budi County. According to the sources, on three separate incidents beginning on 22 November, SPLA-IO elements attacked road construction workers along the Torit-Kapoeta Road, killing the 37- and 40-years old men. Reportedly, on 23 November, the attacked and opened fire on two civilians (one 24-year-old man and a  27-year-old woman) while they were traveling on a motorcycle, killing the woman and injuring the man. On the same day, the same group of assailants, shot and killed three male civilians (14, 30, and 35-years old) along the Torit-Kapoeta-Road. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Loriyok Boma for medical treatment. The SSPDF was reportedly deployed to  Loriyok Boma to contain the situation.

Location of Incident: Patuet-noi Boma, Panyang Payam, Duk County
Description: 2.	On 24 November, multiple secondary sources reported that on 23 November, suspected Murle armed elements from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) shot and injured a 12-year-old boy in Patuet-noi Boma, Panyang Payam, Duk County. According to the sources, the Murle armed elements attacked and opened fire on a group of civilians traveling in Patuet-noi Boma injuring one minor. Reportedly, the victim was unable to access medical care due to insecurity along the route to the health care facility in Pajut Payam.

Location of Incident: Pieri, Pieri
Description: 3.	On 23 November, multiple secondary sources reported that on 19 November, Murle armed elements from GPAA abducted and raped one 23-year-old woman from the Lou Nuer community in Pieri Town, Pieri Payam, Uror County. According to the sources, two Murle armed elements ambushed and abducted the victim while she was on her way to visit her parents and thereafter raped her. Reportedly, alerted by her cries, the local authorities and youths in the area pursued the abductors and in the ensuing confrontation, the victim was recovered and subsequently received medical care at a health care facility in Pieri Town.

Location of Incident: Payam, Pochalla South County
Description: 4.	On 24 November, multiple sources reported that early in November 2025 (exact date unspecified) a two-year-old girl from the Anyuak community who had been abducted by Murle armed elements was recovered by the local authorities in Likuangole County, GPAA. According to the sources, the victim was abducted by the Murle armed elements from Pochalla Payam, Pochalla South County in February 2025 (exact date unspecified) and taken to Thontol village, Gei Payam, Likuangole County, where she lived with the mother of one of the abductors. Reportedly, on 10 November, the victim was transferred to the Interim care Centre in Pibor Town, waiting reunification with her family in Pochalla.

Location of Incident: Amok Boma, Meen Payam, Rumbek North
Description: 5.	On 24 November, multiple sources reported that on 17 November, armed elements from the Anin clan of the Dinka Pakam shot and killed two male civilians and injured five others from the Gak clan of the Pakam section in Amok Boma, Meen Payam, Rumbek North County. The attack was reportedly a retaliation for the beating to death of one male civilian from the Anin community on 16 November by members of the Gak community when they caught him in the house of a woman of the Gak community at nighttime in Lang village, Matangai Payam, Rumbek Center County.

Location of Incident: Amok Boma, Meen Payam, Rumbek North
Description: 5.	On 24 November, multiple sources reported that on 17 November, armed elements from the Anin clan of the Dinka Pakam shot and killed two male civilians and injured five others from the Gak clan of the Pakam section in Amok Boma, Meen Payam, Rumbek North County. The attack was reportedly a retaliation for the beating to death of one male civilian from the Anin community on 16 November by members of the Gak community when they caught him in the house of a woman of the Gak community at nighttime in Lang village, Matangai Payam, Rumbek Center County.

Location of Incident: Pagor village, Paweng Payam, Tonj East
Description:
6.	On 24 November, three primary sources reported that on the same day, Nuer armed elements from Unity State abducted one male civilian (Boma Administrator) from the Dinka Luanyjang community during a cattle raid in Pagor village, Paweng Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the Nuer armed elements attacked Pagor village and abducted the victim from his homestead. The attackers also reportedly raided an unspecified number of cattle and fled back into Unity State. Reportedly, following the intervention of one Dinka Luanyjang male civilian suspected of being an accomplice in this incident, the victim was released and returned to Paweng Payam.

Comment: As the dry season sets in, there is a noticeable increase in cross-border cattle raids and related violence against civilians.

Location of Incident: Pagor village, Paweng Payam, Tonj East
Description:
6.	On 24 November, three primary sources reported that on the same day, Nuer armed elements from Unity State abducted one male civilian (Boma Administrator) from the Dinka Luanyjang community during a cattle raid in Pagor village, Paweng Payam, Tonj East County. According to the sources, the Nuer armed elements attacked Pagor village and abducted the victim from his homestead. The attackers also reportedly raided an unspecified number of cattle and fled back into Unity State. Reportedly, following the intervention of one Dinka Luanyjang male civilian suspected of being an accomplice in this incident, the victim was released and returned to Paweng Payam.

Comment: As the dry season sets in, there is a noticeable increase in cross-border cattle raids and related violence against civilians.

Location of Incident: Thur-Nyul village, Kuac North Payam, Gogrial West
Description: 7.	On 24 November, three primary sources reported that on 22 November, one SSPDF soldier shot and killed one male civilian (a traditional chief) in Thur-Nyul village, Kuac North Payam, Gogrial West County. According to the sources, the SSPDF arrested and detained victim for his alleged involvement in a fight with a SSPDF at the local market who was accused of killing one female civilian (relative of the traditional chief). Reportedly, while in detention, the victim attempted to escape, and he was shot and killed by a SSPDF soldier, who subsequently fled the scene for fear of retaliation from the community members. The sources further informed that following the incident, another SSPDF soldier was attacked and beaten to death by the angry mob.

Location of Incident: Ikpiro residential area, Yambio Town, Yambio
Description: 8.	On 24 November, multiple sources reported that on 20 November, SSPDF soldiers arbitrarily arrested, detained and ill-treated one 38-year-old male civilian from the Azande community in the Ikpiro residential area, Yambio Town, Yambio County. According to the sources, the victim was arrested, detained and severely beaten by the SSPDF following allegations of extra-marital affairs with the wife of another civilian. The victim was reportedly released the following day after the intervention of a community leader and received medical care for at a health facility in Yambio Town for the injuries he suffered.

Location of Incident: Mongili Boma, Wonduruba Administrative Area, Juba
Description:
1.	On 25 November, two secondary sources reported that on 17 November, the SSPDF shot and killed two male civilians, injured another, and arbitrarily arrested and detained one 16-year-old boy in Mongili Boma, Wonduruba Administrative Area, Juba County. According to the sources, following an attacked by elements of the National Salvation Front (NAS) on the SSPDF barracks on 17 November, during which three SSPDF soldiers were killed dead, the SSPDF soldiers intercepted three male civilians traveling on a motorcycle from Lainya to a local gold mine in Mongili Boma to sell their merchandise, and thereafter opened fire on the three men, killing two and injuring another, reportedly in retaliation for the attack by the NAS elements. Reportedly, the soldiers later arrested and detained the 16-year-old boy who was transporting two female civilians on a motorcycle from Juba to Mongili Boma on allegations of aiding and abetting the NAS elements during the attack on the SSPDF. The injured victim was evacuated to a health care facility in Yie Town for medical treatment.

Comment: According to the sources, the community leaders intervened and negotiated for the release of the minor; however, the SSPDF area commander set his bail at 500,000 South Sudan Pounds (SSP). These indiscriminate attacks and arbitrary arrest and detention of civilians constitute a violation of international human rights.

Location of Incident: Mongili Boma, Wonduruba Administrative Area, Juba
Description:
1.	On 25 November, two secondary sources reported that on 17 November, the SSPDF shot and killed two male civilians, injured another, and arbitrarily arrested and detained one 16-year-old boy in Mongili Boma, Wonduruba Administrative Area, Juba County. According to the sources, following an attacked by elements of the National Salvation Front (NAS) on the SSPDF barracks on 17 November, during which three SSPDF soldiers were killed dead, the SSPDF soldiers intercepted three male civilians traveling on a motorcycle from Lainya to a local gold mine in Mongili Boma to sell their merchandise, and thereafter opened fire on the three men, killing two and injuring another, reportedly in retaliation for the attack by the NAS elements.
